reviews.review: Beautiful at night!. A beautiful place to spend time; recommend visiting in the evening and taking a walk around the lake and take it in the beauty of the area being lit up.

Fantastic. Lovely lake in the old quarter of the town, a really beautiful part of Hanoi. No need to schedule a visit there as it is used as a central point when visiting Hanoi. We visited Hoan Kiem Lake around 5h.30 pm, a lot of activities at this time of afternoon, mainly exercise by locals. The atmosphere is fantastic. A nice flat walk, see the locals in action, keep to the shade. At the weekend, a lot of people walking around the lake and vehicles is not permitted go here. Absolutely need to see this if you visit Hanoi.

Meeting place for locals, always buzzing with activity. In the morning you can see locals doing Tai Chi and yoga and dance classes in the evening. It's a nice walk around the lake or just sit and relax and people watch. Interesting place.

Refreshing morning walk. I was staying in sofitel metro pole hotel and the lake was just 5-7 min walk....its really impressive to find such a lovely place for morning walk...so refreshing, air was so fresh n perfect temperature for morning walk....views are also so charming and it made me fully recharged for the day long conference...must visit item in hanoi...

Lovely place to walk around . The lake is especially attractive at night with all the lights and lots of people sat around the edges. Best at weekends when the traffic is stopped and then there are bands, dancers and all sorts of activities going on around it.

Well worth a visit. Nice lake for a walk around and lots of history. They close the streets off to traffic on weekends i think which is great. Very lively if you can have a walk around at night when the streets are closed and then grab a beer from the old quarter side and watch the hustle amd bustle pass you buy. Its very interesting.

Nice place to stroll. We were taken to this lake by the walking tour guides from our hotel at the old quarter during the day. This area was bustling with activities and there were people from all walks of life. There were sketch artists making sketches of the people sitting on the pavements. The lake looked serene and we were told about the history behind this lake which was quite interesting. Best time to visit is during the weekends as the roads are open only to pedestrians and you can see people having a good time with their scooters, hover boards etc. There are many shops around this place. During evenings it may be even better.

Heart of Hanoi. The lake is a must-see for all visitors to Hanoi, simply because of what is going on around the lake. Plenty of shops and restaurants around it, people walking and exercising street performances etc. On weekends, it turns into a walking-only zone.

Lake. The history and stories of the lake are interesting. But aside from that there is nothing else really to say. It is green and there is no protective barrier around it. So if you have small children you would be worried if they fell in. Our children are 10years and up and i was still a bit concerned.

So much to see and do on a weekend!. Walked around on a Sunday and had a great day out taking photos. We came both during the day and at night and Sunday night must've attracted a million people just enjoying the crowds, markets and scenery. During the day local girls dress up to have photos taken of themselves around the lake. At night the temple and turtle tower lights up. Great atmosphere. Great place for some night shots.

Cool place in the evening and weekends. Perfect night out:-first go and grap some streetfood at the old quarter-then you should go to lake to walk around. Its pretty nice for couples but also with friends because youre going to meet some people. There are some young local kids that are learning english and they just want to talk to you and take some pics.-if youre still not tired go to a karoakebar

Mornings are the best. There were so many people around the lake at 6am either walking, doing tai chi or playing badminton. On weekends now the roads around the lake are also traffic free which makes it safer to explore.

Beautiful at night. The lake is lovely to walk around at night and of course to add pictures to your holiday photo album. There are lots of beggars around so be mindful of shoe shiners and others not so fortunate that offer services. The ambience early morning or of an evening provides a nice feel good factor away from the busy streets and chaotic traffic dominated by scooters in Hanoi.
Excellent for walk around . Stop for a coffee . We walk around a couple of the days we visited Hanoi. We also stopped and enjoy excellent vietnamese iced coffee at one of the cafes on the edge.

A must do. We walked around the lake one day, took a rickshaw the next and an eco cab on the third day. Lovely place to walk or sit. Beautiful at night. Some great places to eat located around the lake.

An Oasis of Peace culture amidst Concrete jungle. A great place to hang out or just sit and soak in the atmosphere of the place. Be there during weekends especially Fridays and Saturdays. Excellent atmosphere where people with their families are out, Small groups of Music bands playing classical, blues or rock music. The famous Water Puppet theater is also beside the lake. In night the lake is brilliantly lit and it gives an amazing view. In the morning you have people working out, there is a ladies club that will be performing excesice/dance with those paper fans. Great place and near to the Old Quarter where you have all the shops, hotels and eateries.
Have rest here. The lake is big and round, suggest to add small souvenir stores or small cafe here to let elderly have rest here.

Do a lap of the lake. I walk around this lake everyday. But don't limit yourself. In the morning people are exercising. In the middle of the day people are trying to sell you stuff. At night people are dancing. On Friday, Saturday, and Sunday the roads around the lake are closed to traffic and people are doing everything.... bands, traditional singers, buskers... well worth a visit.

Peaceful-ish. A wander around the lake a must. Lots of locals on weekends, pretty views, green gardens and sometimes peaceful, a nice little outdoor cafe for drinks and people watching. Gives you a good bearing for the city layout I found.
Best in the evening. Very beautiful in the evening, you can sit and watch people hanging out, eating ice cream or jogging.

Beautiful for a walk around sunset. What a happening place! Loved walking around the lake in the late afternoon/early evening. There were so many things to see, musicians, art work, locals enjoying the coolness of the evening and visitors enjoying this free local attraction. As an educator, I particularly enjoyed chatting to the school aged children who wanted to practice their English. The lake itself emits a calmness away from the busy Hanoi streets and as mentioned previously, feels like the heart of the city.
Peaceful lake with cultural feel. Peaceful lake with cultural feel. Many nice places for camwhoring!! Street artists doing 10-min portraits!! Artistic place!!!

Best area in Hanoi. To me this was the best area in Hanoi. In particular, in the weekend they close the area around the lake for traffic, making it more accessible and quiet. At night time, its magic with the lights from the pathways and from the lake, and lots of people out in the streets. Here you will find good restaurants , or just sit down to observe the life. Recommended!

Cozy place in Hanoi!. Away from the hustle and bustle in the old quarter.. Some touristbars ( but ok for a beer) takes you Around 20 30 min to walk around. Tip is to try the other part of old quarter. Cheaper restaurants and more real Hanoi!
Lake view . Very nice but busy city was doing a street walk around Hanoi To cross the roads you must keep walking slowly motor bikes will pass around you dont stop its letting them know slow pase .

Good for a jog around. Pretty to look at. Not much else to say aside from the title! It's a lake. Nice enough to look at and would be good to jog around. Don't travel miles to see it, but if you're in the area, it's worth a stroll.

Very chilled. An amazing place to chill. Great surrounding restaurants and shops. Roads closed on weekends and the area almost becomes tranquil. Can walk the circumference happily - perfect size. Temple on the lake is worth a quick visit and is worth the entrance fee. They offer student discount so bring your student card.

Heart of Hanoi. Impressive! The guide was not joking when she told me Hoan Kiem Lake area is the heart of Hanoi. On weekends the road is closed off from the vehicles and it is packed with massive activities , fun and games galore!Sighted street salsa dancing, zumba, line dance, pop, traditional games, rollerblading, hoverboarding and more. Lots of pet lovers taking out their canine for a walk as well. The lake comes with a legend in which the king won the war with a sword given by deity/god . Upon success he returned the sword to the mouth of the tortoise. Prior to Apr 2016 there is a large tortoise around 2m in diameter but it passed away this year. So that was a bit sad. The lake is also known as Green Lake as the water reflection is green color. I walked by the lake about 8 times in my short visit there. It is really breezy and relaxing to while away the time.

Great calming walk in midst of all the chaos. Nice place to walk with some calm while in the centre of all the hustle and bustle of the big city. Nice architecture to see, and lots of interesting activities on the sidewalk areas around the lake. Easy to stroll entire lake in half a hour or so.

Great for relaxing and people watching. We went here on our first night in Hanoi. The lake is really big and was busy. We had some beers at a little food stand and did some people watching. It was a nice place to rest from the bustle of the city.

Lovely Lake. Be it night or day, you can have a lovely walk along the lake. Somehow sitting at one of the benches along this lake or just simply taking a leisurely walk will certainly bring calmness to one's soul.
Nice view in the middle of CIty. Very happening in the middle of city with this lake, many attractions just located around Hoan Kiem Lake. included this place.

Dinner with a view with loads of photo ops. I would say that the best time to visit would be on a Friday or weekend at about 5 to 6pm. We were lucky enough to be there during the mooncake festival (8th montth of Chinese lunar calendar). This is a huge children's festival in Vietnam so there were many activities for the kids. Adults were also welcome to try. I liked that many of the activities were traditional games.Cross the bridge and visit the temple by the lake. Read about the legend of the lake... I didn't know lake turtles grew so big! Plenty of photo ops around the lake and from the pagoda. Then have a meal at one of the restaurants beside the lake or pack a take away and sit by the lake to wait for sunset. There are plenty of places to chill out and this is a great opportunity to mingle with the locals as well. The roads leading to the lake are closed on these evenings so there's no traffic and no exhaust to worry about.The lights come on at about 7 pm ... more clicking! I love the lights from the turtle pagoda. It's easy to walk around the whole lake and there are plenty of hawkers selling drinks and snacks.

Peaceful and fun. The lake side is great especially over the weekends when it becomes car free. In the evenings there are a lot of people who come and there are games and activities. The water cools the place down too and any time of the day you can go and relax at the lake. If you're traveling with kids, and in Hanoi over the weekend, do go there in the evening.

Wonderful character, but smog has affected the view. Being a large city, Hanoi is prone to smog and the view over the city is quite blurred and grey with it. But even the view over this lake is marred by the glare and smoky veil of the air pollution. The atmosphere around the lake is not hindered though, with life surging in every direction: kids playing, vendors spruiking their wares, ten thousand scooters buzzing past and people taking the time to commemorate the stories tied to the lake, take wedding photos, or try to catch some of a rare breeze.There are a few cafes dotted around to make the visit my comfortable, as an ice-cream will always be appreciated on a hot & humid day.On the weekends, the city has made the wonderful decision to close off scooter traffic and the area is reclaimed by families and tourists for a remarkably joyous atmosphere.

Busy place. Busy whole day round. You can see vietnamese woman dancing/exercising both in the morning/ at night. Good place to walk around at night when it is not as hot, the bridge and the buildings nearby are also switched on at night.

Nice evening's walk. Try and combine this with the night market to get the full effect, as they close some roads off. Either way it is a popular stroll around the lake although the attraction is not the lake but the surroundings - the people doing tai chi, or weightlifting or just sitting or eating ice creams. Great place to people watch, just watch your wallet or handbag.

Hanoi Landmark. This is the famous Lake of Restored Sword in Hanoi. We here on a weekend night, and the street are closed off for all motor traffic, making this area a family-friendly space.還劍湖是河內第一風景區，四周樹木蒼翠，湖水清澈如鏡，這個充滿綠意的湖畔。但我們來的太晚也趕時間，所以只能匆匆看一下。。。

Family Fun. On a weekend night they closed the streets around this lake to motor traffic and it turned into a family fun event. Such a festive and friendly atmosphere. People playing group games in the street which anyone could join in. At other times you can visit the temple in the island or see the water puppet theatre near by. Plus some great coffee shops near by.

very pleasant walk. This lake was in walking distance from our hotel. Was a nice walk around the lake. We did get talked into some cooked pastry we didnt really want and also rushed and paid too much. The roads are frantic to cross, remember to look left right left right and nerver stop looking. Some locals store holders will help you.

Beautiful Lake Daytime and Nighttime. This lake is lovely, a walk all the way around is not too taxing. In the evening you may encounter buskers and the temple is also worth visiting. Nighttime the lake area is lit up and there are often local wedding pictures being taken. On weekends traffic is blocked so extra wonderful for walking and soaking up the nightlife.

Nightlife at Hoan Kiem Lake. Walked around the lake on a Friday night. Roads closed around the lake. Lots of Vietnamese families walking the street, enjoying ice cream and music. Minimal haggling from market stalls (as there's hardly any). Great way to see the lake. Beautiful view of Hoc Bridge and Turtle Tower.

Cool temple but a bit expensive to get in for what it is . Nice little temple and walk on the red bridge. Entrance fee was a bit too much for what is inside but worth if you want to get a break from noisy Hanoi and some quiet on the island. Probably nicer in the evenings !

Hanoi hustle. An inexpensive way to experience the area with different activities occurring at different times of the day from tai chi, weight lifting to hawking & what the Vietnamese term chess (not the English version). With a temple available to visit for a small cost over a bridge. A small shady sanctuary from which to observe the world pass by.

Relaxing. Sitting around the lake with the hectic roads behinds you is a must when in hanoi. Very peaceful and relaxing. It's an amazing view with the temple in the middle (which is also a great place to go was only 30,000VND to entre I believe)

It's a nice walk around the late at night. The lake is heavily polluted... it has a nice ambience however with street arts and crafts and performers scattered around the lake.... It is a must visit whilst in Hanoi however
Centre of Attraction. The lake is right in the heart of things and is great to wander round first thing in the morning or last thing at night. Always interesting.

We loved walking around the lake, day or evening. What a wonderful way to immerse yourself in the no nonsense, no worries culture that is Vietnam.The people here are warm and really wonderful, they make this place beautiful.The evening atmosphere is something to behold, this place can restore ones spirit and bring you to a point of enlightenment where you realise there are so many people here in one place, all of them appear so happy and content, there is no agro, malice, just good vibes.There are families, children, the elderly and well young adults/teenagers none of whom are causing a fuss, none are worried about too much, they are all there just to enjoy the time they have and the freedom.I can't say enough about this...You see Las Vegas/Paris/NewYork spending millions on making fountains, and light shows etc, all for what?Hanoi and in particular the "Lake of the Restored Sword" has the ability to hold it's audience day/night, with little to none of the trappings of the glitz, it has glamour by the truckload, it has so much LIFE, so much CHARACTER, you MUST SEE IT.Particularly from Thursday to Sunday ! ! !

CROWDED AND SAFETY. The night market is very crowded at weekend. That's so many traditional activities of Viet Nam. They sell alot of souvenir, drinks, food and artists...The Hoan Kiem lake is very nice.

Small lake. Nothing special . Just a small lake, lot of people work out in the afternoon. Nothing special. I heard that they block all streets around the lake in every weekend for some activities, but I miss it.
Beautiful lake in the middle of hanoi. A popular place for locals and turists alike. We enjoyed strolling around the lake at the warm mornings and the cool evenings.
quaint. Really nice to walk around. Shows a really great Vietnamese ambiance as you can see people of all ages strolling around.

A must when in Hanoi. A must do and a hard to miss. It's free and it's in the centre of Hanoi. Much better at night, particularly at weekends when they have the walking street closures in place around it.

Red Bridge and Lake. A pleasure just to walk around the lake, and see the locals doing their everyday activities. On the weekends the streets are blocked as walking streets which is fabulous. The Red Bridge and temple are always worth a visit.

A Good 3 km Walk. This is my second visit to this lake, after six years! The lake is still as attractive to both the locals as well as tourists like me! The three kilometre walk around the lake simply served as a good exercise after the delicious dinner. Three different groups of dancers were exercising, a skating group was enjoying themselves, many couples were dating, and many families with children were having good family times.The scenery was as attractive as before.
Very nice scene from Day and Night. The lake providesa very different scene and feel from day and night! This is a must see place as recommended in Hanoi

Beautiful Day or Night. The lake is the focal point of the town with people gathering from early morning until late at night. There is always something going on - children playing, bands performing, makeshift gyms set up, picnicking and of course plenty of choices to stop and have coffee. Be prepared to sweat when you walk all around the entire lake and watch out for motor scooters!

Excellent famous Lake to visit, tourist attraction in Hanoi. Went here with free walking tour group Hanoi kids. Had a great time walking around this lake to learn more about the history of this place and Hanoi. Great place to take photos, have a nice stroll and sightsee. Would come back here again for a nice walk, stroll when the weather is not so hot/humid. Sept weather in Vietnam is way too hot and humid everywhere. Lots of good local shops and restaurants close by to this lake :)

Lovely peacefull setting amongst the Chaos of Hanoi. A good walk around if you are feeling energetic. Nice and affordable restaurant's down one corner. Stop for the view or a quiet beer at sunset .Food is also enjoyable. So many people seem to have there wedding photos done around the lake. Great opportunity to photograph the locals in their finest. They enjoy this to. I think the girls look stunning.Its free

HEAVINLY RETREAT. Beautiful place to visit on weekends when streets are closed to enjoy the friendly people and the many musical performances by the local people.Becomes alive at night with the beautiful lights coming on

HEAVINLY RETREAT. Beautiful place to visit on weekends when streets are closed to enjoy the friendly people and the many musical performances by the local people.
Becomes alive at night with the beautiful lights coming on

Lovely lake, island of peace in the busy Hanoi old quarter. This large, pretty lake is at the heart of Hanoi's bustling old quarter. Reaching it through the busy narrow lanes is a great experience in itself. The lake is an island of tranquillity in the middle of racing Hanoi traffic. There are wide pavements around it and a small amount of parkland, busy with people doing Thai Chi or practicing ballroom dancing. A small temple is situated on an island in the lake, surrounded by foliage, and reached by an impossibly picturesque red arched bridge. There is a charge to enter the temple. There is also a smaller pagoda in the water. It's well worth walking the whole way round to see the views (it's not particularly big) and enjoy the relative peace before diving back into the madcap world of the old quarter.
Go there at night. The bridge and temple lights up at night. The lake is at the old quarter. Expect to see large crowd near the lake and surrounding old quarter

A place for local peoples, tourist & family activities.. The night view of Hoan Kiem Lake is nicer compare to day time because there are some lighting at night. For day time, suggest to have a cup of coffee at a café at the lake especially during winter. To have night view, can choose to have dinner at Cao Go Vietnamese Restaurant on 6th floor and call to reserve window seat for nice view. The food is delicious too.We went on Sunday night and some roads at Hoan Kiem Lake were closed & no transport is allow to enter, this give convenience for visitors but the surrounding of lake is crowded with peoples.

Beautiful temple you should see and a walk around the lake is recommended. Very nice temple and place to walk at this lake - lots of restaurants surround the lake and it can be busy on the weekends. Grab an icecream and take lots of photos.Nice at night and during the day. Great restaurant that overlooks the lake. Live music and incredible food.
Best when roads are closed.. Pleasant walk around lake when there's no traffic some good photo spots and a few attractions close by.Nice pice for a beer overlooking the lake .
Beautiful and quiet . Every street in Hanoi is noisy and clouwed except the lake and their surroundingsA child out place in Hanoi
Great for working out. Daily jogs, a free workout gym on the weekends (on the west bank), this area is awesome for somebody who wants to get out and MOVE while still seeing something awesome

Always something going on.. We stayed several days in Hanoi and walked around or past the lake quite a few times, both day and night. It was really beautiful, particularly in the evening. There was always lots of locals there socialising, exercising and having wedding photos taken. They close off the roads around there in the evenings on the weekends so it's easy to get around. On the Friday night there were hundreds of families all there playing games like knucklebones and tug of war, and kids skating and riding bikes.

A short visit at night is better . The place looks better at night so you can probably want to go to a near by restaurant with a nice view overlooking the small lake, there are a lot around and not overpriced, during the day it is very average, aside of course from the meaning that has for Vietnam

Centerpoint of Old Quarter, Hanoi. We visited this place in September and surprisingly it was hot and humid. Not the norm. This is the Center point of Old Quarter and most hotels and guest house are located around this lake or nearby. Hotels nearer to the lake is more expensive. Plenty of shops around this area offering all types of goods from shoes, clothing, souvenirs and backpacks. Around the lake walkway, lots of tourists strolling and enjoying the festive ambiance.

Best visited on Sunday afternoon/evening. We liked strolling around and playing some of the free games with the locals - tug of war, stilt walking, skipping (the locals seemed to like seeing the westerners have a go at the games). Try the cheap ice cream near the fountain. Quite a few locals practiced their English with us with no hidden agenda. We got some useful information from them through our chats. Great night photos.

Bring a good camera!. Hoan Kiem Lake is surrounded with activity! The Lake must be seen at night. We began at the north end, walking just ten minutes to get there from our hotel. We first stopped at LEGEND BAR & GRILL for beer and something to eat. The restaurant is on the second floor and has dining inside or out so, you can see across the entire lake. The Lake is lit up in many colors around its three kilometer circumference. The walk around the Lake takes about an hour or two depending on photo ops. This is a must-do in Hanoi.
Hanoi laķe anď 1000 year old pagoda brautiful Buddhist temple.. lake and temple day and night pictures say it all easy to explore and find from old french quarter Vietnam Hanoi

Great place to walk or simply sit, read or people watch.. Beautiful and historically important landmark in Hanoi. Grab a coffee, or some food and spend some time relaxing in the shade. They often close down the road around it for cultural events which is a great opportunity for walkers and explorers alike.

Historic and peaceful. A really beautiful part of Hanoi and a must visit. The lake is best seen early morning or late afternoon. Great history here too and so sad the 150 year old turtle just died. I know about the legendary story of the lake, the meaning of the horse and the bird inside the shrine. Hoan Kiem Lake in Vietnamese, Hoan means return (restored), Kiem means sword. The place was well maintained and clean. It is beautiful at night and happy walking around the lake. Just take relax and love the peaceful atmosphere here.
Best at night. A relaxing place to observe people's culture. Lively and vibrant at night. Try their coffee in the nearby establishments.

Cool evening breeze. Lots of crowds and activities. Night market on weekends. Good place to shop and dine. I think it is better and more beautiful to visit this place at night. Good for photography too.

Beautiful lake, great buzz at night!. After a short look around during the day (too hot for th kids!) we returned at night and the atmosphere was fantastic - locals and tourists alike out enjoying the lake and creating a great vibe. The whole thing is lit up, from the temple and bridge, to the trees filled with lights. There is your usual sellers around the lake in parts, but also art exhibitions, beautifully sculptured gardens, dance classes for the locals (pumping Gangham Style!), ice-cream and drink machines, and lots more. My son and I took a cyclo tour around and once you're used to the traffic you block it out and get to people watch and enjoy everything around this beautifu area. Right next to the Old Quarter too with lots of shopping options! Suitable for families, couples, anyone. Loved it!

BEAUTIFUL!. This lake is so very very beautiful. I love walking around it and also the locals hold it very dear to their hearts.....so much so that it will soon be a 'walking street' around. Gorgeous by day and magic by night. Lots of restaurants and also the famous Water Puppets.....all at this lake. Photo opportunities galore....another must-see.

Amazing social activities buzzing around the lake. In the mornings and evenings surrounding the lake, throngs of residents nearby gather to exercise in groups and/or bring their families and pets for walks. We've even witnessed a 'laughing yoga' group where strangers gathered to hug, smile and laugh with each other. What a sight to behold as where we come from, the sense of community and togetherness is definitely not up to par with what we saw around the lake, if none at all.During the weekends (Fri - Sun), the government has recently ordered for the roads around the lake to be closed off for people to walk. Many people make full use of this chance to come out to the lake, and the crowd can be C-R-A-Z-Y during the weekends. If you are there at night on a weekend, you will know what I mean!Tip: If you need to get some water, try the vending machines around the lake as they only costs 5,000VND as opposed to the stalls where they'll charge you double. But the machines don't give changes so make sure you have exact amount/notes with you. Otherwise, there are tons of other shops and cafes nearby for you to get other drinks.PS: As you know, the lake has a story that involves a turtle. Our guide told us that a turtle that had lived in the lake for over 1000 years had died recently, presumably due to pollution and the trash that visitors throw into the lake. We are not sure if the turtle is the same turtle as told in the legend, but what a shame and how sad!!! So, remember please do not throw trash into the lake if you're there!
Pretty. Very scenic, good views from all areas surrounding the lake. It is lit up and night and there are plenty of options for food nearby

Ms. Very lively atmosphere with incredible light show and plenty of coffee shop to people watching! It's great for a couple because plenty of romantic spot for coupe to stroll or plenty of privacy to sit away from the crowd sit in one those hidden benches! I would say this is Asian version of Venice.

Must see area of Hanoi. The Hoan Kiem lake and the Old Quarter is the must see area of Hanoi. This is where all the action is. From the summer of 2016 they even made the road around the lake pedestrian on weekends - bringing out People in the evenings for walks and ice cream.
It's ok. Doesnt seem like there's much to see. I recommend going in the evenings as area gets more alive with tourists and kids playing toys.

Love walking around the lake. In the hustle bustle of the city traffic, take some time to walk around the late at night, and visit many hidden small coffee places in the buildings that surround the lake. The inner streets around the lake have a very good bustling night market. I also stayed 0.5 miles from the lake and hence, walked over to the lake and the market easily.
Nice place!. Very relaxing. Went here on the weekend when the road around the lake was closed for cars and it was so quiet and peaceful.
Beautiful place to visit. Lovely to walk around and escape the hustle and bustle of the streets of Hanoi for a bit. The gardens are perfectly maintained with many gorgeous flowers.
Pretty. Very nice place good place you can relax here with cup of coffee and reading your book also enjoy the view !!!!!

#Sunset #HoanKiemLake #Turtle_Lake. Beautiful Peaceful Fresh air RelaxingPeople walk around, run, do exercise, enjoy their free time after hard-working day, couples spend time on having dates. Everybody enjoys the street foods Trang Tien Ice cream traditional jacks. You can see many couples around the lake that are shooting photos for their weeding, they are handsome grom , shied and beautiful bride taking photos, keep the happy memories.

Nice wander around a prominent lake. . We wandered right around this lake in the mid-day heat! Make sure you bring lots of water. Make sure you read the story behind this lake before coming as it didn't seem to appear unless you paid to go into a temple on one side - unfortunately we didn't see any turtles, definitely no gold one!It's a nice walk and there were lots of shaded areas to take a break. There is a few buildings of interest by the lake too which make for good photo opportunities. Be wary of the hawkers that try to polish your shoes, you will also be approached by lots of different vendors trying to sell water, photos, handcrafted cards, handcrafted paper objects and tissues!

near the old quarter's. it is located in the heart of hanoi and just below the old quarters. you can take a walk around this lake. it is surrounded with trees and there is a pedestrian walk along the lake.
Heart of Hanoi. Nice area for walking and relax. Alot of Ice cream shops, cafe shops, restaurants near by. The place have to come

Good . When I was there during the weekend, road was closed, full of local and tourist. Lots of activities seen, gathering, street art display, game and etc. Rather crowded but fun, spent a very relaxing evening there.
nice view. nice view especially in night time. walking around the laka is relaxinglocated in the centre of old quarters and surrounded with alot of shops
Great at night . We visited the lake at night, it was a worthwhile visit and we got some great photographs. Only 30,000 dong to enter.
Beautiful!. I used to paack a sandwich and go sit there for my lunch with music in my ears ..also check the open gym space at night ..people go there to do some aerobics at around 6-8pm

Best place to mingle with the locals. The lake is beautiful and the walk is very refreshing! Plus, you get to hang out with some locals, because if there is one thing I learned during my solo travels of Hanoi, it's that the Vietnamese are not afraid to speak English to foreign people. I was stopped a few times by all ages of Viet people asking me if they can just practice speaking a little English with me. To me this was great, because you, in turn, get a chance to ask them questions about their culture and you get to know a little about the local people... Something we tend to glaze over when we get into sight seeing --- in the end missing the people entirely...

Historical. Is rather eery when you see this at different times of the day. Lovely lit up at night and gives an ethereal image and then we saw it again in the morning and it was raining and mirky and made this look like it could be in some mystical or horror movie with all the moss or soot growing on the outside. Is a nice lake and is in a good area.

Best in Autumn. Autumn in Hanoi is a special time. Countless poets and artist have immortalized Hanoi Fall season in their poem, music, pinting, etc. Hanoi Autumn is even better around this lake. Many cafes, bars and restaurants will cater to your most demanding needs. There is even a backpackers area for the traveling kind. Enjoy Hanoi in Autumn.

Historical. Legend claims that the heavens sent an Emperor a magical sword which he used to drive the Chinese from Vietnam. After the war a giant turtle appeared ,grabbed the sword and disappeared. A must see place. Crowded but a different culture.

Lovely stroll. A walk around the lake on a fine day is a real must - it is pleasant with good lakeside walkways that are even and safe. There are cafes along the lakeside for a quick stop and the prices there are reasonable. It is very relaxing and easy to do with benches to sit and while away an hour or so. It is also just a very short walk from the French quarter or from the old towm but beware the traffic - crossing the road can be very hazardous!
Chill by the lake ... It's cozy and nice place to take a walk during evening. Road will be blocked on weekends for streets performance and people to walk around the lake .
Independence Day Festivities. We arrived on Independence day what a relief as the roads were closed to traffic really easy to get around, plenty of shops and activities around this huge lake.

Beautiful. By day the lake is a great place to sit and enjoy.The evenings the lake and building are lit up worth a visit.At weekends no traffic permitted around the lake side show entertainment and many visitors worth a visit

Nice Lake In The City. Nice lake near the French Quarter and the Old Quarter. Great for a leisurely walk around the lake, filled with people most of the time. Also beautiful at night as there are plenty of decorative lights. Also on weekends the road circling the lake is closed to vehicles, making walking around taking photos and selfies even better.

Weekend great time to visit. The streets around the lake are closed in the weekend this makes it a wonderful carnival atmosphere with many families out in the evening. There was music at various points around the lake . It made it so much more relaxing without the chaotic traffic around. Interesting place to visit early in the morning to see local Hanoi residents getting active. During the week worth a visit but much more interesting at weekend.

Festive atmosphere of Independence day around the lake. Street stalls. food sellers & family fun & games around the gardens surrounding this lake on Independence Day for Vietnam made this a memorable visit. Great area to take walk & take in the sights of the shops, markets & Pagoda in the centre of the lake

Check out the excellent supermarket on the lake.. Enjoy the lake if you want to peruse over the strange water creatures dwelling in its depths. Throw some bread in and see. It is the best place on earth for unsollicited chats in English with adorably keen spotty youth. Indulge them in tales of how your system is better than theirs and that nobody pays fees in German third level schools! Drives them crazy.

Lovely place to walk. On the weekends the roads are closed around this lake and you can walk around with about a billion other people. It's a really nice place to go for a cool stroll or some people watching. It's also fun to watch the locals go crazy over the drink vending machines that have been installed there, as they are relatively new here.

Beautiful place Hoan Kiem Lake. Again we was back in Hanoi and could take tour around the lake in day time and nighttime. Night time is the best time to visit. Lots of people walking around and enjoying the view or sit at the coffee shop and have some snack or coffee or cold beer.

Nothing great. Probably there were just too much hype in this attraction where I set high expectation. There's nothing much to see except you could observe how the locals spend their leisure time around the lake. You will notice there are a lot of them having photography session. Pretty interesting to observe the surroundings but again, there's nothing great in this lake. Perhaps I will go there for a jog if I ever choose to visit this place.

Go at the weekend. A great lake, busy and beautiful. But at weekends the surrounding streets are closed to traffic and the place comes to life with singing, music, dancing. Brilliant. We walked round on both Sat morning and Sun evening and loved it.
Lovely area - share your English!. Great spot to sit and relax, and be prepared to talk to the local students - they'll walk up to you and ask to practice their English - lovely polite people

Walks by the lake. We must have walked around Hoan Kiem at very least a dozen times during our stay in Hanoi. The walking path is well lit & has its own atmosphere.Street vendors are fairly numerous around the lake in case you get hungry, and by the northern side of the lake there is an ice cream shop that is a hit with the locals selling frozen coconut milk ice blocks.The locals use the walking path around the lake for events such as open air ballroom dancing, tai chi etc. also fishermen using bamboo poles as rods are not uncommon.Really nice place & one of the highlights of our trip!

romantic by day and lovely at dawn. Seems to be the centre of all activity. Was up at dawn and you see various forms of excersies ...from people stretching , to ballroom dancing, walking etc. At night the pagoda is lit and couples sit on benches talking quietly and lovely trees lit. Legend has it that a king got his power when he took a sword from a turtle. They say there are still giant turtles in this lake.

Serenity in the middle of chaos. Hoan Kiem Lake is situated in the commercial area of Hanoi. Locals and tourists absorb the serenity of this famous lake with its Ngoc Son Temple and Rising Sun Bridge. They appear oblivious of others and the buzzing chaotic flow of traffic and the northern end of the lake. The temple is open from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.
Beautiful . Weekends no traffic so best time to seeIf you are there for weekendIt is lovely during the day but lit up andBeautiful at night

Nice walk. Once we managed to get across the busy road it was quite pleasant to stroll around the lake , people doing drawing, children coming up to us asking if they could talk to us to help them learn ther English , it was a very hot day but little cafe that you could get cold water and just sit .

Place for walking. The view is something that shouldn't be missed. It was really warm in Hanoi, but cooler by the lake. Lovely lake in the old quarter of the town. A local Dragon god gave Vietnamese Emperor Loi a magic sword to help with the fight. Interesting view into the culture of Vietnam in the center of the city. Lots of restaurants and shops are located around this lake, so you can shop and take a walk at the same time.
Lake visit . Nice place to walk around. The lakeside was rather crowded as it was just the day before their full moon festival

I loved this place. The lake and the pagoda are nothing of particular, BUT were the Hanoi inhabitants that made me love this place. They use the path around the lake to make gym, yoga, tai chi, walking, running, speaking each other and with us: they are so lovely!
nice lake hanoi. nice lake to walk around during the day lovely at night all lit up was lovely sitting in the roof top cafes at night watching the world go by

Lake for all. Hoan Kiem Lake is not to be missed on any visit to Hanoi. A glimpse at the lifestyle of the city multitudes, from early-morning tai chi to conversing and meditation as the day progresses. It emphasizes the friendliness, peace and harmony of the population.A visit to the sacred temple set in the lake from the north-eastern corner is very popular, but I like sitting on the north-western edge and observing the temple's goings-on. Photographer's dream.I have been on two Hanoi visits and Hoan Kiem Lake will remain a landmark.Hugh

Good for pictures. Entry fee is 30,000 pee adult and children below 15 enter free. You can get some great pictures from the bridge leading to the temple. You will find locals praying in the main Temple. The is a large preserved turtle behind the temple building. Some Bonsai trees outside the main Temple look beautiful.Can get crowded on weekends in the evenings.

Serene & restful. The lake is pretty. Can be a nice place to sit, stare out into the lake and rest. Only thing is the hustle and bustle of the traffic on one side of the lake. Nearer the French quarters (if i am not mistaken), it is quiter. Lovely to just spend some time on that side.
Enjoy All day here. Spending our morning, daytime and night here and see different kind of people from local one and tourist from different countries.You never get bored!

Many different elements to the Lake make it a great place to visit. Visited the Lake on both trips to Hanoi as it has a number of different elements to enjoy. The Lake has wonderful garden and trees to allow a cooling experience if you decide to take a casual walk around it. At different times of the day you can see people exercising, picnicking, playing and more. At one end is the Ngoc San Temple which you enter via pedestrian bridge at the West end. The temple is an experience in itself and quite busy with locals and tourists exploring the area. Spending some time exploring the Temple is definitely worthwhile and watching the locals gives some understanding of its importance. There are people selling memento's and artwork, some is good, rest make your own judgement. There were musicians and people exercising, families picnicking and playing. Once we had explored the Temple we had a local explain the story of a giant turtle which lives in the Lake and how back in history had conquered an invading army. Not to sure about that one but we were all encouraged to look out for a turtle in the Lake. There is a walk path around the edge of the Lake and covered with trees. It makes for a comfortable walk in the shade as you meander around and can look at garden Ares as well. We walked the boundary once and then caught a rickshaw the second time - just a hoot as we talked with the rider pedalling and talking as we went.Where the Ngoc San temple is at on end and surrounded by trees, your eyes are drawn to the Thap Rau Temple at the other end. This stands on a small island and is not accessible. The image of this Temple is one of the iconic images of Hanoi and appears on many postcards and artwork. This area is a must do for any visit to Hanoi and we have explored it on several occasions and find something new or different views each time.It forms a junction point between the Old and French quarters so great point to orient yourself by.
Scenic View. Very scenic view of the lake and the plants. Good place to relax and people watching. Short distance from the old quarter and very exciting during weekend
Best at night. Stroll by the lake, see Huc (red) bridge, the Jade Mountain, and the Turtle Tower. Best done at night, the sights and pictures are amazing.

Visit at any time of the day. On weekends the roads that lead to/circle the lake are closed off, so you see folks from all walks of life enjoying a stroll, kids playing rope games, live music performances, lion dance troupes around the time of the Mid-autumn festival, aunties line dancing, vendors selling all sorts of trinkets, etc etc. Great place to walk off all that street food eating. It gets busier at night when the lake really livens up and the crowds come, but it is a much more pleasant stroll in the evening cool. The lake is an ideal reference point to base your walks around the Old Quarter from. Plenty of cafes nearby to chill at after a walk too. As at the time of writing, the lake is also a Mankey nest for all you Pokemon trainers out there ;)

Always something happening.. Our hotel was opposite this lake and the entertainment never ceased, regardless of time of day. Between 5am and 7am, the parkland around the perimeter is a mass of (mostly elderly) people doing tai-chi and other forms of exercise to various types of music. The track around the lake is a constant procession of people walking and jogging - the men often with their singlets rolled up around their chests - and the roadway is a 24 hour sea of vehicles, mostly motor scooters. It is an entertainingl challenge to get from hotel to lake, dodging the scooters who seem to just miraculously part in a wave around you as you walk (has to be a consistent, confident looking pace) across the road.
Beautiful at night. Just a stunning view from our hotel and at night when illuminated it looks magical, great to sit and relax with a few locals while taking in such a view

Tomantic and nice. It a good place for walking, with different type of resturant and coffees hope around. You can easily reach the old part of the town by walk. There are lots of different hotels and motels around the lake. You can find lots of tour agancy for going inside or around the Hanoi.The time of new year is very beautiful. Full of flowers.

Gorgeous lake in Hanoi's Old Quarter. Hoan Kiem Lake is a must-see attraction that needn't take much time to explore if you're pressed, but can be a lovely place to take a break and escape from Hanoi's tumult. It's a beautiful, man-made lake in the Old Quarter, near the French Quarter, and close to many top hotels, cafes, restaurants, and shops. It's a free and memorable attraction (though there is a fee to access the shrine, this is optional) and while it's beautiful at any time of day, in hot weather mornings are especially nice, before the city fully heats up. It's relaxing to stroll or sit near the lake as a way to avoid traffic, though the occasional motor bike (or regular bike) may appear on the foot-path in the ring of park that surrounds the lake.If you're staying in another district it's easy to combine a visit to this lake with a trip to the Water Puppet Theater and an ice-cream or ice-pop from one of the stands selling refreshments near the top of the lake (the side nearest The Huc Bridge). The shrine featuring the large stuffed turtle are also worth a visit. We enjoyed seeing couples in wedding attire having photos taken on and near the bridge and around the lake - it is among Hanoi's most picturesque attractions.

Peaceful. I really enjoyed this peaceful lake in the middle of a chat of city. People come to sit, do tai chi in the morning, walk and there are some displays of art and I think Ho Chi Minh history - it was all in Vietnamese. There's a temple you can visit and just across the street start all the markets and restaurants. It's amuse visit in Hanoi.

Night time on the weekend is best!. This is my second visit to Hanoi and I was very excited to hear that on the weekends the city now closes off the roads that run next to the lake! This is wonderful news as it allows you to leisurely stroll around the lake without any traffic. There are literally hundreds of people taking photos, buying street food and even dancing. If you go any other time its pretty ordinary and noisy, but go in the evening and experience all the lights and atmosphere.
Hoan Kiem Lake . Very nice lake to walk around and enjoy the views, especially at night. We also recommend the cafes around it.
an oasis in the midst of noise and chaos. We walked around the lake several times, met some Aussies, sat on a bench in the shade and enjoyed the peaceful view of the lake.

Great place to walk before or after dinner !. Beautifully manicured flower beds, clean wide walkways, beautiful lake with a story to tell. 45min walk around and I highly suggest it...but not on a hot evening. Save this for after a cooling rain or when not so hot. A MUST SEE for the inner city center area. Many markets and a pub street in the area that are great to soak up the local evening culture. Felt safe the entire time except for trying to cross streets...that gets interesting. you can spend as little as 1hr here, but I suggest 2-3 so you can include a lunch or dinner.

Central point. This beautiful lake with such wonderful history really is a great central point to help find your way around Hanoi. On the weekends this area really comes alive. Well worth going to see.

So Crowded but Nice View. So many people out there to playing any games and get along. We can find people playing rope games, traditional games and some modern games at the same places.
Many couples strolled and just sat to enjoy the view. Better to go there afternoon.

Sunday evening. It was awesome!!!
There were lots of tourists as well as the local folks.
By the time of sunset, the lake turned to all different colors.
And so many local folks were enjoying their games which looked so vivid and live!!!

You will probably pass by default. Its in the old quarter, not something you would go to see on its own. The chances are you will find it hard to avoid as its near the market, puppet show etc. Nice to walk around and good for a few photos. If nothing else gets you a few meters away from the constant stream of scooters.
Lovely relaxing strole around the lake. Very pretty and worthwhile especially early morning when the locals are walking, running and doing their ti chi

Temple within the lake. Good for photography.
Entrance fee priced at 20k VND (adult) for Ngoc son Temple .
Worth a visit. Suitable for old & Young.
Nice for morning or evening walks. The place is clean and have space to walk around without feeling congested. Some vendors to sell souvenirs but not very pushy.
Great place for walking in the morning. We stayed the hotel near this lake, this is very nice. highly recommend people wake up early in the morning and walk 3 rounds. Yeah!

Nice place in middle of crazy city . Like the green color and flowers
But it getting more and more polluted
Lots of scams and sellers around it as well

Park setting.. This was a serine setting in a very hectic city. Go on a weekend and stay till dark. Grab a spot on the edge and relax with the breeze and the lights. The roads around the lake shut down on the northern end on the weekends.
very nice. great to look at, lots of activity around at night time,food, families enjoying themselves, people doing excercise and love birds sitting by the lake

Must see, nice walking. Must see, nice walking Many nice sights in this area. - And don't forget to visit the water puppet show. At night it is surrounded by families and couples enjoying the space. Various kinds of shops, restaurants or buildings can be found alongside it. If you are in Hanoi you must go. Really the heart of Hanoi. What to expect: A beautiful basket of flowers inside Hanoi, a mirror-like green lake, a place of love, the core of Hanoi

Good Landmark. A fair sized expanse (about size of MCG) with a main street running the whole perimeter: that road converged with one of the busiest intersections in Hanoi and it is a feat to cross the traffic for the first time: wait for 'relative' calm, use the crossing and watch the oncoming traffic and commit - watch the horde of motorbikes and proceed carefully - they will avoid you (by some intuition/miracle), head north for some very interesting shopping (try pots and pans street if you like to watch cottage industry at its best). Enjoy!
Walk around. We walked the lake quite a few times, stopping and looking at the pagoda on the lake, quite pretty, so many people.

Good place with lots of Pokestops. Good place for photos and relaxation.The egg-banana ice cream is unique and nice. The taste reminded me of the banana flavored chewing gum I used to chew eons ago.Great place for Pokemon Go maniacs as the area around the lake is filled with pokestops & gyms.

Beautiful at any time of the day or night. We visited the lake early morning. It was the day they had the cycle race. So we enjoyed with the locals and the supporters. Then came the rain and thunder. But we just enjoyed walking along, took lots of photos of the green lake and the trees surrounding the edge.The following day we took a walk late evening. The lake area was lit up and looked wonderful.You can spend your time walking along the lake and at some point cross over to the shops or cafes if you want.Depends how much time you have, but be assured you will not be disappointed if you spend time here.

The most beautiful lake in Hanoi/ Nejkrásnější jezero v Hanoji. Visit this amazing lake during the day, but better at night! :-) This place is just awesome. Nádherné místo během dne, sle ještě hezčí v noci. :-)

Peaceful place. Really nice day walking trip. Nice Pagoda and beautiful pictures locations. Great space to exercise and engage with the locals in the morning. The place was well-maintained and clean. We bought some ice cream and just just sat there, watching busy city and life going. A beautiful lake to walk around. Interesting view into the culture of Vietnam in the center of the city. And hilarious too! In the lake is a small temple on an island and the poppet theater is nearby. The lake is best seen early morning or late afternoon.

Practice your English. Someone eventually has to point this out - What is famous about this lake from a person who lived here for years?... well its the fact that if your single, you can sit on one of the chairs and young students will come to "Try" practice their english with you, take a selfie, post on facebook and ask for you number in some cases. Only to find out that some of these students end up being a prosti and ask you for sex later at night. This sounds like an awesome place for old blokes to prey on young students...other than that, enjoy the view of the lake.
Nice temple . Def worth the short hop over the bridge to see this temple. Lovely setting and strangely peaceful even with the madness of Hanoi only a few min walk away.

Beautiful in the morning. Early in the morning (5:30 onwards) you can see a hive of activity. People taking dancing and aerobics lessons, playing badminton, running, fishing, chatting, doing yoga are all over the place. At that time, also, the mist sits on the lake nicely and makes for a beautiful setting. Be sure to take your camera as you can take some amazing pictures.
Nice walk. Lovely views of surrounds and lake. Easy walk unfortunately we were here during thunderstorms but even then it looked really peaceful
Good for telax, running, coffee. A nice place to relax, run around, have a coffee, sip a drink, eat and ice cream or just seat and watch.. If you happen in the area enjoy.. Or go there on purpose..

Beautiful lake. The lake is just amazing to look at, from all angles. This is a must see when visiting Hanoi. At night the roads were blocked off so no bikes or car could drive and many games were played by the locals.

Lovely place in heart of vietnam. lovely walk around the lake, with a temple in the middle (with a 1,000 year oid turtle). lake keeps area a bit cooler than the rest of the city. But the cafes on the lake are a bit expensive, for Hanoi at least.
just walk around.... jogging early morning, walking in the evening - at any time this place is amazing, so busy, but so peaceful... <3
Quiet place to have a break. The lake, near the Old disctrict of Hanoi is quiet and refreshing, with a very nice view and ambiance.

Centrally located lake, close to the Old Quarter.. A nice lake with not only lots of history, but a place to walk around and have a drink at one of the local cafes whilst watching the world go by. A great place at night as the streets, and lake are lit up for everyone to see.

Sword lake . Having visited Vietnam a couple of times and meeting my Vietnamese friends who to the sword lake this was a very interesting tour which attracts people from all over the world very inexpensive tour with great sights if your visiting the old quarter it's well worth a visit
Beautifully-lit at night. Stroll the beautifully-lit lake at night to get beautiful photos! For locals, this is the dating spots, so you will find young couples around :P
Nice like in the heart of Hanoi. The Hoàn Kiếm lake is in the heart of Hanoi's Old Quarter. The surroundings are full of people who are just chatting, taking photos, dancing...

Beautiful lake. This lake has been known by most of travelers coming to Hanoi. It is nice and charming. Late in the afternoon and evening, lots of people walking around. There is a nice ice-ream shop there to enjoy in the hot day too

Nice running round. Nice running round for earlymorningruns. Many people do there their morning sport. Also during the day great place to visit.
The pagoda is very nice.
so lively at dusk. i loved seeing the many groups of people group dancing and exercising around the lake. it is a nice place to take a walk

Hoan Kiem Lake. This lake is a distinguish land mark in Hanoi, situated in the middle of a busy commercial area amidst the busy street. The entrance via the bridge will lead you to a Chinese temple. The calm water in the lake provides a serene atmosphere and many people loves to hang around the lake from evening, usually around 5pm till 9pm. According to the local, once upon a time, there was an emperor and the country was invaded by enemies. The country was doomed and in order to win the war, the emperor required to retrieve a magic sword from the mouth of a giant turtle. He prayed to god to give him the strength and luck to pull the sword from the giant turtle. Eventually, he managed to retrieve the sword and he used it to fight his enemies. He was able to kill thousands of his enemies and protect his kingdom. As a promised, he returned the sword by placing it onto the mouth of the giant turtle, and the lake was named as Hoan Kiem Lake, meaning Return Sword Lake...literally. Great place to have your evening walk....don't miss it if you go Hanoi.
Great View.. Very pretty and the breeze off the lake is refreshing on a hot day. Good photo opportunity and places to get a cold drink.
Lovely park to stroll. Over weekends there are many happy couples taking wedding photographs around here and the bridge. The part is well tended and a favourite with locals
Lovely and lively. If you are an early riser like me, head down to the Hoan Kiem Lake. I was amazed at the activity and really enjoyed observing how many of the locals begin their day.

Serene views after the hustle of Hanoi!. Lovely location to spend some quiet time after the hustle and bustle of Hanoi street life. Excellent place to get a feel for how the locals relax and just people watch. Take a casual walk around the periphery and admire the tranquility.

Nice lake. The temple and island a beutiful
Cost 30k dvn to enter.
The bridge is very authentic and nice for photos
At the mornings, 5:30 am many people around the lake are doing yoga, thai chi act.
Nice!
Relaxing Place in the middle of the city. This is a place I recommned to go if you are tired. Is very relaxing and has a nice view if the weather is good.

Hanoi life. Weekends it gets pretty busy as the night market (hang dao street) is just around the corner right after the round about near KFC. There are a couple of restaurants thst you can sit and enjoy the lake while sipping coffee. If you the walking type, you can walk around the lake and see the life of Hanoi. Many locals come here to chill out or to exercise. At night the lake is lit up and has a romantic feel.
Great to walk around. Joined a dance exercise class, worked out at the lake-side weights gym, ate at Cafe Thuy Ta - good food, great view

Pieceful. The Lake is very amazing, walked around it a few times. Don't go to relax or have time for yourself as everyone comes up to you and tries to sell you things and also the students will ask you to talk so they can learn english

Great place to see locals in action. Walk around the lake and see what adventures come your way.....students learning English...elderly exercising...women's social groups....badminton...you name it? Not to mention temples and snacks around every corner....get out early in the a.m. to see the action!
Good . Well, it is pretty and has some interesting things to see and that's. Wish I could say more about it. It definitely worth visiting though

Best spot in hanoi. I recommande this place if you want to meet some locals people who can speak English and help you for your plan in hanoi. The lake is beautiful and walk around this peaceful place in the middle of this crazy city is perfect.

Nice makes for a quick visit. Combined with a visit to the water puppet theater makes for a good afternoon program. I advise to but the tickets for the show then stroll in the park 1-2 hours and head for the show. The temple is interesting but I guess if you're traveling on a strict budget you could spare the 30.000 entry fee since you can go to the main gate and on the bridge without paying...

Afternoon walk.. Its worth a visit to be able to walk thde lake in a pedestrian safe area. Not having to watch out for traffic was enjoyable. Its a pretty area and found our time there relaxing. Nightime it lights up and looks lovely as well.

A lovely spot in the heart of the city. Right in the heart of the city and in the old quarter...you can't really get a better spot in Hanoi, in my opinion. Yes, it's busy and full of people trying to flog you things, but just take a seat anyway and enjoy the beautiful views or take a gentle walk around it. It's also a smashing place to people watch...if that's your thing.
Just lake. Not look good at day.At night it's beautiful.There are many people sit around the lake.Not so nosiy, peaceful..

great spot. if in hanoi have a walk around the lake and mix with the local population who socialise and mix down there. We enjoyed speaking english with the kids and enjoyed getting up early and watching the locals doing their morning exercises

Beautiful lake right in the heart of the Old Quarter. There are a few lakes within the district but this one is my favourite as it seems to be right in the heart of the Old Quarter and always has so much going on around it. It's not really what I'd call a relaxing place because it is so busy. We saw people doing group dance classes, many people selling drinks and food on mobile stalls, people exercising and just people everywhere! You could quite easily just sit and watch everyone going about their business for hours and never get bored here. It's not a particularly large lake so you can easily walk around it and the banks are all paved and landscaped.

Better at night. My third visit to hanoi. Second time to actually take the time in walking around. During the day, it is hot, humid, and hazy. Around sunset time, plenty of people working out and jogging. At night, the lights come on and the murky lake water becomes an oasis.Plenty of vendors selling soft drinks at night that i do not see during the day. A cup of freshly made iced lemonade is 20k. I am sure the locals pay less. Littering seems to be a big issue.Great place for people watching. Just make sure you arent playing pokemon go.Something else i observed. When a group of vietnamese friends or family gather, they actually talk to each other rather than playing with their fones. Try it. A rather popular romantic setting among the locals.

Lovely lake. I love walking around Hoan Kiem Lake, it takes around 20 mins or so to do a lap. Love the atmosphere. If you need to break out of the narrow, busy streets of the Old Quarter, take a walk around this lake. We went at nighttime as well as in the day and both were worthwhile. I liked it - gives you a nice natural break from hectic Hanoi. Both are different atmosphere. During festivals, there will always be celebrations here, like fireworks or cultural activities. The tower on an island in the middle is spectacular when lit up on dusk. The lake is beautiful to walk around at night too.
Nice. A nice place for take a walk in this busy city, close to many street foods, restaurants, cafe...etc.

A cool and restful piiece of Hanoi. This lake is really large, loads of wonderful trees, the odd temple, and plenty of grass. The road is busy buzzing with bikes and scooters and 2 metres away you are under trees and watching fish. Really good walk around on a really hot and steamy day. The bridge and temples are really lovely as well. Families just out enjoying themselves in the evening. Even a dog training class. Though the dogs were very hot...

Difficult to Describe. A beautiful lake with a equally beautiful legend woven around it. It is a meeting ground for many in the old quarter of Hanoi. Tourists, couples in love, friends, families, many come here. With a stream of energy buzzing on the outside of the lake, this lake is a center of calmness with in it. If you are in Hanoi, I would definitely recommend that you visit it.
Good for few hours . The lake was good located in old quarter. Good for few hours to visited the park and the lake. The area is nice a lot of store and restaurant.
Fascinating. A fascinating overview of Hanoi life can be gained walking around the lake in the evening. A great way to experience Hanoi

Night Scene of the lake is lovely amidst the bustling Old Quarter. Peaceful in the day, beautifully lit at night. This place is worth a visit at Old Quarter. It can be really hot in the afternoon so be forewarned!

A taste of ancient fable.. The story of the turtle and the sword is similar in many ways to the story of Excalibur in the uk! The museum is interesting, the views across the lake good, and the museum shop average.

Lovely place to escape the chaos and people watch. I loved walking around Hoan Kiam Lake. It was a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the chaos that is Hanoi and was also a fantastic place to people watch. Our kids were 3.5 years and 1 and loved all the attention from the friendly Vietnamese people.
Wonderfull pagoda. It's 1 of the images you get from Hanoi. Red bridge is iconical. The pagoda is small but beautiful place to see and cheap

Fresh. I strongly recommend to spend a morning or an afternoon just walking around this huge lake. It is surrounded by trees so it is not as hot as the rest of the city. There are many benches around the lake for you guys to rest or enjoy the views.
Beautiful festive lake. Beautiful lake. Takes about 45 minutes to walk around the entire lake. Make do the night walk as well, the sidewalks are lit up and lots of locals enjoying the nightlife.

Center of Hanoi. Just before dawn, the lake side is full of locals exercising, doing tai chi or using home made gym equipment or just jogging. It's a great place and time for people watching. During the day, the lake side is also full of activity, plenty of wedding couples having their portraits taken or just visitors strolling. Also great for people watching. At night, the temple, bridge and Turtle Tower is lighted up beautifully and perfect for night time photography.

lake view pagoda temple + Vietnam Buddhist templ. brilliant walk around beautiful lake 1000 year old pagoda in the middle of the lake and the buddhist temple is amazing 5 minute walk from the old colonial French quarters , crossing thre road is a great experience abd easy to do wa slow they see youvdrive orcride there motor bikes around you . night or day ia a must to view

Enjoyable Walk in Hanoi!!. In the middle of the chaos, a lovely lake with lots of trees and gardens. Really recommend taking a walk around the lake or for those who like to exercise, an early morning jog is great but go early (like 5am) as it gets busy with locals exercising! Lots of places to sit and watch people and so much happening! At night it lights up which is very pretty!

Relaxing view. This lake defines Hanoi in so many ways. It has a legend of its own, it has culture and you can also observe how the locals live just by sitting by the lake. We love strolling around the lake and taking photos of its scenic view. Very near the restos if you want to eat and near the old quarter as well if you want to shop.

Green place in the heart of the city . We was there quite often. You can easy find a nice place to relax from the traffic and the town. Some good Coffees in this area. You can also visit a small temple there, but you cant see to much inside.

Nice lake. I think it's quite nice to see a lake in the middle of city. It's surrounded by a nice and unique garden. I recommend you to walk around by yourself so you can stop and see a lot of things by yourself

very scenic. Very scenic - easy to find Took lots of pics - during the day and nightLots of people walking around - and sitting around the place - as a meeting/socialising pointit borders the Old quarter so convenient to find something to eat and drink

Temple is sweet. Walking around the temple which is 30000vnd as far as I remember is nice with the building itself and the trees around.The surrounding of the lake is ok and not very special. It is more viewing busy and noisy Hanoi traffic.

Legendary Hanoi. The lake given the name "Lake Of The Restored Sword" shown up all the meaning! Lucky Hanoi has the lake in it's center. It works like the lung of the old city. People came here to relax, enjoying a cup of code in a shop on the bank of the lake and enjoys the scenery.

Beautiful ..! . A perfect day out exploring in Hanoi lovely views, sunshine and locals. You can pay extra to visit the temple but we didn't do this - we went to the bridge and walked around the lake there was some lovely bars upstairs that overlook the lake from the crazy round about !
Lovely at night . Absolutely beautiful lighting, quite romantic and calming in this frenetic city. Great for tripod photography of the skyline at night.

Relaxing. it's a relaxing place to sit and rest or walk around. Visit here to see how the locals spend their free time here to exercise and relax.There are cafes around the lake selling ice cream and beers (though some are more highly priced than the others).You may want to check out cafes opposite the road from the lake instead (e.g. L'etaige Cafe, 2nd floor)

The best place for walking. We are walked around the lake side, it's comfortable and we can talk with local people, around the lake have so many French style coffee shop, we can sit in shop and saw the morning breeze is swaying the weeping willows.

Nice lake! Great photography spot. This lake, is a lovely walk around, just along the edge of the old quarter, the temple over the bridge is also nice. This area really comes into its own at night and is a great spot for night photography, tonnes of interesting light sources and wonderful colours!!!
Lovely to be around. Worth while visiting the lake. Locals sit and ponder life, lots of tourists too. A gentle respite from the bustle of the old quarter. And a great spot for photos

Favourite place. Our favourite place to chill in Hanoi - must visit if you're coming to Hanoi -it's fun to walk around - check out the cheap shops close by - great fun shopping and haggling - go for 75% to start with

I lake located at one end of the old quarter. The lake is located at one end of the old quarter and it's quite easy to walk to from any of the hotels.The water is a stagnant slimy green.There is some quite green foliage around it and a historic Bridge Crossing from one side to an island in the middle.It's nothing special but if you're in the area you might as well wonder past and have a look.
Just another lake! . It's just another lake in the middle of the city! Sadly, it isn't well maintained and hence, there's nothing great about it!

Beautiful oasis amidst a bustling city. Loved walking around the lake, which was even more beautiful at night. A good way to wind down a busy day. There are several al fresco restaurants around the lake that provide good venues for relaxing.

Great. Lovely to go and visit and read history of this place. The water puppets great nearby too! So beautiful when it is lit up at night!! A good amount of eateries and attractions within 5-10 minute walk.

Beautiful and tranquil island . Stopped by during a city wander. Such a beautiful little island with lots of soul. Left a blessing at the giant turtle, and read about the mythology of the creature in this lake. Just lovely!
Beautiful Lake in the Excitement of Hanoi. We enjoyed our peaceful morning walk and people watching, but the lake at night is just a sight to see! Make some time for it, just a neat place!

Our Haven. . After tramping the streets of Hanoi my sister and I would always end our day here. We would just chill and people watch. We found this area really peaceful and enjoyed just talking and relaxing.

Nice environment and places for exercises and walk. You can have breakfast , ice cream or picnic here. Lots of Vietnamese and tourist walking and doing their exercises here. Toilet are clean and you can enjoy both morning or evening here. Both are different atmosphere. Nice restaurant and pub are around the lake.

Nice are around the lake. Lake close to several interesting places. You can walk around, drink and eat in bars/restaurants nearby. In the lake is a small temple on an island and the poppet theater is nearby. So a lot to do/see naar the Hoan Kiem Lake.

You can't miss it. Literally, this is right in the middle of the major sites/attractions of the Hanoi, so you will come across it one way or another.Locals spend their days sitting or strolling around it, so you can too !There is the obvious mini temple in the centre (Thap Rua), but there is also another temple accessible to the north-east of it (Ngoc Son), by way of a small red foot-bridge.Plan an afternoon or a full morning going around this lake and temple.

The Most Scenic Place in Hanoi. We loved this site. It was a perfect venue for family photos and enjoying the local culture. People of all types were there and so many beautiful backdrops exist for photos. Vendors, pilgrims, and tourists all add to the ambiance of this place.
Beautifull and authentic. Best time to go by sunset. Beautifull place to just take a walk and watch the lake and the local people. Very much recommend

Real heart of Hanoi. Great experience to visit this place early in the morning, round 4,5am. There are many groups of people doing exercise following professional instructor. Young teenager are running around the lake and you will feel very fresh

This is a must at 5.30am. So maybe you can not sleep or are in a different time zone. Walk down here and you'll find everyone excersising and dancing and fitness on mass. The atmosphere is fantastic. During the day it's hot nice to walk by. Did I mention hot!Around the lake there are touristy hire cars etc.

Something mystical around the lake. Magical in the day; and colorfully lit up in the evening. Most of the tourists seem to moving in circles around the lake. You can just sit in one of the lake side benches and stare at the calm lake, and look at the other side to enjoy tourists across the world enjoying the ambience, either walking, in a cyclo (the old style peddle cycle)

Hanoi night life. While the lake is pretty during the day, when it really comes alive is at night. You get a glimpse of Hanoi life. Everyone gets out and exercises and enjoys the lake. The hustle and bustle is awesome. Just go for a walk when the sun goes down.
Lovely lake. A beautiful lake to walk around.We spent new years eve here too where there was a big stage and open air pop concert, lazers, silver dancers etc. Brilliant fun!

Everyone walks it at least once!. If you are staying in the old quarter then it is a 2 minute walk to Lake Hoan Kiem . Watch the world go by ,with all generations here , youngstersholding hands, elders doing physical exercise, pretty girls in Au Dai posing for professional photographers and of course the lake itself ,with the story of the Turtle and the sword.Has to be seen ,but hardly one of the 7 wonders of the world! Pavements aroundthe lake in very poor condition given it is a tourist trap so watch you footwork ,hospitals here leave a lot to be desired!

perfect for walking or jogging. The circumference of the lake is perfect for a little stroll or jog. You can find spaces of shade under the trees that line it, but expect to be bombarded by merchants selling fans/toys etc. Honestly I wish I bought a fan..we walked so much it would've been worth it.

Jade Island and the Hoan Kiem Lake. A piece of Oriental Paradise right in the centre of bustling Hanoi... Beautiful temple with stunning bonsai trees... A pleasure to behold. The lore of the Turtle - beautifully explained

An enclosed body of fresh water!. No ducks! Fairly greenish looking lake... Good starting point for exploring Hanoi... Night market on weekends starts close to the temple end of the lake and you can also pick up the electric car tours here too. At the opposite end, close to the puppet theatre you will find a big (by Hanoi standards) supermarket which is open until 20.00, Bo Intermex.
Evening stroll . Can't beat it for a quiet stroll around in the evening  Watch out for the hawkers, accept nothing even if it seems as being offered for free as they will expect payment.
