Interesting but busy. Interesting but very tourist orientated. The shrine inside is interesting as was the turtle. Have to read most of the information via tourists books as most signs are purely in Vietnamese. Ticket price was minimal. Have a look if you're in the area.

Enjoy the walk around the lake!. There is also a temple you can visit, and children are free here and at all museums. The top of the lake is near the French Quarter and you will find luxury shopping (Dior, Louis Vuitton, Prada...) there.

A Calm Oasis in a Bustling City. Hoan Kiem Lake is a calm oasis in a city that seems to be in constant motion. Surrounded by shady parkland, the lake has two main sightseeing attractions. First is the Turtle Tower, a small stone structure that--believe it or not--comemorates the moment a thousand years ago when a turtle god returned the sword of General Le Loi to heaven after he defeated the Chinese. The other is the red bridge leading to the Jade Temple on a small island in the middle of the lake. The temple is a great place to calm down and get your bearings when you first arrive in the city. The lake is directly adjacent to Old Hanoi and is a short walk from the French Quarter.
Nice setting . Nice lake surrounded by parks and walkways. Many people walking, jogging and even exercising. Can get very crowded in the evenings.
Beautiful. A lovely well landscaped lake in the middle of the city. Well worth taking a walk around it; do a bit of people watching and stop for a beer in the park.

Just a lake. The lake is just a lake. It's not super great and you'll end up walking past it eventually anyways. Don't go out of your way to see it. There's a bridge crowded with tourists. It leads to a temple you have to pay to get in. Just a statue in there. Nothing amazing.

Nice lake in the centre. This lake is a refreshing place when the buzz of the old town gets to you a bit too much. It's nice walking around it, but there should be a few more outdoor restaurants. We ordered a glass of white wine and a beer by the south-west end of the lake. They had no wine and only beer in cans, so we cancelled, and went on with our promenade.

Tranquility in the middle of busy Hanoi. We enjoyed a leisurely walk around the lake and then had a most enjoyable lunch overlooking the same!I wouldn't make an extra journey to see the lake but if in the vicinity worth a look.

See it several times of day from separate angles. It is easy to see Hoan Kiem Lake as an unavoidable center point of many sights in central Hanoi, surrounded by traffic and pitches for cyclo rides, but it remains one of my favorite places to just take a walk or sit and relax around sunrise or after sunset when in Hanoi.

Lake view. The lake can be used as a way to navigate your way around the one end of the old quarter. It is beautiful at night. Cross rhr red bridge. The water puppet theater is across the road. Great for a night walk.
Good morning trip. Good way to start the day walking around this lake. You'll see some interesting things here. Lots of pesky street vendors though!
Beautiful lake . I so enjoyed seeing this part of the city. The lake is beautiful and the bridge is too. Don't forget to take lots of pictures!

The heart of Hanoi. If Hanoi is the heart of Vietnam so this lake is the heart of Hanoi, we went there for a walk last week and saw a lot of people taking taichi in the morning near water edge, we have heard about its beautiful legend (magic sword and golden turtle) and we think a visit to Hanoi is not completed without a stroll around this charming lake.
Nice Exploring Walk. As this is considered a highlight. We visited & did the full walk around the lake. All History. But nice to do it once. Plenty of restaurants around Hoan Kiem Lake

Nice lake . It's a nice lake in the busy Old Quarter district. A lot of locals seem to go by the ice cream shop to eat the locally made ice pops, it's quite a family/big group of friends type of affair. Since the lake is a tourist spot there are a lot more international brands nearby like Aldo, Nine Weest, Swarvoski, Cartier...Burger King, KFC, Domino's, not what we expected but if you need a little escape from local eateries/shops I guess that's the place to go! I enjoyed seeing how the locals relaxed by the lake more.

Lovely place for a stroll in the evening. We walked around the lake in the day and again in the evening.
Hanoi was extremely hot whilst we were there but there's plenty of shade from the trees. Nighttime was something special as all around the lake there are lights. I took some wonderful photos of the Huc Bridge both day and night.

Wonderful people watching . Great place to walk and people watch. Not too crowded. Some vendors got a little pushy, but it's such a big lake, just walk away. Plenty of shade, which was a bonus in the middle of the day. Pretty clean, too. You know that stagnant water and lake smell some bodies of water have? Not this one. Real plus. We went all the way around and felt it was an easy walk and a SAFE one. For 2 girls traveling, this is a huge deal.

Try to visit at night and in the day. The bridge all lit up at night is magical!. The temple across the bridge was closed at night when we visited. However the views of the bridge at night were beautiful. We returned during the day and thoroughly enjoyed our visit across the bridge to the temple. Look out for the resident turtle in the pond when you reach the other side of the bridge! He is very cute!
Beautiful and Peaceful. Quiet place with park benches to rest or read. Beautiful at night with all the lights on the temples and bridge.
Peaceful.... It's nice to walk around the lake.. very peaceful and relaxing watching the locals who are relaxing with friends or later in the evening.. excercising and just catching up..

PLACE TO RELAX AND PEOPLE WATCH. Take a seat by the lake and watch the streams of people pass you by and the din of busy traffic noise on the streets of Hanoi behind you. Walk across the famous red bridge then fina another seat and relax unwind and talk with lov=cal Vietnamese people.

Lake in the middle of the City. Loved walking around the lake whilst the rain was pouring. It gave the place a mystical feel which i simply loved. The locals were very friendly and approachable. The place was well-maintained and clean.

Mini Central Park. For anyone that has been to Central Park in NYC this lake will be terrible disappointment ! It is a sidewalk around a lake that will take 30 minutes to walk. I took too many pictures of the same fabled house in the lake. The people around the lake looked like they had a much more interesting story than the fable attached to the lake.

Beautiful lake and an oasis of calm in the middle of bustling Hanoi. I walked round this beautiful lake soon after I arrived in Hanoi, and enjoyed the calm and relaxed surroundings after the minefield of crossing the streets to get there - those scooters are a cultural experiences in themselves! Many Vietnamese congregate around the lake for one reason or another, whether to chat, relax on a bench or even have their wedding photos take with the famous Turtle Tower as a back drop. It is quite a large lake, and would take a couple of hours to wander right the way round, especially as there are plenty of things to stop and look at along the way - young boys playing football with what looked like a a shuttle cock, historic monuments and even a place where you could have your portrait sketched. So, a lovely setting and a great place to people watch and get a feel for Vietnam and the Vietnamese.If this review is helpful then please indicate so below.
Not much to see . If you are in the area, it is worth a quick visit but 30 minutes is ample time to see everything. As most things, it's very cheap to enter.
Lake of sword. Very nice place with a beautiful lake.The view is awesome at night.it is really hot and all the shops are so closed.
interesting story. Beautiful lake, fantastic at night all lit up. the trees growing around it look fantastic. well worth a look.

Travellgalore. When i visited the place the Hoan kiem Lake crowds are coming different Nationalities went there many things you can do. YOU can seat in The Park, you can unwined , beside of Busy streets lots of vehicles.
Huge Turtle!. I was aghast at how big the replica turtle was, and considering it was smaller than the actual legendary turtle. Too bad we visited while it was raining.

lovely during the day, busy at night. hotel nearby in the old city, walked around the lake multiple times and always nice. at night it had dozens of young couples in wedding or prom dresses getting their photos taken.

Beautiful part of Old Quarter, Hanoi. A really beautiful part of Hanoi and a must visit. One side of the lake is a beautiful temple and has the pictures and model of a big tortoise. Some seating area, a lot of greenery and beautiful view of the lake and clean toilets make this temple side of the lake an excellent attraction. Lighting around the lake in the evenings make it look very attractive. Good Restraunts, bars, night bazaar lane, roadside fresh fruits and iced drink stalls are all around the lake.

Pleasant walk . Not far from the old quarter. A very pleasant walk especially at night seeing all the lights. Joggers frequent its banks early in the morning. Street artists can be found there as well doing portraits for tourists during the day
The heart of the city. Definitely visit the lake at night! It is lovely with twinkle lights and a vibrant group of people enjoying the fine view.

Beautiful and historical vestiges!. After finishing our city tour with the cyclo ride to the lake we seat down in a coffee at the edge of the lake. We enjoyed our coffee and look forward to the lake far. The late afternoon time while we seat here made us felt itve gone slowly because it 's so cool , beautiful and peaceful

Beautiful sanctuary. A beautiful temple, with great architecture and location. Interesting view into the culture of Vietnam in the center of the city.It's a must to see, for the beauty of the lake and temple. Small but worth it.Look out for the money burning place. You see the 100$ bills being burned by the locals,for good luck.

Somewhere cool when its hot in Hanoi. Kind of peaceful and somewhere to just sit and relax when its hot. Great view and good to people watch 😆 but watch the uneven stones... Im being a 'trip adviser' lol
Nice break from a crowded city. It is a nice lake to go for a walk. It was a great break from the noise and city pollution. At night time it is really charming. During the day is ok for a walk.

Very peaceful . It's always really peaceful to visit this lake the traditional heart og Hanoi with so much cultural and spiritual importance to the North Vietnamese people. It's different every day you see so go back time and time again like we do.

Great to stroll round the lake but not in the evenings. When quiet it is pretty and great to stroll round the lake. I did not pay to go onto the island on the lake. I did not think it worth it but don't take my word on that one.In the evenings it is pretty but it is having to fight through the bikes that park up all over the pavement and too many people make the walk slow and frustrating.
Beautiful lake with red bridge . Relaxed atmosphere around this lake. also go there In the evening or at night because the lights around the bridge and temple are impressive and festive.

Summer time in Hanoi. The place where we stayed in during our visit in Hanoi was so nearby this lake and we did our walk during the late afternoon which was about 3pm..I never will recommended anyone to walk around the lake at that time or anytime in the hot afternoon..I think I had a bit of stroke heat while I was there..Bit for those who love the Sun and the heat, I think this is the place for you all...At anytime of the day, there will be a lot of people especially during the weekend..I seen people doing their jog in the early morning as early as 5am and late night....There is a temple and a small entrance fee will be needed to be paid..

Walk around it. It takes about half an hour to walk around the lake and it is definitely worth doing. If you come out of the old quarter it opens up here with wide leafy streets and old colonial buildings. There is a path all the way around the lake. To the north is a temple over a bridge, it is a large temple and is quite beautiful with lots of red and gold. To the south is an old archway and there is also a tower in the lake, the Thap Rua Tower. You can't get to it but you can see it clearly as you walk around. To the west there is an old temple, you have to cross the road to get to it. If you want to go into the temple you have to cover up (legs and shoulders) but you can freely walk around the site without going into the temple.

Good place to visit. We visit this place in evening after our tour luckily it was not crowded. We stay here for about 15-20mins to take some pictures. The lighting effects in the evening was awesome.Its quite place and you can sit to have some quality time with your friends.

One of the must see sites. Very interesting historical site definitely worth visiting. We enjoyed the walk around the lake and while it was warm there was plenty of shade and it wasn't too crowded when we were there. Also the paths were easy to traverse without worrying about traffic. While there were plenty of street hawkers they weren't too bad and left you alone when they knew you weren't interested.

Great for an evening walk/run. I went for a run around the lake one evening during my stay at Hanoi and it was a great way to feel like a local whilst getting a flavor of the city. There are some nice restaurants for a meal with a view, and also some cute cafes with yummy coconut water. Its interesting to watch people of all ages doing fitness related activities by the lake - right from badminton, to weight lifting, to all kinds of workouts. Also some very cute Vietnamese kids to play with..!

A social place ... Went there very very early morning and was surprised to find soooo many people socializing, doing exercises, meditating, stretching, some with music, others in groups. Lots of learly monring life !
Nice place. You should come here when you come to hanoi because its a nice place to visit. one of the attraction place for toursit and local!

check it out in early morning, before 7 AM. Amazing experience if you go early! It seems like everyone in the Old Quarter, regardless of age, are found around the lake in early morning. Exercise of all kinds is fascinating to watch: fan dancing, karate, ballroom dancing, t'ai chi, exercise equipment, runners and joggers, all kinds of dancing and exercise, including something similar to yoga, Jazzersize and zumba! It's amazing.The people are so welcoming, and fee to dance with you, or ask you to participate. The people are SO kind and accommodating.
Nice lake in the middle of the city. This is a must in Hanoi. A meeting place for local people and tourists as well. Many nice sights in this area. - And don't forget to visit the water puppet show.

Romantic strill. Absolutely need to see this if you visit Hanoi - has a beautiful atmosphere especially on the weekends, with tree lined boulevards lit with lamps, and little cafes and coffee shops growing pink flowered trees. Turtle tower lights up at night. Perfect for a romantic stroll or even for family visits. Easy to find food and strung with shops along the way.
Very nice lake. A nice lake with a temple on site and sights of couples taking bridal wedding photos. I didn't do much except walk and take pictures.

Small Lake Close to the Old Quarter. This is a sacred lake with a legend behind it. It has a Temple of Jade on an island on the north and the iconic Turtle Tower in the centre which is beautifully lit up at night.The lake has well manicured gardens and pathways all around where you can catch many intersting glimpses of Vietnamese life, from the joggers and fitness enthusiasts in the morning to the wedding couples getting photo features done in the daytime to the couples hanging out late evening.

A good place to run early morning. The lake offers an exceptional run early in the morning. It offers an interesting insight to the life of the locals with a whole range of activities around the lake including folk dancing, aerobic dancing, badminton matches, weights, running and walking.
Nice!. 30,000 dong to get in per person unless a student then it is 15,000 (show student card). Very tranquil and would recommend if you are in Hanoi.
Lovely short walk. Lovely lake in the old quarter of the town. Great place to people watch. Locals doing their exercises, tourists wandering, locals selling.
Nice view. I was lucky to know some locals who took me to an out of the way coffee shop that sat up high above the lake.

Best view in Hanoi at night especially after a rainy evening. Colorful street lights on the bank with a bright stunning view. Best view is at night when it lights up. You can go for a walk either alone or with your other half or just let yourself loose and enjoy the stunning view. The view is something that shouldn't be missed. I was there at night after a slow down pour and the place was just visually stunning. The atmosphere will make you something nostalgic that you will not forgot for quite some time. Take time to relax and enjoy the view.

Easy walk in the French Quarter and Old Quarter. We went early morning, midday, and the evening. Good place to see locals and domestic tourists. also, a good place to getyur bearing when walking around the French Quarter, Old Quarter, and cathedral district. A 5 minute walk from our hotel in the French Quarter, and a 5 minute walk from our hotel in the Old Quarter.

Nice stroll. The lake gives a relaxing place to unwind from the hustle and bustle of the old quarter. Early morning you see the locals doing their exercises and laps of the lake, later in day you might chat to locals and have students ask you to test their English ( if you get chance please help them because it's not only helpful to them it can be rewarding for you) , then later in evening it's nice to stroll around with an ice cream and sit with cool drink. Best of all its all free!
city temple. Fantastic temlpe in the middle of the city so quiet you would not believe it. with in walking distance

Pretty . This is a lovely spot to visit when you are exploring the old quarter. The monument is pretty and entry is only $30,000VND (about $2 Aus). The legend of the sword and the information about it is all there and there are guides if you want. Lots of tourists and a good place to cool down and take in the site. Walking around the lake is peaceful and very beautiful.

Very happening place, centre of everything. The landmark, many tourism spots are surrounding this lake. Although you may not find it very special, but no doubt this is a very happening place where you can see people exercising in the morning, walking around in the evening, and spending their time there at the night. There is also a story for the lake, check it out.

Nice for a stroll or to watch the world go by. We visited the Lake of the Restored Sword on our first day in Hanoi. Confronted with a 36 degree day, the shade of the trees around the lake provided some respite. The walk around the lake is a decent one and there's the Ngoc Son Temple to visit as well (located on an island in the lake). The lake is green and has plenty of fish, which occasionally jump out of the water catching insects. It's a nice spot to sit and soak in the chaos of Hanoi whilst enjoying the lake and surrounds. Every now and then a vendor comes round selling bottled water and there's constant hawking by Cyclo drivers (3 wheeled cycle taxi), but that's all part of enjoying this part of the world.Well worth a look.

The place to be in Hanoi in the evening. This seems to be the center of Hanoi nightlife. Crowds, especially young people and families with kids, are everywhere, doing all sorts of things. Street vendors sell ice cream, water, and flowers. The lake is lit with colorful spotlights on the temple in the center island and the bridge along one side (night also obscures how rundown the temple in the center of the lake looks during the day). I didn't see any signage explaining the history, but just being there and strolling and enjoying the view was fun. It would be a great spot for people watching.There are people walking dogs, dance classes playing music and sambaing in circles, couples strolling, teens on scooters scaring everyone on the sidewalk, bicycles everywhere, skaters on a plaza with lots of concrete across the street from the lake, cafes, bars.... You can sit on a bench if you find a free one, but it's pretty crowded. I see other reviews that describe this place as relaxing, but I don't really agree. There's too much going on, too much electricity, noise, life, and clamor. We walked by the lake several times during the day, and it wasn't the same, certainly, but the traffic and the urban feel and pace weren't very relaxing, even midday. I'd say it feels very energetic.It was fun. If you're in Hanoi and you don't spend at least one evening strolling around the lake, you're missing out.
in the middle of the city. a nice lake in the middle of the city, with a park, people everywhere just walking to trying to sell their products. The red bridge with the temple.
Peaceful spot. This is simply a nice place to take a break from the hustle and bustle of Hanoi. There are many people sitting and enjoying the lake both in the day and the evening.

nice picture. We walked to Hoan Kiem lake in the evening, the place had many tourist, the lake was not special, not large but beautiful tree and flowers around lake. It is suitable for wander a bit in a hot day.

Nice chilled spot- great ice cream!. Nice tranquil zone (if there's not a huge tour group in your face). Worth a walk around and look out for the turtles! If you're VERY lucky you may even see one of the few remaining giant turtles :)Good ice cream spot popular with the locals at the tip of the lake. Get the lime and mint popsicle and you won't regret it (16k VND)
Scenic Lake. This lake was a relaxing place to visit. With several places to eat and drink surrounding the lake, it provided a nice afternoon activity for our group.
Beautiful to walk around at night. This lake and the temple is worth a visit. Interesting history and stories. The lake is beautiful to walk around at night too.
Nice atmosphere. Lots happening over there like street musician,drink/meal sellers, and other local activities. Nice atmosphere for relaxing from hanoi traffic in the night.

Lovely walk. I often enjoyed a lovely walk around the lake. At night it is surrounded by families and couples enjoying the space..there is a nice little restaurant overlooking the lake which is a great spot for coffee or ice cream

Beautiful in the evenings. Sitting by this beautiful lake at sunset is very special. We were charmed by the gorgeous setting. It is easy to watch the sun go down here, I great cool spot to sit and slow down.

Sit at a cafe and watch the world go by, favourite spot for flash mobs,. Pretty average, read up about it and be amazed at the parralels between the Aurthurian Legends of Great Britain and their stories of swords in stones etc that were returned to a lake.

Lake of the restored sword is a little haven of peace in the heart of Hanoi. Lake of the restored sword is a little haven of peace in the heart of Hanoi. No guide needed. Lots of great pictures to take. Water of the lake is green whereas it is brownish elsewhere in Vietnam. There used to be a giant turtle in the lake.

Worth the walk!. Great to check out since it's near the old quarter of Hanoi. There's not much to see but walking along the lake is quite romantic if it's not too hot out. I enjoyed seeing Turtle Tower from a distance. Also, we paid to go to the temple and it was worth the few dollars we spent. Great picture opportunities within the temple!

nice to visit. it's very small red bridge on big lake which has really interesting story (restored sword) you have to visit it when you are in Hanoi and you should listen to the story from one of the local :)

ROMANTIC STROLL THROUGH HANOI. Really nice day walking trip. It was very hot so make sure to dress light and bring a water. You can buy fans that are sold throughout the walk. Lots of vendors to give you cyclo rides as well, but we walked around the lake and through the museum garden. Nice Pagoda and beautiful picturesque locations. Really the heart of Hanoi, and everything else is around. BE CAREFUL when you pay the street vendors selling fruit and stuff. Buy them , but dont expect much change as they kind of just grab it and smile. Very nice people though, so try and get some 10k and 20k notes before you leave.

the best place in hanoi. I really love the Sword lake or the Vietnamese name is Hoankiem. it great to see people walking around, doing exercise. Such a peaceful place stays next to my accommodation in BC family homestay, just 5 minutes by walking
Great early morning. Make sure you get up early to see 1000's of people doing their early morning exercises.The temple on the lake is very beautiful too
Nice for a stroll. Nice to stroll along the lake though not too much too do or see. There are some nice restaurants around that give a good view.

Changing colours and faces of Hanoi. I love walking around Hoan Kiem Lake, it takes around 20 mins or so to do a lap. The scenery constantly changes - the colours change with the weather and time of day. There is the contrast in traffic between day and night - when the street is relatively quiet to peak traffic periods. The outfits that people wear on motor scooters also change with time of day. Activities around the lake also change - tai chi and aerobics in the morning, dance groups, people walking dogs or jogging, the corner where the boys skate; so much to see. For a fee you can walk across the red bridge. The gardens are well maintained and can be admired. And there are several Cafes and kiosks from which you can purchase a drink or something to eat. Take the time to soak up the atmosphere.

Nice lake in the center of Old Quarter, with a long legend. A bit of surprise to see such a lake in the center of town. It is a really nice walk along the Lake. The night view with all the lights reflecting of the water gives a dramatic and different feel than day time. The local guide told us that the lake has a historic legend: during the 15th century, Vietnam revolted against its its Chinese overlord in the Ming Dynasty. A local Dragon god gave Vietnamese Emperor Loi a magic sword to help with the fight. Once the Chinese was repelled, a turtle surfaced asking Loi for the sword back. Hoan Kiem Lake in Vietnamese, Hoan means return (restored), Kiem means sword. Obviously not the original, but there are still a number of large, old turtles in the lake. There is a temple, red bridge, and tower on site.
Impressive temple. The temple in the Hoan Kiem Lake is quite impressive and should not be missed when visiting Hanoi. Less crowded than expected
Nice little lake to people watch. Beautiful lake that is lit up and looks amazing at night. Great space to exercise and engage in Two Chi with the locals in the morning.

A good location for waling around. We came to Hanoi when it began the Winter here which is nice for us (around 24 degree), we took a walk around the Lake where you see hundreds local doing Taichi, excises and hanging around. Were were surprised that lots people actually go out in the late afternoon and it was so interesting to see them. We bought some ice cream and just just sat there, watching busy city and life going...love the atmosphere.

Lively place. Lake is beautiful but the area around the lake comes to life in the evening. Many shops, pubs and restaurants are lined along the lake. Good for a leisurely walk too. Be careful of the pick-pockets and scammers.

Serene and beautiful. There is a history behind the lake. If you are lucky you may get to see the green turtles that consider the lake their home. It is a nice walk around and is situated in the old quarters. You can visit and relax around the lake. There is a Buddhist temple on the red bridge and opposite is the temple of turtles. To visit the temple there is a fee, but to walk around the lake is free
A place of peace in the heart of Hanoi. Located inside the Historic Center of Hanoi, you can visit the temple and watch the Pagoda in the middle of the point.

People watching par excellance. You go not knowing what to expect, you see a lot of real Vietnamese, doing the things they do, exercising, taking photos of themselves and each other, posing in wedding gowns, eating and drinking! It really is great, and to make it even better the Vietnamese are amused by the tourists who they are watching, I suspect they have their own ideas about us, but they are enormously polite as long as you are not in a queue for anything! The story of the giant turtle who just passed away is now even better than when you had to try yet fail to spot him! The temple on the little island is a good example of real people worshiping in a way not familiar to many tourists, but take the time to read up and understand what is going on, and how the influences in Vietnamese culture are Chinese yet this is distinctly not China! Try to walk all the way around, as the lake is different depending on which part you visit!
Every beautiful lake. I went to here many times for walking, reading, visiting and I still want to go here more. A lot of local people here for exercise, dancing and dating aslo.

Nice walk. It's pretty walk by the lake but that's really all. Just go by it and take a quick photo if you are headed somewhere nearby. Not something you need to go out of your way to see but it's close enough to other things that you can easily see it.
Touristy. Good to learn some history about the city. Cool change from the heat of the streets. Bonsai are impressive as are the views of the lake. Iconic Hanoi.

Enjoy the walk, lots happening. This is also called Turtle Lake or so our guide said, in the middle of Hanoi, lots to see around it.We have walked around it several times, heat of the day, early morning, evening etc and we saw something awesome every time.Mostly shaded, but still oppressive humidity, lake itself fairly green and polluted. But walk around in about 20min.It has a temple for about $30000 dong, approx $2 Au to get in and see a giant preserved title as well, not really worth it.It had its own Venice beach, locals lifting free weights, tai chi, dancers etc. you can see some other hotels etc as you walk around for food or drinks you may like.Early morning, tai chi, badminton, futsal, a massive aerobics group in a park as we walked around to name a few.Our teenagers were approached by young locals to practice their English, our kids loved this and seems common as you walk around.A nice flat walk, see the locals in action, keep to the shade.
Serene place. Visit in the evening, the lightings of the place makes in vibrant. Locals will visit to enjoy the lake and lots of tourist taking pictures of the beautiful lake.

Dangerous locals. Hanoi has a different feel to Hoi An and Saigon. The locals around the lake selling pop up cards are horrible people. I was pick pocketed on our first night. He just wouldn't let me go and was really all in my space. He stole my purse and threw it against a tree for his "friend" to pick it up. Exercise extreme caution and don't let anyone get close.

Just a lake with a temple. There is a temple with entrance fee of 30k but you can get in with 15k ticket if you have a student card. It offers nothing much to see unless you have a storyteller in your group which can explain the history of the lake and its temple. To do the temple justice i must say if you are not familiar with Buddhism temple then it might be interesting for you.

Historical and informative. was nice to hear of the integral influence of chinese history on vietnam and highly recommend to be at lake in evening to night as it simply lights up with all the various colours
Fantastic. Old Quarter's strees across and meet at that place. Trees, benchs, musicians, food/drink sellers. Walk around the lake and take a photos at night or noon.

Very beautiful, nice walk. Nice lake in central Hanoi. Makes for a nice walk, where you will see water puppet theatre, outdoor gym, street sellers, and a temple with a small entrance fee.All in all it's quite humid in the summer, but very nice and you'll be able to spot a lot of different restaurants and café's all close to the Hoan Kiem lake.
Must see at night. At night the bridges and monuments are lit up and looks great. We went at nighttime as well as in the day and both were worthwhile.

Picturesque lake. Coming from New Zealand this isn't the pristine water body we are used to - but regardless it's a nice centre-point in the city, has some great attractions in and around and makes for a fun scenic walk on the edge of the city's old quarter.
It is nice but.... We were walking through the park around the lake and you see rats just walking around. I know it can happen anywhere (including Hyde Park) but kind of puts you off...

Nice to walk around. It's a lake, it has a path, it's nice to walk around...but I wouldn't have been upset if I missed it. It rained off and on while we were there so I would not recommend in the rainy season.
It's a lake. . Just a lake with an island. It's ok if you don't come here but you probably will see it on the way to somewhere else. It's ok.
Very good and well maintained temple. Just loved this place both in the day and at night. At night almost all the trees are lit up and the bridge is very colorful indeed.

Worth a visit but nothing special. The lake is very easy to visit when in Hanoi, just in the corner of Old Quarter. It's clean and has nice surrounding gardens. The only problem with it is that there's just nothing special. It's not particularly pretty, not very exciting, there isn't much to see (the temple isn't much to look at). It's just a lake in a city.

Great at night!!. The lake is absolutely beautiful at night time. With its amazing lights and people walking. In the morning you can see people running besides the lake visit the temple and see pagoda

Beautiful and very busy place. The lake is best seen early morning or late afternoon. The tower on an island in the middle is spectacular when lit up on dusk. Many locals, doing boot camp, tai chi, wedding photos, picnicking, people-watching etc. very nice pagoda too, at the other end of the lake from the tower.
Evening Run. we had evening run at the lake with total 5.25km (3.5 round within the lake). We had beers and avocado after the run.

Great spot for a small city escape. Take a break from the hustle and bustle of Hanoi and enjoy a stroll around the lake -- sip on an iced coffee at one of the surrounding cafes, enjoy a popsicle on a hot afternoon, slow down and enjoy the prime opportunities for people watching!

Lake view makes all the difference. I'm coming from Mexico City, thus big amounts of non sea water is not common that is why I am impressed with lakes any were.But this one in Hanoi makes a big difference between Saigon and the capital. It gives it a real flavor. The bridge... Well is not worth it at all but once you're there you pay you take the customary picture and you are done.If you are in Hanoi you MUST go.

Beautiful!. It is lovely to visit this lake at various times of day. In the early morning (around 6 am), the lake area is filled with locals of all ages. You can see zumba classes, badminton games, tai chi classes, and all sorts of physical exercise. During the day, the area is bustling with tourists, motorists, and vendors.

A place to Chill. The lake and its park provide a welcome sense of space from the hectic and teeming streets nearby. The island temple and the red bridge make fo nice views and the area is nicely lit at night. There are a couple of cafes to sit and watch the world go by.

Pleasant. The whole area around the lake is very nice and pleasant. Especially at night it's very lively and energetic. There are cafes, restaurants, places to sit and enjoy the nice views. There is a nice temple on the lake that is open for tourists.

Nice serene lake. A nice quiet lake to walk around and do some thinking. Great history here too and so sad the 150 year old turtle just died. Mornings are great here with people exercising early, burning incense and praying for the turtle spirit. A nice place to spend a hour or so.

Absolutely beautiful. . The landscaping is amazing, and at night it is lit with sparkling coloured lights! Such a beautiful lake with an incredible story behind it. The temple is lovely. Visit at night and during the day!
My Journey My Views . The Beautiful Lake Of The Hanoi The Capital City of Voetnam Is Situated At A 10 Minutes Walking Distance From The Hotel

Don't expect too much but it is a nice like in the middle of the city. If you put it bluntly, it is just a lake in the middle of the city. But it is a nice place to relax and get away (temporarily) from the traffic of the city

A lake is still just a lake. Although it was brilliant joingnin some 6am yoga beside this lake and enjoying the beautiful temples that lay upon it, im of the opinion a lake is still a lake and this lake did not wow me. However, it is a spot that you will not miss if in Hanoi, and is a pleasant walk around. Take care when crossing the roads though, i cant say the same for the drivers.

Very nice!. It is a very beautiful and safe park, try to stay at night is even more beautiful every tree with lights. My kids enjoyed it very much, there is a restaurant over the lake, biter didn't go; there are boats tour, but the day we went it was raining. The tuktuk are there too, that is a nice thing to do.

Not the highlight I was expecting. Even though this was not what I was expecting at night time it was a very different story. During the day the Japanese bridge gets crowded with tourists and the views are not that spectacular but of a nighttime even though still crowded with promenaders the lake is spectacular. Crossing the road is another matter!!! Stick behind a local.

Beautiful natural spot in a bustling city. If you need to break out of the narrow, busy streets of the Old Quarter, take a walk around this lake. It's beautifully lit up at night with lots of people watching to be had. You may even be lucky enough to have a bench to sit on and watch the world go by. A somewhat more chilled out spot.
A great walk and scenery. We spent an hour or so walking around the lake, taking photos of scenery and attractions. You could probably walk in 15 minutes if you were only exercising.

Bridge of Selfies. Lovely lake in the center of Hanoi that is a major attraction for both locals and tourists. The water in the lake does not look overly pristine, but there is no odor and apparently there were turtles in it for years, but the "last" turtle died last January, and no others have been spotted since. It's very nice to walk around it, even when we were there on a dull day. The Huc bridge is clogged with people taking selfies.
The. This is the epitome of Vietnam: get up early and watch the walkers/aerobics; in the evening watch the lights on the water.
A place where both locals and tourists meet. Is a popular place for both locals and tourists. Worth to visit as you can experience the local culture. A good place for a picnic.
Beautiful and even better at night. We loved taking a stroll around the lake by day and sitting having a drink by nice. Great views can be enjoyed from 'I want coffee' restaurant.
Yeah, it's a lake. Not very clean, apparently there are turtles in it, not sure where they were, possibly water so dirty they were impossible to see.

A regular walk. The lake is beautiful and a great place to dander and people watch. We usually ended up at the lake for a walk at least once in the day while we were in HanoiIt's location means that you can walk around it to get to most places but it is also a beautiful spot for a morning or evening stroll.
Good for morning run. The morning run before 8am is great! later than that there would be too many cars and motorcycles :)

Nice lake to walk about. It's a beautiful lake to walk around. Lots of restaurants and shops are located around this lake, so you can shop and take a walk at the same time. There's many benches and small parks around the lake, so you can enjoy the lake while taking a rest, too. There's a temple in the center of the lake, and the red bridge connecting the temple and the land is very beautiful.

A lake. It is nice to have a stroll around it at many times of the day. I was keen to visit at night because around the edges there are LED lights ornately laid out. The 3 nights I was in Ha Noi they never turned them on. I was surprised how little street vendors are along the lake. You really could just sit on one of the many seats and just have a nice relaxed time. It was surprisingly quite for being in the middle of the city. I liked seeing the locals enjoying this space as well.

You will see this lake when in Hanoi, no need to make a special trip. Beautiful lake with local history associations. Catches the breeze and pleasant to sit beside and walk around. No need to schedule a visit there as it is used as a central point when visiting Hanoi.
A walk around a lake with temple inside the lake. Every evening local people come here to walk around the lake or enjoy parks on the side. There is a small old temple inside the lake near the corner.
Meh. It is a nice place to eat a sandwich but the lake it self is more a pond with dirty water and really cheesy LED lights at night.

Just a lake. It's probably worth a look but it isn't anything spectacular.I slowly walked the entire circular lake only because it was extremely hot. It doesn't take that long. There is a temple you can go into for 30 000d but if you've seen one temple you've seen them all. In the middle of the lake is a shell of a building called Turtle Tower. The only disappointment is none of the signs around the lake are written in both languages so you cannot read about the attraction. Trees align the pathways, you can join ladies doing their morning exercises, a large garden clock surround by flowers and garden beds filled with lily or a type of daisy.The road around the park is very wide so if you cross the it to go to the shops just be careful of the chaotic Hanoi traffic. Along the way there are stores selling drinks and ice cream along with WC. The good thing is it is free unless you go see the temple.

It's a lake. There's a bridge to a temple on an island in the middle (admissions is ~$1/person), and there are some nice banyan trees growing around it, but that's about it.Walking around the lake isn't peaceful, mostly due to the loud roads around it.
Beautifull. Very beautifull lake and lovely to walk around, we had a personal guide with us who explained everything about the lake and its surroundings.

Average. The lake itself is a nice quiet place in the buzzling city centre. However, the temple on the island is not very special in itself. Not worth the VND30.000 entrance fee in my opinion. I've seen better temples for less/free, or with better value-for-money.
Stayed at the foot of the lake. I Stayed with my daughter at the foot of the lake for a few days - we loved walking the lake first thing in the monrning.And watching sunset over it

Amazing view of the daily lives of the locals . Take a morning stroll around the lake and you won't be disappointed... Ladies doing ther morning stretching, a bit of Tai Chi... Men lifting weights, dog walkers, a couple of restaurants... City life early in the morning, before the sweltering heat descends. Fascinating, positive and relaxing.
Beautiful lake and area in a very busy bustling city.. Just lovely to be able to relax peacefully admist this bustling city of motorbikes..yes motorbikes. More motorbikes that you could imagine.

Really lovely after 9pm. Walking around this lake after 9pm any day of the week is lovely. It is always busy with local families, there are regular dog meet ups, mature aged dancing and breakdancing. It is also has a good breeze in the night. I came here every night 3 days in a row as the vibe was so nice.

Incredibly tranquil . Beautiful bonsai and calmness in the centre of this madly bustling city. The incense shrine and mythical tale of the divine sword of the lake remind me of our Calesvol-well , except for the giant turtle!!

Unbelievable! A must see!. It has a small litle red bridge. Very pitoresc! On the middle you will find a temple, small but very cheap(1usd) and fast to see. Good to rest a bit under the shadows of the trees.

Nice walk. Beautiful lake. Nice to walk around the perimeter but not nice to fall in to. You're bound to end up near the lake so go check it out - it's not a big activity in itself though. It's more just a nice thing in the middle of the city. A nice way to get between neighbourhoods ( ie between old quarter and French quarter or cathedral district ) as it's less busy than the streets. If you go, don't forget to look out for the tortoise tower that is in the middle. It's an attraction that can be overlooked. Read up on it before going to understand its significance because I still haven't idea and I saw it.

A little oasis in the middle of Hanoi. Often seen as one of the most popular places to visit in Hanoi as its so accessible. We visited here and enjoyed the history and respite it offers from the hustle and bustle of the Old quarter. Well worth the VND30,000/ pax to get in, kids under 15 free.
Not that special. . Touristic thing. Not really interesting. I was done in less than 5 minutes. It isn't something I will recommend.

Beautiful lake and lovely temple. We enjoyed a stroll over the bridge and visited the Ngoc Son Temple. It has a nominal entrance fee but is worth the look around and has a lovely view across the lake from the little terrace at the back.We also saw the turtles which is supposed to be good luck! We enjoyed the stroll around the lake before braving the manic little streets in the centre of Hanoi and heading off towards the mausoleum and Ho Truc Bach lake and Chua Tran Quoc temple which was actually my favourite. On our route back round to the hotel we stopped for lunch at a lovely tiny little local cafe on Truc Bach where we enjoyed a lovely drink and some really fantastic local food for a tiny amount of money. In total we left the hotel at 11am and returned at 6pm and had had a lovely day & felt that we'd really taken in a lot of Hanoi.

Lovely & relaxing, even on a hot summer's day. It was really warm in Hanoi, but cooler by the lake. It's always a delight to see the locals out enjoying this area, with the odd wedding photos being taken and families relaxing on the grass. The bridge is a popular photo spot and while there is a fee to enter the temple area, you can wander around the lake and on the bridge for free.

Nice place for taking rest. Hoan Kiem Lake is located In the middle of downtown Hanoi, and it is an oasis for local people. It is an ideal place for taking a rest, and there are enough benches surrounding the lake. If you keep its location in mind, you never lose your way.

Lovely. An evening walk is the perfect way not only to explore the lake, but also to see the hanoians during their everyday life: families with kids giving food to the fish, old people exercising, youngsters chatting over a cup of coffee...you might stumble across people dancing or playing sports until late at night on a tuesday and they don't seem to be bothered that they must wake up early the next day for going to work - a feat not many of us can do nowadays.Truly amazing.

Beautiful lake.. Lake is close to old quarters and across Apricot hotel. Evening around the hotel is very lively. One can walk across the lake any time but in summers evening is the best time. Lots of food joint across the lake.

Cool park. A quick stopover to Hanoi and this is one place that we got to see and walk a bit. If you enjoy people watching and just doing nothing..best place to go. Just order the vietnamese coffee (cafe su dua) and your all set to enjoy the view.
Serene place. Beautiful place to be at in early morning and evening. Good for a stroll. But must be wary of pickpockets at times.

Hoan Kiem Lake is the real heart of old Hanoi. Interesting by day, a spectacle at night, lovely for walk and some people watching. The surrounding park is clean and well kept and plenty of places to walk or sit.

Absolutely Beautiful. Tourists and locals alike stay in this area because of the beautiful ambiance as well as the calming scenery. You actually have two options: you can pay to get inside the small island where it has temples and a mini-museum or you can just stay at the red bridge and take pictures.There isn't much inside after paying the fee though but it's worth going inside only once. Some kids play around with the water since you can dip your feet but there's not much activity except people just enjoying the weather and ambiance.
Beautiful at night. We spent a lot of time walking around this Lake, both day and night, just beautiful. The reflections are amazing.
i hear the turtle is dead. Used to have a big turtle swimming around, a ridiculously big turtle. Got polluted, turtle died. Kind of nice to walk around at night time, kind of.

Lake Walk Around.. Visited Hoan Kiem Lake around 6.30am, whilst waiting for our hotel room in nearby Trung Yen Lane to be made up, lot of activity at this time of morning, mainly exercise by locals. The walk around the whole of the lake is easy and gives you a good idea of the area besides the lake the area is mainly commercial. As a photographer I was given lots of opportunities, can't recall being refused permission to take a shot. Note the island temple was not open this early in the morning.

Heart of the City. The city seems to revolve around this serene lake - and it seems that the serenity of the lake, bridge and park keeps the rather chaotic city of Hanoi grounded and balanced. The lake is magnificent in the morning, with locals running and some people practicing their tai chi moves

Awesome people great location!. I walked around the lake and was approached several times by students wanting to practice English. Finally in the evening I say and talked with an entire class. I cannot tell you how great of a gift this became for me. These kids were bright and hopeful. Eager to learn and full of curiosity. It was so refreshing to see young people so open to learning. They were like little sponges. And hilarious too!
Great site in the centre of Ha Noi. Whilst I was waiting to see the puppet show I took the opportunity of visiting this wonderful historic site.Located on a beautiful lake and so well preserved.
Enjoy walking here!. The lake was just in the heart of the city. Very peaceful and calm in the middle of busy streets. Safe walk. So a must for Hanoi.

Tranquil lake. Took a stroll along the lake but did not pay the entrance fee to go and see a temple. Lake is peaceful and offer some contrast from the busy-ness of Hanoi city. There is a pen pagoda at the entrance to the temple. Night view is nice with beautiful lightings.
Hot. Close to busy street + busy vehicle traffic + concrete jungle + humid summer = unbearable. Not much can be done though - nice but could skip it.

Nice! . There is not a lot to see here, it's a large lake in the middle if the city which is nice, and pleasant to walk around, there is a small island in the middle with an old temple on it ( which you can't get to ) at one end is a very old bridge which gives you the perfect photo opportunity, (but watch out for all the locals trying to take your picture and charge you for it!) the bridge leads to a small pay per view attraction which from what I could see, the majority of people bypass ( me included) if you are going I would say evening is probably the best time to go as the area comes alive with locals and tourists alike, they have also made a good effort at lighting everything up in quite a creative way. If you have time to fill, there are worse things you could do. One word of caution, although I did not see any trouble I was advised that 'phone snatchers' operate in this area so use extra care!

Place to visit, pray and place for recreational area for jogging, walk and admire the beautiful lake of Hoan Kiem!. If you are residing somewhere near center of Hanoi, this is definitely not to be missed. Hoan Kiem Lake is about its cultural and historic heart. It may not be big–it's much smaller than West Lake–but the Old Quarter wraps this place along. What to expect: A beautiful basket of flowers inside Hanoi, a mirror-like green lake, a place of love, the core of Hanoi!When to go: Early morning sees Hoan Kiem Lake at its best, stirring to life as walkers, joggers and tai chi enthusiasts limber up in the half-light.Fees: Free if just walk around the lake, a small fees would be needed if you are planning a visit to the temple

Smaller than imagined. Walking around the lake is easy but the footpath is not the best. Walking around in the heat and humidity is trying..... very draining.Not very pretty at all. Green lake. Red bridge and temple in the middle. Pay a small fee to enter. Another ruin in the middle of the lake.Nothing much else to do so it seems this is the main and only attraction there is.

Pretty lake in center city!. The Vietnamese people and visitors love to stroll around this scenic lake with a small island showcasing a picturesque temple. Spend some time people watching or enjoying a snack or cool drink on a hot Hanoi afternoon. Plenty of restaurants and stalls selling local fare.

Beauiful at night. This is a nice place to walk during the day or night. This place exudes amazing atmosphere at night, beaming with city lights. At the top end of the lake, you will find lots of restaurants or cafes where you can sit and watch the city go by.

A nice walk in the park. There is nothing much but the tranquility of the lake makes walking around it nice. But the traffic around it is buzzling. But you can see locals resting around the lake or walking their dogs. There is no activity in the lake.

A little lake that is most popular in Hanoi.. Vietnamese love this lake. They like to walk along it, do physical exercise or take photos. There's a small temple on the lake which can only be reached by the beautiful red bridge. At night the lake and the bridge is lighted up and is even more attractive and beautiful. During festivals, there will always be celebrations here, like fireworks or cultural activities. It's also one of the few places you'll see demonstrations occasionally. Tourists love this lake. This is the most important landmark in Hanoi. It only takes about an hour to walk around the whole lake. Various kinds of shops, restaurants or buildings can be found alongside it. This is also a place young Vietnamese students will come to meet foreigners to practise their spoken English. Be patient if you come across them. Spend some time with them. This is a meaningful cultural activity for tourists.

Lesiurely stroll. Probably the heart of the city and center for activities. The pathway makes it easy to circle around the lake and sit down and relax. Wont take very long to do so .. around 30 to 60 mins.
Very relaxing next to Old Quarter. With clear skies this is a beautiful place to walk around. Marvel at the temple and turtle tower and learn about the local legends!
Nice stroll along the lake. Nice Lake doesn't take long to stroll around it lots of vendors offering street food and fruits. There is a pagoda to visit but we did not do it since they were closing.
Nice to stroll around. Nice lake in the middle of the city. Pretty to stroll around with a temple to visit as well. Close to old city center so easy to walk

Beautiful stroll mid-morning, gentle breezes, very enjoyable :D. I went for a stroll around the whole lake, took it very slow and easy. A simple beauty indeed. Waters, trees, bamboos, flowers, people chilling around, and not that many peddlers.
I liked it - gives you a nice natural break from hectic Hanoi. Of course, allows you to recharge yourself to head back into the organized chaos

Deep history explored. If you only have one or two day in Hanoi, It's good if you do a research first because this area has too much things that you could see. I was lucky when wandering around the lake, then being order to try an app named Hanoi Audio Guide by a group of start-up team with 3 lovely Vietnamese girls. This app will lead a solo traveller like me to explore the Old Quarter like a local, even without a tour guide. I tried for free with Ngoc Son Shrine and it was very useful. It would be a miss for me if I didn't use the app. I know about the legendary story of the lake, the meaning of the horse and the bird inside the shrine.

Beautiful! . It's a great walk to complete and there are lots of coffee shops and eateries surrounding it.We only walked around a third which took us nearly 20 minutes. Would love to walk the entire circumference.It is stunning and beautiful both day and night.

central and nice to walk around. it's not that big so recommend walking around. I went at day and night. Busy and safe. Interesting to watch the locals exercise and socialise. Met a student who walked with me to practice his English and then took me for a scooter tour.

Peaceful but expect to converse with students . Very nice shady lake. Lots of students keen to practice English by talking with you. Fun at first but after the 6th group it can be tiresome. They were very polite when we said we were busy.

Worth a visit. This lake is really lovely very picturesque by day by night the place comes alive with seller's and people doing exercise classes it is really a site to see. Take a trip over the bridge to the temple you have to pay to go in but worth it.

An asset to a busy city. We always walked around the lake every day during our stay in Hanoi. It was a really peaceful and reflective place despite being in a frantic city. Nice to see lots of locals using this space with their families.
basket flower of Hanoi. a Small lake of Hanoi city, many trees around the lake so it like a super condition air in the hot summer
Beautiful. This is a lovely park with excellent views all around. There are some beautiful trees and bonsai. It's a place of relative tranquility in the bustle of Hanoi.
Enjoy a walk!. Buy a coffee or a coke walk around and sit in the shade and haggle with a few vendors.Good afternoon relaxing.

Stunning scenery!. Can't describe its spectacular beauty. With crowds of people wandering around, the flowers blooming, the greenery verdantly rising, the winds lightly blowing, i can sit here daydreaming for hours on end!

Beautiful at night . Great place to take a nice walk after dinner. The view at night is nicer, quiet and there are places to sit along the way. One leisure walk around the river took us about 30mins, with stope for photo taking!

Ho Hoan Kiem. Tbh, I don't find anything special at all with place with regards to the view or whatsoever. Its just a lake in the miidle of the city. View was more attractive at night due to the lightings. If you are free after dinner, no harm taking a slow walk here around the lake.

Great relaxing spot. The Lake is perfect to sit back and watch the world go by, or walk the loop around the lake. There is plenty of photo opportunities along the way. Peaceful, natural and so much on offer, whether it be restaurants, cafes, a seat or to get some exercise. I highly recommend walking over the red bridge to temple.

Stroll in the evening. Went there in June, super hot and decided to return to the lake for a stroll in the evening. Many locals gather to meet and even a group of students approached and want to communicate with us in order to learn more from the tourist. Interesting place for a relax walk and though the lake seems a bit dirty but the view at night is so much nicer and also more windy. Only issue is crossing the crowded road to reach this lake is no easy task!

Peacful. Went for walks around the lake . Big groups of mostly elderly people doing " Thai Chi " ( or similar ) in the morning . There is restaurants , both old traditional and some new fancy one to be found .

Strolling. Pleasant lake, worth a stroll. Maybe go for a run around it if you are keen at twilight? The smog can be appalling, so do as the locals do, and consider covering your face to help breathing.

Worth a visit. If you're able to drown out the incredibly loud background noise, the result of infinite scooters and horns, you'll find the lake to be fairly tranquil. Lots of restaurants and bars providing a view, the lake itself is easy enough to stroll around or sit down and relax with a good book.

Worth a stroll around Hanoi's heart. To me the lake feels like the heart of Hanoi. I would thoroughly recommend a stroll around it in late afternoon / sunset. It's great to see the local people meeting, walking, chatting, eating or running!!As the sun sets the lights bring the place even more to life - we loved the lit up views from one of the rooftop / overlooking cafes.

Pretty but sweltering in June. Really lovely lake. Definitely nice to walk around, or grab coffee/drinks nearby. In the early morning before the heat starts getting crazy (we went in June), many people are out and about exercising, walking, doing tai chi, and it's a fun vibe.Really just wish we came at a slightly cooler time. It was 70% humidity and 36-38 degrees, quite intense.

dirty water but you can never see it at night. It was really really hot in Hanoi. But walking along the lake was really good because it was always windy near the lake. Not much to see there and quite noisy. It's worth a visit at night time.

Beautiful lake . It is always crowded here . Spend 1~2hours walking around the lake, you can find many interesting views. Don't know how it looks like in the day. However, it is splendid in the night. This is the spot you can't miss when coming to Hanoi.

What an atmosphere!. This Lake is the perfect spot to come if you are new to Hanoi or Vietnam. It allows you to see how lovely all the locals are. At night time and on weekends the lake is surrounded by so many people enjoying dancing, singing and socialising. It doesn't take long to walk all the way around the lake. I highly recommend it - especially at night :) I loved visiting this Lake as the atmosphere was wonderful.

A good walk. The story behind the lake is intetesting but i found the lake more useful for s good walk and people watching. It takes 20 minutes to walk around the lake. The walkway is wide and level and is well lit at night.There are a few cafes on the lake and a number of restaurants across the road which offer cold beer and a view to watch the lake,people and traffic

Must-Visit Place. This is the well-known place in Old Quarter. And somehow the Old Quarter built circling this area so you must be cross this lake (in any side of the lake) most of your time in Hanoi :)

Amazed by its tranquil beauty!. We were staying around the corner and we came for a very relaxed walk on the shores of this magnificent lake.It is so beautiful with every aspect a post card shot- the bridge, museum, side walks are all wonderful aspects to enjoy the lake whilst having a totally unique experience. It's safe, tranquil and one of the most enriching experiences of our time in Hanoi.

Beautiful lake, but the water is murky. Huge lake with nice pedestrian walking paths around it. Also, very nicely well kept flower beds all around. Tons of old people doing "exercise", and chilling on benches; super cute.

A peaceful centre in a busy city. This lake is a very peaceful, relaxing centre to a frantically busy city. There are lots of beautiful gardens, good walkways and lots of seating to stop and rest and observe the people.
Experience local culture. Go early in the morning to see groups exercising together. Hang out in the afternoon and help students practice their English!
Not much. Not much to see, except that the lake provides a good central point for orientation to exploring the city. Nice ambiance at night. The temple smaller than we had imagined!

Standard lake!. Worth a quick visit to if anything view the bridge crossing to the island. The elaborate bridge is the only highlight. Standard city lake...a relative peaceful area with the awesome chaotic old town.

Legendary Lake. Hoan Kiem Lake is a famous legendary lake. This is a most beautiful lake in Hanoi. The lake reflects culture and daily life of the city. In the early morning it is very interesting to watch people doing morning excercise, taichi, running around the lake. You can the nice young couples come here to take weeding photos.Very nice place !
Relaxing. Lovely to walk around both in the day and the early evening!!! Lots of things going on and people doing their yoga! A really relaxing walk to spend an hour or two!
lake in the city centre. come early in the morning to see local exercise near the lake. pass 8am it's gonna be hot. few things/attractions to see around the lake.
My favorite part of Hanoi. A fairy tale setting on the lake, lovely red bridge, nice temple, breezes, great place to get your zen on.
Nice and close to the city . This place is small but ar o und there on the night you can enjoy a beautiful view. If you want to visit te temple across the bridge you have to pay, it is not that big.

A beautiful location in the heart of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is really large and sits at the centre of several arterial roads that lead into the Old Quarter, the Museum of the Revolution and a massive statue of Ly Thai To, the first king of Vietnam. Most roads lead back to it, and it's a beautiful place for a walk, especially in the evenings. Peace lilies abound, as do people out for a stroll, a spot of exercise, or just some family/couple time.

Must-Visit in Hanoi. Our family of 5 visited Hoan Kiem Lake in May 2016. The evening is the best time to go as many locals are enjoying a break from the hot daytime sun. You will enjoy the view of Thap Rua Tower and Ngoc Son Temple in addition to the city views. One of the highlights of our trip to Hanoi is when we were approached by Vietnamese students looking to practice their English. We learned a lot about Vietnamese culture through this. If you are strapped for time or too tired to walk, pay for a cyclo driver to take you around the lake and through the Old Quarter.

A lake is a lake to me. Sorry but I couldn't get excited about seeing a lake in the middle of a city. You can only walk around it as there are no activities like rowing boats etc.There is a legend about a turtle and the lake but that is as interesting as it gets.You can pay 30,000 dong to visit the temple over a little bridge which is small but ok
Loved to come read out here. Calming lake thats a great place to read, some locals will stop by and have a chat with you possibly. If you are going to Hanoi you will see this lake.

Where the local relax.. This is the Lake every one talks about but there is not much to see as the main part for visiting is shut,so if you want to take photographs then it is only from the outside of the painted Red bridge which is the entrance to the Temple that is closed,it does not take long to walk around the lake and seeing people relaxing or doing their daily routine of keeping fit,having a beer or eating local food on offer,the heat is unbearable so as the saying goes ( only mad dogs and English Men walk in the midday sun ) the place is bustling with people most of the time and crossing the roads is a nightmare,the secret is not to look at the traffic heading towards you just focus your eyes on to the road it has been said that you have a very small chance of getting knocked down.

Nice place, nice walk.. Better to visit this place in the night.Many colors in the lights around the lake, give a nice feeling.Some very expensive places for lunch, dinner etc around the lake.And some shops, in the north-eastern side.You must visit

Hang out and People watch. Great photo ops and to get a feel of the Happiness and quick to smile and laugh, essence of the Hanoians. Loved the youngsters that would grab you and ask you to spend time with them so they can practice their English. But mostly, to engage in learning about who is visiting their land. And learning about your culture.

Nice for a stroll in the Evening. In the day I do not like the place but in the night it does turn into something else. There are lights all over that make the place different. I like to walk one time round the lake and look at the lights. Be prepared to meet young locals that want to practice their English!
A like in the heart of a crazy busy town!. It's surrounded by a small park area, so you canst at in the shade or repair from rain. It is busy as it is right in the center of the city.

Lovely city lake at heart of Old Quarter!. Kiev Lake is a centre point in the old quarter. You can walk around the very lakeside or on the path that runs though pretty gardens all the way around. It's a busy and popular place with locals both day and night. Great for people watching! There's all kind of things going on; wedding photo shoots, salsa dancers etc. You get the picture! A night stroll around the lake is very enjoyable too. Recommend!

Vibrant part of old quarter !. This place is buzz with activity anytime of the hour. We visited in the morning around 7 and it was alive. We saw the temple by crossing the bridge and took a round around the lake. We were stopped by pretty girls trying to sharpen their English by engaging in a conversation. Stopped by an ice cream parlour. Lots of flowers. In the evening it looks beautiful with all the lights. I suggest that visit at least in the morning and in the evening after dark

Always nice to see water - more peaceful place in the city, with the Old Quarter close by and many shops around. We stayed on Au Trien street, not far from St. Joseph's Cathedral in the Old Quarter; there are a number of small hotels on this street - good location from various places to visit. It was easy, even with primary school aged children, to walk to the lake. The water puppet theatre is also close to the lake as are places selling ice-cream, drinks, floats etc. There are many places to eat, and lots of shops selling many different types of things on the roads around/close to the lake. The lake has areas for seating around and grass. It's pretty having trees, grass etc in the city, and not just concrete building. The lake is popular place for local people also, it seems especially on the weekends - so that can give you a better insight in some of the life around the city. Hanoi is very busy and traffic always flowing, but here is a relaxing place if you turn your back on the traffic and just walk on the walks/sidewalks, area around the lake. There is a nice breeze coming off the lake at times and you can sit and enjoy it. There are people of all ages enjoying the area. Some sitting, drawing, talking, walking, some exercising, even with weights in one area in the early evening. At night the lights around are nice to see. Some of the younger people will ask to speak English with you, if you speak English, and are quite friendly.
Beautiful area to explore. Beautiful area to explore during the day time or during the evening hours as well!! A lot to explore especially if you're doing a walking tour of the area.

Enjoyable and very interesting. A lovely pocket of Hanoi that makes you feel relaxed. loved walking around the lake visiting the historic areas and watching the locals engage in dance, exercise and other activities
Enjoy. Lovely view, very relaxing, just take a walk around and forget your self. Don't worry, be happy. You would maybe like to do some tai chi exercise.

Walk around of an evening for a never-to-be-forgotten experience. The lake itself itself is wonderful, but the experience of walking around it at night is memorable forever. People walk up to you to chat and try out their English, while others are just minding their own business and getting on with enjoying the atmosphere of this wonderful place. As the Red Bridge glistens across the lake, and the 18th century Temple of the Jade Mountain reflects onto the water, it is easy to imagine yourself back in time to when the story of the reclaimed sword of its owner, Long Vurong, was alive. A story that brings to mind the similar legend of King Athur!You can walk around the lake in about half an hour, but don't try, otherwise you will miss the magic of this wonderful place. And the best of all, it costs nothing!

Beautiful - do it at night!. When the sun goes down and the lights turn on, the lake is a beautiful place to visit for a walk. Quite busy, but full of families enjoying themselves and couples strolling. Nice atmosphere, lovely breeze off the water, a different side to Hanoi from the old quarter, definitely worth a visit.
The lake is beautiful. love walking around the lake, looking at the trees and flowers and people hanging around... I also enjoy the view from Ngoc Son Temple, really peaceful and nice place to visit
Middle of town. Large lake set in the middle of the town centre. You can walk round it in 30 mins and there are places to sit but would you want to with the traffic and fumes.

Lovely walk around. . When you visit Hanoi you must walk around the Lake soak up the local atmosphere and just watch the locals do their everyday life routine very popular amongst the elderly who just love to sit and chat with each other don't be surprised if you get some young locals who approach you to practice their English. It's probably a 30 minute walk but allow more time and enjoy the sites and people.
Great dinner sightseeing Hoam Kiem lake. The leyend of turttle that restored the sword, temple, flags and flowers, are charming.the view from terrace of Avalon's 7 floor is great.

Good walk to soak up the culture and fumes. Great start to a visit to Hanoi, watch the maddening traffic and locals doing Tai chi. Feed the carp in the lake and have a coffee at one of the cafes or the Patisserie at the southern end ( French influence) Also visit the temple in the middle of the lake (entrance fee) as part of a self conducted walking tour of the old quarter. Communism very much in evidence but unobtrusive.

Cool lake for a run or walk around. Ran round here a few times in the mornings and was full of people, same as in the afternoon or night. Cool vibes, but I know it is bad to say this but watch out for groups of local kids trying to practice their English. Definitely have a yarn to one or 2, but you feel a bit bad saying no to them afterwards but you really cant talk to every single group that approaches you. Cool lake though

Best enjoyed at night!. This lake is just a little outside the old quarter, pretty hard to miss. Whether day or night, walking by the lake is an extremely peaceful activity. But for me night is when the lake is at its best... People dancing, the bridge lit up, the cool night Breeze... Good for after dinner walks

A must visit Oasis in the Chaos of Hanoi. Having a hotel opposite this wonderful Hanoi oasis was wonderful.To cross the chaotic street to wander among the floral gardens, willow trees, the cool breezes , the relaxing crowds or to enjoy a cool drink or meal in the cafes is an awesome way to spend a few hours.Locals and tourists alike sit, relax, walk and take in the views.. the night lights add to the charisma.Evenings or early am have exercise, tai chi, dance lessons , gym groups availing themselves of the plentiful spaces.Crossing the red wooden bridge to Ngoc Son Temple built in the 18th century is also worth a visit.

Great central point in Hanoi. Especially gorgeous at night.. This is a lovely walk just at the edge of the Old Quarter. There's a decorative temple at one end and a rather gorgeous active temple at the other, which you can access via a red bridge. Try to also visit the lake at night as the buildings all around are lit up, as is the bridge and it's beautiful. If you're in town on a Saturday night, you'll join in with locals promenading around, playing various instruments, dancing the tango and doing aerobics. Definitely a must-see and a welcome respite from the craziness of the Old Quarter.
beautiful. we had lunch overlooking it.. great to walk around shops around are great fun and you can bartertake camera with you

Lovely environment. It's part of Hoan Kiem Lake. Amazing nature, only thing you want is just sit down and chill in the shade, watch the environment, flow of people, birds, flowers. It's a very clean park, locals and tourist together, street food and fresh passion fruit juice opportunity. It's amazing at evening time.

A very nice view. My family and I went to the Old Quarters, but since the lake was very near, we decided to see it. It was a very nice view. We took pictures and selfies. I would recommend you guys to go here if you also want to go to the Old Quarters. It's also better to go here at night so you can enjoy your walk without the heat.

A good break from the old quarter. A walk around the lake can rejuvenate you from the craziness of the old quarter. If you have some spare time school groups tend to congregate on the south side of the lake and will pick out the westerners to have conversations. It is ta fun way to kill some time and help the students with their English.The lake is a good walk during the day or at night. There are beautiful lights on the paths, lighting the lake and trees.
Pretty lake. It's so busy and peaceful in the early morning and the affternoon. There are many people run around, take a walk or exercise. I love the type of the local people taking rest.
Interesting sight . It's a really interesting sight to see in person. Take a walk around the whole lake. There is a great cafe in the park on one side. It's a fabulous place to take a break.

good spot to relax or eat a cheap takeaway lunch around.. Walking around the whole lake takes 20mins, good restaurants and food options across the road surrounding the whole place. Pretty lake to walk past.

Heart of Hanoi. If Hanoi is heart of Vietnam, Kim lake will be the heart of Hanoi. Different people come to the lake for different purpose. Family with children, most of people are couples…
Just walking around the lake and sit by the lake side already a very good experience at Hanoi. Must visit there if you go to Hanoi
Enjoyed the views. Really nice place to walk around although very busy. Try to visit both day and night if you can as totally different views, especially when it's all lit up at night.

Pretty lake. Had a walk round here in the afternoon. There were lots of young local people having out which gave it a lively feel. It's very pretty and a nice change to the hustle and bustle of the streets. You have to pay 30,000VND to cross the bridge if you want some pictures from the perspective so I didn't bother because you can walk round the edge (which you're likely to do anyway) and see the whole lake as you go. I wouldn't travel for ages to see it though as it is just a pretty lake. It happened to be round he corner from my hotel.

A gem in the heart of Hanoi!!. We stayed in the old quarter of Hanoi and every day was started with a walk around Hoan Kiem Lake. We loved watching the locals starting their day with exercise.
