However, you can not miss the night activity. Everyone is out strolling, or ballroom dancing under the stars. The trees are ablaze with thousands of lights, adding to the magical feeling here. A must do in Hanoi.

A place of tranquility and calm!. Hoam Kiem Lake is the center point that brings the different areas of Hanoi together. It is serene and peaceful and offers a natural relief from the hustle and bustle all around it. There are many places to eat, or stay and lots of seating and grassland to sit and enjoy the cool breezes that come off the lake giving respite to Hanoi's heat.There were people of all ages just enjoying the area and it was lovely to see many loved up couples, holding hands and strolling slowly around the lake. At night, the reflection of the city lights and hundreds of fairy lights gave the lake a very magical appeal and you could easily spend hours just relaxing and watching the lights bounce and reflect in all directions,In a city that is so busy and frenetic, Hoam Kiem Lake offers a place of tranquility and calm for all to enjoy.
Cool Shrine. It's a cool little shrine in the middle of a pond. It's close to the old quarter and only a dollar or so to enter. Worth a short walk.

The Attraction of Hanoi Old Quarter. I prefer to visit here in the early hours when the town has not wake up. And a lot of activities in the morning, Tai Chi session, jogging, line dancing all take place here.You can slow walk around the lake in 1 hours and enjoy the cool air during winter.

Lovely by day, stunning by night!. Really good place to hang out. Loads of restaurants and coffee shops around. Beautiful trees and the heart beat of the area. You MUST visit it if you are in Ha Noi if you don't, well you haven't really been to Ha Noi!

shake your tail feather.. "Le tout Hanoi" gathers around this lake early morning to do their physical exercise. Anywhere from slow and reflective Tai Chi to hiphop aerobics. But all stationary - the only joggers are expats. Walk around the lake in about half an hour and take in the collective spirit of health and happiness. It is a great start of the day.
Amazing area. Any one who travel to Hanoi he should not miss the area and take around on the lake to see the people how they spend the time and running and to see the beautiful lake

nice place for a short walk. A walk around Hoan Kiem lake is short and always a good opportunity for nice experiences. Cross the bridge to the Pagoda and light some incense sticks, have an ice coffee or fresh mango juice with a view on the lake. Flowers and decorative art make it truly worth a visit. Exercise in the early morning, chat with locals or simple watch couples taking wedding pictures. I have been there more than 40 times and I will return :)

Safe and beautiful place for walk around.. For Vietnamese people it is a place for dating, you can see many couples walking around or sitting near the lake. It is a very romantic place, surrounded by trees and lights. I recommend you visit it during the day and also during the night because the scenery changes a lot.

Sanctuary in the middle of the city. This is a relaxing place in the middle of the chaos which is Hanoi. If you can make it across the street around the lake which seems to be one of the busier ones in Hanoi, you are treated to a pleasant area where you can relax in the middle of the city. The lake is right near the Old quarter and the French quarter so you will almost certainly pass by the lake in your adventures. There are benches all around the lake which you can sit and enjoy the scenery. There is also a nice path to walk around the lake. In terms of sites there is one temple in the Northern end of the lake on a small island connected by bridge. Seeing the lake is one of the must dos while in Hanoi.

The lake of Legend.. The lake is situated in the middle of Hanoi, not a stone throw from the old french quarter. While peaceful & serene during the day at night it turns into a magical sight to behold as the colored lights turns the lake into a fairyland. There are numerous restaurant & Coffee bars along side the lake that lend themselves to an enjoyable break from the never ending hustle & bustle of a busy city. There are adequate seating around the lake where you can spend time enjoying the scenery, or if you are up early you can join in with all the locals doing Ti Chi or in some cases Yoga, even seen a couple doing Martial arts with real swords. The lake itself is known to the locals as the lake of the magic Turtle Gods, & there is a legend where it is said that two warring tribes were constantly warring with each other until one day the turtle Gods had enough so they summoned the two tribes to the edge of the lake & ordered them to throw their sword into the deepest part of the lake. After they all complied the head turtle told them to go back to their villages & live in peace! Now I don't know how much truth is in the legend, but there is still enough child in this old man to hope there some truth in this story, as even today we can learn a lot from the magic turtle Gods about living together in peace & harmony. You will also find the people to be genuinely friendly & very helpful & you can get around Hanoi without any fear from crime, as it is very well Policed, day & night. Actually this can be said of all Vietnam, as it's a very friendly country. Friday & Saturday nights a lot of downtown Hanoi is blocked off to traffic by police barricades that are also manned by the friendly police force & only pedestrians are allowed in these areas. It's great seeing all the kids come out & play games in the streets..Go there, you will love the carefree lifestyle.
Interesting must see. If you walk around the lake you must have a look at the legend of the turtle. It is a good photo opp
beautiful lake. beautiful lake, an interesting story, ask students about the turtle, which helps them) -Students ochent lot near the lake.

Nice quiet walk. Visited in spring. Lots of flowers surrounding the lake. It is a place for pondering, or simply people watching. The lake is the center of life in the city of Hanoi where most people converge for a break. Some people eating at the benches during their break time. Around the lake are nice hotels, restaurants, the puppet show and a Green tour shuttle that will take you around hanoi's old and French quarters for a fee. Best if you are with companions. Otherwise it would be too expensive. I did mostly walking around and did not feel like I missed out.

This lake makes Hanoi a magical place. The trees surrounding the lake are lit at night with multi coloured fairy lights, which reflect on the water. The effect is outstanding. It is a focal point for the city and the place to get your bearings right.
nice walk around the lake. In the middle of Hanoi it is a relaxing place, many people enjoy, exercise and students wanted to practice their englisch with us.

Very nice at night, the temple in the middle is a nice 30 minute visit. $2 entry to the temple on the island, interesting lore and history.
Great views of it at night from surrounding hotels/restaurants (but you will pay more for those).
Nice spot for a stroll but it can be really busy!. Lovely spot for stroll to get away from the busy streets of the old quarter. However, it can be busy in it's own right, particularly on weekends!
A good walk around the lake. Nice place to walk around to see various activities. You can see locals doing tai chi to modern exercises, hear traditional music to latest pop

Atmosphere place!. Great place to wander around and clearly the central heartbeat of Hanoi. We arrived late in the afternoon after travelling overnight from London and with the lake so close it was a waste if we didn't visit on our first night. Lovely ambience and setting. Great little temple to walk around too. Close to many other great little plans to visit as well. Recommend!
Come at night to enjoy a different view!. The lake offers a distinct atmosphere at night. Try to visit at night to see the temple in the middle of the lake illuminated by colorful lights.

A lake with a couple of islands. This may be an important site locally but it is not that well respected. Being in the middle of busy city, the water quality is less than perfect and no one seems to care too much about it. Have a look as you pass by.

Nice lake right in the heart of Hanoi. Those who want to escape from the business of Old Quarter and the traffic should do a walk around this lake. A nice water body with trees and flowers right in the very center of Hanoi. There are also some very nice cafes nearby where you can have a drink and watch people passing by.
Amazing. The lake is beautifully however I don't like the busy traffic around the lake . You can try the ice cream when walking around the lake .

It's just a lake. Not much to see it's literally a lake with pretty skanky water and a bridge you have to pay to go on. It's a good place to use as a base but apart from that there's just lots of locals say about spitting on the floor and dropping there food everywhere.
Beautiful at night . It's really nice at night with the lights. It's right in the center so you will often see it. We enjoy sitting there and just watching the busy streets and people

Love it. Hoan Kiem Lake meaning "Lake of the Returned Sword" just 10 minutes walked from my hostel, I always go to there in the afternoon to chill out with my friends after we tired sightseeing around Hanoi. really love the ambiance.
Walk around the lake, why not?. Central spot close to lots of what people go to the Old Quarter to see and visit. Decent place to take a break and enjoy a cold drink while watching Hanoi.

Must go at night or early morning. Breathtaking at night when all lit up - we also walked round the lake at 5:30 am and saw so many exercise classes - power walking, badminton. Not another tourist in sight and everyone wished us good morning. An idyllic start to the day. Such a beautiful place. We sat for 5 mins to commit it to memory.

A good way to meet local people. It took me about an hour longer than I expected to get to the temple in the middle of the lake because on the way five or six groups of Vietnamese students stopped me to ask if they could practice their English with me. Apparently they do this on weekend mornings, or maybe just Sunday mornings. It was interesting and fun to talk to them, but it does take time. If you say No, as I did to some groups, they are very polite about it. The lake itself is nice but nothing special. The temple is well worth a visit, but small. You have to pay, but it's cheap (about $1.50, I think). Be prepared to insist when it's your turn to buy your ticket though. I could have been there all day if I had let everyone who tried push ahead of me.
Nice walk around the lake. A walk around the lake, especially on WE days is definitely a must - you can really feel the vibe of the City and see Vietnamese families enjoying the day
Nice to walk around. A break from the busy streets (although you never really get away from the traffic in Hanoi). The temple on the island was nice too
Take your time. It isn't that big, but it's a wonderful lake, especially the area surrounding it. Stroll around it and most of all enjoy the people / locals and you'll have a great time.

Little bit of quiet . In a very loud and busy city this is a very welcomed break from the hustle and bustle. You can stroll around it day or night and it's looks beautiful. Great people watching place.
Walk around lake. Pleasant walk around observing life.pay to visit the temple on the lake as it gives a bit of history about the turtles

Our favorite pass time in Hanoi. We love experiencing how locals go about their daily lives. You have seen things written about this, and it's all true. Would you like to salsa or tango at 6am? Come here. Badmttten anyone? Line dancing? Tai Chi? Groups are everywhere. They welcome visitor participation and we did. No one is self conscious. It seems perfectly normal to enjoy all of these activities out in the open. An added bonus to getting up early is to see the street action in the old quarter as fruits, vegetables, and flowers are making their way to their spot to be sold. I could do this every morning. Always something unique to see.
Green Heart of the city!. The lake is well located in the city center. Walking around the lake, enjoying clean and peaceful atmosphere here would be what all should do while visiting Hanoi.
Just okay. It is a nice place to walk around. The temple seemed like a waste of money a little bit. Better sites elsewhere.
Nice to walk around. Spent lunchtime sat on a bench admiring the lake and people watching one afternoon. Very close to old quarter so cannot be missed.
A place to rest. A place to rest after thousands of steps of your walking tour. I like the different flowers blooming and being taken care of. This is a very crowded tourist spot though.

Best location for visiting Hanoi. We loved staying right on this lake. Essential services like post and banking are located around the lake and the lake is a good size for going for a morning or evening stroll or for just hanging out at a lake side eatery. The surrounding area is full of local colour and it has not been ruined by too much tourist stuff. The hawkers are a bit of a nuisance but as they are everywhere in Vietnam you get used to them.

Nicer at Night. If you just wanna hangout and stroll with a view, you can check this out. However, dont expect that youll get that nice solo picture along the bridge, coz you wont all-day everyday! Nice when you want to jog in the morning or maybe some taichi or yoga.

Little germ of the city. In hanoi it's quite hard to find an area which is so green and relaxed from the hustle and bustle of the city like this lake. Great to walk around in early morning or evening.

It's OK - Beware pickpockets. The lake is nice and all but it's ridiculously busy and there are pickpockets everywhere trying to steal your things. Best time to walk around and not be hassled is early in the morning or late at night when there are less people. It's a nice sight at night but there's nothing to really draw you there. If you do go make sure you keep your belongings in sight, in front of you and put your hands in your pockets. I read a lot about pickpockets here and thought it must be an exaggeration but sure enough, first time I walked around it, they were there. If a bloke comes up to you with his mate, with a camera and wants a photo with you push him away, he's a pickpocket. If someone continually hassles you to buy things, walk away, they're a pickpocket. If well dressed ladies surround you, hold your things close and walk away, they're pickpockets.
Another magic moment. Lovely park around the lake. Wedding parties like to take pictures there. Great way to take a walk. Lots of beautiful trees and plants.

Tourisy but must visit.. I visited this lake almost everyday, everytime I come to Hanoi.. It has its own charm.. Since early in the morning, locals will jog around the lake, or dance or aerobics in the square beside the lake, at evening all social activities were there.. Music performance, prewedding photographing, cuddling couple, snack and souvenir seller, group hang out, or just walking around the lake after dinner (me). Not only tourist, but locals were there.. For me it was entertaining, sometime start conversation and chat with them when I visited solo.

Nicer at night time. It was a nice lake. Can walk around entirety of it without much effort. Atmosphere is much better at night time when you can see the bridge and temple light up. Lots of locals on dates or doing exercises in the evening time as well.
Great place to stroll around. This lake is beautiful to see !! Great day and night !! The lights are something else,,locals exercising ,,Have a coffee and relax

A lake of tranquility amongst the hustle and bustle. We had a very peaceful walk around the lake whilst waiting for the water puppet show. When we went it was relatively quiet and it was nice to have some peace from the hustle and bustle of the old quarter. Some fantastic views and worth doing if you want a time out.
Beautiful lake. A nice way to pass the time by walking around this lake. You can visit the temple for a small fee. Would take a good half hour to circle the entire lake.
Beautiful place, but not much to do. Is a nice place, where you can take many nice pictures, but that's it. Nothing else to do. So don't expect much more of this place

Great for evening strolls. Very nice walking around the lake at nighttime when the locals congregate here to exercise, play games and hang out.The nighttime illuminations are very (perhaps a bit too?) colourful and photo opportunities abound.If I lived in Hanoi I'd definitely hang out here frequently. For visitors, a 1-2 hour stroll is probably enough.

Picturesque lake!!. Pretty lake in center city Hanoi...walk across red bridge to temple in middle of lake, plenty of photo ops...Have a cool drink and people watch or just soak in the atmosphere. Restaurants and shoppes throughout the area to spend an afternoon relaxing.
Visit at night. We went both during the day and night but its beautiful just to sit on the banks edge enjoy a drink or food and enjoy the views

A lovely place to take a walk. This is a great place to walk around, either during the day when it is a bit quieter, or at night when there is a lot of people around.The lights out at night make for a wonderful place to take photos and relax.There are some coffee shops and restaurants near the lake to have a drink or food and look at the water.

Beautiful Lake. A peaceful lake near Hanoi old quarter.
Sight seeing is great. The sun was killing us wheb we walked around there in noon time, but it is great after 5pm.
Nice spot to cool down for a while. $1 entrance fee is well spent for a sit in the shade and a vista across the lake. Good bonsai work too. Small temple and craft shop and nice red bridge!
a welcome relief. the lake is a nice retreat in a busy city. you can enjoy the people relaxing,running and taking walks.

The heart of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem lake with Ngoc Son temple was known as the heart of Hanoi with it's beauty and history as well. That could be great time to working around the lake and feel very peaceful atmosphere with local life style here. From the lake, I can easy to discover the old quarter with a lot of local food restaurant & bar, souvenir streets, hotels or water puppet show theater...
Serenity. The lake is very serene, peaceful right in the center of the hustle and bustle of old quarter. a place where you can see locals and foreigners relaxing.

Lovely place to hang out with the rest of Hanoi. In the bustle and traffic of Hanoi, the Lake is a little haven of tranquillity. This is where people, young and old, lovers and families, all come to escape the humidity and heat of the city in the evening at at the weekends. The gardens are beautifully planted, with topiary, marigolds, begonias, aurum lilies and azaleas; people loll on benches, practise Qi Dong, do their bench presses, buy ice creams, lollies and balloons. Everyone is very friendly and wanted to chat - and then take photos. Thats fine - it's what we do all the time. In fact on our weekend in Hanoi, we spent more time there than anywhere else, because it is where life is lived.

Beautiful, romantic.. If you go at night you will see many couples by the water. If you go alone prepare to be hassled by the street vendors. Luckily they seem to leave couples alone except maybe trying to sell you flowers.

Haven in the middle of city hustle. We stayed in a hotel nearby and visited here almost daily. The surrounding park is clean and well kept and plenty of places to walk and or sit if needed. Also a great place to let kids run off some energy. The lights of a night make it even more comfortable. Definitely worth a visit at any time, just need to be prepared to do the 'frogger shuffle' crossing the road to and from. This part, not so relaxing:-)

Pleasant walk . The lake was close to our hotel (Sofitel) so we took a stroll in the late afternoon. It was a pleasant walk with many Vietnamese families doing the same. But don't go out of your way to get there.
A great place to visit .. A tourist walking all the time. The evening will have people pay attention to walk a lot, both locals and tourists .
small lake. A tiny unoccupied house in the middle of the lake, there are some good looking cafes on the edge of the lake overlooking across the lake.
Looks better at night. When I first visited the lake, I was not very impressed. However, the place looks really different at night. The place lights up and look magical. Romantic place!
Beautiful night and day. . I went on to the island during the day, i believe it is closed at night. It lights up in the evening. And there are many people walking around it. Very fun atmosphere.

Beautiful spot to relax and watch the local atmosphere!. The lake is a wonderful place to chill out and relax, it is a hive of activity with many locals doing all kinds of things.
The view across the lake is very pretty and I was not expecting such a scenic location in the heart of Hanoi.

Lake of Joy. Life in Hanoi centres around this lake. Many activities happens here from dawn to dusk.Go for a morning jog around the late and you will be pleasently surprised that there are so many others exercisin there already. Joggers, line dancers, ballroom dancers, muscle builders are all have their stations around the lake. In the afternoon, tourist, locals and hawkers will be busy all around the lake. At night, the lake will be lighted up with the two main attractions in red. Very nice!
Yep it's a lake. Not overly exciting. It is a nice spot and there is a pagoda to check out but it was completely packed when we got there so we bailed.

Nice place to walk / jog.. Always enjoy a walk along Hoan Kiem Lake. Most of my Hanoi stays are near the Old Quarter .. and we make a visit to the lake every day or two. Relaxing place to sit and watch the people go by. Very good photo opportunity, many newly married couples get their photos at Hoan Keim Lake.
Nice sorounding . Nice place to walk around and relax. Many benches to sit down and look at the sorounding. Also nice background for photos.
Beautiful at night!. Lake very huge and beautiful view. Atmosphere is clean we can walk along lakeside. Center of the Lake there is a building and it's the symbol of Ha Noi - capital of Vietnam.

A Great Place To Take A Walk!. Hoan Kiem Lake is a greta place in the Old Quarter to take a walk, whether in the day or at night. The lake is surrounded by a park, with plenty of places to sit and relax.

Iconic location. It is a good way to find your location by pinpointing the location of the lake. The lake itself is not that attractive but it is cooler to walk around the lake than walking on the streets in Hanoi.
Peaceful walk around. We walked around the lake after visiting the Old Quarter. Hanoi is crazy busy but the path around the lake was a quiet spot in the city.

Lovely evening walk. As you walk around the lake you mix with families, couples and groups of friends. All in all it a wonderful walk to build up an appetite for the wonderful food available in the old quarter

Great for a walk around or a break. This is a great place for a "stroll in the park" with lots of places for a drink or a snack with in easy reach. I love going there for a coffee or an ice cream and watching the world go by.

Great to relax by. This lake also seems to be popular with the locals with a few eating places around the park . And a meeting point for people going to the night markets . We arived on vietnamese independence day so it was packed . We stopped at the little kitchen restaurant for lunch great inexpensive meals very relaxing

If you have the time, worth visiting. If you have the time to explore the city, go ahead and spend some time. The place is relaxing and a good backdrop for selfies of groufies. But after looking at the mummified giant turtle, there's not much to explore here.

Must see. The best to see and walk around in Hanoi
Surrounded by nice implantation a and fliers
Songs at night and local people dancing very nice atmosphere

Pretty lake.. Check it out during the day and then again at night when it's all lit up.
Good for a walk around to get your bearing and as a reference point.
Pretty to visit at night . Lovely to see and walk around the lake all lit up at night. Not too many vendors hanging about either. So quite tranquil.
Worth a visit . Some lovely scenery day and night in a lively area of Hanoi. It doesn't take much time to walk around

Nice view and atmosphere . Nice view, good to sit and have some beer at night time. Good for jogging in the morning I love it. I stayed 5 nights in Hanoi. 3 of 5 days, I went to the lake. I like see life there. You see people, jogging, reading, enjoy time with family, kids and dogs running around, hug and kiss events :) , drawing, selling etc.

Visit this popular, breezy spot. In the centre of Old Town Hanoi, this lake offers a gentle breeze on even the hottest day! And a stroll around the lake in the evening shows off the night lights surrounding the lake.
beautiful lake and great for picture. Lovely place surrounded by the beautiful lake , great place to relax , take a seat and enjoy the scenic views and using the lake as a back drop for pic

A must!. No one visits Hanoi without a walk around Hoan Kiem lake. It's fun , interesting especially at 6.00 am when all the locals are jogging, doing aerobics or ballroom dancing! And it's wonderful at night , really safe with everybody enjoying the lights and the happy crowds. Plenty of places to sit and have a drink while watching the world go by.
Peaceful. Compared to chaos of old quarter and motorcycles, the lake was a pleasant break to sit and have an ice cream
Good walk around the lake.. The temple is worth visiting giving that is quite cheap and quick. If you're staying nearby, good place to go for a walk or a run.
You've got to hear the story. It's just another lake in a big city but when you hear the traditional story that goes with it, it add a bit more interest. Talking turtles and special swords.
A place to be. I enjoyed early morning walk by the lake. It is so peaceful, even thou there is already a lot of people walking and dancing or just having coffee by the lake.

Interesting place. If you just take bus from the international airport and wonder how you can move to the lake which nearby have many hotels for your trip in HanoiThere are 2 kinds of bus from the airport. You take red and yellow bus mean the last stop is by the Thong Nhat park ( Cong vien in Vietnamese) in Tran Nhan Tong street, then you just walk few step in same side to over the park's gate and wait for number 9 bus ( only 7000 dong or 30 cents). This number 9 bus will take you to the lake as its last stopIf you take other bus by private owner which will take you to Quang Trung street is last stop. From this stop you also walk to the lake in 10 minutes also Wish you best luck

Always interesting day or night - rain or shine.. At night there are pretty reflections from the lights around the temple - the bridge - the lake. During the day engaged couples pose for preparing wedding pics. Lots of bars and restaurants abound.

Nice way to spend a morning. Walked around the lake, footpath complete, nice places to sit
Lots of fog/smog or whatever you would like to think of it

Must see at night! . We have been to the lake many times during the day time but the atmosphere at night is totally different. The lighting of the red bridge, turtle tower and the temple gives it a nice feel. One might also come across a newly married couple getting their photo shoot done nearby. Very nicely maintained and nice place to relax from the hustle bustle of old quarter.

Pretty. Nice area to walk around especially at night. There was even a group latin dancing. There are several cafes around the lake to sit and have a coffee or meal. It is smaller than you might think.

Good first introduction to Hanoi. This is a good place to start if your plan is to do a walk about on foot. We started from old quarters and took a slow stroll here late evening on our fist day here. You can see plenty locals doing walks along the lake and some people taking wedding pictures here too. If you have the time, find a cafe overlooking the lake and have some coffee while drinking in the scenery relaxing and observing busy traffic pass by.

Tranquil lake. The world famous lake of Hanoi, in the centre of the city. The popular spot for locals to while away their time, especially in the evening. Actually, Hanoi has plenty of such lakes, but this lake is the best due to its location and history. The Old Quarter lies to the north shore of the lake. A good place to rest your feet after sighseeing the Old Quarter on foot.

Nice place to chill in a busy city. Pretty much a standard lake with some nice photo opportunities.There is a temple over a red bridge which from memory cost about 25k pp to enter.Some shrines and lots of trees, flowers and a bit of seating around the lake

"A True Surprise". This lake is the highlight & heartbeat of Hanoi. Picturesque, tranquil and delightful to see so many locals strolling, exercising and gathering. A draw card for many and it won't disappoint.
Peaceful lake. Pretty lake which can easily be walked around. Water Puppet show a must do attraction. Friendly people to chat to. Many photo opportunities

Nice lake. An impressive Lake which is nice to wonder around in the afternoon. Lots of cafes and restaurants nearby, as well as the water puppets. There is a temple on the lake but it was heaving with people when we were there so we didn't go and see it.
Beautiful.... This lake is beautiful, as is the surrounding area. Well worth the trip to see it. It is free and very close to the Water Puppet Theatre.

Gorgeous scene. This is a truly amazing place and a walk around the edge of this lake is a highlight of vietnam. The mist over the water, the walking boulevard, the beautiful trees, the people playing games and wedding couples having photographs...makes this a brilliant place.

Walk Around the Lake. This is definitely a place where young & old like to visit on the weekend! Lots of young people just visiting with friends, brides having their photos taken and couples with small children playing on the perimeter. Water looks pretty green so you don't want to get in but floral plantings make up for what the water lacks!
Busy place at night. This is a place that local come to have a stroll or even have some aerobic dance at night. There are some hawker selling local snacks/ fruits and drinks.

A great way to start or end the day. Hoan Kiem is somewhere that I've been able to visit pretty regularly in the past 6 months. It's situated right in the middle of town, so if you're meeting up with friends or just popping into the Old Quarter for a delicious cup of coffee, it's pretty easy to take a look. The lake itself is quite small (compared to Tay Ho) so you can do a circuit of it pretty quickly. In the mornings and afternoons it can get quite crowded with people commuting to and from work, and the exercise-obsessed who use the lake as a track. There are some great rooftop bars that can offer a decent sunset view.

The landmark in the old quarter of Hanoi. The bright color of the bridge makes a great imagine to the tourists. Whenever we pay a visit to Hanoi, it always gives us pretty and unforgettable impression in our mind.
It's a lake. Walked all the way around the lake which has some pretty views but A LOT of street vendors so you spend a lot of time trying to get them to leave you alone.

Perfect for an evening stroll and people watching. Fascinating to perambulate in the evening, when the air is cooler and Hanoians spill out onto the banks of the Hoan Kiem. Just watch the locals as they exercise, chase their children, romance each other, eat ice cream like there's no tomorrow, and generally enjoy this little oasis in the middle of their frenetic city.

Beautiful Hoan Kiem lake at night. This is a great spot to visit after enjoying the Old Quarter of Hanoi. The night is alive with families and tourist strolling beside this center of the city lake. The park like atmosphere is enhanced by the colorful lighting in the trees that line the shore.
Hoan Kiem lake. A nice place to spend the evening leisurely.Many nearby restaurants, night market and the old quarter. You can also enjoy riding a trishaw around the lake.

Lovely lake and area. Except for the not so much clean lake's water,everything is very good here.Nice environment,busy with locals and young people at night,very alive area.nice temple and very nice view.
Pleasant Temple Over Lake. Nice spot and a retrieve from the bustle immediately across the road. Entry is 30.000VD. I do wonder if worshipers need to pay this when they bring offerings.
Nice to see. Had a seat here during the day to rest our legs, it's nice and scenic, waters fowl. Peaceful even with all the chaos around. It's beautiful at night all light up.

Romantic at night. Visit this beautifully lit lake at night. Many locals and tourists sit on the banks or stroll around it. Despite being surrounded by many people you feel relaxed and peaceful. A nice break from the hectic old quarter.
A scenic lake. Hoan Kiem lake is at the old quarters area. It is scenic especially at night with the bright lighted bulbs and beautiful bridge.

30k VND adult ticket. Pretty place to watch upon the lake. The tickets gain you access to what looks like a mummified giant turtle, a small temple and mini gardens. Quite an interesting place to take photos, especially along the little red bridge.
Pretty at night. Lots of coupes at night time - a pretty spot to walk around the lake. Don't fall in, in looks quite dirty, but definitely a place to get a feel for local life.

Very nice . A great place to have a relaxing walk amongst the kaos. We walked around the lake twice. Once in the day and again at night. On The day trip we saw the temple. It was insightful, with info on the giant Turtle And amazingly sculpted bonsai. At night the lake was stunning! The gardens and temple were lit up and the lake was still and peaceful.
A little Oasis. This is a nice little oasis in the hustle and bustle of Hanoi. However, visitors need to beware of the ice lolly vendors selling Green Bean flavoured lollies. What a dissapointment!

Aussie Adventurers abroad. The lake is quite pretty at night and Dusk. There are many food hawkers in the northern part of the lake. There are also more formal cafe's and restaurants with a view of the lake. It would take about a half hour to stroll around the lake. Most of the time we visited it was shrouded in a mist or fog.
best view and place to relax. Can exercise the evening Just walk around the lake You can experience the art of Vietnamese temples.
Lovely lake views when the weather is clear. Almost separating the old quarter from the french quarter the lake presents lovely views, a great walk - with ice creams available at local shops.

A lovely evening stroll.. A great way to work off some of that great dinner you just finished. Usually busy and yet a peaceful stroll in the big city.A great place to sit and watch or walk.for as long as your legs will carry you.

Good service HOTEL. Family trip~
This Hotel staffs are very kindness
Good service~ free blackfast
Goood locations
Great facilities, clean & bright room
Everything is be all right~
Thank you
Must be next time to go to HONOI
I'm re-stay this HOTEL
Beautifual lake to wander around. A relaxing thing to do in Hanoi is wander around the perimeter of the lake, taking in the views, and people watching.

My favorite place in Hanoi. This was my favorite place in Hanoi, I took a walk around it and went over the bridge to the turtle island. The place is just beautiful and a real escape from the rest of the city. I returned at night and it was just as stunning if not more with all the lights. In fact I returned a number of times during my time in Hanoi. Whenever I went past I was drawn by it's beauty to risk life and limb crossing the road just to walk along the waters edge before perilously crossing back over to head to my real destination.

A great spot for an early morning walk. It's the Wandering Yank here. Mrs. Yank and I recently spent several days in Hanoi. Friends had told us we should go down to the lake early in the morning to see the locals doing their morning exercises. We did, starting at 630, and it was well worth it! Women doing group salsa routines, older women doing tai chi with fans, men weight-lifting - it was very memorable. The lake itself is pretty, surrounded by a well-kept park and sidewalks. A picturesque ruined temple sits at one end, and another temple is at the other end accessible by bridge (and an admission charge).It feels like the heart of Hanoi, and it's a great place to people-watch. A warning - one time we went on a weekend afternoon, and we were approached by 2 groups of college students who wanted to practice their English skills. They were delightful of course. But if you want to be left alone, you might not want to sit down :)2 thumbs up!
It is a lake. We walked around the lake. It's quite a short walk. Lots of things going on around the lake. So when you have spare time it's worth a walk around.

If in Hanoi you just see. It is not a particularly amazing temple but it is conveniently placed, with some amazing photo opportunities and an interesting history. It is not expensive, in a pleasant and colorful.

Peace and Tranquility. I have been to Hanoi many times on work and this is the place which is a must visit,this is the centre of the city yet looks soo away and secluded from all the business. I prefer going here in evening as there are beautiful lights and great crowd. you just feel soo much relaxation and peace. take a stroll around the lake or can sit and enjoy at thats happening around it. Make sure to try some awesome local food which will be by small vendors, there are also some joints and cafe's where you can hangout. There is a temple in the centre of the lake but it opens only in the morning.... but to me its a great place for nightlife.
Heart of the city. Here you will experience how vibrant Vietnamese people are with a mix of modern world and old beautiful landscape. A must visit at night!!

Random placement!. We chilled around the lake for an hour or so, nice scenery with a bridge to walk over. Very random placement with it being right beside a very very busy road...take care when crossing! It was very busy with tourists but we visited on a Vietnam bank holiday! Nice wee visit
ok, but I would go out of your way for it.. We went in because we were literally walking by and we decided to check it out. I was nice for about 30 minutes, but it really isn't all that impressive.

You must see. Beautiful lake in the heart of the city.
The best time to see it in the evening time.We can see there a beautiful pagoda too /only in daytime/.
And near the lake one can find a square,when the locals engoy the time.
Good opportunity to make fine pictures around the lake.

Nice place for a walk. Evening with beautiful lights. . Romantic place. Ice-cream and cute couples around.
Next to the lake is must visit old quater of Hanoi. Plenty of food and tourists. Gift shops and old cute buildings.
Have fun!

Hoan kiem lake. A large lake forming the centre of interest in Hanoi, just at the edge of the Old Quarter. Beautiful flower beds around it, several nice eating places nearby, people sitting on benches to enjoy the ambience, a must-see for anyone visiting Hanoi. We strolled around the area, both during the day and also at night, as it is well lit, the bridge lights up a strange red, generally a pretty place to walk around in.

Nice walk. Great for a walk. Lots of people are out and about around this lake engaged in various activities. The bridge is very popular for photos. At night the lights are on and it is just fun to sit and watch people.

Early morning walk. We went one morning at 6:30 am for a walk around the lake. It was much more quiet at that time! It was interesting to see the locals exercising - badminton, stretching, aerobics, and even dance lessons. Worth getting up for and a fun morning walk.

A bit of an oasis away from the hustle and bustle. When you're in Hanoi and walking the old quarter, venture along to the lake and just wander. Soak up the atmosphere and it's a pleasant walk and you avoid the traffic and can gain back some inner calm

Nice Backdrop. We walked around the lake the first day we arrived. It was a Sunday and the place was heaving with lots of things going on around it. The locals were pleased to talk to us and music and family events were happening next to the lake. Always good to have somewhere green in a city and Hanoi scores well in this respect. Having accommodation in the vicinity of the lake would be a good choice and offers late afternoon and early morning stroll options.
Oasis in Hanoi. Great to get away from the traffic and street noise and see one of the oldest pagodas in Hanoi. Lots of people hanging out around the lake and exercising. Nice sociable area.

Can't visit Hanoi without a stop at this lake. This lake is central to the Old Quarter district of Hanoi, and is worth a visit. Unfortunately the last turtle, for which it is famous, died in 2015, and looking at the water quality, it is not hard to see why. Nice to walk around the lake , and for a small fee, go over the red bridge and onto the island. Nicely lit up at night.

Historical/Fantasy. Was nice to hear about the story of the lake. The turtle did fascinating things that changed Vietnam forever. Without its help, who know what it would be now :). That is, if one is to believe the tale! I will leave it up to each person to do so...we all have our opinions. Cool experience and one day I hope to go back to get a glimpse and the turtle if it still lives at the bottom of the lake.

Great Area for Photos. One of the best areas to take pictures or selfies! On the north side of the lake is Jade Island where Ngoc Son Temple stands. The island is connected to the shore by a red wooden bridge, The Huc Bridge. More towards the southern side is Turtle Tower. Day or night, it doesn't matter, great for pictures!

Not spectacular by any stretch, but interesting nonetheless. I think it was 35 baht to get in- nothing really!We went at around midday, so other times of the day may be different- Walk across a picturesque bridge swarming with selfie stick tourists, nice views of the Lake (if it's not foggy like our day was- doh!), see the interesting arcitecture in the centre, see turtle tower from afar, enter the large place of worship in the middle (quite cool), then leave the same way.It's definitely not something you should pin your day on- 1.5 hours max.

A peaceful place. A peaceful and scenic lake located within the historical Old Quarter. When you walk around the lake at night, you will be able to catch a great view of city's well lit skyline.The lake is a great place to "escape" from the chaotic Old Quarter. Lots of chairs around the lake, so you can take a break and relax here.
I was expecting more... It was ok. The pictures looked a bit more magical. It was very crowed with people trying to sell stuff and tourists. I wouldn't go out of your way to see it.

Lovely lake in bustling Hanoi. It's wonderful to be able to step away from the hectic streets of Hanoi's historic section and take a leisurely stroll around this lovely lake. There's a scenic bridge to a small temple which provides visual interest. Or, ride around the lake in a pedicab. You'll feel like a king or queen.

stroll around the lake. stroll around the lake and you meet some very interesting people, most will chat and tell you about their city, and where to visit, or just take in the sights and enjoy the area.
Lovely place. I visited Sword lake before I moved from Hanoi. It's always one of the most beautiful places in Hanoi from all perspectives.

Peaceful place in the crowed city center. The lake located in the heart of the capital city, surrounded by trees with peaceful atmosphere. The nearby beautiful streets, restaurants, interesting sightseeing spots make it more attractive

Great for jogging or just walking around. Great fun place for a walk. You'll get away from the rush of the old quarter. Just be careful not to relax too much and lose your street crossing awareness.At night it is a delight with many a light (pun intended). Make sure you go to one of the high cafes or restaurants so you can enjoy the view from above.

Cool atmosphere. It's really really busy & touristy some history I did not know - ( I've realised the more you know about the place you are visiting, the more you appreciate what you see & learn) FYI"According to the legend, in early 1428, Emperor Lê Lợi was boating on the lake when a Golden Turtle God (Kim Qui) surfaced and asked for his magic sword, Heaven's Will. Lợi concluded that Kim Qui had come to reclaim the sword that its master, a local God, the Dragon King (Long Vương) had given Lợi some time earlier, during his revolt against Ming China. Lợi renamed the lake to commemorate this event, from its former name Luc Thuy meaning "Green Water". The Turtle Tower (Thap Rùa) standing on a small island near the centre of lake is linked to the legend. "
Beautifully scenic. Lovely lake to stroll around with a bridge leading to an old temple in the middle. Stunning to wander around at night (lots of fairy lights and a great atmosphere)

Beautiful lake in the city center. The most beautiful nature lake I ever seen in my life, can't believe it's located in the center of the city. It's beautiful in the morning and more in the evening. Clean and well maintained surrounding. The best way to enjoy the lake is by having a cup of hot Vietnamese coffee in the cafe by the lake.

Hoan Kiem Lake Hanoi. I took a cyclo around this beautiful lake on a lovely sunny day and enjoyed every minute of it. The gardens around the lake were especially beautiful and it seemed like everyone was out and about, enjoying this lovely area. After my ride, I then walked back along half of the lake to take many photos. Be careful crossing the roads around this area. I don't think I have ever been so scared crossing a road before and the first time, I screamed the whole way across. Apparently the secret is to just walk and don't stop until you get to the other side - and don't look at what's coming towards you. Trust that the traffic will miss you and it will. Or be like me and wait until some locals start to cross then cross with them, making sure they are on the side which will get hit first, if there's an accident! It worked for me!!!
An easy walk on a good day. Easy distance from the Old Quarter; interesting, especially if you enjoy 'people-watching'. Can be noisy during rush hour traffic. Visit the temple at the northern end.

Awesome Place. Scenic place with a history assosciated along with it. Lovely place to take pictures and when we went it was raining so we enjoyed more. Loved to click the bonsai trees and selfies. Saw the turtle which is dead and kept in glass. Look forward for my pictures.

Lovely walk at dusk. Walked the lake in the morning and saw lots of folks exercising, running, walking, enjoying the light and lake. Walked it at dusk and the lights were lovely - lots of wedding photos happening and just lots of people watching in general. Go see

Tranquil, gorgeous. This area of Hanoi is astonishing. I could stay here for weeks. The lake and its story go along great with the authenticity of the city. The gardens surrounding it are very beautiful

Stunning night & day. What a spectacular area in the old quarter of ha noi we walked around this lake several times and just could not believe how beautiful it was ! must not miss this and join in with the wonderful locals ! They are just a pleasure

Nice people watchinf. This was quite busy. But for 30000dong you can enter and see the temple.
Nice to just watch the people and look around. Can sit and just soak in all the atmosphere. A nice walk around the whole lake will take a good hour.

pleasant evening walk. a very lively place. a must-do when you are in hanoi, to have an evening walk around the lake. not exactly crowded, as people are moving around and not congregating except some people doing exercise together or dancing in groups. besides, some people play music and attract a small crowd of sorts. lot of small eateries

A nice relaxing walk. This lake seems to be the center of Hanoi activity, near both the old quarter and thetrendy French quarter. I would take an early morning walk around the lake for a little exercise and before it gets too crowded. The lake itself is nothing special, but is a tranquil spot in the midst of the busy streets.On weekends it is nice for people watching, but it gets so crowded with people taking selfies hard to walk. The temple in the middle of the lake gives the story behind the temple. It was a shame that the rare turtle that lived in the lake passed away earlier this year.
Lake area. You can visit the water puppet show near the lake and lasts about an hour interesting buildings located around the lake near to attractions

Great sight in the heart of a busy little city. Came here with my small family and we truly enjoyed the lake. Safe with a great vibe and just stunning scenery at day and at night.All angles of the lake allow you to see the calmness amongst the mild chaos of the city itself
Wonderful. It is magical at night but very interesting during the day to walk around the lake and safe as you don't need to cross busy roads

Temple dedicated to the Turtle. A beautiful walk around Hanoi s lake ends with a look at the Temple of the Returned Sword . I wish I could tell you the story however there was not much information in there . I understand the turtle is the symbol in which the temple is dedicated to . There have been over the years lovely giant turtles enjoying life in the lake and being worshipped ! A shrine in the temple is colourful and I believe it is Chinese
Worth a walk around. Worth walking around so long as you can impersonate a mute! Cause your constantly being harassed to take a 1 hour rickshaw ride :(

Peaceful Lake in middle of traffic chaos. Hoan Kiem Lake is a tranquil setting with a great walking path around the perimeter. It serves as a perfect place to walk outside the traffic area and is a stunning sight after dark with the lights. Terrific views in one of the many coffee cafes or eateries around the lake on the top floors provide an excellent view

My place in Hanoi. I got stuck in Hanoi for 10 days because of different troubles, and my daily walk around this lake made me feel like the air I was breathing was not that polluted. At night you can see many couples happily walking around, enjoy a cocktails in a little bar, and admire the temples on the lake. Or people exercising, doing tai chi, or just enjoying their time. This lake might be the only thing I will miss in Hanoi! So if you're around the old quarter, don't hesitate and go have a walk around this lake :)
Interesting and Tranquil. A visit can be included when walking through the city. A good spot for photos and quite pretty. A meeting spot for workers in the area when the weather is cooler.

NICE PLACE, BUT.... Looks like Hoan Kiem Lake is the center of Hanoi. Here,people converge and while time away. Everywhere you see lovers, students, health buffs, artists and people eating ice around.
BUT... sadly, the lake is not spared from garbage. It would have been more beautiful and relaxing if not of garbage on the waters.

Worth a visit . This place is easy to find and worth a quick stop if you are in the old quarter. We enjoyed learning about the history and the kids liked seeing the huge preserved turtle on display. The bridge makes a nice place for taking pictures.

Historic and nice. Definitely history to why the temple was built and a very nice view of the lake in middle of Hanoi
Easy to get to and visit

Nice time . Im gone here the Hoan kiem lake many time. Some time alone some time with my girlfiriend. But many time and many few. I waking arow the lake and in there they have icream is that name "Thuy Ta" very nice retaurant for icream you can go inside the retaurant or stand outside for eat iceream. Like it very much

Where Hanoi Slows Its Tempo A Bit . Hanoi is full motorcycles, weaving in and out, the pace fast. Here at the lake, the tempo slows down a bit. You can see how some Hanoians relaxed, the young courting each other, the older ones exercising, the just married posing for pictures, the local tourists sightseeing, etc. A great place to be to sample another side of Hanoi. A local guide with knowledge of the lake's history and legend like the one we had from Hanoi Free Walking Tour made our visit there all the more enjoyable. Highly recommended.

Lovely walk. Located amid the hustle and bustle of the Hanoi Old Quarter, one can take a leisurely walk and take advantage of photo opportunities or just sit and enjoy people watching. It's a favorite of both locals and tourists alike.

Stunning Gem of a Lake. A perfect sized Lake for walking around - you feel like you've done something and you've been able to get a sense of the Old Quarter of Hanoi. A great way to understand this part of the Country.
Very Nice. A very pretty lake in the middle of Hanoi. It was interesting to see everyone using it during the day and night. At night it is all lit up and seems to be a congregating place.

A tranquil lake in the hustle and bustle of Hanoi.. We walked around the lake did Tai Chi in the morning beside it and snacked one afternoon looking for a rest and some quiet time. Some great photo options here it extends from the busy old quarter out to the business sector of the city. We stopped for shopping and a beer one afternoon at the business end.
great place for a walk!. A perfect place for a walk with great views and lots of photo opportunities at day but it is better at night.
check out th early morning exercising and Tai Chi. what a peaceful spot in the heart of the city. not a bad run around if you want some exercise. Get up early and join in the tai chi.

Nice place. I have walked around Hoan Kiem lake and have visited the park at the south end several times. The park is a little break from the craziness that surrounds you in Hòan Kiem. I saw my first public trash can in Ha Noi here. It's beautifully landscaped and is directly on the lake shore. There is a cafe there too and a public WC.. Get a park bench and take it easy for a while.

Get exercise while people watching and soaking in the culture. This lake is near the Old Quarter and the Sheraton Hanoi where we stayed. Crowded but lovely at night as well as during the day. See photo

Laughing at Lake!. The lake is an excellent landmark when exploring Hanoi. It's a really interesting walk early in the morning. As its so early, there isn't the traffic to reckon with. All the working population are out there exercising before their day begins. By the bronze statue, there were joggers, elderly people stretching with their friends, red track-suited Tai Chi ladies, Zumba and the Laughing Yoga class. I was welcomed to join in as were other travellers. A great start to the day.

Flowers surround the lake make a serene oasis in the noisy city. A red bridge & pagoda provide a nice photo backdrop.. Multicolored geraniums in carefully manicured flower beds surround the lake. The pagoda in the lake's center seem disproportionately small compared to the size of the lake and red bridge. The geraniums match the bridge color and at the lake edge a narrow walkway provides a place for a romantic stroll. There are lots of places to sit under the tree canopy and relax.

nice lake in hanoi city center. Good place to have an evening stroll and enjoy nice food from the eateries next to it.For the shopaholics hang dao street is just o stones throw away which sell almost anythingIncluding clothes,footwear,jackets,souvenirs.nice location to get some good photos and nice to walk around .

Lovely stroll. I enjoy strolling around the lake both in the day and night. The lights at night are really pretty and the breeze quite chilly. In the day it was really tempting to sit by the lake and have an ice cold beer.
Central Park. The lake is pretty much the living room for the city. Most of the day there are folks walking and jogging. In the evening, it is flat out vibrant. A great

Beautiful area. We walked around the lake and over the Huc Bridge (red bridge) on a rainy day in Hanoi. It was a very pretty area and the bridge leads to a small temple. This is worth walking around and getting some picturesque views.

Space in the middle of chaos. We'd heard the lake described as a peaceful place and maybe it would be if you could get to the middle of it! Located right by the Old Quarter at one end it has a road around it that has endless traffic - cars, buses and motorbikes - all tooting their horns non-stop. We walked around it on a misty warm day, along with hundreds of locals and tourists. There are places you can stop for a drink or food and icecream, and it is 'space' in a crowded and chaotic city - it's peaceful only if you have ear plugs in!
Nice setting. This is a nice setting ...a must visit area if seeing Hanoi ... there are more things to see there. It was busy when we visited
Lovely to walk round. Walk round the lake first thing in morning when the locals are doing exercise to music etc. there is little traffic at 6am!

A tipycal asian attraction. I use to walk around the lake very often.I do not think it is something special.If u are in Hanoi the lake deserves a visit mainly during the evening when the bridge is lighted.in the middle of the lake there is the temple which is the symbol of the city.Deserves a couple of pictures...
Question to visit. If have the interesting on Vietnam old history, worth to visit but not a good place for western foreigner.

Cool weather and nice ambience. I flew from Kuala Lumpur KLIA 2 airport to Danang and took a coach from the North bound bus station to Hanoi. The air-conditioned night express coach I took was a comfortably clean one and the unique narrow bunk surprisingly fit me well. Despite the driver's irritating incessant horning, the journey was a smooth one and I had my intermittent deep naps throughout the 14-hr long bus trip. It was the longest bus journey I had ever embarked but I found fun and joy in the night ride and in having my two ears flooded with pulsating disco Vietnamese music and love songs. It is natural that some will react towards the new stimulus with a hostile mindset but I am quite adaptable and my mind can easily switch to a different channel to adapt to this new environment and culture. If you are in Rome do as Romans do. Upon reaching Hanoi, I passed by a number of lakes but the moment I stepped into the park of this Lake of the Restored Sword, I could feel her difference from the rest. Bright colorful flowers dotted the park. Couples sitting intimately on benches occasionally hugging and giggling to each other while some took their seats in the café nearby sipping their coffee in their relaxed mood while occasionally extend their gaze to the calm and serene lake. I stared at the `little hut' in the middle of the lake. The isolated hut in the expanse of the calm lake looks distinctively tiny but it adds a mesmerizing appeal to this lake. The wind was cool and the ambience and setting deliver a different sort of taste. I strolled my way round the lake stop for a while at the entrance to the pagoda temple took some photos and continued my walk. The lake is serene and lovely. The long branches of the year old trees stretch their prowess and cast a mysterious stint to the lake scenery. At one corner of the lake, a crowd gathered around a group of four graceful tall young female musicians donned in long red dress playing lovely tunes on their violins. Further down the lane, I met models attired in beautiful `ao dai' ( the traditional Vietnamese costume) having their photography by the lake. I sat down on a bench set my gaze at the lake enjoying the serenity of the surrounding when a few young university girls suddenly interrupted my relaxation and strike casual conversation with me. They were honestly keen to learn English from me. I found them sincere and we had a good exchange. I traveled alone to this foreign country and hardly can converse a single words in the language of this country. I looked lost ,isolated and abandoned. But at this lakeside, in the cool weather and serenity of the surroundings, I felt the affection, warmth and friendliness from these young lovely university students. In simple dribs and drabs, they tried to understand me and I tried to understand them. We laughed and when I was too fast in my pace, they requested me to slow down. We shared our face book and added each other to continue our friendship journey. We took a good photo before we departed. Today, while I am writing, their faces vividly appear in front of me and they are also now my face book friends.Cool weather, nice ambience and my lovely friends. The Lake was our friendship bridge.
Interesting, nice view. Not far to walk from our hotel, but difficult to cross the road. Nice environment and close to cafes.

Escape from the Old Quarter . A lovely calming way to spend some time away from the narrow streets and constant assault on the senses that you get from staying in the Old Quarter. The temple/pagoda is worth a visit, cross the red bridge to get there. There is an entrance fee, I forget how much but not exorbitant from memory. A walking path that is not full of motorbikes, and at night, festooned by overhead fairy lights makes it a worth seeing in the day and in the night. Also plenty to see and do nearby, especially around the huge intersection where it butts to the old quarter party streets.Find your way there.
Crowded but of interest. Huge crowd on the day we went but still managed to walk over the bridge and listen to the history. Reasonably quite considering the crowds and traffic
Great early morning and evening "scene". Be sure to visit early (6am) in the morning to see everyone out exercising!Evening and late evening is also quite a scene.

Pretty. Pay the 30.000 D fee to cross the bridge into the temple grounds.
Some good photo opportunities.
Illuminated at night
nice park around it. this is one of the many lakes in Hanoi. it has a nice park around which accomodates the lazy traveller or the occasional evening dance with locals.

Nice respite from bustling streets of Hanoi Old quarter . A short walk from the hustle and bustle of the Old Quarter, the lake offers a nice opportunity for a walk or a jog around the lake which is lit up with pretty lights in evening.
Nice lake, nothing more. The lake is nice but really nothing much is going on there/. It's nice to walk around it and look at the people and the cafes, but really nothing more.
Good location. The lake is good to walk around and to sit at watch the locals do various activities. I would not bother paying to see the temple as there is not much to see there.
Touring. Had a lovely day exploring this area..would only say a little smog/mist around. Busy as usual..watch out for those pesky bikes..
Great night life!. Beautiful but crowded place to visit in the heart of the city. Great place to cycle around or have a quick drink in a bar place
Dirty!. The lake is polluted with rubbish and green algae. There are dead fish floating around. Not good if they want to encourage tourists. it wasn't anything special.
Hub of activity around the lake. Worth a visit, really nice views and a nice walk. People also take to jogging around the lake. Lots of shops and restaurants around the lake too.

An icon of the city of Hanoi. Ho Hoan Kiem is an icon of the city of Hanoi, this lake represents the soul and the heart of Hanoi. On the shores of the lake there is a shady pedestrian with lots of benches to sit while relaxing lake enjoying the breeze. Hanoi city residents looked both young and old to exercise or just mingle here.

Tranquility Amongst The Chaos. The lake sits on the edge of the Old Quarter and is a Jade sea of tranquility amongst the traffic chaos of the city. I must confess the colour of the lake does look artificial & I assume some chemical is added to the water to give it its highly green nature. Get here early enough and you can join in the Tai Chi. It has a Chinese temple accessable over a bridge at a cost of 30,000 Vietnamese Dong (£1 or about $1.50 US). Its also a pleasant place to stroll.

Hoan Kiem Lake - Beautiful Lake. Hoan Kiem lake where every morning i often wake up and do exercise with walking around the lake and take breath with fresh air. In addition, you can join a club where everyone does exercise together with music spoken by a cassetle. Everyone here always welcomes with a warm hug. They are friendly. Hoan Kiem lake is one of famous place in Hanoi. I love it so much.
Best visited at night for the lights . A very busy spot with lots of shopping and restaurants in the surrounding area. Best at night when it's beautifully lit up.

Busy busy busy. This was a lovely area of Hanoi, and walking around the lake is really wonderful. However, crossing the bridge to visit the temple on the lake is really a pain and was totally overrun with tourists. It didn't add much to our trip and I wouldn't recommend it. Walk around the lake: YES! Go to the island: nope.

Hoan Kiem Lake. Situated by the old quarter in Hanoi city the lake is at the center and the temple inside is beautiful. the lake in itself is a nice place for walk or just to sit and gaze into the distance. lot of shopping around the lake and nice beer and coffe joints. Visit in the night to see the lake and surrounding areas lit up beautifully and the circle next to it lit up with a colorful fountain. Walk into any of the joints have a beer and watch the chaos unfold which is surprisingly calm and peaceful...

Relaxing Location center of Hanoi Life. Great Lake aquare in the center of the city, great for relaxed walk and photos. Great at night and make sure you walk around in the small market like benches in the streets surrounding it.
Weather still good for walking. Weather still good for walking.Place littered with cafes around the lake.Hop on the electric cart at vnd150.000 per cart if too tired to walk.

Day or night - great place for a visit/walk. Whether its day or night(my preference) Hoan Kiem Lake is in the heart of the old quarter and is the center of the action. The well manicured path around the lake offers a great walk and beautiful scenery along with the tranquil lake. You may forget for a moment that there are a 1,000 scooters whizzing by... for a moment. Enjoy your walk, run, stroll, time around the lake.

Beautiful lake in the middle of downtown Hanoi. Our taxi drove around this lake three times on the way to our hotel. It was past midnight and the banks of the lake were lit up with many lights - truly a gorgeous sight. We returned the next day to walk around the lake ourselves - great peaceful experience, even though the overcast skies didn't lend a colorful backdrop to a beautiful lake.

At it's best viewed at night. At first glance the lake appears to be very big - however, it doesn't take long to stroll around where during the early evening local Vietnamese will be exercising in groups or even dancing which is a lovely sight. Youngsters in love can be seen walking hand in hand. This appears to be the best photographed place with tortoise temple in the middle of the lake and the weeping branches of trees which create a lovely picture. .The surrounding buildings are lit up at night as are the temple and red bridge. We have walked around the lake during the day which is equally as nice however it is at night when it comes into it's own in my opinion
Beautiful. This lovely lake near the old town is beautiful and worth walking around. At night it is lighted and gives a wonderful impression of Hanoi.
Stunning . Stunning little island in Hanoi and great little story behind it, about the only good thing in Hanoi to be fair apart from dunking donuts

A piece of peace!. After the hectic, crazy pace of the old quarter with the traffic - sword lake is so peaceful and relaxing. Very attractive gardens - great for photographs. Beautiful to walk around early in the morning and at dusk. A must do.

Talk to the students and walk around the lake. Beautiful lake, especially at sun down/in the evening.  The lake and surrounds are surprisingly clean. There is also an on water pagoda. Close to the old quarter and lots of eat and shopping streets nearby. Groups of students often congregate near the lake and stop tourists to practice their English - this is not a scam! They are great to talk to and it's a direct exchange of information - very interesting. This was our favourite thing to do in Hanoi.
Nice ! . Stayed just one block away from this lake, I must say it looks amazing during the day and also at night, my wife also loved it !
Peaceful and interesting. Great place to sit and watch modern Hanoi life. The park is 1,000 meters so easy and nice to walk around.

Worth a look if convenient. The lake is an interesting concept, however the novelty wears off quick. It's a nice view if you are passing by the area. The area is overcrowded by tourists and you may need to learn how to duck and weave the millions of selfie-sticks!

Nice looking at first glance. Beautiful looking lake. Very green from what looks like algae, not sure though.. The temple in the middle is nice and peaceful and worth a visit..The only reason I'm rating it 3 is because of the large amount of fish either dead or floating on the top struggling to breathe .. Really left me with a polluted image in the mind..
Big lake in the city. A must to visit if you are in Hanoi. Have a walk around the lake. Morning and night version both are interesting. Becareful with your own belongings in the crowd.

Stunning landscape in central Hanoi, gorgeous at night. This is in the center of Hanoi, surrounded on one side by shops, restaurants, etc. A show at the puppet theater across the street recreates the legend of this lake. Brilliantly lit at night.

Beautiful lake to walk around!. The Hoan Kiem Lake is so beautiful and peaceful, specially in the night. Also, it is a perfect place in the city to click photographs. Definitely go to see this, if you are in city centre. Serenity and beauty at its best!
Nice place to walk after a good meal. Have a nice walk around the river after enjoying your meal. Make sure to bring you camera for some nice pictures

Nice place but watch your valuables!. This attraction is for tourists and pickpockets. A nice place to see with a compelling and loving story behind it but keep your eyes out for young males lurking around. I saw qquite a few checking our group. When they realised that I had their number, they eventually drifted to another group. But don't let that stop you for seeing this interesting site.
Beautiful site in the city center, very crowded. Beautiful site in the city center, a must when visiting Hanoi, very popular and thus very crowded. Beware of pick pockets.

Great place to hang out. It is nice to visit this place in the morning when a lot of people exercise, and in the evening when it is lit up.Beautiful scenery, and nice place to be in if you just want to kill time.
Great views. This lake in the middle of the city is a great place to chill and relax after a day of sight seeing this amazing city.

Good Landmark, Beautiful at Night. Being very tired when we arrived in Ha Noi, we decided on just a walk around the lake before a dinner and bed. What a perfect choice. Close to the old quarter, it is touristy and busy further around the lake, it became calm, tranquil and more about the local culture. The lake is very green and we can't decide if it is something in the earth, the pollen or pollution that makes it that way.Be a local and just plant yourself on a park bench and watch the world go by.

Vietnam trip . This is a very pretty lake in the center of town, which locals and tourists gather for walks, early morning Tai Chi, setting and talking. Many shops surrounding the lake and many restaurants the help pass a slower paced day

Awful City. Hanoi is one of 2 places int he world that I can honestly saw I do not want to go back to. The old quarter is so congested and dirty, you cannot even cross the streets without fear of death. I can't believe the reviews that praise this city - it sucks!
Peaceful and beautiful lake - nice walk. Hoan Kiem lake is so beautiful and peaceful. It's great to walk around it. Perfect place to take photos.There are nice coffee shops around.

Wonderful for a evening stroll. This is a wonderful lake to walk around and watch modern life in Hanoi, particularly in the evening time. During my last visit in February, there were always loads of people enjoying the outdoors, particularly in the evening, and when the lights are turned on the lake can look spectacular.

Lovely!. It was lovely to walk around this lake with the lovely temple in the middle. It was peaceful which compared to the rest of the city . At night the lights were beautiful, definitely go see this if you are in the area. It's also a few minutes walk from the water puppets show if you're heading there. Highly recomended!

Serenity amongst chaos. It's hard to believe that this beautiful lake is in the middle of one of Asia's busiest cities. We experienced the serenity on an early morning walk on a foggy day, just beautiful.

Mandatory to walk there!. Having a tour of this wonderful lake you can see a lot of people taking pictures, selling stuffs, sleeping, study, getting lost....most attractive emotion to me is that I needed to stop and try to imagine about the story behind this lake, its pagoda...the turtle, the sword. I've been also into the Pagoda, always crwded indeed. A lot of couples use to be there to shoot pictures with wedding dresses...I'did also with my wife. Around the lake many links, join the lake to entertainement, shops, restaurants...nearby there is also Te Water Puppet Theatre, nice show for all!One suggestion, be there in the evening is different with to be there during daylight! so care to be there on both the periods because you will be surprised

A good lake next to the City Centre. A small lake having a nice little bridge and a statue in it. Well illuminated in the night which adds a different dimension to it. Good place to have an evening stroll and enjoy nice food from the eateries next to it. For the shopaholics Hàng Đào street is just a stones throw away which sells almost anything - including clothes, footwear, jackets, souvenirs, gizmos etc. The weekend night market happens here from 7-10pm Friday to Saturday
Very smoggy . Lovely walk off the very busy streets but very smoggy days. Lake is very dirty!! Very pretty at night all light up. Many good food places , banks and post office around it.

Nice park in the city. Nice park, little temple over run by tourists in the middle. Beautiful at night when lit up. Careful at the ticket booth as they may short change you. Tickets are 30k vnd, paid 100k, received nothing back.

Lovely walk. We find it to be a pleasant walk from our hotel to the old quarter along the lake. It is beautiful both day and night but have a different feel. In night time, it was really pretty with all the lights.
Interesting . Avoid the weekend if possible. Get a guided tour to hear about the pagoda and history. Certainly worth the visit. The lake is not necessarily the most appealing.

Good photo location (especially at night). Very pretty (especially at night) and conveniently located near the Old Quarter and right in front of the water puppet theatre. Great location to get some good photos and is nice to walk around. They say a magical turtle lives here, so you may be lucky enough to spot it! Hehe
Great at night time. Lovely focal point of the city and really pretty at night time. Great to walk round and a photographers dream with great lighting at night time.

Great Lake to walk around. Nothing much to see expect the tower in the middle and the temple which costs 30,000 dongs.
Pretty much it, nice place to sit and eat. Lots of locals walk around here.
Lovely. I always enjoy the lake when I visit the old quarter. At night it lit up so beautifully. Its good for a brisk walk or just a relaxing wander enjoying the scenery
Great place to walk both night and day. Beautiful lake in the center of Hanoi with an interesting history. Lovely night view from the top floor of one of the restaurants around the lake.

Good spot for a stroll any time of day. This was close to our Hanoi Pearl Hotel so we experienced the lake at different times of day. It's not that big so comfortable to stroll around, Early morning, by which mean about 6.30-7.30am you see the locals doing Tai Chi, Badminton and Dance classes so quite atmospheric. During the day it's a respite from the Hanoi motor traffic (albeit this is on the roads next to you) and in evening the wide promenade is brightly lit up and you can see local couples enjoying some time gazing out across the lake - probably best tome for this as the water in daytime is filthy - no idea how the Turtle (you must get someone to explain the history of this) survived in there.

Hoan Kiem, the heart of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is the real heart of old Hanoi. Wonderful to walk around any time of the day. Night-time is especially good with the fancy lights. Beautiful gardens all around the lake and wide footpaths. Join all the locals doing the same walk, morning and night. Famous for its tortoises, but none seen. The temple in the lake is very good to visit as well. It will pull you back there time and time again.

Interesting by Day, a Spectacle at Night . The lake, it's red bridge, temple etc take on a whole new look with the night lights. A walk around the lake during the daylight is easy and many lovely flower beds surround. At night it takes on mystery and magic with an array of food vendors, balloon sellers, restaurants and coffee shops plus people, strolling, exercising, playing with children and just sitting in silent contemplation. The centre to which all roads lead in the Old Quarter.

Pictoresque. This lake is situated in the middle of Old Quarter, in the heart of Hanoi. On an island in the northern end stands Jade Mountain Temple. It can be accessed by a red painted arched wooden bridge. Very nice !

Nice way to spend an evening. Beautiful lake with such an amazing legend behind it. Lots of shops around the lake to browse thru. Perfect place to people watch. People doing dancing classes, tai chi, artists doing caricatures and lots of other small traders. At dusk when the lights come on its a magical sight. And a very nice ice-cream shop next to a very french looking restaurant.Must visit spot in Hanoi.
Peaceful retreat. A nice lake with a small pagoda on it. Worth a quick stroll and a 30k VND admission for the pagoda. Look for the turtle story that is special for this lake.
A must in the morninh. To walk there, early in the morning is a must. To see all the people who do different excersises. Gym, dancing, yoga, badminton.
