Lovely for walk and some people watching.. A decently sized lake near the Old Quarter, Hoan Kiem has a walking path around it that offers a little exercise and great people watching.

Lovely walk at night . All the way round the lake the walkway is lit up as are the buildings and hotels. More than walkable even on a heavy misty night as the effect across the water is not to be missed

Nice lake to stroll and relax. This is a popular place for the locals to gather. Though there are many locals and tourists, it isn’t too crowded as the lake spans across a large area. It is a great place to leisurely stroll along the lake, enjoying the flowers, trees and greenery. Also great to take photos of the turtle tower and the red bridge. Try visiting here during the day and night as the scenery and atmosphere is so different.

Lake walk in the morning. What an experience of sight and sound. The serene backdrop of the Lake surrounded by a cacophony of people and experiences starting the day. Tai chi, Zumba, ballroom dancing, meditation, singing, badminton, exercising, running, eating and communication networks working overtime. A 25 min walk around the Lake and attached parks turns into a minimum hour depending on what activities you join in. Absolutely a MUST DO in Hanoi!!!

Yet again, something for everyone.... ..the only real downside is the (utterly filthy) water. (Did Toto really die of old age or..?) Dead fish being collected by workers is an all-too-common sight nobody wants to see... But I'm sure they'll eventually cotton on to the fact that any large body of still water needs regeneration. Aeration by another name. However, if you lift your eyes away from the murk, the whole area is a restful break from the frantic rush of traffic.Still, if you stop (anywhere!) you risk being pounced on by (everyone?) wanting to praise their English. Enthusiastic young students especially. Enjoy the experience by asking any questions you might have about Vietnam. Their answers always cover the whole spectrum, so everyone gains. Ok, back to the Lake...The walkaround itself is more like a botanical garden, with shady trees, seasonal flowers and creatively pruned shrubs to admire. The odd information and ice-cream kiosks keep everyone happy, not just the kids... Yes, there are WC's too...But the Lake itself remains the attraction, giving a meditative ambience for a quiet, reflective break from the bustle. Avoid on the weekends; too crowded!The bridge might be too commercial for all tastes, but offers excellent photo views and overall the total experience is one that should not be missed. Enjoy the peaceful surrounds while you can. Plenty of other 'necessities' close by with Supermarkets on both sides, Post Office, Hospitals, Cathedrals and Twin Towers to keep you occupied. A good cross-section of fast-food outlets on the Western side (where else?) will satisfy the cravings... Still plenty of shops to check out too!Enjoy!

Nice stroll. We made a point of strolling around this lake last thing every night we were in Hanoi. We found it to to end the day, It is nice to see so many local families out doing exactly what we were doing.

Quiet place to relax even with lots of people around. When the sun is out, this is a great place to relax with a book. You can perch yourself on the side of the lake for hours with the view of the temple and the noise of the roads behind you. The lake is beautiful day and night. Especially busy around the Chinese New Year due to the temple in the middle of the lake. There are lots of vendors around selling ice cream, fruit juice and fresh fruit.

Fun area of Hanoi. We enjoyed walking to and around the lake, as it makes for a nice complement to the bustling Old Quarter. The bridge is great for photos and the tower on the south end is cool looking with a great story. The water itself is kind of gross, but the grounds surrounding it are well maintained. It's a good place for walking or running. Recommend reading about the legend of the lake.

Two views, one in the day and the other at night.. Great to take a walk in the evening and observe the daily on-goings. Come back in the night and be immersed by the night lights. The place also if you are suffering from fast food withdrawal symptoms - McDonald's, Burger King, Popeye's, Dun kin Donuts, etc.

A nice place for relax walk. Not so special and have to pay for walking on the red wooden bridge. Some street performance and vendors along the lake. A lot of cafe around it so you can enjoy a good Vietnamese coffee while enjoying a good view of the lake.

Go by and night. A good place to walk around. On the map as Hoan Kiem Lake. It is beautifully lit up at night with plenty going on. The old quarter, and the Water Puppet theatres are on the edge of this lake. It is a good place for shopping and eating.

My favourite place to go for a walk. I don't know why but there is no other park or lake in Hanoi which gives you such a positive feeling and mood. So try it yourself and take a walk around the lake!=)
Awesome view. Been there in both day and night time. Nice view in the day time for photo taking, as for the night view, will never forget the lightings, especially the red lighted bridge.
Pleasant walk . Nice enough place to walk around. Good reference point when out and about and you lose your bearings. A few restaurants and cafes and public toilets.

The beautiful City Centre lake in Ha Noi. We stayed at the wonderful Meracus 2 Hotel just a city block away, and this lake was always a focal point of our morning walks. The small temple on the lake is accessed by a bridge and is well worth a visit. The electric tour buses are parked at the end of the lake and offer a wonderful hour long tour at minimum prices. We enjoyed these tours so much that we went twice.You may find yourself accosted by students with questionaires who wish to practise their English language skills. We learn a lot from them during these very pleasant meetings.The various high level eateries are accessable by ljft and are next to the big roundabout. They offer wonderful views of the lake.
Peaceful lake. Had a lovely walk around the lake. Especially enjoyed seeing all the local artists and people enjoying their lunch break, eating, playing games, etc.

Relaxing nice scenery. The lake itself only take about 20 minutes to walk around. I thought it was a very nice site for a cloudy day. Nothing amazing but worth the walk if you are in the area! The gardens were all very well kept and full of beautiful flowers. There were many different types of trees that towered near the waters edge. Overall good experience!

Great Relaxed vibe about the place.. I know right, relaxed in se asia?! not a thing! but to me this place has a sense of calm about it. I would recommend taking a walk around it at night, it's at it's most stunning then and it was the most interesting watching people work out near the water edge.

Passage oblige in Hanoi. You can't go to Hanoi without going to the Lake. The most memorable times are early morning when all the locals are exercising and in the evening when in summer they are looking for fresh air. Assist at the gym exercise and the dansing lessons.
Hoan Kiem lake. Check this lake out when the sun goes down. It lights up and everyone comes out to play. Lots of local playing and dancing all around the lake.

Dirty water and Vietnamese who live with it. No matter if morning exercise, student exchange groups during the day, or pick nicks and weddings on the weekend - be prepared for everything!
Only one thing is for sure there, something will go on and even at 4am you will not be alone - somehow amazing, somehow disgusting, definitely a must!

Lovely lake to walk around. Lovely lake in the middle of town. An early morning walk will see many people practicing tai chi as well as aerobics class that you can join. At night the lake and bridge are beautifully lit and a great spot for pictures. The lake in evening is a popular walking spot for young couples. We missed walking over the bridge to the pagoda as it was closed at night.

Hoan Kiem Lake, Hanoi. Absolutely beautiful, peaceful and calm. The many activities around the lake include people doing Tai Chi, walking or just taking in the calm and nature. A beautiful part of Hanoi and lovely to walk around and avoid the busy roads. Do not miss seeing this.
One love. The heart of Hanoi, an oasis, a place to be a favourite one, this is all Hoan Kiem. Serenity and tranquility and amazing huge trees.

The most famous of the 'Hanoi' lakes. Take an evening stroll around the lake, great place to start for a walking tour of the old quarter. Pay a visit to the temple accessed by the pedestrian bridge at one end of the lake, there's a nominal entrance fee to pay and a small museum and a mummified giant turtle in a glass display case.You can read up on the centuries old legend of the sword and the turtle, or you can join a tour and pay $50 to have someone do their best to explain it for you.The rest of the OQ seems to be a mix of tour operator shops flogging tours to Ha Long Bay, Sapa, Mekong and all points on the compass in between. There's also the made in vietnam outlets selling 'Nike, Adidas and North Face' shirts, jackets, trainers and bags...Pity the city couldn't corral these places and put them in a market somewhere, it works great in HCMC with 'Saigon Square'.Read up on the streets surrounding the lake, easy walking distance to some great French colonial era cathedral (St. Joseph's) and what's left of the 'Hanoi Hilton' (not much).I'd have thought they would have kept this site complete as a museum but maybe the most recent history isn't something the authorities would like to dwell on.

A nice way to orient yourselves. Hoan Kiem was the first place we went upon our arrival into town. It was a great way to orient ourselves in the city. We loved people watching as we strolled along the lake. A couple of groups of students stopped us to practice their English and we had great time speaking with them.
Big lake. Looks peaceful and we walked around part of it on a cold day in Hanoi. Maybe it was the weather but nice as it was we wouldn't go out of our way.

THE lake.. Have to see it... It's the easiest way to move around. I mean, go from the lake to anywhere following straight streets and you see 90% of Hanoi. Totally recommend to give it a try for jogging.

Lake temple. A temple on an island, good for photos and a nice story too, plenty of locals, reached via a pretty bridge and well worth a visit whilst walking around the lake, nearly opposite the water puppet theatre.
Nice lake. A peaceful place amongst the hustle and bustle of Hanoi . Worth a visit especially at night . The lighting is very nice and you can capture some very nice pictures .

Nice walk around. This is the place you want to walk around in the evening with your romance. It´s nice and relaxing even though the traffic is near. With a guide, telling the stories about the sword lake, it really lifts the experience.

A central part of Hanoi and history. Lovely setting hard by the city. Learning the mythology and history of the lake and its surroundings, even to the crash of John McCain's jet, is a key to understanding Vietnam. A relaxing walk and lovely setting around the lake nad its pagoda.

Beautiful!. The lake is wonderful for an evening stroll. It's a fair size so you also get a little exercise walking around it. They have beautiful lights at night. It's mesmerizing! You can also visit the temple on the lake,I can't remember the price but it was very beautiful and worth seeing.

A beautiful location away from the chaos. This is a lovely lake and clearly quite popular with the locals. A midst the chaos of the old quarter it is a nice place to come and relax. You can sit by the lake and either choose to take in the serenity of the water or turn around and be fascinated by the turbulent traffic.

Peaceful center of Hanoi. Complementing the Old Town, this lovely lake is surrounded by restaurants, theaters, shops and a lot of activity. Yet it's such a peaceful spot.
Should definitely visit the Pagoda and read about the legend of the restored sword. If you're lucky, you'll spot turtles!
Worth a visit if you are passing.. We visited as we strayed from the old quarter. Entry was inexpensive and it was interesting but we wouldn't have gone out of our way to visit.
lovely place. big lake with huge area to walk around in. lake is also surrounded by cafes, restaurants and shops. it is also lovely at night with all the lightnings.

Well worth a visit . It's only a small charge to get into this attraction but make the effort and have a wander around.
Read the history and visit the temple
Good time.
Beautiful lake. We walked around this lake on many occasions and took time out sitting in the sun and just watching the world walk by - must to visit

Hanoi's Lakes are Perfection. Hanoi is more hyperactive, polluted, and crazed than NYC or Cairo. The traffic is worse than anywhere else on earth. So, when you hit one of the local Lakes in the center of Hanoi, you will be stunned by their beauty, perfect gardens, small temples, many restful benches, and locals performing tai chi, exercising, taking selfies, or walking with friends. They are the perfect restorative after Hanoi's bustle. You can find small perfect cafes around them, art exhibits on the streets, vendors selling local crafts, and free and spotlessly clean public bathrooms. These perfect lakes give you opportunities for hundreds of perfect photographs, as well as a blessed opportunity to catch your breath, chill, and enjoy being just one person among the throng of locals enjoying the parks.

Go a little off lake to find better priced restaurants.. Spent 3-4 days walking Hanoi and this lake is centrally located and helped us get our bearings. Pretty gardens and fun to observe locals exercising in park. Be sure to see at night for light decorations.
Beautiful lake next to the old town. Beatiful lake in the middle of the city. A must see for all Hanoi travellers. You could just sit and watch the lake for hours.

Beautiful lights at night. The lake is delightful. It is a little paradise in the middle of bustling Hanoi. When we first arrived we sat outside at the coffee shop next to the water puppet theatre to watch the world go by and it was very entertaining. We went in the late afternoon and hung around until dark which was a good idea because the light of sunset and the city lights reflecting off the water made for spectacular photographs. You can walk across the Huc Bridge (wooden bridge painted red) to the island at the centre of the lake for 30,000VND. At night you get a pretty good view of the city lights from the centre of the bridge. There are a few stalls selling the 3D cards.. Don't buy them here, they are cheaper at the night market.If you like to run for exercise, this is the place to go. Hanoi isn't really a runner-friendly city so you'll see a lot of locals running around the lake. We were there on a Saturday and there were also a lot of weddings. We didn't see any turtles though. Apparently the last one recently passed away :(
Beautiful . Would definitely recommend seeing this at night the lights around it are gorgeous and the lights in the street. During the day it's good to see too.

Nice lake. It is a nice place to walk around and relax during the day or at night, when the lights are lit up. A lot of colorful flowers around it. Also many restaurants and bars to spend some time admiring the lake

A good start to your day. Lake itsself is a greenish small lake with the story which means to locals a lot. You if you go over the bridge to the island where is a temple have to pay 30000 VND but it's not a big money and I think it gives you also some sort of peace and a good feeling for the whole day.

A very serene view. It was our first day in Hanoi and the hotel staff recommended this place. It was a beautiful place, the flowers were in bloom and standing by the edge of the lake it gave me a kind of calm feeling and the atmosphere was so serene despite the honks of motorbikes and cars in the background. A walk in the evening too was pleasant with all the lighting effects around it.

Focal Point of the Old Quarter!. The Old Quarter surrounds this lake and is a nice sight given its urban atmosphere. Enjoy some coffee while looking out over the water. There's also a ice cream shop with a variety of flavors for under 50 cents on the path around the lake near the big roundabout.
A gem in hanoi. Very nice place, a heart of hanoi. Feeling relax and peaceful here. Walking around the lake and find out alot of things surround it. Must visit here when come hanoi

People watching and walking.. I enjoy being here. It is full of interesting people and great restaurants around.
Try getting to the small island early in the morning to avoid overcrowded tourists.

A nice relaxing walk with plenty to see. What a way to spend a couple of hours after travelling all day. We walked around it in the rain but it was still magical and peaceful although it is right in middle of the city and next to the old quarter

A calming symbol of the past.. A symbol of a past time. Well kept and presented, it is a fitting legacy to a past dynasty. Large in size, it's a great walk around and interesting to watch the locals making good use of its surroundings. A great place to sit and relax after a time in the hussle of the Old Quarter.
Beautiful illumination. Great, relaxing place to walk around and do people watch. We visited right after the Tet and enjoyed the holiday decorations. Beautiful and well maintained flower gardens.

Nice place to walk around. This lake is situated in the center of the city and is a very nice place to walk around. At the parks by the lake you will have the chance to see citizens doing aerobic, which is something very common there and is really amusing.

I love the surrounding. Surrounded by a town, you can just walk around the lake and enjoy the view. Beautiful and colorful flowers. Its a place for an evening relaxing with family or friends. I saw many local people did their wedding photography there.

Beautiful scenary, not much to do otherwise. This lake was so beautiful I could have sat here all day and watch the fish jump. We went to the little temple across the bridge and learned all about the lost sword which was very interesting but quite a quick visit. There was a man playing bamboo flite st the side of the lake and I felt so transported by the whole thing! So beautiful lol

Represents the colours of Hanoi.... People, perspectives!!!. This place gave us two completely contrasting pictures of itself....We visited it in the night, and it was Adobe of young couples, lot of activity, chats, ice creams, lot of local food, gaining lot of calories!!!Next morning we were back to see the beautiful lake.... Early in the morning, lots of people working out, meditation, jog, walk....burning calories....Smiles smiles everywhere... A place with lot of activity...Use uber cabs where ever you go... They will cost you 1/5 the of what local taxi drivers quote

Must visit if you are in Hanoi. We stayed close by so we were happy to stoll here both mornings and nights. Friday night atmosphere was just awesome..lovely to see the way the locals youngsters enjoying simple things in life.
Place to visit. Good place to enjoy the view of the lake. Nice restaurants are also around the lake. In the night is a must to see the beautiful lake.

Some of the slimiest water I've experienced. . What could be a beautiful lake is somewhat compromised by algal bloom. As we walked around the lake we saw some of the scum which had somehow found itself of dry land. An extraordinary putrid and fluorescent green of a most off putting vivacity .Despite the algae the area is interesting. The temple is pleasant but too crowded.Watch out for the two women with bamboo poles and pineapples. They throw the poles over the shoulders of polite westerners, elicit photos and demand money. Absolute harpies.

Great place in Central Hanoi for a walk.... Visited the Lake of the Restored Sword (Hoan Kiem Lake) with friends on the way to the temple in the middle of the lake, which is unimpressive, however the pictures you can get on the bridge are great. Plus there are nice bars and restaurants around the lake if you need refreshments. You can also see turtle tower in the middle of the lake and this is explained in the legend surrounding the lake, as well as explaining its name. According to the legend, (or should I say according to Wikipedia) in early 1428, Emperor Lê Lợi was boating on the lake when a Golden Turtle God (Kim Qui) surfaced and asked for his magic sword, Heaven's Will. Lợi concluded that Kim Qui had come to reclaim the sword that its master, a local God, the Dragon King (Long Vương) had given Lợi some time earlier, during his revolt against Ming China. Lợi renamed the lake to commemorate this event, from its former name Luc Thuy meaning "Green Water". The Turtle Tower (Thap Rùa) standing on a small island near the centre of lake is linked to the legend. Depending on the weather I would advise taking: Sun Screen, Water, Camera, Hat or Umbrella.
Very beautiful. We initially went here during the day. It is far more beautiful at night when all the lights are lit up. One of my favourite places to stroll and enough the sites of the city.

Pleasant walk in the evening. I've been visiting Hanoi since 1995 and I always find it a very pleasant and enjoyable experience to take a stroll around Hoan Kiem lake in the early morning or evening, especially in Feb/Mar when the temperatures are a little cooler. So much to see and very reminiscent of Paris.

Great place to walk around and very central. The old quarter borders the lake. Several nice bars and restaurants around the lake to stop and have a relaxing time.We normally Mai our way here after a walking tour as man taxis are waiting so you avoid the hassle of trying to get a taxi in the small streets of the old quarter
peaceful. We visited this area with local guides. It is very nice lake with park . Locals like to run around the park but it is really good just to sit and relax for a while in this busy city.
Lovely Lake. This attraction was part of our tour, We walked over the bridge and took some photos. It very pretty...and touristy! My husband went back in the evening, when it as lit up. Beautiful.

Take a night stroll. Situated in the heart of Hanoi the lake is beautifully lit at night a worth a (romantic?) stroll round. Read about the legend behind the lake.Turtle Tower was built to represent the legend and sits on an islet in the centre of the lake. At the northern end of the lake stands Den Ngoc Son (Jade Mountain Temple) which can be accessed by The Huc (or Sunbeam Bridge). There are a number of bars and restaurants with great views of the lake.

One of best things in Hanoi. Amazing and clean lake. It feel so calm and relaxing to walk around the lake area after being in the Hanoi's hassle. There are a lot of restaurants and shopping places around the lake. Worth of visit!

Lovely. A walk around this lake would take about an hour and its lovely. There are some mythological stories about this lake and you might want to google if you are interested. From the point of view of a tourist, I would say this lake is central to Hanoi and the Old Quarter, French town and other shopping districts are all situated close to the lake. You can walk around or hire a cycle rickshaw for $5 an hour per person.

Full of dead fish an litter. We were in Hanoi for Vietnam new year (TET) and the condition of the lake was disgusting for such an important time of the year,it smelt bad from all the dead fish (thousands ) and litter floating everywhere.

Relaxing. This lake is close to the old quarter, possibly even in it. It's rather large, however nothing too special. There's alot of Western chain restaurants and touristy gifts. There's a neat little temple that's picturesque. It wasn't amazing, but it was a nice little break from all of the chaos. Be careful crossing the wide roads and use the crosswalks.

A walk around the Lake. Lovely area in the city to walk around, great for photos and meeting local students who want to chat and improve their English skills. Seems to be a much safer environment than the last time we were here in 2003!

A nice place to watch the city and be one of the locals. If you are visiting during the Spring, then this park is a must visit. They have different types of colourful flowers growing around the park. During Saturday nights, this seems to be one of the spots in the city that locals hang out at (more people here than their malls). You might even see some trying to catch fish just for the sake of catching one, they'll immediately set the fish free once they catch one. There are also different street food being sold here, especially the sliced fruits drizzled with chilli salt. Ensure to bargain, as most are being sold to tourists with a higher price than with locals.TIP: Do not buy from the ladies carrying a plastic basket selling bread. They tend to overprice the tourists and they don't even taste that good.

A beautiful lake in the middle of the city. It's a nice lake near the old quarter of Hanoi. I walked near the lake in day time and in the evening. I enjoyed the lake side in the evening...the weather is cool, more tourists, the pubs and restaurants are bubbling with tourists and locals, I saw even some local function near the lake. So my favourite time to visit the lake will be in the evening. I would recommend that people should visit this lake at least once when in Hanoi.
Nice lake in the centre of town. The lake is nice and beautiful, the location is in the centre of the tiwn, around the lake, a lot of restaurant, old street and shopping area.

Best way to meet locals in all of Vietnam . Unwittingly we sat down on a lakeside bench on Sunday afternoon and we were soon accosted in the most charming way possible by locals between the ages of 10 and 80'ish who wanted to practice their English. They were exceedingly polite, friendly, and fun-loving. Best two hours we've had in many years on the road.I guess it is a tradition here for those wishing to improve their foreign language skills, I think that 10 yo will be famous some day.
a respite in a very busy city. We walked around the lake and over one of the lovely bridges. The Puppet Theatre is across the street.

A gorgeous temple in the middle of the lake. It rained all day we were here but that didn't detract from the experience at all. At the entrance to the bridge you have to pay to get in. Just before the kiosk, a woman was burning fake money as an offering. The red bridge over the lake to the temple gives great photographs. Women gardeners in coolie hats wrapped in plastic were tending the grounds. The temple is a working temple and don't be surprised to see locals lighting incense and making offerings to Buddha. There are several shrines. The mythical golden turtle is on display here. Lots of huge old bonsai trees. Grey stone courtyards and red lacquer buildings. It's magical and won't disappoint. The pavement around Hoam Kiem Lake is all busted up, so watch your step! Also when crossing the road, keep moving and don't hesitate or make eye contact with the traffic. Brazen it out and you'll arrive safely on the other side!

Best part of Hanoi. We visited 4 different times at all times of day and made it around the lake twice. Evenings are magical. Mornings are quiet and more authentic. Come by 6 to see or take part in Tai chi. Although it is crowded to get across the red bridge later in the day it was worth it. Tip : it's closed in the evening. There are a couple of places to cross with a light if you haven't nailed the walking across traffic. Sit on a bench and buy your water puppet tickets a day ahead.
Nice lake. I found it a romantic place. The light decoration at that time was so beautiful. It was nice to relax there.

Fantastic. The lake is the focal point of Hanoi and is the first place you must go to get your bearings. It only takes about 15 minutes to walk around but you get a feeling for everything which is Hanoi. Don't hesitate to go across the bridge to the temple, and enjoy being in Hanoi!

peaceful and very nice. the lake, park , flower and especially the temple on the lake is amazing, morning for tachi and for exercise , in the afternoon for relaxing and old people playing chess. a very peaceful place in crown city.

Leisure. Beautiful scenery good for walking around n people watching local n tourist from all over the world but u have to pay 30.000Dong to go inside the temple to pray n burn incence .stature n prayer hall.

Oasis amidst chaos. Without Hoan Kiem Lake, Hanoi would simply be just another Asian city bursting at the seams. At the time I was there, the weather was jacket-worthy, and women were planting pansies around the lake. Very pretty. Hard to believe that sitting on a bench and looking out on the lake, behind you is a maelstrom of motorbikes negotiating the rotunda. Truly a defining feature of the city.

Lovely feature of Hanoi . The lake is a juxtaposition to the chaos of Hanoi. A walk around the lake during the day or night providers the opportunity for some great pictures. Also cafes on the lake are a great place for a rest and relaxation of the hustle of Hanoi. It is not clean water but anything different should not be expected.

Small circular walk is a joy. We arrived at Legend Beers end of the lake and did a loop of the lake enjoying the fun of locals.Only 30,000 VND (£1) to cross the red bridge to enjoy the temple and mummified turtle museum.Worth a visit and nearby is the water puppet theatre so you can tick off a few of your tourist musts.Around the area is also the night street market so lots of experiences in one lovely area.Suggest roof top Legend Beer to take in the views over the lake and watch Hanoi traffic at it's entertaining best.

Like Your Favorite Sweater.... This focal point at the southern end of the Old Quarter of Hà Nôi is worth a visit. It's used by locals for a stroll and to relax. It's like your favorite sweater; well worn and well used. Some very old trees surround it and overall it's well maintained particularly The Sunbeam Bridge and Jade Mountain Temple. (Green water doesn't seem particularly pristine or healthy but hard to tell what actually lives in it!)
Lovely place to visit. Very nice walk around the Lake, we did it several times. Especially good at night, lots to see and within reach of bars, cafes and restaurants.
Central landmark of Hanoi. romantic atmosphere around as well as on the island which is really worth the visit especially with the rare plants around the tao temple.
Lovely lake. Lovely lake bordering both the old and French quarter. Has a temple on it. Very well maintained gardens all around and offers a good lung space to the city.

A must see when in Hanoi. A must see. The lake draws locals and tourists alike. It is a gathering place to walk, sit, talk and relax. Lit up like Christmas at night. Old Quarter is on the northern end, high end shopping at the southern end.

Strangle Peaceful Amongst The Carnage. Nice picturesque location & despite the busy traffic busting all around the outside it is easy to switch off from it & take in the various views around the lake. No sign of any turtles on my visit but then thats probably wishful thinking.

Super fun walk and beautiful . Easy fun thing to see in Hanoi. It also looks beautiful and night. The views from the bridge are awesome. Also it was interesting how many ppl wanted to take pictures with us!

Great place to take a stroll at night. This scenic lake is surrounded by beautiful European buildings. You think you are in Europe or Shanghai if not for the temple in the middle of the lake. It is a great place to take a stroll that is uniquely Hanoi.

Nature in the big city. A beautiful natural spot in the center of Hanoi, the lake attracts families and young couples as well as tourists. There are the usual food and trinket vendors, but the sidewalks are wide and there’s plenty of room for strolling under the ancient shady trees. There are a couple of pagodas on the lake, one that you can reach by a bridge. At night the bridge, pagodas and trees are beautifully lit up. A nice nearby stop is Fanny’s, an ice-cream shop near the north end of the lake where you can take a break in the air conditioning and choose from dozens of exotic flavors. Also nearby is the Thanh Long Water Puppet Theater, so if you have time before the performance, the lake is a relaxing family-oriented place to hang out.

Nice and peaceful. Can't really miss this attraction..if you walk around Hanoi looking for food or other attractions you will most likely walk past this lake. There is a little temple over a bridge that you can visit during the day for a small fee.

Tranquilly in the heart of Hanoi. Spend time here at leisure for people watching, and visit some of the attractions lakeside; if you're lucky, you might catch a glimpse of the giant turtles in the lake that face imminent extinction.

Without the backstory it's just a nice lake. The lake is a nice oasis in a hectic city. There's plenty of legends and stories to this place, but unless you've done some research or brought a guide you'll be missing the lot. Then it's just a nice lake and a pretty temple. Still worth seeing though, as it's located in the centre of Hanoi and the entrance fee is next to nothing.

Best time to visit is the crackof dawn!. Why at dawn? Well, this is where you see the locals out and about - exercising, peddling their wares, less traffic and serenity. In the day, too many tour buses!

A cultural highlight. This lake sits in the centre of Hanoi, within easy walking distance from the Od Quarter where we stayed. This lake is a central meeting place for the locals. During the morning there are public exercise classes to watch. During the day there are restaurants to eat at. At night the area is transformed with a sea of lights and music, where you can watch dance classes and other activities. No matter what time of day we turned up, there was always something interesting happening. Highlights include a walk across the Huc Bridge, (the red bridge in all the photos) across to Jade Island. Turtle Tower also stands proudly on its own small island. This area is a great way to experience some of the culture of the inhabitants of the vibrant city of Hanoi.

Weather was just awful. In spite of the weather, this place is absolutely worth visiting. The lake is named after a legend and you will need someone to tell it to you (guide?) in order to understand the meaning but the lake is situated in a lovely section of Hanoi and visit is wonderful. A must-do and a must-see.
Very nice walk with a cute temple and nice night overview. nice to do by day, by night, nearby the water puppets show, church and temple on the lake, bridges are illuminated by nights

Watch for the tutle. Nice lake , good for people watching, you can walk round the lake , roughly 1.5 miles. If you see a turtle you get good luck. Wouldnt bother going to the temple - bridge good for photos.
Great people watching spot. We had an early morning, picturesque stroll around the lake and stopped at a cafe for an iced coffee and watched the world go by.

Excellent night time walk. At night the lake is illuminated in all directions giving an amazing reflection j. The rippling water. On my walk around I saw two Zumba classes being taken, several artists who do characitures, a man doing night fishing, a man dancing for money, food vendors. It was a hub of activity yet also very calming. What an excellent feature to escape to and the experience is all free.

Saw it on a wet and windy day, still beautiful. Named for the legend this lake is a lovely section of Hanoi. The temple is special and the experience is relaxing. The crowds can be a bit much but other than that it's really lovely
Lovely surroundings. Around the lake, there is a very nice trail to stroll or jog and do your morning exercise. You also get to see a lot of French colonial buildings and residences well restored.

Good place for an interesting walk. The Hoan Kiem Lake is the heart of Hanoi. Most of the things you want to see in the city are around it, so walking nearby is almost mandatory. Many people use the park surrounding the lake, just to sit, to do taichi or run. It is full of people all the time, but probably most by night. The lake has a couple of buildings in the center; one, the Ngoc Lon Temple can be visited.

nice area and worth a stroll but nothing to get overly excited about.. nice area to stroll around, a cafe on the one side is nice to sit and have a drink at. Makes a nice change to the pretty hectic streets a stones throw away and the small temple on the island is worth a short visit. I wouldn't describe it as an attraction but certainly a very nice place to take a stroll and take a breather from the old quarter.

In which all seems lost until a Magic Turtle comes to our rescue - Hurrah !. At some point in your visit to Vietnam you are going to feel "Templed Out" it's just like being in Venice when you get that feeling that if you look at another dark oil painting you eyes will drop out . After a while they all begin to merge in your memory .Thats how l felt until l came here But Yes ! You will remember this Temple because it owes its existence to a Magic Turtle . The Kingdom was at risk ,the enemy were battering at the gates and all seemed lost for the brave Prince as he faced almost certain defeat .When ,as if by magic ( and l privately think it probably was Magic ) a magic Turtle rose up from the depths of this lake and on its back was a magic sword which it gave to the Prince. Freshly Armed and Full of Magic Enthusiasm the brave Prince drove the enemies of Vietnam far away (Cambodia ) and everyone except the Turtle lived happily ever after .. Why was the Turtle unhappy you might ask well maybe it knew that it would eventually die in the far distant future - 1967 and end up as a (rather badly ) stuffed turtle in this very temple . It's different you must surely admit and therefore Very Memorable .You will not forget this Temple l prophecy ! I haven't !

Lively place in the Centre of Hanoi. We were living very close to the lake and that was the best decision we made, every Nook and corner of the city is so easily accessible from the lake. The lake itself feels a bit dirty, but great efforts have been made to make the area around beautiful with lighting and flowers. The energy in the area begins at 6am, when you can see tones of ppl exercising in different forms, it's a really vibrant and novel experienceMust visit if you plan not to, Centre point and highlight of Hanoi city
Enjoy the view. This place is nice and there are lots of people,locals and tourists.You can sit by the water,take photos,just relax,not far you can find benches.

A place to rest and enjoy the Hanoi air. It was a perfect place to chill after long walks around Old Quarter. The area is clean and there are benches for you to sit. The lake was very calming and we enjoyed n hour of quiet there. A lot of locals jog there with their dogs, which was also entertaining to watch. :)

Peaceful oasis in the heart of Hanoi. Walking around Hoan Kiem Lake gives a sense of peace while the bustle of Hanoi continues nearby. It's lovely to see young couples just sitting and cuddling as well as the newly married having photos taken. There is dancing, tai chi and badminton going on, even some hopeful fishermen and women throwing a line in to see what they can catch. If you go during the day you can walk across Huc Bridge and visit the Temple. At night, you can view the lights reflecting on the water, which is quite a sight. After one visit you just keep being drawn back because of the Lake's beauty and tranquility.
Beautiful lake. Very relaxing walk around the lake day and night so very different Little Cafes on the lake are great Always something different to see

Nothing spectacular . Our hotel was close to the lake so we passed it every day. There is nothing really spectacular about the lake, it is dirty and the main attraction is a red bridge which you cant move on as there are too many people. Just a lake, nothing interesting really. Lots of locals who try to sell the same tourist souvenirs that you can aquire on any other street in vietnam, only difference is they dont get out of the way.
lovely..... Very pretty scenic lake. Lots of benches to sit on and watch the world go by. Lots of student there when we went, and they are very keen to sit with you and practice their Englsg.
Beautiful . I have seen this lake many times at different times of the day and it is always nice to walk around and there is always something different to see every time.

A good attraction. The lake was a 2 minute walk from our hotel so we visited it on our first day. Very busy with a lot of tourists. A good 20-30min walk around the entire lake, provided good photo opportunities and very nice at night.
Stroll and people watcuing. It is nice to visit if you're in the old quarter, it is good for a stroll around and a decent place to sit and relax and people watch.

Worth a Visit. Nothing unique but still worth a visit. You can stroll around it lost in your thoughts, there is good lighting, sketch artists, street vendors etc. There is also a temple in the middle which one can go. I will prefer it for a calm evening or morning stroll,

Lake iof the resored sword, a must in Hanoi. The most famous red bridge in Vietnam takes you a Chinese style temple. The lake is also home to a monument to the turtles that have inhabited the lake for very long periods of time

Beautiful and Tranquil park in the middle of Hanoi. Interesting history and tranquility (all the gawking tourists aside) are the hallmarks of this beautiful park in the midst of Hanoi. The walkways have lots of planting and it's delightful to watch the local people relax and enjoy

Crowded, but well worth a visit!. This is a VERY popular spot for both Vietnamese and foreigners. It has an entrance fee (30,000 VND - about $1.50) which allows you to cross a small red bridge to a small island with great photo opportunities. There is a beautiful Buddhist shrine on the island and again many photo ops. The entire visit will be about going 30 minutes.

The heart of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake was our first destination after checking into our hotel in the Old Quarter, and one that we revisited the following day.Be prepared to be approached by all manner of sellers during your stroll around the lake and if sitting on a bench don't be surprised to find someone trying to glue a non-existent split in your shoe!Beautiful flower beds line the paved paths surrounding the lake and thousands of small light bulbs are strung across the walkways which we unfortunately didn't have time to visit in the evening. The lake looks quite large, but it's an easy hour's slow stroll to complete the circuit, taking time to cross the red painted Huc Bridge to visit the Temple of the Jade Mountain on a small island in the lake (small charge to enter). Here, incense smoke drifts in the air and locals pray. There is a small seating area next to a couple of perfectly trimmed bonsai bushes on the island with a couple of benches, but you'll be extremely lucky to find them vacant.There is a café at the southern end of the lake and plenty of coffee shops on the streets surrounding the lake.A perfect mixture of locals and tourists alike, the lake is markedly less crowded in the middle of the day when temperatures can soar.The lake is a wonderful spot to take hundreds of photos and should be at the top of your list when visiting Hanoi.

Beautiful day or night attraction. Take advantage of the 1.7km loop around the lake - free from scooters, bikes and anything else on wheels! Day or night, there is always something beautiful to view around the lake. In the daylight, you'll find musicians, food and drink vendors and people playing chess/other games. There are places to sit as well. Take a stroll across the bridge and enter the island for a small fee. Lovely temple and landscaping on Turtle Island - worth a visit. At night, the lake is fully lit with stunning light displays. Local musicians and dance groups set up to perform for free. Runners/walkers loop around, brides take photographs and vendors create delicious street foods. It's a FREE must-see while in Hanoi.

A lake with a red bridge leading to a temple. This is one of the main attractions in the Old Quarter. Within walking distance from our hotel and right opposite the Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre. Just another spot for some photo opportunities but we were not very impressed by it. Lots of locals and tourists crowd the bridge when we were there, not easy to find a spot to take photos too.
Such a romantic place. feel he heart beat of Hanoi is there, looking at couples fully dressed in typical wedding attire for photo, mannequins, students, older people.

Relaxing spot. Perfect for anytime of the day ; for a morning jog, a walk with your new Hanoian friend in the noon or just simple having snacks and drinks there in the evening after a long day in the Old Quarter. Sadly I didn't see any turtles despite the legend. :D
Ride Bike around the Lake in the morning. Rent a bike and ride it around the lake in the morning. Watching all the old vietnamese people do tai chi is awesome!
Early morning tranquility. Get up early and head down to the lake for some great photo opportunities and to enjoy the view. Must be done when you are in Hanoi

Beautiful lake and great place to walk. It was lovely to walk around this lake with the lovely temple in the middle and the lovely bridge there are turtles in the lake if you are lucky enough to spot them apparently the oldest one died in January.
It was OK. I spent some time here because it was on the way to somewhere else. It was pretty, but I wouldn't have necessarily gone out of my way to find it.

Idyllic lakeside - perfect place for a sundowner!. Families enjoy strolling round. Stopping for a cool drink or an ice cream whilst balloon sellers plié their wares. Views of the temple and the pretty pink bridge in the distance known as the phong canh dep.

Lovely walk. Our first honeymoon evening stroll was around this lake. The lake is surrounded by glorious Christmas lights, and would appear to be a magnet for courting couples. The temples in the centre of the lake make for an amazing backdrop. During daylight hours you can see the locals practicing tai chi and on the evening the locals eating copious amounts of sunflower seed looking food. Lots of history. A must see place to visit! :)

Something fishy. From a distance, this is a nice lake. Go closer to take a walk around it and you will notice scores of dead fish floating on its green surface. Stop at an outdoor cafe and sip on your drink. What's that out of the corner of your eye? Oh, nothing. There it goes again. It was ratatouille in 4 legged, long tailed person, rambling over to look at my apple cake, the dirty rat. I called a waiter to alert him to the said rat. He seemed nonplussed but went to find it, during which time a wasp, clearly an extra from the film, Jumange, also came to admire my cake but it was too late for him. I must say I was rather surprised at what turned out to be the day of the uninvited critters, but I still loved my trip to Vietnam. Just get out of Hanoi or be sure to leave your spectacles at home so you can't see the reality. That said, watch the roads!
Visiting. The place is looking awesome good nature its nice locatione in vietnam and shooping perpose also very nice i think its an good looking pla e in vietnam

Relaxing spot in the middle of a buzzing city. I loved visiting this area. It was peaceful which compared to the rest of the city was a nice treat. At night the lights were beautiful, definitely go see this if you are in the area. Its also a few minutes walk from the water puppets show if you're heading there.

Walking destination on a beautiful afternoon. Walking around this lake is what families and couples seem to do on a beautiful afternoon or an evening. The paths are wide, benches plenty, and traffic on nearby streets not too bad. It lies between the Old Quarter and a nice tourist-shop neighborhood tothe west, and the embassy area to the south. Couples come and post for wedding photos along the paths.

Great place to visit and people watch!. We enjoyed walking around the lake several times during a recent visit to Hanoi. While it's great during the daytime it's even better at night with beautiful lights lining the area. It's a peaceful escape to nature in the middle of a busy city. The area is well-maintained with lots of restaurants and shops surrounding. Water puppet theater is nearby and you can get tickets for a fun show!

The place to be for fireworks on Vietnam New Year . I know this is late notice but this places is buzzing early in Feb for the Tet festival. A pleasant walk anytime and right on the edge of the old quarter,French Quarter and where the main water puppet theatre is too. On the north corner opposite the Rev bridge is a lovely cafe to take in the view served great cake too.
Crowded but nice. Lots of people, lake is polluted but still nice overall. Takes about an hour to walk around dodging the foot traffic but beautiful by night

Pleasant walk around the lake. The walk is a must-do when visiting the Old Quarter of Hanoi. It will take about 45 min when you prefer strolling to a fast pace. It also allows you to check out the numerous restaurants and coffee shops located around the lake.

Attractive Lake. Really easy to get to & an attractive lake to see. The bridge & temple are small but quite pretty with attractive views over the river. You can stroll around it on the way to other sights in Hanoi so add it to the itinerary if you're around the area.
beautiful. good to take pictures at night and also during the day. lots of couples go there during the night and you can also get someone to paint you.

A Beautiful serene experience. I used the Lake as an anchor during my stay to know where I was.! I walked around it early in the morning which was magical as there was a mist and it was very quiet and serene. People doing Tai Chi, Dancing and exercising before the day started.

A key attraction. The Lake is a key and prominent attraction in central Hanoi. Legend is that the Emperor was boating on the lake when a gold turtle appeared and asked for his magic sword. The Turtle Tower is linked to this legend and stands on a small island in the lake reached by a small bridge. The lake is an area of great activity with many cafes and restaurants, street vendors and people. It is possible to walk around the lake and there are some beautiful flower beds and displays. We visited Hanoi during the Vietnamese New Year and the place was heaving both during the day and at night. It may be quieter at other times. The walkway was lit up at night which gave it a very different feel. A definite must when visiting Hanoi.

Nice to walk around. Very nice lake to take a leisure stroll. There are parts (north and west side of the lake) with coffee shops so you can enjoy the view. We went there on New Year's Day so the temple in the middle was free of charge. But it was fairly crowded, likely a tradition in Vietnam. Lots of people wearing traditional cloths, especially kids. Great cultural experience.

A favourite place to walk and watch the people of Hanoi.. Our hotel was just around the corner from the lake so we took advantage of the location to walk around it several times each day during our stay. The lights on the lake were beautiful at night with the shimmering reflections and colours. But apart from its scenic qualities the lake also provided us a constant stream of entertainment from the spectacular lion dance parade in preparation for Tet to the scores of Hanoi locals going through their varied exercise routines. I loved the energetic zumba ladies spread out along a busy corner undeterred by the manic traffic rushing past as they sashayed through their moves. My favourite though, was the elderly gentleman teaching a couple of lucky ladies to Tango. He looked so suave and dapper in his suit and hat it was hard not to ask if I could join in.

You will be surprised!. This lake might look quite ordinary and even dirty on the surface (with plenty of dead fish) but we spotted a snake and a turtle in the Lake at night and found this to be quite mystical. This lake definitely deserves a visit if you are in Hanoi

Quite in the middle of chaos.. Hanoi is a bit chaotic, the Lake offers many quite and peaceful spots to chill out. I had rented a motorcycle and drove around the lake a few times, stopping for some peace and quite.
However I didn't visit any of the tourist places near it, that lake itself is nice enough.

Nice place for a walk. We took a stroll down here on our first night, and the views were nice with the lights reflecting off the buildings on the opposite side. And there is a nice tale behind the lake, with the turtle and the sword etc.Its not that amazing though, and you can tell the water is very dirty as every now and then you see dead fish floating on the surface which shows you how well looked after the lakes are in this city.
Lovely lake. Me & my boyfriend stayed right next to the lake when we went to Hanoi in December. The lake is lovely to walk around, especially at night when the bridge is lit up!

Very calming. Hanoi especially the Old Quarter but realsitically all Hanoi is frenetically busy,traffic flying around in all directions! Have faith, stroll around this beatiful lake, pausing to sit on one of the lake side benches.

Beautiful lake!. We loved the beauty and vibrancy of this area. You should try to get here when you are in Vietnam. It is a nice place in the heart of Hanoi old quarter! It's really nice to stroll around on a sunny day or sit and watch people taking photographs. We walked the perimeter of Hoan Kiem Lake several times and look forward to another visit soon.
Nice lake near Old Quarter. I went there with my husband to see the lake. It has a beautiful view with a Temple in the middle of it. Atnight the view has pretty lights.

Beautifull Lake In The Heart of Hanoi.. This Beautifull and Peaceful Lake is Surrounded By Highly Manicured Gardens. It Has A Historic Temple Located at one End, and takes about One Hour to Walk Around the Entire Lake. It is Located in the Heart of the Old Quarter of Hanoi. In the Early Evening Local Artist Show their Skills and People practise Tai Chi in the Gardens. Well worth a Visit.

A Beautiful Walk in the Midst of a Busy City. We joined the locals as they strolled around the lake during Lunar New Year's Day dressed in colorful traditional clothing. There were a some comfortable outdoor cafe's near the water's edge and the grounds had been well-maintained with beautiful floral gardens.

Small lake, nice for a walking on a sunny day. The lake is quite small and has nothing special but if, like us, you like walking it is nice to spend some time there..maybe on your way to the Old Quarter or to the French Quarter as it is between the 2.
Brighten up with flower. As we were there 1 week before Tet festival, the lake was beautified with flower beds filled with colours, particularly cherry blossom
Beautiful. Loved the beauty and vibrancy of this area. We walked the perimeter of Hoan Kiem Lake several times and look forward to another visit soon.

Flowers, flowers, flowers...totaly unexpected!. Walking around the Hoan Kiem really pays off and you can see how much care is taken about the place. Totaly unexpected where all the flower arrangements and flowerbeds all around the lake. Its actually very clean and relaxing.
The absolute must-see in Hanoi anyway. Almost no touting and other annoyances you came to love so far travelling Vietnam.

Lovley lake for walks in Hanoi. Walked around the lake in the evening, and since it's nearly Lunar New Year, it was well lit and filled with people and activities during our stroll. Visit the bridge and small temple, nice views from the bride and when lit up, makes for great photos.
On the tourist list. Worth a visit however the day we went the weather was quite foggy which spoil tour view of the lake. Worth a visit you have to pay a minimal fee to visit the temple island.
Charming. The lake is a lovely bonus in the heart of Hanoi. Visit the interesting small temple out on the lake, with a lovely legend of a turtle and a sword.
Busy but tranquill. Visited couple of times during a day and evenings. Hoan Kiem or Sword lake is place you should not miss while in Hanoi. Day or night it offers its charms

The heart of Hanoi. If you don't mind waking up early in the morning, you can come here around 6, 7 a.m. and see a lot of activities happen around this small but lovely lake. Especially for hot days in summer, some people came here since 5 a.m. to exercise before going to work.These is a small but charming souvenir store near by the red "The Huc" bridge selling a lots of authentic Vietnamese gifts with very reasonable prices. Love strolling around this lake and many other lakes in Hanoi!
It is nice !. You should try to get here when you are in Vietnam. It is a nice place in the heart of Hanoi old quarter!

Good for a stroll. A city lake always have some drawbacks. It's really nice to stroll around on a sunny day or sit and watch people taking photographs. However the number of dead fish floating in the water made me feel a bit uneasy.

Nice place for at walk. Here you can see a beautiful bridge leading to a temple, many beautiful flowers and the big lake.
It took us app. 40 minutes to walk all the way around incl. picture stops.
Jewel in Hanoi. The lake was very clean despite there were a lot of visitors going there. Love the green vibes and the breeze around the temple, it made you forget that you were still in the city.

Highlight of Hanoi. An afternoon stroll around the lake brought to a local wedding, professional models posing for their photgraphers, hipsters, couples walking hand in hand, and the Red Bridge (and more). So worth the walk to take in the Hanoi vibe.

Nothing special.... Nice place to take a stroll and escape the craziness of Hanoi traffic. At the north side of the lake there are many locals who will try and sell you things. The lake itself is very dirty and full of floating dead fish. Nothing special to see.

Beautiful, atmospheric lake in the center of Old Town Hanoi. This is a beautiful, atmospheric lake in the heart of town and a VERY welcome respite from the crazy (I mean crazy) traffic in Old Town Hanoi and all its accompanying noise. You can walk around it in about 45 minutes and also visit the Temple (small fee) at the North End. This and the much larger West Lake are great for relaxing in a city that is chock full of mopeds (and their sometimes insane owners... we nearly got run over a few times by drivers speeding the "wrong" way down one way streets).

Beautiful. This lake is a great point of reference. If I ever got a little lost walking around this lake would always steer me in the right direction. I was sitting on a park bench one day and people wanted to have a chat so they could improve their English. Its a peaceful spot too if you just want to sit and relax a bit.
Love it. Walk around the entire lake. Its really nice lots of benches to get caught up on ur journals writing or contemplating the meaning of life...oh n awesome pics even on cloudy days!

Nice place to take a casual walk. Although I wouldn't put it on the list as a "MUST SEE" thing to do, If you happen to stumble across it, the lake is a decent size to take a casual stroll around and some time out from dodging the many cars and bikes you come across in the streets. If you get up early enough to beat the tourists, very few people around means there are some good photo opportunities of the temple on the lake.
A short visit will suffice. The highlight was the number of college graduates, dressed to the nines having photos taken,supplemented by selfies of course

Good atmosphere in Late Dec (Christmas and new year). The weather was foggy that the view of the lake was not good, but the atmosphere during the Christmas and new year was quite good, countdown party nearby and many people celebrated the brand new year on 31Dec. Therefore traffic control on 31Dec -2Jan should be considered.

Great place to relax and enjoy. This is a small lake (there are many in Hanoi) in a park setting in the old part of Hanoi. An hour or two will give you time to walk around the whole lake and stop to see the temples and gardens along the way. Don't miss just watching traffic (usually not a tourist sport) in the big intersection near the KFC. There are a couple of restaurants on the upper floors on the buildings around that intersection where you can sit on the balcony and watch the combination of trucks, buses, pedicabs, motorbikes, bicycles, and pedestrians...keep right? you've got to be kidding! Just head for where you wish to go! It truly is fun to watch while you are relaxing with a cooling drink.

Best place in Hanoi. Here is city's heart, in one word. To be around during day time or night time has different tastes also. Temples, cathedrals, shopping streets are just in walk distance. Just taking a cup of delicious Vietnamese coffee and sit down near by the lake and watch around for hours. I totally adored there.
Great spot right in the old town. Very nice area right in the heart of the old town. Nice to get away from the traffic and hustle and bustle of walking the streets of the old town
One of the highlights in Ha Noi. Nice place, especially in the evening with all the lights and reflections.Oasis in this crazy, chaotic city.

Gorgeous. Austin city lake, eat your heart out!. The old quarter in Hanoi would be utterly charming without the lake, but the lake just puts it way over the top. Amazing place for a romantic stroll, great people watching. We were there during the preparations for Tet, so the gardens were especially beautiful.
A place for photograph. Take photo of the lake, the bridge towards the temple, nearby attractions, beautiful flowers at pavement, etc...Btw, it was hot and humid when we visited Hanoi in August.
excellent view!. Hoan Kiem lake in Hanoi have excellent view, all of member in my familly love that, and we spent nearly one day beside of that.

Misty cold. It's quiet compared to what i remember of the lake when i visited years ago. Perhaps it was cold and misty and locals busy preparing for their new year. It is traditional to release life for new year so you can see live fish seller waiting for buyer to release them to the lake

Scenic and Beautiful Park Setting. The lake is surrounded by beautiful parks and large, colorful flower gardens. The Turtle Tower sits on a small island while the HUC bridge leads to an ornate temple. Well worth the time to stroll around the lake and take in its peaceful nature. At the conclusion hail one of the pedicabs parked along the park perimeter and take an exciting ride through the Old Quarter.
Hoan Kiem is rivaled only by Central ParkTh. This is the center of Ha Noi. Make sure to stroll it around sun rise for the full effect of the locals exercising.

Excellent View especially at night . This place is quite good and the history is so interesting, it is worth reading it before you go. At first I was curious whose sword was returned and who go it. 😀! You will laugh if you read the history. 👍🏽

Clean lake. Had an hour or two to spare before heading off to the airport so decided to get a cup of egg coffee and stroll along the lake. It was serene and clean, with locals and travelers jogging around the perimeter which was a pleasant sight. There were guys who came up to my husband, offering shoe cleaning services at a good price. He decides to let them clean his soiled boots after his sapa trek at 40,000vnd. Midway, they came back to him, offering to smooth and level his shoe pads as it was not aligned without indicating there would be a surcharge. Eventually they returned the boots and requested him to pay 250,000vnd. Point is do exercise caution should you choose to engage their services.

Just Another Place of Interest. This lake is just another place of interest - nothing that fascinating.You can probably consider taking a walk around the lake in the evening to enjoy the scenery of this city.

Quite relaxing.... The lake is lined with wide footpath, which provides good view of the calm water. Nice landscaping with colorful flowers separating the footpath from the busy and noisy road. Big trees with leaves hanging into the lake provides a nice reflection on the water adding a kind of charming scenery. There is a temple close to the far end of the lake. There is also a tortoise temple that can be accessed from the footpath via a bridge for a fee. If there is an empty one, then we can enjoy the view form several benches placed around the lake. Nice stroll in the afternoon. During the time we were there the weather was foggy.
Great place to stroll and people watch. Walking distance from our hotel and a great place to hangout anytime of the day. They are benches to sit and food vendors if you are up for a picnic.
Our anniversary trip. "Hoan Kiem Lake" located in the heart of Hanoi,VietnamWe can go back over and over again,because we really love how people live in vietnam.
A must see on your trip to Hanoi. The lake offers nice paths, manicured gardens and lots of open space with nice views to the Tortoise Temple and Ngoc Son Temple and Red Bridge

Relaxing visit. Possible one of the bests sights in Hanoi. Stroll around the lake during the day or night and discover how the views change, although the people remain the same, friendly. If you are lucky you may spot a turtle, or be asked to assist some school children to improve their English with a brief questionnaire about their city and your home country. A great way to spend a relaxing time in a busy city. Remember to visit at night, the lights are wonderful.
Cool lake. A cool lake located in the centre of Hanoi. If you get the chance make sure you go for a walk around the lake. They have some floating fleet gardens on the banks

Ita a lake with a bridge. Fairly unimpressive. A bridge that you pay to walk across yet the pictures are better when you stand away from it. Takes 20 mins to walk around the lake and not that interesting to be honest. Better time spent walking the streets and enjoying the hanoi city buzz(which isnt that great either!)

Central Ha Noi. This is the center piece of Ha Noi with the Old Quater to the north and the French Quater to the south. You can eat Pho on the street or shop at Versace. Excellent spot for night photos.
Hoam Kiem Lake. Don't miss a walk around the lake in the night time. Lights are beautiful and sights include pho graphing of multiple newly weds.

It all happens here! . Take time to walk around the lake during the day and again at night, just fantastic and so different!the evening walk is my favourite time, we walked around there three times one night and each time there was another new thing going on! Dancing, keep fit, a concert! Young boys and girls hanging out and having fun, street food being cooked and sold, the sights and sounds were amazing! The lights around the lake are really well done. Well worth seeing. Loved it!
Tourists only. Absolutely no reason to pay anything to go in here. There are plenty of temples in the old quarter to go into that are more authentic and are free.

Beautiful Breaktaking Lake. When I first time in Hanoi, I came across this lake on my way to hotel. Right after check in, I on my google map and want to come here for a jog after many hours sitting on plane. I really like here because it is a nice place to jog. I came here in afternoon and evening several times before. The scene I see are different. There are temples and status where I will capture some of the scenery as I jog. During evening time, the lake bridge will light up beautifully and feel happy to see the daily life of hanoi people. children are playing, couples are strolling the park, old folks are chatting, groups are gathering to do workout. It is a great place to sit down and talk too, especially when it is winter time, i really enjoy the breeze, relaxing the lake view and chat. Well I feel it is good for jogger, and people who enjoy walking at park. Quite difficult to carry camera because the distance are wide. So I take my phone camera trying to capture some beautiful scene.Enjoy
Pretty lake in the old city. Raining when we were there but still beautiful. Nice to get a breath of air alongside after a visit to the old town. Interesting temple on the island over the bridge.
Happy Morning Location. Try to visit here in the early morning when many people are out dancing, exercising, practicing Tai-Chi and simply walking or relaxing.
It was ok. Much prettier at night. The island temple is like a 1.50 USD so not expensive but also nothing incredible to see. It is in the old quarter and right by the water puppets.
Walk around.... It is nice to walk aroud the lake. You can see a lot. Close to old quarter and water puppets theater.

Great escape from the motorbikes. What a great surprise. My hotel was by the lake at the edge of the Old Quarter. The lake is a great place to relax walk around the lake etcLots of flowers and there were lights over the sidewalks as they are getting ready for TET holidayIf visiting Hanoi try to get a hotel close to the lake and Old Quarter

Hoan Kiem Lake, the center of French Quarters. I spent 3 weeks just around the corner of the lake. Visited often, so alive with life from old ages to children and families. Early mornings groups ( usually seniors) doing exercise, movements, some with music, most with an instructor. Many people locals, just having fun, with friends, loved ones and family. You will never be bored. Walk around the complete lake.
cooling winds and beautiful relaxing spot. when it's really hot it's good to spend a few hours at the lakes around Hanoi. This is one of my favourites.

Relaxing peaceful Place. Pleasantly surprised a piece of paradise so relaxing and serene in the middle of a bustling city. Suggest visit it in the evenings. It's a popular place for tourists and locals.Tip : sunhat, sunscreen, water, camera

Nice to walk round during a break in the rain. We walked all the way round the lake to take in the changing scene and enjoy the views over the water. A lot of others, including locals, were doing the same thing.

Beautiful place to wander around. Lovely place to wander around, and a sense of calm in the otherwise craziness of the Old Quarter. Be warned, we tried to sit down and relax, and were approached by a few young locals. Not sure if they just wanted to practice their English or were shady and trying to distract us to steal something, but it made us a bit uncomfortable to just try and sit and relax, instead of walking around. We quickly left anyways.In the morning, it is nice to see the locals practicing their tai chi.

Lights at night are beautiful. It's a semi-quiet place that you can walk around, at night the bridge was lite up and the reflection in the water was so beautiful. At the Water Puppet show they did a little skit about the sword, so it was neat to cross the street and walk around the lake

Scenic and Relaxing escape from the Streets!. We've visited this during day and night time. What a scenic and relaxing escape from the chaos and bustle of the Old Quarter’s streets. In the middle of the lake is a small island with a small stone Pagoda that you can’t get to it (no bridge or boat to access it).During day time, not much to do. Trishaw (cycle) ride is nice!At night, it was more relaxing. After eating some street foods, We saw a lot of local artists drawing/sketching a portrait near the temple entrance. Most of them are local students. After observing all of them, we decided to get the "best" artist and portrait our wedding picture form my phone.

Better to visit at the afternoon to night. nice lake, definately one of the tourist spot, because when we went there (at the afternoon) too many people (tourist and prayers) we cant take pics or enjoy the view nicely
Very beautiful historical Lake in Hanoi. It was interesting to walk around this Lake, this point is one of the best attactions to visit in Hanoi

very interesting cultural site with a temple and locals use it fr prayers and daily requirements esp now. its very appealing if you enjoy the budhist approach and sentiments in regards to culture and idols ,very thorough all the way inside and out ,has a symbology to the region along with superstition as one would expect from the region

great place to walk at dawn or dusk. we found ourselves drawn to this lake at least four different days. early morning, dusk, and late at night all brought different experiences. Sadly, the ancient turtle in the lake passed away on Jan 20th, 2016.

A place to relax. The lake has a very interesting story, so you should learn it when you are there. We went to a water puppet show near the lake and we learnt the lake's story in a very funny way.
I recommend to see it during the night when it is (at least this is my opinion) more impressive.

Beautiful place to walk around during the day and night.. This is a beautiful lake near the Old Quarter. Definitely worth walking around during the day and night. They have nice lights at night. Find a Bo Bia bike and get a sweet treat for less than a dollar. It is a coconut, sugar treat in a corn tortilla. Awesome.
Beautiful morning, noon and night. Plenty to see. Great for morning walks to watch the city come alive. Also worth a visit as the sun goes down and at night for some beautiful photos.

Nice . It's nice to take a stroll around the lake and just soak in the atmosphere.
You can cross over the red bridge to the beautiful temple on the little island.
In the morning lots of Vietnamese people do their exercise along the shore.
Beautiful . Stunning part of the city. Definitely worth a walk around and there are some lovely cafes and restaurants overlooking the lake.
Beautiful. It was a beautiful lake. Clean and nice view. Sit in a chair while facing the lake a gave a very relax moment. Some locals are very friendly and it feels safe.
Pleasant lake in the Old Quarter. A very nice lake in the heart of the old quarter. Worth checking out at night when everything is all lit up

the hub of Hanoi. Located between the historical Old Quarter and French Quarter, Haon Kiem Lake is a cultural and civic center for locals and tourists alike. Set with willows and other trees beautifully weeping all around into the lake, frequented by locals day and night, there is a photo op at every corner. A few restaurant scattered around the paths offer a respite and hours could easily slip by relaxing and people watching.

Cute little lake though there's an entrance fee for the island. You won't miss this lake if you're staying in central Hanoi. It's a very focal part of Hanoi's inner city. Definitely worth going for a walk around the lake (at any point of day, really).We went for dinner at a nearby restaurant which was on the top floor and offered great views over the lake.
Quiet lake in center of Hanoi. Very nice ambient and walking paths along the lake shore. The entrance fee to island is around 20000vnd. The lake adds alot to city arhitecture.

Beautiful lake but without the super old turtle. Thelake is beautiful, especially at night, local people all go there and spend their time. The Ngoc son trmple is in this lake, so tou can have 2 shots. The temple has student disncount, so make sure you have you student id handy.There are plenty of good restaurants around, and there's a really good water puppet show close to the lake, so you do lots of things when you get there.

Beautiful walk. When I went with my friends, the weather was quiet nice and sunny. Not too cold or hot, which is perfect. We were able to walk around the lake a bit and see all the street food/ peddlers. There were so many foreigners.The environment was both peaceful as you look at the water, but also bubbly with many things to do around the area with shopping, cafes, and riding the bicycles. This place is known as the central part of Hanoi, so it's a must see plus many new delightful things will be found in this area~

Big lake that seems to attract young love. Visit the area twice, and saw many pre-wedding photography being done in the area. The lake gives a space for people who want to take a walk or do some running. Beautiful LED lighting at night time.

Walk Around the Lake. Take a leisurely walk around Hoan Kiem Lake to get a flavor of Hanoi. You will pass lots of attractions and restaurants on your walk around the lake as well as many local vendors selling their wares to the myriad tourists. Definitely worth a visit when in Hanoi.

A lovely place for a stroll in the centre of Hanoi. This is a lovely place for a stroll in the centre of Hanoi. The lake of the restored sword got its name after a legend: the emperor LeLoi had been given a sword by a local god to fight against the Chinese. The sword worked its magic when the Chinese were defeated. The emperor was in a boat on the lake when a turtle came towards the boat. The turtle grabbed the sword and disappeared, the emperor could find neither the turtle nor the sword. He concluded that the sword had been given to him to fight the enemy and that there was no further need for the sword as the country was free. The emperor changed the name of the lake (which was called the lake of the green water) to its present name, the lake of the restored sword. The turtle tower on a small island in the lake commemorates the event.We were told that here are rare turtles in the lake – we didn’t spot any (but we enjoyed our stroll)
Iconic but not well-maintained enough. The quality of the water in the lake was simply horrible. It should be no wonder why the Turtle died, it should rather be how it could live for that long.

Mystical little lake. You feel the history around this little lake downtown Hanoi. It looks different every day depending on the weather. We went there 3 times and met nice local people, eager to practise their English

Best viewed early morning or in the evening.. Hanoi is a wonderful place in late Autumn & early winter. Visit the Lake early morning to experience how local people enjoy exercising, socialising and being part of this very special place.Take you time when walking or even better take a seat and soak up the atmosphere.Often young Uni Students will ask to sit with you to practice their English & this is a great way to share and exchange culture. If you are there in the later part of January or early February you will be lucky to experience the Lake being even more magical with the flowers and (at night) the lights for Tet Festival. Yes it can be cold outside but this is truly the best time to experience the Lake and have the opportunity to interact with some of the local people. :-)
Vacation . Very beautiful and peaceful place . This is in the center and from there you can keep walk to other interesting places.
MANDATORY VIEW. It is in the center of Hanoi. You can´t miss it. All the ways lead to this place. Most celebrations are held there, and it is a place for walk, rest, etc

Beautiful. A bit of a relief if you're coming from the Old Quarter, the lake is quieter and much less busy.
