If you go here on a weekend locals will be exercising, out with friends, practicing music or dance and the English students will swarm you. If you have time to spare a bit of time talking to the students is well worth it - I ended up a block away playing games, singing traditional songs and trying local delicacies. The Ngoc Son pagoda is worth a visit - even more of an oasis than the side of the lake and the views and temple itself are quite beautiful. At night the lakeside is lit up and beautiful in quite a different way.

Beautiful and so many friendly people. I thoroughly enjoyed my walk around the lake. There are many beautiful trees and Vietnamese and tourist life happily mingle side by side. People smile and say hello, ask to have their photos taken, offer to take yours. There are all sorts of things happening along the shore and the cacophony that is Hanoi fades a little as you explore.

Nice little restingplace. This little oasis is situated in the middel of the Hanoi traffic horror. Go here if you need a little bit of relaxation. Read the story of the sword and turtle and don't forget to take a walk in the park around the lake, buy some ice cream and enjoy.
A nice stroll. You can stroll round the lake hunting for the turtle who supposedly grabbed the sword back. He/she is there somewhere! Be sure to visit the temple as well at the top end.

Relaxing not possible in Hanoi. This lake is not to relax, it's just a lake in the middle of the city and this city is dirty and very crowded. So if you would like to relax, please visit another part of Vietnam and skip Hanoi. If you like to relax in Hanoi, go to a good spa. This is just a lake in the middle of the city center close to the main church.
Grateful history . Did a private tour of the city and lake. The lake has a long and interesting history. Worth a visit with a local guide because you get told the history of the lake.
Quaint!. A nice place to have an afternoon walk. Lots of restaurants and shops surrounding the lake to check out as well. Worth the visit!
Love this lake. It was wonderful to sit down and eat ice-cream near the lake. I also had chances to meet and talk to nice friendly local people around this place.
Pretty lake with lotsa activities around. This beautiful lake offers quite a variety of activities in the surrounding area. Local artists do INCREDIBLE caricatures for under $10; nicely landscaped

Slimy green and smelly!. Big lake that looks amazing from a distance but slimy and scummy close up. Smells bad too. Probably one of the best bits of Hanoi though!
We saw what looked like human faeces floating in the luminous green scummy water.
We also saw a pickpocket who was wearing his finds!

Nice for a walk around, the bridge is pretty st night. I walked around the lake during daytime. Its a nice stroll but not to special. It is a good landmark in the old quarters and close to many museums. It's pretty at night when they turn their lights on.

Lovely old Chinese architecture . Great view lovely traditional buildings and a great story to go with it.
The red bridge to access it reminds me of Japan.
Must see in Hanoi.
VISIT AT DAYBREAK. Watch the locals taking daily exercise, of every kind. I have never seen so many people at 5:30 in the morning.

Beautiful scenery!. After dinner, it would be nice to take a walk along the lake. There are plenty of coffee houses and cafes located along the lake. Many locals also flocked there and there are many activities happening along the lake!

World famous lake with fresh air. I've heard a lot about Hoan Kiem lake and seen many photos, but you got to actually be here to experience it for yourself. Fresh, clean air and relaxing view is a treat in the busy alleys of the old quarter. I love the feeling of cold breeze in winter when facing the lake. There are people jogging and even an outdoor gym. Motorbike parking costs 5k-10k. Highland cafe has one of the best views of the lake. At night, the lake is a very romantic place. The pagoda and red bridge is a picture worthy place. When you are exploring, you can use this lake as your bearing when you get lost or trying to locate a place. This is a must visit, must see in Hanoi. A place you can chill and watch the world slowly go by
Beautiful at night. A nice paved walkway goes around the lake. About twenty minute stroll. The City Cafe sits at one end with a rooftop view.

Great for break from the Old Quarter. Well within walking distance of the Old Quarter, and a great respite from the nearby madness. Relatively relaxing, but be prepared to be approached by the odd group of local kids wanting to practice their English. I find it fun, and a good chance to balance it out by asking them their favourite foods to eat in Hanoi, or other local knowledge.
Beautiful lake to walk around. This lake is very beautiful both at day and night. Be sure to walk around before 11 p.m., as the hanging lights around it go off at that time.

This lake makes hanoi a special place to visit. I like to walk around hoan kiem lake at dawn to see the morning activities of the local people. It is a great spot for photography. Have taken many photos around hoan kiem lake and each time is different and still appeals to me. Night time is also great especially with the lightings around the red bridge.

Go early in the morning and see Hanoi life.. Go early in the morning and you can see how the locals take advantage. Across the street from the lake is a park where locals start with exercise, dance and badminton early in the morning. But everything stops by 7:45 am, so be sure and go early. Join a tai chi class, ballroom dance under the statue, or just participate in a stretch/exercise class. They are very welcoming, and it's lots of fun.

Great place to unwind. The lake is at the heart of the Old Hanoi. It's perfect for unwinding and chilling out after a long day of going around the city. Great for socializing as well as for solitude. There are pockets of flower garden which looked fabulous when we went in January. During the day, there are artists working on their art; some do portraits. On one side of the lake is the Ngo Son temple close by is the Water Puppet theater. There are also restaurants and shops nearby.
Nice pretty lake . We went earlier in the morning before it was totally mobbed with people. It is a nice lake with a great pagoda that you can visit located right in the middle.

Awesome place. Loved the place. Specially at night the place gets crowded but its not disturbing at all. The lake and around gets all lightened up at night which makes it a lovely sight. You can walk around the lake or just sit and watch people walk by. This is something you should not miss during your travel to Hanoi.
Calm away from the traffiv chaos. Peaceful walk around the lake to take in the view and people watch. Best to do before going to the Water Puppet Show.

Great to promenade. The lake is great to walk around located in central Hanoi. You can also sit down and people watch which is (always) great in in Vietnam especially with a fresh coconut in one hand and a cold passion fruit drink in the other.

Beautiful, Historic, and People Watching.. A great place to walk around and people watch as well as get some exercise. Vietnamese students often frequent Hoan Kiem Lake to practice their English. They're always nice and informative about the area. Talk to them if you speak English! They will appreciate it and usually offer to be a free tour guide for language exchange.
Worth a walk around.. The Hoan Kiem Lake is nice to stroll around any time of the day. It's surrounded by the old town of Hanoi.

Very pretty. We stayed at The Apricot Hotel across the road from the lake. At night it is lit up all pretty and very picturesque during the day. We had a couple of very pleasant walks around the lake - there is always something different going on. There are also very talented artists sketching if you want you portrait done. The must see water puppets are also on the lake front.
Beautiful. Loved this lake and the beauty around it. Lovely in the evenings particularly. Great spot for bridal photos.

Amazing spot to visit. I spent a few days in Hanoi and I enjoyed walking along this lake. It is worth going inside to see the Turtle, I thought it was really good. There was also a funeral going on at one point and they were scoping water out of the lake and putting it into the urn of ashes. I was invited to join in and it was a very neat thing to be a part of. Only downside is locals approach you (almost relentlessly) and want to have conversation with you so they can practice English. At times I just wanted to enjoy the view and I found it a bit annoying!
Central area of Hanoi. Walking around the lake is a pleasant experience. The gardens are lovely. This is a nice thing to do in the evening.

Nice lake in the middle of busy-ness!!. Great lake to walk around, watch people and their activities, take refuge from the hectic Hanoi.We're here during the Holidays, the lake was well-lit at night, very pretty!Public toilets are also available, and clean!

Nothing special. We visited there this morning. It is just a park for locals. If you have limited time, you do not need to go there because there is nothing special. To certain aspect, it copied chinese style but it was just at elementary level in term of construction, presentation, style, and even chinese characters. This copy was a failure.

Beautiful by day, stunning at night.... In the heart of Hanoi it's a really beautiful lake.I has a cool story behind the name, and it's a nice spot to just sit and people watch.At night time it becomes illuminated and it's quite romantic.Anyone giving bad reviews of a lake is an idiot. It's honestly beautiful.

Beautiful Lake. The lake is especially gorgeous during late December and early February thanks to the Christmas and Lunar New Year celebrations. In the evening the lake is covered with colorful lighting which makes it look like a scene in the garden of Eden. It is a small lake that you can cover by foot in 20 minutes. Although it is crowded at night times, you can still walk effortlessly through the stream of people.

Beautiful lake. This lake is especially gorgeous at night times thanks to colorful lights during December and January because of the celebration of Chrismas and the Lunar New Year ( Têt ). It is a small lake which one can walk around for 20 minutes. I wish there were more Bistros on the lake shore to relax and sip a cup of hot brew. It is pretty crowded at night times but you can still stroll effortlessly through the stream or people.
Peaceful... A great spot to walk and relax..Gives you a chance to walk and talk without being on high alert ;-)) and watch locals exercise and walk their dogs.
Heart of Hanoi!. The lake is Hanoi's heart. Just keep walking around it. Exciting sights and sounds. The shops near the lake are the best for bargain hunters.

So much to see and do.. The lake offers so much. In the early morning a walk around the lake shows people taking exercise, During the day there are always people, people meeting each other, older people sharing conversations on benches located near the water. In the evening people go for a run or a stroll to enjoy the evening air. At night, the lights reflect on the water and lighten the walking paths that surround the lake. Under the trees during summer can be a welcome respite from the heat. If you are lucky you can see the large turtle that inhabits the lake. I have seen it a number of times. You can buy an ice cream and sit on a bench to enjoy the sights people passing or the quiet reflection of trees in the water. During wedding season you can see couples having their photos taken. There is so much happening every day. Walking all of the way around takes about 40 minutes but there are so many things to see nearby that it may take a lot longer. However, it is possible to walk part of the way around and come back to finish it later. And there are lots of opportunities for lovely scenic photos of the lake.It is close to the Old Quarter where there are many hotels, restaurants and cafes and shopping for tourists. At the lake near the Water Puppets for a small fee you can take an electric bus ride of the Old Quarter. There are a couple of cafes on the lake side where you can stop for a refreshment and rest. On the lake is a temple with access by a small bridge, This too is well worth a visit and te cost is small.A walk around the lake can quickly become a favourite activity.
Best early in the morning . I jogged around here early in the morning when the place is really alive. The locals are out doing morning exercises and walks. Great experience.

SHOULD VISIT IF ONLY TO SEE THE TURTLE. This is a famous lake which legend has it was instrumental in the success of the famous general Le Loi in one of his battles.Apparently the turtle God had presented the general with a golden sword prior to his battle and it has helped win the war for the general,however after war the General ,the turtle returned to claim the sword back.The general refused but the turtle jumped out of the water and snatched the sword from him.Thus the name the name the lake of the restored sword.It's quiet picturesque with a nice little bridge joining the land to a small island where the turtle temple is .In this island a shrine and supposed shell casing of the famed turtle is on exhibit.With this legend the water puppet show came to life in one episode too.The shell is really huge much like the size of the giant leatherback turtle which is now extinct .

Nice walk around the lake. A nice 40 minute walk around this beautiful. It's right in the center of restaurants and Hotels. Very close to the Old Quarter. It's also very close to the University of Hanoi. Many beautiful foilage surrounds this lake. What I found fascinating, is that while I was sitting at one of the many park benches that surrounds this lake, I literally had close to a dozen people stop and sit next me at various times throughout the day and days that I sat there and want to talk to me in English. They were mostly University students and they all invited me to dinner on the same day, of course!! I found this setting very endearing to me. And I must say, all these students have written back to me on a fairly consistent basis. So, now that I live in Da Lat, I can go back visit them at my choosing and enjoy the lakes beauty.
Nice. It's nice to walk around and appreciate the view. Many shops and restaurants around. You can sit in a bench and watch the locals going by or practicing tai chi...

ROMANTIC. This is a very nice walking tour. Not too long actually. Enjoy the relaxing atmosphere while looking at the lake. We did half of the lake in the day time and the other half in the evening. I don't know if it always the case or if it was due to the holiday season (we were in Hanoï from December 16 through 22) but the illumination gave a very special effect to our excursion. Beautiful.

Beautiful lake in the heart of Hanoi. It all happens around the lake. Joggers, people dancing in groups, food stalls etc etc. well worth walking around and checking out the architecture, local markets and generally feeling the vibe. The bridge is a nice photo op and it is a great way to get your bearings when the crowds and chaos can be a bit overwhelming. The city transforms at night w beautiful lights everywhere - worth checking out both by day and night

Fantastic Place. This area is lovely during the day and amazing at night.The entire lake is lit up in the evening with many different colored lights and everyone including the locals.The cafe on the lakeside is buzzing with people.I'd go backin a heartbeat.

An Urban Pleasure. Just down the block from my hotel, this urban lake on one side touches the Old Quarter, and the opposite side, the section of the city with the Opera, Hilton Hotel, etc. the lake attracts people from all walks and all strata.My concierge suggested that if I wake up early and visit the lake,I will see literally thousands of people walking, jogging, doing calisthenics, tai chi, etc. I did it and will do it again tomorrow morning.Go out at 06:00, and walk around the lake in a clockwise direction. Everybody else walks/jogs counterclockwise, so you will wind up passing everyone. You can circumnavigate the lake at a moderate pace in less than 40 minutes.
Nice Walk. A pleasant and reasonably peacefull place to walk aroundA visit across the bridge to the temple should not be missed.
Nice Urban Lake. One will end up here since this is the center of Hanoi. It's an urban lake and is beautiful but not extraordinary compared to other urban lakes.

First World Fun. This is an energetic hub of Hanoi life. So much to do, so much to see! There were young and old couples, singles, and families all enjoying the evenings around the well-lighted lake. Beautiful views of Hanoi night life! (The ice cream is exceptional!)

Absolute gem. What a beautiful gem in the heart of buddy exciting old quarter. The lake is also the centre of the old quarter lifestyle where hi can see people doing morning exercise, walk, hang out, chill etc...

Relaxing Walk. In Hanoi it is difficult to move anywhere easily so being able to walk around this lake, which is located in the middle of the busy city, is a joy. There are designated walking paths, opportunities to purchase a snack or drink and plenty of interesting things to see such as portraits being painted or wood carvings for example. We were there when it was warm so the breeze off the lake was also refreshing.

Stroll and see a part of the public life of the Hanoi locals. It is a joy to just laze around or "stand-by" at this lake. From early morning to night, if you just hang around on this lake area you will see slices of life from the Hanoi citizens. On early mornings, you will get to see many of the people doing their own exercises - whether solo or in groups, whether some vigorous martial-arts looking moves or energetic dancing from women.During the day, since the lake is surrounded by all sides with buildings, if you are on the side of the Old Quarter, then it never ceases to be busy as many tourists and local people pass by in order to shop or maybe just even enjoy a cup of coffee along the numerous cafes dotting its side. If you are in the area for a water puppet show, by the time you come out of the theater, you will still see people going about their business - whether vendors hawking their wares, people just enjoying the breeze or using the lake as a jump off point to the many points of interests within walking distance from the shore.There's also the Turtle Tower in the center of the lake. You can't get to it, but if you are a typical tourist, its always a good background for your souvenir photo.Another structure on the lake is the Temple of the Jade Mountain located on Jade Island - it is near the northern shore of the lake and is connected to it by a red, wooden bridge which is another place to stop and pose for pictures.Whether its to enjoy nature, people watch or just be a typical tourist of Hanoi, visit one of the most popular lakes in this city.
Nice lake. Nice to have a short walk. Tried to catch sunrise, but it was too cloudy. Lot of t'ai chi in the morning

A must visit place in Hanoi. People said that Hoan Kiem lake is heart of Hanoi - since it located in Hanoi center, near old quater square. But the lake is called like that due to not only physically but also symbolically. For thousand years, the lake is still pride of Hanoians. She is the memory of all Hanoians who living far away from their native home, she is the symbol in many beautiful songs of Hanoi....Not many capical in the world that having so many lakes as Hanoi, but the most special one is always Hoan Kiem lake. If you have long vacation, take time to study and observe, you will find out more special abt this Lake.For the people who really want to witness Hanoi’s life, just take a jogging around the Lake, or sit down on one of the stone bench, enjoy the view from early morning till sun set, you will understand and more love the place.

Nice lake to stroll around. Walked all around the lake twice , very nice atmosphere as there is a lot of green and the lake is quite big which is nice as you feel for a minute that you escape from the city!
I was surprised how peacefully this was.. This is worth a visitI was surprised how peacefully this was being minutes from the hustle and bustle of the old city.
Not beautiful but fascinating 'must see'. Essential. Central starting point for exploring Hanoi. Great people watching. In the middle of everything.
Nice walk Day and Night. Nice gardens around lake and good paths.Usual hassles with locals trying to sell items. Amazing artists who can draw your portrait in 15 minutes. Amazing lighting at night

Talk a stroll around the lake at night. This lake is surrounded by lights, lights, and more lights of all colors and shapes. If you make your way to the North side of it, find your way to the top floor of one of the restaurants for a terrific view of the whole lake. It's great for people watching and relaxing.
beautiful lake. this lake offered an incredible walk with amazing views of an evening, the bridge was great to see at night time as well

Quiet lake at the centre of Hanoi. Though historically important for Hanoi, this seems a sleepy lake for the most part.
There are some cool trees growing sideways into the water in parts, and the temple is great.

Step Away from the Hustle & Bustle of Hanoi. A stroll around Hoan Kiem Lake feels worlds away from the endless cacophony of human and motor traffic of Hanoi, just steps away from it. On a drizzly winter day, it provided a much needed respite—calm waters, wide open spaces, relaxed locals and amazing trees with overflowing canopies stooped over the water. Strolling around the lake (took 30 minutes at most with multiple photo stops), I felt at ease and immediately slowed down my pace and breathing.It’s said that there are three hundred-year old plus turtles that live in the lake, and those who catch a glimpse will have good luck, while couples that glance upon one will be in love forever. The tower in the middle of the lake is (unsurprisingly) called Turtle Tower.If you get a chance, stop by the ice cream shop (not a sit down place, just a permanent stall) and get a kem chanh popsicle—the local favorite. This mint and lemon treat with a creamy center is a sweet treat even on a chilly day.

A nice walk. We went there before New Year and had a nice walk around the lake in the evening. It was nice with some illuminations. Many local and foreign couples seemed to have a date there. Some people were dancing, other singing... Nice atmosphere.Be a little careful anyway as a guy came whispering to ask us if we wanted to buy some drugs?! We just pretended we did not hear.

A lovely walk in Hanoi. We stayed on the lake and walked around it every day to get to old town. Lovely temple and Turtle Tower on the lake, worth visiting during the day and at night as they are two very different experiences. Great photo opportunity
Super View!. Very nice to take pictures, to enter its 30.000 VDN. Inside its like a temple but more Chinese influences. Go in the morning,not a lot of tourists, better to do photos.

Beautiful. The Lake was amazing to stroll around - We were there during the new year and it very well lit and decorated.The place was very lively and had a lot of tourist places around like Ngoc Son temple, Water puppet theatre, French Quarter and Old Quarter.There were open air live music shows on the 31/12 eve.Enjoyed it!

Great scenic spot!. One should never miss walking around Hoan Kiem when in Hanoi. you can see old folks doing tai chi & qi gong in the morning and around sunset. the willow and bending trees make for a good background

Well worth the visit. As I arrived in Hanoi near dark, this was one of the places still open for a quick visit and it was well worth it. Still many tourists to keep the place busy but not to many to be intrusive. Great view of the lake at dusk, blocking out the noisy streets.
Center of Hanoi. We're it all happens. You have to walk round it, at least once. This is their meeting point and everything happens here. A must

An oasis of calm in the Old Quarter.. We stayed close to this lake and it makes a lovely stroll anytime of the day. Sunset and sunrise are particularly rewarding as the locals use the perimeter as a social gathering place and an exercise area. It also became apparent that they love to take photos of their loved-ones and girlfriends using the lake as a backdrop. At the northern end of the lake the Avalon restaurant has a rooftop dining area overlooking the lake. It is particularly beautiful at sunset when the lights come on around the lake.

Morning, evening, afternoon--a walk that was never dull. We saw all sorts of wonderful things--women dancing, students getting graduation pictures taken, wedding parties, and just life. There are ice cream stands, and it is jut a pleasant, kid friendly-length meander.
Peacefull place !. If you are bored with the old quarter noisy place, take a short walk to the lake to fi d a peacefull place, more quiet with a nice point of view.

Makes for a nice stroll in the evening. Best to be seen in the evening/ night, some of the dirt and rubbish is not so visible. The temple is nicely lighted and you can take some nice photos. It is much visited by the locals, which I feel it gives it more authenticity than just a tourist spot. Fauna- exotic trees, fish, local rats, and sweetly singing birds. Close by is a cafe, if going to the highest floor, it's really good for photos as well as watching a crazy Vietnamese intersection.

Visited morning and evening. We walked around the lake a couple of times during our visit, there was always great people watching. In the morning lots of locals exercising, playing badminton or even ballroom dancing on the sidewalk. In the evening we saw couples walking together, games being played and families out walking. Nice area for a stroll.

The gem. It's great to find a lake in the very centre of a busy city like Hanoi. But as soon as you walk over the red timber bridge to the temple, the hustling bustling life outside seems to have melted away and give way to a very peaceful hideaway
very mixed bag colonial & local sights. Highly enjoyed walking around the lake early in the mornings & watching the locals doing Ti Chi. May is very hot & no breeze so air pollution is high.

Peaceful centre of a busy city. This lake is a great place to wander around and see a variety of city life. its a place where the residents come to relax, to eat and to play various board games. The surrounds are well laid out with gardens and flower beds and the lake is surrounded by many trees givning a great shady refuge from the sun. Of course there are many tourist attractions both within the lake as well as just on the perimeter so its both a must see place in itself as well as being a handy walk to several sights. Cold dinks and a few cafe towards the northern end are availiable. the place it littered with pedal-lo's who offer to take you around which is an option if you can't walk so far, but otherwise its a great place to stroll.
Nice View. there is a really nice view from the red bridge, there are lots of birds and fishes all around the lake
culture but dirty. our staff recommend us to visit the Hoan kiem lake on during time visit in Hanoi. But the water on.. very dirty. I think that Vietnamese people need to clean it for tourism.
Not worth visiting. Just a simple lake with many big trees surrounding it. Not worth a special trip down. There's a cafe nearby that sells nice coffee

beautiful and fullfilling. enjoy walking around the entire lake watching all the people from weddings to families enjoying, peaceful and allows you to sit for hours and just enjoy and watch the amazing Vietamese culture.

Frenzy and calm side by sude. You are seconds from the frenzied streets yet I found the lake a calm place where you could escape and stroll. It was my favourite escape when I wanted escape in Hanoi. There is a posher end with street cafes and a gentrified department store serving the very rich and powerful officials. The old town end is more trashy and lively. Both are interesting. The lake itself is quite beautiful. Definitely worth a lap.
Early morning walk around Lake and Area "must be early morning Best. Vietnam market early morning around lake area in streets off lake , when walking or Ti Chi early plenty of people about.

Lake by day or night. The lake is in the old quarter area and is just beautiful. Make sure you see it by night as well as day. The temple is worth a visit. cross the red bridge and visit the Buddhist temple. There is a very peaceful feeling on the grounds. Nice escape from the nearby hustle and bustle.

Walk around early morning. A nice walk around (about 3km) if you like walking. Many great Cafes on the shore. Be sure to visit early 5-6am to see or join in with the locals doing their morning exercises.

A bit boring . Went during the day , foggy which made it harder to see. Nice to look at/walk around but that's it. Temple that you can walk across to which you need to pay a small fee to see 30 000 vnd

Easy to access little temple. right there in central Hanoi so really you cant miss it and you may as well pay to go over the bridge to see this temple. It was very quaint and lots of bonsai trees with little china figurines of buddhas and farmers and water buffalo sat amongst the roots. Quite sweet.
Great place to walk. Great place to walk around in Hanoi, whether during the morning or when it's lit up at night. Great photographic opportunities.
Oasis in the middle of the city. It adds the uniqueness of the city. Good place for taking picture in the evening. Good starting place to explore Old Quarter...
Nice and relaxing. A place not to be missed in Hanoi. Cool weather during December. You can have a nice walk around the lake.

Great Spot Day or Night. We love this lake and have visited it in one way or another, daily. Mornings you can find locals walking, exercising and playing badminton. The ballroom dancers were wonderful and encouraged us to join in. At night the lake and surrounding streets are beautifully lit and perfect for a romantic stroll.

Nice and peacefule lake. Very nice and peaceful lake in the busy Hanoi City. Especially night time, the red light on the bridge and the spot light shining on the old trees look so romantic and beautiful. Stay somewhere in the old quarters and walk to lake is advised.
Take a walk around the lake around sunset .... This lake is close to the Water puppet theater. I had some free time and took a walk around the lake. It takes about 30 minutes.
First rate people watching. This is a lovely spot in the city, and you can't beat the people watching. On Christmas Eve, the park was packed with revelers and Santas! It was really fun.

Central Park of Ha Noi. This is a large park and lake complex in central Ha Noi close to the Hotel Metropole and the Ha Noi Opera House. It is a small island in the center of the lake that houses an old temple. There is a fable about this lake. This lake seems to be a gathering spot for locals, not a tourist stop. Much like Central Park in Manhattan or Hyde Park on London. Great for outdoor strolling and people watching.Went in March, 2013.

Pretty. With better weather ..it's fun to sit on bench and watch the world go by..pose on the Chinese red bridge ..or was it Japanese ? Don't recall.. watch the stage come alive as we did ...we came on new year's so got to see some major action..big tourists and street shows. .Tons of light and music and people..aah the people.It reminds of me my homeland india..the tons of people ..such a comforting feeling .Puppet theatre is nearby and is the basepoint for many tours specially the green line tours by electric car which was rather crappy btw..they promise you something else and deliver altogether something else ..don't u be fooled by them ..Food all around is great .

Relaxing. I came here and sat on one of the benches and people watched. Cute couples, tourists, young locals - all just enjoying a casual walk around the lake.If you're lucky you might see the 800yr old Mr. Tortoise poke his head up.Locals have claimed that he only comes up during special occasions. Perhaps I was special enough because I certainly did not see him!

Stunning and peaceful. A walk around this lake is a must especially around sunset when numerous brides dressed in gorgeous outfits arrive to have their formal photographs taken. Also stunning at night with the endless reflections of the many coloured lights

Lake by night. Whilst having dinner; in the building next to Aldi, we had a magnificent view of the lake! It's a must see if you're in the old town of Hanoi! There was a makeshift gym; great place for people watching!

Wonderful Spot for a Morning Walk!. Our train got into to Hanoi very early (5 am) after a cup of coffee we were ready for a walk. By 7 am this park was beautifully lit by the morning sun. Better yet it was full of locals walking, playing badminton, exercising and even ballroom dancing! Everyone was very friendly and encouraged us to join in!

Great place to mingle with locals. This is an attraction for both locals and tourists. Great place to people watch as lots of locals hang out here, taking photos and relaxing. The walking path around the lake is also lit up at night.
Great . Especially in the night it looked amazing. On our side it was crowded by young people and it looked like festival.

Beautiful at night!. Walked around the lake at night with my 12- and 10-year-olds. We all were fascinated with the hustle and bustle of the sidewalks surrounding the lake, as well as all of the people there. Decorated so nicely for the New Year with tons of lights.The bridge near the temple was illuminated in red at night. The temple can be visited for a very nominal charge, and children are absolutely free, so why not?! So glad we took the time to see it!

Nothing to carve for . It is central attraction of Hanoi. It boast the all kind of restaurants, Hotels, puns around lake. But lame itself is nothing to carve for. It was nicely lit up during night. It is overcrowded and good to take few pictures.
Temple and lake. This is an iconic site - but is a little of a let down. It was very crowded when i went and it is notorious to pick pockets. It is however a very good photograph oppertunity.

Good respite from hanoi's pace. The lake is nice, the pagoda is worth visiting (in particualr the preserved 250 kg turtle!) but the main attraction is that for a short period of time you dont have to have eyes in the back of your head looking out for manic scooter drivers.

Relaxing and interesting . Taking a stroll around the lake is a great way to get a feel for the energy of Hanoi - calm yet dynamic! My husband took a run around the lake at 6am and was amazed by all of the public exercise classes taking place and the many individuals stretching and doing Tai Chi. Saturday afternoon we sat down on one of the benches surrounding the lake and were soon approached by friendly, local students eager to practice their English (apparently a common occurrence!). Our discussion with the students was fascinating and a great way to get some insight into local life.

Nice walk around the lake. It was a nice break from the busy streets to walk around the lake and visit the temple. At night, at least when we where there, they had nice lights around the walk path of the lake

Magical place!. As I mentioned in some other reviews the air quality of Hanoi is still a problem due to the excessive motorcycles, what a shame since the landscape is really smoggy due to this.I think that the magic of the lake lies within not only its picturesque quality, but also the legend behind. It's believed that during the 15th century emperor Le visited this lake and received a sword from a gigantic turtle, with which the emperor fought off the Ming dynasty invaders to retain the independence of Vietnam. The sword was then returned to the turtle by the emperor upon a second visit for a full circle ending. Hence the name of the lake literally means "restored sword lake". The turtle is sacred and was regarded by zoologists as a cryptid.At a surprising turn of the story, the animal is real and during the mid century it was spotted and unfortunately killed by a local fisherman. It's corpse has since been preserved and displayed at the Temple of the Jade Mountain at the lake opened for the public. There is another turtle and has since been spotted and conserved by the local government and scientists. The turtle belongs to a soft shell turtle family called the Yangtze Softshell Turtle, a highly endangered animal with only 4 live specimens in the world including this one in the lake.If you are lucky you could spot this legendary turtle during your visit (I was not), but be a responsible tourist and do not throw garbage to further pollute the already fragile environment of the lake.Also pay a visit to the Thang Long water puppet theatre to enjoy the traditional Vietnamese performance, in which a version of the lake's legend is told.Such a magical story at the heart of a busy city, I truly hope this could be preserved during the process of hyper urbanization and industrialization. Peace out.

Cost free and pretty . Nice place for a stroll, different times of the day bring out different types.A safe "go to" place if your wanting to exercise with a walk or jog. A visit to the temple on the lake and a read up on the history of both necessary to make it come alive.

Slowly Life of Hanoi. We visited the lake in the early afternoon on our first day in Hanoi, That was a wonderful lake with quiet moment during our walking pass. The life in early afternoon was slowly & gently, very different with the night when the traffic jam was crashed the peaceful of Hanoi.
Lovely. Lovely, peaceful place. Gorgeous temple on one side. Recommend just strolling around the lake with a nice cup of Vietnamese coffee.

A place full of energy for your soul. I came here 2 times while I was visiting Hanoi. Both times I came very early in the morning and I run around the lake. The atmosphere is great and lots of locals excersize there in very traditional way. They also serve free the or cofee to people that exercize. The atmosphere is magic and this is also a good place where to relax

A beautiful spot in busy Hanoi. A wander around the lake is a must-do activity for any visitor to Hanoi. If you can ignore the honking horns, it feels quite serene. The lake is pretty, with a couple of interesting structures and it's worth going over the bridge to Ngoc Son Temple. Plenty of place to stop for coffee or a bite to eat and the North end of the lake links to the fantastic old quarter.

This area is the locals personality and lifestyle in a nutshell. Taking a walk around the lake it really reminds me of Muscle Beach area in Venice Beach Los Angeles, and Central Park fused together but the Vietnamese version. There are groups of old people, middle aged, young people all doing tai chi, lifting weights, jogging, and badminton. It's where the people that live in downtown congregate and socialize. It's a nice walk around the lake which is in a highly central location of downtown Hanoi.

Good For Strolling Around. There's nothing much to do around here , but since it is in the City - it is a busy location with lots of motorbikes and vendors around. It is also surrounded by a lot of cafes and restaurants. It is very near the night market. It's nice to stroll here in the evening and take photo of all the travellers and locals visiting the ngoc son temple and the red bridge

People watching. At night the lake is beautiful with fantastic lighting all around. It is peak season so very busy. Keep an eye out for all the newly weds getting their photos taken all dressed up in their beautiful gowns.Students approached and asked to practice their English with us. We accepted and learned a bit more about Hanoi as a result. In the afternoon there is even a Hanoi version of golds gym with local muscle dudes lifting old school weights by the lakeside. We went for a run around the lake in the morning, it was less busy, good to get a bit of exercise after NYE celebrations 2 laps = 3.4km
beautiful lake. i visited this lake morning and the afternoon. felt so peaceful in the morning, and turned to romantic feeling in the afternoon. both are beautiful.

The bridge is the highlight. It's close to downtown and old town, so right in the middle of everything.
Go in the early evening or at night to see it all lite up, lots of wedding pics taken here so great opportunity to see brides in traditional dress

Beautiful lake and surrounds. This area of Hanoi is well worth a visit, in fact two. One in the daylight and one at night to enjoy the illuminations. A very relaxing place to walk, watch the people of Hanoi relax and conduct their lives. A walk in this area gives you access to the Old Town, various temples and much of the history of Hanoi.

Great entertainment. We found ourselves early on a Sunday morning visiting the parkclose to our hotel. There was so much activity going on at 7:00am.There were tai chi groups of old women, ballroom dancers, hip hop dancers and other forms of exercising groups. Their pet dogs added to the entertainment. It was great fun to observe without language being involved.

Hoan Kiem Lake. By days, many tourist visited the place. The place is a Temple on the Lake accessable by a wooden Bridge and old an old tortotise living in the lake. There is an entrance to be paid if you want to visit the temple. Occassionally you will meet couples taking their wedding photos there.Crossing the road is a problem with so many motorcycle but no traffic crossing.
Peaceful place in busy coty. The lake in fantastic & is so peaceful. Such a nice place to walk around to chill out :) the temple on the lake gives you a lovely view too.

Beautiful but quite blend after awhile. Good for people watching though. Went today on New Years Day so there's a lot of people. Nice for families or couples, but after awhile it gets pretty blend, since there isn't much to see other than some trees and lakes. Good for people watching though, u see lots of vietnamese families, kids, couples and youths. Some have interesting street style. There are some caricature artists close to the bridge and temple, interesting to see them draw real time. I didn't go into the temple as there's an entrance fee..

Great lake in the middle of the town. I spend lunch times going to the lake to get a break from work - lovely walkway around it. Not too big, always something to look at and a few nice places to sit and have a coffee.

Quiet oasis. Did a lovely wander around here. Great for a 'look - see' of different areas of life here. I saw some delightful wedding scenes as it is common for the bride and groom to come here to get the photographs taken. various kinds of people from small groups of 'oldies' sitting and chatting to groups of teenagers of their cell phones and a pre-school outing. Children are very friendly and will should out 'hello' and 'bye' as you walk past. Good English practice. There are a number of little outdoor cafes where you can get good Vietnamese coffee, or tea - wither hot or cold.

Great for an evening walk. It just so happened to be the night before New Years Eve, so this spot was bustling with activity. It is obvious that the community flocks to this spot as a gathering place and a place to stroll.Beautiful evening walk.

Great Place to Observe Hanoi. Spend a few hours walking along the shores of the lake and you'll get a good flavor for life in Hanoi. At dusk you'll see numerous newly weds having their pictures taken on the shore of the lake. It is also a good escape from the hustle and bustle of Old Hanoi which is very close by.
Nice little lake. Good for a 30 minute walk around. There is a temple in the middle that can be visited for 30,000 dong.
Take a stroll. Take a stroll around the lake. enjoy a drink or icecream. Watch the people. It is nice to leave the busy streets for a quieter break before hitting them again.
beatiful lake. we walked around here early morning and at night. it was beautiful and unique both times. definitely worth a visit.

Lovely at night. Visited here just before New Years, was set up with lights and also had entertainment, making it a great place to hang out. Learn about the legend of the sword before you go so you know what all the talk is about!

Great place to run in the city. Get there by six AM and everyone will be walking or exercising to music. Make sure to run around the outer sidewalks as the paths in the park are full of jazzersizers. Walks in the evening are also nice as the temple and bridge are lit up.

Worth A Visit. The lake is worth a visit, as there is many things to see & do. Very close to bars, shopping, restaurants & other attractions. You can hire a golf buggy style cart & driver for 120K VND that takes up to 6 people. You have a choice of two different routes around & through the old quarter for either 35 or 60 minutes. We also did our own early morning yoga session next to the lake - mind blowing!

Lovely park . The lake is not very big. It's a nice stroll around it. A lot of activities around the lake. It was quaint and there was a park gym made from metal instead of the usual plastic kinds. Good for a stroll after dinner as it lights up beautifully.

Okay, not much to see. This really is just a lake. It's more relaxing to walk around at night, where they have nice lights set up on the streets and there are lots of restaurants and bars to walk around. Otherwise, it is just a lake....

Lovely lake in the center of Hanoi. Beautiful lake with exotic romantic atmosphere. The two islands have remarkable monuments, particularly the Den Ngoc Son temple is worth a visit. Have a walk around it.

Nice at night. Worth a walk.. A bit more calm than the more cramped old quarter and a good spot to start exploring hanoi from. Would definitely recommend a walk at night and a visit to the temple at tgenorth end of the lake. Not sure if tempke is open at night as we went in the day but it is lit up at night and makes a great photo. Lake area is free to walk around but public toilets cost 2-3k to use but are clean. Temple cost us 30k vnd each to enter. Early morning and at 6-7pm locals run and do fitness around the last lake.

Legend comes to life. You can't stay long in Hanoi without hearing of the legend of the restored sword and the turtle. Although the lake is just...a lake and therefore nothing spectacular it is nice to see the setting of the legend. The lake is right next to the watterpuppet theatre if you are planning on going there you can do them both at the same time. Not worth coming a long distance especially for but if you're in the area is not to be missed.
Hoan Kiem Lake!. When walking around the Old Quarter, you get to see this lake in the area, and it's nice to walk and circle the perimeter of it since it's a big area..
Everyone visits the lake. Stroll around the lake. Finish up at the bridge and wander across it for the photo. Entry to the temple has an admission fee.

Sword lake. The Sword Lake so called because of a folklore surrounding it is located in the old quarter and withing walking distance to main shopping district of Hanoi. the bridge on the lake looks stunningly beautiful after sunset when it brilliantly lit in red colour. the pathway around the lake offers a good walking track where you see both the locals as well as the tourists enjoying themselves.
Active yet serene and peaceful. Good place to take a stroll or simply to sit by the lake, enjoy a time of reflections of read a book.

A lonely temple in the middle of the lake. It was a raining morning when I visited the lake on 24th September 2015. It's the temple that stand in the middle of the lake that caught my attention. I was told no one is allow to goes near the temple. Night time is lighted up. Whether day or night , it still look sad and lonely.

Beautiful and romantic place for picture taking. Weather was please during winter.. The lake is walking distance from the Old Quarters. We have visited the lake everyday during our stay in Hanoi. Weather was pleasant during winter. We enjoyed the view both during the day and night while sipping a cup of warm takeaway coffee. The lake is a popular venue for pre-wedding photoshoots. We have seen 4 wedding couples in one afternoon itself
Peaceful and beautiful. It won't take you long to see it but at some point during your stay you will walk by it.Very beautiful at night and worth seeing.
Beautiful City Scape/park. Really special on a nice evening, vibrant, scenic , energetic area of old Han oi. A treat, hire a cyclo circle the lake then walk a least part of it!

Fascinating Views. There is a lot of photo ops for this place. You can just sit there and be with moment. Or observe how people move. There were quite some friendly locals around esp. the younger generations.
pleasant lake area. this lake was close to our hotel and provided an easy walk around this sizable area. a couple of cafes around

Lake with A temple. It took me just a few minutes to visit the temple which located in the center of the pond.
The temple likes most of the Chinese temples, but I think it is still worth for a visit.
It is recommended to eat or drink by the lake. There're lots of restaurants around the lake.

Must do at night. The lake is beautiful during the day too, but at night with the lights is magical. We were able to do a nice long, slow walk around the lake after dinner. The lights are great and you have many families out walking and enjoying the fresh air.

Pretty lake in middle of town. Interesting story behind it with a lovely bridge and pagoda on it which makes for great photos. Very pretty setting which is peaceful break from the madness of the streets.

Love this. There is so much happening all around Hoan Kiem Lake, that no matter which time of day you visit you will still have fun.Just walking about is great. Also lots of shops, restaurants around. And the Water Puppet show theatre is located here.We loved our long walk all the way from hanoi Opera House, past the Metropole to Hoan Kiem.....the road is wider than else where in town and feels like one is in big open spaces....such a relief!!
Great place. The cultural heart of Hanoi was a great place to be around the evening with cool breeze coming of the lake and plenty of places to stop and watch life go by.
Nice to see. We walked along the lake yesterday and enjoyed most the nice lights in the evening. Very crowded place in the morning, caused by many people doing traditional Tai-Chi

Hanoi's Central Park. A calmly rippling lake, a canopy of green trees and manicured plantings make this a popular scene for locals as well as visitors. Weekends are especially fun with festive lighting. Many a bride gets her picture taken with the turtle monument in the background. Wide pavement and coffee cafes, what is not to like. Don't miss going into the temple for a great view from the north end.
Nice afternoon visit. Again, we did a self walk around the major parts of central Hanoi & was a nice end to busy awlking day.

Beautiful trees. Nice lake, nice bridge and beautiful old trees. The trees give nice shade from the sunshine in the summer. It is great just to stroll along the lakeside and watch people doing their thing. We were lucky to see some newly weds getting their marital photos taken. Also, we bought some fantastic postcards with pop-up 3d sceneries.

Not that much to see. It is a mid sized lake, perhaps small to some, located in the middle of their shopping area. Nothing really much to see, unless you want to see a lot of people just walking around from one end to the other. There is a temple in the middle of the lake but we did not visit as it was closed at night.

Average temple. Aberage temple whose selling point is being on a tiny island reached by crossing the red bridge over the lakeFor a tourist attraction, it would do well to clean up and beautify the buildings and land that are in a shabby state of disrepair and dust.The highlight of this place? The temple cat who wanders nonchalently through the temple offerings and artefacts with complete disregard for the tourists and chaos. Hope it is fed well by the temple managers but I doubt it.The shop has some products that are slightly different from the street merchants but not so much that you want to blow all your money there. Like all attractions here, they need to smarten up their tourist merchandise and differentiate from the street products, particularly as there are many discerning international travellers visiting from sophisticated markets.Worth going? If you have half an hour or so to spare, then yes. But expectations of National Trust standards, then no.

Beautiful urban centrepoint. Not many cities can boast a lake as their centrepoint, and even less can boast one as beautiful as this. Hoan Kiem is something that enchants you whether it's morning, with locals doing tai chi, day, with food and tourists abounding, or night, where it is presumably a romantic touchstone for locals and tourists alike. Don't miss it, even for just a walk-by.

Great place to walk and if adventurous, do Zumba in the early morning. I stayed near the lake for a week and now work next to it. It is a great place to walk and see the life. Some good food vendors just off the main roads. If you want to do Zumba,be out at the lake by 0530-0545 near the Opera House end (2 blocks from Opera House (opposite end from temple) and you can join the ladies. If is free if you just show up for 1-2 days, after that, slip the leader a few dong.
Dont expect it as a place of interest . At night (esp xmas eve) it is romantic and looks great. But when you at the day time.. oah.. just a dirty drainage.
Chill. This is a pretty large lake and makes a nice walk. The temple is beautiful to see in the night. Old quarter on one end and a fabulous joint for a coffee en route
Hanoi. Pretty walk around lake, nothing special but it kills an hour, and gets you away from the manic traffic

Beautiful lake. We had time visiting this unique lake and Noc Son temple in the middle of it. The temple is very well designed with many history stories. There is also a giant turtle in the room next to the main temple and that was really huge. From the temple we could have a nice view of the city.

Peace and quiet amidst the caos of central Hanoi. It appears to be only green space in the city centre, popular with joggers, families taking photos amidst its flower beds, street sellers and anyone looking for a bit of quiet contemplation. The water is dark green and there is a bit of floating rubbish around but apparently turtles live here. Particularly nice is the Ngoc Son Temple at the north end - see separate review.
A must visit by day and by night. Lovely monument in the heart of Hanoi, wonderful to view from the 'red bridge' (The Huc Bridge). Walk the Hoàn Kiếm Lake to view from all angels.

Chill in the heart of Hanoi. There is not that much to see at the lake itself, but this body of water is located in the heart of bustling Hanoi surrounded by great restaurants and shops. Legend says there is a giant turtle that lives in the lake, so make sure to look for it when you visit!

Pretty lake. You can walk around the lake in about 20 minutes. A lot of people around, a lot of street vendors trying to sell you trinkets. A small island where you have to pay a little bit to see a pagoda (not sure it is worth it)

Scenic. Take a stroll from the Old Quarter to the Hoan Kiem lake. Learn about why it was called the lake of the returned sword, and try to look for the legendary turtle living in the lake. A good place for morning jog. Peaceful and quiet at certain time of the day.

A must see feature of central Hanoi. Beautiful lake in central Hanoi near the old french quarter. In the centre is the turtle pagoda with the famous bridge.
Also a good place for a jog because you certainly can't run on the streets here!

Average. There's nothing much. A good place for some photoshoot at the red bridge. The lake is close to the Old Quarter, if you are staying around the area, a quick visit is suggested but don't spend too much time or has so much expectation. There's really nothing much.There'll be a booth selling the ticket. You don't have to pay for the ticket to get ON the bridge but the ticket is for the wntrance on the other side of the bridge. I did pay for that but there's nothing much on that side so a friendly suggest would be don't bother to buy it.
A pleasant place to wander. The lake isn't spectacular. It's pretty murky waters may well hold ancient secrets but isn't pretty. It is however good for a walk amidst the general madness of Hanoi

This is the center of Hanoi. This place is wonderful to walk around at night. It gets all lit up and its a great place to people-watch and simply enjoy an evening stroll or participate in an open-air ballroom dancing class. Great experience for tourists!

Beautiful lake!. Beautiful, gem of the city, nice temple to visit in day, must walk around it at night with lights above the path and balloon vendors...all the locals constantly walking around the lake so awesome even when its hot and humid... check out the restaurant on the lakeside. Water puppet theater near the lake, it's a must-go to see the show.

Tranquil, good for a leisurely stroll. Hoan Kiem Lake was located 5 mins' walk away from my hotel (HM Boutique Hotel). My family and I had a nice, leisurely stroll around the lake on our first night in Hanoi, after dinner. It took us about 40 minutes to circle the whole lake, though we were walking quite slowly and stopped to take photos. The lake was nicely lit up with Christmas lights, and was a good spot to take photos. You will be able to see attractions like the small Bo Tien Temple, Turtle Tower and the Huc Bridge, though I wouldn't say they were particularly breathtaking. Strolling around the lake is a good way to catch the array of activities that the locals engage in. We saw many groups exercising, dancing and working out when we were at the lake. Hoan Kiem Lake is located in close proximity to the Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre, so you can enjoy your stroll along the lake after or before you catch the water puppet display.

Hoan Kiem Lake. This is a great place just to sit with your partner and look across the water. Also a good lake to walk around (25 minutes if you take it slowly). Good to walk around in the evening, or early in the morning. Then branch off at a tangent to different attractions - Water Puppet theatre, Trang Tien St with interesting bookshops, old quarter.Highly recommended for couples

Centre of all Hanoi action. Most of the hotels, restaurants, shops are all located around the lake. The lake with a central tower is beautiful in the evenings, after the light are switched on. The coffee shops beside the lake are a good option to sit and enjoy the beauty of the lake

Hanoi starts here. A large body of water in the middle of Hanoi, Hoan Kiem Lake seems to be a centrepiece of life in the city. People gathered day and night to meet, eat and play badminton on the footpath. The traffic here is the same as anywhere in Hanoi – frenetic. This was our first real experience crossing the road, and even using a pedestrian crossing, it is an interesting experience. But, eyes front and keep walking. The abundance of mopeds will weave around you.The first thing we encountered approaching the lake was the statue of Emperor Ly Thai To. Apparently legend has him provided with a magical sword that he used to drive the Chinese out of Vietnam in the 15th century. This leads to the other name the lake is known by: Lake of the Restored Sword.This was my first attempt at photography in Hanoi and I learnt early to have the camera on and the lens cover off to allow the humidity to evaporate from the lens!There are a few photographic opportunities around the lake, including the lake itself and Turtle Tower perched on a small island. Also in the middle of the lake is another small island, atop which sits a pagoda known as the Ngoc Son Temple. As we posed on the red bridge, we met some young Vietnamese students who asked us if they could practice their English with us as part of their university studies. From here, you can wander up to the bustling market area around Hang Gai Street in about 20 minutes and experience the real Hanoi – frantic, bustling, and ready to sell.

Nice feel of Hanoi. The lake was just round the corner from our hotel. We had a nice stroll & got a good feel of the locals. The roads were streaming with motorcycles in all directions yet the lanes along the lake were peaceful. There were several.ice-cream outlets and seem to.be popular with the locals tho the night air was cold. We saw an elderly man playing his violin & young children would come alongside him to sing along. Many local couples & families were strolling around & taking photographs .... it was a nice sight.
Tranquility. Great stroll around the lake on the outskirts of the Old Quarter. Peace and quiet just if you need a break from the bustle. Much closer to the Old Quarter than expected.

Walk slowly around the lake at night.. At night when everything is lit up, walking around the lake is one of the best ways to spend an evening in Hanoi. Its also worth having a drink at one of the restaurants that offer views of the late from above, especially at night.

Lovely stroll. This location is great for a leisurely stroll day or evening. Great for taking in the local vibe of the city- grabbing a coffee or an ice team, reading or sketching on one of the benches, watching weddings, families, artisans & grandparents do life together in Hanoi. In the middle of a hectic tour this lake can be s nice little reflective pause, not necessarily a quiet pause in all areas but still good.
Beautiful Lake. Remember to visit this place. It is decorated beautifully when you visit this place at night. It is really nice place for food and shopping too. Water puppet show are just nearby.

Lovely. Walking by the lake is a very nice experience,is quite pretty, perfect to chillax after lunch or dinner. Crossing the red bridge to visit Ngoc Son Temple is worthwhile, I would suggest doing it very early to avoid the crowds. The temple itself is not that special but you can take very nice pics from the bridge and the temple site. In the lake you can also see the Thap Rua (Turtle tower), quite picturesque.
peaceful. nice place! awesome by night and day! in the morning you can see all the people doing tai chi or zumba, or running!! really interesting place to see how people live!
Locals like to hang out here. Did not see any turtlesLocals like to do exercises hereYou can drop by to the temple nearby This is just in front of the old quarters

Romantic strolling . The lake provides the centre of attraction from morning to night for wedding pics, candy sellers, joggers, musicians, artists, balloon sellers, lovers and families. A stroll around the lake is a must for Hanoi visitors.

Great place for evening walks. We really enjoyed out time waking around this lake in the evening. Many stalls and food options pop up all over the place. The lake and the walkways are beautifully lit up and the buzz of people adds to the atmosphere. We stopped for a coffee along the lake to enjoy the views while sipping on a cold indulgence.

Pleasant walk with interesting views.. We were staying in the old quarter and found the lake walk to be a nice oasis from the hurley burley of the traffic. Also some interesting sights along the way like the women doing aerobics to a western song with very inappropriate lyrics - my kids were highly amused.
Nice Place. You should have a rest in this area for a quiet momment in the busy city with million bikes. A idea to take a cyclo to go around is much better than take a electric car.
Beautiful evening. It was very nice visit with my wife. We went inside the temple. the climate was pleasent yesterday. we took some great pics.

Experience at night. A must see while in Hanoi but hard to avoid anyway. I would sugggest a cyclo ride around during the day then stop to walk on the Vietnamese bridge and take photos. Delightful young students will ask if they can ask questions, do participate as it is part of their studies and they are interested in life in your country. Make sure you go back and walk around the lake at night as is magical and lovely to see Hanoi people also enjoying the night air

tranquil place in a noisy city. The experience starts with crossing the red bridge (The Huc). Once crossed you are in the temple area, whereby, the history and mythology of ancient Vietnam is revealed, with the giant turtle enclosed in a glass case and images of the event.

Beautiful to walk around at night . Gorgeous Lake at night with sidewalks mostly clear of motorbikes, which is hard to find in Vietnam! Pretty short walk so we went both nights on Hanoi to walk off some of the massive amounts of food we were eating daily.
Beautiful view . This place is very good for rest after a long walk. green car station is here and you can take a ride for city sightseeing. Surrounded have many cafes.
the most noticable attraction. The lake is beautiful and a great place for a run in the old quarter. many good cafes are located near the lake

Beautifully lit at night. We walked bit around Hoan Kiem lake in the day and in the night and there is always something new and fresh about it.
We caught a panoramic view from 11 Hang Gai, where there's a hidden cafe and it has good Caphe Trung (although not the best).

Great place to go for a walk and relax. The Lake is a great place to go for a walk and relax. Much quieter here then the rest of the city. It's a must to stroll by in the daytime or evening. Also great for morning runs.

Large and pretty lake in the heart of Hanoi. If travelling to Hanoi, highly recommend staying in the Old Quarter or near Hoan Kiem Lake (they are right next to each other). Lots of good restaurants and shops, narrow streets, plenty of activity.

Nice to walk around. Have been told the lake has two of the four remaining females of an endangered breed of turtle. They are too old to breed from and last male died. They are apparently very big and sometimes sun themselves on the small island. Traffic around this lake is very heavy....take extreme care when attempting to cross the road!

You cannot miss the Hoan Kiem Lake. The Hoan Kiem Lake is the heart of Hanoi. It is always beautiful from dawn till dark, throughout 4 seasons.It is surprisingly relaxing and interesting to sit by the lake and watch the hustle and bustle of Hanoi city center. It is very interesting to watch the local people doing exercises in early morning. It is graet to savor a nice drink or ice cream at the Thuy Ta cafe by the lake. I loev it here!

Nice Place to Visit. This is really a nice place to visit with your love ones. I went there with my lovey behalf just few months ago. And trust me, this is the only place in the earth where you can enjoy the lovely nature.
Nice place to stroll. Quiet, scenic and pleasant. A nice place to take a short (all up, around 30 minutes around the lake) walk and relax.Plenty of people about, and a good place to take some photos.
Nice. Nice lake with beautiful bridge and ancient story but, slthough very cheap, a bit ridiculious to pay money at the entrance.
Nice surroundings. A walk around e lake is one recommendation for your stay in Hanoi. Try to visit the place both at daytime and at nighttime.
Peaceful spot in Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is like 10 minutes drive from our hotel. Since Hanoi is a more quite instead of Ho Chi Minh City, Hoan Kiem Lake provide peaceful ambience and environment.

Nice walk and temple visit. In the day, the temple on the north of the lake is open, and you can visit it for 30,000 Dong. It's beautiful and great for a quick visit. At night, the footpaths are lit up, making for a lovely evening stroll.
Worth a visit in the evening. Nice with all the lampoons in the evening. For the rest it's just a lake. The little pagoda in the lake is worth a visit.
Good for one time. I went there alone. It looked beautiful. The only downside was it's closing time. The gates to temple close at 7:30 pm.

Great place to visit in the evening. Great place to visit in the evening. Lake looks great in the evening and great for wedding photo-shoots for vietnamese. There are also places where they draw your sketch using charcoal sticks for 5 USD... worth a visit

Nice walk. We had a nice walk.. The lake is very romantic and it has nice views. You can walk around it in 30 mimutes. There is nothing much to see there, but it is located at the edge of the Old Qaurter, so most of tourists go there, because it is very near. There is a Pagoda there, but I did not visit it.

Interesting legend. There is a legend of a king who lost his sword which was taken by a turtle who disappeared into this lake. Thus the locals get pretty excited when there is a sighting of a turtle. The lake is good for a walk or a jog especially in the evenings when it is cool. In the cool months it is especially nice. There is a temple next to the lake. Nice break from the hustle bustle of the city.

The Social Center of Old Town Hanoi. Hanoi is a great walking town and Hoan Kiem Lake is the center of that activity. It is a pretty area, and always full of people who are walking, exercising, dancing, playing and talking. If you look Western you will be approached by young people who want to practice speaking English with you. Don't worry, they are not scammers. Talk to them and enjoy the interaction. I have made many friends this way.

Nice Walkabout. Nice place to relax for a couple of hours. Lake is easy walk a some interesting things to see along the way. Many people and very safe. A few vendors along but can be very relaxing. Good photo opportunities in different locations and a few good places for food
A little bit of history. you can glance at it from a distance or you can go in and pay. i didn’t pay to see the inside, however it did look beautiful. a little piece of history here.

Busy,floodlit at night. This is a lake in the centre of Hanoi where everyone seems to gather on their millions of motorbikes in the evening. Families and couples enjoy strolls around the lake and admire the floodlit bridge and temple

Great place to vile yr free time.. This is the heart of hanoi. Pun intended as it is always 'throbbing' Great place to walk around the 2 km Long perimeter of well maintained lake.Place will be filled with visitors and vendors after the sunset.For a photography freak this is great place to be as you will come across wonderful subjects.One can finish of his window shopping of vietnam visit around the lake as the place is filled with souvenir shops and coffee shops.You can also enjoy an ride in the 'trickshaw'
Nice lake to walk around. Nice lake for a pleasant stroll in this scooter free zone. Extremely busy on the weekends with family's and brides having wedding pictures taken

Beautiful hub of Hanoi life . Whether it's the crack of dawn and people are doing stretches on its perimeter; or evening when it's beautifully lit and teeming with people, this lake is the centre of Hanoi life. It is well kept, tidy and a good way to keep your bearings. It's also a welcome reprieve from the narrow moped-filled streets of the old town and is dotted with the odd street seller or cafe. It's worth paying the small fee to cross the red bridge to the temple to read about the legend surrounding the lake and soak in the surroundings. The west of the lake leads to the bustling old town, taller buildings with rooftop bars and tourist shops line its north shore and the more upmarket French quarter skirts its South edge. Night time is especially atmospheric as people gather to meet friends and tourists mill around.
Temple in near the lake. The lake itself having a lot of local people come for relaxing, photo shooting . Lake view with the temple in one side, another side is the building.

THE NEVER ENDING SUNDAY STROLL. We have been doing this for the last five years almost every Sunday: Walking once or twice around Hanoi's most famous lake, taking in the same sights: A group of elderly women doing their aerobics, young and not so young atletes practising in their outdoor 'fitness center', the friendly hordes of students catching tourists to practise their English. Then of course the soon-to-be wedding couples posing for the photos to be included in the wedding book to be displayed on the very day. There are virtually the same groups of old men gossiping on the benches. The book sellers, the post card girls and the fruit vendors are all the same. The point is: You never get enough of this stroll. Don't miss it, when in Hanoi.

Mystical. Mystical dawns watching people doing tai chi, excercising, dancing, or just watching the lake with that old temple in the middle. Take a stroll in the early evening when it is lit. just fantastic
Relax and beautiful. This seems to be a popular place for both tourists as well as locals. Most interesting location are around this lake.

Worth a walk around. Nice spot to enjoy the views and the local people exercising. The temple is not much to see but does have some special bonsei trees that make for an interesting foreground for pictures of the lake.
Quite a view, especially at night!. More stunning at night than in the day but definitely worth a visit. Beware exercising pensioners, or Enjoy... your call!

A day in the park. We arrived at this oasis not expecting the beauty and peace we found just walking around this lake. In the middle of Busy Hanoi this is something to be treasured. Plenty of trees to relax under and watch the many different people go by. Close to shops and restaurants i have no hesitation in recommending a visit here

"Eye of the storm". The lake is right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Hanoi City. It's wonderful place to stop by and take a break from the crazy Old Quarter weaving traffic and constant street vendors touting.
Nice lake in the middle of Hanoi. Nice place to have a rest in bustling city. Walking tour around the lake takes about 1/2 an hour. Water puppet theatre nearby.
Not special. Nice little pagoda but pretty average lake. Some amusing bonsei trees with little figurines. There is a small charge to get in. Crossing the road to get there can be eventful.

A good break from the traffic . A walk around the lake can rejuvenate you from the craziness of the old quarter. If you have some spare time school groups tend to congregate on the south side of the lake and will pick out the westerners to have conversations. It is a fun way to kill some time and help the students with their English.The lake is a good walk during the day or at night. There are beautiful lights on the paths, lighting the lake and trees.

A nice walk. Must see at njght. This Lake encompasses Ngoc Son temple, the most visited temple in Hanoi. Its circumference leads to old quarter and to various other attraction. Seeing this Lake at night is recommended for the beauty and verve that the Hanoians represent.

Amazing Lights!!!. Crazy traffic all the time, but the lights are so beautiful. The food offerings are a little more expensive around the lake, so go to the Old Quarter for some tasty cheap eats, just north. If you miss Hoan Kiem Lake, you aren't doing it right.
Make the lake part of your walking tour. Lovely park and walking path around the lake. Nice during the day or night, but the lights at night make it a different experience. See both.
Go early!. If you get there around 6am, it's really worth the early start, watching the locals of all ages doing their fitness sessions - from muscle bound youngsters to ancient tai chi-ers!

A must. Really nice to experience this special Hanoi landmark. Interesting to people watch, wedding couples getting pictures, locals buying and eating fruit from street vendors and locals exercising around the lake. An easy and enjoyable stroll around its perimeter. Can even get a portrait done with a local artist. Great in day but more special at night.
A lovely break!. A lovely break where you can walk through without having to look out for scooters. Saw a big group of dancers enjoying themselves.
History in a lake. Legend of the Vietnamese emperor with the giant turtle and the sword. Great location for photo shoot.

Nice place to get away from the shops nearby. The lake near the Old Quarter provides a nice respite from the bustle of the Old Quarter and the shops. The broad pavement area allows for street vendors to be present but still sufficient space to provide easy access. As you walk around the lake you can see people doing Tai chi, painting, etc. Although we did not complete a walking circuit of the lake itself it would be lovely walk in the morning.It is lovely to see the contrast between the business of the city and the calm of the lake - an ideal place near the centre of the town to take a break.

Romantic walk around the lake. During our visit to Hanoi, we took a stroll around the lake at night and were rewarded by romantic views and lots of just married couples having their picture taken by the lake. The surroundings are clean and safe. I was bothered that the police took away a young shoe shine fellow who was just trying to make a buck. I thought that was uncalled for. Please, be aware that most food and beverage establishments around the lake are overpriced, but I guess one has to pay for the view...

Great at day and night. No matter if you make a little walk at day and actually go over the bridge, or have a nice walk at night -it is really pretty. At night it is actually really nicely lit and the locals seem to have sports activetys and dance classes - it is fun to watch!
A peaceful period of history lake !. If you visit Vietnam you should go there and see all by yourself around the lake with alot of fun and visit Ngoc Son tepmle on the lake.
Beauty In the heart of the city. A great place to walk everyday and people watch, meditate, photograph and just smile. Close to Hotel and lots of shops and food.

Take a walk in the morning !. This is a must do if you are an early riser when the lake is calm, the traffic is minimal (well nearly minimal) and people are either jogging, walking, Tai Chi or just enjoying being by the lake.

An oasis of calm. we had a lovely drink towards the end of our stay in Hanoi and it was very pleasent. The staff were lovely and it was an oasis of calm in a frenetic city. Would love to be sitting there now.

Great little lake to walk around at any time or whatever the weather. A very clean lake given its location in the heart of the city. beautiful in the sunshine and in the evenings, in the rain a damned good walk! To be discovered around it are little coffee shops from where you can watch this fascinating life of Hanoi pass by, and indeed the main Post Office if its eastern side.

A beautiful oasis in the middle of Hanoi. The lake is an unexpected sight as you walk out if the old quarter. The gardens around the lake are lovingly tended and beautifully maintained. One way traffic around the lake makes crossing the street to the lake much easier.A visit to the temple should be planned, if you have time.
