Nice place to people watch. The lake is right in the old quarter and is always bustling with locals and tourists. It is very photogenic with a pretty red bridge and a temple. It is a short walk all around the lake on nice, traffic free pathways. Often there are students hanging around hoping to speak English with tourists. They are very friendly and were a a highlight of our visit.
Heart of Hanoi. This is truly the heart of Hanoi. walk around at leisure and at anytime of the day or night - absorb the essence of life in Hanoi!just sit and watch the life as it happens around you.

Famous lake in Hanoi. Apart from being a famous lake with its equally famous turtle tale, this is also a good place to walk around, unwind, take photos. A lot of shops and great restaurants nearby. The lake should be seen both day and night to get both perspective of this wonderful place.
Great place to relax. The Hoan Kiem lake comes alive at dawn where locals, and tourists, go to do morning exercises. I recommend watching sunrise over the lake, it is pretty nice. Worth a visit.

Beautiful Lake. We saw this lake while in the Old Quarter and also when we walked the streets of Hanoi. A beautiful lake which our guide told us attracts many visitors and even more locals. It is worth a visit for a photo and to relax.

Perfect location for wedding photos? . Our Hanoikids took us here and explained the Turtle tale to us. The lake is beautiful at night with lots of lightings. During our visit, there were lots of couples having their bridal photoshoots. It's a good walk along the lake if you are in the vicinity, other than that nothing much to do here.

A beautiful lake in Old Quarter. This lake should be seen during both day and night, to compare it's beauty. It is certainly worth a walk around and admire the water body almost in the middle of Hanoi.

Most visited attraction in Hanoi . Of all Hanoi's attractions, this is most certainly the one most loved by Hanoians. Visitors can't hope to understand its significance: it's of course a must-visit destination. It's beautiful too, although you won't hear it mentioned in the same breath as Hangzhou's West Lake. Someone on a UK message board describes it as a big pond: You have to contend with hoards of strollers and people doing their morning calesthenics, as well the air quality is bad. Don't trip over the beggars and hawkers, either. (I don't believe this journalistic exaggeration.)One can't describe the lake, and the 1.5km paths surrounding it, an oasis either. Try sit on a bench, soak in the water expanse, close your eyes. You hear the drone of motorcycles and the incessant honking. I believe though that, after a few moments of doing that, you just may get a sense of how Hanoians see this lake. Company with friends, or meditation amidst the bustle, it's a privilege few foreign visitors will enjoy. Tourists, especially if they look native English-speaking, can't escape being accosted by students who want to practise their English.I try and stay near the lake so I can enjoy walking here.

Nice to visit . It's nice to visit a lake/park in the midst of the chaos of Hanoi. We paid 15000 dong to visit the temple on the island (student price) which was cool but not amazing. Cool place to also go at night, lots of artists there to do amazing portraits which is cool!

Nice but very little to do. The lake looks great in the evening, and one can get really cool pictures. However, there's very little else to do here except walk and take photos: for restaurants and drinks one has to step away from the lake and the park. So just walk by, enjoy the view and carry on.

A must see.... Promenading around the lake is something you just have to do ! Beautiful day and night . Lots of activities ,restaurants ,cafés,birds,flowers...so much to see . Try one of the rooftop cafés for people and traffic watching .Sounds dull but I assure you it's worth the effort . Also the Water Puppets is a treat .
You can't miss it. Lake of the Restored Sword is a wonderful place in the middle of the town. Just walk around and enjoy.
Beautiful Views. This lake is right by the Old Quarter and French Quarter. It's lovely to take a slow walk around it or find a place to sit and eat away from the hustle and bustle or the streets.

Walk the lake, drink coffee, enjoy the ambiance of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem is a walkers paradise. You can walk the circumference of the lake and see so many wonderful things and people watching is superb. A slice of Vietnamese culture. Enjoy coffee, lunch and even ice cream at places situated overlooking the lake. Enjoy the experience that is Hanoi

The best area in Hanoi . This is for sure the best lake to stay and get some great time to explore the culture and local shops. I like The upper north part of the lake. The southern part is a bit dead and modern

worth a short detour for the visit.... The temple (which you access over the small red bridge) is an interesting site which reinforces the history of Vietnam and its battle for independence against China 1000 years ago. The giant turtle itself makes the short detour worthwhile...

Very Pretty. Very nice area. The lake is beautiful and there are plenty of food/drink options around. I did notice that the things near the lake were more expensive then what we generally encountered, but it was totally worth it for the view while eating.
Pretty to visit at night. Lots of people and activity. Many couples taking wedding and engagement photos along the lake side and near the TTP mall at this time of year. Worthwhile to visit at night.

Beautiful Lake with Legendary Story. A beautiful lake with a very relaxing walk way. To rest the tired old feet there are numerous benches to sit on.There is an Old Temple to mark this lengendary lake.There is also a renovated old French style restaurant and cafe to cool yourself with a drink.The lake area us mesmerizing with people from all walks of life relaxing and enjoying the view. Students come in throngs during weekends to catch English speaking foreigners to improve their communicative English. A good way to understand the local culture.Beautiful women can be seen in local national dresses photographing themselves like models.Highly recommended not to miss.Simon.

relaxing stroll. Have your portrait done by the lake at only vnd100k, visit an historic temple at a small fee. They are also small food vendors and cafes around it..The famous Pho Thin is about 100 metres down the left side of the water puppet theatre, you will need a sharp eye to spot it or ask your hotel staff. enjoy!

Beautiful, peaceful, and cultural; the whole package.. This lake is absolutely breathtaking. Not only is the sight of it all just beautiful, it's surrounded by amazing shopping, food, and most of all; people!We were lucky enough to be stopped by some of the local University students who just love to practice their English with tourists, so if you get stopped by one of them and ask for a chat - say yes! We ended up speaking to them for almost an hour and they were the sweetest bunch of young adults I have ever met. Great area for photography; but be mindful of getting photos or selfies with the religious structures as we were told it's disrespectful.
interesting. Really beautiful lake. Beware scammers trying to sell you drugs and postcards. I was also approached by a guy that wanted to take me somewhere with him.
Must see. Great relaxing and beautiful visit in the midst of bustling Hanoi. All around the lake are local interest spots so it is well worth the stop.

Favorite place in Hanoi. I've taken at least 5 strolls around the lake in my 8 or so days in Hanoi. The lake is gorgeous during the day and in the evening. There is always people walking around the lake so it adds a lively energy to the area. There's also a part of the walking area where you will always -- always - see engaged or married couples taking photos. It's the most adorable thing! Absolute favorite part about Hanoi.

A peaceful heaven !. After many visits to Hanoi, finally managed to visit this attraction with a friend's son. It really is a wonder. A peaceful haven from the hustle of bustle of down town Hanoi, situated at Hoan Kiem Lake. A must in Hanoi!
Walked around for the morning. It's a centerpiece for the area..surrounded by a couple of sights..not the most exciting thing you will do..but a great little stroll
TRANQUIL. We walked all the way round the lake. Took in lots of sites on the way. very relaxing day. Highly recommend.
Not many cities have a lake in their centre.. It is not the lake that is that interesting, it is what goes on around it. People running, jogging, practicing Tai Chi etc. Great for people watching.

Well worth a visit. We LOVED this lake, we visited almost daily on our stay at Hanoi! In the morning (5.30am onwards) and the evening (about 6pm onwards) the locals join together at the lake and participate in many activities- Tai Chi, laughing groups, zumba, ballroom dancing, soccer, badminton etc. We loved people watching while walking along the lake. In November when we went there were also many couples having their wedding photos taken at the lake, it was lovely walking around in the afternoon and seeing all the brides in their traditional dresses. Definitely our highlight of Hanoi!

Nice, central landmark. Hoan Kiem in the mornings, right after sunrise, when all the locals are out doing calisthenics, running, performing yoga or tai chi is at its most amazing. It is a great landmark to orient yourself to Hanoi's Old Quarter.

Hanoi is too dangerous and cheaters paradise for walking.. I ride a motorbike in Hanoi is a way to ruin a trip. So if you walk it will be a hell. Many victims' representative from the countless local restaurants fraud restaurant will share only photos.Without asking a few simple tasteless side dishes and rice prices in the local restaurants it was subjected smacked an absurd lie.여기 로컬식당을 가신다면 굉장히 맛없는 음식을 먹고 가격을 묻지 않고 먹는다면 호구가 되는 내상을 입게 되실것 입니다. ㅎㅎㅎ 맛없는 찬 5가지에 밥두그릇230000vnd 내라는데 머라 하겠습니까?깟바섬 와서 해산물과 맛난요리 세가지를 fullmoon 레스토랑에서 먹어도 15만동 도 안 나오더이다 ㅎㅎㅎ더 기가막힌건 3일 머무르는 동안 그곳만 지나가면 그아줌마는 나를 보고 저 호구놈 하는듯 비웃고 옆사람과 비웃는 뻔뻔 함 이었습니다.

No need to go inside.. Not much to see, if you know the story you can just take the picture from the outside. Inside there is only the temple with the turtle. But since it's the symbol and the main attraction, you can check it out. The ticket is not that expensive.

English lessons on the lake side. Wow stunning.We were staying in the Old Quarter and you walk straight out to this view. Even though it is crazy busy with locals and tourists and motos the lake brings somewhat peacefulness. We were just relaxing after a busy day and a group of university students came up to us and asked us if we spoke English...the next thing we are giving them lessons on the lake side. It easy so enjoyable. There is yummy cafés and restaurants. People doing exercise. Beautiful gardens.

A serene lake surrounded by astounding activities. The lake is the main attraction of the city. It is surrounded by trees and parks and a circular road on all sides. You can find interesting people around the lake, taking photographs, exercising (there is an open gym too!)You can rest on the in-numerous benches around the lake and soak in the man made beauty.

Heart of Hanoi. Scenic lake in middle of a bustling city reminded me of my hometown, we spend 5 days in HaNoi and HaLong, this lake will be most memorable thing for our HaNoi tour.Small lake with few KM area is spread near the junction of old quarter and French quarter like mixture of two cultures this lake offers insight to a typical Vietnamese life.stroll near the lake and don't forget to view the water puppet show in the evening, that tells you story of HaNoi and the restored sword.

Beautiful Central Attraction of Hanoi. The lake is pleasant at any time of day but my favourite time is early morning which is a truly unique experience. I have never seen so many people engaging in many different and complicated exercises and movements. They come out in force and are of all ages and shapes. Most of the exercises are graceful and appear to be directed at becoming more supple and include group dancing, sword dances and many individual contributions. To me it is one of the most charming sights of Hanoi and not to be missed. Be sure to walk the full circuit of the lake and take it all in.
Don't pay to enter. Nice lake in the middle of the busy city but don't pay to go inside, there's no point ad it's very small and not worthwhile. Walking around the lake is more than enough

Take a Stroll in the evening. Almost all the tourist kinda stay around this lake area and there is a lot of life here during the night. The footpath was lit up in the evening and we took a very relaxing walk. Lot of eateries situated around the lake as well.

lovely walk during day or night. The lake takes an easy hour to stroll around and take in the mass of activities that go on around the lake. The locals seem to find it a haven for exercising, selling souvenirs, practicing their English with unsuspecting tourists, wedding photos etc. Most interesting during the day or at night. Night time the path the whole way around is lit up as well as Turtle Tower and Red Bridge. Its is very beautiful to walk on a hot balmy evening and take some great photos. A must do while in Hanoi!

Integral part of Hanoi. The lake forms an important part of Hanoi. Visit during the day and at night for completely different views. Walk around the rim of the lake and go to the temple that is in the middle of the lake. A lot of activity happens around the lake.

Not as good as i thought. The lake is quite clean and big, if you want to enjoy the lake, better you go in the morning, quite peacefull there, but during the night especially in the saturday, this place became too crowded

A place for celebration!. The lake and its surroundings are a place for celebration - of life, of love, of friendship, whatever you want to celebrate. It is a peaceful yet alive place where the locals go to get together, pray, dance and... celebrate! It's well worth to spend a few hours there.

Pretty through the day. The lake served as a pretty landmark for our wanderings in the areas around it, as well as a place to have a snack or a cool drink. The bridge and temple on the island in the middle are lit up at night, and are quite pretty.

go at dawn. Our hotel was just a block away, At dawn you can walk among the many walkers, exercisers, and tai chi groups.
Also be sure to visit the Buddhist temple on the island, and go early, before the hoards arrive.

A lovely place to just walk and people watch. A small but picturesque lake in the center of Hanoi, a landmark. Just circumnavigate it, especially in the early evening when if gets cooler, and the lights turn on. The small temple in the middle of the lake also blazes, so it's a great photo op. Lots of joggers, tourists, and locals walking about.
Beautiful lake. Is located right in the center of Hanoi. It is very beautiful at night, with small bridge lighted with red lights.
Where to see Hanoi relax. A walk around the lake and a visit to the temple is a must. Locals exercise, dance, take wedding photos and celebrate.

A Beautiful Oasis in the Bustling City. Our hotel was close to here, so we were fortunate enough to spend a fair bit of time near and around the lake. There are MANY shops, restaurants and hotels in this area. The lake offers a bit of cooler air, space and open sidewalk for strolling. Many people go here in the morning to walk or exercise, and in the evening to socialize and walk.

Lovely site. This is a nice place to visit and it was a nice historical site to visit as we were staying locally. It was a short walk to get to from our hotel but it is worth a visit if you're in Hanoi.
Must . This small lake is the heart of the old quarter of Hanoi. Take a walk around it see the local people activities. Early morning the locals come the do " morning exercise". Don't miss.
Good visit. Nice lake not far from Old Quarter were I stayed. Many shops and vendors everywhere. They force you to buy from them. A wonderful lighting at light.

Nice but for me nothing special. . It was nice walking around the lake. There's turtle island at the centre. You'll encounter a bridge to go in the temple but buy you tickets on the left hand side of the bridge. With the money since it's a dollar or something anyway.
I went back at night and & it's beautiful with lights.
Just a normal lake. Been here in the afternoon and come back again in the evening and at night. Night scenery is much more attractive.
Interesting story of the past and beliefs. in the heart of the old quarter, this was interesting and became the focal point of our daily walks, as we explored the city.

Really nice place. Enjoyed our stroll along Hoan Kiem Lake, very clean & refreshing with lots of benches to sit & relax & enjoy the view. Lovely cool weather in November, as it is autumn in Hanoi, with the vibrant colors of the flowers & greens everywhere. Lots of locals & joggers in the area. It's quite a stroll but not overcrowded with tourists except when crossing the bridge. It's a short walk from the old quarter.
Hoan Kiem Lake. Hoan Kiem Lake is a walking distance from Old Quarter. The is also a bridge to the Pagoda located on the island.

Beautiful lake in the middle of the city. Right below the old quarter, if yin wish to walk around the lake it will take approximately 40-50 minutes depending on your pace. The ngoc son temple can be access via the bridge near where the water puppet theatre is, it's free to walk on the bridge but if you're entering the temple, you need to purchase the entrance ticket first. There are lots of people doing wedding shoot near where the thap rua temple. Beautiful scenery.

Worth a look. We were staying in the area so we walked down to this spot many times. Very pretty spot, lovely at night with all the lights. Worth going to see if you are in the area. Pretty good for getting some exercise as well. Pretty busy with people.

The mysterious lake was in my mind my whole life where my parents had been when they were young. I finally set foot on this lake. It was exactly the way I had imagined when my parents talking about their lives in Hanoi 70 years ago. It was so surreal to walk around the ho Hoan Kiem. My dad had passed away 40 years ago but I know he was there with me and Bob. I love the way all the trees with their branches and leaves touching the water of the lake like they are waiting for the sword from the Imperial turtle.

Visit after dark. The area around the lake really lights up after dark with people dancing, exercising, and just taking a stroll. The lights are beautiful around the lake, at the temple and on the bridges to the temple.

Its just a lake. It ain't huge but u do get to see lots of activities around it, especially at night. there is a restaurant beside the lake but quite costly. the plus point is there is outdoor sitting to get a view of the lake.located just opposite a food mall and a round-about, it is quite a nice place to have a stroll. commonly used as a centre-point for travelers (its near the city centre).there is a temple there though.my take-its just a lake and you'd probably need to pass this lake anyway so need not specifically visit it.

Pleasant in the day, best at night . A nice way to while a way a few hours by crossing the bridge and visiting the pagoda in the day. Recommend a stroll at night and watching the sun set from the cafe overlooking the water with an ice - cream cocktail. Don't be afraid of all the teenagers who will want to talk to you to practice their English, they are all very sweet!
nice tranquil spot amongst the chaos. Virst day in Hanoi spent wandering around and stumbled upon this lovely quiet spot. Nice to escape the traffic madness!

full of life. Our first time at the hoan kiem lake when we landed in the evening on 8/11/15. First impression was this lake attracted not only locals but lots of visitors like us. People hanging around chit chatting, locals with children congregating. Like a communal space for everyone. Lake was well lighted everywhere and there a sense of space that you felt welcoming. This lake brings along life and place to rest especially when we first touch down from the flight.

In The Middle of a Bustling City. Nice lake smack right in the middle of Hanoi city. Within walking distance of the Old Quarters, where you get good food and shopping, this is a must-do when you visit Hanoi

Early morning Hanoi Life around the lake!. Someone said you must get up early and walk around the lake. So on our first morning we did and loved being there before the crowds. Still lots of people out doing morning exercise, dancing, tai chi, badminton etc.Children on the way to school, street vendors and card sellers wanting an early sale, grandparents minding young children, old men meeting friends for a chat and students wanting to chat in English. Take a coffee at the stall out in the park and watch the world go past. A great introduction to Hanoi and Vietnam.
Visit early. Great place to soak up the atmosphere of old school Hanoi. Take a walk round the lake around 6am to see the locals throwing some Thai Chi shapes.

The heart of Ha Noi. Do walk around the lake in the early evening or early morning to see the heart of Ha Noi beating. Locals are out exercising, doing Tai Chi, playing music, eating icecreams and chatting. The lake is lit up at night and there are mystical tales about this lake.
Ho kiem lake. Nice and relax. Have a good experience to visit at here. Surrounding have a lot of restaurant to eat and shops to visit.

Favorite neighborhood landmark. We stayed 2 blocks away from Hoan Kiem Lake so we visited it in the early morning to observe the early morning exercisers, in the evening to enjoy the lights and in the middle of the day to take beautiful photos of the red bridge, the pagoda and the flower lined paths.

How to review a lake?. Place seems to have great appeal to Vietnamese tourists. Since it's at the center of the city, worth a visit, and a stroll around. Be careful of charming youngsters with good English language skills and small notebooks: some are just interested in you and practicing their language, and some definitely have other less benign purposes in meeting you

Wonderful nighttime walk. We've been there during the day and enjoyed it, but at night, it is truly charming. The lights around the lake give it a special atmosphere. People are out walking and dancing. It's romantic.

lake in city center. not amazing, not even clean or similar to a park or a natural lake! just nice. of course is to see, but just because is in the city center and allows you to seat in a quite place to rest and restore youe ears from cahotic traffic! we used that lake as orientative point on every map :-) :-)

Vietnam is the country of the lake. Hanoi city of the lake. Many cafes, where the tourist paradise of, a trail that leads to the lake.
Where you can have the time of composure and a cup of coffee.

Nice wandering day or night.. Nothing much to add really. It's a lake with a path around it. There's a few spots selling ice cream or offering coffee/snacks and you can dart off down anybody e many adjoining roads at any time. I guarantee you'll end up here eventually of you wander long enough.Oh and The Post Office is on one side if you need stamps for your postcards! Enjoy!

Romantic Lake View. Nice place to get away from all the swarming motorcyles. The red bridge was a sight to behold. Artist to paint or sketch you for only $5 is a must try. Had coffee and gelato in 1 of the restaurants along the bank.

Good place for a walk. Felt a cool breeze while walking around the lake in the evening.Could see a lot of tourists/locals strolling by then.There are quite a few restaurants on the opposite side of the road from the lake.Overall, a nice place to spend for 2-3 hours.

An oasis in a busy city. In the old quarter, a large man made lake, tree lined with loads of benches, ideal for a walk/rest after shopping. There is a little outside French cafe in one corner. There is a small island in the lake with a temple reached by a bridge, small entrance fee, less than a £1. The water puppet theatre is by the lake. Had a coffee on the third floor of the building at the end of the lake, Highlands, which is a local chain. Partial views of the lake from there.

Wouldn't recommend. The traffic around the lake is the usual Hanoi chaos and the noise pollution - not to mention air pollution - is horrendous. The lake is filthy and unappealing with dead fish at the edges and no other wildlife in sight.

Great place to people watch. A lovely place to walk in shade under the trees. The temple on the lake is well worth the small entry fee.Lake looks very different at night when lit up so go both during the day and at night.

Lovely to walk around. A walk around this lake became a daily activity, each day we saw or participated in something different. It was a great way to see how the locals entertained themselves from families to couples, loved being part of it.

A big lake, just where you don't expect it. This is a great place to people watch. All of Hanoi seems to come here to jog, court, be photographed or just stroll. It takes about 30 minutes to walk around and is very pretty, especially after dark.

Good jogging place. It was a good place to chill and jog around during autumn this time, but i went there the other time on June and it was very hot even only after 11am, so better come early in the morning-mid morning.

Place to let time go by. You can start your day jogging around this lake in the morning. You can also just sit here in around 5pm and wait for the evening to come. Plenty of locals stay here to do tai chi or just to relax.

Great area for a walk. Great for a walk around, there are plenty of coffee shops around the area.
I would try and include this in a walk around the old quarter, but wouldn't say the lake alone was something you can make a day out of.

Great place to spend a day. With 2 young children we found the lake to be a great location where the kids had some room to walk and run around by themselves. The Thang Long Water Puppet Theater is also right by the lake, an experience we all enjoyed. We also visited the Ngoc Sun temple in the middle of the lake. Finally there are also some restaurants by the lake with lovely views. We went to the Thuc Tay which is right by the lake and the iFEEL cafe which is on a rooftop with a great view of the lake and the city.Potential itenary:Get tickets for the water puppet showLunch at Thuc Tay/restaurant next to itVisit Ngoc Son TempleWater Puppet ShowWalk around the lakeDinner at iFEEL cafeVisit Night Market

Great area to walk off dinner.. There is always something going on around the lake in the evening. We walked around the lake on 2 occasions after meals with friends and on the second walk we were treated to a noisy, colourful parade with drums and dragon costumes. Great fun in a beautiful location.

Charming. Really lovely lake, especially by night when they turn the lights on. Underneath the lake surface there should be a big turtle living but not comming to the surface frequently. It's a nice walk around the lake, with cafe and a restaurant (with awful staff and not so good food).

Great vibe at night!. We were fortunate that the Lake was a short walk from our hotel. It is beautiful during the day and even more so at night with lights shining everywhere. The masses of people make for great people watching.Don't miss it! There are a number of bars and restaurants around the lake that provide great views from ground level and from up high as well.

Beautiful. I loved it here both night and day. At night it is all lit up and looks really magical. Many people walking around and having photos done. Very close to everything you need as well. The bridge is lovely, especially at night.

Gorgeous in the day and night. We took a stroll around the lake on several occasions at different times of the day. There's always something to see and plenty of street vendors or cafes to stop and watch the world go by.

Lots of things to do around. Nice place to stroll around. Beautiful lights around the area especially at night. Lots of coffee shops, restos and bars around the area. Also you can buy a lot of north face, kipling, krumpler, etc in the area
Great to walk around at night. Very enjoyable romantic moment. Small food stands all around, and the light show from everything around makes it worth your while !

The walk around the lake is one of the best thing you can do in the city. The walk around the lake is one of the best thing to do in the city during the day and also during the night when all the city lights give an amazing atmosphere . You gonna find and see for sure a lot of couples that makes foto for the wedding .
Beautiful - another great water space. Close to the office. Another great water feature in Hánoi. A few good cafes. Good for a lunch time stroll or a relaxing drink.

Very nice views of the lake and nice place to chill around. Very unique view, there is a temple in the middle of the lake that you can visit and also a lot of things are happening around it: people chilling, some bars and cafes with lake view.

Breathtaking. Great during the day, even better to visit at night. Strolling the perimeter of the lake, you see couples, friends, seniors, gym junkies, people of all types doing their leisure activities around the lake. The amazing thing is, none of this is disruptive in any way, on the contrary it feels like they are a distinct feature of this lake which without the lake would lose its unique quality.
Amazing Morning View. amazing view. many foreigners were spotted jogging along the lake. Picture worthy. Air is refreshing. There was a old temple at end of the lake, crossing the famous red bridge.
so so only.!. Nothing so different from other lakes. The only nice was can see their local people (Vietnamese) relax at this place.
Leisurely activity. This was a lovely relaxing walk and you can get some nice pictures. A few nice coffee shops near by also
it's the heart of the old quarter. I was going there nearly every day it's full of life you can see all the people from all ages there playing or just sitting or practicing

Cool Turtles!. It's pretty cool. Definitely worth going to if your in Hanoi. There's a great egg coffee shop overlooking the lake by Citibank which is cool. And there are allegedly massive turtles living in the lake!

Pleasant meander. If you are in the area it is a pleasant way to spend some realitively quiet time. While much of Hanoi is hectic and noisy, this can be a bit of an oasis. Entrance is cheap, good place for photo ops and an opportunity to learn some of the Vietnamese culture.
The red bridge and shrine. This is a great little site with a brilliant in-house guide who can explain every aspect of the history, culture and religious artifacts.

Lovel featue of Hanoi in the middle of a busy road.. A beautiful area to be explored in the evening when it is cooler. The walk is easy as it is all on one level. Dont miss the artists offering to draw your portrait for less than 5 dollars.
Relaxing. Once in Hanoi this is a quite place. The noise of the city is lower than usual and you can refill your brain with silence. Nice food places around the lake

In The Center. Hoan Kiem Lake is in the center of Hanoi and a walk distance from the old quarter, it is a very peaceful spot and has this magnificent bridge connecting it with an old pagoda, the lake looks magical at night and a walk around it is priceless.

Heart of Hanoi. Chances are you will walk past this lake during your stay in Hanoi. While there is not much to 'do' or 'see' for the tourists, it is a great place to people-watch and see the locals doing their thing. On the first evening we were in Hanoi (a Sunday) couples were having their wedding photos taken around the lake.

serene place in the middle of busy city. good retreat after a long day...
watching people exercising, couples chatting on bench, or perhaps do your own round of jogging :)
can be very romantic at night, esp on winter/fall season.. :)

Beautiful atmosphere. Really enjoyed just walking around the lake and everyone around seemed to be in good spirits. At night it becomes a bit of a haven for mosquitoes and isn't very pleasant if you're the type that mosquitoes love to bite.

Take a walk around the lake, and check out all of the people.. Why hurry to get from place A to B, when you can take a slow stroll along the lake shore? We walked around the Eastern side of the lake on a Sunday.We saw the Red Bridge in the North East, and then proceeded to make our way South. We passed the statue of Ho Chi Minh on the Eastern side of the lake.We saw plenty of young locals having their photos taken or being photographed, all dressed up in more traditional clothes.In the Southern section of the lake, you will see Thap Rua tower

Such a lovely spot. I don't think anyone can visit Hanoi and not visit the Lake - it's right there in the Old Quarter. I really enjoyed wandering around it and grabbing a seat in the shade to watch the passing parade. It is incredibly popular for wedding shoots and exercising locals. There is always something to keep you interested. I only wish I had made the effort to get up early one morning and catch the tai chi'ers but I was tired by the end of my trip and a sleep in was more important. But on my future travels to Hanoi - and there will be many - I will most definately be back by the lake.

Just a garden. There's not much to see beyond the bridge which has an entrance fee. It is not that expensive to get in so I thought why not check it out. Quite disappointed as there's not much inside and it was so small. The view was better from the outside and unpaid area of it. Hard not to miss it out especially when you are walking as this lake is enormous.
Tranquill. It is well worth a visit to this pretty lake, a lovely bridge leads across it. There is a nice temple there also.

A nice walk around the lake. Take a nice walk around the lake, take some photos of the temple in the middle of the lake and visit the temple near the Old Quarter. A good way to spend a couple of hours.
Lovely and Peaceful. Any visit to Hoan Kiem lake should include a visit to its centuries old temple. The entry ticket price is insignificant and the walk around the temple a blissful treat.

Center of Hanoi!. Every visitor to Hanoi should plan to spend some time around Hoan Kiem Lake. The lake is the focal point for much of life in Hanoi....he heart and soul of the city! Especially fun in the evenings, when thousands of people cruise around the lake, in dizzying rotations, on motorcycles (years ago, used to be bicycles!); walkers of all ages stroll along the waterfront; and vendors sell all kinds of snacks, toys, and a huge variety of other items. Nearby are lots of pubs, shops, and restaurants. The famous Old Quarter and the weekend night market are just at the north end of the lake.

Nice stroll. Walk around the lake daytime and the feel is very different to night time. Daytime is more sedate and has a good feel to it , go at night and the glow of overhead lights will light the path. The are fish and turtles in the lake to be seen if your lucky. There is a great ice cream shop at the lake near KFC, that serves delicious ice cream.
A Beautiful Respite in the Heart of the City. This was a really nice place to visit. We visited on a scooter tour, then went back and walked around it, just enjoying the views and peace and quiet.
lively place.. good place to see hanoi people relaxing and socialising. There are restaurants and a coffee house by the lake. also a pagoda in the middle of the lake. clean place, no rubbish.

Symbol of Hanoi. This lake is a nice place to relax after hours of exploring the old quarter. If you have time and really want to observe Hanoi’s life, sit down on one of the stone bench, enjoy the view and have a good talk with some local friends over an ice-cream cone. It is also interesting if you can wake up early in the morning, at about 5 a.m., you will see lines and lines of oldies and teenagers doing anything from yoga to tai-chi to aerobics. It looks as if the whole city was up and running for morning exercise.
Great place for a walk. Here you can see a bit of Hanoi life. Lots of people exercising, having a laugh, walking back from work... Good place to go for a walk and spend a couple of hours.
Nature . The best lake in the word inside the capital of Vietnam every thing like comfortable if you say there . I love that very nice view and lovely place
Beautiful. Amazing Lake situated in the middle of old quarter Hanoi. Picturesque and makes for some beautiful photos. Can cross bridge to temple in the middle of the lake.
Beautiful lake in the heart of the city. Relaxing place to take a break during your walking trips around the city (trust me you will walk a lot in Hanoi).
Vibrant. This place was near my hotel. We went for the weekend night market, and we had fun bargaining for stuff.
Serene. Pleasant to stay . But a bit crazy at night with so many people moving in different directions. Beautiful scenery
Escape the madness .... Hanoi is a bustling city of scooters, cars and people .... the lake and its surrounding parks, gardens and walkways provide a pleasant respite from city mayhem.

LOVELY RELAXING WAY TO SPEND A FEW HOURS. My title says it all.A walk around this lake is a great way to relax and get away from the noise and stress of Hanoi.The day I went it was overcast and a bit rainy but it still was enjoyable to see the families and local artists who hang out there.
Beautiful. Lovely stroll along the lake. It is very relaxing! We had drinks at a cafe there and felt so relaxed after a big day of walking the streets of the old quarter

Great way to relax. Get here at 6 a.m. and watch tons of people doing tai chi. Very motivating and a great way to start the day. It's about 1 mile around and very popular with the locals. At night it's all lit up with lighting over the walkway. Very cool lighting not just regular street lights. The shut lights down at 11pm. This was my favorite part of Hanoi.

Full of life!. I had a wander around here one evening and I thought that it is a beautiful lake with soo much going on all around it. The lights and colours during the night make it look amazing and I guess it's also very popular for newlyweds!!If your in Hanoi then don't miss it!!!

An oasis in the city. It takes only about 20 mins to walk around the lake, so you can veer off to the side to check out the opera house and also sit outside at one of the cafe's which are along one side of the lake watching the world go by.

Love the story!. This is very beautiful lake in the center of busy Hanoi city. Loved story about it's name and temple in the middle of the lake. We had lovely wonder around the lake in the early morning and joined with local for Tai Chi!
Very beautiful at night. We walked around this lake a few times over the course of our stay. It certainly comes alive at night and there are a few nice restaurants located around it.

Beautiful and great to people watch. amazing by night with all the lights and a nice shady stroll on a hot day, with portrait artisits and tai chi exponents, and various other things going on.On our last day in Hanoi we checked out then sat at the lake for a couple of delightful hours - people watched and talked to students who approached us wanting to converse in english. A lovely way to meet people and find out about local life.

Beautiful place to sit & people watch. We walked around the lake several times. It's so pretty, and the area is very well used by all sorts of local people. There are a couple of nice places to sit & get a drink beside the lake. Gorgeous at night, when all the lights come on.

Lovely view and great atmosphere. I really loved going to Hoan Kiem Lake. It's a beautiful sight and it's a great place to socialize with the locals as well. The lake also comes alive at night, so it doesn't really matter what time you're visiting, it's great just the same!

Interesting visit close to the old quarter. Certainly worth a visit if your strolling around the lake.Entry is very cheap and it's worth a visit. It a great place for photo opportunities of the lake etc. Gets you away from the hustle of Hanoi life for twenty minutes. The small temple has lots of character and once again ideal for photo's.Worth a visit.
Fairyland at night!. So beautiful and exotic- a spot for locals to meet, but all are welcome. You can walk for hours! People are friendly and welcoming.
Beautiful Oasis in Hanoi. I was only able to get there in the evening, but it was beautiful all the same. I got some great early evening and after dark shots with lights.
Peaceful. If visiting on a Sunday you can interact with Uni Students wanting to practice their english. Lots of fun
Halong bay is great. Traffic is very bad in the old quarter but you have to just walk quietly across th streets and the bikes will go round you

This Beauty for Evening Walks. Lake that comes to life with lights, people socializing, artists, eateries, etc in the evening.
Just stroll around or sit at one corner of the lake with your loved one and let the mood of this area encapsulate you, gradually.

A place for social gatherings and phototaking. Brightly lit with beautifully appointed lighting, the lake is a great place to visit at night when it is cool. Crowded with families, couples and street vendors, the venue and its surrounding areas are also the choice scenic spot for many wedding photo shoots. Unbelievable how many blissful couples chose that Sunday night to take their wedding photos. Literally see one happy couple in wedding finery every few steps. An amazing sight indeed. The trees along the lake bending and leaning towards the water are unusual and memorable.

Lovely lake in the middle of a busy city. If you're in Hanoi, you should definitely take the time to walk around the lake as it's very beautiful and relaxing. Many of the locals come to sit by the lake and it is a romantic place for couples in the evening as the lake is lit up.

Beautiful location!. If you haven't seen the lake, you haven't seen Hanoi. Really one of the hotspots in Hanoi, and very close to the old quarter. Take a walk around the lake, or visit the temple, it's just nice and relaxing. Not only a tourist spot, but as wll local gather here any time of day.

Not a must-see. Its a like like any other lake. Nothing spectacular. If you have the time, then visit the lake to take in the atmosphere with the locals. When we visited there were lights all around. I am not sure if the lights are a permanent feature. Anyway, makes the whole place very welcoming. Saw many newly weds getting photos taken by professional photographers. The water puppet place is close by so you can club that with this during your visit. We didn't go the puppet show.

Relaxation by the lake with a refreshing breeze.. A great place to chill out watching the world go by. You will be approached by a few hawkers but it is the students that ask to give you a small amount of your time to improve their English skills.

Best place to chill nd relax in hanoi. The lake was the best place fir me to chill nd relax in early morning and the evening during my daily routine in hanoi... Loved the fresh air and abundance of green.. The scenic beauty of the lake was so tranquil that i used to spend longer hour just siting by the lake.. Watching people from all walks of life nd beyond all aged was also a soothing experience..

A 'must do'. So much to see around the lake - especially as night falls. Such a good people watching'' place! people walking, running, courting! [no kissing allowed] taking photos, walking the dog, just sitting and enjoying the lake views. Plenty of cafes and restaurants and places to get drinks and ice creams. The lights come on at night to show off the bridge,the Pagoda and other features. A lovely atmosphere.
Beautiful Lake. Nice place for an evening walk. Well lit with many people hanging out, walking, riding bikes, many photo ops, bridge and pagoda lit up as well.

Romantic . Its a must see attraction. The is so beautiful very relaxing and good for a nice walk especially if you are visiting the Old Quarter as it's so close. I strongly recommend it also for a evening walk as it's so romantic. Beautiful views. Enjoy. . .
Nice walk . Take a good stroll around that lake, it's beautiful and romantic.. try to get a portrait of your with many artists sitting by the river to draw. We spent 150,000 dong for the portrait.

Worth a visit as it is a center of attractions. Interesting story about turtles and swords. Very tourist friendly. Convenient to old city. Take an electric car tour - they part just north of the gate to the temple

The prettiest city lake, historic and full of wonderful walk ways.. Loved visiting this pretty city lake. Lovely cafes and walk ways surrounded this interesting lake. We even do some tai chi one morning.

Nice view and good for relax. Nice view - can walk all around the lake there are have many things interested such as temples, shop bars, and restaurant. I love the big trees and like to look at any peoples in many style there.

An existing legend in center Hanoi. According to the legend, emperor Lê Lợi was boating on the lake when a Golden Turtle God (Kim Qui) surfaced and asked for his magic sword, Heaven's Will. Lợi concluded that Kim Qui had come to reclaim the sword that its master, a local God, the Dragon King (Vietnamese: Long Vương) had given Lợi some time earlier, during his revolt against the Chinese Ming Dynasty. Lợi renamed the lake to commemorate this event, it was formerly known as Luc Thuy meaning "Green Water"). The Turtle Tower (Thap Rùa) standing on a small island near the centre of lake is linked to the legend.

Take a Break at Hoan Kiem Lake. This is the place that the local Hanoi people flock to visit to escape the heat of the day in summer. Cross the iconic rising sun bridge, visit the Island temple, find a quiet spot under the shade of a tree and take in the serenity away from the bustling Hanoi. It is also a bonus to learn about the legend behind the sacred sword and the turtle of the lake. It just adds to the whole experience and provides a greater appreciation of the surroundings.

Tranquility in the middle of mayhem. Went there during our recent visit to Hanoi. Do spend the little money to not only cross the bridge, but definitly pay to enter the temple. Very peaceful in the middle of all the action Hanoi has to offer.

A place of energy. As I stayed at a hotel just one block from Hoan Kiem Lake, it was the place that I frequent during the stay in Hanoi. I love it. It was always lifeful throughout the day. Every morning, local people would gathered there for their morning exercise, dancing, jogging or even dog walking. It was also a popular spot for lovers, couples and family gathering till midnight.

Great place to run in hanoi. Thank goodness for this little lake in the midst of the chaos that is Hanoi. As an avid runner, I don't know what I would have done without being able to run daily morning laps around the lake. It gets very crowded by 5 a.m and is roughly a little less than a mile around, so if you like to put some distance in your runs you will have to adjust to dodging other pedestrians and doing many laps, but it is definitely doable. The lake is also a great place to people watch both locals and tourists and is a good land mark to navigate about the old quarter

Hoam Kiem Lake. You would come by this lake anyways if you come to Hanoi for trip. There is nothing special. One very interesting thing you would see is a lot of Vietnamese wedding couples posing for a photograph near this lake which is rare anywhere else in world I suppose.

Pretty at night. In the morning older people perform ti chi type exercises round the shore and at night everyone is walking around, and the lake is lit up with lights. There are wacky karaoke singers and random brides and grooms getting there photos taken but aside from this its just a lake!

Awesome place to sit and relax in Hanoi. Even in the mid day sun is an awesome place to sit in the shades and cool down. Often there is a cool breeze to cool you down.There is a really cheap ice cream place on one side (14k).Water sellers are always walking around so need to be a typical westerner and walk around with a massive bottle of water.If there are no seats just sit on the ledge like a local.

Nice Temple located on the island. If your into temples and history, you will like this attraction in the middle of Hoan Kiem lake. Good photo opportunities here but suggest you have dinner at the 6th floor of the City View restaurant/cafe (great food & prices too) for an amazing photo of the bridge in bright red illumination perfectly reflected in the waters of the lake. Restaurant is located directly across from the roundabout with the fountain

Have a chat to the locals!. It's hard to miss the lake when you're in Hanoi, but I started off by doing my very best to avoid it (or at least anyone walking around it) thinking I'd be falling prey to plenty of scams if I stuck around.But then I discovered that the majority of Vietnamese who wander around the lake asking to chat are doing so only because they're wanting to learn and practice their English.I ended up spending an afternoon chatting to various people, helping with their pronunciation and just letting them practice. It even gave me the opportunity to learn a little Vietnamese myself!If you've got the time, you should definitely spend some time chatting with the locals. It was an interesting experience, and one that sadly doesn't happen often for them.

Relaxing Views, Be wary of pickpockets. The attractions in this area would be these: lake, bridge, temple and turtle. When you've had too much of the crowds and motorbikes in the Old Quarter, head off to the lake area and enjoy the wide open spaces. My husband and I found the area particularly romantic at night. Be wary of PICKPOCKETS in the area! Some guy tried to pester us (almost pushing us) by selling the Vietnamese cut-out greeting card, while another guy he was with was reaching into our bag. Thankfully my husband was alert and noticed. The guy was already holding one of our belongings and had no choice but to hand it over to my husband and "pretend" it dropped out of our bag. He quickly walked away. Sneaky indeed! The men pretended that they did not know each other. After a few minutes, we same them again standing around 15-20 meters apart. My husband tried to take a photo of the man who was selling us the cut out card. He noticed the camera, then he used his mobile phone to call. Lo and be hold, we saw the guy who took our stuff pick up a call from his phone. They instantly started walking away from the Hoan Kiem Lake in separate directions. ====The temple is small but has a good view of the lake. A stuffed giant turtle is on display. The red bridge is a great place for photos.
The beautiful Lake. It's first time I see a lake in the central of a noisy city. Ya can image that many thing noisy ya have tobe calm and take nice pictures here
Nice temple. It was busy even though this was low season. Worth a look and a sit down to get a view over the lake.

Red bridge . You only need half an hour but worth paying for. About 1 gbp. Red bridge beautiful at night. Pagoda now seems similar to others but was the first we saw so I really liked it. Massive stuffed turtle.

Tranquility in the eart of Hanoi. You cant miss this lovely peaceful oasis in the middle of wonderful, chaotic Hanoi. Just to walk around the perimeter or more likely stroll around you can't be helped than to be uplifted by the ambiance. One of the many reasons I love coming back to Hanoi time and time again.

Delightful place to relax and watch the world go by. I have spent a few hours here over several different days and loved each time. You can certainly visit the Temple, but it's just as much fun picking a chair to sit on and watch the people at play and work.There are many shady areas to keep out of the hot sun, and usually a few groups having their photos taken. Each time I have been there is usually a bride-to be having her photos taken with her husband-to-be, as well as groups of school kids etc.
Lovely . It's wonderfully shaded throughout and is a great spot to people watch, even the hawkers are relaxed and enjoying the views rather than doing their jobs, it's lovely
One of the key sites of Hanoi. Nothing spectacular to see, but it is one of the key things in Hanoi as it is central to the city. Hanoi life exists around the lake.
Picturesque lake by the Old Quarter. Beautiful in the day and even more so at night when everything is lit up. The area comes to life when the sun goes down so be sure to check it out.
A nice hour stroll. With so much to see in Hanoi we just spent about an hour here. A lovely quiet evening stroll before dinner! Interesting spot.
Giant lake. Great to walk around and chill out for an afternoonWorth checking out and there's lots to do around the north side of the lake
Beautiful!. A beautiful lake in the heart of the Old Quarter. You must tour the Pagoda, so interesting. Lot's of interesting history here, the turtle is something to see!

Best spot in Hanoi. We walked around this lake often during our visit. In the morning there is a lot of joggers and Tai Chi going on, by evening the lighting makes it a romantic walk, plenty of activity around this lake it draws tourists and locals alike. Also the Jade temple is here, worth a visit but just make sure you get to the lake a few times during your stay in Hanoi.
This is Hanoi! Gotta love the vibe!. My favorite place in Hanoi! from early AM till late PM. In fact it's full of 'life' and activities from toddlers to old people 24 hours around the clock!

Scenic. . The lake is tranquil. A lot of people hang around and just take it in. There is a pagoda on the lake. You get to it by crossing a bridge
30000 VND is the price.
Breaks up the mish mash. A nice place to come to have some open space! Prices are dearer here of course near water with some sort of view!
Many visits whist in Hanoi. Great place to visit many attractions, bounded by the Old Quarter and French quarter, go to the Water Puppet Theater
Source of peace in vibrant Hanoi. It is still in the the middle of the town and surrounded by streets full of people but it will be a spot which you will always return back to during your stay.

Lovely Lake and Atmosphere. The Hoan Kiem lake is set in the heart of Hanoi. It is tranquil and the west side has restaurants where you can soak up the atmosphere. I didn't find the food to be all that special, however they serve cold beer, soft drinks, tea and coffee which is great.

Night and day. Wether it's running around it in the morning or strolling later in the evening, this is a great way to meet and see many people, the lake is calming and stunning when lit up at night, love the place and that's strange because I don't normally like cities or city life

Get up really early 5.30am no later and take a walk around the lake for some great people watching!. Spent a few mornings here just watching the different forms exercise can take. From simple arm shaking, to face massage, badminton, dancing, aerobics, running, walking, plus dog walking tai chi and of course exercising the jaw with lots of chatter!! Wonderful sights and sounds - clashes of symphonies all over the place and literally everyone exercising in some form or other. Wonderful for photography!!
Misty. Lovely, lush and green. But sadly the smog and pollution just sits on top of the lake blurring the view. Could be so much nicer. But lots of life around the lake, artists and painters.
Relaxing. You can visit this place with a guide and the lake is very calm and very spacious.....there are ducks that you see swimming in the lake.

Peaceful and Relaxing. Hoan Kiem Lake is an oasis in the middle of a chaotic city. Around the lake makes a great casual walk any time of day. In the early morning you'll see many people exercising. In the evening the area is crowded with residents taking a few quiet moments. Don't miss the Red Bridge and temple - there is a small admission charge but both it and the lake are iconic symbols of Hanoi that should be experienced. You may see students praying for good grades, or a aging calligrapher who will write your name or a good wish for you. Around the lake are many small places to eat or shop, and the Water Puppet Theatre is just across the street. If you're in Hanoi you must check out the Lake if only for a few minutes.

Ok for runners.. If like me and you run, then this is a good place to train, especially if you are staying in the old quarter. You cannot run the streets around there. The lake offers you a motor bike free area. It's around 1.2 k per lap. You will have to run around a lot of people but it not to bad. I run in the evening and morning. Morning was better loved watching all the people enjoying the area.

Beautiful to walk around and sit on a bench by the lake. There are plenty of benches to sit and people watch or relax. Lot's of trees make it cool and breezy. There is a restaurant at one side of the lake that faces the lake where it was nice to sit with a cup of coffee. There's internet at all the restaurants, but no air conditioning. We did not see any boats on the lake. It was about 30-45 min walk around the lake.

Nice park for strolling in the morning. I love taking a walk around the lake. It looks more beautiful in the morning. It's also fun to see Hanoi citizen exercise and running around the lake by using free sports equipment available there.

Relaxing park with locals. Take a night walk to the park after dinner. Relaxing and cooling walk. Much to see, like the red bridge and temple. Just rest at one corner of the park and see the locals enjoy their weekend. There are street vendors selling foods, portrait drawing and etc. Recommend to visit at night to feel the surrounding.

Great for runners. Go early in the morning, between 5:30 and 7 a.m. the park is perfect for running and biking. I would recommend going on the street versus on the path as there are a lot of Tai Chi groups practicing in the morning. A lot of people are up early in the morning in the city, and there's lots of street market and selling street food. Great way to start your day.

Walking around Hoan Kim Lake, early in the morning. My prior research fascinated me that Hoan Kim Lake is famous for its fable of the Emperor's restored sword, somewhat similar to a place that I visited in England which is a very likely the location of the of King Arthur of "The Nights of the Table", Tintagel Castle, and his return of the sword Excalibur, in the poem, "Mote de Arthur".

Lake of the restored sword. This is a beautiful and shady spot to relax and catch your breath after shopping and trying to avoid sudden death crossing the busy streets. There is a restaurant on the north side of the lake if you are hungry.

The Heart of Hanoi. If you are about to visit Hanoi for a few days, it is very likely that you will reside somewhere near Hoan Kiem Lake. The lake is considered the center of Hanoi, not only physically but also symbolically. In fact, the more you spend time learning about the lake, the more special it becomes.he lake is not only special in her history. The water color of Hoan Kiem Lake is not commonly found in other lakes elsewhere in the country: greenish, with dark or light shade depending on the reflection of the sky. The lake is full of tortoise, which is second to none to be found among Vietnamese lakes. If you are lucky, you will catch sight of these giant animals rising out of water. And because tortoise is considered a sacred animal in Vietnam’s culture (along with dragon, phoenix and unicorn), Hoan Kiem Lake then become a holy place that nurtures tortoise.
Walking, freetime. Hoan Kiem Lake is really nice place for a walk morning or evening. Takes maybe 1h to walk around. During the walk you can just easily visit shops, restaurants nearby in Old Quarter

Lake of the Restored Sword .... Nice scenery, relaxing place. The lake is quite near to hotels, restaurants and shopping areas. I visited this lake with my high school classmates/friends and all of us share similar views about this place.

Go there early morning. The first time I went here I went at 6 a.m as is recommended in order to see people doing there early morning exercises. They were not wrong. It was so much fun walking around the lake in the humidity of the morning watching everyone go about their morning exercise routines, from aerobics, makeshift weight sessions and dancing through to games of soccer and badminton.Not to be missed!

Nice by day, better at night. BY day the outlook is beautiful but by night, the area comes alive a s a people place. Many young people and families with children, brightly lit, with stunning reflections on the lake.

Peaceful & Relaxing. The lake is very peaceful & relaxing! Very nicely maintained to showcase the natural surroundings. One can easily spend a nice relaxing afternoon hanging out in this space. A walk around the lake is a must for those visiting Hanoi.
Its nice its worth a look.. As the heading says its nice its worth the look but its all over in 20 minutes. Unless you go right around the lake. Then its all over in 1 hour.
Nice place. This place is one "must visit" for take a walk, is near to the city center and every tourist go there.

Loved this lake. There is something special about this lake. There was something special about seeing the people of Hanoi at the lake. Old men in pyjamas walking with the grand kids, women doing exercises, bridal shoots, people of all ages doing exercises, enjoying a walk and just generally a good vibe. At nights parts of the old quarter were overwhelmingly busy with scooters and "beep beeps" and the lake was just a lovely scooter free haven.

Hoan Kiem Lake. This lake is 'The Hub'From very early morning to late at night, it is a hive of activity - walkers, exercise classes of all kinds, people fishing, dancing,,selling cards, fans, toys etc visiting the temple, or just sitting watching it all happen. On Friday, Sat & Sunday nights, the whole area is lit with colourful light displays.It's a fun place to be

For a city full of lakes this one is the most beautiful. Just below the old quarter this lake is the most beautiful to see. Do not miss the pagoda. Sit and watch the people go buy or stroll. By cyclo is also possible to seve ones legs.
good walk around. the place is neat..and is quiet big as well...a walk around the late would take 1-1.5hrs...but is a quite nice, can get to see the buzz around hanoi as well...

You must go if you stay in Hanoi. This Lake is the most famous one in Hanoi with legend of King Ly Thai To's sword returning for the Golden Turtle. And nowaday, in a nice day, if you're lucky, you can see our Great Grandfather Turtle on lake. Walking around and see the left French architecture and feel a peaceful atmosphere. Besides, you can go to Trang Tien Ice Cream Shop, Thuy Ta Ice Cream Shop, go along Hang Gai Street for souvenirs, go along Hang Dao Street and buy a lot of things and also, go to narrow corners to find something impressive about Hanoi Old Quater.

Noisy but still nice atmosphere. Hanoi is a very busy and noisy city and you can feel it even when sitting on a bench of the small island in the middle of the lake. Honking of motorbikes never stops so you can find it quite hard to enjoy a bit of piece and quiet. But it has its genius loci anyway, with the temple and view over the lake.
beautiful walk. a beautiful calming walk about 1.8kms in total. lots to look at on the way around, from men playing checkers, artists sketching portraits and couples taking wedding pics.
In the middle of busy Hanoi. Grab a spot at one of the rooftop restaurants overlooking the lake and catch a beautiful sunset as the bridge lights up!

Nice to walk around, people watching and you can visit the temple. This lake seemed to be the centre of everything we did in Hanoi. It's nice to walk around and the temple for it's small entry fee is worth a look. Locals seem to congregate here day and night and lots of people getting wedding photos etc. here. There are also toilets nearby which are not too clean and charge a small fee, but at least they are there if you are out for the day.

nice temple on the side. it has a nice temple on the side very good to enjoy also near old quarter and the fake markets I think is a good experience also in 1 side you have a lotte shopping mall very fancy and nice

Hoan Kiem Lake. It's a very big lake and you can hang out there during the morning and night! There are many people doing morning exercise and also night exercise around the lake. You can visit the temple at the lake too! I enjoy walking around the lake as it is very peaceful and windy!
Nice views and atmosphere. Nice to go for a walk around it, but careful with the rats at night! a bit polluted but still a must in a visit to Hanoi.
Must visit!. The place has an ambient atmosphere, it is peaceful and full of historical details. It is very interesting and offers tourists a lot to see.
Photo tour. A haven of tranquillity in Hanoi with an interesting adjacent temple.Good photographic opportunities with some interesting characters by the lake.
Excellent vibe . Great place for an early morning or evening stroll . Very safe and loads of activities by locals. Picture perfect

Wonderful place to relax. This seems to be the centre of the city where people come to do their activities while enjoying the lake. The lake us clean. You can just come and sit in benches provided while enjoying the atmosphere.

Pleasant & serene lake among the bustling noisy city. The lake is pleasant with shops, cafe, restuarants around it. Recommended to visit Ngoc Son temple on the lake accessible via bridge. Price VND 30,000 (about 90p) which is very serene. At night the lake is beautifully lit-up especially if you have city view from one of high-rise restuarants. There are benches to sit & relax. Trees shading is welcoming when it's hot. You don't have to walk around the whole lake to enjoy it.

Walk the Lake, a definite, no cost but an experience.. We chose to walk around the lake early one morning, it was one of the best experiences I had, to see the local people doing what they do, so many amazing sights, and then to finish at the temple after crossing the little red bridge, sorry have forgotten the names. The temple is beautiful and the island is so peaceful and tranquil I could imagine anyone loosing time here just relaxing and taking in the atmosphere

Lovely lights at night. We stayed in the Old Quarter so we were lucky to have this lake nearby. It was so hot and humid when we were there but still worth a stroll. I circled the lake in about 30 min. I was fortunate to see lots of girls in their native dresses and even a couple that having what look like their wedding photo being taken or they could just be models. At night, the lights around the lake make it so pretty. Just be careful with the billions of scooters when crossing the road. On the side close to the old quarter, there are loads of shops that sells almost everything incl massages etc. I love this place, despite of the chaos. Vietnamese people are the friendliest and politest I have ever met.
Pleasant walk. Pleasant walk especially at dusk to watch the sunset, with some stalls set around it. The One Pillar Pagoda is also easily accessible.

Highlight of Hanoi. This is a beautiful part of the city and is great for walking round and viewing Vietnamese culture at all time s in the day. It is particularly spectacular in the evening when it's all lit up and very romantic if you are there with a partner.

An Oasis in the centre of the city. The chill ambience despite this is located in the city centre in making this worth visiting while you are in Hanoi. Try coming here in the morning or afternoon you will guarantee to enjoy your time walking around here, it will get more crowded in the evening - night as this is also a main hang out place for the local but still enjoyable place over looking the lake which both charming day or night time.
Hoan Kiem Lake. Nice place to spend some time just walking around at a leisurely pace. Plenty of locals there in the evenings spending time with family and friends.

City centre magic. Wandering around Hanoi we came across this beautiful lake in the centre of the city. A haven of peace and calm after the bustle and mayhem of the thousands of motor bikes.The lake is surrounded by lovely trees and at night is a magical sight when lit up by the fantastic light displays.
Beautiful lake. Nice lake. It is very special to walk around this lake early in the morning. Great chance to meet and talk to local people

Very very nice. Very nice place to walk around and just soak up the view
Walk around with the family or just chill by the lake
City Center - Hoan Kiem Lake.. A nice place to walk around or go jogging. It is directly located in the center. Go there at night to see everything illuminated.

Typical Lake, smelly surroundings. Went during the mid autumn festival so the lake was packed with garbage all over the ground plus it smelled really really bad. The trees nearby have lights that shine on it but there's not very many resting spots. It's quite crowded and some vendors beside the lake. If you go during the day, you can see the water is still dirty (nobody swims in it), there are still stinky parts, & a little less garbage. Nearby is the water puppet theatre and can check out some stores for souvenirs (do haggle), squat down for some good street food or enjoy the beeping of vespas in a cafe!
Peaceful. Surprisingly goe busy Hanoi is. However when you get to the lake, its quite peaceful and tranquil. Nice walk arounf.

Pleasent stroll around Hoan Kiem Lake. I have been to Vietnam 5 times now,and i never tire ofd either walking round or sitting by Hoan Kiem Lake. It's just great to sit down and watch the world go by! If your travelling on your own and you have no friends, you will have by the time you walk around the lake,as so many students want to learn English!
An Oasis. We walked around this lake every day when heading into the old town. It's calming and and gave us a place to relax before tackling the traffic nearby.

Smaller than I thought. When I first visited Hoan Kiem Lake I was disappointed by the size.Looking at a map of the area gives the impression that it's much larger.Walking around the lake can be very entertaining.There were several wedding photographers around as well as the tai-chi sessions also taking place.To me during my four days in Hanoi the lake became somewhere to relax and watch the world go by away from the hustle and bustle and bikes just across the street.Probably one of the nicest parts of Hanoi.

Great place to hang out. You should visit here both day and night as day time you will be able to visit the temple in the middle of the lake where it is open for the public with an entrance fee. The temple are the temple of the great turtle and occasionally you might be able to see some big turtle surfacing around the lake and they are really huge turtle. Night time the lighting here are very beautiful and most Vietnamese couple will choose to come to shot their wedding photo here. Night photo are spectacular here. If you are going around in Hanoi with a backpack, always put your backpack in front of you to avoid getting pick pocketed. Never bring all your cash with you and put your cards and your cash separately, it is also not advisable to bring your original passport but instead bring a copy of them. Do not use your hand phone in the middle of the busy street as it might be grab by someone else later on.All the above step should be taken seriously as i had encounter all of the above in Vietnam. Travel safe.

Love it!!!. In the busy life of hanoi old quarter, Hoan kiem lake can definitely regenerate your energy. So peaceful here and so beautiful. A lot of people pay a visit here but its never too crowded. You can see various activities done by the locals. I saw they did some kind of photoshoots everal times. May it be preweeding or photo in traditional Vietnamese clothes... Definitely have to come here to experience the culture of the locals :)

An easy walk from Hanoi Sky Hotel. If you are in Hanoi on a Sunday, visit the lake. It is a very pleasant setting but the best part is that you will meet lots of Vietnamese students who are all desperate to practise their English. They are incredibly polite and just want to practise their conversational skills, so if you are walking round and a group of boys or girls ask if you have a minute to spare, say "yes" and find out something about their lifestyles too.

Nice twice. You may need to visit twice as I am undecided if the Lake looks better during the day or at night. Any time of day there are cafes on the north side where you can gaze across the Lake and let the time pass away. At night the footpath that surrounds the lake is lite with thousands of lights hanging from the trees that help make for an atmospheric walk. In the evenings aerobics and dance classes seem to spring up at random locations that add to the entertainment.

Walkies. Nice place to walk around a few times a day but if you take a breather on a bench you will be most likely asked by students to talk to them in English to improve theirs, guess we must be on a few Facebook pages but they are so polite and pleased that you enjoy being in Hanoi.

Great place for an afternoon walk and a chat.. A nice location to hang out on a Sunday afternoon, with lots of students who want to have a chat with you in English if you can. The turtle temple is nice, but I have seen better around Asia. The atmosphere around the lake is great and buzzing with in the morning some of the elderly taking the opportunity to do their yoga.
Must visit in Hanoi. Nice place to walk around and appreciate the city life of Hanoi. Locals from all age groups hang out at the lake in the evenings. Just a few minutes walk from Old Quarter.
A must walk. A must walk round here its so busy and people seem to be going every where. Night time is brilliant and still so busy we sat and had eats and drinks a few times and loved it

Quiet history in the middle of a busy city. Visited the lake as part of the Tonkin Travel Private Tour and without the guide would not have appreciated the significance of the lake and its role in the history of Hanoi. Very interesting to visit and understand the 'legend' of the lake and a quiet spot in the middle of a hectic city

Magical In The Early Morning. A walk around Hoan Kiem Lake at 630 am was truly magical. The energy & beauty of the Vietnamese people of all ages especially the elderly exercising in a myriad of ways was so very refreshing. I remember saying to my partner that this is one of the joys of travelling, being surprised! The Lake & surrounds are quite scenic although the lake itself seems a sad victim of pollution. Still this is a must do if you are in Hanoi!!!

Good place to run. The lake is right in the middle of the city. Very accessible. Water is clear and it's a good place to go for a morning walk. You'll see a lot of locals heading to the parks for their morning workouts. There's a temple in the middle, which is okay. I would skip it because it's small. You can already get good pictures of the lake from the small bridge.
Loved the walk around the lake.. Absolutely beautiful walker ounce the lake. So tranquil and peaceful. Wonderful story behind the origins of the lake. Sacred to the community around it.

Take a wonderful walk here.. I walked around the lake everyday for exercise. Loved it! You can stop along the way and have coffee at several cafes, or any beverage you like. I even witnessed a couple having their wedding photos taken, which I took a photos myself. I saw young Vietnamese couples holding hands, and many locals just soaking up the fresh air and exercising. What a wonderful way to spend a morning or afternoon walk. Evening is nice too, because the lights are beautiful. There are many restaurants on the streets near the lake. Enjoy!

Slightly polluted . The lake itself was slightly polluted when we visited, with some dead fish and rubbish floating near one of the banks. Surrounding areas were busy, with tourists and locals alike, so there was hardly any peace nearby. The view of the lake from afar however, is lovely.

Definitely worth spending time on. The streets of Hanoi can be exhausting with endless traffic and noise, and this offers a welcome respite. Especially at night, there is some lovely lighting and it's nice to stroll around, lots of locals and a good atmosphere. There are a couple of lakeside cafes and restaurants to unwind in. You may also get ambushed by groups of very enthusiastic Vietnamese students wanting to practice their English with you, which was a highlight for me!

Nice Lake, Hectic Town. Unfortunately the lake itself is surrounded by the hustle and bustle of the street, so it's hard to relax here. There are tons of tourists and locals alike that seem to frequent the lake. We sat down and were greeted with a couple of young adults who just wanted to talk with us to practice their english. Overall a nice time

Worth the stroll. Not a huge amount to do here other than walk around the lake and visit the temple (inexpensive). Having said that, if you are in the Old Quarter it's worth the stroll. There are plenty of cafes around for you to stop off and people watch or head over into the French Quarter.

Great place to walk around and relax to watch the world go by. Great place to walk around both during the day and at night, when the bridge is lit up and looks so nice. The temple over the bridge gets very crowded as it is a spot everyone wants to visit, but worth going onto the island. My advice would be to not do a city tour, but to get there on foot as Hanoi is so easy to walk around.

Cool oasis. A lovely place to visit when you are in Hanoi..we loved going early in the morning and watching the locals doing Tai Chi in the beautiful green park that surrounds the lake. We also caught an electric open small bus from the lake and did a city tour which was well worth doing

A quiet walk around. Its a quiet retreat from the rush of Hanoi, walking among the trees. Many university students ask for English speaking practice, so take the opportunity to learn about their life as well.

Great place to relax!. This is a peaceful, mirror-like green lake located in the center of Hanoi, minutes walking from the Old Quarter. In the middle of the lake is a small island with a small stone Pagoda. You can’t get to it–there are no bridges or boats to the island. This lake is a great place to observe Hanoi’s life, sit down on one of the stone bench, enjoy the view and have a good talk with some locals over an ice-cream cone.

Lovely walk around the lake. The lake has a surround pathway for you to walk or jog on. Lovely in the day as well as at night time when the temples and the bridge are lit. Lovely walk in cool weather.

A really busy lake!. This is the busiest and noisiest lake I'd ever visited. There were so many people - locals and foreigners that it's really hard to enjoy the supposedly peaceful and scenic atmosphere, and take photos.
