Wanted to walk the entire lake, but it's so packed with people that I gave up less than halfway. Maybe one should visit the lake in the mornings instead of at night.

its a lake with trapped water. As explained to us, the lake's tributaries were closed off, which means the lake's waters has no direct inlet or outlet. They claim there is still a century old turtle alive in the lake whose species is very rare. The lake size is 1.5 kilometers, so for lake standards its not big.Its a place for people to enjoy amidst the concrete surroundings of the old quarter. Its historical significance sounded more like folklore but i respect that as it adds to the lake's aura. There is an ice cream outlet by the lake that is supposed to be the oldest ice cream store in hanoi.
Beautiful Lake. This is pretty much the best part of Hanoi. The lake is beautiful with all the light that lit up during the night. Perfect for jogging and romantic walk with your other half.
Holiday in Hanoi. again another astounding lake, good for a stroll, especially in the evening, although I did go round it on a motorbike.
Boring. Nothing special to see there, maybe thé mysthical turtle. Wake up early to se e Viet fitness or laughing yoga. Be careful of pickpockets.

Nice. One of the famous symbols of Ha Noi city. if we do not visit here it means that we havenot yet visited Ha Noi.Beside the beauty of the lake and all nice stories around it, the lake is just like an air conditioning for the city.Many people come to the lake with different purposes but all of them have received the same outcome - the special satisfaction inside their mind.Really love this place.

great place to hang out. walking distance to the old quarter, nice large lake, lots of greenery, seating. wonderful for people watching. sweet youngsters will approach shyly to practice their spoken english.lots of coffee places, restaurants to eat in. we spent every evening there after sightseeing. dont miss sunday evenings, terriific local crowd, great energy.

You should come for knowing!. It was crowned of Hanoi with a lot people came here such as a main place from the tourist to the local people came from everywhere in Vietnam for relaxing and visiting when they had have time. In the early morning will have a lot of old and young people came here for took their exercise.

Nice walk in the busy city. The lake is very relaxing. There are several little cafes to sit and relax. Several little stands to buy trinkets. Very nicely maintained to showcase the natural surroundings. One can easily spend a nice relaxing afternoon hanging out in this space.

Oasis in Center City. Although there is always traffic swirling around this lake, there are nice paths where walking around this beautiful lake seems so peaceful. In the early morning, the lake is mobbed with people silently (except for laughing yoga) exercising. A walk around the lake is a must for those visiting Hanoi.
Busy place. Most beatyful on the weekend with lights on, but very very busy in the evenings. Lots of noise from the traffic.
Cooling in Hanoi's Heat. Visited the lake as part of a bigger tour of Hanoi. There are boat rides and excellent restaurant choices.

A beautiful hang out and nice views. We stayed right next to the lake and it was an enjoyable experience. The location is perfect for taking a walk, grabbing an ice cream or coffee, catching a pedicab ride or eating at one of the many restaurants dotted along the roads surrounding the lake. The best part about it is choosing one restaurant high up (Cau Go for example) and getting a table with a view of the lake, at night it's gorgeous.
hub of activity. Must see early morning when people are practicing Taichi dancing playing badminton evening when beautifully litup

Beautiful lake, well worth visiting. Hoan Kiem Lake is a beautiful feature to have in the middle of the city, featuring a nice park around it and presenting a relaxing walk quite distinct from the more aggressive tourist areas of Hanoi. The Turtle Tower in the middle is gorgeous to see, and the temple located at the lake's northern end is a fascinating one.

Nice lake !. The lake was very nice, I like this lake so much, during i stayed in Hanoi i never miss to walk around every evening before go to sleep because in the evening there're many of tourist and local people do alot of activity near by the lake. I have a good memory in this lake while am staying in Hanoi...!
Nothing much. Despite being the most 'famous' lake in Hanoi, there's nothing special about it. The water is green and murky. It's a good landmark to orient yourself though!

Pretty lake. Visited the place twice on a Wednesday. The first time, at around 12 pm and the second, around 7 pm. Better to visit during the day. Not too crowded. Definitely must be visited at least once. Strolled around the lake and visited the Ngoc Son Temple. There is nothing else to do. Would recommend spending about 3 hours here. Plenty of restaurants and bars nearby. The Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre is right across the road.

Meet the local people. We went to this lake and found a lot of local people (along with tourist) spent their time on the lake side. We went around 2-3 PM and sit on the bench on the lake side, watching the motorcycles or cars on the street. The trees and breezy air will make you don't feel like doing anything.Other than this - you will find a pagoda on the lake (entrance fee is VND 15k/person).

Intersting at all times. No matter what time of day or night you visit the lake there is always something happening. It is a glorious spot to watch the sun go down and as evening appproaches the foreshore comes to life.

Nice lake in the middle of Hanoi. Nothing super special but a beautiful lake to stroll around. Place to meet people and get into a conversation with a students who want to know where you came from and just to practice there English. A lot of activity in the late hours.

Beautiful relaxed setting great for people watching and a cool breeze. It seems like you can't really say you've been to Hanoi without a stroll around the beautiful Hoan Kiem Lake. There are lots of great spots to sit in the shade and people watch-- there are interesting vendors carving intricate wooden "toys" -- there is ice cream and spots right on the lake for a cool drink. Just a nice, lovely way to spend a couple of hours.The Red Bridge is there and is the stereotypical Hanoi photo. A "not-to-be-missed" joy almost anytime of the day or night.

Very calm and chilled atmosphere. It's an amazing lake right in the centre of the busy old town surrounded by the zillion cafes. In the evening lot of people visit and gather around this lake to socialise. A truly vibrant place to relax and enjoy the lights in the evening.
Nothing to see. Located in med of city with all the noise pollution this lake got nothing to visit.It may have that value in the past but now it is nothing.

The hardest part is to cross the street..... It was crowded, the bikes and scooters kept coming, everything is dirty and full of litter (we carried the empty plastic glasses around the lake till we found a trash bin).It looked slightly lovlier in the dayligt, but at night - lots of loud bad music and noise
Delighted morning experience. The lake is very photogenic, specially in the morning when we had chances to witness the locals doing morning excercises and follow our guide to see the morning market

Interesting Place. The lake is located in central Hanoi city, no matter what time of the day it is always crowded. There is a small fee required to gain entry into the temple after crossing the Red Bridge. Inside the temple there is a mausoleum dedicated to the legendary turtle who brought the sword to the ancient King.
Cool place for relaxation!. Been in Hanoi and we walked around Hoam Kiem Lake and we have to stroll around this lake. Nice place for resting and just enjoying the view
And then the lights came on.... We arrived at the end of the day. Day was changing into night. And then the lights came on and changed it to a delightful sight.

Cool treelined lake in heart of the city. It's a nice easy walk round the lake - under the trees it is cool and shady. There are lots of cafes etc around to refresh or bench seats to pause at. Unfortunately the lake was not that clean with some plastic bottles and bags in it as well as the fish.

Peaceful Lake. It's a peaceful lake in the middle of Hanoi, worth a look if you are staying in this area. It has a couple of attractions to see and lots of restaurants / cafes on the edge. Be wary of shoe scams on your way walking down. They pretend your shoe is broken and then fix it with string very quickly so that you are unaware if your shoe was broken or not, and then try and charge you an extortionate amount for a job which you neither asked for or needed doing. Just say no thank you and keep walking.
Beautiful Walk in Hanoi. Beautiful lake with a lovely temple on a island accessed by a beautiful red bridge. Great for people watching and taking a nice walk while visiting Hanoi.

Nice lake. I had walking around here for several time during my stay in Hanoi and this lake look very nice in the evening especially the Temple on the middle of the lake the Image of Hanoi.I like this place so much and never miss to walk around with my best friend KIM Oanh.Best regards, Sam
Great experience. We did a tour of the lake of the restored sword and it was worth seeing to understand the history of how it come to be.

Nice place to relax . You need to pay to cross the bridge. It was nice, but not necessarily a highlight. Walking around the lake and sitting on a bench was much nicer. It's a great place to relax, and people watch. Many Vietnamese exercise around here so it's fun to see daily life in Hanoi. Load of restaurants and shopping near by as well.

One of top attractions in Hanoi. You should visit Hanoi in autumn or in winter. The weather will be nice and you can walk around the restored sword without sweat. There are many things to do in old quarters near the lake: night market, book street, old coffee shop,... Come here and enjoy life as a local is a great idea.

Lake. A really relaxing walk around the lake made a good start to the day.Very friendly people,no noise people just taking in the calmness and picturesque views.We strolled around here many a time stopping for coffee and then walking again.It is different during the day than at night.

Quite a nice stroll around the lake. Strolling around the lake can be quite relaxing in the hectic city of Hanoi. When we walked around it, we found very little hassle from street sellers. There is a cafe/restaurant on the north side of the lake, but unfortunately we didn't get time to try it.

Peaceful Environment. This lake is located at the heart of Old Quarters. Huge lake that you can do a lot of activities as any time of the day. Clean with fresh air that you want to inhale all the more. The lake has a view of a structure build by the French years ago and a small island temple where you can pray and worship.

Lake of the Restored Sword Hoan Kiem Lake. What a beautiful sight to see. Very crowed especially the Huc Bridge and Turtle Tower. The Lake has a spiritual legend from hundreds of years ago. A must see to believe the beautiful green lake
Chill. Really nice place to sit and chill and relax away from the very, very busy city. While it doesn't make tranquil, it is a calming place.

The only quiet place in Hanoi. A refuge in the heart of a crazy city - but just crossing the road to get to the lake can be a life-changing experience! Locals flock here at all times of the day and night, to enjoy the serenity of the lake, its surrounding trees and beautiful pagoda, plus tourists throng to the bridge (is it the Monkey Bridge??), where you're likely to witness wedding shoots and lots of posing. A walk around the lake is not taxing, just relaxing. Go in the evening, when the locals are out in force, winding down after their hard day's work.

Nice and Tranquil Strolling. It's one of the most famous tourist location for foreigners and locals. The lake has very rich history and legend, and the areas around Hoan Kiem are the most sought out locations in Hanoi.It is good to stroll around Hoan Kiem Lake, then turn into the Old Quarter for some rowdy atmosphere and a feel for 'old Hanoi'/
A touch of Tranquility. We walked around the lake then paid the entrance fee to go over to the island. It's very pretty with little spots to sit. It was busy and you do get to see the golden Turtle!

Pretty Lake in the Middle of Hanoi. This lake has a temple in the middle of it celebrating a symbolic victory of the Vietnamese people over the conquering Chinese. It's a nice park attracting tourists and locals with another temple accessible by bridge. Close by are other attractions. This one is worth a 20 minute visit.

Relaxing stroll. Spend just a few minutes here crossing the red bridge and taking in the beautiful view from the pagoda. Don't forget to take a perfectly centered picture from the pagoda with the bonsai tree. Might want to skip the walk around the embalmed giant turtle.

Pretty, no need for the ticket. We walked to the lake and spent the 30000 Viet dong on entry to the tortoise temple. The legend behind the lake is that a sword was brought to the king at the time who drove out the Chinese then a golden tortoise came and took the sword, swimming to the bottom of the lake bringing it back to its divine owners. You get to walk around a Chinese temple with a giant replica of a giant tortoise... You're not missing much by not spending the money going in. Just walk around the lake

A lovely walk. Went for a stroll around the lake our first evening in Hanoi. Evening is a great time for it as there is so much going on! People exercising, walking their dogs, drawing, selling food, students grabbing foreigners to practice their english. Great way to ease into the hustle and bustle of Hanoi. Very pretty with all the lighting. Must advise avoiding the ladies with the donut things. If you even make eye contact they will follow you for longer than you expect!

Heart of Hanoi Old Quarters. Get the best view of the lake up the cafes or restaurants near it. My favorite is Avalon cafe. Take a stroll along the lake and appreciate the French architecture buildings. You can also get some street food here. Walk at the red bridge that leads to a temple. When I get lost at the Old quarters, I always make this as my anchor to figure out where I am.
Amazing Hoan Kiem Lake. Soul of Hanoi. Heart of Vietnam. Proud of Viet. A must-see for all travellers whoever visist vietnam, and hanoi.

The living heart. Just sit and watch ,from the Ti Chi exponents first thing in the morning to couples in love walking side by side of an evening to everything in between . Scenic and vibrant, the beating heart of Hanoi.
Must do. Been to Hanoi 3 times and each time make sure I set time aside to walk around the lake. Of course sitting in one of the bar is always good

A beautiful history, & must do.. This lake is in the Old Quarter. In the morning, there are people doing tai-chi, dancing & walking around the lake, & they welcome you to join in.
History is fascinating. There is a small bridge that leads to a temple. In the middle of the lake, a tower is build for the giant turtle.
Must do in Hanoi.
Oasis. A nice relaxing walk around the lake, seeing all the locals exercising, walking, fishing and generally enjoying themselves. A quiet oasis in the hustle & bustle of Hanoi

Lovely lake in the middle of Hanoi. This is a really pretty lake which you are bound to see quite a bit if you're staying in Hanoi as it is very much the heart of the city. It's a lovely lake to stroll round.

What a beautiful and peaceful place.. Right in the middle of hanoi you will find this beautiful lake. It's a nice walk around and the red bridge is worth seing. It's also quite peaceful, the local students did come and talk to us to better there english and took selfies with my friend and parents.
Calm beautiful area . Very beautiful Lake with pagoda,bridge and turtle tower. Worth visiting anyway or just spend some time chilling on the bench by the lake.

Escape the Chaos. During our 9 day stay in Hanoi we strolled around the lake almost everyday. There are some nice shady places to sit to escape the heat and you are away from the chaos on the streets which is quite nice.

A nice stroll in cooler parts of the day. Takp a bottle of water, a hat or the lightest umbrella..the latter being one of the best things I used in Vietnam...me and conical hats don't see eye to eye!! ... and walk around the lake. They have lovely flowers everywhere. Treat yourself to the delicious and only available, it appears in Hanoi, local lemon and mint popsicle. Icecream stand is next to the lake in one side.
For morning people only. Great if you are a morning person. Thousands of locals exercising, walking Ti Chi, aerobics, dancing yogaIt's a must see (even for non morning people)
Every city should have one.. A great place to amble around especially in the evening after dinner it seems every family in Hanoi have the same idea.

A great place to walk around and get the feeling of vibrant Hanoi. Every day we walked around the lake, our hotel was close by (Metropole) and we enjoyed the surroundings, people and activities at every time of the day. Beautifully lit in the evenings it was fun to stroll around after dinner.
Lake. A lake is a lake! Sword lake is a man made lake!!! Lots of people hanging about and exercising around the body of water. It's nice. Nothing special in my opinion!

Old Quarter of Hanoi (Tongkin during the French Indo-China era.). This place is reminiscent of French Colonial Architecture with the vibrant pulse of an Southeast Asian Dragon Economy on the Rise. Walking thru the streets that surround Hoan Kiem Lake is like walking into the History of Vietnam. I cannot place it but it feels so very familiar yet very foreign. The culture is Asian but the place is European. Sidewalk Cafè Bistros dot the scene along with noodle shops and Boutique shops. You'll fall in love with the place and may even decide to stay a few more weeks even months.
Nice view in the evening. we visited the lake in evening time and had a really nice view with lighting all around ! there is a temple also on the lake
Nice Stroll. Really nice to walk around if you like to look at the scenery and take a stroll watching the locals.
Respite. A great refuge from the hectic traffic, a lovely legend! Plenty of places to drink, eat and rest around the lake.

Lovely large lake on the edge of old quarters. Hanoi is all about this historic lake. With a beautiful and peaceful buddha temple in the center of the lake. Huge tortoise and lovely picturesque setting. Have to go and see.

A piece of history well maintained. The lake itself was very clean and the park surrounding it was tidy too. A lot of turtles can be spotted every now and then in the lake, and you can sit on any benches scattered around the lake for a quick rest from jogging or if you just want to enjoy the view with your ice cold lemonade. At night, the lake comes alive with bright and different colored lights, the park also has a lot of lights which are really nice and you will see a lot of joggers as well. A really nice heritage in Hanoi with a touch of modern finish.

Just take a seat and watch. Nice place to just people watch. From watching men lifting weights to women doing tai chi, I think it was that. Anyway, its a relaxing place to just walk a round and only mins away from the hectic life of the locals.
Nice place to take a break. In the center on Hanoi, good place to have a rest on the benches arounf the lake to get away from the hustle and bustle of the town.

Best viewed at night!. The lake transforms at night! During the tour with our hanoiebuddies, we roamed around the lake before lunch, even when it was drizzling, the lake and its surrounding was beautiful. The flowers made the park look more alive.
We went back in the evening to watch the fireworks during the 70th independence day and the lake looked amazing!
Very pretty lake. Beautiful, we had a guide who took us around and told us a little about the story of the sword. It was quite busy but still easy to get around.
Beautiful. Beautiful to walk around, friendly locals chat to you asking to practice their English and many nice restaurants nearby.

Another part of our trip to Southeast Asia. Beautiful view of the lake from the bridge. Very relaxing to walk around with your family. It was nice to have a tour guide to tell you about the story of the Hoan Kiem lake.
Pretty and Tranquil . Really nice place to take a walk and unwind, less busy than the rest of the city usually. The water puppets are worth watching.

Romantic stroll, shopping. We visited in January after spending the New Year at Halong Bay. The cool atmosphere was just perfect for a romantic stroll with my husband while the rest of the family were shopping at a row of specialty shops across one one of the lake. What made the occasion even more special was this very charming girl on a bike with long stemmed roses. There's a lot of benches where one can watch both tourists and locals of all ages enjoying the cool breeze. The next day we had an opportunity to go around the lake again - its not any less beautiful in the daytime. At the other end which we had not explored the night before, our kids had a grand time shopping for sports shoes & bags ay such bargain prices.

Lovely place to sit and enjoy.. Read up a little about its history and spend few hours walking around, sitting for an icecream and watching for the turtle. We sat there in the early evening and had 2 toung school kids cime aak ro talk to us and practice english. We learnt a little about vietnamase kids and they a little about aussie ones.
Better than wondering around Old Quarters. This area is way better than the Old Quarters, less chaotic and plenty of restaurants and nice boutique shops.

A beautiful lake for a walk. This is a highlight of Hanoi for me. It is an enjoyable place to wonder along, or sit and enjoy people watching. The lake is very beautiful, lined with many wonderful old trees. It is well lit at night to create a very nice atmosphere. It is certainly a more relaxed place to walk than in the busy old quarter.

Hanoi by the lake. A good place to hang around . One can see just about everyone locals and tourists pass bye. Lot of local flavours.prices vary from shop to shop for just about everything including beer.lots of beggars around the lake ........ So not very peaceful but definitely worth your time if you are up for an eventful evening.

Beautiful all day but peaceful early morning.. Being near my hotel in the Old Quarter I visited or passed the lake on numerous occasions. It is really a beautiful place, not only the lake but also the surrounding paths and gardens. During the day it is very busy so I decided to also visit at 5.30am. I was surprised to see so many people there, although not nearly as many as later in the day; mostly joggers and others exercising, as well as gardeners. One of its popular attractions is the red timber bridge linking it to a small island temple.

Lovely peaceful place. You can walk around the lake and sit at a cafe enjoying the lovely views. It makes a nice change from dodging motor bikes on the roads! You get the opportunity to see local people having some free time especially at week end. We were approached by a number of students who wanted to practice their English. If you take the time to do this they are very happy to tell you a little bit about themselves and the city which can be useful.

Peace and Quiet in Hanoi. Peace and quiet in a bustling, crowded city. A beautiful lake with seating surrounding it for a sit and relax. Tia Chi lessons in the morning, a path circling the lake for exercise, lots of locals meeting and chatting. Good photo opportunities. Cross the street, and your back in the Old Quarter. Good bars and cafes on the street to enjoy the view.

Perfect oasis in Central Hanoi. We loved walking round the lake in the evening taking in the beautiful surroundings. This place is lit up with fairy lights after about 7PM and with the temperature a little lower then it's the perfect place to spend a few hours people watching!

A Favorite In Hanoi. A great location to wander about enjoying the park around the lake, the Huc Bridge, Ngoc Son Bridge, and interacting with the local people. There are public restrooms along the walkway -free some days, fee (nominal) on others. At night the walkway in many areas are illuminated with overhead designs.

Hanoi must see. Very nice walk, and the inside of the temple is quite nice - The legend of the tortue giving the Sword to the general to defend the city is also good to listen to - Look for the remaining tortues !

Beautiful little park in the middle of a busy city. The park it's lovely with beautiful flowers and trees all around. There are some benches, but not too many, if you find one you can relax and enjoy the lake. At night it's very pretty, there are colored LEDs light that illuminate the bridge and sidewalks, I definitely recommend it to see it at night, it's very romantic. Right across the lake they have a theater for the water puppet show which I definitely recommend to see during your stay in Hanoi
The best place ever. Such a nice place to enjoy tranquility, relax and excercise. I'd like to go back to this place sometime!!!
Hoan Kiem Lake should be in your travel spot. This is big lake on the heart of the city . Young generation they chat and gossip even for the old people for relaxation

great local friendly peoople. beuatifull lake with lots of locals wanting to learn/speak english with you.you can walk around the lake in 25 minutes.therer are a few cafes along the lake to stop and have a drink.also there is a bridge to the temple in he middle
Place to relax. Calm place in the heart of the city. Walk around the lake and forget the chaos of motobikes and cars that surrounds you...

Wonderful central area. This seems to be the place to hang out, exercise, people watch, walk your dog, etc. It's a beautiful oasis in the city center. There's lots of shopping and good restaurants nearby.

Beautiful. Very pretty, especially at night time when the whole lake is lit up by lights. There are cafes on the lake so a great place to stop take photos and grab a bit to get. Also another must see is the temple on the lake, it will cost you 40,000 dong to go in but worth the visit.
Such a nice place. Landscapes are picturesque and romantic. Many local people come there in the early morning to do morning exercise. It is one of the must-see place in Hanoi.

huge Lake in the middle of Hanoi. We were in Hanoi for independence day and i think most of the people close by come to town for the night, hundreds of people, motorbikes sellers, buskers etc. it really came to life. Traffic was crazy busy at this time but the hustle and bustle was exciting. the pagoda in the middle lights up at night and you can cross the bridge during the day - one way!great morning walk. lively walk in the evening.

An oasis in a crazy city. The lake is a lovely oasis, especially on really hot days where it is definitely cooler than the surrounding streets. Only problem is the difficulty in getting across the busy roads but we managed to walk right around the lake 3 times while we were visiting Hanoi and it was worth it. We saw two couples in their wedding clothes having photos taken, men having a sleep in the heat, lots of locals enjoying the scene, and the vegetation was pretty. At night it is particularly appealing as a quiet place to stroll.
Hoan Kiem Lake...a must. This is a fabulous lake to walk around and to take in the culture that Vietnam has to offer. Don't miss out on this wonderful "old quarter" site.

Early morning stroll and turtle spotting. This is right in the centre of town so you can't miss it.Lovely to have this really in such a busy place - in the morning take a turn around the lake with the residents - they are there walking, dancing and generally getting ready for the day.We were lucky enough to see the turtle swimming across the lake - he is huge!!!!!

Walk, Don't Run around this Lovely Lake!!. We spend 7 to 14 days (e.g. 6am) each year walking around this picturesque lake in the most fascinating district of Hanoi. The citizens of this amazing city congregate here each morning to take their daily exercise - ranging from badminton to ballroom dancing to weight lifting. Absolutely delightful time of day and impossible not to join in. You will be welcomed by these wonderful people and probably will return year after year!!

Scenic lake. Scenic lake in the middle of Hanoi. Sent there at night and in the morning for a run.
In the morning its brilliant, many people are around the lake doing Thai Chi or gymnastics, pushing weights or pull ups on trees. Cool atmosphere. Be there early around 6.

Lovellllyyy at night. The lake is really beautiful, especially at night when they turn on the lights. The area surrounding the lake is very lively and you must visit here when in Hanoi, this is the place where locals and tourists hang out! There is a lovely cafe right next to the lake, where u can sit and enjoy coffee, ice cream, lunch, dinner etc. My bf and I had a lovely time here. It's really nice for an after dinner walk!

Peaceful. A very busy place. The local Vietnamese are always around. A peaceful pleasant walk around the lake. There are local artists waiting to draw your picture. A few drink sellers and you do need them with temperatures in the mid 30''s. The old bridge is over 200 year's old and in perfect condition. Went there everyday for 4 days.

Beautiful bridge and lake. I love the design of the bridge. As the weather was great, i managed to get a photo of it having it total reflection on the lake. The guide shared the story of the Hoan Kiem Lake. It is just opposite the Hanoi Post Office and Old Quarter.

Cool and restful. This lake in the old quarter of Hanoi is a favourite spot for the locals to come with their families to escape the heat and traffic. Ngoc Son temple in the middle of the lake is well worth a visit.

Nice place for a walk. We walked around the lake just on sunset and really enjoyed the feeling of being part of the Vietnamese crowd. Families, couples and groups of young people (uni students) are all out enjoying this attraction. As a westerner, be prepared to be bailed up by uni students wanting to practice their English. This is a really fun experience to meet some local people and ask some questions too. Enjoy!

Go to see their lifestyle!!. It's a big lake with crowded people and a bunch of traffic around here (which is not really good) but It's good to go and see how people in Hanoi spend their time on weekends.

Lovely tranquil lake. Different place at night and day . Stayed in two different hotels near the lake, so spent a lot of time walking by and driving by. We are here for he 7th anniversary so lots of light up around the lake (and around trying city generally) which look beautiful at night.Come here on the weekend and you'll run into many students who want to practice their English. A lot of fun :)

Lovely place amongst the chaos of the city. Probably the water could have been a bit cleaner to be really lovely but nice spot to visit in the day or night and a pleasant walk around. There was the usual hawkers but they don't harass you. We got a great view from five floors up at the restaurant.

Look nice at night only. My daughter and I have been for a walk twice on the lake and the lights is very beautiful at night. The lights look like Christmas lights. It is also a places where there are group of locals ladies doing their Zumba with their music blaring away. We also saw some local men doing weight lifting and they seem to bring along their gym equipments. I suppose you see all kind of things near the lake and there are all kind of people wondering around the lake. I sat on one of the bench and left my green umbrella with a symbol that say "0%"on it and taking photographs of the lake I forget about it and walk away. When I went back for it it was gone obviously someone have taken it. I was quite upset as it was of sentimental value and kind of spoil the trip for me.
Pretty views.. Great place to visit either early in the morning when the local people use the area to exercise in, and for a romantic stroll in the evening.

Peaceful and relaxing. There is a lot of activity around the lake at the center of Hanoi. Especially, there are lot people have exercises at night. The atmosphere is peaceful. Watching taichi, people singing, have exercise and having fun. You can also take a city tour on the electric car starting from bus station beside Hoan Kiem lake.

Beautiful lake near the Old Quarter. A tranquil place located in a bustling city, just perfect for some down time. Frequented by locals and tourists alike an unexpected oasis from the chaos that is Hanoi traffic! Well lit at night but equally beautiful in the day as well. There is a pagoda and small temple located in the middle of the lake which is reached by a small footbridge. There is a walking track around the perimeter of the lake. Lots of places to stop and picnic on the grass but lots of park benches available too.
Oasis. Lovely lake and a reprieve from the noise and heat .... Rig in the old quarter - just ignore the cyclos and wander around yourself!

Lovely and Lively. When we went we had the pleasure of first seeing this lake at night, which is brightly lit by a plethora of lights. Which didnt wow me as much during the day. Its nice walking around it as you see the locals and foreigners mix together. I feel like this place comes to life by the forementioned as well as the locals daily zumba like sessions and the old mens exercise clubs. Its a great place to start of your adventure in Hanoi. Its also a very good focal point if you ever find yourself getting lost. There's a lot to see and do around the lake. I never found myself bored of the view though. Its also a nice place to relax and people watch. It may be polluted and such but it didnt distract me from the beauty of the Temple and Bridge there.
Beautiful Lake. Beautiful Place when you visit in Evening , there is laughter club here anyone can join , everyday at 5 pm you can see them

Nice to walk around. Lovely peaceful walks around the lake, marvelling at all the Vietnamese people undertaking their exercise regime, from ball room dancing to Tai Chi, Aerobics, walking, running - just amazing. Early morning was the best time before it got too hot.

Absolutely wonderful heart of the city. The legend say there is a big turtle guarding the lost sword, a great story...Its a wonderful place to walk around, and sit in the shade, temporarily escaping from all the chaos of motorbikes.

LOVELY RELAXING SCENIC WALK. Situated in the Old Quarter near our Hotel(Gondola) a great place to walk around or to just sit and watch the locals exercising early in the morning before the heat arrives. Many little food vendors(ice cream and hot food) on the way around the lake. Also shops and cafes on the streets nearby if you want to combine walks with shopping. It really is very serene early in the morning and at Sunset. Recommended as part of your sight seeing in Hanoi.

Nice walk, beautiful in evening . This is a nice walk to have a wander around. It's not too big and there is a path round the entire outer perimeter. I preferred it in the evening it was much more beautiful with the lights on the bridge etc. the water is really quite a murky green, it's still worth a visit during the day but it's less satisfying on the eye.

Peaceful Place in the Center of the Old Quarter to Relax and People Watch. The hustle and bustle of the Old Quarter is exciting and invigorating for the travelers, as well as the locals, so it is perfect that there is a beautiful and serene lake in the middle of the city to go and relax and gaze in to the water and beautiful scenery. You will find many park benches to sit on and have a great conversation with your company, as well as random people who will come up and exchange a smile and perhaps a small pleasantry with you. We basically walked along the edge of the lake every night on our way back to our hotel from wherever we were and would get a Bia Hanoi and sit there and reflect back on the events from the day and night. The first night in Hanoi we actually got a Ban Mi sandwich and a few beers and sat there and ate and drank and took in the sound and sight of the city. I fell in love with the city from the very first moment we walked around Hoan Kiem Lake and saw the pagoda in the middle of the lake and the small temple all lit up at the edge of the water with a small, yet beautiful bridge connecting the temple to the land. You will most likely see many people exercising, young people having a picnic, and even people paying their most reverent respects to the altar near the temple. I really enjoyed being able to observe the life of the city as we took a moment to take a break from it and just live in the serene moment.

A lively but relaxed oasis in a bustling city. The Hoan Kiem Lake is a welcome refuge during or after a sweaty walk around the old city or the French quarter. You can just sit and recover from the heat on one of the many benches or have a revitalizing Hanoi beer in one of the café's. At night the illumination is worth taking your camera with you. (A picturesque temple in the lake). All day and night people take a stroll here, meet with other people and as a white you should not be surprised to be addressed by students who want to practice their English. The Vietnamese are curious, direct and have a good sense of humor, so it is easy to communicate.

Worth the walk. Enjoy a leisurely walk around the lake -- you'll sweat in the humidity but there are numerous places nearby for a cold beverage. Walk in the early morning for an entirely different sensation (and different walking, exercising "companions") and then walk in the late afternoon. Beautiful.

The beating heart of Hanoi. All roads lead (or should) lead to this lake which is the iconic soul of the city. With the old quarter bordering the north and the French quarter to the south the area is a fabulous spot the explore

My favorite place in Hanoi. My favorite place in Hanoi! I love walking around it a 6-7 am with about 10,000 others. Ball room dancing, Tai Chi, Hacky sack, badmition, weight lifting, walking, jazzercise, conversation...it is multi generational and all there. Great people watching ...and about 7-7:30 much of it vanishes as people leave to go to work. In the evenings, awesome to walk around. The museum is great. The story of the turtle burying the sword of war I love

A little oasis . Take a walk around the lake just before the sun starts to set. Beautiful light through the trees and a nice breeze makes it a nice escape from the city's heat and traffic. Be prepared for all the students who are looking to practice their English with any foreigners they spot.

Lovely walk. what a beautiful lake to walk around and view Vietnamese life. From watching the seemingly Old (incredibly fit) locals participating in excersise on the water's edge to the simple gym set up with free weights to the children marvelling at the tiny fish, this was a lovely place to walk, ended with a refreshing Ale at one of the waterside cafes

Very neat and full of history. BEAUTIFUL! People get married here all the time. They have cool nest-like lights in the trees that light up at night. Take a walk, visit the pagoda and make sure to take note of the island in the middle. There are many stories about the stork and the turtle in this lake-- read about them!
Hoan Kiem Lake. Hoan Kiem Lake in Vietnam is very popular with the locals where they exercise, ride bikes, drink coffee and just sit and admire the Lake.

Walk around a peaceful lake at the very centre of Hanoi and eventually visit a crowded but beutiful temple. The best time for a visit is just before or during sunset, when the light and the colours change rapidly from the warm evening light of the sun to a tasteful artificial lightening of the tower in the middle and the coast line.

Calm Oasis in the heart of the city.. Beautiful lake situated in the heart of Hanoi. Attracts a lot of locals and tourists. Great place for a stroll or just to take the weight off your feet and enjoy some people watching. Well maintained gardens.
Very pretty at night when it's all lit up - still busy in the evenings, this is a popular place to visit.
Just another lake!. The structure in the middle of the lake is inaccessible AFAIK. But there is a temple on the Lake (Ngo Soc temple) thats worth a visit :)

the centre of the old quarter. By walking around the Lake you will see the the different sides of Hanoi. the rich and the poor . at one end is the 5 star mall with all the boutique shops . the other end are resturants and coffee shops and in the middle you taste the noncommercial side of the city, A great walk that could take hours . but the lake is not big.
Nice to walk around. Nice to walk around the lake, visit the temple and join the locals for a 'break' from the city traffic and some shadow

Pretty cool place to hang out and people watch.. This small lake is right in the middle of a ton of action that Hanoi is known for. It also has a small attraction itself. From the Old Quarter, Puppet Theater, and NUMEROUS restaurants and bars, the lake provides an area to kick back and enjoy what Hanoi offers.

Beautiful, serene place for a stroll. It's a very beautiful (small) lake and there were people daily working in the flower gardens keeping it well-manicured. Most of the action is at the North end, and a little is at the South end as well; there is hardly anything along the Eastern shore though the Western shore has a few cafés on the inside and outside of the road.TIP: During the day/evening there are youth wandering around the perimeter trying to stop foreigners to practice their English; it seems legitimate and I had a few pleasant conversations through the several days I was there. Also a popular spot for joggers/speed-walkers in the evenings.

Giant Tortoise!. It is worth going here just to see the giant preserved tortoise. I think it may be an authentic replication, but who would have known one could be so huge! The gift shop has a nice range of gifts. The lake is also great to walk around or sit by and enjoy the quiet.

Beautiful n peaceful place in the middle of bustling Hanoi.. Great place for an evening stroll. You can walk around the lake in the evening and marvel at the flowers and the activities there. You can find locals doing line dancing, classical dancing, jogging and walking. As you walk around the lake, try the local ice creams and other street food sold by vendors.
Beautiful lake view. beautiful lake to go around. Your can go to Thap Rua or just walking along the lake. It's very relaxing. You can have a cup of coffee across from the lake.
Beautiful . Beautiful spot to walk around during the day and even more beautiful at night time with all the lights on
Landmark lake. Most famous lake in Hanoi. Nothing to shout about but its a great place to just sit and rest and watch the tourists go by.
Must visit . Next to old quarter but a must visit at night because of lights. Mostly people walk around the lake but few good restaurants as well

Great Place to hang out in the evening and go for a nice breezy walk. Great location for evening walks and people watching. Lots of locals enjoy the lake and they converge at key points to enjoy the evening breeze and frequently you get to see the local conduct dancing classes or keep fit classes around the lake area. . Weekends it gets crowded so beware
Sit, relax and enjoy. Walk around the lake, take a rick Shaw ride, enjoy the café/restaurants, watch the people go by locals and tourists, watch the gardeners, the place is cool and inviting

A great place to stroll. We enjoyed strolling around this lake in the heart of Hanoi. It took longer than anticipated as we were approached by about 4 different groups of students on the way wanting to practice their English! To be able to spend time like this with 'the locals' was a real joy.
Lovely walk round the lake. Lovely looking lake, enjoyed walking round watching the locals do tai chi and the ladies replanting the beautiful flower displays. Lots of places to sit and people watch.
Beautiful view. Meeting place of the local population for walks and jogging, where the gardens are well maintained and offer good spaces of rest.

A World Away From Hanoi. A world away from Hanoi. The lake is is so peaceful, you easily forget about the bustling streets of Hanoi. There are a lot of benches but it is busy so you might have to walk quiet a bit until you can find a vacant one. My most enjoyable experience at the lake was when a couple of Vietnamese students came and asked to practice their English, they told me about university in Vietnam and I shared stories about university in England.
Great place to sit and enjoy. Loved this place it was full of activity by the locals and visitors some nice cafes around the lake or you could just sit and enjoy the moment!!

Life at the Lake in busy Hanoi. We enjoyed an early 6:30 morning Lake walk. Great to see Hanoi people go about their normal life - tai chi, exercises, a wedding, dancing, meditation, friends being together. We returned later at 11am where students politely approached us to practice their English - a wonderful experience. Highly recommend a little bit of nature in busy Hanoi
Not much to it.... Not much to the lake itself. Nice for a stroll around it if you can handle the frequent pestering from locals to buy their food/souvenirs/water/fans etc etc.....kills 20mins

Lively at night. It's like most waterfront in tourist site, but this lake holds a legend about it, and very significant to Hanoi's history. Very lively at night with beautiful lights surrounding it. And the presence of Ngoc Son temple and its bridge in the lake also make it exceptional. We're very lucky to come here at this time because it's nearing Vietnam's National Day on 2nd September, so it's festive around here.

Pleasant walk showing all sides of Hanoi. It takes between 20 minutes (running) and a hour (walking) to circumnavigate the lake. You can also do it by cyclo or electric buggy. At one end is the Old Quarter and the Water Puppets and at the other is the style French Quarter.There is a pagoda on an island, parks, coffee shops, shopping... These is the traditional and modern. You will be tempted to move away from the lake to look at things in the adjoining blocks, but as it is so big and obvious you can find your way back. There is good outdoor Highlands Coffee tucked away next to the Opera House at the French end.
Early morning exercise. An interesting walk around this lake. Get out early to see the locals. You will be bothered by hawkers but not as much as in the city.
nice place to walk. nice . a lot of people walking here but no stress. Everybody is quiet. nIce pictures thanks to this lake

Clean air. You can feel very free, like your flying on time if you have chance to visit here!You can site on the chair with a cup of coffee or enjoy favourite ice cream! ! Look at people or lake views. Just come and try.
Best place for relaxing. Located in the middle of the city, you can relax , jog, run and can do many more physical activities. Nearby many hotels and eateries.
Lovely lake to wander around.. Lovely to wander around the lake, there is a great coffee place on the lake that has wonderful vanilla slices.

See the local hanging out doing excessive and tai chi in the morning and evening. Great place for coffe and morning walk, locals are always out doing something around the lake like tai chi, dancing. A nice place for a romantic stroll or to clear the mind and soul.

Everything is possible. Sword lake has many oppurtunities. You can walk , run , sit somewhere and read something or make slackline such as me. It is very good at everytime of the day. But to be honest, it is very good but a little bit hot at july. Anyway , its a good place to be visit... :))) Sin chaooooo....:)

Chatming place, especially after sunset. This lake is beautifull 24 hours a day. You can come here during the day and relax, sitting near water, or you can come after sunset and enjou this peacefull place in the middle of busy city. Illumination and reflection will make your mood dreamy, and feels like you can sit near the lake forever and enjoy the view.
THE LAKE. The Lake was nice but a little overated. We enjoyed a walk around and take about 4 hours to check out all that was available to see. Entrance fee very cheap so worth a walk and look

Take some time to relax. Located in Hanoi's Old Quarter, the lake offers a nice walk around or a pleasant place to sit and watch the people. Some university students also are out and about there trying to improve their English by talking with Western visitors.

Wonderful oasis. The park is a wonderful oasis in a noisy bustling city. There are lots of bars and restaurants around the lake but it is nice just to sit and watch the world go by, especially if there is a breeze blowing. At the top end of the lake you can access the old quarter and stock up on North Face gear and any gift you want till your hearts content! At night the lake is well lit and a nice place to be. The story behind the lake is very interesting too.
Beautiful lake in the centre of the old quarter. Beautiful lake right in the centre of the Old Quarter. Visit at night and the bridge to the temple is all lit up which is perfect for photos.

Fabulous park area in central Hanoi. A leafy hideout from the bustle of Hanoi. Relax and watch the Vietnamese people embrace their early morning activities. Maybe meet some local students who like to practice their English.

A great spot. Loads of restaurants and coffee houses around the lake.It is close to the French Quarter.Many of the locals meet here to exercise, chat and enjoy the scenery.If you go to Hanoi, at some point you will come across this focal point.

Nice place. Hoan Kiem lake is a nice place to have a walk in day time or in the evening. I found it more relaxed and peaceful here in the morning and in the afternoon when u can see lots of people doing exercises, jogging or just sitting by the lake contemplating its beauty. A nice spot to avoid the heat of the day.
Hottest spot in old quarter. Walked around the lake, beautiful place to explore especially at night. A lot of food and people to explore too. Can spend your all night here!

Beautiful lake. The lake is a lovely place to walk around, relax, watch the world pass by and selfie. It's situated inside a complex of Ngoc Son Temple, The Huc Bridge, Pen Tower, flower beds in the surroundings, making a sparkling colorful natural picture. When you need a break from the chaos of the Hanoi streets, this is that kind of activity. Worth an hour or so. Have fun!
Very tranquil. Nice place to sit and relax, if you want to get out of the heat. Very beautiful and tranquil, you tend to forgot you in such a busy city.
Ok. The lake is ok... Nothing special it has a red bridge that lights up at night but I don't think it is a must see. Just seems like a man made lake to me.

Nice walk or pedicab trip. Walked around the lake several times while in Hanoi, also took a pedicab. That was some experience. Several activites in and around the lake . Watching taichi, people singing and having fun. Very nice atmosphere .

Soothing refuge. Hanoi is quite a bustling city and it was nice to get away from it a bit by visiting the lake area. It's fairly pretty and they've done quite a nice job with the extensive flower beds. It's also a bit cooler here than elsewhere in the sweltering city. Worth an hour or so.
Beautiful Gardens Surrounding. Very beautiful gardens around the lake. Also good spot to find a nice restaurant and café, and just watch the world pass.

Fun at night!. Very beautiful lake to take a walk around, when you need a break from the chaos of the Hanoi streets. We had fun visiting the lake at night when the locals exercise around the lake with differnt dance-classes and other sports. A lot of night life, and people-watching available there. Great fun!
Nice place to walk. A lot of activity around the lake at the center of Hanoi. Very nice atmosphere for a leisurely walk.

Beautiful lake. The lake is closed to our hotel, so we walked there every day. The lake is really nice. If you would like to watch people doing Taichi, wake up early and go there. You can also take a city tour on the electric car starting from Hoan Kiem lake

Nice and peaceful area. After we arrived into Hanoi and settled into our room,we went for a walk, this lake was within 3 mins from our hotel.. We walked around the whole perimeter, was nice and peaceful with lots of people around, taking selfies with the lake in the background.. We also went for a walk over the red bridge , but didn't pay to go into what ever was there, so we just turned back.. There's lots of photo opportunities anywhere around the lake

Scenic. This lake is situated in the old quarter of Hanoi, and is central to many attractions. It is nice to walk by or eat at a cafe near as it is quite scenic, but there is not a lot going on there and you're not missing anything if you don't see it

Relaxing place loved by locals and travelers. My son and I took a walk there firstly we arrived at Hanoi. Not only travelers, but also lots of local people enjoyed having relaxing atomosphere in evening breeze. There, I think you can become friend with others by taking photo for each other.

Impressive lake. We enjoyed taking some time to wander round the picturesque lake. The beds surrounding the lake had just been planted and the flowers looked beautiful with the lake backdrop. We were grateful for the shade along the tree-lined walkways; a welcome relief from the heat.

Just ok. I liked it but in my opinion is just ok. Good for walking around, see the pagoda on the lake and take some food or drinks around it. I recommend all to visit it but just do not expect too much.
Peaceful and serene temple and great photos. Peaceful area and beutiful temple on island. Small charge to cross bridge to the island - lovely temple and view back to Hanoi from island for more photos
Pleasant but overrated . A tranquil part of the city and pleasant to pass by, but not a "must do". The lake seems man-made, not that clean and there's a bit of an artificial feel to it.

Good place to get your bearings in the chaos of Hanoi.. Nice place in central Hanoi to take a leisurely stroll. Very pleasant and a good vantage point from which to see several of the important sites walking distance from the lake (which is quite large). It is bounded by highly trafficked roads, but a quiet walk is a great way to find some of Hanoi's hidden gems, such as the puppet theatre.

Look for the turtle!. Home to one of the last four of its kind, the Hoan Kiem turtle has been living here for years and years! It's a national and cultural symbol (you see depictions of its story everywhere in Vietnam), so you definitely will want to catch a glimpse in the morning or late afternoon.The lake itself is sadly a bit polluted and the locals seem to care less than they should. I would urge travellers to be more responsible with their trash, especially plastic bottles or bags. Still, the temple in the middle is beautiful, and provides a great view of the lake. You will definitely come across it if you stay downtown.
Lake. Be careful of scam artists around the lake.They hone in on the tourists.Lots of approaches ..Be careful of the taxis and scooter locals offering to take you to a desti ation.

Must do if your in Hanoi. If you survive your introduction by fire to the tsunami of traffic, chaos and noise that is Hà Nội, you can walk around the Hoàn Kiếm Lake. It is a dynamic daily tableau, from morning walks amid locals doing exercises on the shore, to young couples water-gazing on park benches, to the multiple shopping and sight-seeing opportunities in the vicinity. Centrally located in the city, Hoàn Kiếm Lake serves as a home base for most tourists, and provides endless people-watching and recreational opportunities on the edge of the Old Quarter. You can do nothing and see the best of Hà Nội at the lake. Its even more interesting if you know the histroy. The Emperor LêLợi came to power after revolting against the Chinese Ming Dynasty. A local God, the Dragon King ‘Long Vương’ gave Lợi a magic sword, Heaven's Will which ensured his defeat over the Chinese. Later Emperor Lê Lợi was boating of the Green water lake, ‘Luc Thuy’ when a Golden Turtle God (Kim Qui) surfaced and asked for the return of his magic sword. Lợi renamed the lake to commemorate the event. Turtle Tower (Thap Rùa) standing on a small island near the center of lake is linked to the legend. head around the lake visiting various sites Sites around the lake including Indra Gandhi Park with the massive bronze statue of Ly Thai To (founder and first king of the Ly Dynasty) dominates the entrance, he reigned from 1009 to 1028 AD. It was he who moved the capital to Hà Nội in 1010. On your walk around the lake (other side end) you may see Fannies 48 Le Thai To, if so stop and try the young rice ice cream. Hai cảm ơn. It has a cult following. Trang Tien ice-cream, uses natural ingredients to make a “fresh-tasting” product open until 10:00pm. Head to the northern shore of the lake, to Jade Island, where the Temple of the Jade Mountain (Ngoc Son) stands. Erected in the 18th century to honour the 13th-century military leader Tran Hung Dao who distinguished himself in the fight against the Yuan Dynasty, Van Xuong, a scholar, and Nguyen Van Sieu, a Confucian master and famous writer in charge of repairs made to the temple in 1864. It was Tran Hung Dao who invented the spikes in the pit and rotating spikes defences that were used by peasants to initially hold back 3 different Mongol invasions, later the Chinese and American invasions. The Emperor posthumously bestowed Trần Hưng Đạo the title of "Hưng Đạo Đại Vương" (Great Lord Hưng Đạo). Approach by the wooden red-painted Huc Bridge, meaning Morning Sunlight Bridge. A small museum on Jade Island holds the second to last large soft-shell turtle, of the species Rafetus leloii in honor of the emperor. At least one has been sighted in the lake. This individual affectionately known as Cụ Rùa, meaning ‘Great Grandfather Turtle’ enjoys this popular lake almost as much as countless locals and tourists. On June 2, 1967, a Hoàn Kiếm turtle died from injuries caused by an abusive fisherman that was ordered to net the turtle, but instead hit the turtle with a crowbar. The turtle was preserved and placed on display in the temple. That particular specimen weighed 200 kg and measured 1.9m long. Until that time, no one was sure if the species still lived. The species is critically endangered and the number of individuals in the lake is unclear. The lake is clean enough for freshwater crabs to be common.
sword lake. nice place to walk around and the tour guides can tell you the history behind the lake nice for taking pictures

Lovely walk. Lovely spot for a walk late in the afternoon. It's a great way to get used to the climate at a slow pace (as the roads don't allow this!). We also stopped at a cafe on the south western side of the lake and which is good for a rest stop.

Beautiful place at night!. Vietnam is far too busy for me but here at night is beautiful & (cooler) with all its lights & sitting at the lake is lovely
Ross & Sandy Ireland

A lovely walk around the lake. A very spiritual experience, sitting by the lake....but wait you can't anymore over 50 seats have been removed in the last 2 weeks. This makes it much less pleasant to enjoy the lake. This is a very nice place to wander and enjoy the views you also occasionally get the opportunity to help people learn English conversation, but unfortunately so many seats have been removed it's not quite so pleasant.

Not just for the birds. A great place to relax after taking on the hectic pace of the ancient city. Enjoyed watching the local people performing their exercises in the morning. Comfortable walk around the lake. Good people watching venue, watching the Vietnamese going about their everyday chores.

Nice Walk. Its really beautiful in the morning and late afternoon when you can enjoy fresh air walking around. Nothing much to do there but its a good place when you want to get some fresh air, walking around or even jogging.

Nice & peaceful!. Local people are resting, exercising around the lake. Waterpuppet theater stays next to it. The lake look clean & quite with trees well planted around. It's good to take1 to 2 hour to have a full leisure walk along the lakeside!

Not much things to see but nice. To me this is just like typical Chinese temple. Except from mystery turtle not much interesting things to explore. Nice to sit under the shade and chit chat with friends and families though.
No turtle today.... Enjoy a walk around a lovely city lake and garden. Be sure to stop in the temple and look for the legendary tortoise!

Pleasant point of reference. This lake is an interesting little oasis in a busy city. It is a pleasant walk around it and the scene changes depending on the time of day and day of the week. It is a good point of reference for other sightseeing, especially with the Old Quarter at one end and the beginnings of the French Quarter at the other.

Nice walk in a busy city. The lake centrally located, is a nice place to walk around if you want to escape the hustle and bustle of the small streets in Old and French quarters. It is a good place to sit and watch whats going on around you - locals doing yoga or Tai chi, children having fun, scooter drivers with precarious loads etc, or just sit and have an ice cream.You can visit the Ngoc Son Temple at the north end of the lake - there is a charge for this.It is also a good point to get your bearings when walking around with a street map. Unfortunately like many other waterways the lake is dirty but you can overlook that and appreciate the peace it offers .

We love this place. You should not miss out this lake. Really beautiful in morning and late afternoon. We love the atmosphere there- local life with fresh view. My friends said it's much more beautiful in autumn- romantic and lovely. Don't forget to visit ngoc son temple. It was crowded but worth trying.

Nice walk along the lake!. What a nice afternoon walk! We went back there over and over again as it was our point of reference to find our hotel too. Parents with children, locals and tourists gather around the lake to exercise, enjoy the late afternoon or have a beer or an ice cream.
It a nice lake.. Very nice lake for looking at I would never swim in it. But aesthetically pleasing lake located in the centre of town a must see in hanoi
It's ok. The place is good...We went out for a walk during the night...seems a really romantic place (lots of couple). Otherwise the lake is a little bit dirty

Lake worth walking around !!!. a major scenic spot which any tourist cannot miss if staying in the Old Quarter. The lake serves as a focal point for its public life for the local Vietnamese.My friends and I decided to walk around the lake leisurely during the mid morning before it got too hot. It was soo nice, and only took about 35mins to walk right around with a few stops along the way to take photographs. During the day and at night they look quite different and I find the lake quite pleasant. Its also famous for locals to take their wedding photographs.
Pretty to see. This was a nice lake (and I enjoyed that there were many locals). It's not all that interesting, but if you're nearby - definitely worth a visit.

Hoan Kiem lake is a gem in the middle of Hanoi city... Like a pearl in the oyster !. Walking by the lake or cycling around it, is so romantique! And learning the story of the Turtle who found the sword of a Lord Master add to the beauty of the site.

Great walk. We loved waking around this lake. We went early in the morning (6:40am) and we were able to see some of the people out and about. Some where doing their morning workout routines, some dancing, some gardening etc. Research the history of the lake to have a better understanding of why locals love it.
Fun. Very nice and big lake to walk around. Great to kill some time and see a temple while you're at it. Very cheap as well if that's they route you're trying to go.
Refreshing. WE enjoyed the walks around the lake, it seemed a bit less hot than on the streets, there are water vendors and taxi bikes you can rent around. There is a fee to enter the temple.
Nice walk around the lake. You should get a feel in the day time and at night. However, it is nicer at night because of the lightings.

Hoan Kiem lake is very beautiful, but it is a little pollution.. I liked the historical lake the most.
I disliked several people that tried to sell something to me made me angry.
Nice area for a walk.. It's a bit of nature in a busy loud city to enjoy. There is also a small temple you can visit on the lake.
Beautiful lake in the middle of koas. Just a beautiful like in the middle of the town right near the old town pls walk around it nice and relaxing after th5 traffic of hanoi

People watching overload. Hoan Kien Lake early in the morning (before 7AM) for a leisurely stroll along with the "Old Quarter" has to be the number one must see in Hanoi. A feast of sites as you watch the locals, mostly the elderly generation working through their early morning rituals and something I feel they have been doing for generations.Absolutely mesmerising stuff. Take your camera.
Beautiful small lake. Right near Old Quarter, a small lake with beautiful scenery. Take a walk around and you will find many photogenic area.

Peace in the middle of Chaos. It's such a nice reprieve from the chaos of traffic that is the centre of Hanoi! Walking around the lake and being able to divert off (cross the road slowly, let the traffic go around you!) to the French Quarter, The Old Quarter, the Water Puppet show etc.and the air just seems that much cooler and cleaner.
Romantisch. Very nice to walk around and enjoy. in the morning the people excersize their practisis. In the evening it is romantic. The turtle house in the middle

It's the life around the lake... Several things to enjoy around the lake. But it's a small 4 stars. As with everything else concerning Hanoi, it's not the sights tourist attractions that are recommendable. It's the people, food and culture..
Nice focal point. The lake is surrounded with lots of benches/cafes and place to relax and take in the lake-- goos for people watching too! You can also see locals practicing tai chi
Promenade with the locals. The lake appears to be the centre of Hanoi! It is just lovely to walk around the lake in the evening, strolling with locals and travellers alike.

Not much of a lake. As with many other cities in Vietnam, this is the obligatory lake around which the city i built. It's quite dirty and quite small, but people gather along the esplanade of an evening, and early morning you can see many groups of people running exercise classes such as Ti Chi

Worth the visit. Interesting temple with a story. Worth having a look around and understanding the history of the temple. Look up the history unless you have a guide book. Under 15 years old for free.
Beautiful. We walked around the lake, very nice walk. Beautiful and great photo opportunity. At night the lake lights up !

True insight. True insight to Vietnamese culture, especially when visited early in the morning! This area comes alive from around 5.30am with people exercising around the lake. Exercise here ranges from people playing keepy upies with a shuttle cock to ballroom dancing to tai-chi. Anything to exercise the mind and body goes, just walk around the lake and you won't be disappointed. There is a real hive of activity to the left when walking from the Old Quarter. We found the hole experience jaw dropping, fun, friendly and don't forget to join in. This is a real must for anyone when visiting Hanoi!

Beautiful Hoan Kiem. Hoan Kiem Lake is very pretty, with lots of trees, a walking path which encircles the lake, paddle boats and an island. It is in the Old Quarter, with plenty of places to eat, night markets close by and the Water Puppet Theatre across the road.

Almost the centre of tourist Hanoi. I've spent endless hours walking around and sitting by this lake. It's a jogging track, a place to exercise, a busy traffic area and very photogenic place or a place to have coffee

Beautiful Lake. I can spend the whole day here! Its a very beautiful lake. It is very calm and a pleasant escape from the busy streets of Hanoi. You can see people lounging, exercising, playing, eating, playing games, etc by the lake. You can walk around the lake. There are cafes nearby.

Best to View Early in the Morning!. A beautiful place to be especially in early morning at around 7 am. Businesses are opening up enroute, and the lake is full of young and old Vietnamese walking, doing rhythmic group dances, exercises, or just chilling and taking in the vibe.
Activity Lake. Beautiful and Serene! Lots of people excercising, dancing and enjoying themselves around the lake. Dislike the trishaws hasslng for a ride.

A nice stroll. Great place for a stroll in the morning or evening. This seems to be the hub of the city with everyone coming here to walk, court and exercise. Nice at sunset to hear the birds and see the bats!!

Peace from the streets. A great way to escape the crowds in Hanoi old sector, just to people watch, or read a book. Took a slow walk round on a wide easy to navigate pathway round, many photographic opportunities as you walk. The pathway also has many seats and toilets spread around the lake. Two very good coffee stops on the way round serving good coffee and cakes, etc to refresh you on your walk. Well worth the visit and get some exercise in, top spot in the morning to walk.

Highlight of Hanoi. After an electric bus through the city centre we were dropped off at this beautiful lake. In contrast to the West lake, this was clean and well presented with a walk around it being a must for visitors to Hanoi.

Great to walk round after crazy Old Quarter. Walking round the lake and enjoying a drink by the lakeside was a calming experience after visiting the Old Quarter. We saw the central pagoda and went over the red bridge to visit the big pagoda. We throughly enjoyed the Lake

It's a lake. It is a lake and you can walk around it. In the middle there is a small island with a shrine or temple. If the weather is nice and you have eaten to much good french food you might want to take a walk around.

Escape from the city clutter. It's quite nice to walk along the path around the lake. Plenty of benches to sit on and people won't bother you just for being a foreigner. Not so much to see regarding the lake itself, but when you think of the crazy level of clutter completely surrounding you the lake makes for a chance to regroup for a bit.

Peaceful lake and temple, small cost to walk over red bridge to temples. Great vies of city and also large temple and offerings on the island once you cross red bridge. Small donation to cross bridge to island and temple

A HAVEN IN THE MIDDLE OF HANOI!!. The lake itself, sits between the old town/quarters at it's north, and the French quarters to the south. In the middle of the lake you will find a small island with the Ngoc Son Temple located on it. A small bridge connects the surrounding land to the island, and a fee applies to get to the temple. If you are staying around the lake, you can join with the locals for a bit of t'ai chi in the morning, otherwise, their is a path which encircles the lake, so it's great for a brisk walk (or run) around it.

Nice stroll and nice spot to people watch. Very near our hotel, so we enjoyed a walk around it. Interesting place to watch the Vietnamese enjoying their city. Peaceful spot in a busy city.Especially beautiful light up at night. We were approached by students who wanted to practice their English so we had a chat.

Nice strolls depending on the weather. Depending on the time of year, either stroll early in the morning (summer) to join the locals out for their exercises or middle of the day (during cooler weather). Lots of cafes around the lake to stop in and have great Vietnamese coffees - make sure to try the "egg" coffee.

Lake in the city centre. Its an ideal picnic spot right in the middle of city. We used to visit this place twice a day. There are loy of bencghes to relax and on the other there are icecream vendors and some food sellers. Walking along the blake is an enjoyable experience. There is a small temple shrine in the middle of the lake. there is also a shrine on the lake too.

Hub of the Old Quarter. Hoan Kiem Lake is a nice break from the chaos of the Old Quarter despite being the hub of the area--you'll see locals and tourists alike passing time in the area.We found ourselves coming back to the late to grab coffee after long stretches of walking / sightseeing in Hanoi--and would strongly recommend it to anyone staying / visiting the Old Quarter
Great Outdoor Experience in the Middle of the City. This is a beautiful place to walk around. Great photo ops, nice place to "be" outdoors without too many people.

Scenic, lit at night. The Lake is close to the old quarter. We would spend time in the evenings observing the passers by. Had a good experience when severaL groups of Viet Names students wanted to practise their english, we spent perhaps 2 hours one day and aN hour next day conversing with them which we enjoyed and seems they enjoyed too.
Centre of activities. A peaceful spot in the middle of the hectic city centre - it hosts good restaurants, tour options, Water Puppet Theatre, Ngoc Son Temple and lots more

Interesting stroll around the lake.. WE really enjoyed walking around the lake noticing that lots of people ( mainly ladies) doing tai Chi. There was a section with a public work out facility where only men were using. On both sides of the lake couples dressed in finery ( wedding engagement? were taking pictures. I saw a man practicing his golf chipping with badminton birdies on the cement.
Don't miss it.. Nothing like a walk around Hoan Kiem Lake. This is a very special place with lots to see, especially if you like people watching! There is a real sense of history.

Romance or family visit?. romance place for couple too,but for family why not? actually this history place can visit by any type of visitors,for prayer also a nice place for calm down,not comment on any religion but for this vietnamese temple can be make a wish by any one,and little musuem can know the lake history and how to keeping untill now
Peaceful. This is a lovely little haven of peace and beauty in the midst of the hustle and bustle of downtown Hanoi. The walk around the lake takes about half an hour and refreshes the soul.

Tourist. Beautiful lake in centre of old quarter, beautiful old temple on an island in the middle of lake. Temple by lakeside was interesting and quite old, well preserved with information in English and French on boards around. Beautiful Buddhist statues. The lake has a nice wide pathway around it lined with green trees and gardens and can be circled in 30 minutes. Hanoi is a clean city
Wonderful place to stroll. A lovely place to go for a walk and I recommend making sure you see it early in the morning but also late at night when it is lit up. Gorgeous at night!!

Worth a stroll round. Nice peaceful area out of the busy streets. We took some time out just strolling and sitting watching the world go by. Great place to people watch. We had a young girl approach us politely asking if she could practice her English for an upcoming exam so she sat and had a chat, we saw a young couple having wedding photos taken and lots of families out for a stroll. Nice place for some time out and no mopeds!

Beautiful, plus great people watching. We spent a lot of time around the lake in our few days in Hanoi - there is a cafe/bar on the north side that is popular for ice cream (though we just used it for its Wi-Fi and its Bia Hanoi), the turtle pagoda (accessible by the red bridge) is great, but I think we liked the people watching the most. It's clear that the lake is a social place to be - you can see people meeting there after work, or hanging out and doing Tai Chi - it's a central place in Hanoi and a good place to get a sense of the city.
A moments respite from the hussle and bussel of the old town. A picturesque walk that gives you an opportunity to escape the hussle and hussle of the old town. Nice cafes along the way

Vital centre of city. This lake makes such a difference to the city centre - and such a pleasant change to HCM. Great to see local families and tourists enjoying the scenery and not be harrassed by sellers.

Relaxing stroll around the lake to escape the hustle and bustle of th surrounding city.. The lake is quite picturesque surrounded by the busy city of Hanoi. There is lots to do other than stroll around the lake. You can cross the Hoan Kiem Lake bridge, have a bite to eat at the surrounding café, talk to the locals or just relax and visualise the emperor Lê Lợi while boating on the lake when a Golden Turtle God (Kim Qui) surfaced and asked for his magic sword (according to legend). The Turtle Tower is located in the centre of the lake and looks fantastic at night. To cross the bridge there is a small fee but otherwise the lake is free. The café on the lake does great crepes.

Worth a look when you are there. Most visitors to Hanoi are in this area, so take an additional half hour to cross the bridge to the island in the middle, and look at the temple there. It's not really worth the ticket price, but it is not excessive so go anyway to look at the view of the town from another angle, watch the locals having their pictures taken (the young 'n trendy on the bridge, families by the temple with the lake as a backdrop) and to get away from the noise and bustle of the traffic!

Nice atmosphere . Go for a stroll here early in the morning or evening to see two completely different sides to this city. In the morning it's chilled out and peaceful whilst in the evening it's jam packed. Both times of day you will like this place, walk around the lake at your own pace and stop to take pics. Some nice café's looking out on the lake too.
Great view and amazing story. The lake is a good place to take pictures. We love the myth about this lake as well as the story about the tower.

Very calm & beautiful lake. I enjoy the calmness & beautiful scene of the lake with the great contrast surrounding with heavy & noisy traffic. Unfortunately we have not enough time to enjoy the bicycle ride around the lake.
Bliss!. A perfect place for meditation.Energy is very strong on the lake .In the evening people of the city come to the lake and dance,exercise,meditate.This is very positive !

Go early in the morning. Definitely visit the lake early in the morning (before 6:30) to catch the local vibe. It is a gathering place for Hanoi residents of all ages for exercise of many kinds. A stroll around the lake puts you in touch with the people on their own terms.
