A place of Relaxation in Old Hanoi. This area around the lake was just amazing! it was like a sanctuary of peace and a breath of fresh air. In the early morning and evening, the locals gather here to exercise, play game and even do some ballroom dancing. You can see families out for a small stroll... However, be aware of the street hawkers. There are very persistant and I paid for a very overpriced set of postcards (about $10 for 10 postcards). After buying from one, her friend came over and wanted me to buy another set from her...

Very nice touch to Hanoi. We encountered many volunteers who wanted to show us Hanoi for free and they were very friendly by the lakeside.The lake is located at the heart of the city and we enjoyed visiting the temple. When we walked around the lake, we saw couples taking photos and many interesting scene of Hanoi.The next morning, we also participate some excercise with local women, very lovely !

Early start recommended. Worth getting up early ( 5.30) to watch the locals exercise. Very atmospheric as crowds seems to converge on the lake to do tai chi , dance etc . Worth losing sleep to savour the experience

Nice lake to walk around. Getting across the street from any side in order to be at the lake is a challenge due to the quantity of vehicles (motorbikes) and having to dodge between them. The lake is pleasant, although you do have to pay to enter the pagoda on the island in the lake. Crossing the bridge has no charge.

Nice relaxing space day or night. There is a temple on the lake connected by a red bridge, admission for entry. There are ice cream parlors and cafes arond the lake. It is a nice stroll in the centre of Hanoi next close to the Old Quarter. We saw many bride and grooms having their photo taken around the lake and if you visit the lake early enough, you can catch the locals doing a bit of morning laughing yoga!
wonderful surprise. Who knew, this amazing lake with it's distinctive red bridge is right the very heart of the city surrounded by some wonderful rooftop restaurants
The sword is gone. The bridge is nice, the temples are nice, nothing wrong with the lake. There is a giant turtle... But it is dead. Nice not a must see...
Nice place to Visit. Nice place to visit to get a feel for central Hanoi. Good mix of tourists and Vietnamese visitors, nice, easy walk around the Lake.

FRESH AIR, NICE WALK & NATURE. Autumn is best time to visit Hoan Kiem lake: Blue, high and clear sky. There is nowhere in Hanoi you can see the deep & clear blue water like at Hoan Kiem lake! The lake is surrouded by lot of trees --> make you feel relax & peace! In front of Ngọc Sơn temple, Thê Húc bridge is stand out with the red. On October 10th, many people come here to take photos, especially students & young ladies. Normally, they wear the aodais on that day --> so cute! And also, many couples come here to take wedding photos

Beauty Surrounded by Motorbikes. It's a beautiful relaxing walk in the middle of the city surrounded by motorbikes on all sides. The view from the bridge is beautiful and it's a wonderful place to sit and watch the world go by.
Chill out in old Hanoi. if you are looking to run away from a chaotic Hanoi and the crowd,this is the place.Grab a drink or have a coffee in one of the coffee shops on the lake edges.
It was hot and humid when we visited. We cam to the park around the lake to rest but found it to be crowded and provided no relief from the heat.

relax time. This place wehre you can take "time out". In early morning (06.00) there are local doing sports and runnings. Daytime is good to look around and walking and evening is perfect time to relax. Just sit near the lake and enjoy local life. Beautiful view and peaceful surroundings are guaranteed. I spend my evening time many hours there, its unforgettable
Nice walk. While we didnt go see the temple in the lake or anything, we did walk around the lake a few times during our stay. Beautiful scenery.

Nice lake in a great location . We stayed in a hotel right next to the lake and it was nice to walk past it every time we wandered in to the Old Quarter. It was also nice to have a drink overlooking the lake. Very large, peaceful lake in a very busy part of the city. Has an interesting history behind it too. Wish we saw a turtle though :(

chill out like a local. there are touristy spots along the lake but it is big enough comfortably accommodate both the tourist horde and local populace.Hanoian couples, families and elders spend much time along the lake from early evening onwards.keep an eye out for the group exercises and games of shuttlecock kicking amongst the locals!

A center point of all activities. The lake is a center point for all activities, in the morning one sees elderly doing tai chi etc, the younger men working out with weights, Zumba, Aerobics etc is all happening here. There are ice cream carts with kids teaming around them. The area around the lake is impeccably maintained, it is a pleasure to take a slow stroll around watching the hand pulled rickshaws, the electrical tuk tuks, people playing shuttle etc.. Do not miss an evening walk around..

Early morning Hanoi. Go for a walk around the lake early in the morning (from 5-7). It is really interesting to watch all the activities. You will see walkers, ball room dancers, fan dancers, badminton, martial arts, Zumba, yoga, laughter classes and more, all in the cooler hours without the traffic mayhem. In the evening it is a great place to sit and watch. We met many local students wanting to speak English. They were all genuinely friendly with no other agenda.

The center of Hanoi.. Hoan Kiem Lake is located in the center of Old Hanoi. It is surrounded by many of the sites that you will want to visit, so access is easy. The charm of Hoan Kiem is all encompassing. I have been on warm, sunny days and rainy days as well. A stoll around Hoan Kiem is a great way to unwind and enjoy nature and the city and the people. A great place to people watch as well.

Beautiful area. Hotel was close so walked around the lake every morning and sometimes evening. Always felt safe - in the evening college students will approach and ask to talk to you. They want to practice their English - this was a surprising and wonderful occurrence as they would answer as well as ask questions.

Peaceful oasis in the middle of town. A nice and relaxed area where you can escape from the hustle of the town. Sit down on a bench and just enjoy the view of the lake, or look at all the people fishing, jogging or just relaxing like you.
Don't miss the lake. Best views from the restaurants to the north of the lake - try City View Cafe for the best vantage point. Nice place for a run. Decent coffee on the perimeter of the lake.

Tranquility in Old Hanoi. Wonderful to walk around both during the day and especially evening. The center of Old Hanoi is filled with both locals and tourists. While the vendors can be a bit annoying it is a small price to pay for the ambiance of sitting in a coffee house overlooking the majestic lake.

hoan kiem lake. the first time i visited was in november 2013 and my friend was kind enough to introduce me to the pagoda in the lake and the lake itself.since then when i visit hanoi i ensure at least one visit as sitting on the bank of the lake watching the peaceful scene and people walking and excercising...and drinking coffee..makes my mind relax and a sense of calm pervades the atmosphere

"Charming at night". Our hotel was in the Old Quarter of Hanoi it is minutes walk to Hoan Kiem Lake area. We walked around in the day time but at night the area is transformed and is lit up which adds quite a charm to the Lake area. It is bustling with life but looks prettier.

A Nice Lake in The Old Quarter. A really nice peaceful place in Hanoi. A pathway circles the lake making for a great jog or cycle. The southern end of the lake was much quieter and had many shady trees. he streets around this lake are mostly noisy, especially in evening.

Great part of Hanoi.. Love this place, full of activity all around it, great to walk, cycle or to sit and ponder the beauty of Hanoi from a shady seat by the trees.Cool at night and all lit up, get down here and have a look.

Great and also shadie. Lovely lake at the bottom of the old quarters .trees are fantastic and wedding parties all day having photos taken about an hour to walk right around , with numerous places to stop and eat or drink . Or just shop ..Also many older styled hotels surround the lake of French Architecture. A really nice peaceful place in Hanoi.

Great for a morning walk. A pathway circles the lake making for a great jog or cycle. The old Turtle Tower sits on an islet whereas Ngoc San Temple sits on an island in the lake. A striking scarlet bridge connects the island to the lake shore. Nearby the lake, we also saw the Martyrs' monument, erected in memory of those who died fighting for Vietnam's independence.

Head to the southern end.. The temple on the lake was interesting but if you've seen others around Vietnam it basically the same. What I liked was the southern end of the lake which was much quieter and had many shady trees. Lovely little coffee shop in the south-west corner were you can sit and enjoy a cool breeze. Especially good between 12pm and 2pm when the streets are quiet but can get noisy later in the day.

Scenic. Nice place for walking, resting, eating observing.As our hotel was near here, had several walks around the lake - always lots to see, people of all sorts doing their thing - English lessons for students, families picnicking, a shoe shine man being questioned by the authorities, models being photographed, places to stop, eat, drink and a respite from the intensity of the nearby Old Quarter

Place to understand Vietnamese Culture. Best place to chill in Hanoi. You get to experience the life of the locals in Hanoi. Furthermore, street vendors selling numerous stuffs along the street in the lake.
Lively park. Peaceful, windy park it becomes alive in the night due to the Vietnamese culture of gatherings may it be long walks, dances, and chit-chats around the area

Symbol of Ha Noi. This is one of the nicest green spaces in Hanoi, which is different from most of other places. Get up early - and walk around the lake and enjoy the locals doing what they love to do. Really “Hanoi”
The Turtle. History. I like the story. I just hope the guide could speak more clearly and maybe a brochure of the place
Heart of Hanoi. Great place for me to sightseeing, early in the morning there are many people do exercise. I can walk around, meet many people there. Very good place

Where everyone seem to be. Strolling around the Hoan Kiem as the sun rises is lovely, as we get to observe Tai Chi practitioners, joggers, dog-walkers, people hurrying to work, fearless travellers, or those simply taking in the crisp morning air and enjoying the calmness of the lake. In the evenings, young and old alike sit around the lake to watch the faint ripples and the lights dancing off the surface of the water as the sun sets from beyond the Old Quarter.

Great night stroll. Recommend going at night (around 7pm). Park is quite clean and well kept. Lit up and bustling with happy family's and couples enjoying some serenity after a busy day. Quite a romantic little stroll.

Lively and full of energy!. Went to the lake for an early morning jog and found it overflowing life. There are people dancing, running, playing every single morning even on weekdays and all the crazy energy which makes up Vietnam can be seen here!

Peace in chaos.. The lake is in the heart of the city. We had a few drinks here to relax and have a rest form all our walking. It is peace in among all the chaos. We paid to go into the temple at the lake, having seen the temples in Bangkok this was mediocre, but cheap if looking for something to do.
Beautiful. So peaceful and beautiful set in the centre of the main street amongst absolute traffic chaos unbelievable.

Beautiful spot right in the middle of all the BUZZ. Beautiful place to sit down and see locals and tourist relax in the shade of the trees. We walked around the lake several times. You can buy a juice or an ice-cream. We met a 10yr old boy who came to the park with his parents to practice his English skills, he explained things about Hanoi, the lake and about himself.Just lovely!
Beautiful Lake. Great escape from the bustle of Hanoi. If you can brave the heat it is particularly quiet at lunch time. Definitely worth a look.
Serene. Had a good stroll around the lake. Found a great cafe on the north west corner (thutya) where we sat for a couple of hours and watched dusk fall over the water. Would definitely recommend!!!

Symbol of Ha Noi. Ha Noi is considered as a capital of lakes. There are hundreds of lakes in Ha Noi. Among all, Hoan Kiem lake is the most famous. You wander why? Obviously, because of its beauty. It is not too large, it takes me about 7 minutes to cycle around it. I strongly suggest you to visit it in the early morning or in the late evening. At these time, the atmosphere near the lake is cool and quite. In the morning, you can see many groups of people(both men and women,old and young) do the exercise and you can ask them to join. They are very friendly and helpful. If you like taking photos, you should go in these time, the sunlight reflects the water that make a beautiful picture. Moreover, there is a ice cream shop near the lake that is called "Thuy Ta" means "sitting in the water". There are many kinds of good ice cream: chocolate, fruits, green bean, coconut that will satisfy you. Walking around the lake and enjoy the peace in a busy capital!

Sit and talk with the locals. If you go and sit by the lake late in the afternoon the local students will come and ask if they can spend time talking to you. Many of them require English as part of their uni degrees and want to become as proficient as possible. We had a great time talking with them and out teenage daughter was a great hit with them.
Early morning or dusk. Highly recommend you pay a visit in the early morning or towards the end of the day. Watching everyone's activities around the lake is very enjoyable.

Relaxing ambiance but very busy at night . Perfect if you wanna just walk around. The walk ways are very spacious and the traffic enforcers are trying their best to catch motorbikes driving thru the walkways trying to avoid the traffic on the road. Nothing much more to see in the lake but the lighting effects are nice. It can get very busy during the night. And we are advised to be careful and mind our belongings when walking around.

Warm evening stroll recommended. Bustling with people but plenty of space to walk and catch the city lights. Really attractive, people having dancing classes in the warm evening, couples, families, friends. Beautiful shady trees everywhere.

Peace and Serenity. We recently visited Vietnam and stayed a few nights in Hano. Hoan Kiem Lake is just a beautiful place, although there are lots of people all around the lake it has a calmness about it which makes you feel peaceful and serene. A lovely lake to take a stroll around.

Very pretty lake near old quarter. Recommend booking a restaurant with a view over the lake for dinner and walking around the lake early in the morning to see how the locals use this environment for exercise and recreation. If you are lucky you will get to see the locals practicing their rock and roll dancing at 7 am and see some interesting forms of Tai Chi.

Peaceful, Serene. Romantic at Night!. At first glance, I felt that the Hoan Kiem Lake - albeit beautiful and calm - seemed to be a little overrated compared to pictures in travel guides and the Internet.However a stroll along the perimeter of the Lake proved me otherwise; little by little. Monuments, structures, and the famous red bridge that leads you to the Ngoc Son Temple are just mini surprises that you will see along your journey. Keep your eyes peeled for both things you see on the Lake and around you, on the shore and just your surroundings. It is amazing that the Old Quarter area, with its busy hustle and bustle, would feature such a serene and calm place amidst.As such, don't be quick to judge. If you have the time, do take a leisurely walk around and check out the Lake at night too! The colours and lights will blow you away.

Great place for a stroll or just top sit and watch people. Find a quiet spot mid morning or mid afternoon as the lake is much quieter. There are lots more people in the early morning or late afternoon. take a relaxing stroll around the lake,

Worth a visit!. Find the giant turtle that is still living in this lake! Why go to Loch Ness?Thanks to the magical sword Lê Lợi (a nobody) received from a turtle, he was able to win all kinds of battles and found the Lê Dynasty! After being emperor, the turtle claimed back his magical sword. All in this lake!

An interesting place. Lovely restaurants near the lake. The lake is a gathering place for locals and foreigners. By night the place comes alive with many locals coming to exercise, meeting up with friends, or just winding down from the hot and humid weather.

hoan kiem lake. Loved the motorcycle traffic around the lake ,busy busy, ate at the restaurant on the edge of the lake near the busy end roundabout cant remember the name of the restaurant.But if you are there why not eat in amongst it and have a the best view of the lake and watch the traffic circle the lake.you can eat elsewhere another time

Buzzing with Tourists yet peaceful. A bit touristy but near the old quarter. Worth a visit but perhaps not the ticket price for the temple. Can be a pit stop if you are tired from all the walking around.

Hoan Kiem Lake and Surrounds. Hoan Kiem Lake holds a special allure for visitors and tourists alike. The long history and folklore surrounding the lake are interesting reading for tourists and residents alike. Tales of ancient turtles (or tortoises) appearing from the green waters of the lake with retrieved swords of legendary rulers lend a rich and exciting colour to the area. The surrounds of the lake are well kept gardens with huge old trees where the local population congregate particularly in the mornings and evenings for excercise or just the romantic or casual stroll in this beautiful environment. An old vietnamese estate and temple is perched on an island across a narrow bridge into the corner of the lake and offers some interesting sights for the sightseers. As a popular meeting spot close to other tourist areas, coffee and tea houses and restaurants abound here and it's easy to find a relaxing perch to watch the world go by or perhaps even spot the fabled turtle breaching the serene lake surface?! For those who want to learn more about the ancient stories a visit to the nearby water puppet theatre is a must.

Lovely Lake, great to have an afternoon walk around. Truely beautiful, however there are opening times to walk across the red bridge to the middle!
A lot of activity around the lake which is refreshing, ranging from tai chi, dancing, singing and lovely people always keen to have a chat!

Be prepared for some attention though. Hoan Kiem Lake certainly provides some "peace" from the Old Quarter that lies metres away (northern side). Adjacent to the lake (near the Old Quarter side) is the entrance to Ngoc Son Temple. During the day around the Lake, near the Temple side, there are many people asking you to purchase food or goods...which is not usual, but quite constant. In the evening, I did not feel that the attention was evident though. The Lake has much history which is worthwhile reading about. There are many restuarants/bars adjacent to the lake, particularly at the Northern side of the lake. Definitely can't go to Hanoi without visiting Hoan Kiem Lake.

A nice walk . We had the chance to take a nice stroll around the lake one evening and my wife and I found it very relaxing. It happened to be scorching hot that evening and even so the presence of the lake seemed to drop the temp (although it was probably mental) it's hard not to run into the lake as it is in the center of town!
A must for visitors to Hanoi. An impressive spot in the center of Hanoi. It is a must for visitors to Hanoi. The small island with the golden turtle is however sometimes slightly crowded.
Quiet temple where everyone goes.. Nothing much to see but hordes of tourists come in because is is central to the District. Liked the quiet & peaceful surrounding, can rest around the lake any time.

The hub of the city. Great for a stroll around under something shady trees. A lot of activity - especially in the early morning with runners and Tai chi going on. Also an easy landmark to orientate yourself with

Peaceful and Relaxing. If one is based in the Old Quarter it is a short walk to Hoan Kiem Lake where you can find a bench and watch the locals having photo shoots for their upcoming marriages or just relax and take in the peaceful surroundings. Also great for a walk and a visit to the island across the Red Bridge (small fee) where there is a sample of the famed turtle that is supposed to live in these waters. There are great views of the lake from the many adjacent restaurants based in the HSBC and City View Cafe buildings on the circle.

A magnetic pull!. You cannot help but be drawn to the lake. It seems to be the centre of the city. The fable of the lake gives great insight into the traditions of the city and in summer, there is some relief in the shade surrounding much of the lake. There are a lot of hawkers who may approach you whilst walking around the lake so be mindful of this. The best thing I found was to get up early one morning and go down to the lake's edge to watch th locals exercise. We got there before 6.30 and there was still lots to see but some people we passed on the streets were clearly walking back from having finished their exercise. We saw lots of people doing tai chi and dancing and the funniest thing was a huge group doing Gangnam Style. We're talking about women who are 50+ which is what makes it so interesting. This is a must see in my opinion.

Nice stroll by the lake. Local people and tourists mainly walk around this area. My visit was perfect! It was a hazy and rainy morning. The atmosphere was tranquil and the view was beautiful. You should take a slow stroll in the morning to see the local lifestyle and appreciate the scenery.http://townske.com/guide/2205/northern-vietnam-travel-guide

Timing to the Airport. If you want to be in walking distance of this lake try some hotels near the old quarter. It's more like 35 to 40 minutes in traffic from the airport, 45 mins if traffic bad. With the new freeway, it's an easy ride into the lake area. I was told it was about 500K Dong from Airport to near this area. Note - when changing money - you will get better rates near the ANZ Bank/BaoViet Bank. The rates at the airport are not good at all. Singapore Dollars is not widely exchanged (at all banks) so bring USD if you need hard currency to exchange.
Peaceful and Beautiful. Take a walk around the lake in the early morning. It left you with a peaceful feeling. Locals were relaxing and I kind of wish to have such a beautiful lake at my own town.

Nice to walk around. We visited this site one hot evening for a casual walk. There's plenty of tourist friendly restaurants nearby and souvenir shops. The lake itself is picturesque but nothing wild. Worth cruising by if you're in the area.
Take a walk.... With cooler weather on offer it was a wonderful day to stroll around this quaint lake. It's story is far more intriguing. Enjoy!

A nice place to take a walk or just sit and relax. It's a nice leisurely walk around the lake with plenty of places to stop and sit. A lot of shade makes it nice on a hot day. Seems popular with locals and visitors, lots of young couples holding hands, it's very nice.

Great for early morning walks !. This lake is a hop,skip and jump away from the Old Quarter. We spent a couple of early mornings at the lake and were surprised to see just how many people -young and old came here for morning walks, tai-chi, line dancing or playing badminton.A complete lap around the lake at a decent walking pace should take you about 40 minutes.In the evening, the lake is lit up around the perimeter and it looks very beautiful. With temperatures lower than during theday, I would imagine an evening stroll would be even more enjoyable.We were here on a weekend and Sunday night was super packed, which made it feel like there was a lot happening- we love the hustle and busltle of this area including the Old Quarter.

Lots of activity. We took the advise from Trip advisor and headed out for an early morning walk around the lake. What an awesome scene. Everyone out exercising was very inspiring. The look of the lake is beautiful, but having people perfomrming in groups, and badminton games taking place every corner was such a great scene.

Educating. Couldnt see the big deal,, we however became the attraction as various people wanted to practice there English and ask questions about our culture. To use this became very enlightening as it gave us the opportunity to ask the same type of questions on observations we were making on how the people were going about there day

A wonderful break from the bustling streets. I walked around the Lake both in the day and at night, I loved the Japanese bridge and the colored lights in the trees. Always something to see here and a photo to be had.

Lovely place!. In the middle of the Old Quarter you will find this lake. You can take a look at Ngoc Son Temple (VD30,000) or take a walk around the lake. It takes about 30 minutes and you pass two cafes.Or you can just sit and relax on a bench and watch people take their power walk and yoga classes.It is nice to get away from the scooters, but be aware when you cross the road. Then they are all over the you!Defintely a place where you can use a couple of hours between sightseeing or at the evening when they light up the lake.

Anytime ..Any-day !!. This place has some magic .... I love to be there whether its early morning with loads of people exercising or late on the evening when, people from all walks of like dress up and just roam around.Get your self immersed in the old quarter and the small stories of Hoan Kiem lake. Try the local ice cream beside the lake or get yourself sketched in $5 .... All worth for the rich experience of this 1000 year old city.

A great place to sit, relax and have an icecream. Sitting on the benches eating an ice-cream or wandering around the shoreline is one of my favourite experiences when unwinding in Ha Noi. The lights on the water at night are lovely.

Worth a walk throguh. Worth a walk through on the way to the old quarter, nice to out out in the middle of the lake, no English translation so not sure what we were looking at all the time but a pleasant experience.

Good way to wind down. We walked here from our hotel in the Old Quarter. Definitely worth checking out, very chilled out. Lake is very beautiful. Many people sit down and read a book or just take time out to look out at the scenery. Restrooms located near the footpath. Note: Please be weary of the shoe scam, my partner was approached by a middle aged man wanting to "fix his shoe" when in fact they put thread solvent on your shoe then offer to fix it for you.

Beautiful lake, a break from the shops. A beautiful lake. Walk over the red bridge for the views, you can also buy a ticket to enter the centre of the lake.Be careful of locals who try and fix your flip-flops/shoes if you are sat down...quite funny...but they will try and fix or polish your shoes for money. No harm done by them though

A little green place in a crowded urban area. This is a precious green place in a crowded urban area.The Sword Lake is the symbol of Hanoi. A lot of people excercise here in the morning. A walk around the lake could take up to 30 mins.Another attraction around here is the Ngoc Son temple which located on the island closer to the Northern bank, with the The Huc bridge connect the island and the bank.

Better at night. The lake looks good during the day but even better with the lights on at night. Lots of locals and foreigners sitting around the lake, some topless men jogging, lots of activities around the lake at night (e.g. aerobics class, ballroom dancing, etc). Good for a relaxing stroll or just to sit and stare at the turtle pagoda.

Nice for a walk. You can walk around the green lake and see the locals exercising and meeting. There is a nice temple and bridge for photos, and a little cafe across the street for refreshments later.

Could spend hours sat by the lake. Beautiful peaceful lake right in the heart of Hanoi. Locals and tourists alike would often gather by the edge, sitting and chatting or eating food. It's a great way to spend a few hours in Hanoi. There's even a temple on a bridge in the middle if you want to check it out.

Visit very early or late. Get up early and wander down to the lake to join in any of a number of activities ranging from Tai Chi, kick boxing, ballroom dancing or just walking. Later in the evening, especially as it was very hot when we were there, people are out walking, sitting with cool drinks and just observing life go by.

Another way to kill your time.. I just like to stroll around the lake and viewing at the people passing by. After that you can sit in one of the local coffee shop near the lake and killing time by doing nothing, it's totally relaxing for me. Just try.
A cool place. A cooling place to walk around in the heat of the day, you should find out about the legend of the lake before going to the Water Puppet show which is close by.

Great place to take a walk. This is one of the nicest green spaces in Hanoi. This is one of the few places you can (usually) walk around in the city without fear of being run over. Lovely place to spend some time.

Get up early. If visiting Hanoi, do yourself a favour. Get up early - and walk around the lake and enjoy the locals doing what they love to do - get out and enjoy themselves, whether it be dancing, exercising, tai chi, playing soccer or bad-mitten, or laughing. You will need to be there around 6:00 to 6:30 am, but the experience is fantastic.

I never miss the early mornings around the lake.. This is the place to walk at 5am each morning. Do a few laps and see Hanoi waking up. If you are lucky and energetic join in the Tai Chi with the locals. I do this every day I am in Hanoi. Alternative visit on a weekend when the courting hanoi couples are out and about. Great fun
Great history.. A great place to learn real history of Vietnam in the Ngoc Son temple at middle of beautiful lake. Also good place for morning exercise in busy city.

Take a stroll . See Hanoi life as you walk around this pretty lake. Enjoy an evening drink as you people watch both the tourists and locals. Lake has important historical and religious significance as well as beauty. An oasis in busy Hanoi.

Hanoi's Centrepiece. This is the central place in Hanoi for meetings, walks, and wedding photography. Cross the red bridge and visit the temple for an alternative view. Around the lake, you will see sketch artists, people playing golf with badminton shuttlecocks, and meet the occasional local student wishing to practise their English.
The Walk !. Walk around the lake in the morning and evening to witness Hanoi and the people in their true self. And since old Quarter is near by, shop a little !
Good location. A great place to have a lake. Whole area a little dusty and tired. Difficult to cross the busy road safely to get to the lake.

Like many other lake in the city. Ok, you can walk along the lakeshore but it's like many others in the city, only point very characteristic is the temple (I believe it's a temple) right in the middle.

Beautiful. Fabulously pretty lake, lots of benches to sit on and take in the view. Very clean area and spacious. Unlike in Ho Chi Minh City you can sit here and not get harassed by street vendors. Also lovely cafes at various points around the lake.
Lovely!. Lovely place to have a walk around. Many places to eat/drink nearby which overlook the lake. Just a must when being in hanoi!

Little jewel in the lake in middle of Hanoi. lovely temple in the lake. This is the lake of the restored sword tale. Preserved huge turtle to see. Working temple with Vietnamese people paying respects.

Lovely Lake. Our hotel (The Golden Lotus) is just a few blocks from this lovely lake...a central point of activity. The walk around the lake is beautiful, with so much going on both flora and fauna. We stopped at a restaurant to enjoy iced coffee (yummy, and ice is not a problem here!) while enjoying the view and posting photos to family while using the free internet. We also grabbed a tuck tuck (bike) driver for an hour ride around the city...fabulous! We paid too much, $9.00 for the two of us, however it was worth it (costs a lot more for something similar in Western Europe). Our driver was super nice, informative, and funny. He took great care of us, even covered the front when the rain got a bit heavy. Bottom line...head to the lake and enjoy some Hanoi experiences you will remember.

Lovely place to walk around and/or relax with evening drink. Vietnamese equivalent of the Passeggiata occurs along the lakeside in the evenings. A great place to relax around at any time of the day however, with island temple of Ngoc Son at one end and the Turtle Tower at the other end. A couple of k's to circumvent and at the bottom you can branch off into the French quarter or rest at the lakeside cafe/bar and people watch. Soft-shelled giant turtles still exist there and it is a good omen if you spot one. The legend has it that when the country was occupied by the Chinese in the 15th century, Le Loi, a resistance leader, caught a splendid sword when fishing there and it assisted his victory over the Chinese. Later, as Emperor Le Thai To, he rowed across the lake to return it when with a clap of thunder a golden ‘tortoise’ popped up to take it from his hand. It is said the turtles will be there again in times of national peril. (Think King Arthur and the Ravens of the Tower...)A very imposing statue of To in a square can be seen on the opposite side of the road leading alongside the lake on the way to the french quarter. Just before you reach it there some savvy female street money changers

Awesome. During the day or night, this lake is so beautiful. A must see if you are in Hanoi. Day time shopping of local products can be done around here and during the night you can just enjoy coffee and admire the view.

Beautiful and serene. It's a well maintained lake with 3 temples on its banks and a beautiful park. If you have time it's a must see. One of the temples has a beautiful bridge connecting it as its in the middle of the lake.

history lake , good place. this place have nice history.in the morning you can exercise around Hoan kiem lake. vietnamese people is friendly and when we walked around Hoan Kiem lake some student want to talking with us

Beautiful. This lovely centrally located lake has a nice temple that you can walk to where they display the remains of a giant turtle. It's a nice spot and worthwhile. It's a pretty standard tourist site so you'll probably see it when you visit Hanoi.

A Place to have a Relaxing Stroll. Hoan Kiem Lake is one of those " must visit" places. It has the Ngoc Son Temple on an island in the northeastern section of the lake and the famous Turtle Tower(Thap Rua) in the southern end although red star that is supposed to be on top of it must be in for repairs. The lake is a good place to have a stroll around and on the southwestern side, there is a kiosk where you can sit and have a drink at reasonable western prices. The photo is the view of Turtle Tower from the kiosk.

quiet lake in bustling city. Lovely spot to get away from the city streets for awhile.
Footpath circumnavigates the entire lake and is easy
walk from all hotels. Just watch the locals trying to sell you things
and using there children as bait.

Be careful!. A group of us, strolling down the lake on evening, just before dinner, beautiful,no doubt ..you get to see the locals hanging and chilling but be careful, one of us nearly got pick pocket! We manage to see it happening on time to stop it from happening!
Relax a little. Nice to see a bit of old Vietnam, take a walk through it's well worth it, go early morning if you can when it's a bit cooler

Beautiful Part of Town. We came here a couple of times to walk around and enjoy the lake. Close to some eateries and stores, easy to get to from most areas for a cheap taxi ride. Full of people strolling and enjoying the day.

Heart of the city. Hoan Kiem lake is considered the center of Hanoi. It's nice to walk around and the old quarter is very near by. And you can see many locals doing work out or just sitting there enjoying the scenery, especially in the early morning and late afternoon.And in case you were lost in the old quarter, the easiest way out is looking for how to get to Hoan Kiem lake.

Must visit day and night. Relaxing and an easy walk to do. Shaded areas, beautiful gardens and sites to see along the way. Locals gather to exercise, chat and relax.At night it looks totally different with the lights.We loved it ..... Just to have time out.
Nature's air-conditioner on a hot day!. Very peaceful and relaxing along with the much needed cool breeze on a hot day it's Nature's own air-conditioner on a hot day!

A beautiful lake to hide from the sun. This was a beautiful area in the touristy district in Hanoi. Many shops and restaurants surround the outskirts of the lake. There are two islands in the middle of the lake. The island on the north side of the lake has a temple which you can cross a bridge to visit. I'm unsure of the cost to visit the temple as we did not go. There is also another building on the southern island in the lake that is inaccessible. Walking around the lake is shaded and there are many areas to sit down. The lake is close to many other sites in Hanoi.

Center of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is one of the famous tourist & local attractions.According to the legend, emperor Lê Lợi encountered the Golden Turtle God (Kim Qui) surfaced and asked for his magic sword, Heaven's Will. Lợi concluded that Kim Qui had come to reclaim the sword that its master, the Dragon King (Vietnamese: Long Vương) had given Lợi some time earlier, during his revolt against the Chinese Ming Dynasty.Lợi renamed the lake to commemorate this event,formerly known as Luc Thuy meaning "Green Water"). The Turtle Tower (Thap Rùa) standing on a small island near the centre of lake is linked to the legend.
Relaxing. Nice to walk around, tons to look at, lots of stalls and shops. The temple in the middle of the lake is lovely, not a lot to see but entry only costs 30000.
Great scenery. It is a beautiful lake in the heart of the city. You could have Vietnamese coffee and enjoyed the view of the lake.

Focal Point of the City. The lake provided a great focal point and pretty red bridge and turtle house in the centre of Hanoi (and landmark for getting out of the Old Quarter when lost). It is really nice to walk around and soak up the atmosphere and view the traffic from the relatively peaceful setting.

Good break from the busy Old Quarter. We were fortunate to have stayed in a hotel merely a few steps away. We joined in with the crowd exercising in groups, early hours of the morning; had our midday snacks at the benches under the shades in between shopping n sight-seeing at Old Quarter; and went for late night stroll before retiring for the night.

Beautiful area. This is just a very beautiful area surrounded by bustling roads and shops. Lots of local people and tourists walk around the lake which is very shady and has some gorgeous temples out on islands.You really can't miss this lake if you visit Hanoi, as it sort of bridges the Old Quarter and French Quarter, but I recommend taking the time to walk around it and enjoy the view...probably best to do it early in the morning to avoid the worst of the heat!
worth a visit. this is a little sanctuary in the middle of hanoi ,its only less than a £1 for entry , you should find it and go

Morning visit or late afternoon. The morning at 6am is best as local residents are doing tai chi or running. The bridge and turtle monument are beautiful in the lake. It is a lovely walk with plenty of photo opportunities.There are some markets near the bridge that are good. I recommend doing this walk and then walking the old quarter. Makes a great morning activity.

Beautiful lake (better at night). A oblong shaped lake in the middle of old quarters. Can't really missed it as it is like the central location to any parts of old quarter. Many cyclo peddlers (was a definite rip off though. We were charged 100 000 dong per pax for a short distance). Many couples hanged out there, a few budding sketches that drew portraits at 100 000 dong and a red bridge that linked to a small temple in the middle of the lake.It's a nice lovely walk especially where wind flows freely and you get that occasional cool breeze in the afternoon. During the night, it is transformed into a colourful spectacle.
A place of calm in the middle of Hanoi. There is a little coffee shop at the bottom end of the lake where you can sit and have great Ca Phe and food and while away some time.
Beautiful at night. Very crowded, at times. Nice lake with a small island linked to shore by a bridge. Gate to island was closed when we were there. Very scenic. Near Old Quarter.
Nice little Temple. It's right outside the Old Quarter on the lake. It's a pretty Temple jutting into the lake. A very pretty setting with an interesting story. It's worth seeing.

Average lake although the temple was quite interesting. The lake itself is quite average, nothing to shout about. Although amidst the hustle and bustle of Hanoi it is a welcome change of scenery. The temple in the middle is quite an interesting visit.

Just take it all in. Hoan Kiem Lake is at the centre of Hanoi, just past the Old Quarter. Just sit and relax after an amazing walk around this water area. So relaxing and take in all the sights, smells and the people. Everyone sits down has a chat ,people excising and riding bikes, people just walking and enjoying the atmosphere, a must walk . Local in there lunch time ,just relaxing and enjoying the lake.
A. Beautiful place. A beautiful lake that comes to life in he evenings... You will see people dancing , exercising they even have their own Gym equipment...

Picturesque . Hoan Kiem Lake is at the centre of Hanoi, just past the Old Quarter. It's a lovely walk and surrounding it are little cafes and restaurants. Just be aware that it's expensive compared to cafes and restaurants that are just a street away. There is a turtle living in the lake that is over 500 years old according to the Vietnamese. There are people sitting around the lake waiting for the turtle to raise its little head above the water as this is very lucky. Apparently it happens only once a year. Definitely worth a visit.

Steeped n folklore. Walking round the lake you can soak up local flavour especially at lunchtime when office workers take a break. It has interesting folklore associated with it. However it is not particularly beautiful and not that well looked after. Bu when in Hanoi it's worth a shot. There a a few eateries at one end where you eat Vietnamese food and drink the local beer.

Nice to walk around the lake. The lake is next to the old quarter, not that big but still interesting and beautiful. Its a good place to walk, sit down, relax and see alot of other local people doing their thing. They have lunch, dinner, listen to music, jog, dance, talk,... Theres also the red bridge, very nice to take pictures. You will alot of newly married couples taking their pictures here because of the view. There are also two temples in the lake.

Peacefull. Take a cyclo ride around the lake it's beautiful and very tranquil. Early morning people doing their morning excersises others going for a brisk walk. A place where people meet up to have a chat or just go for a stroll. The temple on the lake is very colourful and worth crossing the red bridge to see.

Relaxed place in the busy city. Compared to the old quarter in the north of the lake it's very relaxed.There are some nice cafes around the lake bur be aware that they have much higher priced than just 50m away of the lake.If you're visiting Hanoi you will see it quite likely when you're on the way to something else.

Hoan Kiem Lake. A restful but busy place for refuge from the heat! Watching the fish in the water is amazing..so many of them! Then there are the eating places around the other side providing excellent meals and refreshments!
Lively and historic. Plenty of locals dancing and exercising to music or just sit and watch the world go by on one of the many benches

Always a pretty sight. Hoan Kiem Lake is probably favorite spot in the center of Hanoi. The red Huc bridge over the lake is always a pretty sight and the lake is a great sight even at night.
Its popularity, even with locals, is evidenced by the number of couples who have their pre-wedding pictures taken around the lake.

Nice evening walk . It felt nice to take an evening walk by the lake to take a rest from a bit chaotic and hot city. We stayed in a cafe for cup of vienamese coffee and ice coffee drink. Prices there are quite high as compare to what you get in the city, only location pays it off. Then we walked over a small bridge leading to the Temple of the Jade Mountain. The ticket price to see the temple was 30 000 dong per person. Temple is quite small and there's not much to see there, though if you want to hide from sun and enjoy the lake view when being in the shadow, it's a good place to stay for a while.
Peaceful and Relaxing place.. One of the best place to relax and enjoy hanoi alone. This place has a very relaxing and peaceful view, I'm hoping to go back in this place.

Small lake surrounded by busy traffic. This is a small lake. You can walk around it in half an hour. It is next to the old quarters and surrounded by busy road. A good place to sit down and rest if you are walking to the old quarters. There is not much else to do.

The only peaceful area in Hanoi!. Come here for a little bit of peace in an otherwise frenzied city. Watching the locals practice T'ai Chi in a morning is a wonderful sight. Beware of young groups of people approaching you asking if they can practice their English, I've heard it's a scam.
Nothing much. . The lake is dirty. Not much to see. Would've given it one star if not for the outdoor gym. It's amazes me that people work out like that in the open with rusty weights.

Sanctuary in the city. Take the time to stroll around this little piece of paradise in this very busy city. I walk each morning and enjoy the crazy mix of exercise activities that are being enjoyed by many Vietnamese as they begin their day also. This is a great place to be and I am so glad that they are utilising this great space. Enjoy it folks

It's a small lake.... It's a small lake...there is an attractive little red bridge going over to a temple; the photos look better than it does in real life.Lake could do with being a bit cleaner.Lots of activity going on around it, people exercising, sitting, taking photos etc,Nice place to have a walk around.Looks nice lit up at night.I'm told there is laughing yoga there in the morning, didn't manage to wake up in time to go and watch it/join in though...

A Legendary Lake in the Centre of Twon. Great walking paths around the lake. The red bridge is great for a few nice photos. Dont bother buying a ticket to go into the temple at the end of the bridge - no one seems to look after it and there is nothing to see. Just go for a stroll over the bridge for free and grab a few snaps.

A very pretty lake. Hanoi has lots of lakes, making the city a charming place to be in. Hoan Kiem is well lit at night, with the temple in the middle of the lake looking very romantic. Excellent little temple museum you access over a bridge. Worth a visit. Worth a walk around the lake and sitting with a coffee or drink or icecream and watching Hanoi go by.

Second visit. I love visiting Hoan Kiem Lake as it's a really good way to gain insight into Vietnamese culture - if you go the the Water Puppet theater, one of the skits will make more sense if you've already visited Cua Rua (the giant turtle) at Hoan Kiem. Has been repainted since last I visited (2012) and is a good place to have a rest if you're overheated.

A great walk in the evening. Enjoy the view at the lake. But the best thing about this area is where you can do alot of shopping spree. Further and can find a lot of hawkers with numerous dishes. You will be spoil with choice.

Tranquility amidst bustle. Small lake near the Old Quarter. Nice spot to stop under the trees and people watch. I would advise anyone to go early in the morning.... 5.30 to 6.00 and see everyone exercising around the lake. Its a fantastic scene. Join in the tai chi, the dancing, the jogging, power walking etc, then have a coffee a rest then back to your hotel for breakfast. See the street sellers getting ready on some of the streets on the western side of the lake. Loading up bikes, carrying sticks, selling from small stalls by the pavement. A scene full of colour, energy and commerce and one which you could have seen years ago. Buy a mango, have a piece of watermelon or join the locals for a great bowl of Pho. We went there twice and would wander around again. .
Lovely area for peace and quiet. Great for a peaceful walk, there is a great history associated with ths lake. This is enoyed by both tourists and locals.

Day or night, a lovely spot.. This is where the locals go, morning, noon and night. While the lake is beautiful is gorgeous on its own, making a stroll around the perimeter a must do, be sure to visit at night, grab a coffee and a snack, and then settle in for some people-watching.

A Great Walk. A walk around the lake is absolutely beautiful and well worthwhile, with a whole bunch of small attractions and nice cafes along the way. However, don't take a tuk-tuk - they are overpriced and tend to scam travelers.

A place to meet people. Go to the lake - find a bench to sit on - enjoy the view - and before you know of it you will be talking to some students who want to ask you about your country and they also like to tell you about their country. You will have a wonderful time!

Good for locals spotting. Being one of the main tourist attractions in Hanoi, we were surprised that this is really the place to be for locals as well. Just sit down on a bench and watch the locals do their morning walk, exercise or just sit there and relax. We enjoyed being there. Just watch out for the ladies selling sweet donut thingies. We were hungry and said yes. Before we knew she filled a bag of these things and charged us 150000 Dong for it (6USD). Since this was our first day in Vietnam, we only realized later that we overpaid like crazy.
Good walk. great for a walk in the morning or evening when it cools down. Some good cafes to sit at and have coffee or meal.

Hanoi city lake. we went for a walk round the lake at 7 in the morning to avoid the heat wave and it was a fascinating experience with people doing thai chi, zumba, walking dogs, etc. very pleasant and later in the day we visited the temple in the middle of the lake - pleasant enough.

Must Visit the Lake of Restored Sword. Ok, this lake in the middle of the old quarter, is also surrounded by bustling traffic. The lake itself is quite worth the visit, with a temple at one end and memorials to the great scholars of Vietnam at the other. we walked the entire surrounds of the lake, found temples and shrines of interest, the odd great restaurant and bar, shopping streets and the like. This is the hub of Hanoi in some respects. At night the locals come to sit and view the lights and the floodlit shrine in the middle of the lake, have an ice cream or just go fro a stroll. If you are in Hanoi, a must visit.

A pleasant park and lake for a stroll, or a run.. I ran around this lake every morning during my stay in Ha Noi. It is a beautiful and peaceful place. It is good break from the closeness and noise of the city streets. There are several places for coffee, and ice cream or cold beer along the shore. On the weekend, during day, I had several groups of students approach me to practice their English. It took me a moment to realize that is what they were doing. As a tourist in nearby Old Quarter, someone approaching you is always an attempt to sell you something, part of being a tourist. But the students are very pleasant to speak with, energetic and enthusiastic to learn English by speaking with native English speakers. It was kind of fun to go over there today, knowing that it would happen.The first day here, I got up about 5AM (jet lagged), thinking that I would have the place to myself. Wrong! Ha Noi wakes up early. It seemed half the population of the city was here exercising in the morning. But I recommend it for that. You'll see everything from walking to running to weight lifting to old ladies doing aerobics to macarena music.

The heart of Ha Noi. If you have even 1 day in Ha Noi, this is the first place you should come. It has a history dated back hundreds years and a tale to its name. Beside that, it really beautiful to walk arround in the morning or sunset.

The heart of Old Quarter Hanoi. You have to visit this place at least two time, early in the morning and late in the evening. You will experience how this place different between the two time. Hoan kiem lake is always a center of activities for people around ild quarter Hanoi. In the morning there will be lot of people excercising, jogging, thai chi or aerobic within groups. Or some elderly will have lights moves while chit-chatting to each other. A warm comforting view to have. While in the evening the lake provides more merry situation where youngs with enjoy the euphoria of hang outs with friends with the scenery of colourfull lake. They will enjoy ice creams, light snacks while laughing with friends. You can join them too! At the center of the lake there is an island which you can reach by a red bridge laying at the crossing the lake. And in the island there is a temple which preserve a legen of return sword and giant turtle. You need to pay vdn 30.000 (1,5 $ ) to enter the temple. I like this place to get a feeling of being a local of Hanoi ☺️. Enjoyable time

The nice area in Hanoi. When you visit Hanoi, you must stop here. It is a beautiful area with many nice restaurants and shops. This lake is a welcome break from the marketplaces, museums, and crazy traffic. You can walk the perimeter, and try out a park bench and people watch. Nearby you can also find great ice cream shops too.
Beautiful lake scenery. Must-visit place for all who visit Hanoi. Morning and evening seem to be the best time to go. There are many locals so you can do people watching. :)
Really charming. Really charming to walk around and beautiful at night. Lots of nice restaurants around. Didn't got the chance to go early in the morning.

Hanoi early morning and late evening. If you stay a few days in the old city in Hanoi make sure you walk around this lake around 5 or 6 am, then repeat the experience late evening. It is fascinating to see Hanoi without scooters for an Hour, to see hundred of people cycling around the lake and thousand oldish Vietnamese exercising in the cooler hours. Some dance, other do some strange forms of taichi or Qin Kung, others walk or do bizarre gym on benches....And then you lol also experience the small street markets where housewives buy their veggies, fruits and meat.At night it becomes a completely different place. The old generation is gone to bed and the young one chat, eat, dance, or are fully absorbed into their cellphones. The lost sword museum is not really worth a visit unless you have never seen an Asian temple.Interesting to notice how North Vietnam is totally atheist (no temples, churches, tombs...) and south Vietnam is full of Catholic Churches, cemeteries, Buddhist temples, etc

A beautiful small lake in the middle of the Old Quarter.. A beautiful small lake in the middle of the Old Quarter. A nice place to wander around & unwind. try and go early in the morning to see many Vietnamese out walking, exercising and doing Tai Chi. If you are very lucky you might see the famous last Turtle said to be over 100 year old.
Great people watching park. This is a wonderful park in the middle of the city to just sit and watch the crowds walk by. Also it is a beautiful lake and very peaceful.

Tranquility in the heart of a major city.. This lake is located in the heart of Hanoi, come early in the morning, watch the sunrise, and take part in the Tai Chi exercises with other Hanoi residents. If your lucky you may see a turtle, which will give you much good luck.

Easy walk around the Lake. This attraction was close to our hotel and we walked around it a few times during our stay. It was lovely watching people exercising, dancing and playing games around the lake in the evenings and early mornings. This is the heart of the city, cultural, commercially and spiritually and a great place to begin exploring the city from

Worth a walk around the lake.. This is a nice walk and a good way to observe and enjoy the hustle and bustle of the traffic without it 'coming directly at you'. The gardens surrounding the lake are always changing depending on the season and there is always something new and interesting to see.

beautiful lake and temple. This is a beautiful lake in the middle of the city and you can easily spend time walking around it, eating snacks from vendor (don't eat the porprofiteroles, doughy pieces of deep fried batter), watch the street painters sketching portraits and people watching.On one side is the temple. You cross the red wooden bridge into the temple and it's clearly a popular place with tourists and local alike. While many seem to be sincerely praying to the almighty, most others are happy clicking selfies, climbing the branches of mangrove trees, surrounding the temple. We saw a lot of students, crowd around an old gent, who was writing scrolls on papers for a small fee,I guess it's something like a 'wish' letter. Then there is the large stuffed turtle, by god..he is huge and guess spotting a live one in the lake, is considered lucky! One tip is to head to one of the restaurants like avalon, across the temple. From the upper floor balcony, you get a wonderful birds eyes view of the lake and temple.

An Oasis in the middle of Old Hanoi. A relatively small lake right in the middle of the city. It seems that the fountain by the lake is the point that everything in Hanoi is measured from!! The little temple commemorating the legend of the turtle and the sword was nice and peaceful. The walk around the lake was full of people sitting enjoying the cool breeze to people exercising and jogging around it.

Relaxing spot... This is where you can actually relax in the middle of hanoi city. Im here in march so the weather really nice when you sit around the lake with a cup of coffee. When you done maybe you can watch the puppet show just next to lake.

Calm. A beautiful place of calm and serenity on the edge of the old town. A great place to walk or jog round or join the locals doing yoga or Ti Chi. Plenty of cafes restaurants nearby to watch the frenetic antics of the motor cyclists.
Nothing special from this attraction. Nothing much to comment on this lake as I found a lot of people here including beggars.A big lake but the traffic bear this lake was chaotic :(

Worth a look - only need 10 - 30 minutes.. It's a nice enough temple but the tortoise is literally stuffed and kept in a glass box with an air conditioning unit in the corner. Having now seen it I would say it's a nice view but I wouldn't lose sleep over missing it.

Best view in the city. Distance to city of Hanoi is measure by Hoan Kiem lake meaning Hoan Kiem is the centre point for Hanoi. The view is amazing especially in the morning and evening and if you are an avid jogger, jogging around the lake is the best way to enjoy this place.

Peaceful lake in the middle of Hanoi. Hanoi was very hot and humid in May and streets were dusty and thrash is found everywhere. Amidst all that is this lovely lake that has calm waters and nice greenery and provided a relaxing walk around it.

Beautiful calm and cool in the centre of mad Hanoi. A lovely natural lake, surrounded by trees. Peaceful but right in the middle of the city. The little island with the pagoda was well worth a trip over the little bridge. The bar/restaurant at the top end was pricey but a lovely experience.

Cool off in the evening. The lake is a lovely place to head to in the evening as the breeze pics up and then temperature drops a little. You can see Hanoi locals out and about enjoying the cooler evening and doing tai chi, dance classes, and chilling out. The temple and turtle tower is cool to check out the history of the lake
friendly locals. great walk under shades tress around the lake (1.8km), friendly locals always want to speak/practice english with foreigners here.
Too cool to relax!. Quite cozy & relaxed place. If you have a good company with you then just be around enjoy the beauty, greenery, weather, nice restaurants around. Too good!

Hanoi history. Our guide took us to this site and explained the mythology of the Lake. A guide can be arranged via the hotel It is a must see. We walked via side streets, lanes and took in the sights on the way. Taxi back to our hotel cost $US3

Trip Advisor statt see below. Attention Trip Advisor Staff.
Have just submitted a review of this lake under the title "West Lake". The review submitted is for Hoan Kiem Lake.
Pleas rename the west Lake review with this name
Must see in Hanoi. This is a beautiful lake! I liked to come and strolling around in the early morning to breath fresh air and see local people doing morning exercises.

Best at night. This beautiful lake can be seen as part of your visit to the old quarter. I've seen it both in the daytime and at night.
It is, in my opinion, best seen at night when everybody comes out to stroll around the perimeter of the lake. There are plenty of coffee shops and restaurants to explore as well.

Nice walk. I came here really not knowing much about the place. I found the bridge and the walk around the lake to be quite charming. The $1.25 or so to go to the island probably could have been saved, but it wasn't too costly. Overall, I'd recommend coming here (but don't expect too much on the island)
Excellent for sighseeing and people watching. Went for lunch with 8 other colleagues at restaurant right on lake side. Food and sceneries were great in this area.
Best in the morning. We stayed very close to the lake and, in my opinion, it's best to visit in the morning. It's bustling with locals working out and enjoying the morning before the heat.

Beautiful lake - full of activity. Loved walking or running around here early in the mornign (like 6am). The whole lake was surrounded by locals exercising and dancing etc. Amazing start to every day.

Hoan Kiem Lake. Beautiful Lake lot of History. and we went thru the temple and the view was magnificent. So much to see inside the temple as well
Really Beautiful we enjoyed seeing the beauty and clicked many photos.
Center of Hanoi. Small lake in the centre with a lot of people jogging around. Should take a cycle to go around and also to discover Old Quarter.

Part of any city tour / old quarter tour,. This any how is at the center of the city, so will pass by with any city tour. You should have 0 minutes for visit and you can normally, when there is no special vietnamese day, relax from chaotic hanoi

Now this was a good lake. Our first experience was getting a taxi to the Water Puppet Show at the top end of the lake, you could walk, but it was showery and no problems with the getting a cab and the prices are good. There are electric cars there to do the circuit day and night but we didn't use them. In the day the surrounding paths and gardens are clean and tidy, plenty of seats, the odd café on the lake side but plenty on the other side of the street all around. The lake is definitely a photographer's paradise so definitely take your camera during the day and you could take all the time that you want. We were probably just over one hour but could have stayed longer. It was also our first experience of crossing the Hanoi Streets, it was an experience but no close calls and we would do it again and worth paying the small fee to cross the red bridge into the pagoda.
Hanoi Icon. Worth a visit. There is something strangely spiritual about the lake and the island temple. Great place to walk round at night and watch the local life.

Loved exploring this historic lake. A wonderful oasis in the middle of Hanoi, great walks along the lake, plus the historic bridge.When I was there in November it was graduation time so the lake edges where full of students all dressed up having their graduation photos taken, it was very colorful and wonderful to be there to be part of the celebrations
central lake. public central park, can't avoid it, don't want to..public central park, can't avoid it, don't want to.public central park, can't avoid it, don't want to

Cooling. The lake was relatively more chill than the hectic streets of Old Quarter. Many a time, I would find myself back here to enjoy the light breeze along the lake and to sit and relax. To be harsh and honest at the same time, it was just a lake to me, nothing special.

Beautiful but busy. At first it seems a bit strange as there isn't much grass surrounding the lake (as I'm British its just different to English lakes). There are some very pretty flowers and large trees that branch over the lake pathways and some of the road providing some much needed shade for people walking around it.The flowers and garden patches surrounding the lake are very well tended to and there are many female gardeners always hard at work re-potting plants and weeding.There are ALWAYS people walking around the lake and doing their exercise routines, usually involving fast walking or some kind of independent yoga.During rush hour (5-7:30) it is best to avoid walking around the lake. Early morning or late evening is a better time to hang out and explore the lake, although it is quite small and takes roughly 20 minutes to walk around the whole thing.It is a very pretty lake, and there is so much lore and history about the lake of the restored sword. There is a one pillar pagoda, or small monument on a tiny island near the south of the lake called Turtle Tower to commemorate the legend of the restored sword (Ho Guom), but you cannot access this.The other building on the lake is a functioning red temple (Ngoc Son) with a bridge that you can actually go inside it and is worth a visit. As far as I recall they played traditional Vietnamese music daily that can be heard from anywhere near the lake.  If you ever go to one of the water puppet shows (roughly 100,000VND) they depict part of the story of the turtle who stole the sword from Emperor Le Thai To so that could give you more understanding of the history of the lake.NOTE: * beware of rats in the thick grassish areas, there are also cockroaches in and around the concrete edges of the lake. I think both of these pests are unavoidable in Hanoi in general, just a heads up.* vendors will definitely approach tourists so if you do not want anything you must be firm in saying no thank you -Khong Cam on (khawm gam eern)Hope this is helpful :)

the best lake near old quarter. this lake is brilliant! with the bridge as the facility you can take a picture with hoan kiem lake. this lake is cover by a lot of trees. and there's a small park. if you are a couple, then you have to spend your day in here. because it's not too hot, and you can explore hoan kiem lake in a day. it's very vast. and the view is lovely
Beatiful but-. Go either early morning (7am during May) or late afternoon. Otherwise this picturous stroll with beatiful views could turn into one sweaty hell.
It recommended the early morning hours. This pretty surroundings, walking trails, you can see it is very interesting that a lot of people in the exercise group about 6:30 a.m.
Cool breezes on a hot night. Lots of great energy as families and teens congregate, walk around, and eat ice cream on the remarkably cool banks of the lake.

Beautiful!. Hoan Kiem Lake was awesome. My girlfriend and I visited the temple in the middle for about 30 minutes, took some pictures, and then just sat on the edge of the lake and relaxed. It is definitely a place you want to visit to relax and cool off after a long day around the city or if you are waiting for the water puppet show.

The centre of Hanoi. The whole city of Hanoi is revolving around this lake. It is a wonderful place to be . At night you can walk around the lake and admire the reflection from the water. But the streets around the lake are extremely busy and the path around the lake is the safest way to move around the area without having to negotiate your way through the traffic.

relaxation from the bustle. This lake is adjacent to the Old Quarter and provides a refreshing break from the hustle and bustle. A shaded tree lined promenade surrounds the lake with good views. Ngoc Son Temple is situated in one corner opposite the Water Puppet Theatre. Beware of unscrupulous taxi drivers touting for busy by the lake and keep just sufficient money in a top pocket to pay. Do not show a wallet which must be kept hidden. Refreshments can be purchased from lakeside kiosks.
symbol of where u are standing. it is very nice ,and for me a reminder of just how capable the country was and is ,certainly done to the last detail
A must see. A pleasant morning walk around the lake, a visit to the Pagoda one day, then back again at night when all is lit up.

Worth a visit. Picture perfect and a peaceful place to wander round this very pretty lake and with cafe's overlooking the lake to enjoy a coffee/ ice cream and watch the locals and tourists or nearby to watch a water puppet show

A nice place to be at any time of day. In the morning, you'll see lots exercisers. In the evening, couples and others strolling or sitting or eating ice cream. It's always a good place to walk around because there are convenient places to sit and cafes on the west side to get refreshments. I've seen the giant turtle twice (really), but I've spent many, many hours near the lake over many years. Be sure to go to one of the cafes at the north end and get up to the 5th or 6th floor to get a great view, especially at night. Go across the red bridge, too. It's the best and therefore the most crowded place to see the Tet fireworks, especially from the north end; get there early.

Nice lake and good crowd. It's a nice early morning or late afternoon walk around the lake. Quite romantic actually. And since it's right in the old quarter it's even better. Plus read about the lake's history and its unusual resident.

My Favourite place in Hanoi. If the capital does not have this lake... How is this...??? Early in the morning you will see people walking, exercising for new day. Around afternoon is Local life of HaNoi.and romantic nights for every couples come here.I tried great ice cream and coffee from a famous shop (could not remember name).Do not miss out it

A Refreshing Sight at the Heart of Hanoi!. After shopping around Old Quarter, we chanced on this beautiful and peaceful lake. What a refreshing sight especially in the late afternoon when you get to see locals and tourists alike flocking in the area! This lake makes Hanoi so unique and simply beautiful!

Perfect place to walk and people watch. Very peaceful and picturesque lake near the old quarter. Fun to walk around and see life go by, sit on a bench with a coffee, or enjoy a bit of relaxation and break from the chaotic old quarter.

Peace and Serenity. This lake is near to Old Quarter and yet it is peaceful. There is a temple on this lake that is related to the Legend of the Restored Sword. If you like to just relax and see how the locals enjoy their evenings, this is the best place to visit. There are also coffee shops along the lake that you can sit and view the Hanoi local scene.

Peaceful lake. Just as the title says, peaceful or in other words, there's nothing much to it. People hang out, some take wedding photos. There's a tiny pagoda in the middle of the lake, however you can go there. Plus, with the heat, you probably don't want to be there for long.
very popular place. a little oasis in Hanoi. Nice around late afternoon when it is getting cooler. Interesting to watch the locals.

Lovely!. Even though it's encircled by busy streets, the lake is like a peaceful haven. It's a pleasure to stroll along the shady shore, and there are open-air cafes as well as an air-conditioned restaurant right beside the lake.

Gorgeous. Absolute must do in Hanoi.The area around the lake is very happening so buy an ice cream, drink a coffee, take pictures and walk around.Perfect time is evening when there is light to take pictures and then night when the lights comes on.You can get some lovely pics of the watch tower.The red bridge is another spot for pictures.I wouldn't buy anything around as it's overpriced.

The best area for tourists in hanoi. Beautiful area, with a lot of hotels restaurants shops ne everything around the lake.On the evening we enjoyed the the breeze, the walking on the beach with thousands of people, dancing and jogging and biking around the lake. We were on the 40's to the merging of south and north Celebration and we enjoyed the fire works and the activity around the lake
very hot spot in hanoi. in hoan kiem lake, so many wedding couples take wedding photos. so many dating couples kiss here. hoan kiem is center of hanoi
Nice Lake. It's call to have this central to the Tourist District in Hanoi. Nice way to navigate your way around the city on foot.

Much more than just a lake.... Lake Hoan Kiem seems to be the spiritual heart of Hanoi. It is most certainly peaceful and folk stroll quietly around the shore.Our visit started with the Tran Quoc Pagoda and the Stupa.The Pagoda is magnificent; one can become jaded with all the Buddha statues in Indochina, but this Pagoda was quite 'invigorating' in a way. The Stupa is also most impressive.

AMAZING!!. This peaceful place was not what we expected to find in Hanoi. In the evening it is lovely just to wander around this.  In the middle of chaos is this peaceful, beautiful lake surrounded by restaurants, shops and close to the Old Quarter. It is a gem and one you will remember always.

Small but fun. The lake by itself is pretty small; one can walk around at a leisurely pace in say half an hour. The environ in the evening is fun experience, though. With locals shooting the breeze and the lights and the restaurants, an hour is well spent at the lake.

Beautiful lake in the centre of Hanoi. This lake has a history behind it as explanined by Ms. Ling our free tour guide. It is the centre of attraction for not only the tourists but the local people, be it morning excersie, evening stroll or just relaxing.

Best photos you can take. Magical place.. You can find lovers sitting there.. Admiring the views... Professional photographers trying to find the best angles for their amazing photos... Locals trying to sell you their goods... You'll get a good feel of Hanoi... Very close to the old quarters

This is the place to be at sunset. It's buzzing and yet peaceful, packed yet pretty. Hoan Kiem Lake is where you can sit for hours and watch Hanoi go by, or walk along and try to decode the currency as you make friends with the street vendors. Lovely trees and walkways. And the occasional wedding shoot to watch as well!

A good evening stroll. We walked from our hotel to this attraction after having our early dinner. It's a big lake and lit up at some places. You can just stroll and take in the beauty of the place. It was quite cool but crowded. From here we walked to the Old Quarter to browse. Quite interesting to pass the time.
Great place. It is nice to walk around the lake. Or just sit on a bench and relax. The pagoda at the lake is also beautiful.

What would the old quarter be without Hoan Kiem. While its great to visit the lake anytime, its best to get up at 5:30 / 6am and take a stroll around to see all the locals practicing tai chi and dancing to music. It's a must see.
In the evening, grab a balcony take in City View Bar and soak up the views with a cold Bia Hoi!

Hoan Kiem lake. Really lovely lake and surrounds lovely walk easy to get to one attraction in Hanoi not to miss
Water puppet theatre across the street excellent

A walk along the lake to relax & people watch, with breeze. I went both in the day and evening on a Sunday. During the day i saw festival celebration and some wore traditional consumes walking about to do photo shoot. There's also a museum in the middle of the lake worth checking out. There's a saying there was a king who borrowed a sword from the holy turtle that lived in this lake to fight against oppression and won. After which he came back to return the sword to the turtle. The turtle is one of the four holy creatures of that time ( including dragon, Phoenix and unicorn). Apparently there's still a very old tortoise that lives in the lake, that is considered critically endangered. I came later in the evening for a walk and it was lovely lightings and breeze. You'll see many couples around and there are quite a lot of cafes to chill. Here, the cafes are more expensive. Or you can go for the cheaper option which is to get ice cream and sit around on the public benches provided.

Beware pickpockets.. Pickpockets operate here,as I found out the hard way,in March.Do not allow your phone to be seen ANYWHERE.I got mine lifted out of my shirt pocket,and did not even feel it gone until I got back to my hotel.It was a street vendor,with a tray held up high,and in my face,who did it.Don't worry about the fruit sellers,they ok.It's the guys who try to sell you those fold-our picture books you have to avoid.DO NOT LET THEM GET CLOSE TO YOU.They use the tray to block your view,and then pick your pocket,and will leave immediately you tell them you don't want anything,unlike the other guys who will badger you for 5 to 10 minutes before leaving you alone.So,be careful.

A delightful walk. It's difficult to rate a lake but I guess it is a real asset to the Old Quarter. This is a lake to use as a "if I get lost place'. If you memorise your hotel in the OQ from the lake, whenever you are out at night, just ask for the lake, everybody knows it!it is a delightful walk both early morning and evening. The morning is taken up with both young and old doing their exercises, the evening, mainly the young courting couples doing what they do. There is also plenty of myth and history to keep you amused.
Location In The Middle of Old Quarter. Most of people visit this place because this is main icon of the Old Quarter, and better visit this place in the morning or afternoon, so not really hot
