Even Better at Night. We walked the whole way around the lake during the day. It was on the Liberation Holiday so everything was decorated and we were lucky enough to have some fireworks over the lake in the evening! What a GREAT experience. Beautiful part of the world!

Serenity. Hoan Kien lake itself is natural and peaceful. The surrounding area though is bustling with activity, with joggers and aerobic activity. A great place to wind down after a hectic day of travelling or shopping.

A nice little oasis in Hanoi. Hoan Kiem lake is a nice little lake to walk around in bustling Hanoi. There is a nice little bar just by the lake, and close to the puppet theatre, called Thuy Ta Cafe, where you can have a drink and food outside and right next to the water. A really nice place to spend a couple of hours.

A quiet place in the city.. We walked around the lake, and it was very quiet, considering it was in the midst of the city. People were sitting quietly, just reflecting on their day, their travels or the wonderful view.
The walk around the lake is very relaxing, the gardens are beautiful.

Beautiful. Seriously beautiful. I just loved it. Sitting under the trees with flowers everywhere is such a great was to spend an afternoon. We bought icecream near by and just had a wonderful time. The people there are so lovely and friendly and will chat to you. It's also such such a great spot for people watching which is a must do. Haha

Great meeting place. A leisurely walk around this lake tells much about Hanoi and the people here. One should know the legend of the giant turtle and King Ly Thai To-we in the West have similar stories. Great coffee shops, restaurants, foreign banks, access to the old quarter. 99% of the people you meet will be great, just watch out for the other 1% who want to take advantage of you.

It was nice to walk around the lake. When it was cool, so nice to walk around the lake. My kids liked waking up early and went out to watch the locals doing tai chi. We also ate the ic cream next to the lake and it was delicious
Oasis. On a hot night, the relief as you approach the lake is visceral. Great meeting place for the locals.

A lovely setting in the midst of a bustling city. We visited the lake 2 or 3 times and enjoyed it as a haven from the frantic pace of the Old Quarter. At night there were many locals who promenaded and gave it a lovely atmosphere while during the day it was quieter and just a nice place to sit and view the pagoda and the lovely bridge for a little while! Then back to the madness!

Beautiful spot in busy Hanoi. A great place to visit any time of day. Early in the morning you see people walking, exercising and embracing the new day. During the day its a relaxing place to get away from congestion and at night its lovely and romantic

Made my niece cry. It was a cold, foggy day and the atmosphere was calm and enveloping. All five of us thought it a place well worth the time to visit. Don't try to take photos the sellers out front will have a pack fro about VND30,000 which are far better than you can take and they need the money.

A must see!. We wandered down to the lake about quarter to six in the morning and couldn't believe just how many people were exercising! Walking, dancing, football,badminton and Tai Chi everywhere! A fascinating experience and I highly recommend it!
Walk around and relax!. A lot of greenery and places to sit around the lake. It is a nice place to have a evening stroll and relax in between shopping!

Place to Rest. I was there on Sunday and everyone - both the Vietnamese people and the tourists - was there. Sitting by the lake was one of the most relaxing things that I did in Hanoi. I really really like the lake!

The heart of Hanoi. Watching the locals greet the new day was a wonderful surprise. You must be there at daybreak, it is all over by 7. It is a moment in time which gives a glimpse into the real psyche of Vietnam

I love HoanKiem Lake. Like: windy, peaceful, be "culture" when local people do excerise, play music,..Nice place that is close to ice cream shops! Many students come here to meet nd talk in English with foreginers, share with them their experience and help other people knw more bt HaNoi and VietNamDislike: chewing gum selling always want to try to insist u to buy something. If u dont buy maybe scold you and walk away. I love ice cream place but as i see there re many bins very very close to it but many people here seems Blind grugru..through rubbish on the sidewalk, or on the lake. Especially i saw many younge people did it! Hope all of us protect environment!
Meeting place of the people. A walk around Hoan Kiem Lake,at any time of day is full of surprises. It is the meeting and greeting place for all ages.

Happening. Morning, the park surrounding the lake will be full of tourists snapping photos and etc. Evening, full of locals who dance, aerobics, tai chi, cha cha and etc around which makes it a very happening place to be. Love the environment here! <3

Nice place to be. Huge lake and really very well maintained by the local council. Central location and always lots of people relax around this place especially in the evenings. Very beautiful in the nights when is lighted up all around. Watched a beautiful fireworks display on 30th April 2015 ( Vietnam;s Reunification Day ) - a public holiday in Vietnam. Lovely...

Sunset of the lake. Sunset is beautiful for the lake view, with ice-cream.. :) We visited in afternoon time, is too hot and not suitable to take any photo, but nearly have many shop can do some shopping. Evening come back and have enjoy the nice scenery and you can have dinner at opposite the lake, some restaurant rooftop can view the town and lake.

Relaxing escape from the city. Take a stroll around this calming lake, maybe sit down and have a picnic. Even if it's located really central, it gives a feeling of having escaped the busy city for a while.
Oasis of quiet. In the centre of the old quarter, this is a pretty lake with pathways all around, plenty of seats under tree cover and a lovely place to people watch, (mainly the locals).

My childhood. I was born in Hanoi, which means each year we saw the fireworks when walking around this lake on New Year Eve. The lake itself is not so special, and is even a bit dirty, but there lives the big turtle which you can see sometimes, if you are lucky, and around the lake are many small restaurants.

Good area to see. Really beautiful, massive lake that's nice to walk around, or sit at and people watch. There are a lot of parks around it that the locals enjoy, but not a lot of restaurants the crowd the area which is nice for a change. You can't miss it when in Hanoi ☺
Nice . Very good place for a evening walk .many things you can do.and see here .a good place don't miss it .

Relaxing. A lovely place to sit, watch, enjoy and just enjoy the whole ambiance of the area. The evenings are wonderful watching the local people exercise and feeling the cool breeze come across the lake. There is also a large supermarket across the road on one side of the lake for all your incidentals.
Nice lake to walk round. Quite a pretty lake. It's nice to find a piece of serenity like this in the middle of such a bustling city.

Walk around Hoan Kiem Lake. A bustling place with lots of things to do and see. Interesting place to mingle with locals and have a leisure walk around. Take a walk around the lake and it takes you around half an hour.

Great for a stroll after dinner. The lake itself isn't a must-see as a tourist sight, per se, but a stroll around after dinner is really nice and gives you a flavor of Hanoi life. Lots of teen couples! :) Also hugely helpful navigational point to get to the main neighborhoods of interest - French Quarter, Old Quarter, etc.
There is lots of life around the lake. Nice to walk around the lake. Different scenery during day and night time. Right in the middle of the city, this lake is stunning and super sized.

lake of leaisure. the view of the lake is good.. i really love the activities of so many locals doing their jogs and bringing their dogs out with them.
many were friendly. language barrier still accounted for since only a few speak english

beautiful area. It was so interesting with all the local culture and information about the area the locals respect it with their memories and their culture. The people treat it with respect and so do the visitors

A small lake, but lotsa people.. 7am, going for a walk(exercise) around the lake close to hotel on Hang Gai.Appears that I was not the only person with this thought! Single and mixed sex groups of people ,some partaking Tai Chi, or whatever , some ballroom dancing, some just stretching , or exercising or what ever, and a number power walking(me).It takes about 20 to25 mins to walk around the lake(some areas are heavily Infestered with people, and looking at the sights does slow one down!)There are a number of must see historical sites,( see once, don't stop next time) that you may visit( if inclined). The weather is not too hot(20+ ) so is quite pleasant.Go again, I go around 4 or 5 times a session for the exercise, the only redeeming feature is the different people that you see doing the same thing!A Pleasant stroll at anytime( can be very hot after lunch ?) very safe. Photo nuts, have a field day here!

Safe walk. The streets around the lake are extremely busy and the path around the lake is the safest way to move around the area without having to negotiate your way through the traffic. If you get up early you can join in with local people doing their morning exercises by the lake.

The centre of Hanoi. The whole city of Hanoi is revolving around this lake. It is a wonderful place to be . At night you can walk around the lake and admire the reflection from the water. You can sit in on one of many cafe around the lake and enjoy a class of beer or a cup of tea.
nice place to sit a while. right in the middle of the old quarter and walking distance from the Elegance diamond Hotel where we stayed. Nice temple over the little red bridge

Nice Attraction. The Lake is small enough to walk the whole way around. The landscaping is very nice and it is very clean. The local Vietnamese people will try to sell you things so just be aware. It is partly shaded by the trees which is useful as it was so hot when my husband & I visited.

Tranquillity in mayhem. The lake is an easy walk from the old quarter, we spent a few hours here prior to our flight home and it was perfect. A stroll around visiting the pagoda, coffee in the quaint cafe's and taking in Hanoi at it's best.
Nice walk round. Lovely place to visit, felt very safe even when it was past midnight. Loads of places to stop and you're not bothered much by street sellers. When you say know they polity move on.
Good place to chill. We always come here to just sit and watch people behaviour. It's like a bug round about around the city. You can relax yet you hear non- stop honking all around you.
Pleasant Afternoon. This was a lovely walk across the bridge and there were a lot of vietnamese students willing to explain everything in english so they could learn at the same time

Get there early!. I had already walked around the lake during the daytime. On my last day I walked around it at 6:30am. This is definitely the time to go. This was one of my favorite activities in Hanoi, to see all the activity of the local people doing their exercises and appreciating the outdoors in the "cool" of the day. I would have done this every morning, so do not miss out.
Nice site to visit in Hanoi. the Lake of the restored sword temple is small but a nice place to see locals hanging out. small fee for tourists to get in.

Great walk around it. My wife and I had a very pleasant walk around the Lake of the Restored Sword, while waiting to attend the Water Puppet Show, which is close by.It was a hot humid day but we enjoyed the walk and beautiful surroundings. People were enjoying themselves and adding to the great atmosphere.Walk around on takes 20 minutes.

Nice park around the lake. The lake itself is steep in cultural history. There is a temple in the lake accessible by a very recognisable red bridge. The highlight however is the park surrounding the lakes. It has nice flower beds and the willow trees are well maintained. Very picturesque from certain angles. At the corner near the temple and outside the water puppet theatre you can find the open cart tour where they charge you by the hour to go round the city. Or you can just sit down at one of the many benches surrounding the lake and look at the calm waters of the lake.

Evening bliss. We spent the evening having drinks at this lake. It was so beautiful and there was traditional music playing from somewhere with all the lights flickering on the lake - a definite must do. I can truly understand why the locals love it so much.

The hottest place in Hanoi. May be it's due to the weather, it was very hot and I felt dizzy when I went there. The lake was not that pretty but all the shopping points are near old quarter and the lake, so we must pass it.
Beautiful lake. Traveling around the lake was really nice, and a nice pause away from the traffic of Hanoi. The Ngoc Sun temple can be really crowded so visiting it early or late can be advisable.

Escape the rat race and relax with a ca phe. Finding the lake was a real blessing in disguise. It's a great place to escape first thing in the morning and watch the tai chi folk and other tourists. Just walk around and take some photos, relax and have a ca phe.
Turtle Lake. very central - once you found the lake it was easy to orient yourself. Nice views over the lake at night.

Small but great. We walked around this lake many times during the 3 days in Hanoi city, since our hotel was nearby. It is a greatplace to walk around to get to other attraction. The lake itself is so interesting due to the life that surrounds the lake.Locals and tourist love to gather and walk around the lake. So much to observe both in the day and night. From exercise to meditation, to ballroom dancing, to lovers having some romance. I had some drinks at a cafe around the lake one of the evenings and it was lovely.

Magical at night. This is quite a peaceful place considering the madness that is Hanoi. A walk around the lake in the evening will leave you with a different impression from a walk during the day, so try to do both.There is meant to be an old Turtle living in the lake and if you are very blessed you will see it - we didn't!

Excursion. Restored Sword lake is located in the centre of Ha noi capital. The best time to explore and enjoy the scenery is early in the morning and at night time when the lights along the lake are on. We can explore Ngoc son temple and the red bridge and also Truc Bach lake is not far from Restore Sword lake. It's worth to be there , don't miss it

A place to chill in a hot and frantic city.. Nice to walk round especially on a hot April afternoon as you get a cool breeze. You can stop to see water puppets, temple or have a coffee or drink at one of the 3 or 4 storey places overlooking the lake.

Good spot for people watching esp during cool evening hours. Right smack in the heart of bustling Hanoi with heavy traffic around, the Lake offers a surprising serene atmosphere despite the cacophony of noise from the traffic and people. The temple on an island, connected by a red bridge, is not much to look at and needs some repair. The Chinese influence is very evident, despite built to honor victory against the Chinese. If one has a short time in Hanoi, the Lake and its surrounds is a "must-visit" place, with the people, the history and an atmosphere that is Hanoi's.

Reunification fireworks and Tai Chi. We enjoy having our hotel a few minutes walk from the lake. Its a lovely place to people watch and while away a few hours. If you are a few days in the city make sure you get up and walk around the lake seeing all the people exercising, playing badminton and of course Tai Chi. I loved watching the groups of people doing Tai Chi in the morning. A highlight for us was being here on Reunification Day and having dinner at the Cau Go Restaurant. The firework display from the restaurant terrace was brilliant as well as the huge crowd below.

Amazing night. We're really lucky when were enjoyed the Amazing night (30/4/2015) - this is very big independent Day of Vietnamese, so there are many people come to around Hoan Kiem Lake at night to see the music performance and Fireworks. I have to say that is amazing fireworks performance we've seen with many beautiful colourful images. Then, we walk around with some friend to try "Bia Hoi" and go drunk to the midnight.

Oasis of (relative) calm. Let's not kid ourselves, this is still the middle of Hanoi, and you won't forget. Lots of other people, lots of street vendors. But sitting in the shade of a tree with a light breeze, with the almost impeccably clean lake in view (they seem to have cleaning personnel on watch, I've never seen any plastic float for more than fifteen minutes) sure will soothe your sweaty brow. Extremely high tourist density may be seen as a plus or minus. It brings along the fact that many students try to strike up a conversation to improve their English, a unique way to learn about the country and help someone out. Can get a bit tiresome after several attempts of people approaching, of course.
People watching. Nice central spot near old town to people watch. You are surrounded by tons of traffic but at least there are beautiful trees surround the lake.
A lovely cool place to spend time. We liked all the busyness of the area but when we went into a restaurant they were not rushing you out.

Take a break. The lake is an area where many locals working in the center of Hanoi come to in their lunch break. Walk around the lake and enjoy the beautiful flower beds and gardens around. You can also sit down and enjoy a cup of Vietnamese cà phê. Make sure to taste before you put sugar because the coffees are usually already sweetened or use sweetened condensed milk.
Serene. A beautiful lake great to watch the locals doing Tai Chi.lovely gardens.You could easily sit there and watch the world go by as there was things happening in all directions.
Good to know. Well, it is considered as the heart of Hanoi so you should definitely have a look. Quite nice lake with beautiful red brigde

Morning run is best. Very busy in evening with dance classes, family photos and wedding groups - so difficult to run through the masses and very hot. Take a stroll in morning and use lake to familiarise yourself with Hanoi

Hoan Kiem Lake a wonderful hangout in Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is central to Vietnamese life in Hanoi. From very early in the morning, natives can be seen exercising, strolling, photographing before the wedding in their full outfits, eating and talking. It is also a tourist hub, which makes it a very colorful place to hang out. There are cafes, both right on the lake, and across the street, where you can enjoy a smoothie or coffee drink, relax, and watch it all happening.

Hoan Kiem Lake. Hoan Kiem Lake e centre of the city of Hanoi. The setting is pretty with a lake surrounded by trees and some attractive Vietnamese and French style buildings. The temple is worth a visit. There are also some interesting shops and restaurants nearby. At night the coloured lights are attractive. The Vietnamese regard it as a sacred place.However, look below the surface and Hoan Kiem Lake is definitely not the most peaceful place in Hanoi. It is surrounded by a busy road that makes you feel that you are in the middle of a roundabout. The continuous noise from the traffic is not the only downside. The lake water is polluted and tourists are frequently pestered by hawkers and students wanting to practice their English. The nearby restaurants are overpriced.Overall, go their for a few minutes to see one of Hanoi's picturesque places, then continue into either the Old Quarter or French Quarter for a more interesting experience.

Comes to life at daybreak. The lake is pleasant during the day but nothing special although the children loved the baby tortoises on sale. The lake really comes to life at around 6am when it seems the all the residents of Hanoi go there to exercise in a variety of ways. Everything from jogging, aerobics, Tai Chi, weights, walking, dancing and whatever takes their fancy. Its worth a visit.

Do it yourself. This is well worth the short walk over the bridge to see this sight. It is included in many of the "city tours" of Hanoi. However we felt the tour guides rip you off as you can so easily do this visit yourself. Just buy a ticket at the little kiosk by the bridge and off you go. They give you brochures that explain everything about the Hoan Kien lake and this particular area.

Every night, take a walk. I was surprised how often we walked around the lake, after a meal, to fill out the night, to simply enjoy walking with the locals. I suggest a nearby hotel and a walk every night .

Go for a stroll, enjoy!. When in Hanoi you should spend some time on Kiem Lake. On a nice day everybody is out walking and the park areas are very busy. Perfect to take photos. You might see some beautiful Vietnamese ladies in their elegant native dresses.

A great place to experience the culture of Hanoi. What I enjoyed here was the interaction with the local Vietnamese people. Some of the students will approach one and strike up a conversation with a westerner just to get the opportunity to practice speaking English. The gardens around the lake are gorgeous and well maintained. If you ever find yourself lucky enough to visit Hanoi then make a plan to get to the lake around sunrise and plant yourself in one of the many park benches and absorb the serenity of the music and the ladies practicing Tai Chi.

Great escape from the chaos of the roads.. Go here (by taxi if you can) and have a walk around the lake. During the day it's busy with all walks of life. There are many shops and places to eat on the perimeter of the lake. The lake it self and the walking area around it is not full of stalls and hawkers. So it's very relaxing. There is a building in he middle and the lake has a story, hence the name (read the guide books or book "Hanoi Kids")The is a temple in the lake that is accessed by a bridge. It's very nice. For photos, I recommend going in the evening when it's all acuminated and very beautiful. At night, I recommend not going alone. I felt safe, but a few shady persons were walking around.

The hub of the city. Although very polluted the lake is a pretty sight with its small island temple. It is very small and you will end up circumnavigating it many times throughout your stay. If you are early enough you will see all the exercising and games.
Beautiful. Really pretty, day & night. We were always drawn there with the trees the beautiful lighting at night, the people doing their daily exercise. Really worth a look.

Take a break here. A picturesque lake with a temple in it. There is also a pagoda on a little island. This is much smaller than the West lake but not as far. At one end there are tour organizers, the water puppet theatre is nearby, plenty of people, the opposite far end is the road to the opera house, right at that corner there is an upmarket Trang Tien plaza, a nice air conditioned place for brand names with many good restaurants and clean toilets.

The Pearl of Hanoi. You just have to visit Hoan Kiem Lake, if not it seems like you haven't really visited the city. Right in the center of Hanoi, Hoan Kiem Lake is the heart of the capital. Be it early morning or late at night, you will have a true "sense" of what the Hanoian life is, as you stroll around the lake. In the summer, I highly recommend a walk for the early risers. Blend in, Participate, Come and see the elderly working on their morning exercises together. If it is hot, grab a Trang Tien Spring Rice ice cream to accompany you :) I am sure you will have an enjoyable time.
Funky Place. Funky place with temple in middle of Lake and a Giant Turtle encased in glass case! Small admission fee - worth a visit as it gives a different perspective of Lake.

Wonderful. The lake itself is surrounded by a busy road. Its a nice walk and you can stop off at the temple but be warned you should check opening times. Sword lake is very close to the Old Quarter and so will be close to attractions such as the water puppet show, and opera house etc. Its really good for a combined visit..

Beautiful, tranquil amid surrounding chaos. Nice lake surrounded by beautiful and well maintained gardens. Many local excercising in the park. Students will approach you to practise their English skills and ask you what you think of their city. A nice respite from the crazy traffic.

This is Hanoi. Great place to walk around especially in the morning and evening. Soak up the central focus of Hanoi, watch or join in with those who use this place for their exercise routines or just sit and be part of the life.
Peaceful in the morning. Love to walk around this lake in the morning, not much traffic around. You can watch the local jogging, exercise...
Lovely Lake in the middle of a busy city.. Lots of activity around here. Nice to walk around. Plenty of people around doing different things. Easy to walk around, no hills.

Best Walk in Hanoi!. My favorite place in Hanoi to walk, sit, enjoy an ice coffee or an avocado smoothie! Two great places to sit and sip, one round outdoor venue Hapro (I think) at the south end, and one long restaurant (the patio outside in back) at the north end.

Lovely area to stroll. This is a lovely area to stroll around, especially if the day is hot, as there is a lot of shade and good pathways. There are a couple of places along the path to drop in and have a cold drink and sit and watch the world go by.

always nice to be here again. this lake offers a sense of serenity despite the bustling life on the surrounding streets and activities... it is very charming during the night with the cool breezes and lightings... happened to see a big turtle with its head floating up, the legend is real!
Lake in middle of town. Only takes 1 minute from our hotel, you should walk around this lake in both night and day. Peaceful with scenery.

Great Evening Stroll. After shopping or dinner take a stroll around the gardens. Neat and peaceful yet there is a hustle and bustle of traffic and shoppers alike. Watch the locals take their daily exercise or stroll their dogs through the park. This is the place where you probably going to interact more with the local folk who are happy to take a pic or two for you. We were privileged to view the fireworks display which was held here at the gardens from our hotel. The locals advised that the place gets too full during the display so we thought it best to view from the hotel.
Go early. Running round the lake watching locals at play and work has to be the best cheap thrill there is in Hanoi.Go early in the morning when it is the most active and the temperature a bit cooler

Lovely place. A great find in Hanoi, made even better having survived the gauntlet of crossing the roads. Not a bad price for entry and is definitely worth a visit given its history. despite being busy we didn't feel rushed or hindered by other visitors. Spectacular bonsai trees inside (rather large bonsai trees) and a nice view. Worth going to escape the chaos
Sword Lake. It's a beautiful lake, easy to walk around. There are any nice places to eat and the water puppet show is right across from it.

Nice walk!. This lake was located close to my hotel and I went for a walk around it. It has a path all the way around and the locals come here to walk their kids, jog, picnic etc. There is a temple at the north end of the lake that you can visit for a fee. While I felt completely safe walking the lake alone, on a second visit with my tour group, we did observe some pickpockets casing out a woman in our group who had a purse over her shoulder. He and his friends were well dressed and tried to blend in with the group but it was obvious what they were looking for. (A common pickpocket scheme in many cities worldwide).

Crowded yet peaceful. When you are there in summer like we were, the best way to see it is through the electric car service it offered at its Boho side. In 35 mins the electric car will be able to take you around the huge lake and throw in an Old Quarter tour too. The car would allow you to encircle this huge lake that houses a temple and a beautiful bridge. It is no wonder that it is a popular place for wedding shoots and romantic couples!

Local flavour galore. Didn't spend enough time at Hoan Kiem lake but I did walk all around it at around 6 pm and I can say with confidence that the ambience and vibe is amazing. As i had read in every travel website, the locals throng the shore in the evening. All sorts of people hang out there, friends, lovers, families, etc. i noticed many people exercising and others jogging along the perimeter. Mostly, people just sit around and stroll along the lake. And what's with all the wedding shoots in Hanoi?

Very nice place. The lake is located in old quarter. On its banks and walks converge adults and children from early morning till late. Early elders are doing their exercises. Young running around or playing. It is interesting to take time to rest from a long walk and observe the people of Hanoi. My hotel was very close and every day I took a few minutes to enjoy this place. We like very much

Best place for an early morning stroll. We headed to the lake every morning anytime from 5.30am and it was such an oasis right in the heart of the city. All the locals head here for a spot of Tai Chi, line dancing, ball room dancing, aerobics, badminton, weight lifting - this is the place to start off your day. Lovely paths go around the whole lake, not too big so do a few laps and enjoy the sights. Nice place for some peace later too as not many people walk around the lake during the day.
Nice lake view. There is a temple in the middle of the lake. Visited the temple with antique and cultural things inside.

Very pretty lake with ancient temple. The lake has gardens down the side, good for a walk. The Ngoc Son Temple is reached over bridge much used for Vietnamese wedding picture shoots. The temple is surrounded by traditional trees and shrubs. The legend of the turtle and sword are part of Hanoi tradition. It was quite crowded when we went.

Sunday Afternoon in the Park. All life congregates here, from tai chi in the morning to dancing lessons in the evening. If you want to see the Vietamese at leisure this is the place to be!A couple of great cafes with offer the chance to sit and watch the world go by on a hot, lazy, Sunday afternoon (or any time).Watch out for wedding "photo days," before the wedding bride and groom get all dressed up, bride has make up done by the side of the road, and they have the formal photos done ready to show guests on the big day itself.

Don't miss the night scenery of the lake. You won't miss this landmark in the old quarter. Day time is flooded with tourists. Night time is much better especially with the lights from the red colour bridge. Less crowded, more breezing .... Many Viet couples are taking their wedding photos around there, you can easily bump into some couples (the bridge with traditional dress) that like to take pictures with tourists.

The heart of Ha Noi - worthy a visit. You wouldn't describe the lake as a must see or beautiful, however it is a wonderful contrast to the crazy motorbikes and hustle and you would be mad not to pay it a visit. It has a great history and story (the famous sword), a wonderful of temple on its Island (Jade Island) accessible by a wooden red foot bridge, and plenty of restaurants and cafes on its edge.

A great way to spend an afternoon. A beautiful place to walk around - a walk that took no more than an hour. Do not miss the temple in the middle of the lake, a relaxing experience whilst learning about the legends of the sword and turtles etc. Afterwards, it would be a good idea to sit in a nearby restaurant or cafe as there are many to choose from at the lake.

Day & Night Visits. Try to visit at both ends ot the day. Early morning is less crowded and serene for walking around. The gardens are very well kept & there are plenty of seats to have a rest whilst taking photos across the lake etc. In the evening it is well lit up & my pictures were not so good. Heather (Oxford)

Peace in the centre of Hanoi. We visited this during the day and also in the evening. It is lovely and you can walk over the bridge and visit the pagoda. It is lit up at night and very pretty. A lot of people gather here and there is a great outside cafe to have a cocktail or meal. It is good to get away from the traffic and noise.
Lake of dreams. The walk around the park, under the shade trees was superb. Low temperature and low humidity made it a dream indeed.

Nice stroll around a scenic lake. Don't miss the temple on the island ($1.5US entrance). Lots of photo opportunities to be had. Legends of giant turtles reclaiming swords, an actual giant (preserved) turtle, and turtles in the lake (though we didn't see any).

Good view for public park in city centre. If you need to relax yourself after shopping in the Old Quarter area, Hoan Kiem Lake is next door to sit down and relax, looking at the lake view, then continue your shopping or massage near by.

Beautiful place to walk around. This is a great place to visit by day or night. During the day visit the pagoda on the Island by going over a lovely bridge. At night the bridge and the lake are lit up and it is lovely. There is always a great atmosphere as you walk around with lots of families about. People will be dancing in some areas and in general, just having a good time.

hoan kiem lake. We walked around the Hoan kiem lake several times during our stay in Hanoi. In the morning we saw people doing Tai Chi, and in the evening, after sunset, some people were doing gumnastics with music, some others were dancing latin, and there were also many many beautiful brides with their grooms. Photographers were taking photos of the happy couples with the enlightened lake as background. We also saw the performance "puppet show", a show with dolls. This show unfolds inside the water. We tasted delicious "street food" in Hanoi's streets, full of life until late at night. "Bia Hoi", their beer, is very tasty.

Beautiful oasis in a busy city. We walked here from our hotel (The Oriental Central) and it's so peaceful. Lots of people out walking, taking pictures, relaxing on the benches. It was a great day with good weather so that helped but this lake is beautiful and calm in the midst of the crazy honking horns (Hanoi and those horns!) and the busyness of the rest of the city.

Heart of Hanoi. Tried to spend every early morning at the lake. What a lively, pleasant place to be. The legend of the lake is very interesting. A pity that there is only one turtle alive now....unfortunately, could not find him...nor, the sword. Maybe next time. Great place for a walk, day or night and just to sit and relax and people watch.

Surprisingly tranquil (in parts!). Walking round the lake is a voyage of discovery - weddings. tai chi, mad mad roads crammed with mopeds, street food, life in all its glorious variants. Take a walk across the lovely Huc Bridge to the delightful Den Ngoc Temple.

Great Morning Atmosphere. Go to the lake around 6am and you will see people exercising in many different ways with music in groups or just by themselves. Join in with them it is great fun, I just loved the atmosphere and the way everyone was doing their own kind of exercise. The area around the lake was very clean and gardens very beautiful always someone sweeping and cleaning.

Excellent Place to relax, & to check out the fabulous Ngoc Son Temple. An excellent place to relax, either in the day or at night (when the Huc bridge is beautifully lit up). The lake also has the fabulous Ngoc Son Temple, which is a must-visit. The souvenirs on sale here are cheaper compared to the same ones at Ho Chi Minh's Ben Thanh market or their Post Office market. The lake has a beautiful pristine view, & is a sight for sore eyes.

Early Morning is The Best Time. Always love to walk around the lake in the morning. The colours make it very scenic. This trip we didn't walk until 7.15am and we missed seeing as many people exercising. I love to watch both the small groups and individuals stretching,meditating, playing sport and dancing. The lake is a part of their lifestyle and it is good to see this area used so well.We always stop at a lakeside cafe to enjoy a coffee and croissant after the walk. The walk takes about 45 mins
Great Morning Walk. I you stay in the Old Quarter of Hanoi, this is a great place to take a morning walk. It is also a great $10 rickshaw ride around at night to get the real feel of Hanoi traffic.

Skip it. Really nothing to see or do here. One bridge to walk on, a temple, and another structure in the center of the lake. You have to pay to see the temple and you can't access the other one. The grounds themselves aren't super eye catching and all set amongst a neighborhood with older buildings with eyesore architecture. There are plenty of hawkers there to make it even less enjoyable if you choose to stroll around the lakes entirety. Unless you have an abundance of time you might want to visit, if not, there are more worthwhile places to see.

A must for everyone visiting Hanoi. A nice area for a stroll, lots of people. The small pagoda is nice, and the waterpuppet theater is very close. The monument of the fallen in the American war is beautiful

Not to be confused with West Lake!. Hoan Kiem Lake is one place you will inevitably end up at if you are staying in the Old Quarter. It is a little bit of an oasis from the chaos of Hanoi. It is also great to jog around in the morning (the earlier the better) and watch the locals perform exercises ranging from martial arts to ballroom dancing.
Nice walk. Nice. Good to walk around our sit on a bench in the shade when it's hot in Hanoi. Although there's more people trying to get you to pay for a tour, taxi etc that you don't want.

Must-visit site in Hanoi. You really can't visit Hanoi without taking in Hoan Kiem Lake, even if you just spend an hour to walk around the lake and take a coffee or ice cream along the way. You'll see the lovely Turtle Tower, positioned as though it were floating on the lake, as well as the similarly iconic The Huc Bridge. The legendary Metropole Hotel is paces away from the bottom end of the lake, while the Old Quarter and its shops are paces away from the northwest corner of the lake.

A special lake view. This is a lovely spot to visit, especially at night. It's a nice walk with the moon reflecting onto the water, and flower stalls all around to buy roses for your special someone. It is always buzzing with people from all around the world. Early in the morning (6am) groups of Vietnamese people do traditional rituals and exercise around the lake, including a Laughing Exercise where people just laugh out loud for an hour. Also visit the Ngoc Son Temple; located in the lake so you have to cross the red bridge. Entry fee to the temple applies.
Fabulous walking area. The lake is in the centre I'd the old town and is easy to stroll around. The market streets radiate from it.

beautiful city centre attraction - great place to relax!. Join the hoardes of locals as the escape the heat of the streets, grab and ice-cream and sit and watch the people pass by. the lake is gorgeous and the perfect place to take a break!

Nice pagoda across the red bridge. THe lake can get a bit chaotic with hawkers and locals everywhere but it has nice gardens along one side with benches and trees to escape the sun. Across the bridge is a little island with a pagoda which is quite nice and gets you away from the busy streets for a while. It's a breath of fresh air in the middle of a crazy city and costs peanuts to go inside, although it does get quite busy of course
Hoan Kiem Lake. A great place for a walk and to watch the passing parade. The centre of busy streets and hectic traffic.

beautiful lake in the middle of the city. It is a nice place to relax, enjoy the greenery and breathe in fresh air instead of walking along the traffic-congested streets and breathing in fumes from the vehicles. It is very tranquil and you can just sit on any of the benches along the lake to rest your tired legs.

Nice stroll. Nice and relaxing stroll around the lake while you get the chance to see what the locals do there. Some walking their dogs, some doing people watching and there's even a "gym" area where you can see all the make-shift gym and equipment. It's really interesting how they put together different items to form those equipment. The lake itself was dirty and looked polluted.
a welcome open space in all the hubbub. nice to stroll around day and night. A popular space amongst locals at night. Some restaurants at the top end have views across the lake.
Nice location with some great restaurants overlooking. The way it's lot up at night, the exercise classes in the mornings which have a certain comedy aspect to some of them.

Majestic. I first visited the lake at night. I observed many couples walking hand in hand, people jogging, or just walking and taking in the beauty of the lake. I was busy snapping as many photos of the beautiful lake and it's historical sites as possible. The lake is full of tortoise, which is second to none to be found among Vietnamese lakes. If you are lucky, you will catch sight of these giant animals rising out of water. And because tortoise is considered a sacred animal in Vietnam’s culture (along with dragon, phoenix and unicorn), Hoan Kiem Lake then become a holy place that nurtures tortoise. Located on the lake are the Huc Bridge which most just call Red Bridge due to it's red color and in the middle of the lake is Turtle Tower. The night view is best due to lighting.

Atmospheric area to explore in Hanoi. I really enjoyed walking around this lake in Hanoi. It's very calming amongst the business of the rest of the city. There are some great cafes on the north end of the lake in the roundabout that have a beautiful view over the lake. Great for relaxing.
Very pleasant place. very nice place to take a walk and observe Vietnamese habits. The lake and the surroundings are very well preserved and clean. A lot of restaurants and shops near bye.

The heart of Hanoi. Marvellous spot, the combination of the lake and the park around it: we admired the landscaping and the great eye for detail. There are places where you come to certain realizations and this spot is one of those. Here we became aware of the Vietnamese attitude, the state of mind and the way of life. Sitting at the lake we had lots of interesting conversations with local people - we went there twice, walked around and sat for hours. A place where we could go every day ;)

Worth a stroll. It is not big, and nothing really spectacular but if you got some time to kill, a scroll along the bank is OK. There is a small temple (connected to the shore by a bridge) at the end of the lake close to the old quarter which has an admission fee of VND30,000 (about USD1.5), I would rather buy a new pair of slippers. There are several temples in the old quarter that has no admission fee and got more interesting things to see.
Romantic. Nice for a romantic evening stroll and we always felt safe. Many fine eating options around the lake. Make the complete walk around and you get a sense of different areas of town.
Very serene amongst the hustle. Looking at water is always so peaceful even if it was green! It is a nice walk around the lake with a dedicated path so you don't have to negotiate with the traffic.

Nice to walk around. after a visit to the temple on the water.you feel like you are mixing in with the locals who come for respite from the heat, gather in the shade of large trees, young couples sitting on the water's edge. a few people asked if we wanted a shoe shine or to buy anything but otherwise, it's quite peaceful.

Evening strolls around the lake were cool and romantic. Interesting place to walk around, park benches, shady trees, juice bars, ice-cream shops, locals doing sketch caricatures and playing hack-sack.

Good focal point but locals seem too busy to use it. Tourists can be seen walking across the bridge at the north end to the island. Some locals gather in the shady areas but I did not get any feeling of connection to it . Maybe if there is a festival or something. Fir us it is not a draw, just a point of reference.

Plan to sit and enjoy the view. I liked the small buddist temple in the lake (small charge to enter). It was peaceful and pretty. Don't miss the mummified giant sea turtle that use to live in the lake (they say it died due to american bombing during Vietnam War). This is a nice place to bring food and a drink and sit and relax.
Take a Stroll Around this Gem of a Lake. A lovely oasis in the middle of the old quarter. A fun place for an evening walk and a opportunity for great "people watching"
Center of town. This small lake is where local and tourist gather in weekend, you can find a night market right near the lake.

Feeling at peace. My friends and I walked thru this lake from the Quan Thanh Temple on our way to the monks' temple, Chua Tran Quoc. We were hesitant to walk at first, afraid that we will unnecessarily tire ourselves. However, our guide assured us that it will just be a short walk and that in no time at all, we will be able to reach our next destination. I did not regret consenting to the walk. I find the short walk very peaceful. Although it was drizzling, it just made our walk more beautiful. We find street hawkers peddling their wares on the side of the lake and some local residents fishing for their food. It was very exciting to see the fish caught by them. Our guide told us that fishing in the lake is actually prohibited, but this did not deter the residents to do the same. The tranquility on this part of the lake was the exact opposite of the scenario at the other side of the lake facing business establishments where tourists flock to buy Kipling bags and purses, Northface jackets, etc. and to relax and dine in local restaurants. The water in the lake appeared to have some litters which proper authorities should address to preserve the cleanliness of the lake.
Pleasant walks. This is a great place to visit for a morning walk or an evening stroll with an icecream after a hot day of exploring HaNoi

An oasis plus best people-watching. For a great Vietnamese experience, walk around this lake, or grab a seat - Watch older people practice tai chi, badminton, and some other very individualistic exercises involving lots of hip movement. See folk fish, younger couples hang out, business people on their way to work, athletes running the lake. Cross the red bridge, pay the entrance fee - Totally worth it for another oasis inside the oasis, plus you'll get to see the body of a 250 kg turtle preserved! Ice cream & coffee shops strategically placed for breaks.

The best of Hanoi. We loved this lake, it,s beautiful and seems to be a real gathering place for all types and ages of people. In the early morning catch the vietnamese people down there doing there excercises, sit in the lovely lakeside outdoor cafe drinking great coffee and people watch, in the evening sit amonst the buzz of Hanoi with the lake lit up, a really great place to get a feel for this charming city.

never feel bored. There are many lakes in Hanoi,but this is perhaps the most famous one. Very beautiful at night, and so many people come to chill out by the lake side. it is safe too as the lake is encircled by busy road with many traffic (yes, even at night).

Beautiful lake. A lake for lovely walks. Many couples photographed there, people who in addition to tai chi, young people who want to be photographed with you. A lovely mix of locals and tourists.We have a lot of good pictures here, but I accidentally formart memory card should not be able to upload

Pleasant for a stroll, morning or night!. I walked around the lake both in the morning (about 8 am, so unfortunately I missed the morning exercises) and at night with friends. Get an ice cream (taro, green bean, passionfruit) and enjoy!

Go early in the morning. We saw some of the best examples of daily Vietnamese life in Hanoi around this lake. Huge groups of older women doing exercise/dance classes in front of the shopping mall across the road form the lake to unbelievably hilarious music, older men doing Tai Chi in the mist, a congo line of older Vietnamese people pounding on each other with their fists while someone shouted instructions through a megaphone, people praying at the temple on the north-east corner of the lake. It was magical. Make sure to get up early and go for a walk around the lake on at least one day of your stay, then head to Cafe Giang in the Old Quarter for an egg coffee to really round out the experience.
solas amid the bustle. lovely to walk around , sit and read a book or watch people doing Tai Qi, you can also sit in one of the lakeside cafes and have a vietnamese coffee

Interesting and nice people. The lake is really together with the area of the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum in Hanoi the only point that breaks away from the chaos of the city. The wide sidewalk that surrounds it is frequented by families with children or people who are footing. Towards evening then we witness the spectacle (unusual for us Europeans) of groups of people of all ages and sex that do gymnastics to music. Inside the lake is to visit the Ngoc Son Temple: nothing special, but interesting for its calm atmosphere and the large tortoise embalmed. In conclusion: the lake itself is not anything special but the people and the atmosphere that surrounds yes!
Just have a stay and watch.... ... people walking, making sport, young couples discussing, taking pictures, ... vietnamese people living ...

A central spot!. This lake in the very central parts of Hanoi is the place where almost all citizens in Hanoi are walking and running around every morning or evening. Or sitting on benches exploring love feelings...
Pleasant and relaxing. Walked around this lake on two occasions during the dayVery nice gardens and surroundingsPleasant place to relax for a while

good to visit if you're in the area. This is a relative small pagoda to visit however has some interesting history. Add to this a walk around the lake and you have a lovely way to spend a couple of hours.
Fantastic !. Beautiful ambiance with a very cosmopolitan feel all around. People are very friendly, great shopping around. Try the street food and Vietnamese coffee!
Legendary and romantic. Charming surrounding and accessible to various landmarks. Different scenery from day to dusk, clear to misty and sunny to lighting-up.
Center of town.. Small lake with a lot of people, worth taking a walk around here in morning to enjoy fresh air with little traffic.
Picturesque, and cool. A great place to exercise the legs, and circulate your blood after sitting travelling for long periods. Take your camera, and learn of the folk tale.
Lovely walk. In order to get out of the chaotic street scene, you must walk around the lovely and peaceful lake. Count about an hour. Stop and have a drink! Very nice.

Beautiful but be safe. We were here 10 days before get this year and look was festive with beautiful flowers all around and decorations done by the municipality to bring in the new year. I loved the walk around the lake.Last I had been here was in 2014 May when it was very hot, but this visit in Feb 2015 was very very relaxing as the weather was just as I liked - cool.The place is a hub for various gatherings and the evening are pretty crowded with people exercising, singing, dancing and doing tai-chi. A walk around the lake if very good, but be aware of pickpockets and people asking you to buy stuff, especially children as they are trained to keep you busy, while another one takes something quietly off your bag. Do help local students who want to practice their english, but that's all... don't go for the stories to see you anything.If you are visiting the Pagoda in the lake then there is a fee for it 20000 VND.

A respite from the streets of Hanoi. Sit in a restaurant on the lake and sigh - a place to relax. Watch the tai chi exercises in the early morning. Visit the pagoda and listen to the musical entertainment being preformed there. Must see.

This place is pretty. Walk around this lake early in the morning to watch people doing Tai Chi, amble around in the evening after your dinner gives it a whole different ambience. Both are a pleasant way to spend an hour or so. Buy what looks like a odd shaped donut from the street sellers, watch as brides to be have their photos taken.

Great for people watching. A great place to walk around and people watch. Ngoc Son Temple is also located at the lake and another must visit if you are in the area. If you are up early enough, a must see/do is a walk around the lake and surrounding area to watch all the locals exercising. Whether it be lifting weights at the make shift gym, Tai Chi, or group dance exercises, it's definitely something to watch first hand.
Walking Hoan Kiem Lake. Very pleasant walk, you can sit and hang out, jog early morning. A nice and pleasant way to slow your day down.
Relaxing....beautiful walking area. Go early morning for the exercising and in the evening for a nice stroll. A relaxing place amid the hustle and bustle of the surrounding area.

A place of quiet surrounded by CHAOS. Don't get me wrong, I will probably return.. I cannot describe Hanoi, but to say that it is Chaotic. The lake is a lovely walk in the centre of the old City. Well worth the walk.
worth a visit. enjoyed the mystery of the lake. You can cross the bridge to the temple and spend a little time enjoying the myth and history of the lake.

Nothing To Get Excited About. Briefly - Just another man made lifeless murky polluted Hanio lake complete with the usual man made rubbish. It's a feature pretending to be something it's not and until the whole population of Vietnam get their backsides into gear as far as rubbish goes it and many other attractions throughout the country will remain unchanged.Only 5% of visitors to Vietnam actually return for a second visit, the Government need to have a serious look at that fact.

Lake is pretty but currently full of green algae.. We walked around the lake & stopped for coffee in a very colonial coffee bar on its shores. The temple in the centre is looking a little tired & covered with tropical mold, but most disturbingly, the lake itself is pretty stagnant & full of green algae, which is pretty much choking it & leaving dead carp washed up on the banks. The paths go all around it, but the surfaces are fairly uneven - watch where you walk.Not very pleasant at the moment.

interesting place for a visit. Situated in heart of old district nice place to visit. Temple to visit with entry fee or just walk aroung the lake taking in bussle of Hanoi. You can pick up electric bus to do a city tour 150000d for 30min for2 people or 250000 for 60 mins. Great selection of eating places close by as is the night market
Hardly relaxing. Far from a relaxing stroll .....the crowds and incessant honking of traffic is enough to drive one straight back to the hotel spa!

Beautiful lake. It's basically centrally located and more like a park with a big lake. The lakes is surrounded by restaurants, street hawkers, cafes, shops etc. it has a beautiful night view as well and best time to go and relax there is during autumn. There is a temple in the center of the lake which can be visited

the lake with a pagoda.. The bridge over the lake to reach the island itself is photogenic. There is supposed to be an over 500 year old tortoise in this lake. The trees around themselves are subjects of attrection. The flowers of different variety and colores attracted us a lot.

A pleasant place for a stroll. On a beautiful Sunday it is a beautiful. Place for a walk with the people of Hanoi, it Isabella easy walk, not too far, not too short just right with sights all around the lake.
must see. It was pretty smoggy the day we walked here but nonetheless it was beautiful and you could walk around the whole lake in probably 20 minutes.
Interesting. A peaceful place in a busy city. Many photo opportunities and nice restaurants along the water. A pleasant place to walk around and take in the city sites

Great Lake to Stroll. This lake is so big and pretty. My daughter and I walked this from our hotel which was only a few blocks away. The lake is filled with people enjoying the view and there are cafes to eat and relax at. Early mornings people will exercise around it and I found the history of the lake interesting. We even saw a turtle pop up. Don't miss this jewel.

It was the End of New Years So it Was Crowded. New Years in Vietnam can be both a joy and a misery. Because Vietnamese New Years extends over several days, crowds are inevitable at most popular sites. Nonetheless, for atmosphere and the cultural experience it is worth the effort. OH, be very careful about wallets and valuables--let's see, we lost one wallet and one small camera..
Bustling hub of Hanoi. Everything happens around the lake!! It was great to watch the thousands of people move by, walk, running, doing thai chi, yoga or even dancing. Such a great atmosphere.

A big turtle......and... The story around this lake is interesting depending on who tells it.
Pay a cheap ticket to enter and then take a look to a giant turtle and a temple that Im pretty sure there are lot more intersting one around Hanoi city. A must for the story...but inside average

A nice place to be. If you don't mind an early start its a nice to place to sit with an ice coffee watching Hanoi wake up with the locals exercising by the lake. A walk around it in the evening is very nice with the pop up salsa and Zumba classes.

The only quiet spot. Fact about Hoi An- this city is really loud. Even the small streets are pretty noisy because of motorbikes and constant beeping. This park is probably the quietest spot in the city. Quite big with a lot of benches and nice amusement attractions ( don't know if the still work), perfect for a short gateway from all that noise.

Good to Stroll around in the Evening.. We walked down from the Old Quarter to the Lake front dodging thousands of Motorbikes coming in all the directions.The walk through the narrow and congested streets to the lake is not very pleasant one, but spectacular.You will come across street hawkers selling the Conical Vietnamese Hats, Street Food Vendors, Vietnamese Bread and Cookies and all sort of things beyond your imagination.The road circulating the Lake itself is spectacular and you will find many Hanoian Locals, Tourists spending and enjoying their evening here.
Nice view. Not much to see but it is nice to walk around the lake and enjoy the local rice-ice cream and watch life goes by

Nice scenic area. This lake is located at the south of the old quarter, within easy walking distance. The lake is fairly small so you can take a leisurely stroll around and take in the sights. There will probably be lots of people dancing or playing da cau, which is like a Vietnamese hacky sack. It's really frustrating at first but with a little practice it's super fun and you'll become addicted to it. Pulling one out and kicking it around is a surefire method to meet some friendly locals. The lake is fairly small, but in my opinion was much more scenic than the larger west lake. There are lots of good places to eat nearby as well.

Small lake. Main attractions and gather place for local people, you can take a walk around the lake and enjoy the view and atmosphere in the morning, also spend time to visit Temple of the Jade Mountain.

The Legend of the Returned Sword. Ho Hoan Kiem means "lake of the returned sword". The story behind the name is a legend. In 1418, the Vietnamese emperor Le Loi fought a war against the Chinese. It wasn't going too well for him so when he walked by the lake one day, he saw a giant tortoise coming out of the water with a magic sword in its mouth. He took the sword and eventually defeated the Chinese army with it. When he was having his victory parade at the shores of Ho Hoan Kiem, the tortoise appeared again and demanded the sword back. Before he could do anything, the sword flew away from his hands to the tortoise's mouth. It disappeared in the water. The emperor had a temple built which can still be seen today. Now, here's the curious thing: In 1968, a giant tortoise was discovered dead in the lake. Scientists estimate that it's at least 200 years old. It is exhibited in the temple (Jade Hill Temple, located on a small island in Hoan Kiem Lake) and it is really huge: I would guess that it is about 1.5 metres long and weighs some 200 kilos.Apart from all these historic facts (that you can see in the shows in the Water Puppet Theatre next to the lake), Ho Hoan Kiem is a wonderful place to relax and watch the wind rippling the water. In the early morning and the evening, hundreds of Hanoians gather at the lakeshore to play badminton or do tai chi. Moreover, when you visit the lake at darkness, the lights of thousands vehicles passing by are beautifully reflected in the water

Good location. Walked round the lake .it is set in the middle of the city .Nice park land round it ,people doing there exercise .sitting in the shade of the trees .It is a nice tranquil place to sit and watch the world go by .People having wedding photos taken what a lovely setting to have this done.
Best place for walk. Hoan Kim Lake is best place for walk in night. there are many restaurants and hotels nearby Hoan Kim in old quarter.

Beautiful walk around the lake. We walked around the lake upon arrival to get some exercise and it was a great way to spend a portion of the afternoon. The lake is scenic and it was a nice way to get our first exposure to Hanoi.
We didn't go in the temple but walked over the bridge to it.

Worth the look. Just go for a walk.. The lake has been restored and it is just a nice place to walk around and enjoy the sights and sounds of Hanoi. It is like Central Park Lake in ways. Families walking around. People talking and passing the time. It was a nice walk and the Water Puppets are close by.

pretty lake in the centre of the city - visit at dusk for great photos. This lake is in the very centre of the city - right by the old quarter and lots of great places to eat and drink. Be mindful of pickpockets but otherwise very safe. The food on the lake is more expensive than other bits of the city but this is Vietnam so cheap by western standards. I would recommend visiting the lake at dusk so you can get pictures of the temples on the lake in day light and when everything is lighting up. The best place for photos is the west side the of the lake.

A gentle breeze. OK - It's a lake in the middle of a city. It does, however, give some open space and on occasions a lovely cooling breeze. Loads of locals walk/run round its shores. Good pavements that are scooter free!! You can see groups of locals doing tai chee - sometimes the music they move to comes out of speakers on trees. It certainly alleviates the overcrowded streets in the old town. You'll certainly want to visit and sit on the shore.

A nice wAy to spend an afternoon. The lake is large enough to stroll round and if you like people watching its a great afternoons entertainmentMany of the reviews I had read about Hanoi before visiting made me nervous about walking around on my own, however after a walk round the lake I realised that it's no different to London, New York, or any other city - you have to be vigilant and not flash around expensive jewellry but you are as safe as any other big city crowd - be it Leicester Square or Times Square - just keep an eye on your bag and camera and be aware of your surroundings.The Lake on one side is populated by photographers capturing their "models" both male and female all dressed in their finery whilst the rest of the lake is just occupied by both tourists and locals alike just walking and taking in the atmosphere. If you do have the time take a stroll round the lake just to soak up the atmosphere. Buy an ice cream from the local ice cream seller - much cheaper than the tourist cafe's - and just wander round people watching - you won't be disappointed.

Hoan Kiem Lake. Hoan Kiem Lake is the most wonder place in Hanoiany one wants to feel the spirit of Hanoi should be here, stay still at least 10 minutes to expose yourself to the environment of the lakeyou can see the past of Hanoi when this lake was still connected to the Red River, you can see the present time with people keep coming to see the lake from all parts of the country and you may feel the future of this city which may still be the most historical place in Asiabe there and feel the lake, feel the heart of the city

Beautiful place for some down time. There is a lot to do in Hanoi but I enjoyed the down time walking around the lake with my husband. Friends that live here love to cycle around the lake so if you have the chance - do that!

Lake amid turmoil. This is a large lake and garden in the middle of the turmoil that is Hanoi. A great place to walk run or exercise and a great place to get away from being run down by a motor cycle, if on for a few minutes.
peaceful view. peaceful in the afternoon - can go for a walk or jogging - also beautiful background for ur snapshot

Worth a pleasant stroll. Centrally located. beloved and much used by locals. Very picturesque, with 2 islands. A small one with a pagoda in center of lake is just for viewing from the shore. Well illuminated at night. Second island, located at far end, has a lovely little temple & exact size brass replica of a huge turtle, thought to be guardian of a magic sword rather like Excalibur. Access is via a lovely red bridge plus payment of a nominal entrance fee. There are all sorts of activities all around the lake like an exercise group for Seniors, various artists & roller rink with rentable inline skates. We were approached by a couple of young Vietnamese who politely requested opportunity to practice their spoken English. It was an excellent experience to learn about Hanoi & local customs. My wife & I found the interchange to be lots of fun.

Romantic Place. A place worth visiting during the day and especially at night. It becomes interesting at night because of all the beautiful lights and all the wedding shoots done all around the lake. It is also a good place to do people watching, some doing morning exercise while others try to catch some fish from the lake. For the best view, try to go up to a roof top cafe to get a bird's eye view of the lake.

Great at anytime of the day. On my first night in Hanoi, I walked a roundtrip from the Melia hotel up to Hang Cot between 10pm-1am and found Hoan Kiem Lake to be a magical place. I got some Banh My and Banh Bao from the street vendors for my late night feast by the Lake:)around 5:30am on my 2nd morning from the Melia hotel, I ran through the quiet street to Hoan Kiem Lake. It seems the whole city was there in the morning. It was an amazing sight to see. The next morning, I came back with my GoPro and recorded everything and everyone: ballroom dancing, walking, running, weight lifting, Tai Chi, Kung Fu, badminton, Yoga, line dancing, Aerobic class, Zumba......you get the picture:)I also recorded my conversations with the locals. I find them to be the friendliest people. Since then and in my 2 weeks stay in Hanoi, I frequented Hoan Kiem Lake at every hours of the day and find it to be safe and magical.
magic placeTake a. Take a walk right around the lake.Walk over the bridge and visit the Temple.Forget the noise of the traffic and enjoy the history and serenity of this magical place.

Heart of Hanoi. It was misty rain the whole stay in Hanoi, but the red bridge of the Hoan Kiem Lake stood out in the greyness. The old Turtle Tower on a tiny island at one end was misty, looming out of the lake. Certainly without warm sunshine there were no turtles in view on the island. We visited the beautiful old temple at the end of the bridge, for which you pay a small entry fee, enjoying the serenity it gives despite the many visitors and worshippers. Some delightful trainee tour guides asked us if they could film us listening to their talk about the lake, and so we stood and listened to a sort of Vietnamese version of the Excalibur story... a sword given to a King of Vietnam, with which he vanquished enemies and saved the city. He returned to the lake to return the sword. A huge turtle emerged from the lake, and took the sword into the depths, but if ever Hanoi is under threat again, the sword will once again appear to be used in its defence. The lake is a gem in the centre of the hubbub of traffic in the old quarter, very pleasant to walk around. Lovely gardens surround it, between it and the road, and many people enjoy them. We saw a number of bridal couples having their photos taken with the beautiful lake and tower as backdrops to their traditional wedding clothes.

Lovely place. This place is worth a visit and it is situated near the old town. Many students will come and ask you questions because they are practising english skills. Don't be afraid and enjoy the ride. Many people run and walk around the lake in the morning and afternoon. Great romantic walk at night.

Lovely place. Wonderful to see how many locals enjoy this wonderful place in the very heart of the city. The gardens surrounding the lake were impecably planted and maintained and the temple on the island was special.

The Excalibur Story, Vietnam version. The story of the restored sword is almost the same as that of Excalibur, except that instead of The Lady of the Lake, it was a turtle that handed out the sword and took it back. The hub of old Hanoi, you can wander around it, visit the island temple across the Rainbow Bridge, and look out at the little Turtle Island.
A bit let down. Strong reviews had me excited- I was let down! It's a nice walk around the area. I wouldn't go out of your way to see it. It's green water polluted with lots of dead fish!
sword lake. quiet place to relax and easy to access to 36 old streets in Hanoi. Sword lake is one of the most tourist attraction in Hanoi

Lake of the returned sword. Steeped in Vietnamese history going back to 1418. Read up on it before you visit & you will appreciate it a whole lot more. Cross a small red wooden bridge (The Huc Bridge) that leads to the entrance of an 18th century Buddhist temple, called the Temple of the Jade Mountain. There's plenty to see and plenty to do & a 'must visit' when in Hanoi.

Something not to miss. Hotel staff (May De Ville, Old Quarter Hanoi) suggested we take a walk on our first morning - the lake was close by the hotel, and a lovely cool spot to enjoy. We had the added bonus of being approached by a number of lovely young students with learning English with a polite requests to chat with them to allow them to practice their skills. Visited the temple on the lake also - charming and worth a visit

Peaceful water. This makes for a great early morning walk all around the lake. There are a couple of cafes to have coffee and sit and watch the early morning rush hour speed past. And then stroll past the people practising Tai Chi or exercisiing, joggers enjoying the empty paths and couples dancing the tango and waltz together.

The bridge was nice ... but. I don't want to downplay this location, because compared to the rest of the city, this "lake" is really a wonder - but is it really a lake? I'm not sure if it's big enough to call it that. The bridge is, however, nice. That's for sure. With that said, you'll find many people recommending you go here and I do as well, but only because I'm not sure where else I recommend you to go.

An oasis in the centre of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is well worth a visit especially in the evenings & around Tet when it is lit up. It only takes about 30 minutes to walk all the way around. Visit the pagoda on the island which has a small entrance fee of 30 000 VND & open until 21.00 at weekends when it is particularly atmospheric across the red bridge. There are several cafes, restaurants & bars where you can sit overlooking the lake from the lakeside or from a rooftop.

Romantic walk or a jog around the lake. There are people lingering on the many benches around the lake , join an early morning Tai Chi group or have a cuppa at numerous roof top restaurants offering gorgeous views of the lake with the red Chinese bridge that reflects elegantly over the still water.

Interesting lake temple but a bit tatty. The bridge over Hoan Kiem Lake looks stunning both during the day and at night. We visited late February (getting towards the end of the high season) and it was crammed with mainly local tourists but as Tet holidays were still going on that was to be expected. The temple itself was not much to write home about but had a huge stuffed turtle. Lots of lovely flowers in pots and bonsai but those were typical of everywhere you visit in Hanoi. Very modest entry fee (about US$1).

Hoan Kiem Lake. Just another typical lake with nice view.Best to visit off-peak hours and AVOID weekends, as the place is super crowded.Hoan Kiem Lake is lighted with colourful lights after dawn creating a very nice ambience.
Beautiful Lake. This Lake is huge and the day we saw it it was misty and gracious looking, definitely worth a visit.

Pretty and a nice walking/exercise area. I love seeing the locals doing their exercises and tai chi around the lake and many people bring their tiny dogs to play and socialize. It's a big photo shoot destination especially around sunset and it's fun to see the photos being taken. I never saw the mythical turtles that live there but I wasn't looking all that hard.

beautiful scenery. I was there in Hanoi recently, everyday was foggy... The lake is suitable for you to sit down and relax or take a stroll around the area. We managed to take a stroll around the lake.. I like the view most in the morning... you can see people rushing to work, elders doing their exercise.. and you should go to the lake at night as well as they light up the place. it was so beautiful. especially at the bridge. the night view and a red bridge. what a nice view. ;)you can easily go to this lake if you stay in old quarter.

A breath of fresh air in the city. The city of Hanoi is pretty manic so this is like an oasis in the middle. The lake is really nice and there are some beautiful bridges going across it. Definitely have a look if you are in the area.

City Centre Lake!. The Hoan Kiem Lake in the centre of Hanoi is large enough, but small enough to walk around, it's tree lined, there are flowers, restaurants and cafes around the boulevard that surrounds the lake - there is a beautiful bridge that you can walk over to a small island, where there is an ancient temple (if you want to go into the temple then you need to buy a very reasonably priced ticket before you go over the bridge - saves time going back!).A lovely, restful place and a good opportunity to take photographs too!

Pleasant Walk. Really enjoyed the walk around the lake taking in the local Vietnamese culture. Able to stop at a good restaurant half way round. Best to stay lakeside since crossing the road, one just walked and they drove around you. However across the road plenty of places to eat and alternative things to do.

Beautiful. you are going to enjoy the view and atmosphere... Different at day and night both beutiful, it seems government pays more attention to lake and area ... Its cleaner and with flowers and decorations.If you are bored and you wish to meet locals just sit somewhere there and they will approach to you (most students) and they like to start a conversation, to practice english. Good for relaxation also.
A nice escape. The lake is a very welcome escape from the hussle and bussle of Hanoi, lots of shops and cafes dotted around the fringes.A good place to spend the afternoon unwinding

Nice place to take a walk. A refreshing breath of air in the midst of all the traffic and buildings. The scenery is beautiful both in the morning and at night, and there are many good restaurants or cafés to pick from around the lake. Locals come here for morning and evening jogs or walks with their family, so you can relax here and take in the local culture.

walk around. we walked around this lake to get to places quite a few times - definately a place to walk around at night when city is all lit up and the nightlife is zooming past. On dusk and early morning you see all the locals by the water doing Tai Chi - join in - is lovely to stroll around and relaxing - beautiful atmosphere. if you want to go to the temple on the island there is a fee, but you can walk over the bridge - just not into the temple.

Beautiful setting, great location. The lake is beautiful and the temple is lovely. Lovely to walk around the lake as well. Great restaurants around the lake too for enjoying a cup of coffee, desert or a meal. The location is close to the french quarter, the puppet theater, plenty of shopping.
Beautiful. Wonderful oasis in the middle of the old city. Take time to walk around it. At night magical photographic opportunities.

A Good Morning Exercise. This lake provides you with an amazing scenery while you want to stretch your legs. I prefer to do this in the morning when there are lesser people who come in their tour groups. However, don't expect to see much here. I am just very pleased and contented to be surrounded by the colourful landscaping and the cool weather around. Do look at the sculptures and walk across the red bridge just for the thrill of it.

A lake in the city centre.. This is most unusual, as politicians tend to build towers in the city centre: instead, here you have a small lake and a beautiful red wooden bridge leading to an ancient temple. You have to pay a small fee for the temple small museum.

Hoan Kiem Lake- a favorite spot for photographers. Wandering around Hoan Kiem Lake- top destination in Hanoi city tour on a sunny Sunday afternoon, you will catch sight of many young men with their professional cameras stick to their eyes and beautiful young girls in their fancy clothes attractively posing.Apart from being a renowned attraction in Hanoi with the Turtle Tower serenely surrounded by the bluish water and deep blue sky, Hoan Kiem Lake is also a favorite spot for photographers. With 1.7 kilometers of pavements filled with freshly green trees running along its circumference, the place makes itself being a vividly colorful background to take photographs with. And when the sun goes down, sparkling lights on the trees will sparkle just for photographers to catch such precious moment on the verge of the sky turning twilight.

Must go for Day and Night. This main attraction for Hanoi city which must walk around it in day and night. The night view of the lake with the Hanoi city is so fascinating. Must try the night view from higher building although those cafe much more expensive but really worth it. There is a temple cross the red bridge but need ticket to enter and it not worthy for me as I'm no so with historical. This lake famous for wedding photo shooting.
