Rolling around the Lake. The Hoan Kiem Lake is really a great area to hang out. You can take a walk around the lake. There are 2x very modern shopping centres at the south of the lake, the old part in the north of the lake, many restaurants, shops, cafes. I love to just roll around the lake on the scooter and be part of it.

Nice walk. The lake, definitely not for swimming) is a nice place to people watch and just sit and relax and enjoy your leisure time after a long tour or day of shopping. It is much better at night because the water is filthy. If you go there during the day you can actually see the filth but at night, all water is dark anyways lol. There are many excellent photo opportunities. I wouldn't buy souvenirs there as I tried and the vendors are asking crazy prices. The bridges light up and it's pretty fun to just sit and relax and do noting because you are on vacation.

Lake beside busy road on weekend. Visited the sword lake on a Saturday afternoon on my way to buy tickets at the Thang Long water puppets theatre. It's just beside the busy roads where the vehicles are honking away & there r lots of ppls at the bridge. Definitely not quiet during the weekend. Maybe it's only an oasis during weekday.

Nice to stroll around and people watch. Some of the reviews say that it is not tranquil or peaceful. Yes, the cars and motor bikes are a constant buzz when walking around the lake but add in the serene music coming from the temple at the north end and the fragrant scent of marigolds and find the calm is there. Enjoy he scenes of artists doing sketches, brides and groom poses for photos, and people relaxing on benches and taking photos.

Two contrasting views. I enjoyed walking round the lake early in the morning, enjoying the hazy view and quiet street with lots of people exercising. In contrast, night time was full of street vendors, people and noises. There was a café across the street which had a rooftop terrace with a good view of the lake and surrounding.

An oasis!. Hanoi is incredibly busy and noisy, but a walk round the lake, a stop to admire the view on one of the many park seats, or a visit to one of the cafes is an enjoyable experience.I also ran round the lake early one morning and was amazed at the number of people taking exercise -- mostly stretching and static exercises, but also some walkers and joggers, a group dancing, and several groups playing badminton. Definitely worth a visit!

Interesting place. the lake is not that large but has interesting Pagoda's and at night is lit up with different colours. Lots of local people have their wedding pictures here in traditional dress and first thing in the morning you can watch the older generation exercise. Overall an interesting experience.

A delight. Go at dawn to see Hanoians doing their pre-work Tai Chi, ballroom dancing, badminton etc on the shores and in the surrounding streets. Go at dusk for street food and romantic views of the red bridge. Other times just join the ambling crowds.
Lots of areas to take a selfie. Very picturesque so bring your cameras! Nothing great about the temple, though. Also, it can get very busy and difficult to take decent photos.

Just ok. I didn't find this lake to be peaceful becuse cars and scooters are zooming around it. You can walk around it quite easily as there is a good path. Overall it's just ok, I have seen much prettier lakes in other countries in nicer settings.
Another Getaway from the Hustle Bustle. This and West Lake provide a welcome respite from the pace of Hanoi. Here too, you can stroll, jog or just sit and enjoy the calm.

Lovely Little lake in a busy area. nice place just to walk or relax and watch everyone else only dislike here is the amount of cyclos... we got one and was scammed make sure your very clear where you want to go and where you want to come back and agree on a return trip price don't pay more than what you agreed.

Nice place for a jog. This lake is a nice little oasis in the center of Hanoi. It is surrounded by an interesting mix of restaurants, shops and the water puppet shows. Great place to get dropped off and wander, or go for a jog on a misty morning.

Can waste a few hours here :). Lovely lake right in the centre of busy Hanoi. We were a short walk from the lake and stopped to eat at a restaurant overlooking the lake which was nice to see it from another perspective. When walking around there are lots of benches to stop and take in the scenery on your way around and usually see a newlywed photo shoot which was always good fun! Also there's a little temple place over a red bridge which is nice. Worth a visit if your in the centre and want to waste a couple of hours.

Perfect for a Sunday stroll. We walked the circumference of the lake and enjoyed not only the green waters and the tree branch reflections, but also watching all the couples and families enjoying the afternoon. It actually was the first time in several days with no drizzle. There are scattered benches and a pretty arched red bridge leading to a small temple-like building.

Lovely setting. Our hotel was very close to the lake and we enjoyed a couple of visits to the area,it is such a relaxing place. To go away from the hustle and bustle of the Hanoi streets.A stroll around the lake lets you see various aspects of the city,all kinds of characters,there is an abundance of benches situated all the way around so you can stop whenever you wish and look across the water and see if the the turtle surfaces with the sword.A visit to the Temple is a must and only takes a short time.
Peaceful. Go here to get out of the busy, busy city. The area is very big. We went there in the early morning and did Tai Chi with the locals.

Relaxing But With Energy.. Beautiful lake and quiet area to walk around, relax on a bench, sit at one of the cafes and have ice cream or coffee, see the temple, watch people; all surrounded by the of hustle and busyness of Hanoi. Great spot as destination or to get away from commotion.

Walk all the way around along the water's edge.. Were here in the period before TET when the gardeners were planting flowers, laying sod and sprucing up the environs for the upcoming festivities. Our hotel was just a 5 minute walk away, so we came daily and had walks during the day and in the evening as well. Walking on the path right beside the water gets you away from the hectic traffic noise quickly. If you sit on the benches for a while, you may be approached by a student to practice their English and help with grammar and pronunciation. Or you may be asked to take photos of tourists. A nice respite from the intensity of the city.

Lovely place to while away an hour or two!. wonderful place, so peaceful during the early morning, people watching gives you an insght into "real life" the locals make the most of all they have. lovely way to spend an hour after dinner, cooling off in a liesurely walk around the lake
Tranquil setting. Lovely lake with temple in the middle of the bustling old quarter. Good to visit and on Sunday's admire all the wedding couples having their photos taken

Nice Lake.. It is an iconic place in Hanoi. It was walking distance from our hotel. The lake has a beautiful scenery during the night. We spend some time walking around the lake and enjoying the lake, bridge and the temple. For me it was the nice place near by.

peaceful retreat amid the hubbub of the city. going to the lake in early evening is wonderful. lots of people from different countries, locals sharing time together, families and children just milling around. the lake looks pretty and peaceful and yet fascinating....a little bit of Paris, a little bit of Amsterdam, but totaly Hanoi!
Lovely lake and pagoda. Nice lake to walk round,plenty of benches to sit on and relax to watch the world go by,go across the Chinese bridge to the pagoda
Beautiful scenery. Iconic place in Hanoi. There are many restaurant,shopping area, and water puppet theater around here.

This pretty lake was within walking distance of our hotel. We spent some time one morning walking around the lake, enjoying the temple and bridge, getting coffee, looking at a few shops, and watching the preparations for the New Year. This is pretty at night also, and it's a great escape from the craziness of the streets and Old Quarter.It was raining, but we just donned our rain coats and set out.

Nice break. After surviving the crazy mad traffic and crowds of the old quarter, a stroll around this peaceful lake was just perfect, even in the drizzling rain...definitely a nice break, just what we needed!

Beautiful Lake. Landscaped area around the lake has a promenade likely to be filled with all kinds of people. There are little cart/bus tours of the area, great shops and restaurants all around and an interesting historical story to go along with it

Nice bit stillness amongst so much chaos!. There's chaotic, crazy, busy Hanoi and then in the middle of it all theres a beautiful still lake where people relax, meditate and do yoga/tai chi. The lake is approximately 1.7km around and makes for a lovely walk. There are many shops, restaurants and cafes all around the lake to stop along the way and there are lots of benches around the lake if you would prefer to sit.

worth a walk aoround. Worth going to see. Extremely pretty at night time with an interesting temple on a island. Best to see all of this at night. We got to see it during Tet which was quiet pretty as they ut up lts of lights.

Tet celebrations at the Lake. My wife and I were lucky enough to see Hoan Kiem Lake during the Tet New Year celebrations. The added colour and fireworks were spectacular. The floral displays were impressive. There's always plenty of activity at the Lake.

charming, day and night. the small lake is hillarious. the small temple on the island is fascinating in day time and also at night, when illumonated. walking around the lake is a good chance to meet vietnamese people who like to spend their leisure time around the lake and to meet kids who want to practice their English by tlaking with the tourists. the reflectios of street lughts, trees, trafic lights in the lake add charm during th eevening. in the morning people come to exercise around the lake, so we were told, but were not lucky to witmess since it was raining.

So peaceful. Cross the red bridge to the little island and walk slowly through the area. There are some very interesting exhibits and the story behind it is captivating, if unbelievable. A really nice place to come in the evening just before they close.

Lovely for a walk. A walk around this lake is an absolute must do when in hanoi, you see a whole lot of Vietnamese culture just walking around and taking in your surrounds. A peaceful lake in the middle of a busy and bustling city where you will see everything from students, to those exercising and those selling the ever present fresh bread.
Wow. Trully enjoyable. Take an evening walk alll the way round and you will see the most unusual things. Please dancing in unison on the sidewalk.

Early morning stroll in Hanoi. One of the first places I bring visitors in Hanoi is Hoan Kiem Lake. I make them get up early to catch everyone out walking and exercising as they prepare for the day. You will see everything from Tai Chi to ballroom dancing. Don't miss it. Start by 6:30am if you can get up that early - Jet lag usually helps. During Tet all of the gardens are spruced up with a variety of brightly colored flowers. In October and November you can catch hundreds of brides being photographed on a nice evening. No matter what time of year there is always something going on.

Daily trip around Hoan Kiem Lake. Peaceful and beautiful. It would not have been a complete day without a stroll around Hoan Kiem Lake. Encounters with students, watching people exercise and just enjoying the beauty of the neighborhood,

Place to unwind. After walking through the Old Quarter and market area and being able to catch your senses in this vibrant and busy city it is a welcome relief to be able to sit down and admire this beautiful lake. We were also able to take in the sights from high up in the Highland Coffee building at night and I think that it is even more beautiful at night. We visited just before Tet this year and with all the decorations we were truly fortunate.

A delight in the city. It's a good gathering place for the locals and a place worthy seeing for the tourists. Its small size as a lake makes it reachable mentally by most people. As there are a lot of restaurants around the lake, it has become a focal point of the city and a demarcation of the Old Quarter and the more modern part of the city.

Pretty lake. A nice lake in the centre of the city. Busy roads all around with bars and plenty to do. A half an hour walk to go round. The small visitor centre at the end of the lake nearest the Old Quarter us worth a visit.
A lovely spot. A lovely spot in the midst of the crazy traffic...not really quite total peace, but great start and a good walk.
Quiet during the holiday. It was quiet when most local people went home. We enjoyed our time walking around this charming lake and eating ice cream there

a must to walk around. This peaceful lake has a nice history and they say you have not visited Hanoi until you have walked around it. It serves as a good landmark, too, when walking about the older part of the city.
Heart of Hanoi. It's not so much of the lake but its surrounding and happening which you should see and visit. The lake is also the place where the locals meet.

Amazing lake, breathtaking view. Went during the Febuary New Year and fascinated by the beauty of the lake, all the flowers, decoration, the lake, the locals dressed up in costume for new year. Everything was great. Even though there're no sun, i went there 3 days straight and enjoyed it so much each time. Definitely worth the visit

Surprised by Hanoi. Friendly people despite the "American War", although they do make certain to let us know the problems they are still experiencing as a result of the war. More modern and prosperous than we expected and they are aggressively improving the infrastructure. Hanoi is filled with lakes and parks, has some nice architecture and was better looking than expected
Nice lake and pathway. The path around the lake makes for a really pleasant walk. Some great pictures can be taken and there is a lot of cafes next to the lake. Great spot
Pleasant. Pleasant lake with good photo opportunities.. Electric car station for a ride around the old quarter available at the lake. Be aware of pickpockets praying on tourists who are distracted.

nice walk. It's a picturesque walk around the lake (minus the pervasive air pollution around Hanoi that you can't escape) and would recommend it. Will definitely do it again when if I return. One of the only truly pedestrian-reserved parts around the city that you can walk uninterrupted. Nice views of the pagoda and the tropical trees have nice foliage. Get a good sense of the old quarter and the surrounding environs as well. Walk takes about 20 minutes to make a loop

Worth Stopping By. You can't help but stumble across the lake when in Old Quarter, it's beautiful to see. It was quite foggy when we visited so we couldn't see from one side to the other. I'd recommend having a stroll around and visiting the Ngoc Son temple if you feel like, but you could certainly see the lake once and be satisfied.

Hoan Kiem Lake is worth a stroll. During the day and early evening it is a great place to take a stroll or sit on a bench and people watch and take photographs. The lights in the evening around the lake and the lighting up of the pagoda in the middle of the lake are beautiful. Relaxing. Not recommended to hang out here once the lights are turned off.
pretty. Pretty place to wander around. Nice on a sunny day. Lots of food places nearby too. Pick one high up overlooking the lake
Beauty in the City. An urban haven of beauty, wonderful for a stroll and close to the best restaurants in the city. A must see!

My favorite place in Hanoi. This is the best place in Hanoi to enjoy nature and peace after visiting the old District and the busy surroundings. You can enjoy its view from the "Family Kitchen Restaurant", this is its name in English, great ambiance, good food and the waiters speak English. While walking by the lake you can visit the Ngoc Son Temple which is built in the lake but you can't admire it from outside.

Where all of the activity is. After wondering through the Old Quarters of Hanoi you arrive at the lake, absolutely beautiful and it appears as a place that not all tourist go but locals. Here you will find hawkers, street food & the Water Puppet Theatre. We enjoyed just sitting & watching the world go by.

Fireworks and interesting legend. We were at the Hoan Kiem lake during Tet, Vietnamese New Year. There were fireworks at midnight, which was great. During the day you can sit around the lake and visit the Turtle temple in the middle of the lake. It has the legend about Hoan Kiem lake explained there. When we visited, there was also traditional dancing. It didn't cost any money.

Great for street photography. This is one of places where it was "oh, its along the way and will past by there anyway so let's go check it out"...and thats how we ended up here. Initially, I wasn't too sure what to expect as when I goggled images of this place, it looked just nice as a lake and with a temple in the centre. That was about it. But what was the main attraction to me when I got there, wasn't the lake itself but what was happening in the sidelines. We were there on a Saturday afternoon and it was bustling with activity. There were your usual park goers just around for an afternoon stroll, to street artists drawing their scenes on paper or of a random stranger and being surrounded by curious crowds. There was also the celebration of events from school graduations and weddings which was made more exciting as they were all dressed in their colourful traditional fabrics. I certainly took more interest in what was happening around the lake than the lake itself and definitely a good place to venture to if you are into street photography. Place is quite accessible on foot if you are staying within the city, so just make sure you wear comfy walk shoes. Would recommended this place if you have time for a visit. Would be great as an after lunch walk...just make sure you have got your camera poised and ready!

heart of hanoi. This is "eiffel tower" , "big ben" of hanoi. Each time have big events ( new year, football, ..) hanoian would be here. Hoan kiem lake could be visit at many different hours and offer different show:-5 or 6 am, you will see hanoian who doing sport, it is also beautiful to make photo or drink coffee-4 to 6 pm , with beautiful last light of the day, many photograph shoot beautiful couple with wedding dress.after 6pm, very beautiful with light , it is nice to walk around and see nighlife near this lake.
Nice lake for strolling around , about a half hour walk in circumference .. Coffee shops are good and the little restaurant at the north east corner is nice , good for people watching.

Nice Break from all the scooters!. We were here when things were getting ready for "Tet", the lunate New Year, so all the flowers were freshly planted, and things were being extra cared for and cleaned...it is a beautiful are to stroll and watch the locals. It's a great story and historical influence for Vietnamese history.
must see. the temple in the center of the lake is very well kept. Very original story to hear. shopping possibility in the same place. worth the visit

Nice well tended floral beds around lake with ornamental bridge. If looking around the Old Quarter you will come across this lake which is an orientation point on the map. The lake has many bars and cafes around the "walking Road" area and well worth a look.

Relaxing--Must visit. this tranquil setting is a must place to visit and relax. Although, very busy in the day time go int he early morning to sense the spirituality, serenity and tranquility of the late.

Great walk around the lake. Whenever I am in Hanoi I love to walk around this lake. Great to sit under a tree and take in the sights and sounds of people around you.Situated in the centre of the city, there are many places to eat and drink nearby.This visit was a couple of days before the TET holoday so it was pleasantly quite

Beautiful lake!. We seemed to keep ending up by the lake. It is beautiful, and you could walk around it in an afternoon, if you wanted to. Lots to see and do around it. Make sure to have waqter with you, as it is hot in Hanoi. Stay hydrated!
well worth a visit. This is well worth going to see, it is always busy a bit like Hanoi! Its a pretty spot in a bustling city

It's not Lake Como. This is not Lake Como nor is it the Lake District but it is the centre of Hanoi so unless you just stay in your hotel you can't miss it. It is a peaceful escape from the traffic and noise of Hanoi. There are restaurants on the perimeter but be careful there are better places to eat not far away. If you want a peaceful walk without traffic it is perfect.

Nice for a walk. As the title suggests, Hoan Kiem is a nice place to go for a walk on a day with fair weather. Its close proximity to the large Cathedral and Old Quarter are lovely conveniences. The usual food and junk peddlers will be on the prowl around the lake as well as droves of old women working out in the mornings and your usual tourists. If one is to go during spring and summer be on the look out for surfacing turtles the size of adolescent children and flowers.

Heart of the City. I call it the heart of the city because it situates in the center of the city and it shapes like a heart. It's a great place for people watching and or a taking a stroll. There's a red wooden bridge that leads to a small old temple. It's probably one of the most popular place for taking pictures in all of Hanoi. Lotsa history. Should wiki it before you visit.

Hanoi Lake - perfect walk on a warm day. The Lake in Hanoi is very famous as it provides a real focal point to the old town and its narrow winding streets. If you find it hectic and a bit too claustrophobic then head for the Lake which has a broad paved perimeter that is perfect for strolling and taking in the atmosphere of this unique old city. Plenty of tall shade trees will keep you cool and the locals are always there - en masse at 6am in particular, doing their Tai Chi and synchronised dancing and exercises to the beat of boom-boxes. There's a fin old fashioned colonial cafe which is an excellent place for a quirt coffee and cake and there are also a few small shrines scattered around the edge too. Don't miss the Golden Turtle shrine accessed via a small bridge to a miniature islet - there is an entry charge but it is loose change only. Not far from the entrance to this shrine is a classic piece of communist street sculpture with great, solid, blocky family figures, thrusting their arms skywards in a triumphal pose - a large video screen alongside plays communist party video propaganda - its a hoot. And just over the road is a strip of show shops - great brands, great value.
beautiful. Very beautiful in the early of morning with cup of coffee and friends of family especial under milk flower fragrance.

A good on-the-way stop. Went there just because it's a short walking distance from the hotel. Nothing much to see except a bridge and a temple and a huge tortoise figurine in it. Would I purposely make the trip to visit this attraction - NO! But if it's just "along the way" then no harm. Otherwise it's just not a very good use of time in my opinion.
A lot of history and worth a look. Its worth a few minutes to get a guided tour and find out about the history of the lake and it's occupant/s.

Great for people watching!. Nice place to visit especially in the early morning as all the locals are doing their fitness and workouts. They didnt mind us joining in either!The bridge is nice for photos. A nice walk all the way round the lake.The puppet theatre is near the top side of the lake also.Lovely relaxing place in a busy chaotic city that is Hanoi.

A haven away from the busy Old Quarter. Nice area to stroll, pretty flowers. However still a lot of traffic in this area and to get to the lake you must learn to cross the road like a local (never pause!). There is a little tea/coffee restaurant we went to daily when we needed time out.

Nice lake in a busy area. This lake is located in a busy area including Old Quarter. It is great to walk around the lake (has a romantic feel to it) and take in the sights and sounds. I was there prior to Tet so all the decorations were up and looked beautiful at night. There is a floating temple that charged a fee to enter. There is a myth about a giant turtle in the lake. A lot of people dressed up to take pictures around the lake for Tet New Year. Highly recommended.
Nice Area. Pretty lake. When we went, they were getting ready for the Chinese New Year, and everything was covered in flowers. We enjoyed a stroll around parts of this lake.

A great place to walk around. Hoan Kiem Lake is a place fun to walk around as well as enjoy one of the coffee shops or restaurants and just enjoy it's beauty.Located aside the Old city / Old Quarter and a nice brake from the commotion of it.Also, don't miss the Ngoc Son Temple the floating temple Lake with the lovely bride Leeds to it.Highly recommend to visit early morning, sun set and at night time.

Romantic. Enjoy the cool air, order a glass of wine or hot cup of coffee depending on the time of the day. Or walk round and round the lake. Would have jogged too if I brought along my shoes. Tonnes of flower peddlers target couples to sell roses. Romantic and popular place for couples. Got engaged here and this is a special place for us.

Early Morning Antics on the Lake. Centered in the amazing Old Quarter of Hanoi, Hoan Kiem Lake is a great place to view local Hanoians in their morning workouts. You'll see young and old alike jogging the around the lake, practicing Tai Chi, groups of ladies going through intricate sword movements, couples ballroom dancing all amidst the cacophony of the ever present Hanoi traffic dance. If you're lucky, you may even get a glimpse of the rare large turtles that inhabit the Lake...we did!
Get up early and pay this a visit!. This is a wonderfully tranquil little spot. If you get here before 9am you get to see all the locals doing Tai Chi and the pagoda is all but empty.

A pleasant stroll. It's a very manageable & pleasant walk around the lake &, should you go early morning or at dusk, you will see loads of people out jogging, dancing, using exercise machines etc. The path around the lake is well lit & the pagodas in the middle look lovely when they are lit up at night. The lake is also home to some rare turtles. If you stand n the red bridge, you may see them ... they're small creatures so you'll have to look carefully.
lovely. Lovely place to go. If you are English speaking then the students will come and talk to you to improve their English

Scenic walk, relax and watch the world go by.. The walk around the Lake of the Restored Sword is a great place to meet locals, enjoy the daily rituals of tai chi, watch fitness buffs working out on the installed equipment, street vendors and tourists alike. As they were preparing for TET we enjoyed watching the locals making the 1000's of flowers for their TET displays. A great place to escape the pollution and business of the Old Town and traffic. Beautiful photo opportunities particularly in the late afternoon and evening. We were fortunate to see many wedding parties preparing for their photos and also enjoy the obviously accepted tradition of engagement photos being taken on the edge of the lake in the evening. Locals love to chat to practice their English and of course because they are lovely people. We enjoyed seeing the children skating in the open areas under the statue and babies carrying balloons proudly carried along by their parents. A highlight of our time in Hanoi. We met lovely people there too. All within a 2 minute walk of our hotel.

Beautiful lake in the middle of the hectic Hanoi. This lake is located in the middle of Hanoi, reaching the old quarter on one end of ir. Walking atound it you can enjoy some coffee shops with excellent view of it, the temple in the middle and the beautiful scenary. it is a great tranquil walk around the lake with all the very hectic traffic around it.

Tranquil spot. beautiful temple in the midst of the lake. seems a world away from the bustle of Hanoi. lovely spot to walk around, see interior of temple and mummified huge turtle that supposedly came from lake.
Good for walking. Take a round of the lake in the evening is my most favorite activity. especially taking selfie with the lake at night, great shots.

good to see at night as well. The bridge, temple and pagoda are good to see during the day but it is a great sight at night when all lit up, especially from one of the restaurants and cafés on the rooftop. Its a nice relaxing walk around the shore and you forget about the traffic behind you.
Very worthwhile. Stories about the giant turtles are quite amazing. I wonder if there are any left. We went on a Sunday and it was crowded, but overall, ok.

Okay Historical Place to Visit. This place is right next to the old quarters. The lake is green and it was actually called the green lake at one point. There should be two large tortoises living in the lake still. People believe that when you see a tortoise it will bring you good luck. Unfortunately, the only tortoise i saw that day was the one that was dead, painted over with lacquer to preserve and encased in glass. Oh well, you can't win 'em all.I was primarily impressed with the large fruit that were donated to the temple. They were as big as my face! it was crazy. There were people praying and burning fake USD around the temple. If you happen to be around, it's worth a visit. One of the more cultural things that you can do around Hanoi.
Small Lake. Small lake located in the center of Hanoi so you cant miss it. A wonderful place to relax and walk around.

central Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is central to Hanoi and is a good place to watch people. Early in the morning people exercise around the lake and walk their dogs. It is also a pleasant place to sit and relax from a grueling day of touring. In the months before Tet couples can be seen having their wedding photos taken. You may also be approached by students who want to practice their English. It is also near a Water Puppet theater. Colored lights illuminate the lake at night.

Pretty and nice stroll. We walked all around the lake on a dedicated pedestrian foot path. This was great with the kids so they didn't have to keep their eyes open for traffic all the time. The lake was beautiful and serene. The mist gave it a "secretive" quality. There are people selling food and cards all around the lake but they weren't pushy. There were quite a lot of tourists in the little temple in the lake which is definitely worth a visit.
amazing bridge. very nice view of the lake with an amazing bridge. Picture perfect moment. Just near the water puppet theater

Fun and great place to view locals relaxing. This was near our hotel, and allowed us to build up slowly to the frantic pace of Hanoi.Everyone so friendly, smiling and wanting to perfect their English.

Great Place for a Peaceful Walk. The Hoan Kiem Lake is a large lake located in the heart of Hanoi with a small island in the middle of the lake, as well as an islet with the tiny Tortoise Pagoda. We walked over a pretty red bridge, through the gate to the Ngoc Son Temple, and quickly explored the temple. It was a nice escape from the bustling city. It was relatively peaceful. We saw just as many locals as tourists enjoying this beautiful setting, as well as countless brides and grooms taking romantic pictures by the beautiful surroundings.

Large lake near the old town. The Lake of the Restored Sword is located in the old town of Hanoi with nice walking trails around the lake. Be careful crossing over to the park as there is heavy traffic surrounding the entire park and lake. In addition at the lake there are several other attractions (Thap Rua Tower, Ngoc Son Temple) you can visit during the tour. The lake is a really a nice central point as there are many other attractions bordering the park and in the immediate vicinity.A lot of people take advantage of the green space around the park to relax or exercise. There are a few pay toilets at the lake in addition to benches where you can sit and enjoy the view or gather your thoughts.

Good place for a walk. We did a circuit of the lake and it was nice to find a place in Vietnam where you could go for a walk without being either run down by a thousand scooters or tripping up on broken paving stones/interrupted by parked vehicles.

a peaceful mirage in a busy city. Great place for all ages, you can practice nirvana there, many locals pass you by or just relax after work. They are all smiles and not pushing you into anything. You can see there many wedding photo shooting sessions. There are museums, shows round the lake, you can find info at the entrance. Worth a visit.
Nice place. I'd like to go on winter season. You can sit and chill your day in here. In winter season the view in the lake very nice.

Nice place to walk and relax. Hoan Kiem Lake is a wonderful place to relax and walk around. you can visit at the museum or just walk and relaxing.
the lake located in the center of Hanoi so you cant miss it.

Nice to visit in the day and the evening too!. We stayed not far from the lake and enjoyed walking around it on our first day, including a visit to the small temple across the bridge. Our favourite time to visit though is in the evenings when locals come out to eat ice cream and enjoy the cool. Couples especially seem to congregate here to spend time together, which lends the area around the lake a calm, romantic feel. Definitely worth an evening stroll and an ice cream!

Hoan Kiem Lake. A very pleasant place to walk around Hanoi. It takes you away from the endless streams of traffic and blare of car horns! It is therapeutic to take some time out and walk around the lake in one of the more peaceful spots in Hanoi.

Loved it!. It's nothing much, when considered objectively, but we still liked it very much. good place to walk around, and see lots of Vietnamese people going about their lives, instead of trying to sell you stuff. In the evenings the whole town seems to be walking around it eating Kem (=ice-cream). The legend about the restored sword really got the attention of my two daughters.Oh, and for extra insights in local customs, look out for the young couples in formal clothing with a photographer in tow (They're about to get married, and having some formal photographs taken in advance. Must be a serious business, didn't see them smile a lot).
visit day and night. Easy walk during the day. Stop for coffee or ice cream overlookimg lake. Beautiful at night as people prepare for Tet

Relaxing!. If you have less than 48 hours in Hanoi, this is definitely the place to go and just relax It's beautiful!! If it's a chilly day, there are some nice coffee shops and restaurants around offering a nice view of the lake.

Tranquil and romantic spot. Located in the center of the Old District, Hoan Kiem lake is a wonderful spot for anyone seeking a moment of peace. The lake has a truly stunning temple located in the northern center and is the hot spot for many couple or joggers to hang around. I suguest going at night, the lit up temple is very beautiful.

Lovely stroll. Pretty much as you would imagine, a lake with a path around it...
Was quite pretty and a nice distance to walk, nice coffee shops around the lake and the path is well maintained with trees offering shade and blocking the road off somewhat.
If you've got a free hour or so well worth going round!

A nice walk. The lake is good for a nice walk around, the pavement is actually complete and not many trip hazards. The lake itself is pretty in the centre of a smoggy city and they've planted lovely flowers all round it. There's also a nice coffee shop on the south side of the lake, a nice break point. If you're looking to kill an hour, go for a walk around the lake!
Nice walk.. A lovely lake with quite a lot interesting legends.A center of nearly all of the tourists' activities. Quite attractive at night, as there were a lot of decorations.

Beautiful, romantic and scenic. Hoan Kiem lake is lovely especially at night. Take a stroll round the lake.. it's a great way to unwind. There is a cafe you can stop by for some cake and coffee too. If you want something different from pub crawling after dark, go to Hoan Kiem. You wont regret it!

Nice Lake to Walk Around. A pretty lake to walk around, but make sure you buy a face mask as the air pollution caused by all the 2 wheelers is just crazy. Or sit in one of the bars on the lake, though be warned that all of them have very dirty toilets. We also sat in one of the restaurants at the junction on the 1st floor of a building, and it was just fun observing all the traffic and the chaos down there. Definitely worth a visit if you go to Hanoi.
Must - see. go at 7 am on a morning of autumn or winter, you will capture the best scene ever. after 8am, it will get too crowded.

Great place for chill. Good place for walking around and chill. Many people said it was durty and smelly, but they might have cleaned it up, as I saw no rubish and it was really nice place to walk and just be.

Best walk you can do in Hanoi. Probably this is the best walk you can do in the center of Hanoi. Go there just after the sunset and enjoy a walk all around the lake! they will turrn on the colorful lights and you can enjoy them reflected on the lake

Local red carpet. A place to be to watch and be watched :-) greenery in the middle of the city adjacent to lots of eateries and shops. A place to spend some time after walking around the Old Quarter. From morning to night, the place keeps busy. Over the weekend, it becomes a scenic place for newly weds to capture the memories. Wonderful place to wind down.. Just nice.
Big Family. All the people- even if they weren't all great, they added to the mix. West Lake is great and has wonderful food and the BEST COFFEE.
Viet Nam 2015. very nice walk around the lake and the pagoda at the end is very nice you sit and look around and the local students come up and talk to you...

Cool and lively place. Very good for a walk.lots people around this lake. Lots of restaurants are there. You can all kind of foods from around the worldwide. Ther are few water puppet shows. Good shopping near by. Must visit in Hanoi
Lively. A small lake in middle of the town and a lot of people around. They doing everything from sightseeing to running, selling souvenir. At night it was beautiful.
An Oasis of Calm. Loved walking around the lake to escape the cacophony of noise that is the Old Quarter. Families gather, people exercising, and young couples dating - a people watchers delight.

Symbol of Hanoi. When i came Hanoi, Hoam kien lake was the easiest place to find and see. That is small park into busy old quarter, where i saw many people for children, old and young people come there to relax, do excersice or many couple taking wedding photos. Very interesting and lovely. At here i felt peace as slogan: Hanoi - the peaceful city.

It's just ok. It's kind of unique to see this lake in the middle of the hustle and bustle Center of Hanoi but really nothing special. The water is dirty. It needs better landscaping around the lake to make it more attractive. Also, restaurants and cafés around the lake were not too impressive. They could be cleaned up a bit. It could be a jewel of the city if properly cleaned up.
Should Visit!. Went there with my wife. Scenery not too bad and peaceful among the busy streets.Should visit when in Hanoi and it was close to the shopping areas.

First day tour. Love it.. It got that cosy feeling about it.. One thing that I dont really like is crossing the big interjunction with that heavy traffic.. Just be careful.. Near to turtle tower and red bridge.. Plus, it is the main attraction for old quarter..
very peaceful. My parents and I love sitting around the lake, very peaceful, very safe. And with the view overlooking the lake, can't ask for more.

Escape the bustle and Noise of Hanoi. Hanoi is a noisy, bustling, exciting city to explore, but sometimes it is nice to stop and sit and look at a lake. Hoan Kiem Lake is nicely situated to serve as a little escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. Plus, you can entertain your self by looking for the famous turtle. I didn't see him, but I did see a wonderful photo of him on someone's cell phone, so I have no doubt that he does exist and is not just legend.

Local hang out. Nice to walk around and see people sitting and relaxing. Quite busy during the day and night time. Shops along all sides of it as it is in the middle of the old quarters and you can't miss it.

Go early. Amazing to see thousands run or walk around in the early mornings. Actually, join in for even more fun. Walk around at different time of the day as you will see a lot of the locals going about their day (wedding pictures, elderly people, etc.). Great park.

Serene spot in the city. Absolutely worth a stop in one of the lake-side restaurants for a drink, or to sit on a park bench and watch the ladies doing exercises! It is a beautiful lake, I only hope it remains so serene as Hanoi is developed over the next few years!

Nice for a walk. This lake was nice to walk around (we did half), but very busy. Where there's tourists there's sellers but didn't get pestered like other parts of Hanoi.
Coming from New Zealand, where the lakes are clean and quiet, this wasn't anything special, however a nice break from the streets of Hanoi.

Beautiful and Serene!. Loved this lake. Here you will find many people from all over the world, including lovers, bird watchers, readers, weary travelers, and just people taking a break fro the fast lane. Many restaurants surround the lake that will interest any traveler wishing to get something other than Vietnamese food, but is still there if desired. Awesome views in the distance of a more modern structures that light up and reflect on the lake! Check out out!
Pretty lake. The lake was nice to walk around but besides that nothing special. There are a ton of restaurants and cafes near by and it's a popular spot for tourists.

Great in the morning!. Great to go in the morning and see what all the people are doing. Also interesting to read the reason why it has been given its name. Nice to have a lake in a busy busy town centre b/c it allows you to relax while still staying in hanoi!
walk at night. leisurely walk at night to take in the ambiance. during the day you get to see the beautiful flowers. there were a lot of photoshoots happening, which i found interesting.

Find the turtle. Learn about the legend of the turtle before visiting, and if you have the chance to go during wedding season (now!) you will see brides and grooms to be taking their photos around the lake. It is a pleasant walk, several benches to fully take time and enjoy the place, and if you feel energised you can join various groups working out (morning and evening).

A Relaxing Lake amidst the Chaos. This lake is right on the edge of the chaotic old quarter of the city. It is a nice place to go for a walk and a contrast to the chaotic streets around - at last you can walk on a pedestrian-only path and not be looking in every direction out of fear of the dense traffic. It probably isn't worth going out of your way to see - it is basically a pleasant lake to walk around, and there are several other similar lakes around the city - but, if you are in the area, it is a nice place for a pleasant stroll.

Beware of doughnut sellers around the lake. A lot of fruits and doughnut sellers are walking like zombie around the lake and aim for tourists. One of my friend is cheated by the seller and the seller do not return back the money and fled . My friend paid 200 000 for 2 doughnut which cost 20 000 each and the seller took the money and fled. Be ware !!!!
Wonderful walk in the middle of Hanoi. This beautiful lake is a wonderful place to escape the noise and bustle of the roads in Hanoi. Go for a walk, go people-watching, relax!

A good evening walk. Never expected a beautiful lake at the busy Old Quarters. Locals jog, exercise, weight-lifting along the lake. I sat on the bench along the lake watching people walking their pets, senior citizen, parents and kids spending quality time together at the end of a busy day. There is a restaurant/cafe and local cultural hall showing traditional water puppet show opposite the lake.
Walk and Relax here. After you have explored the city in the day, come here and take a leisurely stroll to soak in the lights and scenic surrounding areas
Great place to stop and get a beer to relax. After a lot of walking, grab a beer and watch the people go by.We had a great time sitting and watching the scooters, and the people.

Best area to roam around, heart of city.. The best part of Hanoi city is this area . Try to find out hotel accommodation around this lake, very good attraction and shopping is around this lake . See Tai Chi session in morning and temple Ngoc Son on the lake. Old quarter or 36 lanes are nearby.
peaceful place. A nice lake to walk around, it is quiet and peaceful and yet it lies right beside a major shopping area on one side.
Tranquility in the middle of bee hive. Beautiful trees and space to wander along without having to dodge scooters and cars. We visited middle of winter and still beautiful flowers and shrubs.

The most wonderful lake in Viet Nam. This place is so great, you can do everything here: doing exercises, dating, chatting,etc. Especially, the legend about Sword Lake is very interesting.We now know that Why the lake is named as Lake of the Restored Sword. Besides, Ngoc Son Temple and The Huc Bridge are also fabulous
Peaceful and romantic. this is the heart of Ha Noi, so peaceful and romantic. if you don't go there, you haven't gone to the capital of Viet Nam. It's so wonderful

Best 6:00am walk!. If you are daring enough, set the alarm early and go for a walk around the lake at sunrise. You will see all the locals in their different groups doing exercise. This is one of the coolest things I did in Hanoi and it was fascinating to see all these groups of old women doing all the group activities. There was one group of old ladies who would have been in their 60's or 70's doing the Macarena!

A Nice Vietnamese Central Park. This place manages to be peaceful and busy at the same time. There are always some funny wedding photoshoots going on. Students will be asking if they can walk and talk with you to learn the language, then they will try to get you to take a tour with them for a small fee. It's great for people watching too. And the lights at night time make it a bit special.
great place for a stroll. found this place to be very relaxing even though it is in the middle of Hanoi just a pleasant place to sit or walk and enjoy

magical mirror in Hanoi capital. it is very great to listen to the Hoan Kiem Lake's legend. and even an old tree around the lake has its own life or a historical witness. we are also interested by the old turtle here. now we have known why he becomes one of the most sacred animals in Vietnam.

Great place to take a leisurely stroll. Located in the centre of the city it is one of the greatest places in the city to just relax, the air feels fresher around here which is a godsend in a city with so many vehicles around. It's a great place where many locals and tourists go for their morning excercises.

Nice a peaceful. Very peaceful place especially when you see what is happening around you. Two people tried to scam us buy trying to read credit cards in our pockets, Mine was in my coat pocket in my lap so they didn't get close enough and my wife wouldn't let them close enough to her bag. They posed as students trying to practice their english with us.
Nice walk to pass the time. My husband and I had an enjoyable time walking around the lake. We used it as our landmark when exploring the different neighborhoods in Hanoi.

Beautiful. The lake is lovely with many locals taking pictures for engagements and graduations. the morning fog and locals doing tai chi everywhere is a sight to see. Take a trip over the bridge to the island and see the story of the lake and the huge turtle.

Delightful city-centre 'park'. Centre of the action - locals sitting and chatting, younger citizens strutting their stuff. Pretty Japanese bridge leads to tranquil temple despite the manic activity in the surrounding city. Did see rats near the bridge at night!

Lovely for an early morning walk. Take a walk around this enchanting lake in the early morning and watch Hanoi wake-up. Modest entry fee of less than a dollar. Great place for people watching and a wonderful respite from the hustle of the city streets.

If the weather is nice and hot, go here!. To walk by this man made lake gives you a tiny break from the busy streets of Hanoi. Here you can enjoy the trees trying to crawl into the water, watch local Vietnamese women dance to 90´s pop or visit the Buddhist temple. The scarlet bridge to the temple is excellent for photos.

The Legend Comes to Life. Come to Hoan Kiem Lake and then you'll understand why there are turtle statues everywhere. It's a wonderful legend and a beautiful and peaceful place to begin enjoying Hanoi!

Oxygen for your lungs, and a spot of quiet from crazy traffic. There are many ways to enjoy Hoan Kiem lake at its best: our favorite are early in the morning for a quiet walk, or in the early evening watching the scenery from one of the bars/restaurants around it. Our favorite place, the I-Feel bar, is a little hard to find: you have to go to Cau Go street on the north side of the lake and find the Springfield clothing store. Go to the back and take the elevator to the 4th floor. Climb one flight of stairs and, voilá, you have the most wonderful view of the lake and the lovely red bridge. Don't expect great drinks of food, (alas, such a lost opportunity!) but a great place to watch the sun go down and the lights around the lake come up.

Important historical/cultural site in the Old Quarter. To the Vietnamese people, Hoan Kiem Lake has much historical and cultural significance -- and well worth your time to see :))Take a walk across the famous red bridge to visit the serene temple on the island (Ngoc San Temple)... it is still being used as an active place of worship... view the intricate and beautiful pieces inside, smell the incense, and enjoy this quiet setting (a most pleasant contrast to the bustle you just left behind on the street). The broad pathway encircling the lake is lined with lovely plantings (plus pleasantly free of the omnipresent scooters), and is used by both local residents and visitors alike for relaxing strolls... Enjoy the charms of Hoan Kiem Lake :)

Good place for watching the world go by. The lake area was very busy with tourists and wedding, having photos taken. But it is a relief away from all the busy traffic. It's an area that's easy to walk round and at the top end is the busy back packer area, with plenty of shops bars and eateries.
Peaceful and pleasant. A nice paved path around the lake. Easy to walk, even a bathroom on the route! Very enjoyable. Wonderful place to,take pictures.

Interesting!. Had lunch at nice restaurant on the lake, then walked around to red bridge & saw the "famous Turtle" stick his head up for air, it is huge. All the spectators were very excited because not everyone gets to see him.

Holy place to discover. Prior to the visit, I studied the history of this place, when the putative everything beautifully. Location is not very large but greeny. And formidable With a long history, combined with the belief that tight. I like sculpture optical Similar in design, it is because the history of China. I stay at the Bridge We will be watching to see turtles and is expected to be alive and living in the river is. And we can see the tiny turtles swim to the really impressive.Visitted August, 2014

Just a nice walk. It makes for some good exercise after you've eaten some good Vietnamese cuisine. There's nothing much in terms of attractions to see around the Lake but it allows you to observe the lifestyle of the Vietnamese people (somewhat). Plenty of locals jogging, taking a brisk walk or just chatting by the lake as well as many tourists around taking photos.It's not exactly 'peaceful' though due to the many people around and the fact that it's surrounded by roads

Worth a walk around.. A quiet spot in the hustle of Hanoi - and to get to it you walk slowly cross the road - don't hurry and never step backwards - continue forward - the traffic will work around you.Sometimes you may have to stop for a second or two but then keep slowly walking forward.!!!Enjoy your stroll around the lake and take in the atmosphere and city life !According to legend, the Emperor was boating on the lake when the Golden Turtle God asked for his sword as he had only loaned the sword to the emperor to fight his enemies and the time had come to return it .Hence the name "The Lake of the Restored Sword"
whats the fuss about?. It is a lake. There is nothing there. I dont know why people call it a sight. The temple is small and just anotehr temple. I found it dull I'm afraid.
Historical place. Joan Kiem Lake locates in the historical part of Hanoi. It is very close to Old Quarter. It is very beautiful.

Nice to walk around. In the hustle and bustle of Hanoi, it was nice to walk along the footpath around the lake and not have to worry to much about traffic and scooters. This is a popular place to take walks or sit on benches and experience some peace and quiet. They also keep it nice with plants and flowers. Lots of opportunities for people watching, and saw several newly weds having their photos taken by the lake.We also crossed over the red bridge and had a look at the exhibition, which among other included a big stuffed turtle. I cannot say that this little attraction was something that you have to do, but the entrance fee was insignificant, and you had a view over the lake. There was a small gift shop selling mostly tacky souvenirs
Quite place far from noisy streets . If u feel hot from busy streets there just cross over this lake. A cool wind and nice location. Covered by trees. Good for relax for a while

try to visit early in the morning. My daughter and I were up early thanks to jet lag. We walked around the lake and were very entertained by the various exercise classes, dance classes, joggers and other individuals and groups of people undertaking their morning pre-work routines. Nice lake and grounds as well.
quiet. great location.motorbikes can be pain in the neck. be careful when on the streets. everything else is nice experience...

Peace in the middle of hustling bustling Hanoi.. The lake is a beautiful spot surrounded by amazing gardens and paths. It is a great place to watch the world go by, visit a couple of must see attractions and is a nice way to get from one side of town to the other without navigating the crazy traffic. And it is free!

Good place to escape the busy streets. While it may not be the cleanest body of water I have seen, it was a great place to start the day. Our family took to walking around the lake each morning in the crisp freshness of the morning. It was a nice escape from the bustling streets in the old quarter. Some nice places to take photos and see the locals doing their stretching and dancing. Close to lots of shops. Would not say it is a must see but given it was close to the old quarter, it is easy enough to check out quickly.
Worth the visit. Fabulous location; minimal entrance fee; peaceful; clean toilets; great photo opportunities. Well worth the visit.

Great at both day and night - cross the road quickly!. We had a great time just wandering around the lake and seeing all the day and night action unfold - all crazy - but great - loads of hawkers, action seekers and sellers - we went for a cyclo ride to get home - make sure you agree the price before hand.

Lovely Place to check out. The lake is a great place to hang out and obviously THE place to be in Hanoi at New Years. They had a stage set up playing dance music and it was very professionally done. I wish they did free things like this in Australia, we always seem to have to pay to enjoy ourselves. Generally the lake is where everybody hangs out, but don't get in the water, it's pretty dirty and would be pretty surprise if giant turtles actually live in it. Also it's great to watch people learning salsa dancing there and playing badminton and the red bridge looks really cool when lit up at night
Pleasant place to walk. Nice to walk along the water here. Shops, banks, and restaurants nearby. Many locals gather and walk here. Good people watching. also birds, too!
Not exceptional. The lake was better at night, with the lights but in the day, not much more than average. Difficult to cross the road to get to the lakeside

Beautiful lake with a scenic view. My wife and I walked past the lake nearly every day, as our hotel was only within walking distance to here. It's a great place for a casual stroll, and if you go there during the winter months (e.g. Dec/Jan), you get to enjoy a nice whiff of cool air too. You can also stop by one of the cafes adjacent to the lake for a nice cup of Vietnamese coffee while appreciating the fresh air and scenery there.You can also opt to visit the lake during the sunset hours to see the bright yellow sunlight reflecting off the lake's waters. And when the sky starts to get dark, the beautiful red bridge leading to the Ngoc Son Temple will illuminate, to provide superb photo-shooting opportunities for visitors.

Hooh ya!. The lake is not as big as i expected. However, it is nice with very green water and surrounded with a tranquil yet active air. Running around the lake in the morning and then digging in a bowl of noodles give me a energetic start for a long touring day!

A city landmark and highlight.. "When you cross the road always keep moving forward. Pause if you're nervous but whatever you do, never step backwards". This was the advice I was given on crossing the road in Hanoi our first day there. One of the first times we got to try this out and navigate the rushing torrent of mopeds and taxis was crossing the road to get to the lakeside walkway on our fist evening in the city. My wife and I got into the habit of having a daily, evening stroll around the lake. The lake is truly is a focal point for public life in Hanoi and people watching is a highlight. I was particularly captivated by the vigorous arm swinging exercises of the older power walkers; the Tai Chi enthusiasts and the groups weight lifters sat around rickety, old equipment set up at the lakeside. We would often sit at one of the lakeside cafes and take in the sunset before the lake is lit up for the night. I also incorporated a few circuits of the lake into my morning run. By 8am the traffic is already quite busy but before that it's fairly quiet. We never did see the resident turtle. Maybe next time..

Halloween Stroll. So much fun! We arrived on Halloween and being from the States, brought Halloween hats with us. We wore them walking around the lake and were amazed by all the small children coming up to us to say "Happy Halloween" or "Trick or Treat" and then running back to hide behind their parents! Ran into some art students who were doing face painting and of course we had to let them practice on us. Great evening.
Havoc. The lake was calm and beautifully placed in the center of Hanoi. I was here during the new year celebration. Really enjoyed the cold weather during the new year's party!

Nice at sunset. This is a good place to walk around if you have had enough dodging the traffic. The left side of the lake is a good location to view the sunset. There are seats along each side of the lie and the lake is lit up at night.

Worth the walk around. Our fmily walked around this lake (took us a while as we stopped a lot). There is so much to see. It was really buzzing and there was always someting that caught our attention. Many people do the same, adding to the atmposhere of the lake.The NGOC SON temple in the middle is worth a look, Plenty of opportunities provided for food drinks and souveniers. We found the lake very handy as a reference point and found passed it numerous times. We enjoyed sitting and eating icecream, along with many others. Its a very picturesque lake and well worth the walk around at whatever pace you choose.

Lovely, small urban lake with a pagoda. If you go to this lake at about 6:00 am, you will encounter native people practicing tai dhi and laughing yoga. This is one of the few tourist locations I experienced in Hanoi that is frequented equally by locals. Very nice.
Beautiful, so much history. We loved our visit to the Lake and surrounds, very enjoyable to learn about the history and take the bridge to visit the temples.

Great in the day awesome in the night :). A very nice lake to walk around in the night when the Hanoi city is buzzing with people. You will see lot of old women (who dont look old) exercising, joggers and also newly weds getting photographed against the beautiful NGOC SON temple in the background.There are many cafes around the lake near old quarters where you can have the tasty vietnamese coffee, but i would recommend you go in the lanes inside where you can sit on street and enjoy the coffee.There is also a famous ice cream shop on the lake, the entire Hanoi eats ice cream there :)Overall its a nice way to experience people and life in Hanoi !

A nice spot for a walk . It's a lake and it's in the city! The end. Well, it's a nice lake at that, can be a bit of a tourist funnel during the day as one of the tourist attractions is located just a small red bridge away it can become quite congested. I recommend coming quite early in the morning to see the quieter side as well as many Vietnamese people's morning routine which includes running, badminton and Thai Chee along the water. I watched this with the sun rise and was quite intrigued. Up until I wandered upon this lake during the day I felt the Vietnamese people weren't interested in conversing with a foreigner; however, when I sat down a little bit away from the swarms of tourists I was instantly engaged by countless students, parents and their children. It was quite a pleasant experience.

All activity happens around this lake. You'll end up passing it multiple times during your visit to various sights. Take time off to stroll and sit by the lake. Even in the hustle and bustle surrounding it, it gives you tranquility.

Just Hoan Kiem Lake. Hoan Kiem Lake is the main place in Hanoi for me. I walked there plenty of times. Actually I didn't have to many options where to walk in the center of this dirty city but still I liked that lake. I think this is best starting point for the Hanoi tour. There is small temple-museum on the island, which you can visit after buying of rather cheap ticket. And mass gymnastics events there is something special :)
Worth an Early Morning Wakeup. If you're so inclined, head to the lake during the early morning. The area will be full of walkers, runners, jailhouse gym sets, and tai-chi all happening at once.
nice. nothing much to say about the lake but you can see many local life which different from everywhere in the worl here and take some time to sit and chill with nice view
Nice and some quite areas. Nice lake and walk around well paved so easy to walk around. Strange but that you only have to take a few steps and back on busy noise roads

So pretty!. Our first view of this lake was memorable - at dusk and with lights on around the perimeter and on the bridge. Hundreds of people milled about, rugged up for winter (even though the evening was quite balmy). A beautiful introduction to the charms of old Hanoi.

Hoan Kiem Lake. My wife and I walked around the lake on a daily basis, finding something new each time. Very popular with locals and tourists, with local students adding something quite special.Each day we would be accosted politely my young students who wanted to practise their English or French with us, or to have there photo taken with westerners.The lake was very pretty although the sky was always overcast and grey, with no blue skies.A very nice place to walk around and stop off for a drink overlooking the lake
Its ok.. Its a small lake in the middle of Hanoi with an interesting story. Other than that, its just a small, dirty lake...

Excellent for a night walk.. A very famous lake in Hanoi. Well-decorated and has many attractions nearby, making this lake great for a walk - even watching the traffic itself around could make any tourist filled with awe!

Relax. This is a charming spot from the city. There is no way you miss it, its just next to the Old Quarter where all the action takes places. Either at morning, noon or evening is a perfect place to walk around, see and be seen. gather with friends... I suggest to take a walk from a tartoint and give all the round.
Nice walk around the lake. If you are looking for a nice easy walk then this lake is worth it. Also a Pho 24 up the north end for lunch.

Worth a stroll around. Lovely temple in the lake, and if you can find someone to tell you the myth of the turtle and sword, the visit is enhanced. We got our taxi driver to drive around one last time before we left. Beautiful day or night.

Located centrally and beatiful. This is right in the middle of Hanoi so you are likely to run into it at some point in your travels. Its a large lake surrounded by shops, restaurants, and bars. Its always full of locals zooming by on there motor bikes, so you have to figure the flow of walking around, but it gets easier! Lots of people excersizing as well, and so peacefull at night.
Good place to come back too for a break. from the noise and traffic. Hanoi can be overwhelming. The lake gives you a place to go, sit have coffee, and peer over the misty lake to the pagoda.
Worth a visit. This lake is worth a visit if for nothing else but to see the way the traffic travels around the area.

Smack in the middle of Hanoi, a leafy respite. where locals do get up at dawn to do badminton on the sidewalks and tai chi in the park. It's about a 20 minute walk to circumnavigate the lake. It's fun to find the vietnamese coffee shop that serves "egg coffee" , climb to their terrace, and look out on the lake view.
cool. nice place to walk around. you see all rhe locals doing exercise and a peaceful quiet area even though its on a major street

Better for Turtles than Humans. It's a lake. The trees are all right I suppose, and there's a bit of human activity like music exercise classes to entertain. But nothing special.
The tortoises are impressive and it would be very cool to see one but IIUC you would have to be hugely lucky.

Cool place for any time of the day. We were fortunate to have hotel in same area, so could enjoy cool atmosphere around lake in the day time and night. Nicely decorated / lighted bridge, turtle tower and temple are usual draws. People do come here to jog, exercise or just to chat with friends. Very lively place...

Dirty lake in Hanoi. The centre of Hanoi is not somewhere you would expect to find a clear lake with fish and turtles so you wont be disappointed when you get here to discover anything once living in it is now dead... the water a bright green and a lot of rubbish round the outside. There are a couple of nice buildings surrounding it but like most things in Hanoi, the pollution has got to it

Center of life in Hanoi. The lake is located in the heart of Hanoi. Nice to take a stroll both during the day and at night when the night lights are turned on. Watch people practice tai-chi, take wedding pictures, play with their kids, eat melting ice-cream...

A lake, and that's it. Many locals gather around the lake for play, chitchat, or just to relax. You can see street vendors hanging around to sell drinks, ice cream or souvenirs. It is actually better at night when the bridge lights up and it feels more calm and charming.

Nice stroll free of bikes & not having to watch where you are going all the time.. Great place for a stroll & to watch locals doing their tai chi. A lot of western travellers choosing this place for jogging around.

Heart of Hanoi.. The tourist center of Hanoi - nearly all the tourism activities here happened around. Always full of activities, and somehow it still retained its charm after thousand years of history. A good guide is highly recommended, as there were many interesting legend about the lake.
Nice to walk around. You can have a nice walk around the lake but there is traffic on the sides. Don't expect to be alone

Morning walk nice flowers.. Great for morning walk to have some fresh air. You have to get a ticket (ard 20,000 VND) to go into the small building. Not much of a scenery but interesting to see some of the things people do there in the morning - exercises, chess, kids playing.
Just normal. Nothing much to see nor talk about! Just a lake with some great flowers by the lake..other than that..really nothing much to say of this lake..

A Hanoi must. If you're after any sort of traditional view of Hanoi, this is one of the major places to visit. The island temple is heavily used by devotees so the burning of imitation money etc is constant along with the incense. The bonsais around the site are large and magnificent, notice the number that are twinned either side of the view to the Turtle Tower. Jade Island's Temple of the Jade Mountain is worth a visit anytime if not to observe the rites then to observe the inclusions. The lake, tower and temple all relate to the belief of the sacred sword in the lake and the emperor Le Loi. The entry cost across the Huc Bridge to Jade Island is 20,000 dong, basically one dollar. It is easy to walk the complete circuit of the lake in an hour at a slow pace. The shores are used heavily for tai chi and social gatherings. There are numerous excellent views of the tower around the lake during the day and when illuminated at night, equally as beautiful. Really an enjoyable time waiting to be had.
Nice walk around the lake. Enjoyed walking around the lake which took about 20 minutes. The lake is good to visit during sunset.and evening where the lighting enables good photos to be taken.
Nice place. The lake and surroundings are good .Lovely place in between crowded markets.Visit to temple in the lake was interesting .Went every evening during stay.

The beautiful lake in Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is one of the most amazing places in the character of our tour. Sticking a lot of childhood and maturity of the people and the country. You are always met and been offered to participate in activities as well as outdoor games by everyone.Dec, 2014

A veritable haven.. A haven after the hustle and bustle of the city. Best viewed at sunset from the lakeside and from a high rise bar just as the lights start to come on. Combine this with the Water Puppets for a magical evening.
Dirty lake... Cool story. The lake is dirty with a shah pagodas in the middle... Almost too far to take pictures of it. It's better at night with the reflection. Fyi: There are no turtles there...
Ho Hum. This area is of historic interest regarding an ancient Viet legend. Pretty crowded and typical temple complex

The red bridge. Lovely to walk around and just watch things go by. Walk over the bridge and search for the famous turtle to receive good luck. Souvenirs are little over priced and beware of the vendors lake side for over charging.

Serene. A good place to hang out at any time of the day or night. For a lake, there is so much to do and see. One can just sit and enjoy people watching. At night, there are many groups practicing their dance.
Lake next to Old Quarter. This lake is just next to Old Quarter. So you can visit these places together. Very nice view from some of the sides.
very nice at day and more at night. worth visiting the temple there and appreciating the lake at night or the temple at day. easy access from every where.. and very central.
Beautiful Lake. This is obviously the center of the city and holds much of the people's history. I found it very relaxing to walk around the Lake.

A lovely walk around a legend. A centre piece of Hanoi. This lake is great for a relaxing stroll around with some high end shops at one end and an island temple at the other. Once you've done your lap try a coffee at one of the many cafe's at the north end (we kept returning to "Highland Coffee") and enjoy the view.
Interesting. Not much to say other than interesting but not really worth an entrance fee though as nothing has really been put back into this historic site.
Great relaxing place. A very good place to relax in busy Hanoi. A good place to have a cool beer and people watch and relax in the middle of crazy Hanoi.

Park at the heart of Old Quarter. If you're staying in Old Quarter area and in walking distance to the lake, it's worth the visit.We were passing by the lake couples of time in the midday, quite a good scenery. But nothing really special which require long-distance travel.You can see locals hang out at the park and tourist taking photo at the temple. As well as street food seller.

Peaceful Lake beside noisy Old Quarter. Depending on the time of the day, this lake could be very beautiful with the nice bridge and the temple in a picture.After walking a few hours in old quarter, managed to find peace by walking around the lake.This lake is my landmark for old quarter. I always asked for direction of Hoan Kiem lake to avoid lost in old quarter.
Sweet Hoan Kiem lake. Very happy to be in a hoan Kiem lake as I had a great time to enjoy the amazing atmosphere with many nice people.

Change of pace in busy Hanoi. The Old Quarter can get too busy for a traveler who would like to enjoy a peaceful vacation. The visit to Hoan Kiem lake can help slow down the pace again. We walked around the lake and enjoyed the sights like the Turtle Tower, Ngoc Son temple, locals exercising on the shores of lake, men smoking their long pipes and playong the cards, brides getting photographed with the lake as a background. Then we just sat on a bench and watched the people, motorcycles, enjoyed the old trees around the lake.
Mythology that sits well with the people. Not a lot to see at this site except for the small and famous small bridge entrance. There is an old pagoda in the lake some distance from the island.

Picturesque and Pretty. A serene and pretty lake right in the center on Hanoi. its a 5-10 minute walk from old quarter (from our hotel it took us about 3-5 minutes). The bridge that goes to the pagoda in the centre is so pretty in the dark - red lights and right out of a movie. The entry into the pagoda has a ticket and we bought it. It has a makeshift model of the large turtle along with the tale and its a very peaceful place. A lot of locals come to pray.We even walked around the lake and its fun to browse through different shops, try the hole in wall ice cream and look at all the wedding photoshoots happening around the lake gardens. in an hour that we spent walking around the lake, we saw about 8 such couple photo shoots happening.Definitely worth spending an evening :)

A peaceful, relaxing oasis in the heart of Hanoi.. Hoan Kiem Lake I believe is the second largest of about 28 lakes in and around Hanoi and I located adjacent to the Old Market area. It is a great place to unwind from a day's outings, tours around the old market, or just to get up early in the morning to witness the beginnings of a Hanoi day. There is a nice pagoda located in the lake but we didn't have time to see it but for the outside. The lake itself is easily accessed from the Old Market area via a short walk or by cyclo driver. It is well worth a visit and a time out while exploring Hanoi.

Peaceful and scenic. Not the most exciting thing ever, but worth a visit if you are there. It costs something ridiculous like 30p to get in. The red bridge is a must for photographers - amazing when it is lit up at night. You just take this from the lake's edge.

Great lake to relax, stroll, sit , people watch and chat !. In the centre of Hanoi don't miss a walk around the lake. It's a lovely break from the shops to sit and watch the locals, the tourists , bridal couples taking their wedding photos , kids and the non stop bip bip of traffic!! . Hanoi has such international visitors you will be chatting to lots of different nationalities in minutes. For 50,000 vd (€1.90) you can visit Ngoc Son Temple, a pagoda sitting in the centre of the lake on a small island. The island is known as Jade Island and is accessible by the Huc Bridge or Rising Sun Bridge which is a lovely scarlet-painted wooden bridge of classical Vietnamese design.Great for photos !! The lake and temple are always busy as are probably the best know attraction in Hanoi city. Just watch you property when relaxing and take care crossing the road.
A simple and quiet lake. Not much activity here unless you go early in the morning. There's a cafe and ice cram place where you can sit down to take a break from all the walking in the old quarter.
Oasis in the middle of the city. Very calm and peaceful. Beautiful views. Need to zone in on the lake to really enjoy it as it's hustle and bustle all around!

Lovely feature in the centre of teh city. Easy to walk around....once you can get to it across the traffic!. A gentle stroll around the lake will take an hour or so, more if you want to stop for a drink, or enter the temple which has the giant turtle in it (well worth doing, you get even better views across the lake and it is very ornate).there's plenty to see around the lake, and it has been beautifully landscaped (there was a topiary herd of reindeer near the cafe when we visited).Just try and choose a good spot to cross the perimeter road to get to it!

Quiet Lake with fresher air but not so clean waters. university students roam around for interview with tourists and also give suggestions to improve stay in vietnam. air around the lake is fresher from the exhaust fumes from vehicles. the water seems quite dirty, tonnes of bread thrown in but no fish eats.
You need to know the story. The temple and bridge on the lake are weak and the whole experience is lame if you don't know the cultural myth of its history.

Great place to spend the early morning. We walked down to the lake before sunrise one morning, and it was a great place to watch the city come to life. We enjoyed watching the sunrise over the lake, the locals exercising and walking their dogs, and merchants setting up their stands for the day. The pagoda is also worth a visit. Many places to grab coffee in the morning.
beautiful and peaceful place. A central lake with old big trees. A beautiful and peaceful sight. The lake was famous for turtle and I could not see any of it.
