Give you peace of mind. This is where Hanoians do morning workout, date, and walk around. This is also where many foreigners hangout. The lake is very calm. I had a great time sitting beside the lake and rest my mind. Great escape from the hustle and bustle.
Joan Kiem Lake. It was quite nice, to go around the lake and visit the temple. Especially on night times its quite nice illuminated.

Be ready for groups of students. Students frequent this lake to practice their English - and you can learn quite a lot by conversing with them. The walk around the lake provides a lovely break from traffic too.

Nice place for a relaxing visit. Hoan Kiem Lake is not so far away from Hanoi's Old Quarter, so you can easily reach it by foot from there.The lake itself and the surrounding area with its parks are making for a nice change from the bustle of Hanoi all around (as much as this is possible with streets all around). I recommend a visit to the Ngoc Son temple - even though it's quite busy - the view toward the turtle tower is amazing. The temple features the preserved body of a large soft-shell turtle. It is said that some turtles are still living in the lake, I didn't see any during my visit, though.

Great for people watching. Tai Chi, weight training, walking, running you name it they do it around the lake.Great place to sit and watch the world go by, very friendly people, we had students stop and ask if they could talk to us just to improve their English, lovely place lovely people

there is no turtle!. The selling point of this is the idea that there is a huge turtle that you may see in the water. It is not the case. The temple is beautiful and cheap to enter (1 dollar) It doesn't take long to get around it but you can take some lovely photos here across the lake.

Nice lake.. A central lake that was right near our hotel. The water was clean, and the lake itself had many interesting tale about the origin of its name. Great for a night walk, as there were a lot of activities nearby, for both locals and tourists alike.

Peace and serenity. We were there in the late morning. There were not many people around the lake and in the temple. A beautiful and peaceful sight. You can also see couples taking their wedding photos around the lake.

walk around the lake at different times of day. Lots happening here. I went early and saw the tai chi exercises and avoided the hawkers. It was peaceful and pleasant. Later in the day there is a lot more action. Great people-watching spot.

Crowds. The bridge was overcrowded with people.When we paid to walk around the temple island, it was less crowded. Elderly men were playing board games around the platform in front of the temple. A beautiful and peaceful sight. Inside the temple were people writing Chinese characters on scrolls. We watched for a long time as an elderly chap painted the inscription with ease. A lovely day out, but uncertain about the history of the temple. Our teens decided they didn't want to see anymore temples, so our guide didn't take us here and we made a decision to go it alone. Around the lake are students wanting to practise their English. We were happy to do this.
Busy temple. An interesting part of town. The temple is OK but very busy. Different shops down this end of town. Wothwhile having a peek.

Quiet place in noisy capital. Lovely place in the noisy Capital of Vietnam. It is not too far from the hotel to reach there. We totally enjoyed a fresh environment there.Sitting on the stone chair and looked the people walking around this place. No thing left to worry about the life, just relax!
Nice walk. The lake location is the center of Hanoi, in the Old quarter district. It is a nice place to go for a walk or to have a beer or coffee in the afternoon.
landmark visit. a historical site to visit and see what the locals revere of their past. lots of locals visit too and it was fun to see them enjoying their heritage
A lovely lake in the middle of a chaotic city. Our guide told us some lovely stories about the lake and the turtles, all very poetic to go along with the scenery.

An peaceful oasis in central Hanoi. Always a great place to take a walk, see the ancient pagoda and the flowers and young couples, students, ladies practicing tai chi and ballroom dancing and men playing mahjong. I've spent the past 2 years living in Hanoi and I still never get tired of Hoan Kiem Lake. It's a beautiful small lake - takes about an hour to take a leisurely walk around it, stopping for an ice cream along the way. Really, it's a "can't miss" place to see in Hanoi.

Interesting place. Took many pictures of the Phoenix, tiger & dragon features depicted on the wall along the lake. The pagoda is at the far end of the lake. Good place to laze around, to take in the sights of the locals & tourists mingling along the bridge.Interesting history relating to the lake, which is enacted in the water puppet show opposite the lake.
Historical Lake history. The view is nice and interesting to know about their legend. Is a good view located at Hanoi city center.
Oasis in the city. The lake is a really nice place for a walk, run or people watching. It is an Qasim in the city and in the Old Quarter! Very pretty!

Interesting spot to experience daily Hanoi life. Located in the centre of Hanoi, this small lake is a good place to experience what its like to be a Hanoi resident, from the older generation going through their calisthenics to young couples taking their wedding photographs along the lake's perimeter
Awesome view. The view is awesome and a good view into the locals' life. At night, the Turtle tower light up which makes a good photo opportunity!

The "small turtle island" in the middle of a lake in Hanoi. Cool story, but smallish. There were about 3 wedding shoots there, which shows how revered the place is. Seeing the wedding outfits and the shoots were as interesting as the island. The story itself is cool, about a magic turtle bringing up a magic sword so General Le Loi could defeat the Chinese oppression, and then when he returned to the lake, the turtle returned so he gave the sword back. There is a big mondo replica of the turtle there and the story is pretty cool. Good photos on the bridge. It was about a dollar or two to get in. Takes about an hour to go through it all, and it's in the middle of Hanoi - you can see the city all around you. There is small pagoda in the middle of lake (Thap Rua) commemorating the whole thing.

Nice walk round the lake. Nice walk round the lake, just next to the old quarter. There's a nice cafe next to it too where you can have a drink. Plenty of local people exercising and playing chinese chess.

Tranquil place amid the city traffic. This is a well maintained park with ample walking paths right the way round. Plenty of benches for sitting and watching the world go by. Near the markets of Old Town: a nice place to relax and reflect after the congestion of the surrounding streets.

The Central Park of Hanoi!. How fantastic to have a two kilometre lake in the middle of your city, which gives done open space, a view & a sense of an oasis.Great to stroll around its banks, taking in the view & watching Hanoi life pass by.
Nice walk. A nice place to take a walk and to get some distance from all the hustle and traffis.But if you dont't need that break - then there's really nothing to see.

One of the most beautiful places in any city in the world. How many cities in the world have a lake in the very center of the city, surrounded by trees, shops, in the middle of which is a scenic pagoda and also an island connected to the "mainland" by a beautiful red bridge? My soul is at rest in this place.

Walking the lake. You could say Hoan Kiem Lake is the beating heart of Ha Noi. Much of life in this fascinating city takes place around the lake. From senior citizens doing their tai chi exercises to joggers, men working out on parallel bars and even couples going through their ballroom dancing paces. You see all life here. The lake is an attractive walk and can be circumnavigated in under 30 minutes. It is a lovely romantic stroll especially at night. If you appear Western you will be politely approached by students asking to chat to you in English, especially on Sundays. And they will often ask to have their picture taken with you. Deny being on Facebook or your timeline will become full of anime, sparkly fairies and lots of VN text. Trust me on this.
Beautiful serene lake. We walked from Old Quarters to the Lake and we loved the beautiful view in Winter Hanoi. The area is clean and we enjoy walking along the lake in the cool weather.
Lake at night. The lake was a very peaceful place and was lit up nicely. We encountered a photographer taking pictures of a bride and groom. Also saw some locals exercising at the lake.

Nice lake. Nice lake surrounded by busy streets. There's a little temple/pagoda you can visit on the lake for a small entrance fee. It was nothing spectacular, but interesting enough to read a little bit about the histry of the lake. Taking a stroll by the lake, particularly at night was a nice experience though, as the "Turtle Tower" in the middle of the lake was nicely lit up. Seemed to be a very popular spot for wedding photographs among the locals, as they were lined up everywhere along the lake.
Lovely to walk around ! . Nice place for a good walk around . Winter weather made it even better. Go in the evening to catch the lights on the bridge and the monument on the lake.
Nice weather to walk and enjoy the quietness. It was really nice weather in december and a peaceful place to relax. Take a walk in the morning to feel the life of Hanoi.

Pleasant stroll around the lake. We walked around this lake both during the day and at night, and we enjoyed our strolls. Somehow, we never were able to correctly time a visit to the pagoda built in the lake, always arriving a little before or after closing. If it were more more important to us we might have made a greater effort to see it.

Great for a leisurely walk. Charming lake with a temple sitting in the middle. Older ladies being led by a boom box exercising together. A few portrait artist working on the east side of the lake. Many people taking pictures all over. There are many lights that illuminate the area at night.
Peace amidst the chaos. This is the place locals go to sit, relax and talk. Though its surrounded by busy roads, its a welcome break and a safe walk even at night.

1st stop in the Old Quarter due to central location/point of reference. This is a good place to start the tour of the Old Quarter since the lake is the focal point of the enitre area. Everything is centered around this lake. Of course, one must visit the pagoda located in the small island tucked away in one corner of the lake. If I recall correctly, there is an entrance fee of about 30,000 dong (not sure) per person. The pagoda itself is not the greatest or the most magnficent compared to others in Vietnam but it certainly has its own charm/heritage.
Evening Stroll. It's a beautiful scene and a romantic way to start the evening. We enjoyed wandering around and taking in the ambience.
Essential. Great for a stroll around either in the daytime or evening. Hordes of locals as well as tourists, many brides being photographed in all their finery with the lake as a backdrop.
Lovely stroll. Really enjoyed walking round the lake both in the day and also in the evening. Pavements were quite good and scooters did not bother you
One of the most picturesque man made lake I have visited. The beautiful vista and many picturesque spots for picture taking especially if you are with your girl

Tranquil spot in a bustling, noisy city. One of the most iconic pictures of Hanoi is the Lake with the Ngoc Son temple in the middle. The tiny temple built in the middle of the lake is not open to the public. At one end of the lake there is a bridge you can walk over that leads to another temple which according to me was not worth the entrance fee. The lake itself is a serene place to escape to, sit and watch the world go by. If you don't want to walk around the lake, close to the walking bridge, is a stand where you can hire an electric passenger carrier (like a large golf cart). For a small sum, the driver will take you for an hours ride around the lake as well as through the small lanes of the Old Quarter and parts of the French Quarter.

Lovely Place. Hoan Kiem Lake is a short walk from most hotels in the old quarter, lots of eating places and shops in this area, we were approached by a young Vietnamese girl and asked to read some text from a book for her. My friend got her to record the reading to her phone so as she could listen to it if she needed to. Also beware of young people runnung up to you to take picture with them, watch your pockets and bags.
Where is the turtle?. Hoan Kiem Lake is beautiful and an afternoon stroll is a relaxing way to wind down after a busy day of sightseeing. We never did see that damn turtle though.

An oasis in the old quarter. There are tons of restaurants around the lake and you can view it from the rooftop restaurants at night. Lots of young people around the lake during the day - expect to be approached by young Vietnamese so they can practice their English!
Nice Walk. A very picturesque lake to stroll around and take in the sights. Plenty to see with cafes and coffee bars scattered around the edge. Try to see the turtles, we didn't.

Pleasant enough. Nice and fairly short walk around the lake, well paved and presented. Not too much hassle from street vendors.A good way to see it is to access one of the rooftop cafes and look down on it.

Good lake. Strolling on holiday afternoons by this lake is amazing. You plus find figures from around the world, still has Vietnamese doing everything there, is the heart of Hanoi !. There is a legend about a well god turtle in this lake.

An oasis in a bustling town. The lake is enjoyable at different times of day ... early, early morning are the Tai Chi, dances, meditation sessions... the regular hours are just people enjoying the walks and sitting on the benches watching people go by... the evening are the lovers holding hands and enjoying the solitude and quiet feelings that the lake radiates even in the center of this busy city

Chill out and chat. Hoan Kiem Lake is situated on the eastern side of the old quarter and just a few minutes walk from the Opera House. This is where many locals come for some relative peace if not quiet - a walk round the lake without having to dodge vehicles of the two-wheeled variety; take early morning exercise; sit and watch the world go by. There are several cafes. There is a temple on one island accessed by a bridge. We sat on a bench to check out our city map when three young men and a young woman came up. "Are you English?" one asked. "We are from Britain" I replied. "Thank you. Would you mind if we practised our English with you?" It turned out that they were undergraduates studying various subjects including law, chemistry, accountancy. If you get into such a conversation do not be offended if the kids ask you your age. This is so they can address you properly. Great place. Enjoy.

Just as well. As soon as we arrived at Hanoi, we came to see this famous lake. It is right in the city and is a good place to start exploring the city. Definitely a place to watch and get a glimpse of the people.

"landmark" of old quarters. If you see this lake, it means that you are in old quarters. A nice place for photo taking. There's a small temple in this lake. Admission fee 20,000 dong per person.Although nothing much to see, it is still good to go and have a look if you are on the way. :)

An oasis in the centre. Visit in the early morning to watch or take part in the Tai Chi. Or in the evening when the pagoda in the middle of the lake is lit up- beautiful. The rest of the day is a bit boring!

Great place for people watching. The lake is a nice place to visit. It is also good to visit at night. There is a bridge to the island in the lake which is a great place for photos. We went at night & also during the day. There are always plenty of people around & it is very picturesque. Sit on a bench & people watch - you'll be surprised at the sights!A little escape from the hustle & bustle.

Beautiful. It's a beautiful lake and was very close to the hotel I was staying in. It's easy to walk around the lake and the park seems to be filled with people throughout the day and evening. There are lots of shops and cafe's around it which makes it a good destination for walking and people-watching.

Place for a little respite. The lake is not large and frankly, it's rather ordinary. It does provide some respite for your senses from the traffic of Hanoi and if you go early enough, you can catch a glimpse of ordinary life as Hanoians jog, brisk walk, meditate or practice tai chi by the lake.

Best chill spot in Hanoi. Hoan Kiem lake is the best place to chill after a long day of touring Hanoi whether you're travelling solo or in a group. The lake can be a very good romantic spot as well though it can get crowded sometimes. There are areas around the lake wherein couples can relax. Best time to go: early morning during winter season.

Hoan Kiem Lake - Peaceful walk. Being there in July 14 temperature was a little warm but the walk around the lake is peaceful and worth the effort. It took us about 1- 1 1/2 hours but we didnt rush. walking path all around and an oasis in the heart of Hanoi

Water, people and turtles. There are many lakes within the city of Hanoi. This is the most popular for locals and tourists. You will meet tourists from all over the world and also many very friendly Vietnamese. It is probable that if you sit down on one of the many park benches that a university student (or maybe 5 of them) will stop by to ask if they can practice their English with you. They will probably ask to take a picture with you also. If you are lucky you will see a fish or two jumping out of the water. They say there are very large turtles in the lake but I have never seen one. I have visited many times. The lake is right next to the "Old Quarter" another important tourist and locals destination. In the Old Quarter you can buy anything you may think of.

Hoan Kiem Lake. The visit to Hoan Kiem Lake in Hanoi is a must. Best you walk slowly around Hoan Kiem Lake and experience Hanoi. There are a lot of activities of active Hanoi people: dancing groups, sport exercises, street markets, the night Hanoi night market at the north of the lake and many café and restaurants. Students might approach you to talk to you to practice their English.

Love the lake. What I loved most about Hoan Kiem lake is how Hanoians just flock to it during the day, and especially at night. It has loads of seating, and is a great place to just sit, reflect, read a book, and people watch. As a foreigner you will always be approached by someone asking for a photo, wanting to engage.

Beautiful. We walked past this several times as we stayed very close, but we also walked part way round as part of a Hanoi Kids tour. The lake is full of gorgeous photo opportunities day and night. Various guides we used filled us in about the rich history of the lake which added to the intrigue.

Good place to walk, soak and relax. The lake was a good place to walk, soak in the atmosphere and relax after a meal. There is a story to the lake, and it is very near Hang Gai Road with its shops and eateries, Hang Dong Weekend Night Market and the Thang Long Water Puppet Theater.There are people practising Taichi, exercising, and even performing gymnastics... Couples on dates, brides and grooms taking their wedding shots... Have fun...
Interesting area to relax. Its a good place to do 'people watching', lazy around the lake, or get a cup of good and strong coffee in one of the many cafe.

Beautiful Oasis. We stayed near the lake so got to see it a lot and walk around it a few times. What a picturesque setting in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Ha Noi. The café that overlooks the lake is a great place to stop for a coffee, lunch or early morning breakfast.Worth taking an hour or two to take in - especially in the early morning when the lighting makes the bridge and building in the middle really stand out.

Walk round and move on. The lake is quite frankly just a lake, there's not much you can do there, expect for sit and stare at the lifelessness of it. There's often people trying to sell you stuff as well which is often unappreciated.
Great Legend. Take a stroll around the Lake right in the centre of town. It is a very pleasing sight. The legend is 'displayed' or rather acted upon in the water puppet show too.

Hanoi's atmosphere is here. Hanoi has its own rhythm here in Hoan Kiem Lake. You can see both of 2 sides of the city where the older is slowly practicing some Qi Yong next to the lake. Beside that on the street is the younger running on their motorbike struggling with their busy life. It is green and has a lot of fresh air with a tranquil atmosphere in day light. But the evening, you can see it is very busy for several festivals was set up around the lake.Almost the time you can find an old musician playing for free. He love to gather people around him to share the love with music to every one without any economic motivation although he is quite famous. He got a nice beard with a beautiful smile always.Love this place!

An oasis of calm. A beautiful lake right in the city centre next to the old quarter. There is a lovely little pagoda in it's centre which you can visit and you walk round the lake on the pedestrian path. It is lovely at night too when it is all lit up and the locals come out for a stroll. Makes a pleasant change from traffic dodging!

Lively at niight. My Thai wife and I were walking back to our hotel in the Old Quarter, having had dinner at a vegetarian restaurant, when we discovered the lake which had beautiful reflections of the lights of the city and surrounded by lots of people, some cooking food. Care required crossing the very busy roads though!
Worth a look. Worth a look I'd say. Everyone seems to do it. Even though it's a lake there is a pretty cool story behind it

Tranquil. Nice to have a seat by this peaceful lake which is right in the middle of a very busy part of Hanoi.You can forget the hustle and bustle for a while and enjoy the tranquillity. Good photo opportunities of the tower in the middle and walking around the lake

Great place for a walk. In a city where walking around can be a challenge, the walk around the entire perimeter of the lake is very pleasant. It's also great for sitting on a bench and people watching. Lots of people in early evening exercising, popular place for wedding photos etc.

Pleasant Sunday afternoon walkabout. The lake will only take you about 30-40 minutes to walk all the way around but it was fun to take the stroll and people watch as we went. We walked around on a Sunday afternoon shortly after arriving in the city, and it was interesting to see the families, teenagers, young couples, groups of friends all enjoying themselves on a warm afternoon by the lake. Be on the lookout for young couples getting their wedding photos taken! Also if you get tired, there are many cafes around the lake that offer refreshments.

Calm oasis in Hanoi Old Quarter area.. This lake is right in the old city and is a wonderful park in the craziness of the traffic. Walking around the lake is easier and calmer than walking with all the motorbikes and people in the street. A lovely place to sketch. Many locals also take advantage of the lake and surrounding area.

Its a lake. Its just a lake surrounded by a busy road with lots of vehicles belching fumes and making lots of noise, I'm know there is a legendary story attached to it, but not sufficient to make a detour

Nice to walk around. Pleasant to walk around particularly in the early morning. Gets quite busy later on. Inaccessible turtle tower on the central west side and the Ngoc Son Temple on the north. Temple is easily reached via short walk on bridge, 20K entry. Lake water is exceedingly murky. Lots of pieces of bread fed to fishes by the temple. Could see the pieces getting eaten but could never see the fish.
It's a lake in a dirty, noisy town.. I don't think the Hoan Kiem Lake is really worth going out of your way to see. The temple is OK, but other than that, there is little worth seeing.

See it at night.. We were accommodated close to the lake, temple and island so thought we would start the day off here. It's a pleasant sight, especially in the centre of a big city. The temple on the island is of course worth a visit for the low entrance fee (20k), but it is small and won't take you more than 10 mins to look around. There was a very cute cat sleeping on a wall in there, who was rudely awakened by a child - much to our amusement and certainly not to the feline's.We came back past the lake at night and it looked very picturesque, as the central inaccessible island was very nicely illuminated.

An oasis on the edge. After coming from the Old Quarter the lake was like an oasis Calm waters with nice green areas all round Loads of local school graduates dressed up getting their photos taken People milling around some doing morning exercise others drawing women making kiddies toys and selling them all at a very easy going pace

Lovely place for a stroll. Great place to go for a jog in the morning or evening, or a leisurely stroll. Numerous cool trees w/ weeping branches make for pretty photo opportunities, as do the red bridge and the structure in the middle of the lake. Or just a nice place to sit, relax and people watch.

Great place to relax. The lake is beautiful and huge, with sidewalks and a park all the way around it. I sat on a bench to people watch and thoroughly enjoyed it! A temple is in the center of it, which you can visit. The story is that there is a large turtle that lives under the lake. Once a king borrowed the sword to fight his enemies, then came back to the lake to return it to the turtle.

Hanoi's Best. Really the most enjoyable place in the city. Weekends are a treat. You can sit for hours watching people. You will also be stopped regularly by college students looking to practice their English. Spend two hours with one group. One of the highlights of my trip. Without a doubt my favorite place in the city.
2/12/14 i love this lake. Hoan kiem lake is beautiful! I like walking here. I come from france and i walk alone around the lake, people is so friendly and nice.

Pleasant walk around the Lake. Hoan Kiem Lake is situated in the centre of the old city and is an easy walk around the lake. Lots of photo opportunities along the way. It is particularly lovely in the evening( I was there in late November and the weather was great with mildly balmy evenings) There is lots of people just strolling around.. tourists,couples,friends,lovers, families and students the atmosphere is a buzz without it being too busy. It felt really safe. It was also a good opportunity to get our bearings on the first night.

Pay the extra money to go in!. We always visit this place upon arrival in Hanoi. The lake and the temple on the island really sum up Hanoi for me. It gives any visitor an insight into the importance of Temples in Vietnam. lt also gives you a great place to just people watch and take great photos of locals! Especially on a sunday.
nice place to watch to local lifestyle. Love the place and enjoyed the beautiful scenery. romantic place to hang out at night after water puppet show
One of the best view in Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is the beautiful spot in Hanoi. I like its night view.

Nice to walk around especially at weekend evenings. The lakeside path is buzzing on weekend evenings with families and lovers enjoying the breeze and activities. We even found a ball room dancing class going on right by the lake in the park with music.
lovely lake to walk. making a nice loop to enjoy the view and the many people hanging out around the lake. Safe and nice to see.

The Lake was a great experience. By walking around this lake was a great way of meeting some new friends that i have made in this trip.A lot of Uni students will stop and want to talk to westerners if you happen to speak english or french.A walk should only take about 45mins to walk can take you about 2-3hrs if you get stopped by the students.But hey, it was funThe weather was great in mid November and it was great place to visit.Its one place you must go to.....

Awesome atmosphere. Go for a romantic walk watching the sun set or take your dog for a stroll or just sit on a bench and in no time some locals will come to practice their english with you. Anyway it's a great place to hang out and be part of the local life. This one time, i was chilling by the lake and something particularly spooky happened. There were some yummy looking baguettes in the water and there was something invisible eating the bread.
Nice Views. peaceful to walk around. nice views. not to busy. close to old town. few craft places to buy local products, but cheaper in old town

Beautiful!. Beautiful area to walk and relax. University students will talk to you and some vendors are located around the lake to sell their handmade goods. One can take great pictures of Huc bridge and Turtle Tower from the edge of the lake.

Beautiful lake near old quarter. Be it morning or evening, one could come to the lake to relax. You could take a break from the chaos of old quarter and stroll around the lake. Though the vendors chasing you around may spoil the scene a bit but that is all part of the scene.And proximity to water puppet theatre among other thing makes it a good landmark for the visit

Refreshing and relaxing. Hoan Kiem Lake is the place to escape from traffic and clamour in Hanoi. Great for walking, people watching and restoring ones equilibrium after the hustle and noise of the old quarter. It is also a super landmark for negotiating and orienting oneself!

Walk around the lake. Walk around the lake gives an excellent insight into local people and their activities. We saw children doing dance practise, groups of elderly couple performing couple dance and vendors selling street food

Central Park of Hanoi. It's like the Central Park of Hanoi - expect smaller, and only a lake. Essential for a visit, and you must go and sit atop of one of the restaurant buildings surrounding the lake and have a Hanoi Beer and watch the sunset.
Great for photos. This place is THE PLACE to take photos on a scenic lake. Especially on a sunny day. In the evening it is lit up nicely as well.
very nice. Sometimes i walked around Hoan Kiem Lake the palce very safety, nice and very relax, you can take many photo about Thap Rua, Ngoc Son Temple specal The Huc Bridge.

Beautiful and worth a short look. A nice place to walk around and take a few photos. Right opposite the Water puppets so easy to access. It didn't take long to see the temple and walk across the bridge.

Nice place to relax with cafe along side, bench to sit. If you like free and easy vacation place to enjoy, relax with view of water, trees, temples, watch horrific sound of Vietnamese motor traffic, people watching ,this may the place for you. Have a cup of coffee or just sit around there are many nice bench all around the lake. Restaurant also available just opposite the road, The popular water puppet show building is just opposite the road to the eco electric open car city tour located on north side of the lake. The water puppet show cost 60, 000 dong n 100, 000dong for front rows are worth visiting. City tour by electric car cost 150, 000 dong for 30 min or 250, 000 if not mistaken for 60min is worth trying just near the north east of lake. Have fun.

Like in the old paintings of the museums. It is the place of Hanoians , specially on the holidays and weekends and still fashinating like some paintings of last century exposed in the Museum of beaux arts

Great place to relax. The lake is lovely. Sitting at the lake is a great way to relax, and get away from all the mayhem of Hanoi (even though you're right next to a busy road). You can watch the lake, and you can look for fish catching bugs on the surface of the water. Great place to peoplewatch. As a tourist you are occasionally approached by very kind, polite and nervous students who wish to practice their English. Not only is this quite entertaining, it provides you the opportunity to ask questions yourself (what is "x" in Vietnamese?/where is x?).Only downside to the lake is that some salesmen require some patience to get rid of, though most walk away after a polite "no, thank you"
Green water. Incredible vistas of the lake and the pagodas. Interesting shrine and a massive turtle on display washed up from the lake. pity the lake has so much rubbish considering its significance.

Symbol of Hanoi. You will know you are in Hanoi if you see this lake and the temple and the red bridge on it. It is a good place for people-watching, taking beautiful pictures, walking, exercising in the early mornings. When we were in Hanoi, it was the time of the year when schools are taking graduation pictures for their students. It was fun to see female students in their traditional long dress striking a pose beside the lake.

A relaxing refuge. This is a great place to surf across the traffic to escape for a quiet moment. The lake surrounds are attractive and there is a nice little cafe at the southern end to have a coffee. You can combine the trip with a visit to the Ngoc Son temple.

Worth rising early for!. We had been advised to get up early (5am) and head down to the Lake to see the lean, healthy local Vietnamese doing what they do early in the morning. All around the perimeter of the lake, We watched people engage in impromptu Tai Chi groups, Zumba, what looked like tea dance steps and a large group of women who formed a Conga line to massage the back and shoulders of the person in front, before breaking into dance. On one side of the lake, there is a constant stream of soon-to-be-married couples in full wedding gear, queueing up to take their turn to sit for wedding photographers who shouted directions at them. One of the highlights of our trip, and we enjoyed our late breakfast all the more for it!

Relaxed place in busy city. The lake is used to relax for the locals. Especially around sun rise 5-6 am, hundreds of people are performing stretching exercities, dance, aerobics, football,...worth to have an early wake up call

Get a glimpse of the Vietnamese culture. Very well maintained & historic lake. The central point of life of people in Hanoi. A walk around this lake any time of the day is not only very refreshing but you get a glimpse into the history, tradition, folklore, culture & people of Hanoi/Vietnam here. Must see destination in Hanoi!!

Beautiful lake. The lake is has a calming affect to busy Hanoi lifestyle, it is a well maintained park and gas a jogging track around it. It has very good lighting at night and feels safe. Its nice to see people exercising around the lake in the evening. One can easily pass hours sitting near to lake. The restaurant on the lake and opposite the lake has good food and drinks for local prices.
pretty to walk. Enjoyed a walk around which we did both day and night. The temple is worth visiting too. nice area in the helter of the city.

The Lake. The lake was nice. A typical run for locals; jogging in the morning, courting in the afternoon.Hundreds of tourist all around. I found it safe day and night.It was also to observe the tradition of wedding photos around the lake.

Meet the locals. Everyday during our 8 day stay in Hanoi we would to Hoan Kiem Lake to sit and recharge. We always ended up in conversations with locals practicing their English. We often had students approach and ask if the could record the conversation for assessment by their teachers. These students can't afford to pay an English teacher so we feel it is just a little that tourists can give back. They were always polite, open and honest but most of all good fun to spend time with.

Of course, you have to be here when you come to Hanoi. If you stay near Hoan Kiem Lake, you should wake up a little bit early, around 6 a.m and come. A lots of people walking, running and dancing around the lake every morning.

The Heart of old Hanoi. I love this lake in the middle of the old city. I have been in Hanoi only twice and find the lake to be my focus and orientation point. To watch people doing their morning exercise, tai chi etc is a joy. We even walked from our hotel on last morning in town, to have breakfast at a restaurant on the lake edge, costing about $AUD8 per person.

My feet hurt...and I need a beer!. On my first day, I took a walk around the perimeter of this lake - walking along P Le Thai To, southwards. Like many locals, this seemed the in thing to do. It was a scorching day, and I learnt where the post office was for my postcards to nephews in the UK (corner of P Dinh Tien Hoang & P Dinh Le), and just enjoyed people watching. I think they enjoyed watching me too - the slightly overweight white guy covered in sweat! Horribly, Humid Hanoi! I remember alliteration from school!Took a number of pics of Thap Rua and learnt the tale - very much like the Lady of the Lake from Arthurian Legend. Spent an hour at the Huc Bridge & Ngoc Son Temple and just soaked up the city.I stopped in a bar for a beer - thats all I could think about in the heat!

Nice Visit. The lake is good with well maintained park and jogging track around it. Very good lighting at night.Its nice to see people exercising around the lake in the evening. One can easily pass hours sitting near to lake.
Special Destination!. You should visit it at night or early in the morning, you will feel comfortable and feel peaceful there. It is the beauty of Vietnam.

In a touristy area but..... It also seemed to be a great place to watch many Hanoians go about their daily recreation. When we were there, we saw many graduation pictures being taken and it was lovely to see the young women in their special outfits. It is only a mile around, and the weather was awesome when we were there. The pagoda in the middle is very picturesque, and there is a ton to look at. We walked around it several times. In the mornings (early- like 530-6) there are all kinds of people doing tai-chi and other exercises. Quite an interesting scene.

Beware of scams by the lake. The lake could be a peaceful gem in the middle of the city but the good experience was ruined by persistent annoying hawkers and an attempted scam.In general you just can't seem to trust anyone who approaches you for anything which is really sad. I would not at all call this a peaceful place for a foreign tourists. Maybe it is good for the locals who are left alone but I was haggled nearly non-stop hawkers aggressively pushing their products. Even though you say no many times (one was putting a donut in my face and didn't seem to understand "I'm fat, I don't need a donut"). Another was selling pop up cards and pulling on my arm despite my repeated pleas I didn't want anything. The worst was yet to come. Luckily this time I was able to avoid being scammed yet again in Vietnam. This country is beautiful and I have enjoyed so many things but it needs serious help with the seemingly endless scams and tourist rip offs. The taxis are especially bad and fast meter scam is the worst I have seen anywhere in my travels. I was approached by a seemingly charming and beautiful young Vietnamese woman who spoke wonderful English. She said she was a student and asked me to help her English homework. I thought was a bit of an odd request to begin with. I said I only had a few minutes and after a little small talk and meaningless conversation I asked her to show me her assignment she wanted help on. She seemed to ignore what I said. She had a good size backpack but could not produce any assignments. Then she went on and started talking about other things asking me all sorts of questions about my travels and then again I asked her to show me her assignment. She then suggested that we go to a nearby cafe and get something to drink. Big backpack but no assignment? Very suspicious. I showed her my old shoes and told her I didn't have much money (which is the truth) and she quickly lost all interest and suddenly she had to meet a friend. Sure. Keep lying. This is an obvious scam. You go with them somewhere and you get an exorbitant bill. The same thing happened to me years ago when I "trusted" a group of students in Beijing. Most expensive tea I've ever drunk. If you go around the lake you are sure to see the same "students" everyday hanging out looking for tourists to scam. It's shameful these people would spend years learning English to only use it to scam tourists.

peaceful. Loved to sit around the lake and relax. Also met Vietnamese students who wanted to practice English and they were so sweet. If students approach you, let them practice with you and learn about Vietnam!

An Easy Stroll To Taste Local Flavors. This is easily accessible from the Old Quarters and is an easy stroll. It should take no more than 1-2 hours to walk around the lake to take in some local flavors. In our stroll, we encountered photo shoots of wedding couples, Vietnamese girls in their traditional dress and elderly seniors just relaxing. We were able to take our own photos of them without them objecting. Even one of the photographers shooting the models were cooperative in allowing us to shoot photos, not only of the model but also of her (the photographer), all with a friendly smile. Take an easy walk and make your own discoveries....
Huge Turtels!. Nice walk around the lake takes you away from the hustle and loudness. The restaurant (can't remember the name) on the lake was relaxing and reasonably priced food.
okey. Closed to the old quarter. When you need a place just for walking around, without motorbikes you can go their but i think its not necessary.

Nice lake/area. It's a nice lake that is a short walk from most hotels in the old quarter. You will see a lot of locals walking/relaxing and couples getting their wedding photos taken. There's not a whole lot to actually do on the lake but it's a nice area to relax, get some ice cream and take some photos!

Photographer's paradise. The night time photography opportunities here are fabulous because although the scenery is beautiful, this is where the everday people spend a lot of their recreational time. We saw live Karaoke where the highly talented performers paid a Master of Ceremonies and sat on a bench to wait their turn to perform. A live band accompanied the singers and a large crowd gave enthusiastic support to each act. No inhibitions; no jeering; a really unusual experience especially for an Australian who holds Karaoke in very low esteem. We also saw countless Bridal couples doing full blown Photo Shoots. The photos were apparently to be used for the invitation cards for guests. Not far away men will be playing Badminton, groups will be doing Yoga or exercising to music. It is a wonderful spot. Then there is the illuminated temple!!

good walk. Good place to walk around, you can see Vietnamese runners around the lake, interesting atmosphere. Good walk as there are walking paths around the lake. Wonderfully lit up in the evenings and at night.

Just pleasant. Just nice to walk amongst the locals and have lunch and coffee by the lakeside architecture up the road by the cathedral typical French colonial but lots of weddings here so you might be moved on by snotty camera people

Nice area.. Hoan Kiem is a nice lake to have a walk around in the evening and enjoy the views across the lake and see the Lit up Turtle Island and the temple. Lots of seating around the lake but not lots to do at the lake.

Scenic place for locals having wedding pictures taken. We were walking there Ina Sunday and many couples in traditional and western wedding outfits were there to be photographed. Graduating students were there along with many locals just wanting a good outdoor portrait? Interesting to see locals all dolled up for picture taking.

Beautiful Lake !. Loved walking around the lake . Visiting the temple and bridge in the middle of it ! Gets very busy during the evenings when people come out for exercise and on the weekends when big groups come out for the wedding photography !
Nice place for people watching and for sitting on a bench with a beer !

Central to it all!. Hoan Kiem Lake is great to walk around and just people watch! It can be very crowded, especially on a Sunday, but there's a great vibe there . Great photo ops, with the bridge to the temple and Turtle Island. The Lake is well worth seeing early in the morning when all the locals walk or run around it (anti clockwise thank you), do tai chi or yoga. Lovely spot!
Piece of Hanoi legend. Don't miss the illuminated bridge by night.Small, charming and quiet place in the middle of the stormy Hanoi20,000VND/Pax

beautiful at night especially. The lake is beautiful and tranquil right in the middle of a bustling city. I would recommend go there in the daylight and then go back at night. Awesome lights around the lake

The peaceful centre of Hanoi's Old Quarter. Great day and night, lots of lively street food around the lake side streets. Great for a walk without worrying about getting mowed down by the frenetic traffic in the surrounding area.

Majestic lake setting with interesting attractions. Lovely setting in Hanoi. Easy to walk to and there were quite a few attractions close by. The red bridge leads to a beautiful temple on the lake which was character filled. The entry fee is only 10,000 dong. Well worth seeing. Try and find a restaurant adjacent to the lake - I was lucky enough to find one overlooking the lake from 5 floors up and got some of my best photos from there.
Majestic. Lovely setting and really good to walk around. Great to do in the day but this place really comes to life after dark

great place to explore. this place is great to explore. you can hang out, drink coffee, buy souvenirs or go to the temple. it is the lake of the turtle and worth a visit (especially with good weather)
Sweet and charming lake. Visited in both night and day and at both times this lake is pretty. Many people go here to have photos taken, and it's easy to see why given how picturesque it is.
Fresh air. Great time to wander around the lake. fresh atmosphere. good to see old women to do Taichi in the morning. highly recommend for anyone to visit Hanoi

Go before sunrise. At any time of day, this is a nice lake to see. However, from about 5am a large number of local people gather at the lake to do their daily workouts.There's everything from individuals running, walking and jogging to a woman upside down against a bench doing some form of stretches. You wil also see some groups with their own speakers doing their thing.If you go during the day, there's a small temple that you can visit on the lake and there's a large amount of people that you can buy various souvenirs from.
Escape. This is a nice area to relax and escape the fun, but crazy old quarter. If you get up early in the morning you'll find the locals doing Thi Chi around the lake.

Beautiful. . Our hotel was minutes away so we spent every day of our visit to Hanoi close to the lake. It's huge and such A pretty sight no matter what time of day We walked around it many times. The locals exercise around the lake, which is always fun to watch as they bring out tones of equipment. It's based in the centre so you can't miss it!

The Hub of Hanoi. The lake is what we based our directions on during our stay in Hanoi. With its cloying mist during the day, the lake has a very ethereal feel. It's very relaxing to take a stroll around the lake during the day or night.
Nice little lake in middle of Hanoi. Nice lake to walk around and take photos. There is a temple in the middle of the lake which you can cross a pleasant little red bridge to get to.
Nice place for a walk. It is a nice place to go for a walk or to have a beer or coffee in the afternoon. If you are up for some exercise, you can rent a bicycle duck to go in the water.

In the center of Hanoi. No matter what is your Hanoi's itinerary you will eventually end up by the lake. It is in the center of the city surrounded by Old Quarter.You can have a walk around, see people practicing for health. It is really good to have such spot and rest for a while in the middle of crowded capital.
Nice. Big turtle is a masterpiece that lives in the pond. Uncle who is have hit the chess beyond the everyday sense was pervaded. Night of illuminations was indeed an Asian taste packed.
Great place for exercise. I do jogging with the locals around the lake early morning which I can get a nice breath and see the beautiful scenery of the lake. It's fun to exercise here.

Beautiful lake in the heart of old quarter Hanoi. The lake location is the center of Hanoi, in the Old quarter disctrict. peacefull & quite in the sunrise early morning, chairs & garden side around the lake. the best lake in Hanoi from escape the noisy traffic city.

Nice walk. Nice walk around the lake, if you can manage to cross the road to get to it! The traffic seems to circle the lake endlessly, which gets a bit tiring. The lake seems to be the centre of nightlife in Hanoi, so definitely worth a visit in the evening. The red bridge is apparently the most photographed sight in Hanoi, and the little island it leads to is quite pleasant for a ten minute wander, but no more.

peaceful in the hustle and bustle. The Hoan Kiem lake is a small lake (walk around takes less than 30 minutes) inside the city centre of Hanoi near the Old Town. The lake itself is surrounded by trees and it has two small islands. One can be reached by the red Japanese Bridge. There is a temple for the turle from the legend of the sword for which the lake was named. Lovely visit and surprisingly serene in the middle of chaotic Hanoi.
Lake. There was water. And a red bridge over it. Led to a temple. Paid VND20k to enter. Saw a mythical turtle. Left.
Nice for a tuk-tuk ride. The region of the lake has many attractions and interesting places to visit but you can not miss a half hour ride in a tuk-tuk around the lake.

Not to be missed. This lake is an automatic draw once you've experienced the organised chaos of Hanoi. It is immediately peaceful once you are around the lake. It's the oasis of calm that's attractive, not the features of the lake. It's not big - it takes 30 minutes to completely circle the lake. There's an old temple in the lake but that's not the reason for visiting the lake. I may sound confusing but make the trip to the lake and you will feel what I mean.
Nice lake in the middle of Hanoi.. Good place to walk around in the morning or in the afternoon & watched the locals! We walked around the lake every afternoon when we were in Hanoi. We love it!
Nice scene in centre of town. Loved the area around the lake. Full of life and interesting sites. Great restaurants and bars surrounding the roundabout.
A lovely bit of a lovely city!. I have lived in Ha Noi twice! I came back after living here about eights years ago. Hoan Kiem Lake just makes me feel like I am relaxed...Feels a bit like home. Peace

One of the best places in Hanoi. Its a large lake in old quarter and the environment around is very energitic. In the morning, there are lot of people (old and young) doing open air aerobics, walking, jogging or generally chatting. There are many restaurants surrounding the lake, there are people playing local games around lake. Overall, a very happening place and a must see in hanoi. There is also a pagoda (temple) for people to see and a puppet show theater (for kids to enjoy)

Lakeside walks in the city. If you just want to sit and enjoy the relative calm of the lake in amidst the noise and chaos of the city -this is just right. People watching is a particular delight as is watching the many wedding couples who have their pre-marriage photos taken near the lake and Tran Tien plaza.

Hanoian relaxation. This is the place that Hanoians visit to stroll and chat on a warm day. It's a pretty lake, eminently walkable (a circuit takes about 20 minutes) and eminently photographable, too. You'll see lots of brides-to-be hanging around being photographed for their wedding books, draped pleasingly against the lake background. There are plenty of concrete benches to rest on under shady trees. There's the famous bridge where, for a modest fee, you can cross and visit a little temple and museum containing the splendid turtle which came out of the lake, was then stuffed and now resides in a large vitrine. Sadly, the last giant turtle living in the lake was 'rescued' at the beginning of last year, subjected to a health-check, given some essential treatments and then returned to the newly-cleaned lake - and hasn't been seen since. Still, I live in hope as spotting it means good luck, good health and lots of money for the rest of the year.Beware the friendly 'students' who come up and engage you in conversation, however. Most of them will soon be trying to get a 'donation' out of you. Postcard sellers and shoeshine boys can be pretty insistent, too. Just say 'No thank you,' firmly (they all understand that) and walk on.
Lots of water. Lovely to have this so near the centre of Hanoi. Interesting to see people fishing it, and succeeding, too.

Hoan Kiem Lake. This lake is just in the middle of the city. There is a nice walk around the lake. Don't be scared, there are benches along the walk so you can sit down and have rest and just look at the view.
Peaceful. Worth a walk around, lots of people doing their fancy exercises (not for me) and a peaceful spot although the traffic is always present in the background.

Hoan Kiem Lake. A lovel piece of tranquility in the middle of a busy city, the lake is really special at night when people with dancing abilities take their music to different spots around the lake and anyone can join in their dancing class for free! Even late at night, I never felt unsafe walking there.

Picturesque. We loved wondering around tge lake - it's very pretty and always has something going in - brides having their photos taken, people doing their exercise/stretching or just having a quiet coffee.We enjoyed a jog around one morning - we had to go around three times to make 5 Ks :)
quiet oasis in the middle of chaos. Whilst not very large, the lake and surrounding gardens do offer a bit of serenity to the general hustle and bustle of the city.

Take a walk around the lake early morning and late at night. A walk around Hoan Kiem is an absolute delight at any time of day. All ages of people do their exercises around the lake in the mornings, at night the lights come on and temples in and around the lake are beautifully lit up. It's magic to see, especially from the lake or from one of the roof top cafes(City View) at the top of the lake .

It can get really busy - especially for a run!. The lake's is around 2 kilometres so half a marathon would be roughly ten rounds. That's what I did the last time I was there and this was on a Sunday. It was quite busy, I must say. I did have a couple of of almost run-ins with other people around the lake. There are many many people doing various activities - tai chi, yoga, running, photography, or just contemplating.The shops and restaurants around the northern part of the lake open early so if you run and you find a need to hydrate, there's a number of small shops selling cold bottled water for 10K dong. There's also a breakfast place right on the shoreline in case you really get hungry.As the lake is small, there's not much to appreciate except for a small temple in the middle (almost) of the lake. The lake does get very pretty at night; dinner or drinks at one of the restaurants with a roof deck would be advisable.

Beautiful. Such a lovely place in the centre of the city to sit down and watch life go by. The lake forms an integral part of the lives of people in Hanoi. People taking wedding pics, exercising, gossiping, relaxing...

Get away from the traffic for a calming walk. We had a walk around the lake away from the madness of the traffic. There's a few statues to see as you go around and you can go over a small bridge to visit Ngoc Son Temple. Very calming.

A must do. You really need to stroll around the lake at least once. I estimate that it takes about 30 minutes to complete. It is the place for locals to meet, greet and exercise. We walked around the lake four times during our visit. There are several spots to stop and just people watch. Since this is the bridal season, one afternoon we counted almost 20 couples getting their wedding photos. I also really enjoying going there at night, it is lit with colored lights along the bridge and street.
Cool. Very beautiful and night time , I and my friend did have a good time together and very impressive and we have had a very nice experience together .
very beautiful. very beautiful lake/park to have a walk or sit and have a drink watch the people go by . special in the evening with all the lights its nice to hang out and meet the locals

The hub. The lake is a central meeting point for locals and tourists. Early in the morning the locals do Thai Chi, walk, run and dance around the lake. The gardens are well tended and the restaurants appear to be more Western than traditional. I found it a good place to jog if you can handle a bit of humidity. Go early for exercise.

Great place to mix with the locals. Go there in the late afternoon or early evening to mix with the locals. Families com out with young children to mingle. Students approached us wanting to practice their English. People were very friendly. It's a great place to sit and watch Hanoi walk by!

Get there early. The lake is beautiful any time of day, but if you get up early and go for a walk around the lake at 6-6.30am then you'll see hundreds of locals exercising in all manner of ways. Long 'conga' lines of women massaging each other's backs...ballroom dancers practicing moves, men and women in groups doing strength and balance exercises. And added to that there is often a beautiful mist over the lake which provides another great photo opportunity.If you visit the lake at night, it is beautifully illuminated,as so the trees and the streets surrounding it.

Great place to sit and take in the locals. Always seems to busy starting before 6am there are so many people exercising round the lake from running, walking, aerobics and badminton, then a bit later are the couples having pre wedding photos, and then the students who go round the lake to talk to tourist to improve there language skills, the girls we spoke to approached us and were very shy to start with but after an hour were quiet comfortable chatting away and writing things down to learn, it was a good experience for us to chat with the local young people.

Nice lake that is actually enjoyed by locals and visitors alike. It's walkable from the Old Quarter and for me, best experience at night. The display of lights around the lake, and the locals just enjoying their free time there. Whether jogging, meditating, fishing, or just a picnic among friends and family.

Beautiful nit of serenity in the chaos of Hanoi. It was great fun to rise early for a run around the lake while groups of mostly older people were practicing to chi and younger ones were out walking, a few running.

A Great Place to Stroll and People Watch. At just about anytime of day, a stroll around Hoan Kiem Lake is a wonderful experience. If you are into photography, there are many fine photo opportunities. You would undoubtedly see couples having their wedding photos taken with the lake in the background. A great place to people watch or just sit and watch the world go by.
A little oasis. The amount of people that are there at 5 in the morning exercising shocked me as was the number of brides & grooms who go there for their wedding pictures taken!

The Hoan Kiem Lake, at the center of the old quarter in Hanoi, is great for a stroll at any time of the day!. A great place to stroll at any time: eraly mirning, people of all ages exercise, then you can have a coffee, ice cream etc, and in the late afternoon, the atmosphere turns romantic ;-).
A must!. I had the pleasure of living within 5 minutes walk from this beautiful lake.If you do visit, then you MUST go to the water puppet theatre, at the North end.Scenic, delightful...

Beautiful lake. I love hanoi. and Hoan Kiem Lake too. It's beatiful lake. You can walk around the lake and visit some famous place such as: Water Puppet, Hanoi Post Office, Trang Tien Plaza, turtle tower, etc..Sometime you can see the old tortoise swimming on the lake.

lovely stroll in Hanoi. Very nice place to visit and easy to walk to from the old quartets. Take your camera with you as it is a nice place to capture photos of the floating temple. Very relaxing ... Maybe take a picnic, there are lots of seats.

Soothing view with breezy wind~. The lake view is so serene and soothing. I could sit here all day long. Contradictory, the roads are very chaos with all the honking! Anyway, there's few ice cream shops you could just buy and enjoy it while walking. Definitely joyous. Nonetheless, too bad that we witnessed people throwing rubbish into the lake, while the cleaners busy using the net to scoop up the rubbish. :(

Nice walk around the lake. After racing around Hanoi seeing all the sights we finally took a stroll around the lake. We stopped for a coffee and relaxed and watched the locals. Great anytime of day or night.

Night life!. We walked around the whole of the lake in the evening and there was so much going on...Salsa, running, power walking, and ballroom dancing.
The statute in the middle was beautiful and the Red Bridge looked amazing. Well worth a visit?

A tourist hotspot. Hoam Kiem Lake is located in a central position and is a must for any visitor. It houses the ancient Ngoc Son Temple which is located on a small island, and can only be reached across a picturesque footbridge. There are many antiques housed in the Temple, and also displayed are the preserved remains of a giant Turtle which was captured in the lake. The legend of the Sword is linked to the Turtle. There are many shaded walks around the lake although traffic noise is hard to escape from.
A place of peace. In such a busy city, this is a great place to rest, have a ice ceam and watch all the weddings taking place... lovely

Beautiful. This lake is amazing. It is beautiful and peaceful during the day and spectacular at night. It is lovely to see people and families gathered together and using the lake all the time. This is a must see when in Hanoi! Take the time to sit a while and talk to the people. You won't regret it.

Lovely night walk.. Excellent for a night scroll. There are many good restaurants nearby, and the lake is quite beautiful at night under the colorful decoration of flowers, neon light and the flow of people walking around. There are also some nice pagodas and temples nearby, with a lot of historical stories and tales.

A pretty lake with a nice temple. Lots of local people take their exercise around this lake mornings and at night. As well you'll see people dancing and doing Tai Chi. It's a lovely place of respite in the middle of a busy city.

The heart of the city. After a long train ride back from Sapa, we jumped into a taxi and found our way to our hotel. As it was early morning our room wasn't ready, so we dumped our bags and headed down to the lake for a walk. So too had half of Hanoi. People of all ages were out and about waggling hips, punching the air, dong the slow movements of Thai Chi, dancing in groups or on their own, running, playing shuttlecock, and every other variety of movement you can think of. And so it is like this every morning and every night.The lake itself is quite pretty, well serviced with paths, shade, impromptu dance floors and everything else. It is the public space of the Old Quarter and is an experience like no other.

Good for a stroll. It doesn't take too long to actually walk round the lake, maybe 20-30 mins, but it will definitely take you longer as you take in all of the sights and sounds that happen around it! There are statues, ornate gates, souvenir sellers etc. We visited on a Saturday and there were many wedding photos being taken with beautiful local costumes. You can pay 20,000 dong to cross the bridge to see the turtle temple too.
Interesting place with nice restaurents. a must visit place when you are in Hanoi. The lake has got good stories to tell and seems the youngsters and all age are loving it.

A start and finish to the old quarter tour. We will never get tired of going to the Hoan Kiem Lake. It very vibrant at night where the local vietnamese go for exercise and entertainment. From this lake, you can go either to the north, west, south or east and there will be something interesting to see. May it be Architecture, way of local life, or shopping.

Beautiful lake at the heart of the city. The lake is beautiful with very interesting legend dedicated to it. The small temple with a big real turtle is shown to the public in the temple is amazing. He should be strong enough to carry the magical sword.The lake and surrounding is an ideal place for walking around in the evening to enjoy the night life of the city.A definitely must-see destination for any travelers.
Add to your itinery. Must see for all people doing a town tour. Very busy so not many photo opportunities without 100's of people in it. Lovely lake - definitely not serene

Beautiful island. The best place to see this lake and island is actually from the City View Restaurant across the street as the sun is setting. To see the lights come up around the lake and bridge is just gorgeous. There is a small pagoda on the island once you cross the bridge.

relaxing heart of hanoi. like a park with a huge lake, right in the center of town: this site slows the capital down to normal activity. Local meet here for all kinds of purposes: romance, relaxing, dancing lessons, music, marriage pictures, jogging, tai chi and so on.
Viva Vietnam. The well maintained beautiful gardens are breath taking and the area around here is so clean - wonderful
Nice part of town.. Once again, everything in Hanoi depends on the level of pollution. The lake would be beautiful if you could see it properly. Pollution levels stops you from appreciate the city

Beautiful Lake. This is a really beautiful lake in the middle of Ha Noi. There is a legend/story to the lake. It is a very busy place, many people going over the bridge to the temple. There is also a little temple in the middle of the lake. It is so beautiful at night time with the little temple in the middle of the lake all lit up

Pretty Lake.. The stories and folklore associated with this lake make it much more interesting. I was able to learn about much of the history from my Hanoikids guide. Very pretty part of Hanoi. Definitely should be visited, but not something that will blow you away.
Happening Place. A very interesting place to visit. Very crowded with locals and tourists enjoying themselves day and night.

Love this lake.. A beautiful lake. It is in central of Ha Noi connect between Ha Noi old quarter and French quarter. There are a lot of tree and flowers around the lake make it becomes a wonderful place to gether around. From every early morning to late evening here is a favourite place for a lot of people relaxing, doing exersices...It is not only the lake but it is a legend too. "Lake of the restored sword". If you are a photo hunter, this is the place.I love it.

Good!. The pictures I got at night around Hoan Kiem were good. This place was full of people, specially on Friday and Saturday evenings. The coconut ice creams okay. I would have wanted a picture sitting on the sloping branches but, so many people. The surrounding shops are interesting. The bridge looks good from afar. I wonder what time isn't so crowded?
Magical Lake. I have always enjoyed walking around the Hoan Kiem Lake during my earlier visits to Hanoi. This was the first time I had the time to also visit the temple on the lake.

Not only a lake.. I liked this lake, it was not only peaceful but also full of locals activities, like jogging, doing aerobic .... Furthermore, there were also a lot of famous place nearby to visit like a pagoda and a famous old bridge. And the legend of this lake was really interesting!

Be like a Hanoian. If you want to feel the local life of Hanoi people, this is the place you have to come!Early in them morning 5am, they have aerobic class, outdoor fitness, jogging, cycling, etc...At brunch hour, they have dancing class at Lý Thái Tổ square.Along the day, you'll find a lot of professionals taking photos around the lake.And so on...A must visit of Hanoi.
Good place for a scenic walk. Nice views. Entertaining people watching. Good way to get a bit of exercise. There are a ton of restaurants nearby so it's a fun place to go around lunch time.

More than a Lake.. Hoan Kiem Lake is just amazing spot to be. You can sit ther for hours just watching the life of the locals. The locals use this lake 24/7 for so many different things from exercising, chatting, selling, family life. We were very fortunate one morning we were at the lake around 6am and saw a large turtle the locals were so excited and apparently he/they don't come up very often and meant to be good luck! My husband and I visited the lake daily for walks and our avro beer!
Rommantic lake in Hanoi. It is the best lake in Hanoi, must come here when visit Hanoi. The best time to walk around this lake is this time ( the Autumn).
The lake near our hotel. We spent many hours around this lake, My husband is an artist and he would often get up early and sketch many of the lovely scenes.
A lovely lake. Right beside Old Quarter and is another main attraction in Hanoi, with the little tower right in the middle of the lake. A lot of people all the times, beautiful in the night.

Historical lake. Hoan Kiem Lake is simply a beautiful place to walk around and chat with a friend. In the evening, it was nice to see people out exercising and the lake is surrounded by shops. We enjoyed many nights just walking around the lake and people watching after dinner.
Nice place to visit. Lake near the Old Quartel, nice place to visit and drink a glass of beer in nearest pub. On holidays very popular.

Lovely lake.. Excellent choice for a night walk, as the central tower and the pagodas around were lighted up with colorful and attractive light. As this is a historical lake with lots of background stories,having a local friend or an experienced guide is a better choice since you will be able to know some interesting legends of the lake.

Watch the world go by. Tai Chi, Yoga, reading, walking, eating, fishing, sitting, worshipping... all of this can be seen and done around the lake. It is a great place to step off the world for a little while.

The centre of my trip to Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake was where we went to recover after long walks around the hectic city. People doing Tai Chi, young couples holding hands, stunning brides in traditional dresses having wedding pictures taken, fish in the water (and perhaps a little snake - did not see any tortoise though ;) ), people enjoying ice cream in the heat and students practising their English with tourists - all in all just a wonderful place to relax in the shades of the big trees around the lake.

Lovely for a walk around. Just a pretty little lake in the main part of Hanoi. One end has the French quarter, book quarter, and Hao Lo prison, the other end has water puppets, main round-about, Old quarter, back packer areas, hotels and shopping

Water is dirty. Lots and lots of garbage around the lake. Waters are dirty and full with dead fish. No benches to seat and enjoy the view. very lovely in the night when light are on. had some amazing pics just at night. In the day it is too hot but lots of shadow from the trees.

Extra special on Liberation Day. We had the chance to see the fireworks over the lake on Hanoi's 60th Liberation Day which made it special and unforgettable - especially with the number of people gathering to view it! Other than that, it's a nice place for a walk during the day and a visit to the pagoda shouldn't be missed. It seems to be the point where all traffic meets and if you've rented a scooter/bike it's nice to go for a round to have a feel of the atmosphere. Nice coffee places and bistros around and over-looking the lake too.

Especially beautiful in the morning. Get there early (just after sunrise) and watch all the local people doing sports and exercises, even playing badminton on the street. Something you do nt see in busy Hanoi during the day.
Very noisy but amasing.. Get there at night and finish dinner at roof top restaurant with magnificant view of lake. Imposdible to cross the road with endless motor bikers.

Where Hanoi lives. This where Hanoi lives its morning, day, evening and night. You can experience Hanoi here. You'll find people running, walking, exercising (a lot), sitting, eating, posing for pre/post wedding photos, romancing, playing etc etc.
Lake. A place to chill out a bit from the hectic pace of the old quarter. Feels safe and easy to stroll around.

Lovely place to walk. This is a lovely part of town, clean and easy to walk around. I was approached by some uni students who wanted to practice their english which was fun. Make sure you try the sticky rice ice cream - an interesting experience.

Picturesque lake. A lovely central point in the city to stroll around or sit and watch the world go by! We watched several weddings, a dragon festival and had coffee overlooking the lake at night - lovely

Hoan Kiem Lake. Stayed in Hanoi, Hoan Kiem Lake where I used to go through to get to the entertainment venues around the city. I was impressed with the open space and verdant landscape of Hoan Kiem Lake. As the center of the city, a lot of people came there to walk around and relax. I saw a lot of young people with friendly welcome. An hotelier recommended me to walk around the lake and eat ice cream at Tran Tian, the famous ice cream shop in Hanoi. I also got to visit the Hanoi Post office, watching the giant clock in gardens and walked along the lake to see the bookstores. It is great to relax in Hanoi, the green lung of the capital.
Quaint. More photo opportunities and well landscaped gardens. Popular place to visit and on edge of old quarter.

nice lake. My husband, son and I walked around the entire lake and found it to be quite pleasant. We walked over the famed red bridge and took some beautiful pictures as we met many nice people along the way. I was a nice relaxing afternoon

bit of peace in Hanoi. nice little temple in the middle of the lake, It needs restoring as much of the work done on it is quite dodgy. It is lovely to sit and contemplate the age of the building and the difference of the city that has grown up around it.

Wonderful spot for morning walk.. Enjoy morning walks around perimeter. As terrific as the view of the lake is all the wake up activity of the city. Such a great combination of tourists and residents walking, people watching, snapping photos, socializing and tai chi practicing. Check out the casual restaurant on the west side of the lake for a very good ice cream (coffee float is 2 thumbs up), cold drinks or light dining. Prices reasonable considering location. Many benches in shady spots for reading or relaxing. It is a true family centered park space.

A pleasant but ordinary lake. It's just an ordinary lake where local spent their leisure time.If you are interest to know how the regular for local then this is the place. There were determined evening joggers running beside it (some in raincoats) even in the drizzle. Please be reminded that you need to take care you belonging carefully...

Peaceful lake in the midst of bustling city. Located right in the centre of the Old Quarter, you will definitely not miss Hoan Kiem lake if you are in Hanoi. I have walked to the lake several times during my visit to Hanoi and I never fail to see huge crowd of people strolling around the lake, exercising there, selling things there, taking pictures there and doing every kind of relaxing activities around the lake. A walk around the lake will lead you to different places located around the lake as well. There is a pagoda and the red bridge at one end of the lake and another monument in the centre of the lake, which is nicely lighted up at night. I later found out that the monument used to be a grave but then later the story of the turtle claiming back the sword has also changed the significance of the grave. If you would like to find out more about the turtle story, you can visit the pagoda at the lake where they even house a replica of a giant turtle. The lake is definitely a place for photo shooting, be it at day or night time. The length of time that you want to spend here may differ, depending on what the purpose of your trip to the lake is.

Small lake, lots of people. Located right near Old District, in the middle of city. Takes about half an hour to walk around it without some old women try to selling something to you. The lake seem to be always crowded regardless of the time because it was the main attractions of the city. However you can enjoy the view from 5th-floor coffee shop near the lake. I think it was called Holland Coffee
pretty little lake. It probably takes 30 minutes to walk around the lake although when it's very hot can take a little longer. Not much to see you but it takes a good picture. Traffic one way.

Nice lake but over rated.. Crowded, people,selling wares, bottled water, women with balanced bamboo stick carrying fruits trying to rip you off on every corner and straight around the lake.Just enjoy your walk, try to ignore the rest n makes a surprisingly good place for people watching, bride and groom photo shoot, models posing with toy poodles on a photo shoot, surrounded by locals, topless Caucasians strutting their bodies (guys) jogging round the lake.Almost inevitable to pass by, or walk around, when you stay around Hoan Kiem district.

Great place to watch Hanoians. After a long day, it's nice to see the locals take their stroll around the lake. Some teenagers try to talk to the tourists which is fun and the others with their family. The fun for me here is to people watch especially the locals who have their pictorials by the lake. Some wedding photos or personal portraits with elaborate and traditional costumes. They even pose for you once they see your snapping away. No touts or guides bugging you as well.

A place to sit and relax in a very noisy city.. We enjoyed our walks by the lake which includes a quaint old bridge across to the temple. The lakeside is every bit as busy and bustling as the old quarter but somehow seems more restful. You can see couples having their pre wedding photos taken, the little old ladies selling donuts, kids riding round on their bikes and others just having a stroll. There are stalls with cool drinks and snacks and plenty of seats when you're feeling hot and tired.

Pretty lake - nice temple which tells the legend. This seems to be quite a central area of Hanoi - you can't seem to avoid it. On the edge of the Old Quarter - nice lake, and a lovely temple on the north end on an island - which tells the legend of the Tortoise and the sword.
