Real Hanoi right there. It's really nice to walk to the lake early in the morning. Old and young are doing all kinds of excersises from dancing to tai chi and yoga. We really loved the vibe around the lake. Hanoians mingle with the tourists. If you sit down a student might come up to you to practise their English. They are all very friendly. At night it looks a bit tacky with coloured lights around the lake.
A quick refresh. Some of the areas around the lake are very peaceful and provide a good break from the Hanoi mayhem. The temple is particularly pleasant.

Nice walk. Nice walk around for people watching and pretty trees. I didn't go into the temple. This place was super jam packed one night when there was a special fireworks display in celebration of the 60th anniversary of liberation day.
A must see!. Located in the central of hanoi old quarter and there is also a temple so you can visit and sit in the lake. It is very pretty with a lot of people and great to see.

Big lake in center of hanoi. Nice to see this, as you get to mingle with regular Vietnamese, playing chess or something like it outside the temple and taking wedding photos in western dress on the grounds leading to the temple.

The heart of the city. As a body of water, Lake Hoan Kiem isn't a big deal. It's the fact that it's a gathering point for so many people - foreigners and natives, alike. Everything goes on there - from exercising, to selling, strolling, just sitting... Everything you need is near there. Countless places to eat, banks, shops, the central post office, the Old Quarter on one side and the French Quarter on the other. It's a cool and breezy place in the heat of the day. As independence day approached I enjoyed several free concerts and an outdoor photo gallery. No visit to Hanoi would be complete without it..

Nice at day and at night. Nice to walk along have a coffee or an icecream. Have a chat with the locals, have yourself drawn or just realx. In the evening there is a kind of lightshow. Have a drink sit down and relax.

Green Oasis. Nestled in the heart of the old quarter you are likely to drive past this lake on the way to many of the inner city attractions.It's worth stopping at least once and taking a wander round the lake. The are plenty of shady spots and if there is a breeze it can be very pleasant.The lake can also get quite busy with fitness freaks in the morning and innumerable wedding parties taking pictures on the weekends. There is a cafe at the South end of the lake if you are in need of a cooling drink.

Relaxing walk & interesting people. This lake is a melting pot of people - tourists, locals doing different things - very interestingFor tourists, it is good to walk around, lots of old trees so if you love hugging trees this is for you. There is also the Turtle museum to see & the city hall buildings to take photos. If you are tired there are cafe's & will recommend the cafe on the 3rd floor overlooking the city - you won't miss this cafe - it is at the junction of the lake & the cafe is overlooking the whole lake
Romantic Lake. Like to have fine dinning @ the restaurant nearby, try choice for looftop restaurant with fantastic view.

Nice enough. The lake is really quite beautiful - particularly if the weather is right. However it's something you're likely to look at before moving on to other things (I highly recommend the temple on the island to the north of the lake which is beautiful).The location of the lake is quite key though - and it's very close to many key locations in the Old Quarter. A central hub of the area, if you will.

A must see. Beautiful lake right in the heart of the old quarter; there is also a temple you can visit that sits in the lake; only 20,000 dong to get in. Definitely worth a visit and its a nice walk around during day or night.
Beautiful. Loved it, very pretty, lots of people, great to see especially on a Xiglo. Lots of historical significance too

it is located in the city center, easy to go, but it was so busy crownded with people.. I planed to go their and read my favorite book, but I was annoyed with a bunch of people who came and want to sell their books to me. I did refuse, but it did not work at all, they keep telling me their dramatic lives. So, finally I have to buy their book. The weather was good, a lot of thing to discover. I enjoy seeing new gen of Vietnamese dating, chatting around the lake, these were so lively. They is nice coffee shop around the lake, and place to exchange money as well. The Thang Long water puppet is just located at the corner of the lake.
City gem. This small lake is a nice quite spot if you want a break from all the city fuzz. Is easy to get there and you can also find the Temple of the Jade Mountain after a red bridge.

Stroll around the lake. If you've had it with walking the streets and crossing the roads, why not take a stroll around the lake. It's a nice place to do a bit of people watching and you might even like to sit and watch the sunset. It's a pity you can't take your shoes off and dangle your feet in the water but then again who knows what's down there. Most probably Eels and I can't abide eels.

The lake is pretty - skip the fee for turtle island. The lake is just off the old quarter, a stroll alongside which is pleasant. Recommend to skip turtle island as you do not get much of a different view than what you get from the bridge (which is still free). The story of the turtle is on wiki for interested parties.

A Circuit of Two and All Hanoi Passes By. To walk around hoan Kiem Lake takes only twenty or so minutes, deoending on your pace and the degree of humidity. But a circumference or two will show you the people of Hanoi, from the elderly water sellers to the young people who congregate to socialise to the military police who appear to be watching the world go by without care. Ngoc Son temple is never out of view, and there will always be someone on hand to tell you legends of submerged turtles and legends of swords inscribed “Thuan Thien” that may sound Arthurian. By night, the place is filled with colour and spectacle, and on special occasions the streets are aflame with joy and celebration.The symbolic heart of Hanoi, Green Lake Hoan Kiem is a place for congregation, exercise and celebration, and a feast for the eyes and ears.
Nice place to relax. A nice place to relax, take a run in the early morning or just sit and people watch. See the temple as well.
Busy and Bustling. Walked around the Lake. Very busy no matter what the time of day. Many selling food, drinks and merchandise.

Nice Park and Beautiful Landscape. There were a few times early morning, my family and I went for light exercise and brisk wall around this lake. The climate is good, park is clean and well maintained and the landscape is beautiful. Just in case you need to catch up breath, there are many spots around this lake that you can take a break comfortably. The lake remains active with people even at night. Should you stay near this lake during your trip, drop by this lake for exercise and even for unwinding, it helps.

Not only a lake. It is the history. A famous place in the city, located right in the center with the Ngoc Son temple and the ? Bridge. I love the history of the lake, with the Holy Sword and a Turtle God. Maybe i will try to visit this country one more time in the near future

Early morning. We walked down to Hoan Kiem lake and watched the early morning exercise classes, Tai Chai, Fan Dance, individuals going through rigorous routines. In the evening , young people played ball games. The restaurant on the lake was a great place to eat in the evening
Hard to miss this. The lake is in the heart of the old quarter so it's hard to miss it. It's a pleasant area for a stroll either by day or night. There's lots of activity to watch.

It's a lake... Better than many. Ok, it's a lake. Fairly large with a temple just over a little bridge. Other than that, you can walk around it, sit by it and view it while eating dinner at one of the many restaurants around it.

Walk all the way around with a stop to go across the Sunbeam Bridge to a small pagoda. This lake is in the middle of the old quarter and borders on the French quarter. Walk all the way around to enjoy the tranquility interspersed with the sights and sounds of this bustling city.

Pretty Lake. In the evenings we tended to take stoles around the lake. It’s pretty particularly when the sun goes down. When visiting Hanoi, you won’t really able to miss it. We also got tuc tucs around it was really nice too. But be sure to negotiate the price beforehand. Overall a very nice lake.

Not to be Missed. I found that the area around the lake really gave me the flavor of Hanoi. It is a beautiful spot and that red bridge is spectacular when seen in the evening. The temple across the bridge is worth a visit.
Magic Lake. A walk around this lake will give you a wonderful sense of the insparation the Hanoi people get from this magical place
Relax your feet. Tired of walking the old quarter? Do some people watching around the lake. The cool breeze will revive your soul. Also enjoy the water puppet show next to the lake

A lake with a history. A famous place in the city, located right in the center with the Ngoc Son temple and The Huc Bridge. I love the history of the lake, with the Holy Sword and a Turtle God. Maybe i will try to visit this country one more time.
Famous and beautiful!. A really famous historical lake in Hanoi that worth a visit if you're on the way to the Water Puppet Theatre. For me I were really impressed by a temple nearby
See the stuffed turtle. The bridge is nice to take pictures, but you don't need to pay to get in the bridge. You give your ticket on the other side. Has a nice pagoda and incense altar.
A lake.. It's a lake with green water. nice to people watch but it gets really hot and humid. Maybe better time in winter.

The life of the Old Quarter. Interesting place to walk around, park benches, shady trees, juice bars, ice-cream shops, locals doing sketch cariacatures and playing hacky-sack (Vietnamese version that looks like a shuttlecock). Evening strolls around the lake were cool and romantic.

Beautiful place to wander around!. We found a cafe with beautiful views right across the lake which was a haven of peace whilst we had an iced coffee. Even more beautiful at night when parts are lit up. Interesting to see so many people of differing ages involved in so many different activities.

The lake is beautiful. The lake is good, you can feel the fresh breeze, but its not that beautiful ..
Just go around, enter into some random shops and spend some time with some friends. If you are alone, don't go ...
A romantic lake in the center of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is a very good place to walk around. Very clean & friendly people. I took many photos at there.

Famous lake with a lot of things to see.. A really famous historical lake in Hanoi that worth a visit if you're on the way to the Water Puppet Theatre. For me I were really impressed by a temple nearby.

Central to your visit to Hanoi. The lake is lovely and the shade provided by the trees is wonderful in the heat. It seemed like we were always going past or around the lake while we were in Hanoi and each pass by it gave a different glimpse of local life. My 2 friends and I joined the "dancing grandmas" in their workout class for 2 songs and it was great fun. They had some moves! :-)The temple in the centre was nice to visit (small fee to cross the bridge) and there was an in-house guide that gave us a mini tour and some interesting insights into what offerings were made and why as well as some history around the lake and area.
Sword.... From our hotel.tublinh legend we just walk there ...or take taxi about 20.000 vnd for taxi..if you come to Hanoi you have to see this place ...
Good place to walk. Easy to walk here without getting clobbered by cycle. The lake has an assortment of hanoi life. I hear they have laughing yoga at 6 am
Nice. Not exciting - but worth a visit. The mummified turtle on the island was interesting... It cost about $1.00 to get onto the island.
Tranquil Setting Amidst Busy City. What a truly beautiful place to visit and an interesting insight into historical events that shaped the culture that is Vietnam today.
The Turtle. This haven in the centre of the city is interesting a great place to relax and look for the turtle and weekends you will always run into young people who love to talk to you
Early morning sights. Wandered around lake at dawn to see groups of people exercising - especially loved the jazercise ladies! Then off to early morning coffee.

Beautiful. Hoan Kiem Lake is in the Old Quarter. although surrounded by streets and traffic it is really peaceful. Its just over 1 mile to walk round the lake and there are lots of shops, restaurants, bars and refreshments available nearby. The Turtle Tower is in the middle of the lake and you get to the Jade Mountain Pagoda by crossing the Japanese bridge. There is an entrance fee to get into the Pagoda but it's not very much (20,000 Dong) and well worth it. The pagoda is very colourful and ornate with a lovely smell of burning incense.
Oasis in the middle of chaos. We lived just beside the lake and it was a great place to get alittle pease in the middle of th busy old quarter

A-must visit place in HANOI. Don't leave Hanoi without visiting Hoan Kiem Lake. The best time to visit is early in the morning and evening. In morning, local people are walking, exercising and having fun in the lake and at night, the lights from the lake is fantastic. How amazing that in the middle of the city, there's a very nice lake.
Piece of tranquility. A beautiful large lake set at one end of the Old Quarter. Lovely in the evenings when it is lit up. Many restaurants and coffee houses around the lake
More exploring. Not a lot to see........part of a walk we did with a very good guide provided by our hotel - Toan was his name!
Historical. Tranquil with lots of locals strolling around it.Has to cross a heavy traffic circuit to get to it.

Interesting historical lake.. One of the top-famous spot in Hanoi, with a lot of legends and tales revolving around. Also has many attractions around, with a overly-famous turtle. It's too bad that I couldn't see the turtle himself.

An nice break from city life. This is a very nice place for a stroll in the last afternoon or morning. A peaceful retreated surrounded by the busy city traffic. You will be approached by folks wanting to speak English with you but that is fun. A few sales folks but I think that too is fun. Good spot for photos for sure. Visit it when in Hanoi.
Very nice. Very nice lake to walk around and get out of the heat when in Hanoi. Might even spot a turtle! We walked by or around the lake several times during our stay.
Beautiful Oasis. Stunning spot to escape the heat and noise of bustling Old Quarter. Be aware of people asking if you have any spare time as they are often looking to relieve you of money!!

An oasis in Hanoi. The lake gives a shady break from the heat and energy of Hanoi. My favourite time to visit is early morning, from daylight, which is a great time to people watch. The Hanoi people are out exercising, and as well as the usual walkers and Tai Chi practitioners, there are a thousand individual styles of exercising, which are endlessly amusing. It takes less than half an hour to do a lap, and there are also plenty of benches. There are a couple of toilets available for a small fee. I did visit the Ngoc Son temple across the red bridge this time, and enjoyed it, but at 20,000 dong it is not a necessary visit if you are spending any time in Vietnam and can visit other free temples.
Hoan Kiem Lake. an oasis in the middle of the teeming and vibrant city ! Joggers and lovelorn couples co exist ! i have yet to discovered any particular dislike,seriously !

terrific. the lake is quite small but as soon as you see it you feel the relief from the chaos of the old quarter. it is both very nice during the day, but especially at night when the pagoda and the bridge get illuminated with different colors.definitely worth it.people suggested to see it in may, since the flowers around it are terrific.

Very Nice City Park. This was a very popular place early in the morning and at night. In the morning you have a lot of people out exercising and enjoying the path around the lake. In the evening you have a lot of young couples and families enjoying the weather and getting ice cream around the lake. Didn't visit the temple or puppet theater though, but I'm sure those would have been nice as well!It was a great place to relax and enjoy some coffee with a good view or just sit on the side of the lake and chill.
good walk. Lake is surrounded by trees and pavements that provide a pleasant walk out of the sun, just a few yards from the traffic hustle.
lake. nice to watch people exercising ,tai chi walking.The water is dirty and I would not like to fall in their.

Go early then go late. Try to get up early to watch the locals do Tai Chi while the city becomes alive around you. Go back at night when everyone shows up to take a stroll around the lake which is lit up like Christmas. Be careful of the cyclo drivers, they will attempt to rip you off if given half the chance.It's best to avoid these scam artists.

Nice. Nice lake especially at nice when it is all calm and the lights are on. Don't be alarmed if you are approached by school children doing a poll and asking questions, they just want to improve there English.
Beatiful lake. Beautiful lake and a great story behind it. You must go to the lake when you visit Hanoi. Fresh, nice pictures. Find the magical turtle

Lovely place to relax whilst taking a break from sightseeing. This lake to the east of the city and on the border between the Old Quarter and the French Quarter is a fantastic place to have a drink, a bite to eat or even an ice cream or ice lolly whilst having a rest/break from sightseeing. To walk around the lake will take about 15 to 20 minutes and there are plenty of benches and walls to sit on at the lake edge. You'll be greeted with all sorts of things, from teenagers having an off the cuff sing along to a class of women enjoying some form of exercise with music playing in the background.I was writing postcards on a bench on the edge of the lake and was approached on more than one occasion by local students just wanting to talk to you to practice their English - very polite and very friendly. So if you look as though you may speak English (like I was told I do by one student) be prepared to take a little time to speak to the friendly locals.You'll also be greeted by other locals trying to sell you an array of things, cards, postcards, tourism books, novels etc. If you need/want any of these things be prepared to haggle (I got a book I was planning to buy back home for £2.80 GBP), if you say that the price is too high or that you cannot afford it eventually you will be asked to offer what you want/you can afford and invariably they will accept your offer. If you don't need any of these things just politely say no thank you, smile and carry on walking, because if you stop you will find yourself being drawn into buying something you don't want and potentially wasting some of your touring time.There is a post office at the bottom right (south east) of the lake for anyone who needs to send anything home or for anyone who wants to send a postcard home. After purchasing stamps go outside and post your items in the yellow post box outside.

Positive Review. My teenagers and I enjoyed walking around the lake - we made the small trip to the island (minimal fee) which was a good way to spend an hour 'slowing down' while still doing something. Purchased an icecream on the way, postcards as well. Word of warning - flat shoes with little grip do nothing to keep you upright on wet muddy tiles - although the teenagers found mum muddy and wet on the seat of her pants, hilarious.

Lovely to stroll around and visit. When in Hanoi we had terrible weather, so it was time to pop our umbrellas up and still see the sights.Hoan Kiem lake is a must visit and the central island provides some pretty sights to see and lovely photos opportunities. We loved the little red bridge!Walking around the lake itself is restful and romantic, despite the rain.You can't avoid the lake whilst in Hanoi, it's a central feature. Enjoy a stroll and walk with your loved one, I do hope when you go you have better weather than we did!
First Stop for Hanoi Tourists. This lake is beautiful, contains folklore, a temple, a tower, and more. Shops and restaurants surround it on all sides. I visit every chance I get.

Best place to relax in Hanoi. Hoan Kiem is the best place to relax and catch your breath after a hectic day of site seeing in Hanoi. Walking around the lake takes only a few minutes and is great for people watching, lots to do, see, eat and buy along the way.
Beautiful lake with a lot of thing to see.. Famous historical lake with interesting tale of origins. Not to mention that the is a lot of thing to see around: The temple, the water puppet theatre....

Beautiful Oasis in the Heart of the City. The park-lands surrounding the lake are manicured to perfection, and the locals take great advantage of the green space. Take time to go to the island (it costs a minimal fee) where you can place an offering at the temple, and get a great view of the surrounding lake.
Lake. Lot of rats and smells horrible. Nice night lights, because at night you can't see all the dust around...

Sit back and let the entertainment unfold. The lake is the heart of Hanoi's Old quarter. You can stroll around the lake and be entertained each step of the way from attractions such as ballroom dancers, aerobics, tai chi, buskers, cafes, the gardens, the many brides and grooms. Or alternatively utilise the perimeter of the lake as a "fast track" for exercising and you won't be alone either - a brisk walk of the lake will take approx 20 minutes. Don't miss it at night time too. The lighting looks spectacular.

peace amidst the chaos. in steep contrast to the hustle and bustle of the streets only meters away Hoan Kiem Lake is the perfect place to relax and enjoy a legendary local coffee after bartering and shopping. At night the light show takes over and makes for even more spectacular viewing!

Hoan Kiem Lake is cute place to visit. Must say that Hoan Kiem Lake is the center of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is beautiful lake, right in the center of the city. It is nice to walk around the lake and experience lots of thing around Hoan Kiem Lake. You must try to get up early, about 5.30 or 6.00 to see local people doing exercises, tai Chi, Aerobic. It is nice to sit at City View Cafe, on 5th floor, you will enjoy looking at Hoan Kiem Lake, streets, motorbikes. In Autumn, Hoan Kiem Lake is really beautiful as some flower is blooming. It is worth to vitsit Hoan Kiem Lake.

A nice place to visit. Considered as the heart of Hanoi, this lake is a popular destination for locals to gather for socialization, recreations, tai-chi, aerobic exercise, badminton... from dawn to dusk. It is a very nice park around the lake. A few coffee shops on the western side , offer great view of the lake

On the to do list. Lake is central to all that is happening close to the Old Quarter. Weekends are specially fun with masses of locals and tourists out for fun in the evenings. We would take a walk around to work off all the wonderful food that is available . There are lots of very old trees all around.We felt very safe, even late at night. Only complaint was the lack of trash bins. Locals littered the place with ice cream rappers ect. Seemed to have been cleaned by the next day.

Lovely place anytime. Its great place to walk around anytime. Its nice in morning when people work out there its nice during day when you hide under shadow of trees. And of course during night when Turtle palace is shining dimmed light in middle of lake, couples enjoying romantic atmosphere and sitting on benches. Ask someone to tell you legend about Turtle and its legendary sword. Only minus is trash in lake and it cant be used for swimming.

right in the middle of the big city. Very beautiful lake right in the middle of busy busy downtown Hanoi. Well manicured grounds - flower beds are constantly being changed and improved. Workers continuously are netting accumulated leaves and debris from the water. Morning dancing is fun to watch - or participate in. A desirable spot for photographers both amateur and professional. Beautiful shade trees. It really is a premier spot well worth a visit.

A great place to chill out. This is a place where you can see local playing chinese shuttlecock, couples snuggling around, and people will just approach you to have a nice chat. Great place to hang out after a whole day of wandering around Hanoi attractions. Try the ice cream there, it's famous according to the local, that's what they told me :)

Green environment in a noisy capital. We walked aroud the lake when we ended our tour in Ha Noi capital. That was a good place for us to breath the fresh air and quiet environment. We saw a lot of old people who seemed always to be there for a whole day. They sat down on the chair and read newspaper, magazine. Some of them played Taichi. Peaceful place, we loved and enjoyed it.

It's a lake, with a pagoda.. It is just a dirty lake with an old pagoda dedicated to the story of Le Loi. The most interesting part for me was huge, dead, tortoise in the glass case (Le Loi or one of his relatives). I think it only cost $1 each to get in so that makes it worth seeing.

Visit the West Side at Dusk. A pleasant lake where Hanoi congregates. The lake isn't that large and can be walked around entirely fairly quickly. I recommend the West Side of the lake at Dusk, when it is at its busiest with people from all walks of life just doing their thing...

Quiet Oasis in the madness that is Ha Noi. Great place to escape to when you need some R and R from the madness that is the Old Quarter of Ha Noi. Good walking paths surround the lake, and Café in the SW corner is a must go to when the temp hits 40degs! Beer, ice coffees, ice cream hits the spot. The area surrounding the lake does not cool down that much, but it might fool the brain into thinking it is. Good views of the temples from the lake edge.

Do not expect anything special. It may be a pleasant walk, but not in August when the weather is so hot. You may find interesting The Tortoise Tower, in a kind of island at the southern end of the lake, and Den Ngoc Son, a small temple founded in the 14th century. Do not expect anything special...
So charming!. What a great place to have a leisurely stroll around at night! All of the sites are lit up, and you see all the locals snuggling on benches and having strolls about.

Don't expect too much and you will be fine.. The lake and it's surroundings we're not well maintained and dirty. Not much activities provided, just an average lake view with local people loitering by the lakeside.

The main city point: a lake. The old district is situated on the north ed, crowded vibrant on south end area high end shopsIt's just a great walk around the lake in the shade of trees, getting away from the hustle.Many local walking sitting relaxing exercising, wedding photographs just sit on a bench watching this daily street life.

Nice stroll. We went for a stroll around the lake. It took approximately 40 minutes to walk the whole distance. Many locals do some kind of exercise here, like jogging and joga. There are many shaded trees around the lake and benches where one can just sit and relax. It seemed as if this is a very popular spot in Hanoi to come to and relax, especially during late afternoon hours. Here you can escape from the chaotic and overcrowded traffic in the streets!

City Focal Point. Northern end has a lot of shops and restaurants nearby and where all the locals hang out. View over lake was a break from the hustle and bustle of the city.Don't bother with the night market where they close off streets. Too hot and crowded.Hanoi shopkeepers are somewhat indifferent to selling you things. Much keener in Ho Chi Minh City. Best shopping was actually in Hoi An which is a beautiful place.

Nice for a walk around. The lake is nice for a walk around. There is no fee to walk around the lake or take some pictures on the bridge. There is a fee however when you go across the bridge onto the little island, on the island there is a little temple. We paid to go over, it is about 20,000 dong each ($1) and only takes a few minutes to walk around. We got some nice pictures on the island, but you would not be missing anything not going over.

Polluted hole.. There is a nice story about an ancient turtle that lives in this lake, thus you would think the authorities would take more effort in cleaning the place up. The turtle is thought to be the only one of its kind left in the world-another one was clubbed to death in the lake a few years ago.It's crazy trying to cross the road from the old quarter to the lake so go early when the road traffic is still light.Certainly not place for a romantic picnic but one of the City's attractions, so probably worth going to see if you have nothing else to do.

Worth a stroll around. As we walked around the lake we spotted many couples on their wedding days having photo-shoots.
A turtle lives in the lake, it is supposed to be good luck to see it. It was taken out in 2011 for treatment of disease caused by pollution and put back in. Lots of nice rooftop bars to sit and chill at

Nice to walk around. We would go down to the lake at night. Lots of people would be out with family exercising or meeting friends. We spoke with university students who wanted to practice their English. Lovely people and lovely surroundings.

Only walk around the lake. Do not pay the fee for the little temple a repos the red bridge. It is nothing special and you surely have seen or will seem travelling in Vietnam, much better temples than that. Take a couple of pics of the bridge than just walk around the lake and, in the hottest hours, sit on the benches in the shade of one of the big trees.

Great place for walking around. So many places to see, and stuff to buy, just around the lake. Many quaint shops, like bookstores, cafes and restaurants just around the lake area. You can spend days just going around the area and the old quarter, sampling food, shopping for items like bags, shoes and souvenirs. This was the center of our after work hours for many days, and we always found something new to marvel at.

The Best Place in Hanoi. WOW! There is no place I'd rather be than taking an early morning stroll around Hoan Kiem Lake at day break. You will see people in every imaginable sort of physical activity...walking, jogging, tai chi, fishing, meditating, walking dogs, walking backwards, 8-80 year olds in motion...cyclists, groups of women's, men, solitary or family...they are all in some sort of creative exercise...put on your walking shoes, get up early and take your camera.

Chilled out in the centre of hustle and bustle. Some beautiful photo opportunities and a place to wind down and relax and just observe people and the sights. A man was praying at a monument in amongst the noise of Hanoi at the edge of the bridge. This seemed surreal somehow, but he was in his in 'place' and it was beautiful.
Centre of Town!. All the best drinking and eating holes are around this lake. Hoan Kiem Lake makes the best area of the city very easy to navigate and everything is walking distance.
Illuminated temple and bridge. The Thap Rua, Ngoc Son Temple and Huc bridge are illuminated at night. It's a nice view to be photographed. Be aware, the light will be off by around 10pm.

Stunning especially at night. This is an amazing place right in the middle of a 1000 year old capital city. I could walk around the lake for hours people watching and taking in the sights. You can buy souvenirs at a small shop at one end, great bamboo root men and excellent retired water puppets etc. The lake itself has the typical arched bridge to the temple island, there is a downed airplane from the war, the worlds rarest turtle, freshwater crabs and is the best places for people watching. We saw soldiers, a wedding, a funeral and found heaps of places for food and drink. The story of the restored sword it worthwhile understanding as it appears in many parts of the Vietnamese culture so before you go read up. If you see the man playing the flute give him some money he is very good. Just remember in Vietnam there is no social welfare system so if you have a disability your own your own. Making a small donation to one or other (or several) of the locals with disabilities is very worthwhile and the few dollars it cost you is nothing in compassion with what they can do with your few dollars. OH I forgot walk around the lake at night as well as during the day it looks completely different.

It's a magnet. Been to Hanoi many times but this attraction has never worn thin. And it doesn't matter what time of day either, there is always something of interest, early morning, early evening, or any time. Takes about an hour to walk all around it, longer if you stop for a cup of coffee or something stronger. A choice of food at any time of the day. It's reached the point with me that I prefer to stay in a hotel within easy reach and preferably with a bedroom window with a view of the lake. There's something quite uplifting about it.
A pretty place. Spent time at the temple and the bridge and then just strolled around the lake. Very picturesque. Went back in the evening to watch the locals

An Oasis. After the hustle and bustle of the Old quarter take a cuclo and head round to the other end of the Lake. a light outdoor lucn and then a slowly walk back. Learn to say Khom 'No' to the street vendors and enjoy 'time out'. Even better at night. Safe and a world within a world.

Hanoi must see temple. It's combination of temple and historic site. One must visit site during Hanoi trip. Interesting venue. Can't remember whether there is English sign boards explaining the history or not.

It's a lake. Its a lake that you can walk around. Some lakes are hard to walk around because the water is a good source of nutrients for trees. Other lakes are too big to walk around. Some lakes are dangerous to walk around because the water is a good source of nutrients for Kodiak bears. This lake is not like those lakes. At this lake the restored sword has been victorious over all things both tall and mildly life threatening. It's a lake you can walk around.

The best part of Hanoi. This is a jewel of urban development. This lake ties the whole city together. People just hang out there, walk around, exercise or sit and talk. There are more people in the evening. You can just stroll and enjoy beautiful views of the old temple or a little "leaning tower" on the island in the middle. Forgive my ignorance but the name escapes me. It is a nice change of pace from a crazy and chaotic old town to serene and quiet of the lake. I kept coming back there while in Hanoi. It's my favorite part of this town.
A must see. Very nice place, full of people practising yoga early in the morning around 5 AMNoisy in day time but the real heart of Hanoi Old quarter

The tortoise legend... A very well known legend of the Hanoian really relates to this Lake of the Restored Sword. I was able to see the very big tortoise that is believed to be found in the lake. Everyone can see it at the Ngoc Son Temple, at the middle of this lake.Very good lake that you can enjoy anytime of the day, be it on morning, afternoon or even late at night.

A lovely stroll. This is in the heart of Hanoi and is a lovely, short walk. We walked there from our hotel the first morning we got there and it was a nice way to check out what Hanoi was like. It's shaded at the lake's edge and was not overly crowded when we went midmorning on a week day. There is an interesting little temple in the middle of the lake that you need to buy a ticket to see but well worth checking out. The French Quarter is off to one side and the Old Quarter is close buy. You can easily walk to either from the lake or grab a bicycle rickshaw.

Very interesting and great restaurants around. This temple is situated in the lake in the heart of the city and it is very nice with lots if things to see, very well illuminated at night and with very good restaurants around? A nice place to be
Beautiful lake, especially in the night. Go to Avalon Sky Garden cafe and book a table in the front row. You will have an amazing view - just WOW!!

Short trip. This is the central part of town. It's very easy to walk around and visit the pagoda. You probably wouldn't need any longer than an hour. After you've done that it's a great place to grab a cyclo (negotiate fare first) and have an hour long ride around the old quarter. We took 2 cyclos and it cost us 350000 ( about $19 Aud) which was more than fair to us.
Go for the view and the exercise.. Great place for a walk, meet the locals, get a bit of exercise.. but watch out crossing the streets to and from there!
nice area with shadow. Nice place, possible to walk and relax without looking out for motorbikes :) the trees offer a little bit of shadow which is nice in July.

A must see in Hanoi. When in Hanoi you must see this, it is a part of their history and culture, the view from Hoan Kiem Lake is wonderful, best time of the day is sunset, enjoy a relaxing beer in one of the cafe's and watch the local people enjoy the cool of the evenings

Beautiful lake in the middle of the urban sprawl. We stayed at the Hanoi Pearl Hotel which is just a few minutes walk from the lake so once we had checked in we went for a walk around the lake. Like the majority of Hanoi there are beautiful trees and gardens around the lake. The lake itself is quite muddy but the overall setting with the trees, the island in the middle and the beautiful gardens make it well worth a visit. After dodging through the traffic the lake provides beautiful and peaceful respite.

Great place to relax. Walking around the lake takes about 30 mins. At night you can have your portrait drawn in 30 mins for 200k vnd (couple) and 100k (individual). But of course that price is for you to bargain with. If you are happy with what they drew then by all means pay them what they think they deserve (i.e. the original asking price). Quite a few cafes around the lake, and a lakeside restaurant which i think is expensive and not worth it. Overall a good place to get away from the busy streets of old quarter, if you are tired of squeezing and getting honked at while walking along the roads, this is a good respite!

Picturesque bridge. The little red bridge is what first grabbed our attention and off course we took photos as do all the other tourists! The temple on the island is lovely and the monks were performing their ceremonies when we were there. It was lovely walking around the lake, as it is a little oasis in the middle of Hanoi !

Early morning walk around the lake. The best time to visit the lake is around 5.30-6am when everyone is doing their early morning exercise, some are speed walking or jogging around it while others are doing aerobics, ballroom dancing, Tai Chi or playing badminton. The laughing yoga by the statue of Ly Thai To is one of the best things I've ever seen (and unintentionally joined in with... laughing is infectious!!)

Lovely to wander around.. In the hustle and bustle of Hanoi, it was nice to stroll around the lake. There are some interesting statues dotted around to look at too. The little red bridge was a nice place to stop for photos but obviously got quite busy.

Nice place for an afternoon stroll. The lake itself is very beautiful in my opinion, its has this mystical feeling to it. A good place for a stroll in the very busy city of Hanoi. The atmosphere is very calming. You can see the locals doing their own thing. You do see travelers from time to time but not too touristy.
Walk around. Take your time to easily surround Hanois central lake, enjoy typical Vietnamese coffe, avoid souvenir shops and prefer small reaturants and coffee shops in the nearby old town

A great place to spend an afternoon. For me it is the best park/lake in Hanoi. The atmosphere is really quiet even with the road around and it's really beautiful.
Don't be affraid of the people who will come to talk t you in English. It is nice english learning people who want to improve by talking with stranger. A really nice time with them.

Good place to take a walk. Not much I can add in my review for the lake. I recommend this area for a walk in the afternoon, or in the evening. If the weather is nice, during autumn or winter, it is really beautiful.

Very Beautiful Place. I came in Vietnam for vacation in July 2014 from Japan
This lake is REALLY BEAUTIFUL
I like the atmosphere here
I like to walk around this Lake!

Place to rest Hanoi people. CC ( 2014.08.01 )
There was very overcrowded around lake. Many people avoided heat on the surroundings of lake. There was good view in day and night, and near to main street. If visit Hanoi, must go there and feel Hanoi's mood.

Clean Lake. I really liked the ambiance when sitting near the lake. You just need to be more extra cautious when crossing the street. There lots of people offering something to sell in expensive price. You should refuse or bargain it.
sunset at lake. lovely view of the sunset, a lazy walk around the lake thru the lash green walkawy with a coffee is an ideal way to spend the evening.

Abit polluted, but definitely one of the symbol of Hanoi. This lake is the trademark of he city of Hanoi. Legend has it that there is two giant tortoise in the lake. One of the tortoise remains is held in the museum in the middle of the lake which you can visit, while the other is still within the lake and can be seen once in a blue moon. Do check out this land mark sight and the architecture located near this landmark.

beauty lake !. speacial lake ! it has Ngoc Son temple and TheHuc bridge.In the center of lake has a small land. On the land has Turtle tower!and when you visit VietNam, you should come here because it is a famous place in Ha Noi.the food is really delicious such as Trang Tien icream, a type of candy which VietNamese say "keo keo", it is made from rice..... oh, so much, come here and..... feeling!

It's a Lake. I run around this lake several times a week, usually on the road that goes around the lake as there are so many people walking around it.I guess from a touristy culturalish viewpoint it can be interesting, but to me it's just a lake.

If you can, visit in the evening.. You can visit it all day, but like in many places in Vietnam, the atmosphere is the best after about 7 or 8pm when everyone enjoys their freetime and the cooler temperature. You can often catch different groups exercising (fitness, aerobics, dancing, etc.) together, which adds to the vibrance of the city. Also, a lot of young University students will want to start a conversation with you, as they are trying to learn English. Go ahead and join in the conversation and ask them about Vietnam, some can tell you local stories you won't hear from the larger tourists places.

Beautiful. Walked along the lake daily, There is temple to visit, on the lake. It was an easy walk from the hotel that I was at. There were lots of street vendors around the late, so it can be annoying if you wish to just sit or walk along. There is no quite time!

Interesting place for walking and sightseeing. This place is a comfortable destination in a noisy city as Hanoi. You can go there all day, especially in the early morning or late afternoon to relax, breath cool air crossing the lake and fall in soft melodies of Hanoi sung by communication radios there. That time, sipping a drink while looking at the peaceful lake is a good idea. The name "Hoan Kiem" related to a mysterious legend said from the past till now. Travelers agreed with Business Travel Vietnam Co., Ltd that the best choice is take a walking or cyclo tour. There are some interesting places worth visiting such as: Ngoc Son Temple, Thang Long Water Puppet Theater, St. Joseph's Cathedral (Nha Tho Lon), then explore ancient streets....

Great place to people watch!. Great place for a jog or brisk walk if your hotel nearby in the Old Quarter. The locals are there doing their exercises by 5.30 am in the morning. Interesting seek how various generations of locals keep fit. Scenery is plant but nothing exceptional. However, it is the morning buzz that makes it interesting. Tip : Be careful if you are carrying valuables in a backpack. There are pick pockets preying in the area near the north side of the lake. Somebody tried but my eagle eyed son spotted his attempt and scared him off.

lots of water. I don't want to sound mean, but I've seen some beautiful lakes and this doesn't really compare. It has a sweet little temple on its Island, but other than that it's a body of water like any other. It doesn't have the romance, charm or magic of the lake by the Summer Palace in Beijing, or the Serpentine in Hyde Park. Good turtle story though!

..a breather at the heart of the congested city...peaceful and calm.... ..this place is the best area to relax ur feet and rest them,after a long walk from the opera house and Hilton hotel...you can sit and take in the serene calm view and enjoy the cool breeze from across the lake...theres a temple in the middle of the lake on a small island.......this spot is simply the green lung in the busy bustling city....nice to go for long walks and have a nice cool drink here...lotsa shops around that sell souvenirs all over and around the lake too...plenty of peddlars selling things as well,they come to you as if they are homing in.....try to visit the temple at the lake,the close by 5-6pm i guess...so be a bit early...

Morning stroll. Get up early (6am) to enjoy Hoan Kiem Lake at its best. People perform Tai Chi, classical dance, play badminton, câu or give eachother massages. Sit down on a bank and within a few minutes Vietnamese will join you to practice their English.

For me the niciest place in Hanoï. I run the lake twice during my visit, and every night I spend a moment, to rest and make the point of the day face to the old temple. It is a place "à part". Don't hesitate to come and come again. Every day it's different, colors, peacefull, peoples.

Best Story of Losing a Sword. The emperor of Vietnam saw a giant turtle who took his sword and now it is in the lake. It is considered very good luck to see a turtle here. Really a very tranquil place in the middle of a very busy city. Well worth the visit.
WOW! So nice view. Beautiful landscape , a pearl in the middle of HanoiIs amazing to walk around this beautiful lake and meet many friendly people

Just walk around - by morning, day and night. Take a trip around this calm and beautiful lake. Gives you an opportunity to merge with the locals and see how they go about their day. There is plenty of good cafés around the lake but I would diffidently recommend the top of Ho Guom Plaza (also known as Shark Jaws). There you can have a drink of choice for a reasonable price and just watch.
Nice for a stroll. Nice lake to take a walk around, particularly in the evening when the locals are out and about. Plenty places to seek a bit of shade on a hot day.

Walk around this lake early in morning. Great to see all the locals exercising doing Tai Chi etc, I felt like joining in, after our trip on Halong Bay, And a lesson in Tai Chi, I did have a go, very theraputic for an action person like myself! The locals seem to exercise early and go to the markets early, loved it. At one end of the lake you can go to the French Quarter and the other the old part of Hanoi.

Good relaxing area. Nice park and lake in the centre of the city of Hanoi, some seating and shade around the lake and for a small entry fee you can cross the bridge and visit the old temple, I mostly liked the lake and found it a nice place to take a walk but wouldn't rate it as 5 star

A respite in the middle of a bustling town. Hoan Kiam lake seems to have a schedule. In the lull of the afternoon sun, I've noticed mostly lovers or people watchers. Mind you, couples there are more discreet so you just see a lot of plain sitting around. I guess it makes it more conducive for others to join in, especially under the inviting shade of the giant trees that surround the lake. In the late afternoon, you start seeing joggers and children. Some photographers, couples on their pre-nuptial photo shoots and students pop up in the late afternoon as well. In any case, I was pleasantly surprised at how well-kept the place is. Seeing all the warnings in forums, I was a bit apprehensive and kept my bag close. Once I was there though, I felt like those who were there were also busy taking in the view and enjoying the breeze. It was a good area for the community to gather -local, foreigner, young or old are drawn here for their own reasons. Just be wary of some men who'd have a sudden interest in chatting you up (if you're a lady). Other than that, enjoy! Bring a book, take your dog, drink coffee, brisk walk...

Definitely take a walk around this lake.... We loved this little lake right next to the Old Town. We were fortunate enough to be in Hanoi when the country was starting to celebrate the New Year and the park area around the lake was being transformed with new plants/flowers and decorative lights. We walked around this lake both during the day and at night when it was all lit up. Is a good way to absorb some local culture as you never know what will be going on. Some artists sell their work, people do their exercises, is a great backdrop for photos, and you can visit the small Jade Mountain Temple if you wish (you walk across the beautiful red Sunbeam Bridge). There are lots of restaurants just across the streets from the lake if you need refreshment.

Tortoise and the Sword. The green coloured lake, as the legend goes when King Le Loi was boating a golden turtle appeared and asked the King for the sword supposedly belonging to the Dragon King which was given to the King Le Loi during the revolt against the Ming dynasty. The King renamed the lake as as Luc Thuy meaning grren water to commemorated this legend. There is a small tower called the turtle tower in the middle of the lake and is linked to the legend.

Just another lake. Worth taking a look if you are passing by but otherwise don't bother. The locals do go there to sit around and in the evenings we saw a few exercise classes going on there. Now that was interesting.

Picturesque. Just a beautiful lake, with the small the Tortoise Tower mid-lake and the Ngoc Son Temple accessible by bridge. Parks surround the lake, which are even better at night when locals gather at the park for ballroom dancing and rollerskating, just really charming.

Take your time. Beautiful lake in old quarter. Lots of great restaurants and places to sit and watch the world go by. Wide paths make it easy to walk round and avoids the thousands of mopeds on the roads which surround it. About 30 minutes gentle stroll but take longer to soak in the atmosphere and have a drink etc.

Lake view. The tranquility of the lake is infectious you can stroll completely around the lake or just sit and contemplate the meaning of life lol, for 50,000 dong you can cross over the lake on a bridge visit the temple in the middle and burn some incense and leave a prayer

Worth the visit. After walking round the lake you reach the bridge which is free to walk on. To enter the temple however it is about $1, which is fine but it is best to know a bit before entering to appreciate it more.

Beautiful walk. Well maintained lake, picturesque. Great for photographers/ photo enthuasiasts/hobbyists
Nice walk, flanked all around by shops and restaurants and hotels
nice place~. many shops and cafes around the lake. the center of Hanoi tourism~

A slice a serenity in a busy city. A lovely large lake in the middle of Hanoi. Take the time to walk around the lake and slow down a little, especially if it is a hot day. Admire the lovely structure in the middle of the lake. A nice change in a busy city.

Beautiful Scenery. The lake is a very beautiful and relaxing location to stroll around and enjoy the scenery that exists in the middle of Hanoi. I didn't enter the temple and yet still found the lake and the location very enjoyable.

A peaceful spot amongst the chaos. The lake area is a really peaceful spot to stop and watch Hanoi go about its business. The lake is surrounded by good cafés and there are plenty of spots to sit and relax, and possibly get postcards or wallets sold to you!
worth the wait to get across the bridge. the line up to get across the bridge was frustrating and we weren't sure why it was moving so slowly but it was worth it when we got across there.

I liked it!. I found the lake peaceful, and my beloved and I walked around some part of it (or the whole thing) every day of our stay. Was it out of this world? No, there's definitely nicer and grander lakes out there (think Lake Como or Hyde Park) - but what it does have that others may lack is a culture and mystery that to me gives it a little awe. Make a point of going over to the little island temple and learning a little about the history of the lake, you'll appreciate it a little more.

Lovely, peacefull small lake&island. We stayed in the old city and this lake was kind of get-away from the city's traffic. Here you can walk peacefully, you have space and you can enjoy the lake.There is a temple in the island. Its nice to see, but nothing special. Its very crowded and there was a 20k entrance
nice enough. I went there almost everyday for a jog. Really nice to do 2 laps, a bit difficult when the weather is so hot thought.

Tracey G Dont miss visiting. While we were in Hanoi we stayed only a short walk from Hoan Kiem Lake, words can not decribe this place.. Dotted with plenty of shady trees and manicured gardens and path ways. You will find people exercising or just sitting looking at the scenery.. At night we came across a group of dancers whick was good to stop and watch.. Also the beautiful temple was worth taking a few photos. Crossing over the main road to the lake was an experience and a laugh as you need to dodge cars and bikes.. This is a must see attraction.

An easy walk.. It is very easy to walk around this lake even in the heat as there is so much shade from the trees. Lots of little cafés to stop at and watch the mopeds go by! Beautiful temple at the Old Quarter end of the lake which is certainly worth a visit.

Lovely green peacefull spot. We stayed in the old city and this lake was kind of get-away from the city's traffic. Here you can walk peacefully, you have space and you can enjoy the lake. There is a temple in the island. Its nice to see, but nothing special. Its very crowded and there was a 20k entrance

beautiful day or night. Lit up by night but best seen at 6 a.m. when the locals are all out doing their morning exercises and Tai Chi. I joined the walkers and saw loudspeaker exercises, dog walking, older people doing chair exercises - you name it. Beautiful temple across a bridge at one end. An oasis in a busy city.

Get their early - or late!. We planned on visiting the lake early in the morning to see the locals exercising but by 8am they'd all gone so if you want to watch the Tai Chi you need to get there a lot earlier (6am?). We enjoyed wandering round the lake and some local students stopped us for a chat to practise their English. They don't hassle you and compared to lots of places they are very timid and we passed quite a few groups who we could see were trying to get the courage up to speak to us. Very friendly people. We also passed by the lake in the evening and it was a different place altogether - a place for families and friends to hang out. A nice atmosphere though!

Everyone checking you out. Although a pleasant walk it would have been more enjoyable if you didn't feel like everyone was 'checking you out'. These countries need to realise that tourists bring a lot of money their way, but you don't feel like going back when so many people make you feel uncomfortable. I really dressed down for this trip, left all my jewellery at home so had nothing to check out, but still felt a bit uncomfortable while walking the streets, even in this touristy destination.

An Oasis in midst of chaos of the Old Qtr. Hoan Kiem Lake is in the historical centre of Hanoi. According to the legend, Emperor Lê Lợi was boating on the lake when a Golden Turtle God (Kim Qui) surfaced and asked for his magic sword, Heaven's Will. Lợi concluded that Kim Qui had come to reclaim the sword that it’s master, the Dragon King (Long Vương) had given Lợi some time earlier, during his revolt against the Chinese Ming Dynasty. Lợi renamed the lake to commemorate this event. He renamed the lake from Luc Thuy (Green Water") to Hoan Kiem Lake (Lake of the Restored Sword) . The Turtle Tower (Thap Rùa) standing on a small island near the centre of lake is linked to the legend.Near the northern shore of the lake lies Jade Island on which the Temple of the Jade Mountain (Ngoc Son Temple) stands. The temple was erected in the 18th century in honour of the 13th-century military leader Tran Hung Dao who fought heroically against the Yuan Dynasty. Jade Island is connected to the shore by the wooden red-painted The Huc Bridge. Go there early morning to enjoy the cool breeze and participate with the locals who indulge in variety of activities in the morning including dancing, singing, playing or just chit chatting.

Place to walk and stroll and be seen. Takes 20 mins to walk around and has the temple in the middle (i think this was this lake!). Loads of people wandering round as well so a great place to people spot, and just chill outWe had 2 local medical students come up to us and wanted to practice their english as we walked - was nice to meet them and chat listen about life in Vietnam. Cant remember who you were but Mr Medic in Yr3, and Mr Pharmacist in Y4, lovely to meet you
Relaxing. A nice relaxing place, especially with the ice cream that is sold nearby. A lot of the locals can be seen relaxing around this lake and one can easily share such a mood at this place.
cooling. Cooling piece of relative calm in the centre of the madness that is Hanoi. Take an evening walk around the lake and then sit and have a cold beer and watch the world rush by!

beautiful lake. This is easy to find and just a beautiful oasis in the middle of a very busy city. It is only about 1.6km around - so an easy walk. Worth getting up early and walking around to see all the locals doing their exercises - a very vibrant time.

The most popular red bridge and lake in Hanoi. The lake is pretty large. Recommend just going for a morning walk around it. Locals just sit around it, catching up, doing exercises, selling souvenirs.
It's probably the most peaceful place in Hanoi.

One of the most popular sites in Hanoi. A must-visit place when you are in Hanoi, as this is one of the most popular sites in the city. Better to go with a tour guide so that the significance of the place and the legend can be explained better. Take some time to savor the tranquility of the lake, even though a lot of people are walking and jogging around the area.

I Gravitated Towards this lake. Great point of reference for all things Old Quarter Hanoi. Buses can be caught here, great scenery, the temple on the island should not be missed and enjoy the tale of the restored sword-I hope it ios true!

Big Lake!!!. You cannot miss it , we walked all the way around it , lots of things happen around here , if you get down to the banks early in the morning you can take part in the "excercise" classes that go on there , great spot for photos
Big lake with a lot scene for photo shotting. Bring along umbrella if you wish to walk around the lake, it's big and many attraction along the lake.
Amazing lake in Vietnam. I've been here for many times when i was in Vietnam. Joining with the local to do the exercise aroundd the lake was so fun. Very nice culture.

An amazing place early in the morning. You need to get up about 5.30 and make your way to the lake to see the thousands of people all walking anti clockwise around the lake, plus there are hundreds of people doing aerobics which all appear to be free. Is early in the morning but an amazing experience.

Peace in a busy city.. A walk around this lake was a nice way to get away from the very busy streets. It is very pretty with mostly shaded paths around its edge. There are 2 pagodas on it one is reachable via a short bridge. A pretty place for a walk or just a break.
Nice Lake View. The lake was very nice view especially when take cyclo to going around, in the morning it's a very good place to take walking and enjoy fresh air, love it!

BELLISSIMO LAGO NEL CUORE DI HANOI!. Beautiful Lake, in the middle of the Hanoi Center, romantic and wonderful by night, and full of peopel during day, many firendly people and a nice Hanoian Atmosphere around this amazing Lake!!!

Free and worth seeing. Tranquility in the middle of a busy city. Friendly students like to chat to improve their english. People smile and say hello. Good atmosphere...can walk around it or just sit and enjoy it.
You should go. Very nice view! It is a very relaxing place. I would recommend it to everybody. It could also be a very romantic place.
lake in hanoi. nice walk around the lake. some restaurants nearby with a view. close by to puppet theatre and old town.

This is perhaps one of the public areas that don't smell like pee?!. Great place for a walk. You can always see ladies lining up to exercise by giving each other massage! And there are men trying to weight-lift and people buying ice cream. Amazing dynamism!

Nice to have a nice long walk. I went here on a private tour and we were in a bit of a rush. But if you have time, spend half a day sitting and enjoying the peaceful scenery. This small park provides an escape from the busy bustling city of Hanoi. The nice thing is that there aren't too many people in the lake, just some tourists going to the Hoan Kiem Temple and old men having conversations.

A special place. At first I wondered what all the fuss was about, this place just seemed like a lake surrounded by hoards of old men sitting around doing a lot of nothing.After walking around Hanoi, and the lake itself I realised the beauty of this place. It is a peaceful haven for those who want a break from the stress and noise of city life. There are people jogging, lifting weights, chatting, and often just relaxing and watching the world go by.It truly does feel like a place the Vietnamese appreciate and respect. It almost feels sacred, but not in an intimidating, guards and signs everywhere kind of way. Grab something to drink and just have a seat, I think you will learn more about the Vietnamese culture from this simple experience than any show or museum could teach you.
Peacefully lake. Very quiet for a stroll away from the main city,beautiful and peacefully retreat.The ideal place to watch the madness of Hanoi take place.

Oasis in a busy city. My wife and I spent our first quiet afternoon upon arriving in Hanoi exploring the Hoan Kiem lake. There is a a nice cafe at the southern end of the lake that serves good, strong Vietnamese coffee. We had a really nice time relaxing, people watching and enjoying the scenery of the lake.We liked it so much that we returned a few days later after our trip to Halong Bay. After walking the entire circumference of the lake and exploring its surroundings, we realized that this was a place that attracted a large section of the local population, as well as the tourists. There were a lot of joggers, old folks doing tai chi or whatever exercise they wanted, hip hop dancers, weightlifters spread out all around the lake.While the daytime view was quiet, reflective and calming, I preferred the night time view where you get the see the lights in the trees create a surreal environment. It was quite romantic to walk along the lake with the lights. In addition, there are quite a few nice restaurants dotted around the lake, especially the west end of the lake.There are quite a few attractions near the lake so its a good place to start if you want to do some sightseeing. Otherwise, you can get a glimpse of the like of ordinary Vietnamese just by observing the activities going on around the lake.

Relax to enjoy the view. It's a good place to visit and walk along.
Buy some fruits and sitting at the lake side to enjoy the breeze, nice scenery & observe the local lifestyle there.
if you are lucky enough, you can meet the local selling the special cracker.
It's very sweet, but great to taste.

Just Another lake. There are plenty of people around the lake chilling out and lots of Street vendors for icecream, food and souvenirs. The Lake does not look speculator in anyway... There's a Bridge that lead across into a mini islet with a building or temple. Alot of Cafes, shops and activities litter the perimeter of the lake.

Different experiance on every walk. Stayed in Hanoi only a short time but hotel was just up the road from this lake, provides great exercise without too much effort just walking around it (which we did a few times). Interesting and different sites, but make sure to take the time to get a quick city tour in one of the "Golf Carts", great value for money, we thought the price was each person, but it was for the whole cart and just two of us riding around gives a custom type tour where the driver stops at designated places and if you want to get out you can, if not he goes onto the next stop. This tour included the old jail which we wouldnt normally have stopped at, but now glad we did, fascinating experience. But the lake is a great central spot and easy to find as a landmark in what can be a confusing city

Lake of the Restored Sword. I felt like i was experiencing the real Vietnam. The lake has a mystical beauty that makes you feel like you have stepped back in time. Day or night if in Hanoi you must visit this lake. Has a nice Parisian cafe. We got some amazing photos that we enlarged when we got home.

Tranquility in the Chaos. I took an early morning walk around Lake Hoan Kiem, where locals go about their morning exercises - ballroom dancing, Zumba, badminton, yoga, Tai Chi, jogging and stretching. At the lake there are the sights of Turtle Tower, Ngoc Sun Temple on Jade Island and the Bridge of the Rising Sun (go back at night and see them floodlit). The lake is also said to the home of a 200 years old giant turtle.....I didn't catch a glimpse of it and it is probably a Loch Ness monster story....but who knows? It took me only 40 minutes to walk around the lake, which is a tranquil respite in the heart of the chaos that is central Hanoi.

Hoan Kiem Lake. The lake was a short walk from our hotel. One of our first challenges to get there was to cross the road, which was scary and then exhilarating! Very picturesque and lovely to see so many of the locals using it for a walk etc, even though it was very cold when we were there in April/May.

Pleasant and good people watching. Hoan Kiem Lake is a nice place to sit and enjoy people watching. We sat near where there were guys exercising with the limited equipment that was there. It was fun to see how many people use the "park-like" area for their recreation.

The heart & soul of Hanoi. It's great to walk around the lake at any time of the day. In the morning the locals are out walking, running & doing tai chi, in the afternoon all the couples are out, & at night it's lit-up. Hoan Kiem is the nicest place in downtown / old quarter of Hanoi.
Great for an early morning walk. Try to make time for a walk around the lake in the early morning. It is great to watch this part of the city waking up.

An oasis in the centre of Ha Noi. On the edge of the Old Quarter in Ha Noi, the lake is a peaceful area to walk around and watch the daily lives of the locals unfold. The breeze of the lake was very pleasant and the ever changing vista well worth the time spent walking all the way around, about an hour.

Brilliant visit. I love the tale of the Lake, which involves giant magical turtles, and there's also a myth that there is a 200 year old turtle that swims the lake, rather like the Lochness monster, hard to see but a great story.

best place for walk around. you can walk around the lake.Visit the Ngoc son temple.see water puppet .
Really amazing the lake
should walk around here.

The heart of life in Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake means the Restored Sword Lake, or some Vietnamese would call Sword Lake. Do remember to find out the history and story behind its name when you travel. This beautiful lake provides respite from the extremely busy and chaotic traffic right next to it. At different times of the day, you get to see the Vietnamese people enjoy the lake differently - workout and sports in the morning, afternoon, and sometimes at night; children climbing a rock to an altar in the day and couples enjoying the scenery in the evening. And street hawkers trying their best to sell you sugar cane (though very diluted), food and ice cream. Worth to see the scenery both in the morning (to take lovely sunrise pictures) and at night (where the attractions are all lighted up in various colours). If you live close by, it's even better. Size-wise, West Lake is much bigger and you can even take swan rides in the water to admire the scenery, but Hoan Kiem Lake is too small for that.

The heart of Hanoi.. Hoan Kiem Lake is located in the heart of Hanoi within walking distance to Hanoi's Old Quarter. The lake is the central focus point of Hanoi as the locals all love to hang out here to enjoy the breeze.In the mornings it's ripe with activities ranging from yoga classes to tai chi. We loved walking back to our hotel from the Old Quarter via the lake as the breeze was welcoming & there is plenty of trees to escape under from the blistering heat & sun. In the middle of the lake sits Ngoc Son Temple on Jade island. The pretty 14th century temple is dedicated to the Military Leader Tran Hung Dao, who defeated a force of 300,000 troops sent to invade Vietnam by the Mongol Emperor Kublai Khan The red wooden bridge Huc connects the island to the lakeshore. Tickets are purchased at a booth located on the left-hand side before you cross the bridge. The temple opens at 08:00 and closes at 5pm.

Peaceful chaos. A very popular park in the hustle of the Old Quarter. Many locals and tourists strolling day and night. People watching is the main activity. Cools drinks and ice cream available from many vendors and a cafe is at the southwest corner. Nighttime it really comes alive (at least in summer) with dance classes, tai chi etc and of course is much cooler for walking. I didn't pay to visit the temple (another temple!) but understand it is nice, as most are. Plenty of vendors selling the expected tourist items and cyclo drivers but I was never hassled in any way The cyclo drivers will shout for your attention but quickly accept a friendly no thank you. I also found it a great geographic reference point when walking the streets as I always knew how to find my hotel from the lake.

Good people watching venue. Travelling in Vietnam in summer is extremely hot!! Walking around the lake at this time was not a good idea, we did however enjoy the people watching, the traffic watching and the awesome ice creams.

Just a lake. many locals gather around the lake for play, chitchat, or just to relax. can see street vendors hanging around to sell drinks, ice cream or souvenirs. It is actually better at night when the bridge lights up and it feels more calm and charming. i felt it is better to just take a taxi around it then to walk around.

Hanoi - Hoan Kien Lake - What a delight in the heart of this bustling city. This lake is situated at the southern end of the Old Quarter and is surrounded by a multitude of both modern and old/ancient buildings of various design and architectural merit. These house all sorts of occupiers from many restaurants, bars and retail outlets to theatres, commerce and ancient monuments. The lake is truly beautiful during the day with Ngoc Son Temple and Turtle Tower standing within its waters. There are extensive walkways and garden type areas around the lake also which come to life in the evening with some beautifully colourful lighting. The Huc Bridge is a bright scarlet red whilst the trees all around depict a variety of colours all intermingled to create a real spectacle. We walked around the lake for a section of its perimeter and it was clear it attracts both local and tourist couples to sit and relax for a while, keen to get away from the hustle and bustle that surrounds them and even though there are many people in the evening there always seems to be an area where a piece of tranquillity can be found. I thought this place was just great. A fairly large area of water which acts as a focal point for the city and from around which most of Hanoi's attractions are within walking distance. You'll want to visit the Ngoc Son Temple and as such you won't miss the lake, but take some time to enjoy the larger picture.

Lovely legend. The lake is in the middle of much of the tourist area and shops so it is hard to miss and you will pass it many times. I love the story of the lake and going to the water puppet show helps to explain it better. It is good at night as the actual stone temple is not as impressive during the day. Many locals hang around just chilling during the day and it is perfect for a stroll.

An oasis in the middle of the frantic city :). Although the lake is located in the city, but once you crossed the road and start walking around it, you'll feel like you were in a different place. It was quiet and peaceful with locals & tourists just sitting around, some painters and vendors selling their goods. We went walking at the lake in the late morning so the ambience is very nice. At night, it seems crowded with a lot of things happening there. There's many coffee shops across the street if you need a break from the walk :)

A beautiful lake in the centre of Hanoi. This lake is just a couple of blocks south of the Old Quarter district, and provided you avoid the touts centered around the northern edge, it's a relatively peaceful and pretty spot in the middle of Hanoi's frantic lifestyle.It's probably not much more than a kilometre in circumference, so an easy stroll around. Early in the morning, large groups of locals gather to do Tai Chi and other forms of exercise. On an island on the lake itself, connected to the mainland by the iconic red footbridge, is the lovely Ngoc Son Temple, which shouldn't be missed.

Nice for a Lakeside Stroll. This lake is at theheart of Hanoi. They have the mystical turtle living there and a beautiful temple. Really a great place for a stroll and just cross the street loads of cafes, shops etc. Weekends you see loads of families out and about with vendors selling about everything under the sun.

Take a nice stroll around it before seeing water puppets. It's really lovely seeing the locals relaxing and strolling around the lake. I guess this is a nice hangout place for them that doesn't require a fee. We also saw a popular old man (who seem blase about his popularity) by the lake who had three cute puppies.It's strange how the surrounding traffic is so frenetic but in an unusual way you're away from it.Also a good spot to get picked up by a cyclo driver for a city tour - don't look too desperate actually if you can try and look reluctant, let them come to you. You need to agree the price is for one or two people, how long the ride will be (point at a watch or write down the time for agreement). Usually when i am happy with a service and I managed to haggle to a decent price I tip 10%. It doesn't seem like a lot but it is for those who earn an average of $80/month, especially if they deserve it.

It gets better.. Our 3rd visit to the lake, it is so peaceful and relaxing, a haven in the heat of the day, a meeting point of locals and tourists alike, you get a beautiful breeze here most times. Lots of shops, cafés around.Nice to walk around or just sit relax and enjoy.
Peaceful. You might have a chance to see businessmen doing Tai Chi after work. It is a safe and peaceful oasis near the French Quarter.

Serenity expected. It would be difficult to explain to people (including myself)...but the lake is a relief from the hustle and bustle in myriad ways...It has a silent beauty and a confirmed relaxation for its real citizenry...not us tourists but the localsI have seldom found a place so easy of spirit but not divorced from spirituality.....The locals make this place special...young love or couples walking....old men stretching their armsI only ever met Australians doubting its peaceful setting, but that is perhaps coincidence

Great place to take some time out!. A great place to just stop and watch! After walking up down the crazy streets of The Old Quarter, anywhere around the lake is a great spot to stop and enjoy the views or just do some people watching.

Space to breath. This is great place to get away from the traffic and fumes. Very relaxing. The pagoda gets busy, but no hassle from the locals. Unfortunately we went on a drizzly day so not the best views, but still a pleasant way to spend a few hours. Plenty of benches to stop and enjoy a drink on.

Tranquility at the heart of a busy and noisy city. This is a nice place to have a wander and the pagoda is a cheap visit. There's benches around the lake and places to buy a drink, so it can be nice to sit and relax. It's a hub for the locals to hang out, but not to harass tourists, and it's also a very central place for local newly weds to go - most are getting their photos taken and it gives the place an added sense of importance too. It's a lake with a myth, which the pagoda details more about. Definitely a nice break from crossing crazy busy roads! Also, it's lovely at night.
Relaxing area in a beautiful setting. Nice green area perfect for a stroll (as the rest of Hanoi). Rather quiet place well suited for digesting the Hanoi-experience.

Nice for a Stroll . Lovely lake to just take a nice walk. Worth having a look at the pagoda. Don't bother eating at the cafe/restaurant on the shore, there are plenty of other amazing cheaper eats to be had around.

Nice place to relax. Hoan Kiem Lake or Lake of the Restored Sword is the best place for relaxation, especially after a hard-working day. The green water and gentle wind make me like being over the moon. Strolling around the lake-side is wonderful.
Wear pants to cover knees. Liked the Pagoda and the walk around the lake. Disliked the people peddling their wares - too pushy.

Should Go At Night. Personally I think, night view was much more better than the day view. I would recommend go here spend an hour around the lake and continue to go for your dinner or shop around those area.Me and wife had a good walk around the lake at night, and we continue go to their night market right after the walk. :)
Nice lake with temple in the island. Walk around in the afternoon you will see many local people spend their time with their love one here ..

great. Great to see an area like this put aside for all to enjoy.
