Early in morning, in the afternoon or evening - there are hundreds of people partaking in a variety of exercises - power walking, yoga, dancing, roller skating, tree hugging and there are even artists, crafts people and wedding photographers. Just next to the Old Quarter of Hanoi - it's fun to go anytime - just watch out for the traffic when crossing to get there !!!
Busy and a Nice sight in the city. Very nice spot in the heart of Hanoi, walking the bridge and island was very nice, watching the locals play Mahjong was also very enjoyable to watch.

The heart of Old Hanoi. This seemed to be the hub of where everything was happening downtown. The night market was near, the puppet theater was across the street, and so many people were hanging out around the lake. Beautiful area.

Good Enough from Outside. The lake is murky and supposedly houses a huge turtle which you probably won't see. You pay to cross the bridge to go to the temple which houses the replica of the turtle's mate. Many Vietnamese go to the temple to give offerings. It was not meaningful or special to us. The lake and bridge are very picturesque.

Can't walk by enough!. Whenever there is a lovely view of something, I can walk by anytime. That is how I feel about this lake, even though I have only visited here twice. I always made a point to detour past this lake. And so will you, I think!

Excellent place!. To relax, read a book and enjoy a tasty ice cream with your beloved ones! You will see locals working out, reading, chatting about politics and culture and enjoying their daily walks around the lake.

You kina have to check it out when in Hanoi. It is nothing super special and that turtle tower looks much smaller in person, but if you check out the old quarter anyways, have a nice stroll by the lake. It is a popular photo spot and you can actually walk on that red bridge without paying the entrance fee for the temple on the island. If you are looking for a better lake experience for cycling or jogging around, try west lake instead. Cafes around here tend to cater to tourists and are expensive (duh)
oasis of calm. Hoan Kien Lake is an oasis of calm amongst Hanoi's millions of scooters! Cross over the bridge to the temple to enjoy a different view of the lake.

I was hoping this would be peace, it wasn't. This lake is pretty average. Located next to the craziness of the old quarter we walked here hoping it would be a peaceful retreat but once you get there you'll find the park and landscaping around it don't really provide the peacefulness you might hope for in a city like Hanoi. The lake and park around it are very average.

Perfect for a wedding photo. While strolling here, we spotted a few Vietnamese couples taking their pre-wedding photo, and we tried to capture their images on our cameras too.The results were amazing and perfect.A stroll here is a must, and I find it very relaxing.

VERY GOOD RIDE AORUND THE AREA. We stayed near this place and in the evening we took a walk around , as the board was in local language could not understood precisely importance of this lake but certainly the place is very old may be 1000 years! on the banks of it there are electric buggy type vehicle which can take 6 or 8 people and price for ride of an hour is very affordable so we took the same. they took us around and we show mix of old and new HANOI in span of an hour what a pleasant experience !!

An evening stroll away from the motorbikes. Either in early morning or early evening, take a stroll around this small lake. The promenade is spacious, treed and relaxing. Meanwhile, all around, the motorcycle hordes buzz frenetically just meters away.
Beautiful spot to get away from the chaos. This is a beautiful and relaxing place. It makes for a nice change when you need a break from the crowds

Annoyed. Walked around with mates to chill out ended up being "harassed" by Vietnamese students who want to practice their English even after we politely reject as we wanna chat among ourselves and relax. Not only once but so many time in a day! Dirty ground, dirty water, sad...
Lovely Place to visit. we had a walking tour of the lake and Old Quarter, and Hoa Lo Museum filled with artifacts from Vietnam's past.A very enjoyable afternoon.

Exciting destination to discover. Lake of the Restored Sword merits your stopover when you discover Hanoi capital. This is the heart of the city where you can find everything from ice-coffee to mineral water. It is easy to get in touch with local atmosphere all the time of the day: morning Taichi exercise of old people to leisure walk of visitors in the evening. We at Cosmos Travel Vietnam Co., Ltd advise clients to explore Hoan Kiem Lake and Ngoc Son temple or attend water puppet show nearby.

Best place in town for time out.. Hoan Kiem Lake is considered the physical and spiritual center of Hanoi. It has beauty, history, wildlife and it is just a really relaxing oasis in a city that can be a bit mad. It's very popular for people to do excersizes by the lake in the early morning or stroll around in the evening. It's a great scenic place to take pictures or just learn the story of the lake. The lake is full of tortoise and because they are a sacred animal (along with dragon, phoenix and unicorn) in Vietnamese culture it is considered good luck if you see one. The lake is a short walk from Hanoi's Old Quater where most of the hotels are, city maps are easy to come by so you can find your way here and back. A must see local landmark. The more you learn about it, the more significant it becomes.

Beauty in the enter of Hanoi. Hanoi is a city of lakes and parks and Hoan Kiem Lake is the crown jewel. All day and night it is crowded with local Hanoians jostling up against tourists, but the former are definitely the majority. The Lake plays a central role in Vietnamese history, the story being a turtle that gave a sword to the emperor, which he used to repel one of the many Chinese invasions. To this day there are still giant turtles living in the lake, although it's hard to imagine that anything could live in the green murky water. They are not natural, having been transplanted centuries ago, but the current inhabitants are thought to be over 100 years old each.Take a walk around the entire lake in the morning or evening and you will join the thousands of locals out for their daily exercise. In the hot summer months the parade will go on until past midnight.

Pretty lake. We enjoyed walking around the lake even though it was 41 degrees. Again, the Hanoi Kids told us different legends which we loved. It is very pretty and calm amidst the hectic Hanoi traffic.

Lovely!!. A nice open place to relax and unwind in the heart of the Old Quarter. The lake is beautiful and has good pathways around it for walking and exercising. You will find many locals and also tourists here. Various restaurants with different cuisines round the lake have a great view of the lake and make a good hang out place in the evening.

Can't miss it. Hoan Kiem lake is hard to miss, and it should be experienced if traveling to Hanoi. It's an easy point of orientation in the Old Quarter, and really can't be missed. The lake has this unique quality of being totally crowded and surrounded by chaos much of the time, yet it somehow manages to retain a very peaceful, pleasant atmosphere. It's easy to walk around, and popular for joggers/speed walkers in the early morning (6am) and early evenings (4-6). Inexpensive ice cream stands are set up around the lake, and the surrounding area is full of cafes, restaurants, hotels, post office, shopping, etc. It's not uncommon for groups of university students to approach you to practice their english or ask you questions for class assignments. They've always been very polite, and it's actually a really great time to ask them questions too! Of course, you should always be aware of your belongings (as in any urban area); but in general, Hoan Kiem Lake feels incredibly family-friendly and safe.
Evening on Hoan Kiem Lake. After 5 pm, it was nice and cool at the lake. There are both local and overseas visitors enjoying the sights.
Nine Lake in Hanoi. The place is quiet and scenic in the middle of the busy city. You can also see many locals exercising

Beautiful spot. Well worth a wander around the lake. It is quite impressive both day and night. Beautiful gardens and the Japanese bridge is beautiful. Lots of great places to eat around here and some good shopping as well.
Quiet place,in this busy part to the city. So nice to stop,and relax,at one of the many eatery,s.available.Pleasant part of the busy city of Hanoi.

Excellent place for relaxation and to do running in Hanoi. With the hustle and bustle of a city life plus the madness of motorbikes on the road in Hanoi, Hoan Kiem Lake serves as an excellent place to relax (if the weather is good). You can also do running here. The pathways for walking and running are good. This lake is located just a few metres ofs some of the main roads in Hanoi. You can also walk to Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre to catch the show. You will require around an hour if you wanna have a slow, easy walk around the Lake.

I liked it. This lake is a good place for walk and drink coffee or something else. The missing thing there is limited choice of cafes and restaurants. The prices are high comparing to other places in hanoi.
Nice walk. A place where travellers can spend an hour or two to refresh themselves from tiredness. A stroll after meal is wonderful, especially after dinner.

It's a lake!. We walked all the way round the lake which was fine, we went onto the little island museum/shrine which was fine, we took photos of turtle tower which was fine. But then we googled the turtle who lives in the lake and that was really cool. For a long time he was a myth, bit like the Loch Ness monster, but a little while ago the caught him, to medicate him. Fascinating. just wish that would happen with Nessie!
Lovely Walk. Just a beautiful area. Nice walk and on the weekends you can look at all the happy brides and grooms as this area seems to be a place where they take lots of photos...and so will you

Nice lake but beware of thieves!. A picturesque and calm lake - this and the surrounding area gives the impression that one is in a posh locality. This feeling can lead one to believe that nothing bad can happen but you couldnt be more wrong. My mobile phone was snatched from my hands by two people on a moped. This is a common occurrence in the old quarter and Hoan Kiem Lake is part of it. Be careful with your belongings when in this area

Picturesque!. Do it in the morning, sunset or at night!This place is such a wonderful sight!See the sun come out bright or the lights that looks like stars at night!Haha! Here, you can take a sneak peak of how Hanoinans live their life. You can see a lot of people doing their daily exercise in the morning, students practicing their english in the afternoon and lovers holding hands at night!

nice stroll. Nice relaxing stroll around the lake and over the bridge to the temple. Interesting to see the elderly gather around the lake, doing their exercises and chatting. Beautiful scenery. Good break from old quarter if you're overwhelmed by traffic

Must visit if you're in the Old Quarter.. Beautiful for a wander around or just relax in one of the cafe's around the side of the lake. You can also cross the red bridge and have a wander around an old religious temple on the lake for 20,000 VND

A lake with a bit of mystery. Encircled by busy (I mean really busy) streets, the lake area is much more calmer than the alleys in the town around. Do not miss the visit to the temple and get amazed by the turtle on display. Do abit research on Cụ Rùa and perhaps spend some time by searching for the mysterious animal.

Life in Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is located in the old quarter of Hanoi, and provides a beautiful, peaceful respite from the craziness that can sometimes surround it. Very much a place where locals of all ages hang out (doing everything from fairly random exercises to dancing alone to music from a personal stereo), we enjoyed walking around the lake and taking it all in.

Average at best. A big murky lake in central Hanoi with a small red bridge to a deserted island. On a hot day a cool breeze about all that it has going for it. Over rated and simply a landmark to pass by.

An enjoyable feature of the Old Quarter frequented by many.. Anyone who visits Hanoi's Old Quarter will ultimately end up at Hoan Kiem Lake as it is a central feature surrounded by shops, restaurants, cafés, banks and just about everything else. The lake is pleasant to stroll around as the breeze of the after drops the temperature a little and perhaps that is one of the main attractions. The atmosphere changes from day to night with many locals using the dusk and early evening period to partake in exercise walks or stretching exercises. Majority of people seemed to use the counterclockwise direction so if going for a casual stroll my advice would be to adopt the same approach and therefore avoid the relentless push to find a clear path, instead just go with the flow and enjoy the scenery instead.
The soul of Hanoians. It is not only a lake, it is the History story. The lake and its area is the most centre part of Hanoi and the soul of Hanoi people.
good place for strolling. An oxygen for the city. Good location. Walking around the lake is nice when it's not rain. Many interesting shop and spots to visit.
Pleasant strolling, seeing Hanoi life. Had a few lovely strolls here. In the middle of summer it's a great place to sit down in the shade, catch a breeze and people watch.

Enjoyable snapshot of the locals. From tai chi at 0600 to couples strolling at 2030 of an evening, this central lake may not be huge but it still represents a good snapshot of Vietnamese life.The surrounds are attractively landscaped.No one hassled me..

History, religion, culture and nature. If you have time, you will enjoy a stroll around the lake to see local people exercising, couples enjoying the day, kids playing around. There is a legend about a turtle that have asked Le Loi to give back the magic sword to the God. The view is nice both at night and during the day. There is good attraction around the lake, to name few: - Ngoc Son Temple- Tap rua - torre da tartaruga- Thang Long Water puppetSo there is history, religion, culture, and nature in one spot.

A place to re-energize. I stayed in an apartment about 5 minutes from this lake, and this was like an oasis for me - a place to walk, a place to sit, a place to stop and enjoy views or people-watch, a place to snack, albeit it's not possible to escape all the traffic noise.And then, re-energized, walk back to the Old Quarter, or head off to visit some attraction.

City Centre Lake. Lovely city centre lake, makes for a nice view from one of the nearby rooftop coffee lounges (such as Avalon). The temple in the middle of the lake (across the red bridge) is worth a visit, too.

The hive of activity.. A beautiful and picturesque lake in between the Old quarter and French quarter, its a hive of activity in the morning ( joggers and such) and in the evenings ( performers, joggers, couples and more). There are two eateries at the two ends of the lake, a restaurant nearer the Old quarter, and a cafe nearer to the french quarter.Do stop by at the cafe to enjoy the lake view, the sights, to relax and regain a sense of calm from the chaos surrounding Hanoi.

Parade of Local Vietnamese Life. Hoan Kiem Lake is like the "Central Park" of Hanoi. Everyone - locals and tourists alike come here to congregate, people watch, take a nap, have a date, take pictures or just sit on the bench under the trees like some of the old Vietnamese people do. It's a large lake but you can walk around this lake in a hour - 2 hours if you dawdle and take pictures. There's the turtle tower which is the main attraction on one end and a temple on the other end. There's shops and restaurants around the lake and just a little off one end - is a large shopping center with all the designer stores. A block away are the local markets where you can shop for souvenirs, tshirts, bags, silk, handicrafts and also local food stands.

Excellent attraction in the center of town.. My wife and I spent 3 nights in Hanoi at the end of April. We were also there during two important holidays, the 60th anniversary of the defeat of the French in 1954, and the Fall of Saigon at the end of the Viet Nam war. The lake was festooned with lights, and there were many people out and promenading. It was a great place to stroll and people watch. We also jogged around it in the early morning and we saw a lot of people practicing tai chi. All in all it's a major attraction in the center of town and close to the old quarter

Nice place to hide from the sun. Nice view and a good place to hide in the shade and the hot sun for a rest. The area is crowded in the evening with many locals strolling the lake and tourists as well.
Walk around and enjoy the views. Great lake. Walk around and enjoy the different views. Especially in the evening when the lights are on and the atmosphere is super.

Good for a relaxing night stroll. Buy an ice cream (try some interesting local flavors like coconut milk, yam and egg) and take a slow stroll around the lake. We went twice, both during the night and enjoyed the casual stroll, watching locals play shuttlecock in groups around the lake. It was an interesting mix of noisy traffic on one side and the peaceful lake on the other side. Head down to the Intimex Supermarket along the way and grab some groceries or necessities if you need. (It's really difficult to find a big mart in Hanoi).

Lovely lake near the Old Quarter of Ha Noi. Very scenic lake next to the Old Quarter of Ha Noi. Kept very clean with beautiful walk ways and gardens. A nice place for a stroll and to watch daily life as it happens.

Heart of Hanoi. My first destination when I arrived at Hanoi due to its popularity. And my first impression is beautiful and clean area. Hoan Kiem Lake surrounded with well maintained park and food stall around. Enjoying so much to walk around the lake and watch local do their activity. Easy access to many tourist spot from here, such as : St. Joseph Cathedral, Post Office, Opera House and Old Quarter by short walk.

Like a local, stroll around the lake. Hoan Kiem Lake would seem to be the place the locals of Hanoi like to promenade, so for tourists it is ideal to sit and watch, or stroll around the perimeter. Crossing the road to get there in the first place is something between madness and faith, but step out and keep moving. If you stop you'll confuse the driver and he won't know which side to dodge around you. The lakeside pavement can be uneven in places, so watch your step. There are seats along the way to stop and people-watch. Young folk with fluffy little dogs, older folk doing their exercises, artists to paint your portrait, hawkers of wares - you'll see them all. There are various cafes around the lake for drinks or a meal. Visiting Haon Kiem Lake is a must-do when in Hanoi.

Central spot everyone enjoys. Best enjoyed first thing in the morning when traffic is at its lightest and the locals are enjoying their tai chi or other excercises. There is a restaurant beside the lake and other bars and restaurants nearby with views over the lake where you can enjoy a meal, ice cream or cold beer on a hot Hanoi night. Was in Hanoi for 4 days and enjoyed the lake every day.

Hanoi's hub.. We spent an hour plus each day at the Lake. As does the rest of Hanoites. Wonderful to see people exercising of all ages. Look out for the ladies group doing the Fan Dance and on the otherside, a group doing the Macarena! Our fav spot.

Peaceful. In the morning I walk around Hoan Kiem lake to refresh my self. Many people do Taichi, so funny. The weather is too easy, many tree are surounding the lake. Especially, you can enjoy Thuy Ta ice-cream at noon. It is the good place for relax. The heart of Hanoi- I like it. The best time to visit Hoan Kiem lake is in the morning and in evening.
Nice view. Beautiful view, a lot of activities nearby, near old quarter area. Be careful to cross the street though

Morning Tai Chi and Gi Gong. One of the most fascinating places in Hanoi, since there are always more locals than foreign visitors. Jogging in the early morning hours, Tai Chi and Co, and a lot of young couples and families seating along the lake. Each time I am there, some young Vietnamese lady asks me to have a short chat in English. This time I had a philosophical discussion with a PhD candidate about Asian geopolitics.....

Locals and Tourists Meet. Located near to the east of Old Quarter district.Locals do their daily exercises in the park surrounding the lake. There are equipments such as dumb bells, bar bells and pull up bars for static exercises. They also do daily jogs there. Locals welcome anyone who likes to join them in their exercises.There's a Ngoc Son Temple and a Turtle Tower within the lake. Ngoc Son Temple is typically crowded with visitors and we didn't think there was anything special to it.Artists also gather in the park to do portraits. I didn't get one done but I did see a few artists drawing a particular couple at the same time and their work seemed very different. Hence, I think one should take a close look at these artists' works first before deciding on one.There are public toilets although I didn't use them.

Nice view at night. Nice place for jogging early in the morning. Nice for picture taking at night. Lots of shops around the area, wide range restaurants you can choose from cafes, noodles, pastas etc.
Check it out first thing in the morning. Firstly its great exercise walking around the lake, and secondly there is a lot of people watching to be had.
Enjoy the life in Hanoi. Very nice area to walk around the lake and enjoy life in Hanoi There are some attractions and sightseeing points around the lake - worth one day visit.

The epicentre of Old Hanoi. Hoan Kiem lake is an enchanting body of water, and is the epicentre of Old Hanoi.The majestic emerald green waters has a calming effect, large lake with lots of activity surrounding its banks. We stayed two locks from the lake at Golden Sun Suites (see review) and we were lucky enough to see the lake everyday we were in Hanoi (4 night stay).An excellent asset to Hanoi Old Quarter.

And the story goes... The turtle god reclaimed the magic sword from the emperor. The Emperor then renamed the lake to mark the occasion. As told by our guide from HanoiKids - a summary of course.The lake is a beautiful place to watch people go by. Some areas more tranquil than others. Very panoramic at nights with the lights. The turtle tower is also pretty at night.

Pleasant haven. Easy walking distance from the Old Quarter, nice place to sit, have a drink and enjoy the passing parade. Since you are there, the temple in the middle, for which you pay a small fee, is worth a visit, but is definitely not a destination in itself.

Part of our stay in Hanoi. This lake is a communal meeting point and a hive of activity throughout the day. The locals do their tai chi exercise early in the mornings, and when the lake is lit up at night it is a lovely sight. Here you can see the red bridge which takes you to a temple, worth going to see.
regards
Baslady

Great resource in middle of city. Beautiful to walk around and try to spot the ellusive turtle. We walked around at 5a.m. and had great time watching all the people doing their various forms of exercise.
People Watching. Calmness in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city. Nice for observing comings and goings of locals and even other tourists.
best at night. Nice to walk round and free but at the end of the day it is a lake with some buildings on. Worth visiting when visiting or staying in the old quarter.

Breathing Space after the Old Quarter. The lake is a piece of tranquility in the centre that is the frenzy of Hanoi. The traffic swirls around the lake but there is a lovely wide pedestrian walk around it which affords lovely views of the lake and its two temples (Ngoc Son Temple and Thap Rua). It is easy to just sit and watch the world go by - especially the large coaches filled with tourists who are always hurrying to the next stop on the schedule. Across the road from Ngoc Son Temple island is the Water Puppet Theatre, some nice restaurants and loads of tourist shops.

Nice lake. Pleasant and interesting lake to walk around, with plenty of food and drink options nearby and lots of places to sit and contemplate the water, or watch the passing parade. Some good shady spots too. Didn't see much wildlife in the lake, but it was quite clean.

Relax... It is like a heart of the city. Hanoi is quite busy in some area especially in old quarter, near the Lake. So the Lake is like a relaxing place after the long tough day. You can find he generations of people here. Air is so fresh with the light wind ;) i love herejust sit.. and breath, nothing more
nice lake. clean lake with nice lighting , a suitable place to escape from crowded old quarter and crazy motorbikes

Hoan Kiem Lake. The lake is probably the heart beat of Hanoi. It is festive and alive. People are walking around, some are enjoying a drink, some doing exercises some students practicing their English on tourists from foreign countries. Lots of places to have something to eat and to buy souvenirs. BUT be very careful for some of the taxi operators. They are ripping tourists off.

Scenic and relaxing. Hoan Kiem lake is full of life, on the outside that is. There was no turtle with a sword sighted but there is activity all round the lake. There are people exercising, walking, running, using gym equipment, doing tai chi, aerobic classes and generally just out and about. It is all action for the Vietnamese people around Hoan Kiem Lake. The lake itself is pretty despite the lime-ish green colour, with the red bridge leading to Ngoc Son temple and the small island with a pergola in the centre. It is a great sight in the centre of the Old Quarter.

An interesting place. My first walk in Hanoi was around this lake. I saw a lot of happy people, young guys playing the guitar. One day, I had to walk by this lake early in the morning and I was amazed with so many people working out, like a big open gym. I spent wonderful time relaxing and watching everything.It is just a lake, but I do not know what made me so amazed about it. I just loved it and that is all I can say.

Hoan Kiem Lake. I love this lake and the surrounding recreation areas. Many keen and eager Vietnamese students seek out foreign visitors to practice their English - a wonderful experience. Many Vietnamese people of all ages can be seen exercising around the lake
A must. I and my friends really enjoy the place. A nice place to go for a walk and take photo. You can visit Turtle Temple to see a death big turtle called as uncle Turtle by the locals

It's a lake. Much has been made about the lake and we took a stroll around the lake and...yes, it is a lake, May have missed something but not much more to say about this lake - except that a supposedly very old turtle lives in this lake.

Always something to see here. We visited this lake several times as it was often on our way to other places. There was always plenty to watch and several little cafes around the edge to stop at for a beer or iced coffee. In the evenings there is some busking and the endless procession of hooting motorbikes is worth seeing if only once! It makes a change from the crowded streets of the Old Quarter although it very busy in parts.

Great to come on a Saturday night. Came here with friends on Saturday night before going to the night market after, and it was PACKED. The ultimate place to hang socially and bought the cheap ice cream for 6,500. Really fun to walk around during the day too
Walk around. The place that worth for walk around at anytime. Locals and foreigners favourite jogging trail in the morning. Full of locals on weekend.

Pretty and peaceful walk around the lake. After the hustle and bustle of the Old Quarter, it is nice and relaxing to have a stroll around the lake and watch how the local people enjoy themselves. Pretty little pagoda in the middle of the lake. The temple at the top of the lake is certainly worth a visit.Recommended for an hour or two.

Pretty to walk around...but that's it. The lake is pretty much in the centre of a chaotic part of town, yet manages to be very peaceful and calming regardless. The lake and accompanying temple are beautiful, and worth walking around, especially at night. However, its certainly not worth spending any significant time around - although do make a point to come during the day and again at night.

ONE OF THINGS TO DO...WHEN IN... Bit overcast for our visit and also crowded, must be a lot better when these factors are taken out. No fee, The Water Puppet Theatre is over the road, so can be timed to do both together.

Lake passive. So it's the lake in the middle of the city with a little pagoda in the middle of it. No big deal.
I walked around, took some obligatory tourist photos and left. Not much going on.
Best viewed from one of Hanoi's fabulous roof top restaurants at night where twinkling lights add to its charm.

Serene location. The lake provided a sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of the traffic. It was full of older Vietnamese people exercising by slapping their limbs which was very entertaining. Many koi and even the odd turtle pop up their heads making the visit very relaxing.

Nice lake. We stayed in a hotel near here.
we enjoyed walking around here, saw fish (koi) and turtles. a nice way to get some exercise in a busy area of Hanoi.
also ate at the little café near the lake which was nice.
Serene and lovely. One must walk around the lake a few times if you are in Hanoi, as each time it will be a different experience - lovely walk, but the temple was alright.
Enjoyed walking around it - several tiems. I had a fine sunday walking around the lake. It was also fun meeting many of the local students, who wanted to practice english :-)

Temple on top of lake. Very nice lake view, lot of people full with local and tourist. Temple itself is small and crowded. Some tradition story behind which local people believe the returning of sword and the turtle.
Amazing.... Place we only heard and read about. Nobody brought to us any sword and did not take ours. Beautiful view.
A lovely spot. The lake is a peaceful retreat from the busy city. You can stroll around it without having to dodge a motorbike. Do walk around it at least once.

Walking around the lake is a must-do in Hanoi.. We walked around the lake nearly every day in Hanoi. It is different early in the morning to later in the day. In the early morning you can see people doing Tai-chi, using the street furniture for all sorts of exercises, playing badminton on the edge of the street, doing ballroom dancing and aerobics type classes. The lake looks a bit grimy but when it is hot, a small breeze off the lake is lovely. We saw 2 small turtles near the pagoda bridge one day. It's also a nice way to go for a long walk without having to cross roads. Each lap of the lake is about 1.8 km.
Nice Lake. One of the places you should go take a look at while in Hanoi. The little pagoda in the center is nice too.
great. people have storytelling about the lake. this is like the spirit of hanoian, they really interesting when talking about this plc.

Take a nice stroll around the lake. Hoan Kiem Lake is simply a beautiful place to walk around and chat with a friend. In the evening, it was nice to see people out exercising and the lake is surrounded by shops. We enjoyed many nights just walking around the lake and people watching after dinner.

Great ambiance- especially in the evening. This is not a particularly large lake, but it is clearly hugely popular with both tourists and locals. Located just on the edge of the Old Quarter, it is a serene oasis surrounded by broad sidewalks (rare in Hanoi) flanked by benches, enormous arching shade trees, and lovely landscaped flower beds. Early in the morning and again In the evening, you see many people doing Tai Chi, jogging, and walking, as well as simply strolling along or sitting quietly on benches. Great photo ops, both of the lake and buildings as well as all the people! At one end of the lake, you find a picturesque temple reached by the charming red bridge and the lotus tower. In the middle of the lake is the 'turtle tower' (we saw people in boats going out there but didn't go ourselves.). Stop for a drink or a meal at one of the lakeside restaurants or snack stands, or cross the street and do some shopping- it's lovely in the evening when the lights are shining on the Turtle tower. One can walk around the whole lake in about 30 minutes, and it's easy to see why it is such a popular landmark in the city.

Turtles!. Gobsmacked to see turtles swimming in this lake in the middle of such a polluted city. The lake is lovely though and great to walk around and to watch over at night from rooftop bars and restaurants.
Pleasant to walk around. A nice place to relax a bit and enjoy the view while strolling. Gets you away from the motorbikes for a bit too.

Hoan Kiem lake is Hanoi' s heart. You should visit to feel the peaceful in your soul.. I was born and grew up in Ha Noi. Hoan Kiem ( or Sword) lake is our nation's pride. If you want to go to Viet Nam. You should see Hoan Kiem lake to see how beautiful it is.

Definitely a great place for a walk. Visit in the evening, the lake is full of people surrounding it. Some is doing exercise, jogging, dancing, board game and dating. A very good place to have a walk after dinner. You can feel the local people life style activities in the evening. Very enjoy walking around the lake.
Lovely lake. The Hoan Kiem Lake is very beautiful and it is just a few blocks away from Old District. Sit there and watch the beautiful scenery then continue your journey in exploring Hanoi.

A beautiful lake in the heart of Hanoi. I leave in Hanoi for 6 years already but I always enjoy to go to Hoan Kiem Lake. I would suggest tourists to have their first visit of the lake at night time: despite the chaotic and noisy road traffic it still remains picturesque and quite romantic! You can go to the Pagoda passing through the red bridge and then rest watching at the beautiful lake: this is a nice spot to take pictures.

Early morning exercises. I highly recommend walking around this lake early in the morning. Between 6 and 8am it is a hive of activity and a great window on Vietnamese society. At various points around the lake there were groups of people taking part in all manner of activities. A group of ladies doing a fan dance, another huge group doing aerobics to pumping dance music. Strangest of all was the group of burly men with gym equipment doing weightlifting out in the open right by the lake. It takes about an hour to walk round the lake unless you want to join in some of the activities.

Hanoi heart beat. You can see a big part of Vietnam there. From morning exercises to evening crowd. The horns and sales persons make this place a bit the heart of Hanoi. Good to walk around. Plus, from there, you can access to many different touristic places of the city.

Center of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem lake is an excellent place to visit in Hanoi. After dealing with the craziness the rest of the city has to offer, the Hoan Kiem area gives visitors a bit of peace and quiet. Sit by the lake, grab some ice-cream and watch city life drive on (by motorbike of course!)
Beautiful lake. Lovely to have a wander around hoan kien lake a beautiful place and very enjoyable it has a history and it's a great setting

A convenient stop. Turtle Island and The Red Bridge as my expat friend described it. Local attractions are not my cup of tea, but this site was easy to get to from the old quarter and was a nice segue to a stroll around the lake before we marched on to a bit of ice cream. When in downtown, it is worth a quick visit.
oasis in Hanoi. Not to believe that place is in the middle of busy Hanoi,so silent and wonderful garden,only it is pity that the waterer is not clean.

Peaceful quiet place.. Its a lake in the midst of busy Hanoi. Has a buddist(?) temple in the center with an walkway to it. A quiet and peaceful place. The lake has an ancient living giant turtle, which is believed to have played a very important role in ancient Vietnamese history. Have to come here and spend atleast an hour, as a visit to Hanoi is incomplete without seeing the lake. The famous water puppet theater is just opposite the lake entrance, so can combine both. There is a bazaar around the theater - prices are reasonable if you are prepared to bargain.
Simple and beautiful. Enjoying so much a sip of coffee at Highland coffee and viewing a beautiful corner of the turtle lake.

Very touristy. This lake was not as big as we had expected and it is very easy to walk around in an hour. However you do get pestered by people trying to sell their wares, including old ladies that follow you and won't leave you alone. The red bridge and the pagoda gets very busy with tourists taking photos. However, you have to visit this when in Hanoi.

Peaceful oasis in a busy city. you can take a nice walk around the lake its very popular with all ages and has a nice setting. We visited the Jade Mountain Temple by walking over the attractive red wooden bridge . The Temple was beautifully decorated with carved dragons and striking colours.

Very beautiful and peaceful place!. The lake is quite huge and it's a very beautiful place in hanoi, if i'm not wrong it's one of the famous lake in hanoi. As i'm staying nearby so i visited this lake, and i was amazed by the beauty of this lake. There are also temple and places to shop and eat as well! Great place to visit.
Peace...ah!. A lovely spot in the midst of the crazy traffic....not quite total peace, but great start and a good walk.

There's a couple of temples in the lake itself. This huge lake had paths going all around it, so was great to walk around and see everything. There's a couple of temples in the lake itself. One has a lovely red bridge to take visitors over, the other I don't think you could get to.

A Peaceful Oasis in a frantic City. Our Hotel, The Essence was only 5 mins walk from the lake and it was one of our favourite places to wander around.It is quite beautiful, a tranquil place with lovely gardens, lots of interesting people, older folk doing their Tai Chi, young families, guys working out on makeshift gym equipment, couples having wedding photos taken. There are many seats to rest on and reflect on such a peaceful place in such a busy city. There is also the Ngoc Son Temple to visit at one end of the lake.
Nice but not exceptional. It is a lake that stretches across a large area but it wasn't exceptional. Personally, it is not a must go place for me.

Golden Turtle history. What a honor story history about this lake and the legend king with the sword. Beautiful green lake with wonderful turtle tower in the middle. Good place for customer walking around
A lovely peaceful spot. A nice spot to sit and reflect or rest after some sightseeing. Be sure to take a look at night too- the lake gets lit up quite beautifully.
Man made lake. This is one of three man made lakes in Vietnam. Pretty remarkable... it's massive. Great to walk around and forget you are in the middle of Vietnam's second biggest city.

A central gathering place for Hanoi residents. You'll likely see prospective brides getting their pictures taken around the beautiful grounds of Hoan Kiem Lake. There are plenty of places to sit in the shade (nice to have on a sunny, hot Hanoi day) and wide paved paths to stroll on.

A great place for a walk. This is a great little park and a nice place for a walk. There is a temple there you can also visit. Around this lake there are lots of little shops and places to get something to eat. Worth a visit!

A great place to walk, run, or try some Tai Chi. Hoan Kiem Lake is on the southern end of old Hanoi. In the early morning you can participate with older locals in exercises, or you can strap on your shoes and go for an early run as the city starts to wake up for a busy day. Shops, coffee booths, and a temple will invite you to try them. Make sure you come by after dark when the temple in the middle of the lake is lit up. For the curious, I would encourage you to look up the Legend of Hoan Kiem Lake and see if it doesn't bring to mind the Arthurian legend of the lady in the lake, except in this story, it's not a lady....

Excellent for a sit down!. Beautiful open areas abound in Hanoi and this was a favourite. Close to the open areas where people gather in the mornings you can get a really good set of people watching in. Excellent pace to enjoy a take away lunch.

A beautiful story. We were all fascinated with the story. But the lake disappoint. It was not spectacular in any way. Maybe it is the wrong season. We bussed around the lake and walked beside it a bit. If not for the story it would be just another lake.

Wander round in the Evening. Hanoi has lots of parks and open spaces. The lake is in one of the busiest parts of the city and is great for a short walk (20 minutes to walk round) or a longer amble to do some people watching. Its safe and pleasant at night.

Visit during Tet. A quick review to counter the many reviews I read telling visitors to avoid Hanoi during Tet - the Lake and areas around it are beautiful and filled with people and decorations during Tet. Sure, if you want to shop or have all the restaurant options available, Tet isn't a great time to visit, but if you are looking for a visit to Hanoi that is rich with experience, Tet is great!
Pleasant setting. A very nice view of Lake in the heart of the city, which is surrounding with garden and some stores closed by is absolutely excellent combination.

Sunday is special. On Sunday there are many Vietnamese couples and families having photos taken as you stroll around the lake. It is wonderful. And an absolute feast for the eyes. Check out emperor ly park as well where all the little kiddies are trying to learn to roller skate and play with balloons. Lovely scene with loving families. Also the front of the Metropole hotel has many wedding couples getting photographed and absolutely gorgeous Viet woman. They love the old citroens to give an old world charm. Great fun!
Loved the Bridge. You can receive a free tour with a uni student. They are very helpful and were able to tell you the history of the bridge. Great.

Great temple on the lake. The lake is, like others in Hanoi, a great spot to relax and see the people of Hanoi. The pagoda and temple are worth while visiting to get the story of the Restored Sword and the Turtles.

Best at night. The lake provides a pleasant setting as you walk from one attraction to another and has a lovely legend attached to it about the golden turtle who lived in the lake. The little pagoda in the centre of the lake looks more attractive at night when it is illuminated.
Vibrant and uplifting. I love the old people valiantly enjoying tai chi at 6.00 am and the rag tag army of lovers, locals, tourists and photographers all enjoying the space in harmony.

Interesting and Beautiful. This is a very beautifull place in the city of Hanoi, it is a real pleasure to walk along and meet citizens doing different activities like yoga, taking photo of brides, talking to foreingners, and running. Buy an icecream and seat somewhere here to give a glance to the city and its people behaviour.

Beautiful photos. Not a lot to do other than look at the lake and not that amazing to look at by I managed to get some beautiful pictures of the bridge on the lake, especially at night with the reflections in the water.

Beautiful Lake. Like the vast pool of water and the surrounding trees and benches for sitting beside the lake. The lake is also situated in the heart of Old Quarter, where various shops and food shops are plentiful.
Relax walk. It is relaxing when u walk around the lake. Pay VN20,000 for a temple visit after walk through the bridge.
Nice landscaping around the perimenter. That's about all I can say that is positive. The lake itself borders on putrid. I feel so sad for the poor tortoise.

Worth going!. We stayed at the Metropole hotel, just a couple of blocks away from the lake. My friends went to walk and exercise early in the morning when you will see local doing their early routine around the lake.

Walk around - takes you to Old Quarter. The lake itself isn't overly special but it is a great reference point for lost tourists (like us) to enable you to go to the Old Quarter and keep your bearings. Crossing the 'red bridge' to the Temple (feature) is only $2 AUD, so for the sake of looking its worth it.

Central location. It is easy to walk around the lake and makes a pleasant stroll. There are lots of places selling good coffee either on the lake's perimeter or overlooking it.It costs 20000 dong to visit the temple with the turtle,which is about 1USD. If you haven't visited many temples it offers an introduction, but it is not outstanding,especially on a wet grey morning.

Nice breezy lake. A beautiful lake in the middle of Old Quarter. There were many locals spending time, breeze walking, exercising, and hanging out A relaxing spot. The temple located in the middle of lake is worth a visit. Well known for sighting of a giant turtle which was supposed to be a Lucky Sighting!! Definitely worth a visit !!
Hoan Kiem Lake. A beautiful and scenic lake, a must visit destination for all in Hanoi. You can see the Turtle Tower and Ngoc Son Temple, which is full of legendary.

Great place for a walk. I walked around the lake after dinner. There were many locals doing the same and many smiling faces. I stopped to talk to a friendly young bloke fishing in the lake. He had very good English. Also saw some beautiful young girls being photographed on their wedding day. I felt safer walking there than I would doing the same thing at home.
Great area. Just to be there in the evening is really great. Hahaha nice ice cream too and nice people walk around there + nice restaurants too. Don't forget to bring your camera
Very nice to walk around the lake. Great atmosphere for exploring and relaxing. Nice place to watch the locals going about their day to day business and traditions.
Hanoi's Heart. Demarcation landmark between The Old Quarter and The French Quarter, a peaceful place to gather bearing traveling in Vietnam's great city of Hanoi.

Great Lake to sit & ponder or walk around. Loved to sit at the Lake daily and people watch. The Temple is definitely worth a visit and take your time taking in all the history of the temple.You can walk around the lake and stop off at the cafe overlooking the lake for a nice drink & cake

The famous lake in Ha Noi. It's a so interesting to be here.There's a lot of historical sites to discover and many shops to buy souvenirs. There's some cafe stalls with beautiful view around the lake. It's really an impressed experience. The only disadvantage is there's too many motorcycles which makes you a bit worried when passing the road. The rest things are so wonderful.

Nice.. I was told it was a must given the legend surrounding this place and that it would be best to walk round in the morning. The weather was dreadful so maybe it is why I was a bit underwhelmed....there was not much life on the walk around, the whole thing looked a bit gloomy... maybe just the weather. I also visited the temple on the island, which is nice, nothing unique, but nice. The price is minimal to visit so worth the quick look.

Enjoyed Taking Time to Relax at the Lake!. After visiting the Old Quarter, it was wonderful to sit around the lake and enjoy some delicious ice cream as our guide told us the story of the turtle and the sword! One could imagine how beautiful Hanoi used to be.
A nice place to walk and watch people. It was very nice just to walk around the lake and watch the people, interface with them, and enjoy Hanoi.

Not impressive. Since it's near where I stayed and went shopping and eating, I passed it several times.The first time happened to be on Sunday when everyone in the city seemed to be out there. It was very crowded and noisy. The traffic in this area seems to be always busy. You have to watch for the motorcycles. Therefore taking a leisurely walk is totally impossible.

Worth a visit..... While this is next to central in the Old Quarter, you are bound to stumble across it as it contains Ngoc Son Temple & the Turtle Tower. One thing I liked it that many locals visit this lake and doesn't make for tourist trap. I found the side towards the Turtle Tower to be quieter and pleasant to sit back and enjoy the daily life in Hanoi.

Pleasant but nothing remarkable. If you are in the area then do a circuit. It's a pleasant walk round without being remarkable. There is a temple half way round which is an interesting diversion and provides you with some good photo opportunities.
Could Be Better For Overseas Tourists. There was little signage in English about what this place is all about. Best to go with a local who can explain it to you.

Crowded but enjoyable. We did this with our guide who helped us get across the crazy roads. This was near our hotel but such is the volume of traffic that we would never have dared cross the roads ourselves. It was a misty day when we went - which added to the mystique. Lots of street traders round the lakeside (we especially enjoyed those who were making stretchy toffee!!). The red bridge is striking and pretty. We were there for an hour - not really long enough to appreciate it all.

A pleasant place for a walk. This is a popular area for tourists to visit, as there are other highlights in the vicinity. During the walk around the lake, there are benches to sit down for a rest. From here, I walked to the Opera House.
Nice walk. Like in many cities this is a great walk. Stroll around the lake and take in the Old Quarter from many different angles.

A visualization of Vietnam's pollution. Foggy due to air pollution. Green due to increased algae growth. The few remaining fish seek to the surface for oxygen, as the extra algae has oxygen-deprived lower layers of the lake. You can always see, hear, and smell the traffic when walking around the lake. There are plenty of tourists and salesmen trying to grab the attention of said tourists. To this phycisist and biologist couple, the lake was a depressing sight. It may have been beautiful before pollution kicked in.
Great for a stroll. This is for everyone whether taking some exercise or just wandering or people watching - especially all the couples having wedding photos taken each day.
Wow. This is the kind of lake that will make you want to reevaluate your life. I loved the hustle and bustle of its surrounding area and how serene the actually lake is.
nice lake!. this is great spot for walking around and have a look for hanoians daily life-always bussy and so many motobikes. so charm!love,love!!

Stroll around this inner-city gem. Lap the lake in a relaxed manner in around 40 minutes. Chances are that (young) locals approach you for some (very) basic conversation in order for them to practise.
Another good thing of this lake is that the locals seem to like this lake as much as the tourists do.

The heart of Hanoi. Chances are, if you are a tourist, your hotel will be a short walk from Hoan Kiem Lake; if not, change your reservation and find a hotel near the lake. Do a little research about the lake, it's history and the many fables about the lake and the sites in and around the lake. Or have the great guides from Hanoikids.org (free tours) include a walk around the lake to explain it's significance to Hanoi. As an aside, this is the lake where John McCain's parachute landed in before he was taken, extremely injured, to the infamous Hanoi Hilton. This lake is charming, whether you see it first thing in the morning, when many locals are doing Tai Chi on the shore, or at night, when the lake looks magical.

Just your average lake. Seemed like an average lake to us, but looks like it is popular with tourists and locals anyways, don't really know why. Maybe they're looking for the giant turtle that lives there :) Didn't see any turtle, just a whole lot of people documenting the fact that they had been at a lake in Hanoi! The upside is that it is probably a nice place to take a walk after eating all the food Hanoi has to offer. Traffic all around, so not very tranquil.

Beautiful area with added mystic. Lovely for a walk or to check out the small trample which lies in the middle of the lake. The lovely red bridge brings you lake side directly to the temple which also gives a great view of the lake and it's submerged temple spire.

Relaxing snapshots of Vietnamese life. I got up 06.45 and went here to get some photos of the Red Bridge and was not disappointed, as it was empty - and closed until 07.30. I also spent time watching the many people jogging, running, dancing, singing or playing badminton in the lake park area. Amazing. It was restful and pleasant with no litter and a grassed are and pavement walkway around it. Very enjoyable!

It's...a lake. But a cool one.. How many lakes are there with a walk-path, colorful locals and places to spend money? Lots.As Hoan Kiem Lake goes, it's not particularly unusual...but the fact that it is in Ha Noi makes things pretty cool and here's why: though it is a touristy place, the locals all seem to like the place too! People-watchers can see the morning calisthenics and tai-chi-type stuff...and there are a few western-friendly restaurants and coffee shops around, too. It is a nice stroll amidst the cacaphony of honks and zooms that are the soundtrack to Ha Noi life. Do yourself a favor and check out the history of the lake; the story behind the pagoda and the name will be be an interesting reminder that this city has seen over a thousand years of life.

Relaxing stroll around the lake. A small lake in the old quarter of Hanoi that is full of activities. Nicely decorated up and convenient to stroll around to see a range of activities by groups of tourist and Vietnamese people. There is an interesting temple on one end of the lake for visitors to go in to pray for good luck. Overall, a pleasant place in Hanoi's old quarter.

Very Romantic. The lake has a perfect dimension. The walk around the lake is less than an hour.The island with the pagoda in the middle of the lake gives a lovely touch.Be sure to notice the countless grooms and brides being photographed for the wedding album. Slightly Bollywood but romantic.
Very Romantic. Specially during drizzle and foggy morning, the lake is a great place to stroll, run or jog with a significant person

Dirty, unclean. I dont understand why this lake is so talked about in Hanoi tourism. Never seen a lake more dirty than this. Seems like all the garbage are thrown here and not been cleaned for years. I had a walk around too and some places it was stinky. The Red colored bridge looks beautiful at night with artificial lighting, apart from that nothing to see here.

Worth a stroll. The number of local people having their picture taken for weddings, or whatever was incredable.A nice place to stop for a coffee, drink or to watch. Some amazing old trees surround the Lake as well as restaurants for the more wealthy locals. Worth a look as it is a pretty escape from the traffic and streets.
DON´T MISS IT. Especial place to see.the red bridge.wood made,place for lovers.hoan kiem lake.beautiful,beautiful.don´t miss it.

Place to sit and relax. During my trip to Hanoi, I often went to this place for relax and enjoy the Old Quarter view. A lot of people make use this place as wedding photo shoot, jogging, dating and relaxing. & also, a lot of local selling the handcraft and foods. Love this place!
Nice walk. We walked around the lake just after the "Tet" party. There was a lot of animation and illumination.

Walk Around!!. Without a doubt, walking around the Lake was one of our favorite things to do while we were visiting Hanoi. We got up early morning to watch everyone doing exercises to get the day started and we walked around late at night to enjoy all the lights and nightlife. It is an easy stroll around and you will have fun observing many different aspects of Hanoi life!

Fun place for a picture. This lake houses a temple you cannot get to, but you can snap a few pictures with. It is picturesque of Vietnam and should not be missed at night. Lights are shining around the whole lake and it is a pleasant walk.

Hoan Kiem Lake feels like the heart of Ha Noi. On the edge of the Old Quarter, the Lake becomes a kind of compass as you traverse the area. Excellent cafes on the surrounding rooftop terraces give a spectacular perspective ob the chaotic and yielding traffic patterns of the town. There is a pretty temple in the middle of the lake, with the celebrated Water Puppet Theater along one edge. ATMs can also be found ringing the lake
Nice to walk around. We really enjoyed walking around the lake and stopping in one of the cafes for a drink. Nice place to people watch and see a slice of life in Hanoi

Serenity in the Heart of the City. Just a wonderful spot to stroll along or sit on the bench and relax. Does not matter if it is a sunny or misty day just nice to unwind here. The beautiful flowers in the lake and the pagoda at the south end of the lake and the Big Pagoda at the north end.

Good for an afternoon walk. The lake is beautiful and is the place were locals go jogging and young people meet after school. Also lots of tourists, because is in the middle of tho old quarter. There is a small temple in the island. Is not an attraction like a historic place or a pagoda, it's a live part of the city, just a very good place for a walk, relax, sit and have some rest, etc.
having a walk. when I visited Ha Noi, I took a walk around this beautiful lake, it was so facinating to see what happened around here, in the middle of the old town of Ha Noi.

Great scenery on night!. Hoan Kiem Lake is famous on where Le Loi King returned the turtle god golden sword over a thousand years ago. If you have time to visit here, you will see its beauty. From very early on, people gathered on the banks of the lake to exercise. Later, you can witness the bustling street walking, there is also the famous Turtle Tower, The Huc Bridge, the Pen Tower is very more visitors, over especially at night, cool air is suitable for you walking around, great scenery. You can also reward yourself with a Trang Tien ice cream, or a cup of coffee, and if you want to buy some speciality foods, you can walk about 5 minutes to nearby 36 ancient towns.Nice trip!

See & Be Seen. This is the focus of much of the evening life of Hanoi and is beautifully lit at night. Although beautiful during the day it really comes into its own with the evening "passeggiata" and a walk around the lake with stops along the way is an enchanting experience. Of course as it is in the centre of a busy city it is never quiet, but it still manages to retain a romantic air. The "The Huc" is a lovely red unmistakeably oriental bridge linking a small island in the lake to the promenade.

A pleasant lake in central Hanoi. The lake itself is unremarkable, apart from it being in the centre of Hanoi. There is a small 'temple' in the middle which is inaccessible, and the Ngoc Son [Jade Mountain] Temple, which can be accessed by a footbridge. It is small but highly decorated, and there is a huge embalmed tortoise in a glass case.Very busy with both locals and tourists, so timing could be critical.

Nice walk around the lake if you are nearby. As the Hoan Kiem lake is not a serious unmissable tourist attraction, it's not something you'd travel miles to see. However if like me you are staying nearby and have to pass the lake frequently, it added to the good feeling I have about Hanoi. We had coffee at an open air café there even though it was cold. We watched people exercising and playing games along its banks. It makes Hanoi a more pleasant place.

It's manky but you can get good photos!. Visibility is about 2cm, but other than that, the setting is lovely. Around Tet etc there are lots of lights and blossoms and general decorations up which are quite cool. It is a very popular place though, so expect it to be busy! Definitely worth a look and walk around (or Cyclo if you're not up for the walk!)

Hoan Kiem lake with Ngoc Son Temple. Beatifull decorations and thousands of flowers along the walking paths around the lake ( especially for the Vietnamese Newyear )Many artists-painters and portraitists perform here.At the northern end you can visit the Ngoc Son Temple after crossing the red Sunbeam bridge. Somebody told me it is also called the Hué bridge but I'm not sure this is correct ! The main feature in this temple is a golden turtle who brought a magic sword to a fisherman to fight the invading Chinese in the early 15th century .

Yes do stroll around the Lake.. It's where the locals also go. It's a nice area to shop, eat, and just explore. The bridge goes to the temple. For a small fee you can cross. I was there for TET to see the fireworks. Really nice.

Beautiful lake. It's just a lake but it's different from what you've ever seen before. I love how it sparkles sometimes and a walk around the lake is amazing and romantic around winter. There are many shops and restaurants around too. A must visit for a peaceful holiday

Interesting feature of central Hanoi. Lovely setting with Temple in lake linked by bridge. Looks lovely but needs a face lift to surroudings. Could be so much more especially as its location is so central
awesome scene at the heart of the city. One of the recommended places to visit. The relaxing view of the lake neutralizes the busyness of the roads surrounding it. :)

Beautiful at night and during the day. We stayed right in the Old Quarter, very near the lake. It was great to use as a reference point for taxis, etc. The lake is very beautiful during the day and at night. Definitely try to take a walk around it at both times.

Peace and Quiet. Amazingly, even though there was amazing amounts of traffic circling the lake, you could find some peace while walking around the lake. Of course, this was also an area which was transformed with plants and flowers for the Tet celebration. The north end of the lake (closest to the Old Quarter) was much more touristy than the south end of the lake.
it's a lake.... nothing special but a nice place for a relaxing stroll. the story/mythology behind the name is interesting i guess.

Don't expect much but still worth the visit.. The lake itself is fairly dirty and not much to look at but its all apart of the history. There is shopping close by so would still recommend you have a look although I wouldn't be dissapointed if you miss out.

A Place of Beauty in the Big City. Amongst the hustle and bustle of the big city lay this tranquil beast. The floral displays were fantastic, and visiting after dark saw the temples tastefully illuminated as well. Lovely.

The lake to visit in Hanoi. Hanoi has 7 lakes. Today, Hoan Kiem lake is the.best lake to visit. Location wise, it is right in the middle of the Old Quarter, so you can do both in the same day.This is a small picturesque lake. It only takes me 1.5 hour to walk leisurely its perimeter. The path around the lake is fully paved so it is wheelchair accessible. There are plenty of trees and bench seats to enjoy.You will soon notice a wooden red bridge linking the lake shore to the small temple on an island. The red bridge is called The Huc while the temple on the island is Ngoc Son pagoda. Both are historic landmarks for many centuries already. The original Ngoc Son pagoda was built in the 11th century. Today, a vietnamese general who defeated the Mongols in the 13th century is venerated inside.Lake access is free. However, access to the Ngoc Son pagoda is paidThe best time to visit is probably just before the Lunar New Year where the streets around the lake, the bridge The Huc are all illuminated. On Lunar New Year eve at midnight, there is a 15 minute fireworks display. If you stay in the Somerset Grand hotel which is only 300 meters away, several rooms have direct lake views to enjoy the spectacular fireworks.
It's a lake.... Nothing to rave about, but it's absolutely worth a stroll around the lake enjoying the city and views of the Turtle Tower in the middle.

The lake gives peace in the mad traffic.. We were around the lake in the Tet period.It was very colourful with flowers and lights.The main streets are around the lake and the temple over the red bridge is worth a visit.
Pleasant walk. We were very lucky as the surrounds of the lake had been prepared for Tet which added a lot of colour. However beware the cafe beside the lake as this is very expensive.

Beautiful lake. Spending the afternoon near Hoan Kiem Lake was more than a pleasant experience, it will be a memory i will keep cherishing. The lake is beautiful, there are nice traditional beverages being sold near it, and is definitely a key element to perceive in order to melt in the culture deeper. Surrounding the lake are multiple shops, ranging from clothes; restaurants; cafe; internet cafe; shopping center etc..
Local Mythology Come to Life. Be sure to go to the little island museum and see a bit of local lore. Very sweet, but crowded on a weekend.

Romantic and peaceful place. This Hoan Kiem Lake is a important landmark in old quarter. In the morning and evening, many people come here do exercises. In night, many couples dating around the lake and the teenagers play traditional games there. It's a nice place to walk around.

When I was young, my parents told me this story…. I had arrived in Hanoi by bus at a crazy 5am from Hoi An. In many cities it’s a long wait until the 2pm check-in but here in one of SE Asia’s more quaint capital cities I made my way to Hoan Kiem Lake where I knew there were park benches & a nice view. I found instead a peaceful place to watch the city come to life. On the banks of Hoan Kiem Lake I saw old women sitting on the benches with their carrying poles; baskets full of fruit resting their crooked backs before the day’s work, old veterans in their uniforms sipping filtered Vietnamese coffee sweetened with condensed milk & groups of local people practicing Tai Chi, the old people’s kung-fu. One of the simple things that make the lake special is a little temple pagoda standing all alone out in the middle of the lake, known as the Turtle Tower. It has a distinct Chinese design & currently has a worn weathered-look. I think the lakeside is one of the more romantic places in Hanoi, I saw Vietnamese couples sitting together holding hands talking to each other, it was nice to see this in the modern age. After sunset, the temple is beautifully lit up, silent in its quiet isolation out in the waters. When I was young, my parents told me a story about how one of the early emperors fought off the evil Chinese with a magical sword called ‘Thuận Thiên’ translated as Heaven’s Will. We were all told that driving out the Chinese was the will of the gods! Eventually after this victory, a huge turtle, a giant fresh water species native to the lake appeared & asked for the return of the sword to Heaven, that’s how the lake got its name, Lake of the Returned Sword, like king Arthur’s story about Excalibur. With the turtles nowadays almost extinct, some people fear the return of the Chinese with all their war-mongering over the disputed Spratley Islands, perhaps this time Heaven will send down a few nuclear-powered aircraft carriers, F-22 Raptors & some Apache helicopter gunships for good measure.

Very nice and ancient. Although it is not the largest lake in the capital, Hoan Kiem Lake, but has been associated with the lives and minds of many people. Lake County is located in the center of an old town with narrow, has opened a space large enough for the indigenous cultural activities. The lake scenery. And more than that, in association with legendary lake, is a symbol of peace desire (pay writers sword), martial virtue worth writing talent of the nation (where the bottom of the lake sacred sword and pen to write on the blue sky tower). Thus, many writers and artists have taken pictures Hoguom foundation for his work.

Peaceful refuge from the bustle of Hanoi. An historic lake with a temple in the middle and an ancient Turtle story. Well worth a stroll over the red bridge to soak up the peaceful atmosphere in this busy and noisy city.

Centre of the city. It's quite a nice stroll around Hoan Kiem Lake, either in the day or night time. We went during Tet so all the trees were lighted up in that nice Asian style, but once it was over all the lights disappeared but this doesn't detract any of the lake's charm. In the daytime, it's rather dirty and unclean (like the rest of the city) but still it's nice to walk around and see the life of the city passing you by.

Beautiful scenery, nice place to walk & dating. Visited the lake at the night and enjoyed the view very much. I went there during new year holiday, the lake was visited by locals in couple as well as family. You can choose to have a coffee at the lakeside while enjoying the beautiful night views, a short walking distance to Old Quarters for shopping. walking around the lake is definitely relaxing.
Nice for a walk in the city. Well worth a visit and stroll around the lake. Places to stop to eat/drink, close to the markets and street food areas.

Lit up at night during Tet. We were lucky enough to be able to enjoy the area at new year (Tet). The flower displays around the lake were stunning and the street light displays at night really beautiful. On one occasion we were walking around the lake early morning and local people were dancing and doing Qigong and Tai Chi.
Heart of Hanoi. Went here almost every day when I was in Hanoi. Loved walking around the lake, eating some cheap ice cream and people watching. Very touristy area but fun and always exciting.

Peaceful centre of Hanoi. This is a good landmark to have with regards to directions in the Old Quarter, as everyone knows where it is. There are plenty of shops, restaurants and pretty things to see around here, so take a stroll around and see what grabs your attention. It also makes a good spot for photo opportunities.

Happy new year. the lake is always a good point to find your way from. Of a night it is lit up like a Christmas tree and there are plenty of spots just to sit and have a coffee and watch the world go by.

Inner City Lake. During our visit it was overcast with smog from China. It was New Year and there were plenty of flowers to make up for the lack of sunshine. Maybe it is more appealing in god weather & sunshine.

A lovely place to sit or walk round .... I was staying in the centre of Hanoi and this was an easy place to walk to from my hotel. It's a nice place to walk around and there is a cafe at one end of the Lake. Well worth a visit away from the busy streets.

relaxing place. if you like the idea of relaxing in the shade under weeping willow trees, this is the place for you. Staying in the Sofitel, this was a close location to go to. I would sit on the benches and watch brides pose for portraits, old ladies gather and gossip, and mothers take their children for walks. I sat at one of the cafe's for an iced coffee for hours, watching the traffic, listening to the sounds of the city. In the early mornings, group exercisers keep your attention. The lake is surrounded by pleasant pathways to stroll on.

A Great Walk. Don't miss the opportunity to walk around this lake. The walk is an easy stroll among beautiful flower gardens and tree lined paths. There is a temple to see and even a sidewalk cafe to rest and enjoy a refreshment or two. At night it takes on a fairy like appearance with all the lights. It's very safe to walk at night as there are plenty of people - just don't leave it too late to do it.

Lovely temple. Lovely red bridge over the lake leads to an old temple, lots of incense, lovely gardens surround it, ornate altar, tells the legend of the turtle and the sword, photos of the turtles, every temple has a crane (bird) standing on a turtle, from little brass ones, to huge bronze ones. Very peaceful great for photos. Loved it.

Hoan Kiem Lake + Temple. Extremely pretty. It costs 20,000VND. cheaper if student but you have to bring a student card. nothing much to do but very scenic. we went over vietnamese new year and it was extremely crowded.
Culture Knowledge. It is an interesting cultural site with lots of history and mythology. Worth a visit. It is just opposite the walking night market.
Nice place to walk around. We visited Hanoi over New Years, the lake was the main area of celebration among the tourists. A nice place for a walk, especially when lit up by night.
tranquil atmosphere. A lovely small lake with two picturesque pagodas gives a quiet feeling in the middle of a bustling area of the old town where traffic is quite chaotic.

Life (literally) revolves around here. This is the spiritual heart of the city and a great place from which to watch the Hanoi city life pass by. It is also a great place to watch Hanoians getting married, people promenading, and some fitness fanatics jogging the circuit. There are a number of street vendors with snacks and trinkets, all with a fairly relaxed attitude towards tourists. Watch the traffic though - there's a lot of it circulating the lake.Do remember to dress conservatively, though.

Soak up the atmosphere of Hanoi with a walk around this lovely lake.. After a day's sightseeing, we found ourselves in a coffee house overlooking this lake from the North, great late afternoon light and lovely views over the lake. The eastern side of the lake, bathed in evening sunshine has a promenade which is well worth the stroll. At the Northern end of the lake you will find the 'Jade Mountain Temple', worth the visit, over a picturesque bridge (the 'Sunbeam Bridge'). But the best bit was strolling along the promenade, amongst the flower gardens, watching young couples having their engagement/wedding photos taken in the gardens. When we were there, it was coming up to the Tet New Year festivities and lots of extra flowers were being planted specially for the occasion - the main celebrations in Hanoi take place at this site.

Best seen at night. Booked a hotel just around the corner from the lake, so went there for every evening of our stay in Hanoi. The lake is best seen at night, when the famous red bridge are lighted up, making a great view.You can wander around (approximately 2 km), or just enjoy the Incredible view from the 6th or 7th floor of Avalon Cafe Lounge wich is highly recommended.
Perfect for an Evening Walk. During the day this lake is great, in the evening the lights (at New Year) means it's amazing.One of the best prominades on the planet.
Nice walk. A great place to get a way from the noise and traffic of Hanoi. The walk around the lake is wonderful.
This was worth the trip.. Our guide told us the story about the Lake and looking around at the surrounding areas it was like a fairy tale come to life between the old and the new.

Romantic setting. This is a beautiful small lake in the middle of the city. We saw many newly wedded couples posing for photos. We recommend to have a walk around the lake after dark to watch all the lights which sets off the beautiful shape of the trees around the lake. The Ngoc Son temple and the red bridge out to it gives the lake a mysterious setting.

Peaceful. This lake was peaceful and great to see. It has a temple on the island in the middle. We went out there and relaxed for a bit. I think we were a little confused about the house on another island. Our tour guide told us a story but she sounded unsure of herself so we weren't sure if the story was accurate. Needless to say it was nice lake and I love the location.

Feel the heartbeat of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem lake is unique. Steeped in history, beloved by locals, a never-ending cycle of life revolving around it's edge. Too many tour groups are not given the space and time to truly appreciate this place. My advice, if on a tour, is to skip some of the planned tourist activities and crappy tourist food and instead take an evening to wander around the lake a few times. Watch the Hanoians going about their daily rituals. Observe the happenings on the fringes. Be enchanted by the evening lanterns and lights. Just take the time. Hoan Kiem lake isn't so much about the lake itself, it's about the life around the lake. There is no better way, in my opinion, to feel the heartbeat of Hanoi than to take an evening stroll around the lake. See the young, the adult, the mature and the old all enjoy this wonderful place.Not to be missed - MAKE TIME to take time and you won't regret it at all. Don't listen to your obsessive tour guide wanting to take you to yet another place. Linger here and enjoy.

Especially Lit Up Around Tet(Vietnamis Tet). A rare breed of turtle like this popular lake almost equivalent to a multitude of locals and tourists. Hoan Kiem Lake is a dynamic animation daily, from dawn to go in the context of local people doing exercises on the shore, the water to see young couples on park benches, so much shopping and sightseeing opportunities in the vicinity. Located in the city center, Hoan Kiem lake serves as a great home base, and provide people-watching and endless entertainment opportunities on the edge of the old town, where the sacred land of Vietnam heart in Vietnam

Great lake for a leisurely walk. The lake was located near our hotel in downtown Hanoi. It is a very pleasant location to take a leisurely walk and experience urban Hanoi. We stopped off at the small buddhist temple that extends out into the lake. Highly recommend this excursion.

Loved this lake and surrounding area.. Charming lake with lots to see and look at. We walked around the whole lake didnt take too long. Lots of people around here at New Year of course and very safe. Would have liked to have stayed in a hotel closer to the lake so I could have spent more time here.

An oasis of tranquility in busy chaotic Hanoi. Just really beautiful, serene, quiet, when only a block away everything is busy and crazy (loved the chaos, by the way). We saw the lake many times during our 4 day stay. A really lovely feature of the city.

Gorgeous, Especially Lit Up Around Tet. It can get crowded but worth the sights. Cross the bridge to the temple in the middle of the water. Around Tet, the Lunar New Year, the entire park edges were lit up and adorned with flowers.
Stunning. Enjoy the tranquility of the lake. It's lovely to see and walk around. Many locals have their wedding photos taken there.
Fun to walk around.. It is an enjoyable open space with all ages exercising and getting some fresh air. I liked seeing everyone from old people to families with infants out for a walk.

A little lake history. The lake was small, you can walk around its perimeter in 30 min. The water was stagnant and polluted. It's amazing that any creature can live there. There is a little temple that houses a large stuffed turtoise that used to live in the lake. Next to the turtlke is its dried uterus- why anyone would want to display the uterus of the creature is beyond me.
