Best viewed at night. Ugly by day (toxic green water and dirty temple), stunning by night. The temple and the red bridge make for fabulous night photos.
Great city park.. Nice place to walk or jog in the morning. It was always busy, lots to watch. We met some lovely students who wanted to practice their English.
Great views at night. The night views are amazing here. Especially by the bridge to the temple. The red lights of the bridge reflect in the water and make for great photo backgrounds.

I was lucky to have a hotel just arounfd the corner.. I got to spend a lot of time at various times of the day around this lake. The area is well used by the locals and tourists alike. Beautifully lit up at night and popular with engaged couples who seem to enjoy having their photos taken on the shore. Some times in the evening you can see worshippers making their way in the dark from the main temple island to the smaller island at the far end of the lake. This lake holds great significance for the local people.

Myth, history, architecture & nature. Centrally located (5 min from the Old Quarter) - has it's own great myth /story. Jade Island on which the Temple of the Jade Mountain (Ngoc Son Temple) stands. Confucian master and famous writer in charge of repairs made to the temple in 1864. Jade Island is connected to the shore by the wooden red-painted The Huc Bridge (The Huc, meaning Morning Sunlight Bridge).

Relaxing environment in the city's center. Central location in Hanoi. It's a great place to see the locals in-action. Head to the lake early morning to see a flurry of activity. It's a nice place to walk around and a good landmark to help you navigate.

worth a visit. not much to really do around the lake (though you can go to the pagoda in the middle), but its worth having a walk around, I ended up chatting to some random local students who want to practise their English which was nice (but there are loads more people trying to sell things)

Life's simple pleasures. A picturesque lake? No.A respite from the motorbikes? No.A must-see? No.So what is it then?A lake where a revered turtle species resides, surrounded by paths where you could stroll around and benches and a cafe where you can rest. Some benches, behind trees with cascading leaves that block out most of the traffic movement around the park provide a bit of rest for your eyes. The noise will still be there, but it'll fade in the background. There's also a cafe around. It's a good place to stop by for a short rest after a day of walking. There are a lot of couples who have their wedding photos shot in this area. My most memorable moment around Hoan Kiem Lake:Walking back from the Post Office (just across the street) to my hotel in the Old Quarter when an old woman just stopped in front of an empty bench and started doing push-ups. At 4 in the afternoon. In full view of pedestrians and vehicles driving by. The place is also interesting early in the morning when locals do their morning walks and exercises.
Worth a visit.. The lake is lovely to walk around and a respite from the hectic Hanoi traffic. Night time with the reflections of all the lights is especially beautiful.
Take a stroll. Its only a few kilometres around. As you go round you will see lots of people getting their wedding photographs taken. There is a café at one end

Must visit!. Make sure you visit the museum in the middle of the lake to view the giant turtle replicate.
Walking around the lake for leisure and photography is lovely too. You can see the Turtle tower in the middle of the lake on a clear day.

English practice central. Sit down around the lake for than a few minutes when students are out and about and someone will come up to you to practice their English. I loved that part of it. Created the interactions with locals I had on the whole trip.

Stretch Your Legs and Enjoy the Scenary. The spot is a very popular destination for locals and tourists alike and its one that I have walked around many times just for some light hearted exercise and relaxation amongst the chaotic pace of Ha Noi life. Take some time out of your morning (if you’re an early riser) to have a refreshing stroll around the lake and admire the many yoga enthusiasts as you casually plod along around them on your way. If you can spare the extra time, the walk later in the evening is also very pleasant. The lighting displays around the lake and the shimmering reflections from the surrounding buildings make for some very pretty sights and photos and for the food tourist, during the evening there is usually a selection of small street vendors char-grilling or selling some very tasty local and ethnic Vietnamese treats at the water’s edge. The kind of thing usually only found in the truly “local” areas.Don’t hesitate, give it a go.
Hoan Kiem Lake. Should try at 5 am. The best time to see how all the Hanoier do their morning sport. Great spirit and atmosphere… or also to do a quick run for yourself..

Morning glory. Every morning around six, you can enjoy any of the groups doing their morning exercise . We partisipatet in "laughing Yoga" and it was great! You can also just take a stroll around the beautiful lake.

Must do. During my stay in Hanoi most days we would go for a walk around the lake or sit by the lake. It was amazing to see that people would by running exercise classes or dance classes around the lake. Sundays are the best time to go for a walk so many bridal party's were there having photos taken.

Do yourself a favour!. I think this is a must see and experience but to see it at it's best you need to get up early. Honestly originally I came down to the river from my hotel for nothing else but exercise as our hotel did not have gym. The lake itself takes about 20 minutes to walk around at a relatively brisk pace. Although it is not overtly attractive what is amazing is to see all the locals out exercising. Do yourself a favour, if you do get there early (6.30 - 7.30am) take a walk around the whole lake before you do anything else. There is an eclectic mix of exercising going on, you will see people walking, running, you will pass the 'muscle building' group, thai chi group/s, ballroom dancing groups (what was cute was I saw an old man teaching another old man to dance...so sweet), you will see aerobics (to gangnam style amongst other things), some thing where there is two lines of people banging/massaging each others backs and necks, badminton, some kind of footbal with a small ball like thing and so much more. It is just amazing to see. Life is not easy here in Vietnam, it is hard for most people to make a dollar, they work long hours and after all of that they get up early to do some form of exercise - makes my excuses for why I can't pretty pitiful! I walked down by the lake every morning here, it was so entertaining. I highly recommend...you might even try joining in with a group!
Walk around the Lake. Thoroughly enjoyable walk around scenic Hoan Kiem Lake, day or night, with a wonderful variety of places along the way, including the water puppet theatre, Pho Thin, and others

peaceful landmark. By day it was pleasant to walk around this lake and pop into the temple across the red bridge too. In the evening local couples walk hand in hand, or can be seen snuggling up to each other on benches. When it gets dark, there are a few bars/restaurants with balconies on the north side of the lake where it is nice to sit and people watch whilst sipping on a beer or cocktail. It seems to be a central landmark in Hanoi and is pleasant to be near as it is peaceful compared to the chaotic roads!

Nice walk. When the weather is chilly and many people picks up an ice cream, its a signal for a nice walk around the lake with your loved ones. Just avoid doing this on rainy days:)Hanoi can get pretty stifling and polluted (especially after a whole day) so walking around the lake becomes the best remedy to sooth your disturbed senses, and invigorate yourself for the next day:)
Take a stroll around the lake. We walked around the lake and enjoyed the peaceful atmosphere...beautiful to have a lake right in the middle of the bustling city!

Respite in hectic Hanoi. Located in the center of Hanoi and near the old quarter, this lake offers beauty and peace after dodging vendors, Toyota taxis, BMW business men and Honda scooters. The lake is large and beautifully landscaped and maintained. There are many places to stop, sit and rest. Although I did not witness this (due to sleeping in late) there is an active and interesting Tai Chi culture that takes place very morning around the lake.
Lovely to walk around and very pretty. My only complaint was being constantly pestered every few metres ( not aggressively ) with people trying to sell us stuff.

Beautiful in the day...MAGNIFICENT @ Night! Take your camera & Tripod!. My favorite part of my stay in Hanoi was walking around the lake area during the day but especially at night when all the locals are out enjoying the serenity of the area. Lot's of activity each night and amazing places to take photos. Beautiful!!! Great little ice cream places when you need to cool off. Enjoy!

Walk around the lake and take lots of pictures. The lake ,at least for me,served as a guide/ landmark so that i won`t get lost. It is in the middle of almost everything - near our hotel and near many tourist attractions. We had a nice walk around the lake. The park was clean and well maintained with lots of benches, where you can sit , rest , watch the locals or just admire the view. We also went to the small temple . There was an exhibit of a huge turtle. This place is popular among locals and tourists.

Lovely place. Gorgeous place in a bustling city. Quite busy, we were an attraction amongst the tourists/locals (3 kids blonde hair/blue eyes). A bit overwhelming at times. Quite smoggy (or overcast?) but beautiful park area for kids to stretch legs. Good opportunitys to engage (7,4 & 20 month) children with stories of the turtle and swords. Beautiful shrines inside with lots of various offerings (great discussion points with children). Stroll up to dragon sculpted hedge with the world in hands icon, kids loved it!

One of the main attractions in Hanoi. Pity about the haze/smog in the city otherwise, it would look even better. Managed to see some lotus flowers in bloom. The water doesn't look too clean. Ex-french buildings surrounding the lake are worth a look.

Good break from all sorts of walking. It's really a nice place to take a break after some walking around the old quarter, just chill along and take a breath. Enjoyed the night view of the lake as reflections of the surround buildings can be seen gracefully on the waters. Rather peaceful. :)

Early morning city life. go for an early morning stroll and see all of Hanoi walking their dogs, doing their exercises and having their back rubs, in a pleasant waterside park promenade that runs right round the picturesque lake.
Take a walk around the lake at night. The lights that line the shores changed colors and the buildings that were lighted reflected in the water. Citizens were doing aerobics style exercises together.

Romantic at Night. This lake is a must see at night. Very Romantic with all the coloured lights. On Christmas Eve anyone with a scooter does a lap around this beautiful lake. It was spectacular to see!

Spectacular at night. I was there over the New Year period and I dont know if its always lit up but it looked pretty spectacular at night with all the coloured lights. The turtle pagoda as well was well lit up and featured well. It was a great place for wandering around as well as there were always people doing interesting things there like gettiNg married, taking photos or lifting weights and exercising! Interesting for people watching!

Lovely. It is a lovely lake, surrounded by trees and jogging trails. People are sitting around talking to friends and children are playing together. It was just a normal lake to me, however lovely it is.

Do take a walk around the lake. A very pretty lake. I went during the chinese new year (Tet festival),the city was so beutifully decorated, and the cherry blossoms just added to the spectacle. Do take a walk around the lake.

(spiritual) centre of Hanoi. This where everybody hangs out and mingles, Vietnamese and tourists. Go early in the morning and enjoy the morning haze over the lake and wait for the turtle that everybody says is still living there......
Disappointed. Dirty and too busy to see much thought the water was too polluted to have any form of life in it. Very busy and they were lots of people using it to take photographs for weddings

Beauty and people.. This is the one place in Hanoi that I never get tired of. It is beautiful, has places to walk and to sit . I always enjoy talking to the Vietnamese college students to help them with their English. Close to shops and restaurants. Also close to many hotels,

Very pretty, especially at night. This part of Hanoi surprised me. Amidst the chaotic traffic and narrow streets of the Old Quarter lies a (relatively) peaceful and pretty lake. It is very nice to just walk around the lake as the locals love to gather here and do many interesting stuffs, great for those who love to seek a good spot for street photography in Hanoi. For example, I found a group of elderly men and women who seemed to practice dancing by the lake. If you bring your tripod, go here at night to capture the temple and the bridge in the middle of the lake. Very pretty. You can also go to the temple which has a very reasonable entrance fee of US$1. This is probably my fave part of Hanoi.
Hanoi 27/- 10/12/13. The people, The peacefullness and the ability to walk round the lake take in the locals and no pollution.

Visit at night. Explore the lake and the upbeat surrounding areas at nights, where people dine, play games, shop, etc. Great atmosphere, good bars and clubs around, very Times Square of Asia. Good experience. PS- a crusing spot too, be warned.
beautiful!. the lake was pretty, the benches and bushes were nice for scenery and relaxation. makes for some good pictures.

If you go to Hanoi, you must get there!. When you travel to and Hanoi, the first place to mention in landscapes of the capital is Temple of Literature, the first university of Vietnam. Another symbol of Hanoi is One pillar pagoda with the most unique lotus shaped architecture in Vietnam. Besides, with hundreds years of history, Hanoi has many pagodas built in the reign of ancient dynasties such as Tran Quoc pagoda, Huong pagoda.Located right in the center of the city , where usually takes place the big cultural activities of the city such as: fireworks, performance, etc, it is the historical Hoan Kiem Lake and Ngoc Son Temple which still remains its purely natural beauty. Hoan Kiem means “returned sword”, and the name comes from a legend in which King Le Loi was given a magical sword by the gods, which he used to drive out the invading Chinese. Other tourist attractions to be mentioned are West Lake, Truc Bach, Bay Mau Lake, etc.,which are the undeniable green, fresh, and peaceful beauties of the capital.

Loved it!. Right to the south of the Old Quarter, bordering with the French Quarter is this big lake. It is a pleasant stroll all the way around, and I made it a point to do just that at almost every time of day: sunrise, afternoon, evening, night.Everytime, it was a different atmosphere. The sunrise time - you see all the elders gathered going through their yoga and tai chi, and others making the morning jog. Pleasant air and a really nice feeling to be around all the energy.The afternoon is a lot more laid back with fewer people so you can easily find an open bench near the water and sit and relax for a bit and enjoy the scenery. The night and evening I totally loved. The funnest part was seeing all the to-be-wed couples out taking their wedding pictures.Would definitely recommend this to everyone to at least see at one time or another during your stay in Hanoi. This is also the lake that has the red bridge leading to the temple. It looks beautiful at any time of day, but is most spectacular at night time.

Pleasant. We went in December to this lake, smack in the middle of a wintery haze. It was a pleasant walk around the lake. A little chilly but a nice change of pace from the other parts of the city. .We saw many locals there too, shooting their wedding albums. Its a great place to people watch and escape the chaos of the city. The only annoyance was being hounded by the souvenir pedlars. Just around the lake you can find many souvenir shops that could offer you a good price if you are willing to bargain. The post office is right there by the lake too so we managed to take a nice walk around, buy souvenirs and send post cards while biding time for our Thang Long Water Puppet show which was ( surprise surprise) right by the lake too!It seems like everything is centered around the lake - ATMs, shopping centers, souvenir shops, the PO...An evening well spent.

Beautiful. I was lucky enough to be at the lake on christmas eve which was extra special but at any time the lake is quite surreal. Stop at one of the cafes for a coffee or watch from a roof top bar nearby

Worth a visit on a slow day. Smallish lake with a temple on it. Not particularly picturesque. Also not a lot happening around it. Traffic circling it is almost insanely busy. A few locals using the circling pavements it as a walking/jogging track.
High score on history, low on scenery. I am biased as I stayed at West Lake Hanoi. It is a good place to watch people and appreciate history.

still center. I came here more than once, for its tranquillity and freshness in the midst of the relentless city--though there's plenty of life: people doing T'ai Chi stretches, skewers of pineapple for sale, young women in cheong sams and makeup posing for photos, a couple of temples in the water, banyan trees and cuddling lovers.
People watch. Great walk and lovely to take time out and people watch. Beautiful peace and quiet amidst the sttreets of Hanoi.

Lake of the Restored Sword. It is a natural spot for this, as it's located right in the middle of the Old Quarter, and is beautiful. You can walk around the lake, watching people do their exercises, and visit the temple without the crowds.

Island is nice escape from the chaos. While Hoan Kiem Lake is not the quiet refuge we had hoped it would be (at any time of day), a stroll across to the island is offers wonderful views and a chance to visit the little temple.
Nice for a jog or walk around. Enjoyed a jog this morning--about 1 mile all the way around so one can go multiple times... NIce pathway, trees, and scenery...

peaceful , serene lake in town. It is always a joy to walk along the pavement of Hoan Kiem lake anytime of the day. This shady path is lined with very old and huge trees with buttress roots , many of which protruding out into the waters. The rustic sounds of the leaves blowing in the wind is mingled with the busy honking of the ever busy perimeter road that runs all around the lake for about 4 km all round. The best time to visit is in the early morning where the filtered sunlight shines through the leaves unto the waters. Another time is during the evenings and the night scene where the temple and the bridge are all lighted up. Benches lined the full lengths of the lake and its very inviting to sit by after long walks, sip a coffee , take a snack or a nap or simply people watching. We can sit down for 1-2 hours and watch students and elderly folks going about their activities. There are ice cream kiosks and cafes dotting the lake side. Just across the road are the shops , guesthouses and food stalls. The night market is also located at the southern end of the lake where most activities take place.

Historical Significance. There's plenty of lakes in Hanoi but Hoan Kiem lake bears the most of historical significance. Got it's name when an emperor who won a war whereby he returns the sword he borrowed from a celestial tortoise. Nice pictures could be taken as it is within the enclave of the old quarters. At certain times, could see many Hanoi folks converging their activities around the lake such as jogging,exercise & picnic. There's a temple on a small island in honor of the celestial tortoise off the edge of the lake. Entrance fee VND20,000 for adults & kids enter free

Really liked it. We walked twice around the lake on a Saturday. Lots of people are out, and several studentsapproached us to practice their English. Several ice cream stands around the lake.If you start at the South (?) end, a third of the way around, you can go left to the old church. Halfway around you can divert into the Old City. There is also a Temple that juts into the lake at theNorth end, admission Dong 20,000 (US$1). Nice but nothing special. After completing the loop,you can bear left to the Metropol Hotel & Opera House. And also a huge 5 star shopping mall,where the A/C was most welcome. We then walked back around the Lake again before returningto our hotel Movenpick.
Interesting bridge. One of the sights to see, especially the tortoise! Good for watching the locals and not too far from the old town.
quiet spot in a busy city. Just have a walk around the lake and enjoy the quiet time without any scooter and lots of people. Nice time-out.

Pretty good. The lake itself isn't the most redeeming feature here, more the activity around it. Locals exercising, playing the romantic, getting married...it's all happening! It's a lovely setting and focal point certainly, but if you're a people watcher, head down for a few hours. You'll enjoy it.
excellent lake to take a walk. Centrally located lake. One of 4 large turtles left in the world reside here and locals feel he is magical. Great spot to grab a cafe and just people watch...

Nice picturesque location. Fantastic lake, great temple and monument. Makes a fantastic walk around the lake in the middle of the old quarter. Really picturesque location for some great photos. I would definitely recommend this to travelers.
Okay for a stroll. It's pleasant enough for a stroll around, but doesn't exactly feel like a highlight of hanoi! If you're up early catch all the ladies doing outdoor exercises...

relax. went on May which was supposed to be quite hot. however, it was raining when we reached the airport in the morning, and the whole day continued to feel quite cool, probably around 22 degree celcius. went for a walk in the evening, we saw families, old couples and many other tourists around the lake. beautiful trees and flowers around, quite relax. many ice-cream vendors around the lake, and also some cafes. did not try on the cafes though, they seems quite costly. just spend about 30 mins walking around and that's about all. not very special but this is a very famous lake, so do spare some time here

Look for the turtle!. So, in reality, you're not going to see the turtle. But you still need to visit the lake! The lake is worth an actual visit, and not just a glance as you're passing by. It's a nice place to walk around, and early in the morning (the only time that Hanoi seems almost calm) is a great time to see locals relaxing and truly enjoying the area instead of just hustling by. If you just can't drag yourself out of bed in the morning, don't worry; it's always a good time to check out the lake!

Take an early morning walk and also visit the templ. A beautiful place to take an early morning walk -- fun watching the tai chi groups (including the Gangum style ladies!). The lake is beautiful -- lots of places for pictures. Pay the money to cross the bridge and visit the beautiful temple.

Soothing place in the middle of hustle and bustle!. Its a beautiful lake. Pay the 50c to cross the bridge to the island and watch to elderly locals play their vienamese draughts game, its fun to observe. Gorgeous bonsai's on the island too. We almost walked right around it, lots of brides having photos etc. Its a must in Hanoi.

Busy city centre lake. The manic traffic slightly spoils the lake which could be quite serene if not for the constant noise of moped horns. Local people love the lake and come in droves to have photos taken. Young wedding couples pose in front of cameras for their wedding albums.

Where you can get fresh air. This is a really nice place to visit. Among historical sites, this seems to be a great place for all people living in a busy city. It is busy in the morning with a lot of people doing their exercise.

Nice, peaceful refuge. There is a temple on an island over a foot bridge at this lake, but it is best to simply walk around the eastern part of the lake where it links the old quarter with the ritzy area of Hanoi via other parks.

This place has an amazing history!. Hoan Kiem Lake is like one of those fairytale stories but somewhat I want to believe that there is really a big turtle inside protecting the Lake and it's people. There are a lot of tourists visiting this place. It gets very crowded and hard to get a good spot to take pictures. Anyway, when you go further inside (from the entrance after paying the entrance fee), there is a bridge connecting to the Ngoc Son Temple. Inside you can see a very big turtle on display (embalmed). I used to think that the legend of the big turtle is really for real. :) This place is not that big and you can visit this place for less than an hour. A good view to relax your mind.

Small lake, good for a short rest and leisure walk.. This lake is rather small, with some cultural attraction there. There are also some street painters there. Its good for just taking a leisure walk or a short rest from walking the busy streets in the Old Quarters.
Picturesque. Really gorgeous temple in the middle of the lake smack dab in the middle of the city. Granted it's also sadly polluted.
Beautiful Lake. You can view the beautiful scenery and there are lots of local people relaxing around, a happy place for everyone.

Beautiful. We visited this area asth e sunward as about to set, we walked across the bridge,an d took photographs of the lovely lake. There were lots of people walking around the nice path, enjoying the atmosphere, there are a few public toilets around the area, and snack and drink at ops. Local people exercise here in the early morning and into evenings on. It was a lovely area to visit, and relax NAND people watch. We went several time, and took an electric car visit of the old quarter. We loved being in the area.

Peaceful quiet lake to rest your tired feet. A simple and quiet lake with not much activity unless you go early in the morning. There's a cafe and ice cram place where you can sit down to take a break from all the walking in the old quarter.

A pitiful puddle in the midst of a dirty city. I don't understand how anybody could possibly think this was a relaxing place, as I walked over the bridge I looked down to see a giant rat and looked up to notice the sky was glazed with a thick layer of smog from the seemingly endless mopeds crowding every corner of the city... Not a fan...

Have to walk round. The classical Hanoi walk for everyone. A nice gentle 15 min walk along the edge of the lake. It was hazy today but I think pollution is getting to be a major problem here. You can buy face masks for 10 000 dong in the market ( about 70c aus) everyone is very happy and friendly.
Lovely in the centre of the city. This is lake is so lovely being close to all the action...yet so very peaceful when you take a walk around it...no matter what time of day

A great place to start your tour of Hanoi. If you are staying in Old Quarter, then this is a great place to start your walking tour of the city. With two small temples on the lake and a great legend to go with it, the lake provides a good hour walk around with many small statues and the like. Take some time to stop and peer into the water to hopefully catch a glimpse of one of the rare turtles that live here.

Relaxing Oasis. The lake is an oasis in the city. The morning is all about exercise and coffee! In the afternoon and evening it is a lovely place to stroll or relax on a bench. Felt very safe. Loved the ice cream and coffee stands. There is a lovely small restaurant on the water with wonder coffee's on chilly nights!

Definitely worth a stroll. Try to visit at different times of the day. People exercising in the morning. At night there are ballroom dance classes and people showing off their dogs. In the afternoon find students that want to practice English, wedding parties, and perhaps a nice sunset.
Nice place to relax. You are surely going to pass it anyway on your trip in Hanoi. Nice to go around it and get (a little bit anyway) away from the noise of the city.

Nice place for a walk. Nice place to relax if you want to get away from the busiest part of the city. The lake is most beautiful at night when lights light up the lake. It is also nice to walk around the lake since you don't have to mind the traffic. It is a good place to spend an hour or two when you are in Hanoi. it is also a place where the local relax and go for romantic walks.

Very nice place for the peace. This is the coolest place to be during hot weather. It's pretty nice too, you can have a drink in a cafe or walk around with an ice-cream (for ex Trang Tien which is very famous here). You can feel the local people life style activities in the evening. Keep walking around entire lake with a very picturesque red bridge and museum. So interesting!

Well, you are going to go there anyway!. A peaceful place if you want a break from frantic city streets. You will get vendors and such, and students keen to practise English. You can always shoo them away.

Great morning walk. Really the early morning walk around this lake is not to be missed to see the people of Vietnam going about their daly morning exercise. Well worth a walk in the evening to watch the sunset and enjoy the family's walking together.

A breath of fresh air. This lake was like an oasis in the frenzy that is Hanoi. It is where the locals walk, jog and cycle and when we got lost, it was the place we asked to be directed to as when there, we could find our bearings again. It is a tranquil and calming place and nice to have a drink at one of the bars on the lakeside or to visit the Temple on the island.

Good for a relaxing stroll. The place is crowded with tourists visiting the temple/turtle tower. There are also many locals there jogging and students taking their graduation photos on the bridge to the temple. Take a relaxing stroll along the lake and soak in the atmosphere at the end of a busy day of touring!

Cool lake. Take a stroll along the lake and just watch the locals pass their time. There'll be line-dancing, locals playing soccer, portrait painting etc. Along the lake there're also very nice cafes which overlook the entire lake. A good place to just enjoy ur cuppa vietnamese drip coffee and watch both the peace of the lake and the hustle of the busy road

Beautiful Place for Recreation and Photography. This is a beautiful lake, perfect for photography and recreational walks. Next to the lake one can find a temple which is a beautiful place for visit as well.

An interesting stroll. Take a stroll around Hoan Kiem Lake it will take a couple of hours at a slow pace and a stop at one of the café’s around the lake, great to sit and people watch or just take in the atmosphere. We were warned about pick pockets in this and other areas of Hanoi as well as all areas of Vietnam, however I never felt any threats whatsoever here or anywhere in fact I felt safer here than in the streets of my home city.

Romantic getaway. This lake is truly for all. You can find many locals who are jogging, walking, enjoying a sunset,… but you’ve also loads of tourist who are taking in the atmosphere. The turtle temple is for sure worth visiting, as it is perfect to escape the busy town life for a while. Along the lake you have some vendors, but they were not pushing, if you just say no they leave you alone. This place is worth walking during the day and during the evening.
Nice spot in the Old Quarter. Nice lake area in the Old Quarter. Make sure you visit the temple in the middle with the 500 year old turtle and learn the story of the turtle, the sword and the king.
Magical Lake.... A lovely picturesque lake and elegant Sunbeam Bridge amid the frantic traffic of the Old Quarter. Also very pretty after dark.

Meet me by the lake. Try meeting someone there, you could spend hours walking around it, yes it's huge, it takes up city blocks it's that huge. There's a pagoda in the middle, but it costs to cross the bridge to go out and visit it. Inexpensive.I badly wanted to see this mystical turtle who clutched the sword and took it away with him. Lucky for me there are faithful recreations and the story unfolds. Downside, there are heaps of people trying to sell you cards and postcards, it gets really annoying, you say No and they're still on you. The heat is so balmy it's like a warm bath so take water, you can buy soft drinks at the pagoda.I liked it, best visited in the earliest hours of day light and you can appreciate it better with a peaceful walk around it.
Lovely lake. The lake was stunning - the trees are awesome... and looks like they've done a good job keeping it clean.

Nice for a walk. Everyone at some point will happen upon the lake as it is near the old quater and some of the museums. Its a pretty lake, with a temple in the middle. It's not epic in anyway, but still a nice place to walk around

Gem in a city. The lake is popular amongst tourists as well as the locals. The temple in the middle is a peaceful oasis amongst the hustle and bustle of a very motorbike dominated city.There are regular jiggers, walkers, people performing group keep fit exercises as well as tourists walking around. At night, the lake is lit up and the surrounding buildings are also lit.

quite peaceful in a bustling city. I loved walking around the lake it made such a lovely change from the noise of the old quarter. Also be prepared at weekends, if you sit down, to be approached by students who politely ask if the can talk to you as they would like to improve their English. They are genuine, i spoke to many and found it as rewarding as they did.
One of the sights of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is a nice lake in the heart of Hanoi close to the Old Quarter. One of the few nice sights in Hanoi.

Early mornings at Hoan Kiem Lake. If you want a different view of Vietnamese culture, walk around the lake just after sunrise. The 0.9 mile walk is shared with thousands of locals, practicing tai chi or exercising in many other ways, including ballroom dancing to recorded music! During our walk we encountered only 8 Westerners. Delightful!
Respite in the city. Don't look too close at the rubbish and the dead fish....the lake is a lovely part of the city but they need to learn how to look after it.

Busy as popular but still relaxing. durning the day you can find a quiet space in a cafe by the lake. At other times of the day it is busy but you are still able to find a seat on a park bench if you hunt. even though it is surrounded by busy traffic it is still relaxing to sit under the trees and watch the lake and people enjoying the fresher air. good respite from old quarter.

Nice to walk around and get away from hustle & bustle. Great meeting place and nice to take a walk around to relax from the city, a nice pagoda to view on the lake and takes about 2-30 minutes to walk around. Most places are easily found from a point on the lake which makes this city really east to navigate. Recommend coming here and sitting in a cafe lake side and relaxing or people watching for the afternoon.
Walk if you can. We walked here as our hotel was close by it was busy..... Crossing the road can be a dilemma nice at night with all the lights
Hoan Kiem lake. I visited here in March 2013. It's beautiful lake. In the evenings, it's very very fantastic. If i come back to Ha Noi, i will visit here again :))

Possible Scam alert. Was sitting down by the lake with my parter. This lovely lady comes up to me and asks me whether I speak English and that she wasn't selling anything. She asked whether she could sit down and have a chat. I said that was fine. I had my bag with my valuables on my lap and was holding it tightly. Alarm bells rang when she got out a book with hand writing and asked me to be the teacher. Possibly with the intention of me loosing my guard and letting go of my bag. She also put a bag beside my parter who was sitting beside me, which seemed a tad unusual. We ended up walking away swiftly after we started to feel uncomfortable. I don't know whether this was a scam and I would have hated to brush off someone who was legitimate. Anybody have similar experiences?!
Serene Peaceful. Temple on the lake has a huge preserved turtle! The other end has a turtle temple built in the middle of the lake too!

Heart of Hanoi. All activity happens around this lake. You'll end up passing it multiple times during your visit to various sights. Take time off to stroll and sit by the lake. Even in the hustle and bustle surrounding it, it gives you tranquility. Place to balance your Zen.

Peaceful walk along lake. I have been to Hoan Kiem Lake many times and many period, found many different culture of Hanoi people. Foggy in the morning make so mystery, Relax in the afternoon tea and ice cream is fantastic.
Go at dusk.. Walked a lap of the lake, go at dusk to see the setting sun though bring repellant for the mosquitos.

You haven't visited Hanoi if you haven't been to Hoan Kiem Lake. Hoan Kiem Lake is definitely a must visit when you're in Hanoi. The lake is not so big so it's nice for morning jog or afternoon jog. Or just sit on one of the bench and enjoy the view. It's the perfect place to observe daily life of local people. Come early in the morning and you see many locals from old to young exercising, dancing or practicing tai chi. I usually go there in the morning and grab my breakfast from the street vendor nearby.

A nice walk after dinner but where is the turtle?. We spent most evenings walking round the lake after dinner as we were staying in the old quarter it was a bit of peace and somewhere to walk out of the traffic. We looked very hard but we couldnt see the turtle that lives in the lake great grandfather evaded us if your lucky enough to see it please photograph him and post it online as there are suprisingly few photos.

Very nice place to kill time. Stayed in a hostel near the lake. The place is really breathtaking. If you want to kill time in Hanoi, the lake is the best place to do so. If you come in the evening, be sure to rest near the pagoda where they light up the bridge. Very stunning view!
refreshing. it is the coolest place to be during hot weather. it pretty nice too, you can have a drink in a cafe or walk around. There is a temple on a small island as well.
Nice to go if you have nothing much to do in Hanoi. Interesting sights to see in terms of architecture, but if you've been traveling around SEA its nothing special.

Beautiful surroundings. Even though Hanoi can be very stressful, I have really enjoyed sitting by the lake and watching the water (the fish) and surrounds and just relax. In the morning it is very calm and beautiful.
Beautiful. Very beautiful lake located in the old quarter, you definitely should take a walk along and you’ll enjoy it for sure
Get there early!. Get up early and head down to watch everyone warm up and excercise! great way to start the day! Do a lap around it.

Meh... This place is ok for a quick visit. But really over crowded and there is a few scams going on in this area. Random people taking your photograph and other people actually coming up to you asking to take a picture (we presumed pick pockets) Watch your bag and wallets here.The lake is nice enough and it is nice to walk around the alke aswell. the bridge in the middle is alright aswell. If you sit for to long you are harrased by people trying to sell you crap. It does get annoying after a while.As i said a qick visit is fine and all you need.

Great lake view, exercise, jogging, family activities. Visit in the evening, the lake is full of people surrounding it. Some is doing exercise, jogging, dancing, board game and dating. A very good place to have a walk after dinner. You can feel the local people life style activities in the evening. Very enjoy walking around the lake. The feeling is very good, a little bit like you are in France. Definitely a great place for a walk.
Byronlady Travels. We enjoyed the peacefulness of the lake, much needed with all the hustle and bustle. The old bridge is beautiful.

Beautiful lake setting. Well worth a stroll around the lake. Savor the serene location surrounded by busy Hanoi. You might see a wedding ceremony. Don't forget to see the temple across the red footbridge.

Pretty place. It's very crowded with locals jogging, sipping coffee/tea, hanging out with kids and engaged couples having photographs taken. Paved trail around entire lake with a very picturesque red bridge and museum.

Hoan Kiem Lake Hanoi. Located in the center of Hanoi between Old quarter and French quarter, Hoan Kiem Lake is the lifeline to the crowded neighborhood. It is a lover point of the capital city of Hanoi and so frequented by young couples at night sitting around the lake. The lake present a panoramic view at night with lot of glistening light, trees and view of city post office nearby, while you can find locals practicing tai chi in the morning. Hanoians call it endearingly “Bo Ho” means shore of the lake. There is nearby shopping centers, night market and any thing you may need.

Great historical story. We liked the story behind the Lakes name and the beauty of the Temple.The Guide certainly knew a great deal about the lake and was able to give very good and interesting talk about the history of the area.

Very pleasant stroll. take your time strolling around the lake. Watch kids playing and families enjoying the day. Many times you'll encounter wedding parties out for a photo session. Awonderful afternoon

Relaxing Walk, Shopping and Restaurants Close By. A central gathering place for Hanoi residents, you'll likely see prospective brides getting their pictures taken around the beautiful grounds of Hoan Kiem Lake. There are plenty of places to sit in the shade (nice to have on a sunny, hot Hanoi day) and wide paved paths to stroll on. Around the lake to the North there is great silk, jewelry, and tourist shopping. To the Southeast you can find high end stores like Burberry. There is a nice restaurant and bar on the banks of the lake and many other nice eating and drinking establishments just across the street.

I saw the turtle!!!. On our first evening in Hanoi we took a leisurely stroll around the lake, partially because that meant we didn't have to endanger our lives crossing roads infested with motor bikes. It was a great walk, people watching and just taking in the calm view of the lake, but mostly trying to spot the turtle! No luck.The next day we spent a nice time by the lake with the Hanoi Kids. Great discussions were had, and much was learned of the lake and Vietnamese history, all the while keeping an eye out for the turtle. No luck.Last morning in Hanoi. I decide to go to the lake to watch the morning Tai Chi. Really great, all the while keeping one eye open for the ancient and venerable turtle. No luck.Feeling hungry, as it was now breakfast time, I sat myself at an outside table in a café right beside the lake and ordered one of those great Vietnamese iced coffees.I took my first sip, all the time gazing at the water, hoping for a glimpse of the venerable, old one.Oh, my God! There he was, raising his wrinkly old head, momentarily, casually, above the surface, for a gulp of air and then disappearing in one big ripple.I cried out. No-one seemed to care. I did. I saw the turtle!

Cooling, and great people watching. At different time of the day, you see this differently. In the morning, you see people rushing to work, elderly people exercising.In the afternoon, you see students playing after they finished their schools.In the evening, you see tourist walking around and having dinner at the nearby restaurants.In the night, couples are facing the lake, planning their future together. It is a place you can see different Vietnamese people at different stages of their life.

An Oasis in the old quarter. This is a nice spot. There is a sort of exercise area on one side and on the other side they have the picturesque Ngoc Son Temple. We walked around in the evening as well as the day time. The temple is all lit up at night. A good place to take a walk.

My favourite place in Hanoi!. This is a great place to walk around and you'll probably find yourself walking around it without going out your way to do it anyway as it's right in the centre of Hanoi. Walking around here I always get young students approaching me asking to talk to me to practice their English. Being a tall Englishman I get a lot of attention from the young Vietnamese ladies too, which is nice. You can ask one of these students the history of the lake and they will happily tell you. Early morning (6am) is a great time to have a walk as many older people are around the lake lifting weights, playing badminton, dancing ( in front of Lenin statue) to music and Tai Chi. A beautiful lake surrounded by pretty gardens, architecture and the most friendly people in the world.

Always walk with the crowds - not against them. I naively thought that getting up early to walk around this lake would let me walk in solitude. Not a hope! It was crowded from before sunrise until well after. Still, it was a lovely walk if you are interested in people watching. Popular with couples, and the odd single who offers to be part of a couple with you!!! Walk, sit, do tai chi or just watch the passing crowds. A wonderful place.

Beautiful heart of the city. This lake is truly the heart of Hanoi. Locals and tourists alike walk, jog or bike endlessly around it. If you're an early riser, go up to the lake early in the morning to avoid the crowd and traffic noises. Best in a sunny day, it's a really a must in Hanoi (and also, it's impossible to miss)

Beautiful Lake. The Hoan Kiem Lake is near the centre of Hanoi. We were there at New Year time and it was beautifully decorated with very colourful lanterns in the trees all round the Lake which were reflected in the water at night. All round the lake there were lovely decorations in preparation for New Year. There is also a bridge across the Lake and at the other side there is a shop where you can purchase all sorts of gifts. People gathered all round the Lake in the evenings and also on New Year's Day and it was a really great, happy atmosphere. I would highly recommend a visit.

Against the Flow!. Here's my little bit of advice, for what it is worth! If you can sense the flow of people are predominantly walking in one direction ( from memory it seems most walk counter-clockwise) then go in the opposite direction and as you circumnavigate this picturesque little lake. As you go, stare at an absolutely intriguing array of character-dripping faces and then imagine the stories that each one of these could tell if you were able to stop them and talk. By all means try and strike up at least one conversation. If you succeed I am certain you will be richly rewarded. The only problem, at least in the early morning, is the determination of most people to complete their early morning fitness ritual- another legacy of the great man Uncle Ho! You might have to stand in their way or feign injury but it will be worth it!

A beautiful lake. My friends and I strolled along the lake watching the activities going by and relaxing. We got to learn more about Vietnamese culture from the activities happening near and around the lake. The lake is located near so many bazaars or shops they call. One nice tourist spot while in Hanoi

A peaceful place to get out of the sun. The lake takes about one half hour to walk around with two islands, one accessible by bridge. The Large trees surrounding the lake are a great place to stop for a time and enjoy. By night the lake shores are used for some group exercises and kids play their own version of 'hacky-sack', a feather with 5 plastic pieces at one end - kicked to those in the circle.
Little lake in the middle of chaos.. Central location ,must see. lovely cooling breeze in the afternoonThe world of the motor scooter and bikes buzzes round the perimeter.temple worth visit
Peaceful getaway. Calm lake with plenty of seats where you can sit and relax by the water. The red bridge that you see in may pictures can get crowded.

One of the best Hanoi sights. This lake is quite nice during day but it is at its best at night. Around 6 PM the Turtle Tower lights up and then the entire lake looks lovely. It is quite busy around the lake and quite noisy too but that's Hanoi. There is a temple on one of the sides but that's very busy too and not much to look at.

No Visit to Hanoi is Complete Without a Walk Around the Lake. I've been to Hanoi over a dozen times and a walk around Hoan Kiem Lake never fails to amuse me. At sunrise you can see people exercising or doing Tai Chi and at night you can see lovers enjoying the view, arm-in-arm. And in between, you can enjoy the views of the Hanoi skyline from various angles as you join the locals and tourists in relaxation. Lately, it's common for young Vietnamese to come here to practice English with visitors. (In fact, during my last visit, I was stopped so often it became almost tiresome.) There is a nice café at the NW corner of the lake that looks directly out over the water. The streets of the surrounding Old Quarter can be quite confusing, so the lake makes a great point of reference. I recommend making several visits at different times of the day, and always with a camera. Plan 30-45 minutes to go all around the lake depending on how often you stop and how fast you walk. There are fairly clean toilets on the east side of the lake for a small fee.

Peaceful and calm lake ~. I was told this is a love lake so seen quite a few couples sitting around the lake. But one will feel very calm and peaceful walking or just sitting around the lake while the surrounding traffic still buzz around it. Lots of cafe nearby the lake too. Overall, its a great place to walk around.

Very nice stroll around the lake. I guess it took almost an hour to stroll around the lake... It was very pretty surroundings with lovely flowers, overhanging trees & lilies in the lake. There were lots of places to sit & take in the pleasant view if you need more rest. A nice way to get away from the intensity of the old quarter but so close. Enjoyed this walk very much

tay ba lo. nb: you can no longer change travellers' chequesokay - the lake is nice and sometimes there are lights and maybe a wedding photo-shoot and restaurants with English menu but this is not all there is to hanoi. try a couple of hours in a residential area."tay ba lo" means "western backpacker". don't be one more robot. big, beautiful country and fairly safe - be brave!

Cool Lake. Good views, lots of tourist, lots of locals looking to practice english, interesting temple in the middle. This is one of the most famous in Hanoi and probably the one you see in many pictures with the red bridge. It is always crowded, not a big deal for me but just so you know. Great place for a walk around!

A little serenity in a sea of happy chaos. Hoan Kiem Lake is in central Hanoi &, whilst the traffic buzzes right around it, you feel like you are in a little oasis of calm. Little cafes abound as well as joggers & exercisers of all shapes & sizes.

Keep your eyes out for the tortoise!. A Hanoi landmark you must visit. The temple houses a stuffed tortoise that is one of the near extinct species that is still in the lake - one of Hanoi's most famous residents.

Worth a visit if you have some spare time. This lake is nothing special really but still worth seeing if you are nearby. there's a temple which you can visit here which is also worth a visit but not much time is needed to explore.

Check this out in the early morning.. What a wonderful place to watch a city wake up. The energy that is expended here daily, and the variety of exercises that are done here from Ti Chi to ballroom dancing need to be seen to be appreciated.

Nice relaxing spot in the middle of the city. This is a great lake to stroll around during the day or night. At night time there are certain areas that are lit up and look realy pretty. During the day it is nice to get away from all of the busy streets to walk around. On your way around you may stop and get your picture drawn or buy something from local sellers. Or just enjoy the walk.
The lake is so pleasant and beautiful. Its in the center of the old quarter which makes it perfect for navigating around this great part of town.

Beautiful lake in the Old Quarter. This beautiful lake that is located in the Old Quarter area, has its own legend. Close to the lake you will also find an old temple related to the legend of the Giant Turtle.
Very interesting. Very peaceful great for a morning stroll or evening. Lots of people around doing execrises. There's a restaurant and cafe on the side of the lake .

i go here every day!!. I'm vietnamese. I live and work near here. I often walk around the lake at the morning, see many people and enjoy the culture.
It is very nice and peace.

hanoi for drinkers. altho sight seeing is low on my priority list, a walk around this lake and a visit to the museum/temple, is worth doing. My enjoyment is more focused on meeting locals and other travelers, and i find this is easyest to do in bars and taverns. one i recommend in hanoi is the gecko bar. Good food, cheap bear and always populated.

Where the local meet up. It's just an ordinary lake where local spent their leisure time.If you are interest to know how the regular for local then this is the place.I came here on National day and it was jam packed with mostly local watching attraction on stage nearby lake at evening.

A great landmark. My sister and I headed routinely towards this as a landmark from which we started out to explore the surrounding areas. We felt like "locals" as this was obviously a popular place frequented by them as well, bustling with activity day and night. There were determined evening joggers running beside it (some in raincoats) even in the drizzle. Just one unhappy incident marred our memories of this quarter: At our next visit we will avoid at all costs the Phung Thien Club's so-called "Art Gallery" which charges exorbitant prices for artisanat items, at 79 Hang Trong Street. It's the last building, a lovely white structure, where Hang Thong Street meets Le Thai To, which runs along one side of the lake. $4 is charged for a lacquered coconut husk bowl which one finds sold at many lacquer merchandise shops for $2.50. An easy mistake is not to wait and look round more instead of assuming that an art gallery wouldn't overcharge by over 50%. When confronted with the discrepancy, the owner's blase attitude was that customers should check before buying - they purchase items there at their own risk. So be warned!

One of my favourite traveling point in Hanoi. A attractive story in this lake, you can watch show about the restored sword in the theatre where near lake. On the other hand, you need to walk around the lake to see the nice view. It just take you 20 minutes. You will see the vietnamese's life. Some younger lovers are dating. Some friends are cheating. Some elderly are playing with their grand son. Some couple are taking the pre wedding photos. Beside the peaceful life, you also can feel the busiest picture that many motorcycles on the road. It's the signature of the Vietnam.Don't forget go to the top floor coffee shop near the lake to enjoy the nice view in there. It is easy to find the coffee shops near the lake and the price of the menu is acceptable. Around 10 US dollars, you can get the drink and some snack like nacho or pizza. (I went the coffee shop call “i-feel coffee”, they provide the free wifi as well) Finally, you can go to shopping on the street. They sell so many handicrafts such as bag, wallace , chopsticks..Remember to bargain the lower price. I feel surprise you can found some gallery shop in there. The pictures was so beautiful. Please be reminded that you need to take care you belonging carefully. Because there are quite a lot of thiefs near by you.
Hoan Kiem Lake. A pleasant lake in the middle of the city. Hookers and hawkers can be a bit of a nuisance but it's a good spot for photo opportunities.

My favourite place!. Over my two weeks of wandering and absorbing the mayhem that is Hanoi, I often found my way back to the lake. It is a place to rest among the buzz of ceaseless traffic and just take a breath while figuring out what amazing Vietnamese dish to try next! I loved just sitting by the lake and walked around it so many times. A very pretty place with a quirky turtle story. Don't forget to go over the bridge and check out the history of the turtle.

Great place to explore. At first glance you think you have seen it all but soon find there's more surrounding this place then just a great walkway and park. Off in any direction are so many shops and lovely people I ended up going back at least half a dozen times. With wonderful food and the time to sit and laugh with the locals it is a great memory for me. Night markets just up the street on the weekends are a buzz of people and sites that bring a smile to your face. Hope this helps you enjoy your trip and take the time to sit and talk. Even if you don't understand their language these where some of the funniest times and best laughs with respect I had.Cheers to you all and hope you enjoy Vietnam and it's People,Bill

See it early morning. The lake is central to most of the tourist spots in Hanoi. It's nice to take the time to walk around it at any time of the day, however early morning is by far the best. The Hanoi locals (of all ages and athletic abilities) are up early to exercise at various locales around the lake. From running and walking to Tai Chi and many other moves. I always take the time to visit the lake.

Scenic. Beautiful place to sit and watch the locals go by. The university students are sent over to hunt out people to practise there English with. Our family spent time speaking to young locals which we enjoyed as we learned as much from them as they did from us!

Good to Catch a Break. At first glance it's a lake in the centre of Hanoi. Pause and you will see locals doing the weekly wash, friends catching up and visitors catching a break away from the rush of the street.A crossroads between new and old, top end of town and the old locals, see how the people and activities change during the days.
Worth a stroll. Definitely worth a stroll around especially at night when the buildings are lit up - look out for the turtle which is supposed to be lucky and the small temple is interesting...
Great photographic opportunities. The lake and temple Island resonate with cultural history. Look out for the playfull cat who lives on the temple roof.

Central of Hanoi. If you visit Hanoi, don't miss this place to sightseeing or discover street food of vietnam. I often drink coffee with my friends at weekend here or go around with my honey after dinner

perfect for a break. as you are in Ha Noi, it is a must see attraction. i would suggest you get few time to understand the legend behind, so you will be able to get why the lake is so important.as the Hilton is very close to the lake, i could enjoy the jogging at the lake, and that was a perfect location to see the city waking up and start getting busy... all of this with a great view.

Peacefull. I love this lake so much that everytime I come to Hanoi I have to go there and have a walk. I love the wind come from the lake and love to see how vietnamese ppl spent their lives here. It's like the heart of the City
Central park. Enjoy the views across the lake in the Old Quarter and have a peek at the big golden tortoise in a case in the temple.

Beautiful and Peaceful. This lake is an oasis of tranquility in a busy city. I found it a great place to get my bearings and to slow down and relax whilst in the middle of a hectic city. Its also a great place to people watch - where else do you see a young man teach a group of elderly citizens how to do hip-hop?

It's one of the landmarks. The lake is a must see, as it is located in the central. Nearby is a big shopping center, with gallery and the Old quarter. Great place for a run in the early morning or late afternoon. Remember unless you are visiting at 11 pm, this place is very busy.With a better view after a long walk, you can visit the coffee shop on top floor of the big building next to the fountain and the Old Quarter. It called "ham ca map" which mean "the shark's jaw".

Unique and peaceful place in the middle of a busy city. Well, after several hard tours around the country, I found this place a very nice place to enjoy a slow life with some coffee, ice cream ... and think about Vietnam people.

Great place to relax, and it's free. Great place to relax after a long day. We did nothing there, just walk around the lake and watch other people. It is clean, although rather crowded on Saturday afternoon. Food/drinks are always available nearby for purchase. And the walk itself is free.

Easy walk and welcome shade. Walking around the lake was like an oasis in the midst of busy Hanoi. Came across wedding parties and groups of women exercising. Toilets were clean Asian style and cost a minimum amount.

Huge lake, lovely surrounds, serene. This huge lake had paths going all around it, so was great to walk around and see everything. There's a couple of temples in the lake itself. One has a lovely red bridge to take visitors over (with a fee), the other I don't think you could get to. Beautiful big old trees stood guard over the lake, and lots of small fish gathered at the lake's edge to be fed scraps. There were plenty of places for people to sit, pray, paint, play cards etc. Lots of people exercised there too, jogging around the lake. If this was near to my home, I'd spend a lot of time there. We went back at night to see it lit up - also beautiful.

Must see when in Hanoi. When in Hanoi make sure you take a stroll around Hoan Kiem Lake. There is a temple on the lake which is beautiful and worth a visit. The lake gives you a bit of a rest from the chaos of Hanoi traffic.

Nothing Special. I feel it was nothing special because it was like any other temples, but smaller in scale. Maybe because I was not with any tour guide to know more about the history. But I was impressed with the front garden facing the lake, it was serene.
Beautiful Lake!. The Hoan Kiem Lake is very beautiful and it is just a few blocks away from Old District. Sit there and watch the beautiful scenery then continue your journey in exploring Hanoi.

Pleasant to walk around. The lake was only a few minutes walk from the hotel and pleasant to walk around. It's not a big city park (like the Sydney Botannical Gardens for instance) so it the path is still bounded by busy roads and the constant background noise of the motorbikes. It is pleasant though to look out over the water or to walk along and people watch. Keep an eye out for couples posing for wedding photos or for the historic stone arch that contained the only graffiti I saw in Vietnam (and of the 'X loves Y forever' variety).There are quite few hawkers but you may find it useful to pick up a fan cheaply; it can get pretty hot!

Pretty peaceful lake. There is some landscaping around this lake that makes it a lovely place to have a rest. With the hustle and bustle of Hanoi literaly at your back, you can look out across the lake and just take some peaceful time out. The large trees provide shade from the heat of the day and it is the only place in Hanoi where we weren't continually asked to buy something. There is pride in Hanoi and its people and you can feel it here.

Great place for a stroll or to sit and relax. It's peaceful to sit under the trees looking over the water, or to admire the orchids in the gardens. Lots of people-watching opportunities too, with Vietnamese using the area for exercise or as a backdrop for wedding photos. We were approached by two University students who wanted to practice their English, good for us too as we learned about their lives. Yes, plenty of street sellers but they generally leave if you say 'no thank you' - can be a bit annoying but it's still a great place to see.
Beautiful but a real tourist trap. Lovely to walk around and very pretty. My only complaint was being constantly pestered every few metres ( not aggressively ) with people trying to sell us stuff.

Time out at the lake. We loved strolling or jogging around the piece of water, situated a very short walk from our hotel. Locals abound here and are engaging and friendly. Perfect form of relaxation in a very busy city.

I go here many times each week!. What a relaxing place! During the day, you can sit all around this lake and just relax. What I like even more is that, as an older woman who does not sleep until 5 am, I can go there to "people watch" as well as to watch the rats scurrying about and to listen to the fish splash in the water in the middle of the night because crime is extremely low here. You meet people at any hour. Some will join me on the bench and, learning that I am an American living in Ha Noi, will want to desperately practice their English. I give them mini-lessons that are helpful to furthering their direction, study and efforts. Seeing people dance the tango and other ballroom dances on their day off or during their 2-hour daily break to a portable player is so fun to watch as well. Many things happen here and, yes, there is an "attended" row of toilets on the "temple" side of the lake, going away from the temple and the Old Quarter.

Lake of the Restored Sword - Hoan Kiem Lake. This lake that is situated between the Old Quarter and the French Quarter of Hanoi is the heart of recreational and social activities in Hanoi. In the early monrings and evenings till late, this lake is teeming with people. Particularly so during the weekends and public holidays.The name of the lake comes from a legend in which the King's magic sword was grabbed by a turtle and disappeared into the lake. The story has it that the sword was reclaimed by the Golden Turtle God. The sword was given to the king in order that he revolted against the Chinese Ming Dynasty. The lake thus got its name and a small shrine on the island in the lake is to commemorate the event. It is called the turtle tower.There is an indeterminate number of soft-shelled turtles still living in the water of the lake. These turtles are deemed endangered.The temple of Jade Mountain sits on an island at the northern part of the lake. It honours a hero, Tran Hung Dao, Van Xuong and Nguyen Van Sieu (scholar, Confucian master and writer respectively) who fought against the Yuan Dynasty. This island is joined to the shore by the Morning Sunlight Bridge.With the setting sun in the evening, it is a very nice walk around the entire circumference of the lake of approximately 2-2.5 km. Along the walk you'd find people, young and old doing their exercises. There is even an outdoor gym area, presumably with equipment put there by the gym enthusiasts themselves. They seem self-organized. These Vietnamese seem to be very much into fitness and healthy lifestyles. Parents with their young children playing, lovers whispering sweet nothings and in embrace. Older folks doing tai-chi. All these are part of the tapestry of life in Hoan Kiem Lake.End the walk at the northern end or the southern end and you'd find cafes and restaurants on the opposite side of the streets that go round the lake. At the northern end is the Old Quarter, where there numerous grid-patterned streets host large numbers of eateries and shops selling all kinds of goods, from trinkets and souvenirs, to hardware and electronics.

A little bit of peace and quiet in the centre of town. I just love this lake. It is gorgeous. It is restoring for the soul. We wandered around it virtually daily. You will see groups of people exercising day and night (I particularly enjoyed the group of middle aged people exercising to a little radio). You will see joggers at all times of the day and night, young teens talking, men playing card games. It is strangely noisy and busy, yet peaceful and relaxing. (I saw no tortoises...but loved the pagoda)

Enjoy a chat with the locals around the lake. Other than in the Old Quarter I found the lake more of a locals spot than a tourist spot. Many students come here to improve their English and in return you get a view on what the Vietnamese dream about and what drives them in life...

Enjoyable walk and good place to escape from the busy streets. We enjoyed our stroll round the Lake and the Ngoc Son Temple in the middle. The Turtle Tower is impressive from the distant views offered by walking around the lake. We visited the temple on the lake and that was ok. This offers a nice scenic and relatively calming stroll as Hanoi can be quite overpowering with it's busy streets. It's almost as if you can walk out of the city for a brief time which is an impressive feature in the middle of a city. Very good.

Tranquility (sort of) in the Center of the Old Quarter, Vietnam. This little lake has a 1,000 year history. It is small, and you should be able to walk the circumference in 1/2 hour. But take time to look around you, toward the Turtle Tower in the center, the temple that you can visit, and the city surrounding you.Sit on a bench and relax. If you've been walking through the traffic in central Hanoi, you'll need a breather. Filter the traffic noise out and you'll find the tranquility that carries so much history.Be sure you read in your guidebook about this site, or ask someone who knows the area to explain it.
Nice walk. Nice gardens surround the lake making for a pleasent walk around with plenty of coffee shops on the other side of the road

A must-see in Hanoi. We were staying in the Old Quarter and found ourselves constantly drawn to the lake, at all times of the day. After getting off an overnight train at 5am, it was a great place to see dawn break, together with the morning exercise ritual for hundreds, maybe thousands of Hanoians. A bit later and they were still doing Tai Chi, walking, jogging, doing aerobics! And the lake with its temples, trees and vistas is a photographer's paradise - all for free!
Red Bridge. Go check out the red bridge and visit the turtle in the temple. Its a small temple and only costs $1 for entry.

beautiful! don't be afraid to wander off and shop. Beautiful way to exercise and see many locals. Just a few blocks walk from the hotel.We found spectacular artists nearby and bought several paintings for amazing value. We weren't adventurous enough to eat the street-cooked food. Lots of pigs, chickens grilled everywhere.All the people we met were friendly.

Nice quiet walk around the lake. This is a free attraction. A nice place to take a walk in the early morning or late evening. There are also many locals selling all sorts of things, food and drinks around the lake. Easy to access by foot or local transport.

If you like local folklore and a pleasant walk. Lovely lake to walk around in the morning or evening. Local Vietnamese doing their exercises, a temple that you cross a lovely bridge to get to sits on an island in the lake (20000VND entrance fee $1AU) and is very peaceful and is still used for worship everyday. The story of the lake is folklore and you can read the story when in the temple.A nice place to visit when in Hanoi there are various restaurants and cafes placed around the lake to suit all budgets.Certainly take some time out for a walk around this lovely lake and park in the middle of busy Hanoi.
Pretty. Situated close to the old town, this is a pretty lake to walk around, lots going on around it at night.

nice place to walk. the bridge and entrance is very old and nice. Lots of incents are burning all the time. Incents are lit to pray for loved ones. They burn for a while to have the prayer heard by the gods to help the prayer come true.
Lovely. Really nice lake to stroll round to get a bit of calm from the chaos of the city. The temple is really lovely and wasn't too busy when we visited.

Pleasant place, temple is disappointing. The lake is a lovely setting, and is a great place for a relaxing stroll. The temple within the lake is interesting from the outside, but is a little disappointing inside.
A pleasant stroll. Open space in an otherwise crowded city. Green, pleasant. Take a bottle of water with you or buy one from one of the many vendors.

Hanoi spot. If you wish to see people's life in Hanoi, then you should come around this lake. There are many people around and they kind of relax at the river side. Busy street around the river especially the afternoon time (~15.00-19.00)
Hoan Kiem Lake. Disappointed, only redeeming feature was walking over the red bridge. Nothing much to see once you crossed the bridge.

Popular with locals. A nice place for a stroll in a peaceful setting in the heart of this busy city, GREAT on a sunny day.
Plenty of restaurants to get food and drink nearby after your walk.
Nice walk.... There are a few things to see around the lake. Get something to drink at Highlands Coffee (not just coffee!) & take a stroll!

Beautiful , But with a lot happening around. This lake is sensational.Much used by locals and tourist.Surronded by resturants, shopping and the markets.Unfortunately the owners of the stalls are arrogant and have a could not care attitude.I found this to be in sharp contrast to the businesses in Nha Trang, Saigon and Hoi An.THE STALLS HERE ASK A RIDICULOUS PRICE AND WHEN YOU COUNTER WITH A SMILE.,they just cut you "cutting their noses to spite their faces"I just do not get it

Interesting. Very crowded but its interesting to see local life and custom.Entrance fee is very minimal. Dressing code is not that strict but as a sign of respect I believe one should dress appropriately as you would be visiting a place of worship.
Simple yet beautiful. Get here for sunset and be prepared to be blown away. It's genuinely one of the prettiest places in the city (and really rather romantic!)

Hoan kiem lake, Hanoi. amazing peaceful lake in Hanoi. U just go there and sit on bench and ur mind will be free from all the stress. Specially in morning u can see ppl dancing on some local music. I was shocked to see i lady of age around 70+ there actively dancing on the music.Must go in Hanoi :)

Nice oasis from the busy streets but nothing too spectacular. I was very happy to get to the lake because it was shady, quiet(er), and less busy than the crazy streets of Hanoi. That being said, it's just a small lake... nothing too exciting. There is a small temple on a little island in the lake - I wouldn't bother with it though. If you're feeling overwhelmed by Hanoi, it's worth taking a break and strolling around the lake but, if not, you're not missing anything by skipping it.

Relaxing morning. A really nice area of Hanoi with some nice coffee shops and eateries. There are a number of vendors trying to sell you various items and this can be a little off putting, but if you are polite they usually leave you to it. The walk over the bridge and around the island was nice with plenty to see, another place to escape the traffic madness. It is not expensive with the entrance fee set at 20,000 dong. Allow a good two hours to relax and enjoy especially if the weather is hot.

Peace amongst the hustle and bustle. A pleasant place to go for a walk, as said in other reviews you meet students practising their English and people exercising and getting their daily ice cream fix. The lake is full of fish and turtles. Easy walk from the old quarter and close to restaurant, and banks

beautiful lights. Such a lovely little discovery we just landed in Hanoi and decided to take a evening walk and came across this lovely lake with people exercising and walking and chatting. We sat down and within half hour we had many university students coming up and practicing their english. Was such a lovely introduction into the North they shared so much and to our suprise very good english.
Heart of Hanoi. Beside busy Hanoi, you can see some quiet, green Hanois and you can see it here at the lake! For me if you never been here that means you've never been to Hanoi!
Beautiful location. Beautiful lake, and gentle walk was relaxing and cooling in the heat of the day. It made a vey nice break in the day in the city.

A very nice place to walk and relax.. This is a surprisingly relaxing place in the crazily busy and bustling Hanoi. Walk along the lake and across the Huc bridge, admire the Turtle tower. Visit the Jade island with the Temple of the Jade Mountain. Lots of photo opportunities and you can do your Hanoi people watching - both tourists and Hanoi natives.
Hoan Kiem Lake. Very beautiful, and peaceful in the extraordinary bustle of Hanoi. Nothing to dislike. Many trees, and interesting to see so many local people out exercising.

peace and tranquility among the madness of the traffic. I visit the lake since 1995 and i am never tired of it, especially the restaurant where spring rolls gelata and Heineken beer have not changed. it is an iconic place and it is beautiful.it is also a peaceful spot where Hanoi residents practice Tai Chi in the early hours of the morning. the contrast between the peacefulness of the lake and the insane traffic around it is amazing (my favorite spot in Hanoi)

pity about the water quality. The lake is a central show piece in the old quarter. At night litand romantic, with young couples strolling and sitting. We understand that run off from the streets empties into the lake.after rain, the water is quite turbid. (can the legendary tortoises survive?). A few dollars spent on filtration could save the day.
Cool spot. It's just an average lake, but it is pretty and it's a great place to stroll or sit under a tree to escape the overwhelming heat of Hanoi.

Nice place..... Nice place to just sit down and relax..
You can see all folks of people came here in the evening to exersice, walk with family members, dating, chill around..

Place to Hang out on the Weekend. The breeze off the water was fantastic. Walking along pathways shaded by avenues of trees was just perfect. Just perfect for a Sunday morning. The rest of Hanoi was out: parents with young children; old folk taking the breeze on a comfortable bench; lovers sorting out life's vicissitudes; groups of young lads being noisy; gaggles of pre-teen girls being noisier; people taking photos of each other and us taking photos of everyone else taking photos. Such fun! People were friendly, we all smiled at each other. Nothing was for sale; nobody wanted us to buy anything. We came across people we would not be likely to ever meet and we shared moments in passing. As legend has it the lake has some tortoise stories attached to it, and a magic sword. There are two islands in the lake, one has a Tortoise Tower and the other has a Temple.The Tortoise it is said took back the magic sword from the King Le Thai To in the 15th Century after he defeated the Chinese.
