The Temple on the other island is 20th Century vintage and represents: military spirit; medicine; and, literature. Needless to say we got some fantastic photos of ordinary citizens of Hanoi enjoying their Sunday.
Lots of fun. go early morning when everyone is exercising. We westerners can learn alot of what these people do to keep their bodies fit. No gym fees here

Just ok.. Hoan Kim Lake was ok. Unfortunately, there wasn't enough information about it. We crossed the bridge to see the temple, and at the gate there was an officer that asked for ticket. We asked where do we can get the ticket? He wasn't speak English but he seemed to understand what we asked and he pointed to the other side of the bridge, so we needed to go back to buy the entrance ticket.Inside the temple, we can see people play some kind of chess, there were also people who pray.Around the lake we can see people who do sports or just hang out with friends.

Central Hub. This is definately the focal point of Hanoi. Get there early and by that I mean before 6am to see hundreds if not thousands of people exercising - some with fans some to music - with many more doing circuits of the lake. During the day there are many tourists from all walks of life taking in the view and using the lake paths as a cross over point from one part of the city to another. In the evening there are many couples and familys walking round taking in the view plus the odd exercising nut as well. Try and not see it ;)

So beautiful in Spring time. As for me, In Spring, I really like to come to Hoan Kiem lake to drink a coffee beside, to enjoy sigh seeing, seeing people going along. The weather in Spring is not hot, not cold so that we could walk around the lake for some times. There is Ngọc Son temple in the middle of the lake with a nice red bridge over where we can see a very big turtle and from here, you can easier take picture of turtle tower. From here, we can take a short tour by electricity taxi ( about 1 usd) to go around the Hanoi Old quarter and Hoan Kiem lake. We can enjoy ice cream at Trang Tien street ( the most famous in Vietnam) or see water puppet show at Thang Long Water puppet theatre.

Didn't See The Turtle.... Great place to hang out...there is a small island with a shrine and tells the legend of the ' resident giant turtle ' ( has a stone turtle )..cost is minor...30,000VND ( about $1.50 ). Walk around the lake, bargain for souvenirs, postcards, stop for coffee, lunch or ice cream. Good for photos and people watching

Great for a stroll. Pity it was raining when we went for a walk around the lake but it didn't hinder us - great place for photos and to wander. Recommend this is on everyone's list when visiting Hanoi.

walk around it. If you walk around at sunset you will experience it in day and night - and get lots of exercise and you will find Vietnamese that will approach you to practice their English. I ended up having dinner with them - was great - meet the locals.

lots to see and eat. going for a walk around the lake it is easy to get distracted by the sights of the city. There is always food everywhere and vendors selling anything from backpacks to paintings. spending a day exploring around the lake is so easy

Biggest lake in Hanoi. Inevitably you will walk around this lake. It is a refreshing walk, such a big lake right inside Hanoi. You can visit a pagoda inside the lake or simply walk around it and check all the motion. Also nearby you have the famous water puppets show.Do not over plan, you will certainly have to walk next to the lake to get to some other local attraction.

Worth walking round. Bit disappointing considering this is the main city lake. Ngoc Son Temple worth a visit. Walking round the lake takes you into the various different areas - Old quarter, French quarter, etc which are very different. Artists drawing portraits, families out for walks, kids 'fishing', nice for people watching and gives a bit of a breather from the traffic surrounding it.

Nice way to spend a couple of hours. We enjoyed a nice walk around the lake which wasn't far from our hotel. There are two temples in the middle, one of which you can get to. It is 20,000 VND to enter and is very small but worth a look

Hoan Kiem Lake area. Changed in 15 years from a rather quiet area with some government buildings and a few restaurants to an busy area with a lot of shops. Still the view over the lake and the temple in the lake is still great. Try to find the turtle. A few years ago there has been a large operation to save the turtle and there was even a special turtle hospital where the turtle was checked on its health.Best view from the restaurants in the City View building.

Beautiful lake to walk around. I loved walking around this lake every morning! In the morning many locals were exercising. In the evening the lake became more vibrant and was beautiful with lights lighting up the trees and water. It's a beautiful place in the midst of the bustling city.

Visit the temple across the red bridge. Visit the temple across the red bridge or just relax on the terrace of a cafe and drink it all in. In the evening there are often musicians and singers performing around the lake, not to mention the all the locals taking the evening air.
Wonderful spot. A small lake right next to the old district of Hanoi. Really worth a slow walk around to enjoy its beauty and peacefulness in the middle of this busy city

day and night you'll enjoy it. very busy surroundings by day, very romantic at night, a stroll along the lake was on our list everyday while enjoying our favorite taro ice cream, we saw a lot of young wedding couples having their pre-wedding photo session. so romantic

Take your foot off the pedal. Grab some coffee, find a seat, start people watching. Around late afternoon, the locals flock into this area for many reasons. Fishing, catching up with friends, walking their dogs, jogging, or simply just sitting there to wind down.If you're not too tired to walk around, you might be able to spot the open air gym by the lake. Watch the locals, young and old, sweat it out on traditional gym equipments.Overall, this is the place to just slow down and relax yourself

If only.... Hands down the best time to come here is early morning. Before 7am. It really left me with a sense of longing. Thousands of people jogging, stretching, dancing and getting prepared for the day ahead. You can really feel the sense of unity here which I find is lacking back in the uk. Its more than just a lake with a temple. Its tranquil waters and surroundings bring calm, and are a key element of everyday life in Hanoi. Peace before the storm.
Red Bridge. Interesting! Lots of tourists out on Sunday. Early mornin good time to go - you would get a great photo with red reflections in water
Beautiful and calm area. A lovely place to stroll or just sit at any time of the day or night - and right in the centre of the city.
Quiet spot in the midst of traffic. Always seemed to find my way back here - to watch the people, to have an ice cream, to just sit and catch breath, to meet friends and absorb the sounds of Hanoi.

Great for people watching and strolling. Duration: - 30 minutes to 1 hourWhat to see: - People watching- turtle tower (Tháp Rùa)- giant turtle & soft shell turtles (if you are lucky) - templeTHE lake in Hanoi, it is worth a visit as you can learn about Vietnamese lifestyle here. Many local people spend their time exercising by the lake... day or night. There are many makeshift drinks stalls in the evening where the local people spend time chatting and drinking while seating on tiny stools. Most stalls only have a kettle, cups, stools and voila... they are in the business!! There are many shops and hotels nearby. Legend has it that 15th-century legendary Emperor Le Loi drove out invading Chinese with a magical sword which was given to him by Kim Qui, the Golden Turtle god. He later returned the sword to the turtle. It is an important piece of story to know before you watch the water puppet show. You will know what I mean when you get there. :) Enjoy!

Great Lake. The lake is a lovely place to visit away from the old quarter hussle and bussle . A great walk around and great photo shoot on the red bridge plus visit the temple or the bridge for a small fee. Also there are lots of stops to get a ice cream drink or something to eat at the restaurant

Down at the lake...... A stunningly beautiful part of the city, bringing the old quarter and the relatively new business end of Vietnam together, centred around Hoan kiem Lake. Take time to mingle with the locals here, they just love to talk to you, especially if you're from the west, at lunch time every day, the workers take time out to sit at the lake, and enjoy their break in its breathtaking surroundings. There are turtles in the lake,a nd it is considered lucky to spot one........no such luck for me on this visit.

a perfect setting in the heart of the city. Hoan Kiem Lake is a wonderful place to stroll around, or just sit and watch the world go by. Enjoy the beauty of the lake along with all the locals who use this wonderful area for all sorts of recreational activities.

Nice Oasis in a Bustling City!. The lake became a point of reference when we navigated our way around Hanoi! Beware of the hawkers!Also an interesting place to walk around at night, we saw ladies doing aerobics with seemingly no instructor just music, what appeared to be a singing competition and of course numerous scooters whizzing around the lake with the whole family on board.Like all cities a hive of activity, just nice to have the lake as the backdrop.

Central Part of Hanoi. If you want to see some of the culture in Hanoi, this is a great place to do so as people are out and about all day around this lake. In the mornings people exercise (tai chi, fans, weights, badminton, etc.) and in the afternoons couples hang out and watch the lake and talk. Also, there is a lot to see around the lake: the water puppet theatre, the book stores, Bao Kahn lane, etc. Definitely a great place to people watch, relax, drink coffee, etc.
The Lake. When you have the need to get away from the rush , a stroll by the lake peaceful but always enlightening .

Restoration missing. This historic site has a lot of potential as a tourist site. Unfortunately, it looks neglected, unmanaged and indifferent to the legend and history that it represents. What a shame!

nice place to spend the afternoon. Love the place especially in the evening before sunset when the weather is cooler. I love sitting there as the sun is going down and see how the local people enjoy the place for jogging, working out, hanging out, or just reading a book on a bench.

Nice bridge and cool place to hang out. The red bridge to the temple was a nice touch to the overall look of the place. The lake is peaceful and a good place to rest and enjoy the peacefulness of the lake amidst the chaos happening on the streets. Great place to have a hot drink or just any kind of drink actually.

In the day time it is crowded with tourists. The lake is in the centre of the shopping area, and prices get more expensive the closer you get to the lake. In the day time it is crowded with tourists and street sellers. There is a budhist temple in the middle of the lake, and you can pay a small fee to go over the bridge and visit.

A pleasant stroll. There are two islands in the lake. The one in the middle is tiny and you may recognise its delightful (inaccessible)Tortoise Pagoda as an iconic landmark of Hanoi. The other, nearer the Old Quarter, houses Ngoc Son temple, immediately recognisable by its red wooden bridge, framed by weeping willow trees (or similar). You will not have to pay to approach or cross the bridge for some excellent photo opportunities, but there is an entry fee to visit the temple itself. It is a pleasant stroll around the lake (try going anti clockwise beginning on Le Thai To Street)and keep your eyes open for the very old well maintained (and likely deserted) temple across the street, about half way along. The only rest room I remember is on this stretch of the walk however there are several cafes and food stalls - not so on the other side. The far end of the lake is a business district and as you round the end, and head back along Dinh Tien Hoang Street towards the Old Quarter, you will find the Post Office, and also some elegant colonial buildings and a square with a large statue and gardens. Locals frequent the shady lakeside area and I observed several courting couples sweetly holding hands and kissing. I'll bet that sort of thing wasn't allowed in the not too distant past.Ignore the overpriced tourist tat near Ngoc Son - you'll find it elsewhere. Just past Ngoc Son , back near the Old Quarter there is a large bus terminus however there is no shelter if it is raining, but there are some shady trees. If you are adventurous, jump on any bus here and see where it takes you, taking care to check where you will need to stand to catch a returning bus. The Water Puppet Theatre is just nearby and you will also spot a KFC, if you are hungering for western style fast food.

Fun to walk around in the morning or evening.. My wife and I rather enjoyed the bustling streets alongside the lake and also enjoyed seeing the city folks out in the morning exercising and playing badminton. Good times.
Nice gardens surround the lake. Nice gardens surround the lake making for a pleasent walk around with plenty of coffee shops on the other side of the road

Must - see place. Of course, you have to be here when you come to Hanoi.While learning about history of Vietnam, you may enjoy the local's life. If you stay near Hoan Kiem Lake, you should wake up a little bit early, around 6 a.m and come. A lots of people walking, running and dancing around the lake every morning.It is the most impressive thing, with the beauty of the lake in the dawn.

A symbol of Hanoi. Sword Lake is one of wonderful parts in Hanoi. Around Hoan Kiem Lake, people can enjoy peace atmosphere between busy street. As a legend story, the king had to restore sword to turtle lord. The evidence still alives is that there has a gaint turtle living in Sword Lake. Being one of the beauty of Hanoi, Hoan Kiem lake has inside Ngoc Son temple, The Huc Bridge which stand in hundred years of history. People now are going to sword lake to have fresh air, take awesome pictures. Each of them has different feelings there and they love it all.

Walk around in the AM. Like several others have said, this is a great place to walk around in the AM. Go get some coffee from one of the surrounding coffee shops and take a stroll around the lake in the AM. You'll see locals running, doing "work out classes" (not real sure what you would call it other than maybe "aerobic dance"), and just enjoying the cool mornings.
a Very nice lake in the heart of the city. a very nice view of Lake in the heart of the city, which is surrounding with garden and some stores closed by is absolutely excellent combinaion
Nice promenade, nice temple. Good starting point to start visiting Hanoi. Nice promenade, with a temple (the golden turtle) in it. Entry = 20 000VN. Nice view.

Must see. This area it's very close to the Old Quarter and it deserves a look. You can walk around that. It's specially interesting on the sunrise or sunset because there are lots of locals doing exercise around which is part of the Vietnamese culture.
There are also a temple but you have to pay a fee to visit (student ID discount).
A good walk. Big lake in the middle of hanoi and so much happening around it. See the world go by twenty times a second
Beautiful and hectic. The lake is beautiful, although it gets crowded during daytime.The best time to go is early in the morning.
Hoan Kiem Lake. We stayed in the Old Quarter so we walked to and around the lake, ate dinner here twice and it was also part of a one day Hanoi tour. We really love this lake and surrounding area.

Very popular evening walk place. It was pleasant to walk around the lake in the evening after sundown. Many fun activities seem to happen every evening. That is partly that people want to enjoy warm evening after the strong sun is down. Observed both locals and tourists were having fun as I enjoyed myself. It is a Must place!!
Quiet place!. Important here: watch out for pickpockets and for the traffic! In the morning citizens do Tai Chi in the small parc of this lake. Beautiful view in this very busy but friendly city

Walk rest enjoy. A lovely place to walk around or sit and enjoy the ambience. Lots of activity - walkers runners dog walkers sitters. And if you look friendly local students will ask you for help with their English You can then branch off to the old quarter, down to the Viacom centre, or to the opera and a drink at the metropol. If you aren't staying nearby, worth the trip.Plus the temple at the top end
Nice little walk. Nice place to take a stroll and pictures! Only takes a few minutes to walk around. Its just south of the shopping district too; convenient location.

Oasis in the middle of a hectic city. The lake is a beautiful place to walk around early morning or during the evening. In the morning it's full of people ballroom dancing, exercising, doing tai chi and generally being active. In the night, couples sit on the lakes edge holding hands and enjoying the scenery. Definitely a must see.

Centre of Hanoi. Everyone must visit the lake, recommend to go round once to see different part of Hanoi. The electric car (starting point near the water puppet theatre) is worth a go, it takes you round for 45 minutes, which is good for first time visitor to get an overview of the Hoan Kiem area. Good photo points around the lake.
A nice relaxing walk. Traffic in Vietnam is a dislike and you can almost get away from it around the lake. Area to rest on way to the markets.
Beautiful lake. Great to do your morning or evening walk around and see what the locals do ... Thai Chi ect or just sit in the shade and watch the passing parade

Best place to beat the heat in Hanoi. June in Hanoi could get extremely hot and humid. The Hoan Kiem Lake is the best place to just stroll either by walking or by taking the cyclo. There are many cafes and shopping areas in and around Hoan Kiem. There is also a boat ride that one could take in the lake.
Interesting story. The people of Hanoi believe this lake is sacred, it's small enough to walk around and to see the pretty gardens etc surrounding it

Great place to relax in busy Hanoi!. This lake is the place to get a bit away from the heat, go for great for a stroll, or you could sit and read. The lake is also a good spot to watch the locals, and check out a few of the bizarre and interesting monuments. There are also restaurants and ice cream for sale along the lake

An oasis. This is an oasis in the middle of chaos. What a great place to stroll and eat an ice cream. This is a fantastic place to people watch. Pull up a seat and while away the day or night. In fact early evening is when everyone comes out. Enjoy it's so friendly.
Can't beat a lake. Hey, it's a body of water in the centre of town, what's not to like? However, I'm forced to write more words, so I don't know, fancy a jog or some early morning Tai chi?

Walk around. You can't miss this one, he heart of town. Walk around is a must to see couples who take wedding pics, to see people do exercise, sit on a bench for a secret first hug, get ripped, walk in the shade of old trees and much more.

beautiful. such a beautiful lake, nice pergoda in the middle, and statues and gardens and paths around the lake make it the perfect spot for a picnic, grab an icecream or relax with a book in the cool of the shade. lots of food shops near by, and a running track .

Walk and relax here. If you walk around this lake, it's over 1,7km...
In the early morning and evening, you can see many local people go for walking, running, playing around the lake...you will see the locals activities there, some street foods...
Beside that you can see the Ngoc Son Temple...

This is a very beautiful area and should not be missed. The lake and its splendid pagodas was a great treat to visit as all the gardens were embellished with fresh flowering plants and the faithful thronged to the temples to make family offerings. This is a very beautiful area and should not be missed.
relaxing by Hoan Kiem Lake. Very picturesque! It's an oasis in the historical Old Qarter that comes with a great myth.. There is a preserved turtle on display in the Temple.

Activity Center of the Old Quarter. Hoan Kiem Lake seems to be the center of activity for the Old Quarter. It is a great place to stroll or sit. We met several university students who wanted to practice their English speaking. This was great fun and led to having several new Facebook friends.

A local gem. The lake was the perfect place to observe everyday life going on and was also a bustle of activity with locals walking and exercising, people painting portraits or selling trinkets and others eating ice cream around the lake.

A lake by any other name.... We spent a bit of time at Hoan Kiem Lake after returning from our Halong Bay tour. It was overcrowded and we were incessantly harassed by hawkers. Wouldn't have gone if we didn't have to kill time.
Easy and Leisurely Stroll. Nice to stroll around the lake in the morning. Nice setting and very relaxing. There's a small temple that you can visit for a small fee too.

Take the time to stroll. The lake is a wonderful place to people-watch and while there are tourists, it's also a central part of the city. We took in the view from restaurants at several spots around the lake on different days when we popped in for iced coffee...iced anything. Always fascinating.

great place for early morning strolling. I was amazed by the activity going on at 05.30 ,
Most invigorating to see the locals all doing some form of tai chi , physical exercise. and its the best time to stroll around this body of water, which during the day looses its appeal.
Serene beauty.
Slice of life. As much as the scenery is brilliant, this is a place where Hanoians come to see and be seen. Watch for the posers and those that come to watch them

not really on the must do list. There's a temple at the northern end of the lake which you can get to by crossing a small footbridge. Then there's a nominal charge for visiting the temple itself, which is OK, but not really on the must do list if you don't have the time.

A very picturesque lake and temple. This is a very nice place to visit as a daytime filler. I wouldn't travel here especially to see this attraction, but if you are in Hanoi its worth a look. The lake you can walk around in about 30 minutes and then you can pay to cross the lovely bridge to the island upon which is the temple and garden. I visited it whilst waiting to go and see the water puppets. The story behind the temple is a very important one to the people of Hanoi - I won't spoil it for you.

Heart of Old Hanoi. This is a lovely lake on the edge of Old Hanoi. It is very scenic and has 2 islands. One of them is linked to the land by a bridge and houses the Ngoc Son Temple (small charge). It is a lovely lake to walk around which takes 15 or a slow 30 minutes. Has a lakeside restaurant at one end and several cafe's at the other. It is well shaded most of the way around. Lots of Vietnamese can be seen exercising around the lake in the early morning and evening. A nice walk just before dinner.
nice to walk around. Nice to walk around the lake. Different scenery during day and night time. Worth exploring the small alleys for various snack (old icecream shops) and interesting shops.
Lovely serene lake in the middle of the city. It was quite hot when we were there, but the lake is lovely and we ate at a restaurant looking out over the lake.
Breathtaking. Right in the middle of the city, this lake is stunning and super sized. Good for a walk around the lake.

An icon, but a little gritty.. There is lots of life around the lake, and a good for a nice stroll. Try to go on the bridge to experience more of the story that represents this lake. The water is very slimy green which wasn't that attractive, but I guess that reflects the bustling activity that surrounds the lake. Looks magical at night, but the bridge is closed then.
A good walk around. Nice gardens surround the lake making for a pleasent walk around with plenty of coffee shops on the other side of the road
interesting heritage. great history- have a walk around the lake and it is useful to have a guide who can tell you all about this fascinating place, we did.

ok, but hard to see the attraction. the lake is polluted, the air is polluted, the surrounding traffic din is unpleasant, and the temple not all that impressive.it's a good introduction to hanoi if you are staying in the old city.lots of people watching as it gets to be later in the day. the lake was the first real encounter we had with hanoi traffic, and the first day we were hypnotized by the crowds of motorbikes surrounding the lake.if you get hot, there's a mall at one of the 4 corners surrounding the lake, and it is air conditioned. i saw no one shopping there and it's hard to figure out who thought a mall would be profitable at that particular spot. but it is cool!

Hmmm.... I realise there's a fuss because of the local legend and so on. And from a distance it is pretty and there are the old sites in it and on its edges. But it was just another water body with litter in places and throngs of people milling about and so close to the traffic that you don't get any sense of tranquility at all. I suppose I rather pity the locals who have this as one of their few choices of "green space".

Place not to miss. Its not just the view, the atmosphere, the typical local life around the lake, but its also historical/cultural place. Come join the group of people doing morning excercises around the lake. Visit the temple Ngoc Son, it gives you peaceful feeling, relaxing from the noisy streets outside.

Nice stroll around the lake.... We went during the day and at night, both were pleasant. Nice to sit and have a drink overlooking the water and just enjoy people watching. Could do without the persistent sellers but they need to make a living too, I bought another fan but negotiate because I paid 25% of what she was asking.

Good place for jogging. If you are keen to keep up your stamina and lose those extra fats you have built during your stay in Hanoi, go for jogging here. People start jogging from 5 am to 8 am and 4 pm to 7 pm. You don't even have to be shy to remove your t-shirt in case of severe perspiration. Local joggers confidently exercise with bare chest.
Get moving!. Get upealry and join the population exercising around the lake or for thwe night owls grab a coffee and people watch in this busy city.

The island in the lake contains a small museum. Plenty of coffee shops and eating places to relax. Avoid the hawkers - they can be a nuisance. Your excursion will be more enjoyable if you can read up about the history of the ancient kingdoms.

water in hoan kiem lake has become so murky. i did ever visit hoan kiam lake back in 2008-2009 when the water in the lake was impressively clear. well, on this trip, it was such a disappointment to see the water of the lake has become so murky.

Lovely oasis in a busy city. The lake has a nice park around the majority of it. While you can still see & hear the traffic it is still nice and peaceful compared to the city. We had a walk around the lake every evening and took along a drink & cake/fruit so we could have our desert looking at one of the pagodas. I would definitely recommend it as you can see a bit of local life and I'd also suggest stopping by in the afternoon to chat with the students who are looking to practice english. A free guide to where is good to visit/eat in the city and an insight into life for Uni students in HaNoi.

A relaxing way to spend an hour or two. A walk around the lake is a "must". You could spend hours doing so, stopping along the way for an ice cream, a bowl of pho, or just sitting and people watching. The island in the lake contains a small museum and craft shop featuring ethnic minorities' products .
Serene and relaxing. There is a small run down villa in the middle of the lake, kind of an interesting scene, can't figure out how it gets there

In the middle of the City. Also called the Turtle Lake.
Take a break from the Old quarter's busy-ness and take a relaxing walk at the lake or join a Tai chi group in the morning or just sit and enjoy a rest under a tree.
Read about the legend of the King and the Turtle.

Good place. Sword Lake itself is a beautiful lake as a lot of reviews said. Being located in a crowded city. The Vietnamese people choose this is an ideal place for doing exercise. The fresh air is available in the morning.

Bats Everywhere. Loved walking around at sunset and seeing all the bats flying around the street lights. Lots of benches to sit and watch the lake. Nice coffee shop on northwestern edge of lake. Another on the southwest corner. Good lightening. You will feel safe. Lots of people at all times. There is a temple on an island but you have to pay to cross the little bridge to go see it. I passed on that.Nice walk after the puppet show.
Hanoi's Hub. Hanoi's Hub, this is where the city comes to relax, hang out, jog, do tai chi, stroll, chat, have coffee in short Hanoi life all around the lake and what a perfect setting for it all.

Another sacred lake?. If it wasn't for all the cars, buses, motor bikes roaring around this lake 24/7 it might be a nice tranquil spot to rest and take a breath after your busy day of sight seeing.To sit and look at the lake is free BUT there is a small temple on an island which you pay to enter. It is home to a large "stuffed" turtle which apparently lived in the lake at some point in time. Given the condition of the water, (filthy) I am not surprised it died.
Pretty. We enjoyed our time at the Lake - very interesting for people watching and soaking up the chilled vibe of Hanoi. Be careful when crossing roads!!

Beautiful place. This is such a beautiful spot in the heart of the Old Quarter. While it's great for people watching you can feel away from the hustle and bustle and there are cute places to eat nearby with some great views.
Peace on the lake. Great spot to sit and relax in the busy centre of Hanoi. Café on side of lake a great place for iced coffee and sit to watch the busy life around lake and streets

People watching and exercise. We can sit and people watch for hours and the path around the lake provided many opportunities. At night the circumference is lit and the view of the the lights reflecting from the water (especially from above - try the restaurant at the Hanoi Elite for a good view) is terrific. Pity about the pollution.
Peace in the City. A great place to visit and contemplate Ha Noi. The Lake and its surrounds are a really peaceful setting in a very busy city.

A scenic and historic location. We walked around the lake early in the morning, about 6:30, to see hundreds of tai chi participants in several groups along our route. It was great to see the residents, mainly seniors, exercising and enjoying the morning. The evening view is also impressive. The lake borders the Old Quarter so it's location is perfect.
it's soso. This lake is not big, it takes you about 50 minutes to go around it. It seems the local people love it very much, it's very crowded at nights.

It's extremely enjoyable there!!!. I love its atmosphere there. In the early morning, Hoan Kiem Lake looks so bright with the breeze and fresh air and people going there is for chit chat and for wandering. It is so peaceful! Also I love going there in the night as it becomes splendid with colorful lights. If you have a chance going to Ha Noi, Hoan Kiem Lake is truly a must-go place.

Cool place to wander. It was nice to take a walk around the lake but also to just stop on one of the many park benches. Early mornings stunning watching people going about their daily exercise. The lake is a great place to use as a point to return to as you wander the streets.Take the time to stop and meet students practicing their English no matter how many times you get stopped.ANZ bank located next to lake.Water puppet show next to lake.
good place for relaxing in afternoon. good place to relax in afternoon, u can see many hanoi people sitting, chichat, work out, dating but sound of motorbike horning so anoying.

Great walking spot. Hoan Kiem Lake is a beautiful spot to walk around in the early morning or late afternoon. It's a great way to get a little exercise, and to see the different activities going on by the lake. Lots of benches and places to sit down and read, as well as a few cafes on the side. My experience sitting down on a bench is that I'm usually approached by young Vietnamese university students who want to practice English. I enjoy this opportunity to find out a little more about the life of young people in Hanoi, and have even made some friends this way! Sometimes touts will try to sell you travel books etc, but will go away if you say no without any hassle. Beautiful and relaxing space to walk around at the heart of the city.

Lovely Lake. Really enjoyed walking around this lake, it was a great base point for us around Hanoi. Loved seeing all the activities that happen here, it's just a great place to stop and have a rest and people watch.
Nice to go. Nice to go if you have nothing much to do in Hanoi. Interesting sights to see in terms of architecture, but if you've been traveling around Asia, especially SEA, its nothing special.
Beautiful Lake. We walked all the way around the park and over the little bridge and the park was lovely and peaceful...enjoyed the ambience
relaxing. I enjoyed watching the early risers jogging and exercising around the lake. Nice to sit in one of the lakeside cafes and enjoy and ice cream and watch the scene.

Beautiful walk and area. A gorgeous walk and visit. Great sight for pictures.
Very central, easy to find and great to use for your bearings
Very pleasant.. Plenty of seats throughout the gardens to have a rest and enjoy a break. Very lively on Sunday afternoon. You can buy a coffee or ice cream or have your portrait sketched.

Lake visits. Picturesque. Different times, different views. Worth the effort to join the locals at 5am walking, tai chi, and exercising. Buy sweet donuts from the vendors but thats later, around 9am. Soul food worth the coffee and honey fried yams to watch the traffic in comfort and high enough to appreciate the lack of apparent rules :-)

Nice stroll in the chaos of the city. We walked around the lake on a very hot day and it was a nice relief to walk under the trees where it was a lot cooler.
We took some nice photos but not much to do there.

Very pretty and a great place to people watch. A must see in Hanoi and a lovely place to visit again and again. But - whatever you do - DO NOT eat at the restaurant on the foreshore on the Western side - it is overpriced and appalling - worst service we received in Vietnam.
Pleasant walk. pleasant to walk around and definately take a look over the bridge onto the small island - nice little collection to look at

Good landmark. The lake is in the centre of the shopping area, and prices get more expensive the closer you get to the lake. In the day time it is crowded with tourists and street sellers. There is a budhist temple in the middle of the lake, and you can pay a small fee to go over the bridge and visit. Lots of seats arounds the lake and we saw a few people getting married there. At night time it is a meeting place for the locals, and it looks quite magical with some coloured lights.

Don't expect too much. Yes, it's a lake in the middle of the city and there are a few attractions worth seeing when you walk around it. Luckily the trees were in bloom when we were there, otherwise, frankly, it's pretty dirty water that doesn't really appeal. If you're in Hanoi, you go to this area anyway and have a look.

Walk, Talk and Enjoy. The evening brings all the walkers and strollers out in force. I lost count of number of times I walked around the lake. All my smiles and hello's were reciprocated by the friendly locals. Often there will be approaches by University students who request some of your time to practice their English. I found that they asked intelligent questions and great conversations developed. Buy an ice cream and sit by the lake and enjoy the atmosphere.

a pleasant walk in the middle of Hanoi. This lake which has a legend around it about a restored sword is a peaceful and green place right in the middle of busy Hanoi where you can walk. There is a small temple which you can walk in for a small fee at the north end.We walked around it and had a glimpse into the local lives. A lot of city workers seem to be having lunch there and families and wedding parties were there. There is a wholesale market close to the north end which is crazy but one could visit it if in the area.

Lovely walking area. So nice to walk around and to see all the locals sitting in the park and using the facilities. We stayed not far from here and our hotel overlooked the lake so to me it is an important part of Hanoi an my memories. Hope to make many more

Nice walk. Stroll around the lake and take in the hustle and bustle. Lots of folks milling around chatting, exercising, dancing. The bridge looks nice lit up at night. You can catch an electric car there that will take you on 3 choices of tour. Great if you just want to sit and take it all in.

The only park/lake in Hanoi city and a pleasure to enjoy. A picturesque area with pleasant gardens and walkway all the way around. And a temple on an island ($2 fee) worth seeing. Always seems busy yet space to sit and relax in this busy city
Nice for a walk. Nice area to wander around or just sit and people watch. Met some very friendly locals and other tourists around here.

Make the effort & get up early !. Nice spot to walk around. One day we got up early (before 7!) and walked to have breakfast at the lake. It was fascinating to see the Hanoi people up,and about everything from Tai Chi to ballroom dancing occurs all around the lake in the early morning.

Friendly people. The Pagoda at the north end of the lake is well worth a visit. The lakeside is popular with newly weds. One day (I think a Saturday) we saw four couples having their photos taken. On two occasions they were queuing to have their photo taken in a particular spot. Also across the road from the lake is the Water Puppet Theatre (north East Corner) and a high class shopping centre by the south east corner. The people here are very freindly saying hello as they pass or even taking photos.

Well...It's a lake !. What can I say, it's a small lake that's ok for a stroll around, but it's not exciting.Expect to be approached by Vietnamese students whilst here who will politely ask if they can speak with you for 10 minutes to better their English. It's a nice way to pass away a bit of time and help someone else

Great for Tourists. One of the real 'nerve centers' for tourists in Hanoi. By all means, try to arrange some time to meet with the wonderful young students who come to Hoan Kiem to meet and interact with foreigners. They are kind and thoughtful and eager to learn, are keen to practice their English, and I am happy and proud to say that some of them are now my good Vietnamese friends.

Beautiful small lake in the City Center. The life around the lake is wonderful. Hanoian citizens do exercise very early morning, from the little girl to elderly people. It is very green also around the lake. Sometimes, there are street sellers and they are quite sticky. And the lake needs a regular cleaning...

Hoan Kiem lake - Legend lake in the heart of Hanoi. Day by day, we must go to work through it. It is amazing lake in the morning with a lot people enjoy doing exercise, sightseeing,... I love it.Despite the time’s ashes and dust, Hoan Kiem Lake - the popular historical and legendary beauty-spot is eternal for good as an evidence of a fairy & heroic Hanoi during the past wars, and a romantic & charming Hanoi of Today!

Need a rest?. It is 'just a lake' but you will be glad for the peace among all the scooters. It's nice to walk around and see the beauty. While evening walks are much cooler, don't forget your mosquito spray.

Hanoi's epicentre of culture and life. Right in the heart of the city, Hoan Kiem Lake is an elegant, chaotic and historic living museum of all things Hanoi. Said to be the residence of an ancient turtle that once magically saved the city from invasion, the lake is at once a place of pilgrimage for the believers and voyeuristic joy for tourists from worlds away. I lived in Hanoi for several months and quickly came to adore this place. I was lucky enough to visit it countless times in all different circumstances. Pro tip: If you hang around, you could be lucky enough to bare witness to a rare sighting of the turtle and some of its offspring at the water's edge!To Do:1) Visit the museum that seems to float on water to find out all about the legends of the lake. 2) Take an early morning jog around the edge. This is the prime time to see all the locals selling their wares before the day becomes too hot, and also to enjoy the placidness of the lake before hordes of tourists descend. 3) Re-visit on a warm midnight. It's fascinating and humbling to sit quietly by the water's edge right in the centre of the city, with silence engulfing you, knowing that the chaos begins all over again in only a few hours.4) Walk the entire perimeter. Every turn has something new to offer, both on the lake and the buildings around it - a monument of some kind; a special flower garden; a crazy vietnamese wedding; as well as everything from banks, to restaurants, to shoe stalls to a skate park. It's all there.This is one destination in Hanoi you can't very well avoid. Soak in all it has to offer. Highly recommend it!

Hoan Kiem Lake - Asia Top Travel private city tour. Hoan Kiem Lake is a lake in the historical center of Hanoi, the capital city of Vietnam. Hoan Kiem lake means “lake of the returned sword”. The story behind the name is a legend. In 1418, the Vietnamese emperor Le Loi fought a war against the Chinese. It wasn’t going too well for him so when he walked by the lake one day, he saw a giant tutrtle coming out of the water with a magic sword in its mouth. He took the sword and eventually defeated the Chinese army with it. When he was having his victory parade at the shores of Hoan Kiem, the turtle appeared again and demanded the sword back. Before he could do anything, the sword flew away from his hands to the tortoise’s mouth. It disappeared in the water. The emperor had a temple built which can still be seen today.
Memorable lake in the central of town. Very nice place for relax by having dinner or even just drink a cup of coffee or tea, fresh air around suit for walking sport and just for reading a book

Spend a few hours relaxing and reading. 1000 year old pagoda where the mythical turtle brought the King a sword he used to fight off and win a battle against invaders. The temple is beautiful and the people great. Even the street vendors have manners and are not pushy...students are given assignments to talk with someone who speaks English and they are incredibly polite. Many have surveys...just a nice place to meet someone truly Vietnamese and relax.

good morning hanoi. since the day starts early in Vietnam, including the traffic noise, you get with the locals and walk around the lake doing exercise. It's a surreal, strange and to western eyes, funny side of life in Nam.

Go there around sunrise. The lake at sunrise is a truly unique travel experience - with locals excercising, playing sport, meditating etc - all around this mystical lake - bring your camera!The lake is small so it doesn't take long to walk around - however every few metres there is something different happening.Look out for the turtle - I saw it twice - which impressed the locals we met later who have never spotted it.

Nice serene lake. Great for evening walks if you are staying around the old quarters area (its adjacent to the Old Quarters). Lots of photo ops around the lakes. I didnt see any of those rare breed of turtles that's suppose to live in the lake though.

Hoan Kiem lake. What a great attraction right in the centre of the old city. I walked right around the lake, visited the shrine over the red bridge, and admired the flowers which are everywhere. Not to be missed!

crowd place. So many spot you can capture this place, The pagoda and temple. Or the people who jogging and playing around the lake. I loves this place already when come to Hanoi, just 5 minutes walking from my hotels and going there every morning and afternoon.
Interesting to walk around. Promenading is the thing to do here,people watching in Hanoi especially on the weekends and near many of the main attractions.

Comes alive at night. this is a real great place to just sit down and relax and observe how they do their thing,the places comes alive during the night when people come in,youll see the joggers,families with their kids,pet lover walking their dog,lovers lane, and they also have like a instant gym beside the lake,guys working out their muscles,i was like surprise coz the day before we walked around the same area of the lake there was no gym equipments then the next day there were dumbells and barbells and bench equipments so i was like where the hell did that come from.i wanted to work out with the guys but since im on vacation,now way im gonna sweat it out during that time.lol
Heart of the city. Serene setting, and a focus for the early moring Tai Chi folk - flamboyants and myrtle in flower make it spectacular in summer

Lovely promenade. If you want to walk on an actual footpath without having to step around parked motorbikes or people carrying out their daily living, the circuit around the lake is a lovely way to spend an afternoon. There are big shady trees providing cool respite from the heat, and even an icecream kiosk to finish it off! There are plenty of benches to sit and either people watch, or contemplate the water.

Peace in the midst of chaos. I don't know about the legends and stories and turtle, very romantic I'm sure. Very nice lake with a walkway to enjoy some serenity in the middle of the bustling French Quarter. Restaurants, and Coffee shops across the road or just take some water and go for a lazy stroll around the water together with many others. A nice time out for young and old. Coffee in the lakeside cafe is expensive and average.

A place to people watch. The locals (All walks of life) seemed to love coming here. Nothing much to see at the lake itself but I was told by my guide that a glimpse of the turtle that lives in the lake would mean that good luck is upon you. I do believe I saw it's shell briefly before it went down into the lake at one point of time.

Great spot for people watching.. We are staying in a little hotel near the lake and have views of it from our room but there's nothing like taking a walk around the lake, especially on a Sunday when there are thousands of people there. The weather is hot but there's a lovely breeze by the lake and it's a great spot to take pictures and get the feel of Hanoi's Old Quarter.

Sword, turtle - history. You can't miss it. It's the heart of Hanoi. The somewhat murky waters conceal a giant, aged turtle whose health was believed to be in jeopardy a couple of years ago. There are of course dreadful myths about what happens if The Turtle dies. The lakeside walks are pleasant and shady, with cafés every so often if you want a break.

pretty red bridge. The red bridge that connects the temple to the bank makes a great picture especially when the the lake is flat calm. The temple itself made for a pleasant place to visit, and the mummified body of the great turtle was interesting.A restful way to get away from the mad traffic chaos of Hanoi !!!!

close to everything you need. the lake is probably one of the most popular lake in hanoi otger than the west lake.it is close to evrything you'll ever need. beer bars, restaurants, hotels, supermarket, banks, water puppet theater and more.in the evenings, you'll see a crowd dancing or pratising tai chi and lots of little stalls with tiny tables and chairs where the locals (and some tourists) enjoy the local iced tea drink and nibble on sunflower seeds.its a really buzzing place with no dull moments.

beautiful lake. The tortoise tower in the middle adds something special, and it's a nice lake to walk around and soak in Hanoi. However, I wouldn't really recommend visiting the temple that is on an island on the lake, as it wasn't particularly interesting.

Great Walk. The water in the lake itself is pretty brownish, it is however a quit nice walk if you go around the lake. Locals use it for exercising, they even have a fitness area by the lake in the open. And its open to everyone! Good way to meet locals, hanging around reading drinking coffee.

great lake.. Best enjoyed early in the morning between 5am - 7am when Hanoins are doing their Tai Chi and various exercises around the lake, or early in the evening as the young descend on the lake to rollerblade, photograph each other and play games.
Beautiful!. Beautiful scenery! You can see how locals made use of this lake in their everyday life. Worth a visit!
Pretty lake to walk around on edge of Old Quarter. We enjoyed watching life going on as we walked around the lake on our way from the Old Quarter and museums the "Hanoi Hilton".

Excellent place for a walk and people watch. My wife and I visited Hanoi in March 2013 and usually had a walk around the lake during the evening when the lake side is illuminated and there are lots of locals getting some excercise in all different ways.It was interesting to know that the Vietnamese are so keen on excercise.There are also several cafes around the lake where you can get a coffee or other drink and just "people watch".We both really enjoyed this area of Hanoi.

Lovely but not a must-see. We enjoyed walking around the lake, and it can be fun to see the local life, but it isn't something I'd go out of my way to experience. The temple on the lake is interesting but not a must-see either.
Beautiful sight. Sitting on the bench near the lakeside and enjoying the cool breeze is refreshing. There is a lot of human activities taking place all day long. It is a nice place to rest and relax.

A bit of sanity in the chaos of Hanoi. Ideal for a gentle walk or to watch the locals exercise. All walks of life are here, and it is a good place to see the people of Hanoi and relax a little from the bustle of the rest of the city.

Go in the late afternoon. Grab yourself a takeaway coffee from one of the many local shops around and head over the bridge in the late afternoon. Sit with the locals playing Chinese checkers and enjoy Hanoi as the mist rolls in - the most picaresque spot - and a great place for a breather in busy Hanoi

great for just chilling out. No mosquitoes! I was shocked by the absence of my little whining winged friends and I totally enjoyed walking around this lake and watching the older folks doing tai chi or playing badminton without a care in the world! There is a temple and lots of greenery and spots to just sit for awhile after walking the Old Quarter all day.

great place to people watch. great place to walk round ,sit and have a ice cream ,always cool wind off the lake , take some nice photos ,near bridge get a bit of hassle from people trying to sell you something , its part of the holiday if you cant find your hotel ,when you find the lake ,then you will be able to find your way to your hotel at nigth people just driving around ,and around the lake on their bikes ,great to watch

Great to walk around in the early morning or evening. It is different from the early morning and the night. You should experience both. There is a temple called Ngoc Son Temple on the lake however I do not really like this temple. You can just get on the red bridge outside the temple for taking photos or views of the lake. The bridge is free admission but the temple is not.

Take a coffee or drink on the lake. You can walk around the lake in about half a hour. Stop off at the restaurant that is right on the lake - behind the red bridge. Go outside. Onto the verandah and score a seat right on the lake edge. Nice place to relax and get off the busy Hanoi streets for a bit.
Over rated!. It's nice to see, nice to walk around or taken by cyclo, but it's just a lake after all with list of people haranguing you to buy, buy, buy.

Xin Chao Hanoi. The lake is said to be the symbol of Hanoi. It was Women's Day so a lot of beautiful vietnamese girls were seen around the lake. Having their portraits sketched by street artists, or weighing themselves on the scale at the park! The lake is as beautiful as the women.

Big Lake. This place is right on the main road to central city. It is a big lake with lots of citizens doing their exercise there in the morning. lots of locals and tourists taking in the air, the sights and sounds of a happening place.

Ok, nice walk but very busy lake. It's a nice walk around the lake, which isn't very big. There are a lot of visitors, or people similarly strolling, or having activities around the lake which makes it very crowded to thoroughly enjoy. It's like the whole of town seem to converge there. There's a little shrine in the middle of the lake which is worth a look. What's nice is there are a numerous cafes, and restaurants nearby to stop for coffee, tea or a nice meal.

An oasis of calm but not that much to see. Walking around the lake you can escape the traffic chaos for a while. Popular with tourists and locals alike but the lake looks dirty and the two temples on the lake are not exactly visually stunning.
Fantastic retreat in the middle of hustle and bustle. Lovely place to take a stroll round and stop for a snack or a beer. Keep your eye out for the legendary golden turtle

nice view. I am quite like this place, nice view with not so crowded (in the afternoon). A bit wind and sunshine.
There are places to sit in for relaxing and take a deep breath.

Crowded. This lake is in the middle of a very busy area and as the park space is not large, it is also very busy and noisy. I visited on a weekend, maybe better on a week day. If you are visiting the old quarters you will see the lake and park for sure. Not need to make a detour and no advantage and walking around the whole lake.

Fantastic place. This is a fantastic place to take in the local culture and architecture. It was a joy to watch the locals both morning and evening, strolling, jogging, dancing, or just meditating, around the lake. There are quite a few cafes and restaurants around the edge of the lake to stop for a drink or bite to eat, a nice wide walkway to saunter around the whole lake with lots of seats and places to stop and take in the view and plenty of photo opportunities all the way around

Interesting. The area is very interesting with nice restaurants and sights around the lake. The lake has a good story about its name and is where the famous golden turtles live. There are only few of the gold turtles that are still alive in the lake. It was a tranquil place where locals were walking their dogs,sitting on benches, playing checkers, doing yoga or Tai Chi
Tranquil. Great to walk around and also to sit and watch the world go by. Join in with the locals as they perform their daily exercises or just sit with an ice cream on a bench beside the water.

The Legend is more interesting than the actual place. As city parks go, this one is average. There's not much green space on any side of the lake, just roads with noisy honking traffic crowding in against all sides. Despite the miry green waters and a large dead carp floating belly up against the cement containing walls we actually saw people putting their feet in the water. I wouldn't.The legend of the emperor losing his sword to a giant turtle which came up out of the lake and snatched it is more interesting to reflect upon than the cocaphany of car horns and crowds of people everywhere on the pathways. We didn't see a turtle this time, but my husband saw one last year when he was in town. They are few and far between, which doesn't surprise me given the water quality. If you're a people watcher I think Hoan Kiem Lake makes a fine afternoon outing. Just don't come expecting peace or quiet.

Lovely place to relax and take in Hanoi. A very lovely lake to relax and watch the world go by. The temple on the lake is also lovely - and has seats for relaxing as well. It's nice that there is a mix between Vietnamese and Foreigners, especially in the evening. Be careful of friendly Vietnamese who approach you, who appear to want to chat - they try to fob off Lonely Planet books and postcards and are hard to get rid off once they get chatting.

Nice walking and chillout area. This is a nice lake that is quite popular with vietnamese and foreigns. Its a nice escape from the hustle and bustle that is Hanoi. I also was confronted twice by local university students wanting to practice some english which was interesting and fun.

be on guard. The lake is interesting. It's pleasant to walk around and its fun to sit and people watch. You must be careful however. The lake is probably second only to the bars and nightclubs in the amount of pick-pockets and thief's. They will distract you or try and catch you off guard and take whatever they can get their hands on.

Very pretty. It's a popular place to see but it's like a calm oasis in the middle of a very busy city. Make sure you buy your ticket before walking over the bridge otherwise you have to walk all the way back to get one (like we did).

Lake with full of life.... Very nicely developed landscaping, lighting and walkways are hard to miss. Very busy with various activities of all age group of local people around the lake. Nice restaurants, water puppet show theater, ice-creams (KEM in Vietnamese) ,balloons,street market and nightmarket shopping, cyclo ride, city tour by electric (green) van give best feel of Hanoi culture and lifestyle....
Its a Lake. Its a large lake with a Café Bar offering food, drinks and outside seating - very pleasant on a hot day.

A lake within a busy city. This is one of the most popular lake in Hanoi. It is right next to the Old Quarters. It is almost a central whereby local folks, tourists and photog all gathered here for photo taking or weekend chill out. The lake isn't very big, it took me approx 15mins stroll to complete about 1/2 of the lake circumference. Probably due to the weekend crowd and the cloudy skies in Winter/Spring, I don't find the lake especially nice. There is an old ruin temple/castle(?) in the middle of the lake, good photo opp, and another Chinese Taoist temple near the Old Quarters side with a red bridge which also provide another good photo opp.
Beautiful lake. Although the lake is in a busy part of town, the landscape is lovely and provides for some sane moments without having to cross the street in all the traffic.

Hoan Kiem Lake of Hanoi. The Hoan Kiem lake is one of the most famous icon of Hanoi, it is situated strategically in the center of old quarter, so a visit to this lake certainly is highly recommended if you're visiting the area. The lake itself may not have any significant attraction, beside a temple built to respect the turtles living in here; but even an 15 minutes walk would is sufficient to give a glance of how Hanoian enjoy their tranquil time by the lake. If you're lucky enough, you will be able to see the giant turtle living in this lake. If you come on the early of summer, the vegetation as at its best, blooming with flower.To circle the lake you might need about 15-20 minutes running, or up to 40 minutes walking and sitting.

Beautiful!. This is a fantastic place to take in the local culture and architecture. Many people like to sit around the shores and wander the pathway. There are many beautiful buildings in the area from temples to colonial-era office buildings.

Pleasant to wander round. Not particularly picturesque but a great way to see the locals from courting couple to elderly people exercising (well we assumed it was some form of exercise as they slapped their arms and legs). One morning we decided to run around the lake and this provoked lots of smiles from the locals who clearly thought we were bonkers!Getting to the lake can be a little challenging as it involves taking your life in your hands to cross the road - be brave, step out into oncoming traffic, walk steadily on and cross your fingers that the traffic will weave around you! Usually it does...
Great Lake. A peaceful place right in the middle of Hanoi. A lovely lake to walk around and take in the views. A lot of beggars hang around the entrance by the bridge, not a problem but sad to see.

The Southeast Asian Seine. Well, Almost. :). Most people walk around Hoan Kiem Lake but I prefer to bike around it. On April mornings, the weather is nippy and the atmosphere tranquil. Weekend afternoons tend to get crowded with locals and tourists alike so my recommendation is to wake up early to enjoy a peaceful walk around the lake. Most people who spend time at the lake are elderly ones so I took extra care in biking lest I bump one of them accidentally. There are numerous benches set-up where you can read a good book or relax.There's a small cafe and a big restaurant within the lake's circle and other cafes and restaurants across from it. For convenience, there is also an area allotted for restrooms although I myself have not been inside so I cannot attest to their cleanliness.This is my favorite place in Hanoi because it provides a getaway from the hustle and bustle of the city. :)
chintzy but interesting. Where else can you see a 500 pound stuffed turtle covered in gold? Well worth the few dong. Very picturesque setting.
Tranquil. Lovely early morning walk round the lake, watching the ladies salsa dance and lovely too see people enjoy and use such a great place

The one of nicest Lake on the World. I like this lake alot, the peoples here call this is the heart of Hanoi Capital, that's right because of the specially for Turtoise Temple, greens trees around the lake, the business building with busy beside the Peaceful and quite Lake. I love Vietnam, especially i love Hoan Kiem Lake.
oasis in chaos. a nice bit of peace and slow pace in the middle of crazy traffic chaos. was here twice in the span of three years and was equally nice on both occasions

Perfect fo an evening stroll. This is at it's best at night when the lights are reflected on the lake. It is a peaceful haven without much hassle from sellers and xyclo drivers. No motorbikes either which is great. Many Vietnamese strolling there too not just tourists.
Nice area. The area is very interesting with nice restaurants and sights around the lake. Walking around at night is really nice with the bright lights and the roaring sounds of the traffic.

Make sure you visit early. Every morning this lake is a hive of activity as people do exercises generally between 6am and 8am. Come early and see them do dancing Ti Chi and a whole range of other exercising. Worth getting up early to come and see this mist shrouded lake.

Early morning stroll around a mist shrouded lake.... Have taken a couple of walks around this very famous Hanoi landmark. Once in the evening, and the other before 6am in the morning. The pre sunrise version works because of the marvellous people watching - laughter yoga, latin salsa, gagnam style exercise, tai chi, you name it! Concluded with a lovely French breaky of omelette & baguettes on the waters edge.

Nice Area to Roam Around. Great place to take in the eveining sun and see how the locals get on with their daily lives. A Scenic place to take some pictures as well.. both during the golden hour of dusk as well as the night look where the little island in the middle of the lake lights up with colour. You can have dinner/snack at the Bistro located at the side of the lake while you take in the beautiful and peaceful scenery.

at peace. a restful place, free from the madding crowds. nice to take a stroll in the tree lined walkways. On sunday people flocked to the location as a meeting place and to chill out on the banks of the lake.

Something to do early in the day. Visit the Lake at 6 am to see how Hanoi residents stay fit. There is jogging, aerobic dance, weight lifting, ballroom dance, and individual routines in a beautiful setting.

Beautiful lake in the center of chaos. What a beautiful lake to walk around in the midst of a crazy, chaotic tourist center. We loved our evening walks around the lake where the kids could run free and we could people watch. Great to have a picnic lunch or chill time. The kids loved running across the red bridge and climbing up the rock mountain. Perfect lake for morning exercise too!
Hoan Kiem Lake. We walked around this centrally located lake several times. It has nice Cafe's and serves as a landmark for navigating the City itself.

Meh it's a lake. Nice little lake in the heart of the old quarter. There is an old legend that goes with the lake, but unless you are told about it, there isnt anything to really tell you much about it. On the northern shore of the lake stands The Temple of the Jade Mountain which is worth a visit. In the centre of the lake is Turtle Tower, although not accessible to the public. It forms part of the legend of the lake.

a good place to sit and people watch. best to go very early in the morning when hundreds of the locals are using the surrounding path to keep in shape by exercising, dancing, jogging, walking, doing tai chi, stretching etc. It's absolutely fascinating and a real inspiration. The morning is probably the busiest time but people still come to walk in the evenings too. Beautiful trees surround the lake and at night it is very pretty with lights.

Nice to walk around. This is a great spot to people watch. It's nice to stroll around the lake. There's a nice restaurant overlooking the lake which has an glass enclosed cafe to have coffee, dessert or a nice lunch.
Great for a stroll and watch the madness around you.. Lovely for a walk before or after lunch or dinner. Lots of seating areas to watch life unfold during the day.

so romantic. It's a beautiful lake right in Hanoi's center. We enjoyed our night walking on its board. really really nice. There ar also coffee shop, restaurants. If you like shooting, come here at sunset taking pictures to people training their TAI CHI, very nice!!
So much you have to do!. Smack dab in the center of the center of the Old Quarter. Iconic pictures, picturesque, great people watching around the lake.

Serenity in the Midst of Chaos. Visit the temple across the red bridge or just relax on the terrace of a cafe and drink it all in. In the evening there are often musicians and singers performing around the lake, not to mention the all the locals taking the evening air.

Dont miss this - get out of bed!. 6-7am is the peak action time around the lake and you are missing a cultural highlight if you dont make the effort to walk round at least once. The various dance, tai chi and exercise groups are great. salsamouse.com was the group I joined in with and you couldn't ask for lovelier folk. (And they had a real teacher, which most groups dont).

A nice place to get some peace in the noisy city of Hanoi. In the center of the crowded, busy, and noisy Hanoi, you will find a place to chill out a bit, Hoan Kiem Lake. The lake has a good story about its name and is where the famous golden turtles live. There are only few of the gold turtles that are still alive in the lake.Of course, most people come to the lake not to find the rare turtle, but for a nice drink while seating somewhere next to the lake, watching people passing by. Being a genuine Hanoian, I find it amazing how I can spend hours just sitting in a cafe next to Hoan Kiem Lake, watching people passing by. Some people might find it such a waste of time, but I find it one of the best way to spend time in Hanoi. A kid coming back home from school, a salaryman rushing to work, a housewife shopping for dinner, an elderly jogging together around the lake, and many other types of people. Just a glance and I can image who they are, what they do, where they are heading to.For a tourist, having a coffee and watch the beautiful lake and the willow swaying in the wind is not so bad for an afternoon.

The early bird has the most fun!. Get up early and go down to the lake to join all the other early risers as they go through their morning fitness routines: Tai Chi, walking, weight lifting, ballroom dancing, Hip Hop aerobics. And kibitzing and gossiping with neighbors and friends.

Great place for people watching. There are more locals than tourists at Hoan Kiem Lake during our last visit. So you know this should be a good place to chill in Hanoi :)I love the fact that this area is relatively cleaner, and the people spending their leisure time here look more happy than others too. There are some nice restaurants / cafes around this area so you can enjoy the lake while waiting for your Vietnamese coffee to drip. Having break at Illy's cafe or City View Restaurant is good too as you can have bird's eye view of the area.

Magical heart of Hanoi. We loved wandering round the lake especially in the morning around 8 - 9am when you could see people doing Tai Chi or playing quoits & I joined in the ladies doing aerobics! Apparently if you go at dawn there are masses of people doing Tai Chi. There was so much going on there - portraits artists, flower displays, lakeside restaurants, joggers, rickshaw rides & the beautiful small pagoda, Thap Rua, in the middle of the lake. The highlight of the lake is the brilliant red Sunbeam Bridge, an arched wooden bridge to the Jade Mountain Temple situated on a small islet.

Be careful at night. Lovely lake by day, but we walked back to our hotel around 8pm, I stopped to give money to a woman, put my wallet back in my bag, stopped to take a couple of photos - 5 mins later realised my wallet was gone. I never felt a thing, so must have been a professional job. Not a disaster, but a big inconvenience. Take care at nighttime. I considered myself an experienced traveller and didn't expect this.

Bit of a disppointment. Concrete surrounds; lots of people; rather tacky temple over a bridge. Not the oasis in the heart of the city i was hoping for. saturday night is a nightmare - absolutely jam packed with motor bikes and people a bit worse for drink.

Nice place to walk and close to Old Quarter. When visiting the Old Quarter, the lake is a nice location to take a leisurely walk and enjoy the scenery. On the southwest shore there is a nice beer garden.

A Pleasant Place. If you stay in a hotel in the Old Town you are within walking distance of the lake, assuming you can get through the traffic...not much traffic when I went one morning to see the people exercising singly or in groups and there was even ballroom dancing near the bronze statue of Hanoi's founder. It is a pleasant stroll at any time of the day and the red bridge with its reflection in the water is very photogenic

A delight in the chaos of Hanoi.. We stayed nearby and walked past the lake everyday and night. It was a joy to watch the locals both morning and evening, strolling, jogging, dancing, or just meditating, around the lake. The old turtle tower is delightful, and the Ngoc Son temple was wonderful. The most visited in Hanoi apparently, and infinitely photogenic. The bridge across is lovely too.When we return to Hanoi, (which we will, having fallen in love with the place) we will definitely be staying within walking distance of the lake. I think this was one of the reasons we enjoyed the city so much, as you really experience the life of the locals

lots of activities. beautiful lake. lots of activities near the lake. many recreational parks, souvenir shops & food stalls nearby. walking distance from Old Quarters. Thang Long water puppet theatre is also very near. Can experience trishaw rides.
Quick walk, nice views. Nice to see some open space after walking through the old quarter. Great views and interesting trees. A small wat on and island. Fairly touristy but nice.

Simply beautiful!. We walked to the lake in the early morning and were astounded by the number of people out there exercising. Lots of groups of people doing Tai Chi, people walking, running, cycling, doing weights or yoga. A beautiful spot to people watch (or join in the fun). There are quite a few cafes and restaurants around the edge of the lake to stop for a drink or bite to eat, a nice wide walkway to saunter around the whole lake with lots of seats and places to stop and take in the view and plenty of photo opportunities all the way around.

Great Place to go for a Walk. What a wonderful place to spend a few hours and enjoy the serenity of the lake. We walked around this beautiful lake a number of times. Being Tete, there were beautiful flowers placed all around the lake. Many people were busy taking photos. Lotus flowers were in bloom. It was a tranquil place where locals were walking their dogs,sitting on benches, playing checkers, doing yoga or Tai Chi. It is also a great place to go for ice-cream or just sit on a bench watching the world go by. Enjoy the lake when visiting the Old Quarter.

Interesting and very pretty setting. After a cyclo ride we walked over a series of small bridges to an island in the lake. There were lots of older Vietnamese playing a form of checkers and relaxing around the gazebo, You have a good view of the lake from different directions.
Lake in Hanoi. Beautiful spot for a walk,run or to relax. Good location for nice restaurants and shops. The old quarter is located close by and also the water puppet theatre.

Nice for a coffee or beer. This lake is effectively the cultural and social centre of Hanoi. You cannot really miss it and the temple on the island on it. Walked around it many times and took in the sights both good and bad. There are some top-end bars and restaurants and some bottom-end backpacker style places...so something for everyone. Great view at night too. Recommend strongly.
best thing in Hanoi. it is he best place to go since it is also the nicest place of Hanoi. It is also the center of the city and the place where all distances are messured.

Relaxing. We visited the lake, one in the morning and the other in the evening. Both occassions were ok especially for picture taking. Different angles and different locations in the lake offered different atmosphere, all of them relaxing and comforting. After a tiring day of walking in the old quarter, it was very comforting to sit in the benches of the lake
Enjoyable. Nice area to walk and see the sights. Some area's very peaceful which was nice to get away for all the city noise.

Hoan Kiem Lake brightens the city of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is a jewel in city of Hanoi. We walked around it early one morning with our local tour guide and found it to be very restful and peaceful. Their is a lot of Vietnamese history and tradition associated with this lake.
Lovely Legend Lake. It combines legend with heaps of history and it's truly moving to watch the devotion of truly religious visitors there.

Nice Lake. Full of tourist, beware of pickpockets in this area, I noticed a tourist who almost got pickpocketed but he realised what was going on and stopped the guy. Apart from that its a lovely area to come and just hang out and people watch.

Nice respite from the hustle and bustle. Hoan Kiem Lake borders the Old Quarter and provides a nice quiet relief from the frenetic pace of the city. It's great to take some time to walk around the lake and enjoy the goings-on. You might see a group doing Tai Chi, or couples sitting on benches having their lunch or a wedding party taking photographs. Take a rest on one of the benches at the south end and just watch the people going about their daily lives. A local just may come up to you in order to practice English. A student did that with me and we sat there for two hours and she finally had to reluctantly depart for school. Den Ngoc Son is a small temple on an island towards the north end. There's a small fee to go on the island but well worth it. On the south end of the temple is a small plaza and there were elderly men playing the game 'Go' with others watching and kibitzing. South is the Tortoise Tower rising gracefully against the trees. At the northwest perimeter of the lake is a cafe - Thuy Ta - which is a great place to sit for a bite to eat and look out over the lake. It's a bit more expensive but the view and atmosphere are worth it.

PAGODA AT HOAN KIEM LAKE. This is a really beautiful pagoda in the middle of the lake. Also there is a small temple for prayer. A very peaceful place to spend some time in Hanoi. Feels so far away from the traffic of Hanoi which is just the other side of this lake!

Watch for the Golden Turtle. Yes, the Turtle Tower, though tiny sits calmly on Hoan Kiem Lake and for the locals, their day is not complete without a look at the Lake to see the turtle comes up. It is considered very lucky when you see one.Hoan Kiem Lake is just what the city needs. It is a place to relax after being hustled and bustled around in the Old Quarter. For foreigners who stay close by, this is a place to jog and watch the locals do Tai Chi, dance or do any other exercise. The lake is surrounded by older trees that give it shade and serenity. Take a respite in this place when you are in Hanoi.

One of Hanoi's lakes. It was a very misty day when we visited this lake and our guide was not very good. We learnt about the tortoise that lives in the lake, we visited the pagoda and saw the bridge that crosses to the pagoda. It is one of the main attractions of Hanoi but we were slightly disappointed in what we saw and learnt about it.
Just relaxing. Nice lake, where its easy to start a chat with nice vietnamese people. they do sport there or have romantic dates :)

Exercise Place. It is a big lake with lots of citizens doing their exercise there in the morning. The garden vies is very nice. Well kept.You can booked your tour of hanoi town and the old quarters on electric bus, which they call green tourism at a booth at the lake. If you want to take the bus, do make sure you go early to booked your ticket. It is very popular.

Great afternoon. We arrive here at 4pm. Just walk around the lake, spent 30mins for it. Try a cup of coffee at the side of Lake . The leaves fell down, the sunny weather, it was nice an romantic. Do not miss the chance to take a photo

Nice walk in the evening. It was a very pleasant walk. People were running, playing games. There were a couple of cute cafes and restaurants with a nice view. Nice bridge with a temple for photo opportunities.
Lovely. Liked the peacefulness around the lake. There was nothing I disliked, Hoan Lake is probably the only peaceful place in Hanoi.

Picturesque. A pretty lake in the middle of the city. We crossed over onto the island to the pagoda. We saw a large turtle swimming in the lake, a rare sight as the locals were very excited and said it was very lucky.
