Wonderful area for strolling & people watching. This is where the action is -- lots of locals and tourists taking in the air, the sights and sounds of a happening place. Stop off at one of the many cafes or shop till you drop at the new luxury mall at the southeast end of the lake. Just meander along and enjoy!

Pretty lake. A nice place to visit day or night and people watch.
During the daytime you may see young bride & grooms having their pictures taken and of an evening the lake comes to life with beautiful reflections from the lights nearby.
A bit of peace in the busy city of Hanoi.

Beautiful Lake. Right in the middle of Old Hanoi, a walk round the lake is a peaceful interlude to the hustle and bustle At night it is especially beautifully lit. Groups of people enjoy impromptu dancing to their radios, there is always something to stand and enjoy watching.

Tranquility & mayhem.. We were lucky to be here for Tet & the fireworks, lights & associated celebrations were a joy to partake in. The Red Bridge was all lit up & looked magical.Even during the day the lake is serene & a stroll around it is very rewarding, experiencing the calmness of the stroll whilst being surrounded by the mayhem of the traffic.There is a lot to see all around the lake from the water puppet theatre at one end to the new luxury mall at the other. ATM's are readily available & allow larger withdrawls with a lower charge than elsewhere we have been. There are plenty of restaurants & shops around & a coffee or beer in one of the high rise restaurants (opposite the water puppet theatre) is very rewarding as you witness locals & tourists alike dicing with death as they try to manouver their way across & around the tortuous road system.

Lovely walk. Join the citizens of Hanoi and take a stroll around the lake. I would say don't bother crossing the red pedestrian bridge, but it's $1 and you will anyway. Go to City View coffee to get a birds eye view of the whole lake!

A nice ride around the lake. Well, in march the weather is just perfect. Walking around the lake can be relax, riding on the cyclo was even better. I paid 50,000vnd for a nice round. You can visit the temple with a little fee as well.

Not much of a sight to see, but an experience to be had!. The physical characteristics of the lake itself aren't really impressive: the water is green, polluted, and the lake temple ticket is overpriced. That being said, the real experience of the walking around the lake is in the evening on a weekend night. Families will flock to the lake to treat their kids to icecream, groups of women will do dance/exercise classes, and both young and old couples will stroll romantically around the lake. Bonus treat: follow the neon lights and find kids and their families roller blading in the nearby square.

Great social place. Locals will talk to you all the time, dont be afraid they are nice people and the Young ones like to learn English. The lake is not for swimming and sometimes you will see water snakes here.
The colour of the water is not clear.
I often walk around this lake good to keep fit and easy walking

Dirty, Not Well Cared For. This place is right on the main road to central city, so you can visit it in about 10 minutes, but only if you want to say you've been there. Modest entrance fee to a dilapidated bridge in need of upgrading that crosses to dirty, run down temple encircled by dead trees and filthy water. Not a highlight.
Good to chill out. Was good to walk around and chill out away from all the noise of traffic...good to people watch. Lots of locals chilling out and exercising.
Nice central spot.. good central spot which gives a nice feel for the heart of Hanoi. Best in early monrning and around evening.

Incredible at Tet. The lake and its splendid pagodas was a great treat to visit during Tet as all the gardens were embellished with fresh flowering plants and the faithful thronged to the temples to make family offerings. This is a very beautiful area and should not be missed.
A Lake. Good exercise to walk round.Puppet theatre based nearby,also Japanese temple and photogenic bridge.Park area good to relax in and watch the world go by.

OK for a stroll around. End of the day it's. lake in the middle of a city. It's OK for a stroll around and to do a bit of people watching. A few containers of lotus flowers are dotted around the lake. So is plenty of rubbish and a few dead fish.There's a temple at the northern end of the lake which you can get to by crossing a small footbridge. Then there's a nominal charge for visiting the temple itself, which is OK, but not really on the must do list if you don't have the time. Also every busy.Early morning and evening are the best for people watching as there are various exercise and Tai Chi activities happening around the lake.

Nice space in a frenetic city, but a bit disappointing. I wasn't here in the early morning or late evening, when it might have been more interesting, but a walk round was pleasant enough. Not really anything special, but a nice area of space in the otherwise noisy and crowded Hanoi.
A glimpse of Vietnamese life. Walking around the lake you can catch a glimpse of the daily lives and the various unique activities of the Vietnamese.

Peace and seenity. A favourite hangout for locals and tourists alike. Tai Chi devotees early in the morning, old and young enjoying the peacefulness, restaurants nearby, and a wonderful temple on an island attached by a bridge. What more could one want.

Relaxing and a great way to meet the people. we spent soo much time there, just wonderful great way to meet people and just see how happy and friendly Vietnamese people are!!! We really loved going there and beautiful beautiful beautiful!!!

Fine for a relaxing stroll around. Plenty of thing to see all around the lake. Plenty of street food sellers working right next to numerous brides out for there pre wedding photo shoots and all sorts of other cultural activities just happening all around the lake
Another gorgeous lake. For me, one of the best spots for photographers, for having a walk and having a break with the magnificent red bridge with the little island ...
Hoan Kiem Lake is in bad shape. It was very dirty with dead fish, lots of activity in the area though. We visited the Water Puppet Theatre which was great

The most pleasant place. It is a totally wow experience by day or night. There is a calmness around you while everything meters away is hustling and bustling. An evening at a cafe facing the lake is a blissful experience. A walk at night around the lake or just doing nothing is calming.

A beautiful and peaceful area. During the New Year Celebrations this lake area was very beautiful. The floral displays were amazing as well as all the lantern and flag decorations. This lake area is really the central and liveliest area of Hanoi and walking around it is a lovely way to spend an hour or so.

Centre of attraction in Hanoi. The lake is really nice to walk around, with so many stalls, flowers and other attractions all around the lake. At night you will also seemany street artists making their living, doing excellent portraits of customers in super quick time..its got a very festive air around it.

Great Place for People Watching. We walked around the lake everyday and found it a great place to sit and watch people. During Tet the parks were full of families recreating, visiting and making stops at the temple on the lake. We also spent time talking with people who wanted to practice their English.

a must in the early morning. Hundreds of people doing all sorts of exercise on the banks of the lake.
No children's play equipment!
Walk around and around it for good people watching.

Nice, but don't expect too much. Its a good place to spend some time, and perhaps in the madness of Hanoi its ok. Maybe we're comparing to other city parks and lakes and it was a little disappointing, Still plenty of traffic noise, but you could while away some time people watching..

Contrast the peacefulness of the lake with the traffic going around it. Nice, relaxing walk once you've negotiated the roads to get here. Very peaceful setting, nice paths to walk on, very clean and tidy. Plenty of seats around if you get tired. THere are toilets which cost 3,000 dong so have money available. When tired of looking at the water, walk closer to the road and enjoy watching the traffic mayhem. A must experience in Hanoi.

Good to visit in the early morning. That is really nice and peaceful if you are stayiing close by, so you can see the local people do their exercises in the early morning.It is not clowded like during the day, the people do the erobic exercises or tai chi.

You are likely to end up here. Not the Champs Elysee. You are likely to drive around it or end up walking to it. Its the centre of the city. Loads of brides having their wedding pics taken and not very happy. Hanoi residents are abound and you could use it as a jogging path if you wanted.

Pretty lake in the midst of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake provides a nice oasis in the midst of bustling Hanoi. Take a walk around it or stop by at one of the coffee shops or restaurants for a drink or bite to eat.

Hoan Kiem Lake. At the heart of Hanoi and a lovely oasis to take some time out to sit and people watch. The Pagoda is worth a visit as well. It is a great place to stroll around and to use as a point of reference for helping not to get lost when walking around Hanoi.
Arthurian. This is about a sword and a lake and a turtle. I am sure you have heard it before but still, it is fun!
Must visit. Were ther during TET and the place was crowded with locals, flowers and hawkers everywhere. Great place to visit.

Beautiful even in the rain!. The Lake is the central park of Hanoi and was was used in many a direction. Many cafes and restaurants surround the lake which are a lovely way to spend some time in this lovely city!

Hanoi's Gem!. Without this lake, Hanoi is not the same. You can enjoy it any time of the day, be it early morning exercise, hide in a cafe by the lake by mid day, catching sunset in the afternoon or explore the history in Ngoc Son pagoda or at any corner of the lake. Take the time to walk around the lake and remember to try Kem Trang Tien (Trang Tien Icecream) - a special treat from Hanoi.

Loved it here. The lake is a must see. The Pagoda in the centre with the shrine for the turtle is well worth a visit. My favourite thing to do by the lake would be to grab myself some food from one of the many carts surrounding the lake, and sit on a bench and just watch everything going on around me. There is rarely a dull moment by the lake, it's where all the hustle and bustle is going on. We were lucky enough to be there during tet this year and watched the spectacular firework display amongst the thousands of locals who flock to the lake. It was pretty amazing.

Good for a promenade. Don't quote me because I think it is average, but too many people go there to visit the Temple and make wishes. The Temple is made out of wood but built on a large pole made out of cement. The guide told us a story for this Temple concerning the royal family but it escapes me now.We took many photos of a just married young couple. They were very cute.

Best to visit during Tet!. This lake is easy to walk around and is best done in the morning when the traffic is light and people are out exercising.During Tet and until the next full moon, there are flowers everywhere and colorful lanterns line the street, making the lake even more magical.Hanoi is among the most polluted cities in Asia and the most polluted city in Southeast Asia.Traffic is the main contributor to air pollution in the city, with the content of PM10 (particles less than 10 micrometers in diameter) being four times higher than the alarm level set by the World Health Organization. PM10 are a major health concern because they can be inhaled into and accumulate in the respiratory system through normal facial masks. By the time I left Hanoi, I had acute bronchitis … so beware!

Gorgeous Lake. You won't get tired of watching this beautiful lake specially to catch up the sun goind down at around 5:30pm..... so lovely... been here a couple times just to watch the sunset and people relaxing in the park facing the lake.
Crazy Busy New Years Eve. Great to walk around and a pretty central reference point. The turtle tower was beautiful just couldn't figure out how to get out there.

Beautiful!!!. Wander around the lake in the early morning is jsut an WOW experience.Very quiet without the sound from cars and motorbike but you can still see how local people starting their new day! Come to hanoi, visit this place is a MUST!!!!
Beautiful flowers. The lake was decorated with fresh flowers and it's relatively well-maintained except for some vandalism.

Nice to stroll around. Nice lake to stroll around, centre of Hanoi so easy to get to , quite pretty. I wouldn't travel specially to see it but you should be beside it anyway . About 1.5 Kms if you want to jog

A pleasant relief from the hubbub of the city!. We enjoyed our walk around the Lake but tired of the people trying to sell their wares. The sun was shining the day we arrived in Hanoi so the walkways around the Lake were busy with locals and visitors.

Great for an afternoon walk. The Lake was great to take a stroll around, it is close to markets and plenty of resturants. There is a temple on the Lake that we visited also. It was decorated beautifully with lights and flowers for the Chinese New Year, very lovely:)
Nice for a romantic walk along shores... Nice for romantic walk along shore, hear the legend about the returned sword, and visiting the pagoda

Picture perfect. My wife and I walked all the way around this lake and onto the island at sunset. Plenty of people were doing the same but it never felt crowded. It is an easy walk with plenty to see and some wonderful vistas. Impossible to take a bad photograph of the decompression chamber in Hanoi.

Be careful with thieves, please!. Hi everybody,I'm Vietnamese student and I was born in Hanoi. I love my hometown so much especially Hoan Kiem lake. This lake is a peaceful symbol of Hanoi. I love walking around the lake with my friends. I always want to show everybody the beauty of this lake and hope many people come there to visit. Please understand that I don't want to make a bad image of it. but, Today I walked around the lake and I saw some terrible things that I really want to warn all tourists who will visit there. I don't know how to share my warning to foreigner tourists so I post there. When we were walking, my friend went to the public toilet at the lake ( in my following picture). While we were waiting for her, we saw some thieves were trying to steal foreigner tourist's assets. One man pretended to sell souvenirs, aimed to distract the tourists and the other man tried to open the tourist's bag and stole things. Their area is at this public wc and foreigners are their objects. I witness a tourist wore a bag at his back and didn't know that the thief was opening his bag. I was really shocked when I saw that terrible thing was happening in front of my eyes. We thought that they are in a crowded thief group so many people near that WC saw that but didn't say anything, maybe they are accomplices. Others didn't dare to help because they're afraid of that those thief would hit them. So we tried to warn as many tourists as we could on the way around the lake. I was very sad because of that, it's the 1st time I saw those things happen at Hoan Kiem lake, and don't know how to help other tourists who visit my hometown. We thought about talking with securities but maybe it will not help much, the securities maybe know but don't do anything. So people who will visit there, please put your bag in front of you and take care of it. Be careful when you visit there. Enjoy your trip:). Hope that you love Hanoi :). Thank you so much!

Peaceful Lake in the heart of the chaos. Interesting Lake situated and surrounded by the chaos of Hanoi, temple situated on the lake too along with beautiful decorations.We were there over lunar new year which added to the occasion On the south side there is restaurant perfect to relax and watch the city buzz

Worth a walk around. It is a nice walk around the lake to have a look at the buildings surrounding it. Plenty of areas to sit down and have a break either on a bench by the lake or one of the many cafes.
Fresh air and nice walk. Great atmosphere in the early morning once many people coming around. Walked two circles of lake was amazing.
Pretty lake. Very beautiful lake to walk around. The islands in the middle are very pretty. Romantic setting, makes Hanoi feel like a European city. Would definitely visit this place again!

Lake surrounded by Restaurants and Shops. We visited Hoan Kiem Lake during Vietnamese Tet New Year. Never seen so many people with cameras and smiling faces. Hoan Kiem Lake is not a very large lake. One can walk around the lake within 1 hour time. Park with flowers surround the lake. There are many concrete stools around the park so you can just sit, relax and watch the scenery and people going by. The lake is located within walking distance from Old quarter and latin Quarter of Hanoi. There are many restaurants and cafes around the lake area.

A picturesque setting in Hanoi. During the Tet Festival, the weather wasn't the best. Overcast skies during the daytime didn't provide the best skies for shots of the Lake, but at night the lake came alive in splendid color. It was a marvellous sight and a lovely 20-30 minute stroll around it.

A relaxing respite. Hanoi can be oppressive, particularly as a result of its heat, pace of life, and occasionally unfriendly locals - sitting down by the lake is the perfect antidote. Make sure you visit the temple at its centre, and take a walk round at dusk - it becomes a hub of activity, with sports clubs, impromptu gyms, and all sorts of fun.Just make sure you treat anyone claiming to be a 'student of English' with enormous suspicion - they're most likely to be running a scam.

Popular. Definitely a very popular place for the locals to hangout. Also tourists cause it is very near to the shopping places, namely water puppet theatre, night market and shopping streets.At night the lake is beautifully lighted. Expect crowds and heavy traffic too

Neat site in central Hanoi. A lake with an interesting history and folklore surrounding the lake, a turtle and the temple on the lake. It's a great spot to take a coffee and enjoy the walking path around the lake and go into the temple to learn about the fascinating story of the turtle that lives in the lake!
Beautiful in the morning. The place is mystical & it really looks it in the morning when the mist is down. Definitely worth a ramble

Paradise away from chaos. We did not enjoy Hanoi very much, but walking around the lake for an afternoon transported our minds to a much nicer and calmer place. I recommend going for a stroll and getting away from the chaos of Hanoi. It was drizzling when we went and I think that the rain mad it even more beautiful.

Great Place to Stroll and Mingle with Locals. This is a great place to stroll and get a feel for the area. It;s great, as many people have noted, that you experience both the vibrancy of the city as well as the tranquility of the lake. If you are staying in Hanoi, you will want to visit the lake often.

A lovely place to stroll. We've been here during Tet (New Year) and on NY day, it was lovely to walk around the lake with its gorgeous floral displays and see all the locals in their finery having photos taken amongst the flowers. The lake is just bog enough to feel like you had some decent excercise to work off a bit of the yummy food to be had around here.

Worth it to visit the pagoda. Great to jog around, observe the locals relaxing / painting / dancing. Then well worth crossing the red bridge & walking through the pagoda. You realise just how resilient the Vietnamese people have been throughout history - they fended off America, France & even Genghis Khan!

A peaceful oasis in the midst of the noisy city. When you see the lake and its surroundings it feels like you are stepping back in time. There is a magical quality about it, definitely worth visiting and taking a walk around. We saw lots of locals here enjoying the peace and quiet.

Such a gem of Hanoi. When I was planning our Hanoi trip the ONLY place I really wanted to go to was the Huc Bridge in Hoan Kiem Lake. And see it we did, at night, in the morning and at night. Each time I see it I am baffled by it beauty and by how serene and peaceful the place makes me feel. Lovely lovely sight. Hanoi People are lucky to have such a place in the middle of their city. MUST GO PLACE! No trip in Hanoi is complete without seeing this place.

Pleasant area. Lots of people take walks around the lake. The lake shore has the rare sensation of being quite busy while giving away a calm impression. It is nice to see all the people using the lake for recreation and the young couples and friends spending time there, Just sit down and watch the Hanoians live.

A respite from the insanity of Hanoi. Walking around Hoan Kiem Lake is a piece of tranquility in a sea of madness. Not only do you meet interesting people, both Vietnamese and foreign travelers, you can sit at a cafe and enjoy a fresh coconut, or buy books and postcards from vendors walking around. You get a nice feel for Hanoi, also, an overview that makes the city seem manageable. Until you leave the lake.....

Beautiful. A very pleasant walk, things to see and a couple of great restaurants with lake views. The menu was both French and Vietnamese, and there was a wide variety of ice-cream dishes. The ice-cream was to die for!!

Beautiful. The temple in the middle was lovely to visit after crossing the red bridge. Lots of neat bonsai trees there. The experience would be more pleasant if there weren't people trying to get you to buy something or to rent their motorbikes.

The lake itself is not it ..... It is the Ngoc Son Temple and the Tortoise Tower that make the lake interesting. At the Ngoc Son Temple you will find the preserved turtle which lived in the lake and died at age around 100 years (according to our tour guide). The bridge leading to the highly frequented temple is a nice photo op. There are also some real nice mangrove trees, just a few but still.

Interesting stroll in old Hanoi. The stroll around the lake was quite pleasant and a welcome relief from the zany traffic around much of the city. Be sure to pay the small money ($1) to cross the bridge onto the little island which has a great little temple and some interesting information about the giant turtles living in the lake.

Open space in the Old 1/4. We checked into our hotel and went for a walk around the lake. It was very busy and we walked around the lake in about 25 minutes. There were people doing Thai Chi, several wedding parties getting photos and lots of people around putting out fresh flowers and other things in the lead up to the new year. It was a nice walk and is good to see some open space in the middle of the city but not sensational.

A bit of sanity in the middle of Hanoi's beehive. An essential must do in Hanoi. The lake is a distinct change from the bustle around it and so accessible. The bridge has a modest charge but you can skip that and just toddle around and pass through some different neighbourhoods. Lots of scenic photo ops and interesting ppl.

A nice walk at dusk.. A popular place to walk for locals and tourist alike. It offers a nice respite from the busy streets nearby. Best time to visit is at dusk when the light provides good photo ops through the surrounding trees and temple in the middle of the lake.

A glimpse into Hanoi local life. A landmark in the Old Quarter, to walk around the lake takes less than an hour, if you can resist deviating into the side streets branching off the perimeter of the lake. We sat and people-watched on a Sunday afternoon, observing the locals who leisurely stroll around in their pyjamas, the young Vietnamese visiting Hanoi from other towns, the tourists from abroad with cameras hanging from their necks or expats jogging around the lake in their gym shorts. Well worth a visit, even just to park yourselve at a bench and just soak up the day.

Huge Lake with viet life all around. Big lake. You will need arounf 45min of walk to go around. Many benches for taking a rest. A lot of Modern statues. Kids playing, Elderly doing Taishi, playing, dancingA lot of lifeMany trees to hide from the sun during hot summers !
The best thing to do in Hanoi. A high-point of visiting Hanoi is walking around the lake and watching the early-morning exercisers, dancers, badminton players.

Interesting. It's a small lake, but what was interesting was the activities happening around this lake, you'll see a lot of Vietnamese people hanging out here doing all kinds of activities, jogging, walk their dogs, dating, etc. However, this place is also very touristy, watch out for the tourist traps.
Beautiful at night. Great for a stroll and as a picnic stop. Be careful when taking out your money - people are watching.
Loved the mist on the lake. It's just very atmospheric, the mist floating above the surface, a quiet still hub at the heart of the madness that is Hanoi traffic...
Beautiful. Beautiful lake in the centre of hanoi. Go in the morning to see people doing Tai Chi on the banks or go at night to see it all lit up with lights

Actually saw the turtle!. This was my second visit to Hanoi and I never tire of wandering around the lake. It has a mystical look to it in the mistiness of the morning, is beautiful in the clearness of full sunshine, and there are always plenty of people to see if you are into "people watching". The highlight of this visit though was when we were wandering around after a late afternoon performance at the Puppet theatre and we were heading for ice-cream at Fanny's when we spotted a crowd of people gathered in one spot by the edge of the lake. Being inquisitive we wandered over to see what was happening. They appeared to be gazing at the lake - not the clearest of water to be gazing at I might add - when suddenly up popped a turtles head!!!!! Now I would like to think it is THE turtle spoken of - the REALLY old turtle that lives in the lake. And I will believe that even though people back home say there are probably more than one turtle living in there and this one was nothing special but....... Needless to say, the lake is a central point of any visit to Hanoi.
Hoan Kiem Lake. Enjoyed this visit to the temple and the lake. Only about 20p to get in. small gift shops there well worth a visit.
Peaceful Hanoi. The lake gives a beautiful sense of calm. We enjoyed walking to the Pagoda and it is great that these ancient buildings are preserved.
The Heart of the City. I loved walking around this lake. The locals use it extensively in the early morinigs and evenings. Watch Tai chi and badminton.

Beautiful. The lake has plenty of options - there's the temple in the middle, the tortoise tower at the other end, water puppets nearby and of course plenty of people selling trinkets and taxi rides!Head there at night for some impressive lights.

Good place to relax and watch people. As you walk around the lake, you will see people doing exercises, walking their dogs, jogging, relaxing on benches, strolling, doing photo shoots, drawing portraits. Motorcycles and bicycles are not allowed on the sidewalks here, so walking is pleasant. At night you'll see the lights of the city.
the tales of the lake. nice way to start your day in and around hanoi..about 40 mins takes you completely around the lake while watching the traffic and people.

The lungs of Hanoi. . The very center of Hanoi is occupied by an impressive lake bordered by decorative gardens, temples and a pagoda, and a couple of lesser museums. Bridges, the most decorative of which is the red-wood/iron flag-festooned Huc Bridge, lead to islands that break up the expanse of water. A promenade that runs around the lake serves the same function as New York's Central Park for the city’s joggers, and skillfully concealed benches meet the needs of its lovers. The parallel with Central Park is emphasized by the long views across the lake leading to distant vistas of imposing buildings. But when you really analyze it, the park itself is not all that exceptional. The wonder is that in a city so ugly and polluted, it is there at all. It is, literally, a breath of fresh air amid the suffocating squalor of the Old Quarters from which access to it is gained. We were there on a rainy week-day in December. It might be very much better on a festive summer evening, although I will not have a chance to find out.

Great in the morning. Found the lake was great and nice in the morning, Could find out some fresh air and comfortable atmosphere here, some coffee shops next to the Lake were brillitant : City View cafe

Lake of Restored Sword – A Place of Peace and Tranquility in Vietnam. Tourists worried about the noise and traffic of the city of Hanoi will find an excellent escape place of peace and tranquility in Hoan Kiem Lake or the Lake or Restored Sword. Catch a few locals doing their Tai Chi in the morning time. Environment was cool and a little drizzle was there when we arrived at the spot but the crowd was still quite substantial. We were told that the lake was part of Song Hong River and it was known as Green Lake because the water remained green all year round. It is situated within a complex of Ngoc Son Temple with the Huc Bridge and Pen Tower in the background. Highlight of the complex is the Turtle Tower lying in the middle of the Lake reminding people about the Turtle God.

Historic. The tale behind the temple is very poignant. Our guide informed us that there are 2 turtles, both in excess of 500 years, in the lake and apparently, on a good day, you could occasionally spot them when they come up (for fresh air possibly). Worth a visit. Very picturesque in the evenings

Beautiful lake in an interesting city.. This is my second trip to Hanoi.Last one was in March last year. For me the lake was even more beautiful than in my last trip. A calm and quite place to spend some time walking about. During my stay in Hanoi I made a trip to this beautiful lake almost every day. The walkways around the lake is kept clean and tidy. In January it is very nice to walk around the lake in the cool climate . The temple in the lake is also a place to visit.
Serene place amid traffic chaos. Interesting to see ordinary Vietnamese exercising and having wedding photos taken and just enjoying the (relative) calm by the lake.

A little piece of relative calm and tranquility. After the noise and traffic of the old quarter it was so nice to just stroll around this lake, it's probably about 3kms.Best in the early morning to catch a few locals doing their Tai Chi. It was rather cool, 15C, when we were there with light drizzle but still. Refreshing.The temple at the old quarter end of the lake was absolutely packed with locals on Sunday and when we returned the next day, the lady in the kiosk would only take Dong, unusual as most places will take US$ even if the change is given in Dong, so be prepared.Worth doing
Quick Visit. Popped in after having had a walk round the lake. Found I enjoyed more joingin in a dance class being held on the lakeside. Husband and I got applauded for our verison of the quickstep.
That Classic Hanoi Charm. Kind of grungy and run down. Don't think about swimming here. Some interesting night photo ops looking towards the well lit island.
a lake in the centre of Hanoi. walk around the lake at night and take a stroll into Vietnam, watch the people, enjoy the cool weather and eat an ice cream. not to be missed
History. Pretty setting .historical. Great guide informing us all about it.loved walking around in am to see all varieties of exercises eg ball room dancing tai chi

A beautiful spot. After the chaos of the Old Quarter streets we really enjoyed the relative calmness of the lake. It is very pretty and well kept. On Saturday we noticed many bridal couples having photos taken around its edge. The temple in the middle was lovely to visit after crossing the red bridge. A few hawkers selling postcards and books were around the lake and a little pushy but we've seen worse in Bali. It was relaxing to be able to let our boys run around a bit after keeping them close in the busy streets.

Always something to watch. We walked around the lake several times at different times of day and watched early morning exercises, badminton, families walking, young couples meeting, brides and wedding photos, prayers and offerings at the shrine, lanterns at night. Fabulous place to stroll!

Nice to see some form of clean parkland. For a stroll around the lake I enjoyed the atmosphere and attached Ngoc Son Temple.It would be a real feature if they spent more resources beautifying the landscape which would take very little to achieve.Public open spaces that offer ambience and a sense of place to offset the busy streets are not particularly well thought out compared to other asian countries and regions. I think they miss a great opportunity to offer residents and tourists something special in a diverse, managed landscape.

A peaceful place for a stroll. The lake is really beautiful and tranquil. It's great to walk around and watch the locals enjoying the lake - young and old. The red bridge and pagoda are also great photo opportunities!

A nice break from the busy streets. A peaceful and serene landmark,where you can take a break from the organised chaos that is Hanoi street life.Any westerner who sits down for 5 minutes will be soon approached by young Vietnamese people wanting to practice their English.Within 15 minutes I had half a dozen students wanting to be photographed with me.All in all a great experience!
Worth a walk. It's nice to walk around the lake and enjoy the view. There's usually flowers festival here to celebrate the New Year. It's just amazing!
Nice area to stroll around. Lots of cafe's and restaurants in this calming part of the city, despite the hussle and bussle of city trafic. Esthetically pleasing and clean.
Scenic and interesting strolling. Great place to stroll, with another fine scenic view every few feet. Pay the dollar to enter the island temple. It's charming.

A nice walk with some interesting sites.. Brilliant - was an interesting walk and our first introduction to Vietnam. Really nice to see the friendly Vietnamese people out having fun. Was interesting to see some Vietnamese wedding parties out having their photos taken.
window into culture. the lake, bridge and pagoda helped us to understand the cultural past of Vietnam and its history, well worth a visit, incredibly cheap to enter

Probably, the centre of your planning trip.. The Lake is a good spot to get references from. It's worth to have a walk around and to visit the temple sited in the middle. If so, be sure you get your money change back.

Good Place for a Stroll. The lakeside paths are an escape from the congestion and noise on Hanoi's streets. Go early in the morning to watch tai chi, or perhaps to be invited to dance with local people.

Watch your bags. We found that it was good enough just to walk across the bridge over part of the lake to get a good view. We were hastled by people whilst we were trying to take photos so just keep your bags on your fronts.
Great place to walk. Loved the lake and the temple. It was very pleasant at any time of the day. Good reference point to have.

Average and be careful. Beware of pickpockets!!Try not to bring backpacks,camera bags,purse while going there especially at night time!!If really have to...please keep it infront of you or hang around the neck if it is a camera.Well.As i almost fall as a victim when this pick pocket open my backpack from behind but i realized 1st time and confronted him and me and my wife left since we didnt lost anything and has no proof as well!!....well..it is happening everywhere but just be careful!!
Around Hoan Kiem Lake. We saw plenty of locals. Beautiful. It is also popular with wedding couples. One of the more wheelchair friendly places
Picturesque. Interesting lake near the Old Quarter with many locals clamouring to take photos, and some history to share if you cross the bridge!
Best seen in the early morning. A nice stroll next to Old Quarter. It is most interesting in the morning when the locals are excersing there.

worth a walk around. This is one of many lakes in the old area, but like most of Hanoi, is overcrowded with traffic on the road around it. Worth a visit, walk around the boardwalk, have a coffee, and watch the passing traffic

Lovely. What's not to like about Hoan Kiem lake - what a beautiful amenity right in the middle of the action. I think what I like about it most is that there isn't any one side of it that stands out more than the others - there are interesting spots all around it's periphary - from the opera area to the catherderal area - or city view cafe & crazy roundabout to the puppet theatre.
particularly nice at night. You can't help walking along the lake on the way to/from the old quarter. It's also frequented by locals practicing which makes it interesting in the early evening
Breathtaking. The walk around the lake was extremely refreshing especially on a very cold day. Benches were everywhere for resting as the lake is rather big,

People Watching. It is great to wander around the lake and watch the locals going about their business. Young couples having their wedding photos during the day, older Vietnamese people exercising in the early morning. Also a lovely view across the lake and usually an interesting food vendor or two

beautiful gardens. walking around the lake is a great way to spend time getting to know Hanoi. We saw several dance classes, sculptures and floral displays, as well as ordinary citizens playing games.
Good view. Take a walk around or ride your bike around the lake in the day time or night time, it offers you a different view and different feeling

Tranquility in the heart of the city. Around the lake, with the bustlinbg city life in the background, one can have a great time to sit back and relax or take a confortable jogging around the lake in the early morning hours, when the air is fresh and not so poluted yet.
It's a Fun place for Sightseeing & Shopping. It's a nice area for shopping for souvenirs or even shirts. Then afterwards, you can see the beautiful Hoan Kiem Lake along. Nice

it's a big pond. The folklore and temple of the lake is much more special than the visual. It took about an hour to walk around the temple was nice. The lake is located at the hub of the touristy shopping.

Really beautiful. We were here on New Year's Eve. The lake was surrounded by lights and it looked very festive. The lake is in the middle of a nice part of Hanoi. It's lined with restaurants and other tourist points of interest.

Great for some photography. A fairly large lake surrounded by trees in the middle of the city. Nice place to sit and relax and have a nice ice cream from the creameries on the north-west corner of the lake.

Nice huge lake to take a breath in bustling Hanoi. Right in town, part of it is actually surrounded by the famous Old Quarter area.
Very nice lake to walk around, lively area, lots of cafés and restaurants in the area.

A haven from the city in the city. We walked all the way around the lake and it was busy with people exercising, walking, reading or just sitting and enjoying the peace. The lake is surrounded by chaotic traffic but all this seems to disappear once you focus on the lake.
the center of Hanoi. The lake is in the center of Hanoi, is full of fish and there is also a little cafè where you can drink a cafè and look the traffic in Hanoi. But nothing special.
NIce place to stroll around. Its tranquil and beautiful. Nice lake to take a morning and evening walk. Don't forget to stop by the temple and a photo shot by the bridge.
A landmark. The lake is a landmark and a meeting place for everyone. In the middle of the city, it provides a peaceful space.

Gorgeous lake and temple. The centrally located lake is definitely worth a visit. There is a temple across the bridge that is really beautiful. Lots of neat bonsai trees there. We actually saw a turtle raise its head up, it looked huge! Locals doing tai chi and badminton.

One way or another, you are going there anyway. I think it is virtually impossible to miss the lake. If you pass through the old quarter you will definitely get there one way or another. The lake has a temple which is quite interesting, where one can see Buddha statues and also a giant turtle. Also, there are some nice options for eating. The "city view" cafe and restaurant has awesome views to the lake and surprisingly is quite affordable (around 5 dollars a meal).

Hoan Kiem Lake. Beautiful bit of serenity in the middle of the bustling city of Hanoi! Great place to navigate around while walking around. Bridge in the middle of the lake to a temple has a small entry fee. Recommend to stay in the Old Quarter close to the lake.

Iconic place in Hanoi. The closer you get to the lake, the greater the sense of peace and tranquility, being away from the busy and noisy streets. We walked around the lake and enjoyed the cool breeze and pretty lotus flowers. The experience would be more pleasant if there weren't people trying to get you to buy something or to rent their motorbikes.

Beautiful, tranquil and scenic. It was amazing how one gets a different experience depending on the time of the day you walk by the lake. As our hotel was just across from the lake, we walked by the lake daily to get to the various places of interest. It was always very pleasant and we would always stop to sit and simply relax.

Beautiful Sight. Could see lake from our hotel room and easily walk to it. The lake is home to a huge turtle and it is said if you see the turtle you will receive good luck. Many local people as well as tourists enjoy walking around the lake or sitting on a bench and relaxing. There is also a bridge one can walk across to reach the other side. There is a nominal fee to use the bridge. On the other side of the lake from where we were is the original puppet theater.
I love strolling around this lake. This is a lovely little lake in the middle of the Old Quarter in Hanoi. Easy to walk around and lots of cages and shops abound. Don't miss it!

Circumnavigate and wander/wonder. And cross the bridge to the temple (small charge). We found a café with reasonable coffee. Lake is constantly circled by a stream of traffic so don't expect peace (you need botanical gardens for that or around the Mausoleum).

WE saw the Turtle!. the supposedly rare turtle in the lake appeared the morning we arrived. A friend who lives there said she jogs around the lake and had never seen it! We think this will be a lucky year!

Great place to spend an evening. Very lovely place to walk around at any time of the day, but the evening hustle and bustle was fun to stroll through. Many cafes and restaurants to sit, drink or have a snack. Avoid the rickshaw tour around the lake, it is quite expensive, very short and not really worth it. You're better off just exploring on your own.

nice to morning welcome. this is a nice place to wake up your senses joining tai chi or fitness class groups, having a run or simply meditate a few steps from traffic and streets of old quarters. appreciated.

Ignore the motorbikes. Do the temple on the island during the day and then a romantic stroll at night to see the lights. It will seem a muddy pond at first but gradually the charm of the place sinks in.

Hanoi Lake. Seems like everyone gets to the lake at some point in the day. Early morning Tai Chi or again at sunset. Others just stroll with someone or looking for someone. Many hope to see the turtles. Many good restaurants surround the lake but be careful crossing streets, there are very few traffic lights

The center piece of Hanoi. In the mist of the chaos in old quarters, you can find some peace in Hanoi city. Getting to the lake especially from the old quarters can be a challenge with traffic. But once you reach the lake it can be a different world. Take time to visit the temple and the tower and take some pictures. Its worth the time and good break from all the shopping.
Hoan Kiem Lake. Attractive open area. Able to watch people exercise, loved the tai chi, walk, talk and a great ambience of a wonderful city.

The lake. This is the lake everybody talks about. Its really not that special in any way but it is welcome distraction from the busy dirty streets of Hanoi. Main market street to the north and the more luxuruious hotels ans bars to the south east.
Busy all day long. Even at 11pm on a week night there were people walking around the lake. Very relaxing just walking and doing some people watching after eating dinner nearby. Seems so safe!

Lovely By Day, Better By Night. Hoan Kiem Lake is a refreshing break from the hustle of Hanoi, and a lovely place to go for a stroll, to sit by the lake and enjoy an ice cream and watch the people go by. By night, it is even more enjoyable, with romance in the air amid the lovely paths that surround the lake. On some nights, the pagoda, bridge, and embankments are illuminated by colored lighting that really enhance the atmosphere. Some good cafes and restaurants surround the lake, so you really can make an evening of it.

the lake of legend. We spent 2 days in hanoi before heading to Halong bay ,it is great view from the city view cafe .especially in the morning , you can see alot of local running for the morning excercise.
Good for an easy stroll. More than the lake, the Red Bridge & the Ngoc Son shrine are highlights. The Water Puppet Museum is in front of the lake.
Beautiful place. It is a beautiful place in the middle of the city. It has two temples in two small islands. It is a very frequented place. Ideal for joggers.

Neat to have a lake in the city. The lake itself didn't seem very clean and we didn't care. It is lovely to have it in the city like this and all the shops and restaurants around the lake including the walking paths was a nice break in a hectic city though I loved Old Quarter!!

Go & have à look. Its oxygen that you need watch out for rogue taxi drivers from here. At night lit up its Nice and IF you can't sleep go watch everybody doing their early morning exercices! When you see them you realize we are paying far too much to our fitness centres in Europe!

Lake runs. For those of us who stay in the Old Quarter area during our Hanoi trips, this lake makes for a pleasant jogging track, where you are accompanied on your runs by locals doing their exercises in the mornings, and boys playing football and doting couples on walks in the evenings. I would recommend giving your hotel gym a miss and going for a Lake run instead, if weather permits.

Let's say it's a must to go but dont expect much. It's actually just a lake with lots of trees surrounding. The temple in the middle and the red bridge are ok though. I think everyone go to Hanoi must at least visit there I guess.

Place to meet and understand the local people. Beautiful and serene lake The locals are here exercising or just sitting. Wedding couples taking photos.We just love walking along the lake amidst the hooting traffic! We hope one day the locals will just stop hooting an dbe patience. Have never heard so much hootings other than in Ho Chih Min City.;)The peaceful lack is a contrast from the traffic surrounding it.You can even have a picnic there.The lights come up in the evening and it is really goregeous. lights on trees, etc....Have fun!
Just a lake. It was great when we travelled during X Mas but on any other day it's just a place for locals to mooch around etc.. Some good restaurants around the area.

Best place to go for a morning jog. If you're like me and need to maintain a fitness regimen even while on vacation, a visit to picturesque Hoan Kiem Lake is a must. Luckily our hotel was located in the Old Quarter which meant we had easy access to the Lake. This is hands-down the best place for a morning jog and to people- watch. If you're a tourist, stroll around the lake and snap photos of French Colonial buildings and by the iconic Morning Sunlight Bridge then rest your feet and have a cup of cafe sua da at Highlands Coffee.
Fresh in the morning. I walked around the Lake Hoan Kiem for some morning, the place was a nice atmosphere in the morning because of crazy vehicles for the whole day.

Lots of shady trees and good place for people watching!. It is a good place to have coffee and a snack and watch senior citizens play chess and mingle. It would be nice if the temple/structure on the small island which was not accessible had descriptions of its purpose and history. The endangered preserved turtle on display was also a fine attraction.

Average. The lake is not very big, looks rather nice and ordinary for a lake but beyond that nothing special. We were there in November, temperature was mid 20deg.cel so it was nice for a short stroll and some photography.Beware of dog's poop.

Where the locals gather. It is best seen in early morning (6-7 am). Talk a walk around the lake and people watch: lots of locals doing Tai chi, QI gong, exercises, dance, praying, etc. Beautiful red bridge that is a great photo spot; embraces traditional Vietnamese culture with its Chinese roots. Also less traffic noise in the early morning so somewhat more zen. Come back later in the day so you can visit the temple for a modest entrance fee.

Nice Lake and folks, but dirty.... If you like a quiet walk around a large lake this is a nice place to start. All ranges of ages, shapes, cultures and sizes here. Photo ops everywhere. Worth a look and take walking shoes.
heart of Hanoi. enjoyed a walk around the lake, especially in the mid afternoon where young local couples sit on benches. Good feel for the center of Hanoi
Beautiful Lake. Love to stroll by the lake to see how people - young and old meet up, enjoy and relax there. Great atmosphere.

A pleasant stroll and a great sight for people watching. We found that a walk around the lake was a good way to relax after the hustle and bustle of the streets around it. We particularly liked it in the early mornings - starting at 6 or earlier, when residents of Hanoi came out to do their daily exercises: sometimes in ones or twos, but often in large groups with music and a person leading the exercise.
Great atmosphere. An interesting find in Hanoi Old's quarter, we could walk around the lake for taking photos, got some funs. Some side-lake coffee shops were definitely great taste

Watch the goings on. It is a nice place to watch people. Many do their daily exercise here. I observed tai chi, ball room dancing, aerobics, fast walking with a lot of arm movement while holding little weights in hand and I am sure I noticed several Kath and Kel style joggers (Aussies might get this). The Lake is beautiful at night with the lights reflecting.

Nice Walk, but keep guard up.. This is a scam that happened to my husband and I 2 years ago when we were here. A young man in a suit...which was a couple sizes too small by the way, approached us and asked where we were from. We replied " United States" and he got enthusiastic. He spoke pretty good English, and insisted we join him for some food and drink. A lady with him had a food cart and he claimed this was his sister. It was late at night, and although we didn't want to stay long, we didn't want to be rude, so we joined him. After we thanked him, he wrote down a huge amount of money he claimed we owed him. When we tried to reason with the jerk, he suddenly began "forgetting" his English. We reluctantly gave money just to get him off our backs, but he still wanted more. This was a big scam, and we realized it because no cops or anyone else was around. Hanoi Police would frown upon these scams. I hope this helps others in the future. Thanks for reading!

A nice break from the honking. The walkways along the lake were a welcoming "breather" from all the honking ... you can still hear them, but I felt more zen that the noise is not right beside you. At night, the temples are lit up and it's quite nice.

Perfect for a quiet stroll. Great way to enjoy the city and fill some spare time before a showing at the water puppet theatre or following lunch.Also: on the northwest edge is a small ice cream shop. Beware, it's entirely in Vietnamese but the prices are incredibly nice—perfect for a warm day!

To relax. There are many benches for people to sit on around the lake. A good place to relax and it is very near the busy Old Quarter. In the middle of the lake is the Ngoc Son Temple and nearby is the Thang Long Water Puppet Theatre.

worth visiting. this a lovely well looked after lake ,with interesting sculptures and Ngoc Son temple.It is quite calming to walk around it especially after the chaos of the traffic. Worth seeing at night as well as day.

hoan kiem lake. one of my favorite places in hanoi. very interesting place to be. people there are very friendly.have made many friends there. have walked there many times during stays in hanoi.here is allways something going on people exercising .walking singing and in evenings could see dance.
Relaxing. Relaxing to walk around, nice view. The place is near the water puppet theatre, so go buy the tickets and while waiting fror the show, it's nice to take a stroll along the lake.

A relaxing place where locals hang out. It's very interesting to see local couples, young families, elderly and pets all gathered around this beautiful lake. One evening, we even saw a group of muscular men with their weight-lifting equipment doing their exercise by the lake! Buy your favourite ice-cream and sit down on one of the benches by the lake and soak in Hanoi!

People and nature watching. I enjoyed walking around the lake, watching the families, trying to guess where the various tourists were from. An easy walk from our hotel, and close to good restaurant choices.

Picturesque lake in the busy Old Quarter. What a great place to stop, sit, and just enjoy the tranquility. Despite the hustle and bustle of the Old Quarter around it, the lake offers an oasis of serenity to a tired traveler. Lovely temple in the middle of the lake too, worth a visit.

The city centre landmark. Our guide said if you haven't been to Sword Lake you haven't been to Hanoi. Scenic day or night,
Knowing where we were relative to the lake kept us from getting really lost.

A lake with a temple in the middle. Nice place to take photographs right in the centre of Hanoi city. You could take a stroll around the lake. The temple in the middle looks great especially in the night.
Lovely lake. Beautifully situated, scenically satisfying, pleasant venue for walking, Red Bridge leading to pagoda, worth a look. Close to shopping, restaurants and Old Quarter

Early morning scene - not to be missed. From 6 AM to about 7:30 perhaps over a thousand people are exercising around the lake. Many groups doing aerobics with a boombox. Some are ballroom dancing. Some are just doing exercises or yoga or tai-chi solo. Some are hula-hooping with a string of big wooden balls. Some just walk briskly around the lake. All ages.

Hoan Kiem Lake. It's a wonderful lake, yeah very nice with trees and you can feel how about feel fresh air in here. It's near old streets of Ha noi, where you will find many interesting things. Let's go there and you'll see how I love it
Completely it worth it!. Just buy the postcard. The section nearer to the water puppet show is filthy and just not the romantic or beautiful place I thought it would be. Maybe if you go at 5am

The Lake. Nice for a walk around the lake, and a trip over the bridge to the little temple in the middle. We got a few good bargains in the shop there as well. Lots of ATMs nearby if you need them, and in the middle of the Old Quarter so there's lots to look at nearby. Couples go here for wedding photos (often years after the actual wedding) because it's so scenic.

Be there at 6 am or you miss all the action. 6am, as the sun is rising, go for an energetic walk around Hoan Kiem lake. Don't be late or you'll miss the most interesting, entertaining and energetic bits! It will take you about 20 minutes to walk all the way round - Go round twice and check how many of the following you manage to find: > men's weightlifting group - they haul all their equipment out of a lock-up across the road and establish a pop-up gym for an hour;> ball-room dancing, very energetic, be prepared to glide on the edge of the lake - you may well be invited to join in and would be welcome if you did;> tai- chi for older women - graceful and slow moving usually around thirty people in unison;> kick badminton - some impressive if un-classical moves but very impressive to see how long a badminton thing ( what's it called?) can be kept off the ground floating over a net or flying between people;> huge gym class on a playing field with loudspeakers and lots of participants - you might even see the overflow class across the road nearer to the lake;> hundreds of others doing their own thing - every style of exercise and movement; every part of the body (well, almost) getting a workout.be there after 7 and it's a nice place for a stroll ( especially in evening again) but you'll have missed all the action!
a lovely site. A lovely site in the heart of the old quarter. great history and don't miss the story of the turtles of the lake

A place to calm you down with its calm water. Places and streets around this lake are too busy. This is the lake to rest and calm down. Just sit around the lake and look far beyond and opposite the lake or enjoy the peaceful calm water. It's the place to destress.Do enjoy the drink , corn etc sold by the vendors. It is also a place to rest your tired legs after much walking around the streets in the old quarters. At least it provides some fresh air and breeze .
small site, nice to take a photo. many newly married couples are taking photos around the lake. Old nice pagoda and the bridge.Walking distance from Old Quarter and Puppet Theatre is right there

Peaceful and amazing in the centre of it all. Take a visit to the little island over the bridge. Worth a visit and if I recall correctly it was only a couple of US$. Quite often you will see wedding photos being taken on the bridge.

Nice place to people watch. The grounds around the lake consist of everything from restaurants to hedge sculptures. The most fascinating part of the lake are the people who frequent the area. We saw hawkers, old people, young lovers and everything in-between. Day or evening the experience is fun. As for the pagoda on the lake - I wouldn't bother. Other than the dead turtle in the pagoda - nothing different than any of the other 4 we say that day.

Around Hoan Kiem Lake. It was nice taking a stroll around the lake which is at the heart of the city. Walking around noon and at night provided different experiences. Walking around the lake provided lots of good photo opportunities. It was a peak wedding season when we were there and we saw lots of young couples who were either just married or going to be married soon (not sure about this) being photographed in their traditional attires by professional photographers around the lake. Just walk around and relax at the lake-side benches. Also, savor a cup of hot or cold Vietnamese tea/coffee as you idle around.
Quick side trip. Not a lot to see, good photo opportunity. If you have a few minutes to spare, check it out, but not a must see for us.

Great place for taking strolls. If you visit Hanoi, you HAVE to take a stroll in this park as well. This place is right in the middle of the city, it's very picturesque and will give you plenty of opportunities to return home with wonderful photos. Lots of people jogging and working out or simply taking walks or quietly admiring the scenery. This place is crowded with people, but in a good way. It's a great place to socialize with the locals, many know English and are happy to help you out if you need directions. We tested that and experienced only smiles and positive attitudes. We loved that!

A nice lake in the middle of city. A nice lake right in the heart of city with well maintained walkway offering locals and tourists a good place for morning or evening stroll. Has a small temple in the middle, lot of greenery around, markets etc. You can spend some good time alone, with friends or family and relax. Do visit once

Walk the lake. Wow what a beautiful place to walk around night or day!!! There were literally thousands of people day or night walking around, exercising, talking, selling things and couples enjoying each others company. It was the catalyst for a lot of social gatherings!!!
Pretty sight in town.. This a nice place to sit down and relax and view the scenery. Lots of trees and benches to sit on. It would be a good walk around it but could be done.
Hoan Kiem Lake, a Hanoi landmark. Nice place, surrounded by a lot of tourist buzz. Great place to walk around in the evenings. A bit difficult to cross the roads though, so be careful.
Atmospheric; good place for a refreshment break. Walk around the Lake and the surrounding area. Stop for a refreshment break at one of the outdoor seating areas. Early morning see tai chi exercisers.

Go here and practice your English.. Hanoians actually use this area as a school and a gym.Young people chat you up just to practice their English. Take advantage and get to know the locals. They are a great source of information and easy to talk to. Very safe area once you get across the street
Go early in the morning.. Be sure to take a camera. Great free entertainment and peaceful as the city swirls around you. This is quintessential Hanoi.

Serene. THis picturesque and serene lake is a focal point of Hanoi public life, giving tourists great photo opportunities especially when the air is still and the water mirroring the surrounding trees and structures and if you are really lucky you may see the elusive soft shelled turtle which inhabits the lake as we did.This is a must stop for any visitor and and pay the 20,000 dong fee to enter the Jade mountain Temple after crossing the Huc Bridge.

Good for relaxation & jogging.. The scenic view and cool weather make it a good place to relax with a cup of coffee at the cafe beside the lake or just relax on the bench around the lake. It also a good place for exercise & jogging.

Watch the locals promenade on Sunday. Very popular with the local population, Hoan Kiem Lake is calm and photogenic - day or evening. Once you've run the gauntlet of motor cycles to get lakeside, enjoy a walk from the Old Quarter down to the French Quarter and the Opera House, where there's a great coffee shop on the East side.

A quick visit. This does get crowded so try to go early. You approach approach via a little red bridge and pay a nominal fee. Stop to enjoy a lovely view of the lake and, quite possibly, a bride and groom having their photos done.Once inside there is a little temple, a preserved turtle and a gift shop. When i visited there was also a man doing calligraphy scrolls.

Nicely lit up. Take a walk around in the evening (along with hundreds of other people). The bridges and the pagoda in the middle are lit up nicely as are the edges which makes it look great. Have your phone handy in case there's a electrical failure as when all the lights go out in that area as happened to me one night, you can't see a thing!

Stunning. Who would of thought Hanoi could offer such a serene place to visit, whilst the traffic passes you by. Great to walk around during the day, and a spectacular view at night with the lights surrounding it. Definitely worth the visit if you are only in Hanoi for a short tome.

Great Central Point. The lake is lovely to walk around day or night. Always feel safe and great to watch people exercising, couples strolling - nice for just a seat to rest your weary feet in between bouts of shopping! Never seemed to be anyone selling anything here so it was nice for a break from the constant pester. Its was also a great reference point for negotiating around Old Quarter - we always kept in mind where the lake was from our current position and then once we had found our way back to the Lake we could find our way to our Hotel

Serene picture. Cool scenery. In the evening, a number of locals jogging around the lake, and having some sort of tai-chi group. The sight of the pagoda in middle of the lake is very nice at night. A number of photographer available around the lake, especially near the red bridge to take your photos for a fee. This lake was always our reference meeting point with our group during the visit to Old Quarters

Much prettier by night. Well worth a visit. Kind-of happened upon this lake by chance as it is only a couple of hundred metres from hotel.Shared by locals and visitors alike. Enjoying a weekend stroll or meeting to walk the perimeter.Most impressive view at night, especially from Avalon cafe 7th floor - see my review.You can walk on red foot-bridge and take a photo and visit the little island - Dng 20,000 ($1)

Perfect place to people watch. This lake is wonderful purely for the people around it. You can see young children fishing, older people doing their morning or evening exercises and tai chi and at night, entire families come out to enjoy the cool and the atmosphere and the kids run around without a worry. There are a few good places to relax and have a drink or meal around the lake and you don't really get hassled by hawkers too much. It is cute watching the couples at night on their motorbikes and the pre-wedding photos!
Beautiful at night!. This is a very popular place with tourist and locals alike. It is quite stunning at night with the bridge alight and the hustle and bustle of the city.

Time to Chill. A great place to spend a couple of hours at the end of a tiring day - away from the bustle of the main roads and endless motobikes, cycles and people. watch the locals go about their early evening, exercise, play games, talk, let their children run free. The bridge is pretty and makes for a great photo location. The only let down is the temple over thebridge which is not worth paying to enter.
Lakeside. Good walk round lake with shady places to sit and cooldown. Picturesque bridge and temple at north end. Good cafes and restaurants round lake.

Centre of old Quarter activity. Great place to get your bearings , see the locals do what they do, both day and night- close to food outlets and every variety of shopping for us tourists.
Have fun crossing the road. don't trust 'cross' signals.
Great atmosphere. Very nice to walk around. Surrounded by shops and restaurants. Great atmosphere for exploring. Also good for relaxing and looking out for the Hoan Kiem Turtle.

Peaceful gap in hectic city. We walked the length of the lake, seeing a local wedding- it is used as setting for wedding photos- to the Ngoc Son Temple, after a visit to the recommended National Museum of Vietrnamese History (this has a lovely cafe restaurant with excellent food and drink at reasonable prices.

Good place for a stroll and to people watch. This is where you can see many locals exercising in the early morning and late in the day brides having their pictures taken - seems to happen on most days but on auspicious days (such as 10 Nov 2012 and next year 11 Dec 2013) it is especially busy. You can walk right round the lake easily and perhaps combine a visit to the old city. Ngoc Son Temple worth a visit too.

Be carefull with cashier. Nearly robbed.. It was my first 2 hours in Hanoi. i wanted to buy entrance ticket i gave 500 000 note, i expect to get 480 000 change, but get only 180 000. i blocked the ticket booth to take my money back, spent 40 min to explain as the cashier forget english immediately and asked 3 locals to help her rob me. They started to count money and tickets. Said i gave 200 000 note, but it was 500 000. I waste much time to get my money back. After all local guy gave me a hug, but i was ready to kick his a**.

Nice lake hang out, soaking in the local way of life. The lake is surrounded by roads but keeps its serenity. A great place to relax and end your day. Many locals hang around here in the evening time. You'll see locals playing chinese chess, exercising etc...

Natural beauty and full of fresh- air. Just small lake but Restored Sword is considered the heart of Hanoi and it is true 100%. Very clean, beautiful and full of fresh- air. We are surprised with no beggars anymore in this area. This peaceful lake must be the best area for relax after 1 day keep walking around Hanoi.
Nice for a walk as well as people watching. Enjoyed walking around the lake. Also nice to sit on a bench for a while and watch the locals doing their exercises. A spot of peace in a hectic city.
Nice walk in the evening. Close to the Art Hotel and a nice place to have a relaxing walk. Also close to the Water Puppet Theatre and an excellent coffee shop!

Calm gentle area to catch your breath.. The lake surrounds are nicely developed with gardens, seats and firm paths, all of which make strolling easy. The are all sorts of people doing the same thing which adds to the interest. Great to just sit and watch the world pass by. Relaxing.

Bland as the water it holds. Snippets of Hanoi-an life can be gleaned from walking ard the lake. You do see married couples taking bridal photos and people just taking it slow.But I was bored out of my gills. There's no scenery. Just a huge body of water that isn't an ocean for chrissakes. Sure, it's quieter and more tranquil than the old quarter but barely so. The relentless horns tooting and lead-infused air still permeate this area. Not worth a visit in its own right unless u view it in context of Hanoi which is boring in general.

Lovely to walk around. This is a beautiful lake in the middle of the Old Quarter, such a nice area to walk around on a sunny day. The pagoda in the middle is nothing special, really it just contains a gift shop and a bizarre gigantic (fake?) turtle. The true beauty of this place is walking around the outside.

Good for either a brisk walk or amble.. Beautiful at all times of the day . Great to sit and people watch . Vietnamese couples come here to have their wedding photos taken. Tradition is that they have them done prior to the wedding in different attire. People of all ages do excercises usually early morning and evening. Expect to be approached by students wanting to practice English, they were all very charming.
magic lake. I love walking around the lake, seeing the people sitting around, all types, sizes and shapes. The gorgeous trees, some of which are hanging in the water. I love it - very peaceful.

No sword but the turtles are in the lake. This part of Hanoi is much more quite to wander around. The streets are broader and the traffic does not seem as heavy as in the old quarter. And it is quite down by the lake wher you can sit and watch the turtles coming to the surface once in a while
Central reference point. The temple is worth a visit but really the lake is the main reference point for this part of the city if you are on foot and for us was the focal / orientation point

If your in the district, this is the place to go, including the Pagoda.. If you like to walk around lakes, you'll like this one. It's quiet, given the tens of thousands of people walking around it. It has two restaurants on the water; one above the other. I recommenced the upper one. Delicious, excellent service and has live Vietnamese music.

A Must At Sunrise!!!. If you exercise or otherwise are an early riser, you owe it to yourself to see the Hoan kiem Lake in the very early morning. In November, the Hanoi sunrise is about 6:30 AM and I made my way each day the short distance from my hotel at 6:15 AM. Quite a few locals will be walking next to you also heading to the Lake. You will be surprised that literally hundreds, maybe thousands, of exercisers are already there. There are badminton partners, tai chi classes (with fans, sticks, swords), aerobics groups, a ballroom dance class and many others doing all kinds of exercises. Mostly old or older people but there are also young joggers, people on crutches, in wheelchairs, etc.No where in my travels have I ever experienced this kind of enthusiasm for exercise. It is not to be missed.Oh, and yes the lake is big, beautiful. picturesque, blah, blah, blah but it is the people that make the experience!!!

Very beautyful little temple. U gotta see this, so u can say that u have seen the turtle ;-)It really is a beautyful temple. And a very special bridge when u are going over there, cause many wedding pictures are taken on that bridge. (and guys, there is something to look at)

Great Pics and traquil setting!. The pics i took of the lake came out really awesome. People fishing in the lake, various yoga and exerciser groups hanging around the outside. You can also catch the buses here to other parts of the city. Nice to chill out and have a beer or just watch the world go by.

A slice of local life. Fascinating to walk slowly around this lake and observe what's going on - tai chi, family gatherings, couples, conversations, it's a real glimpse into local life. Depending on the time of day or season you visit, you'll have different experiences. Plenty of side streets to wander off to, and the red bridge / temple is very photogenic. Fantastic at night and very early morning.
On sunset. Romantic on sunset. Over the lake. Hanoi around. Nice atmosphere. Good pictures. Easy and fast to visit.

Nice for a stroll. Very well kept cleanliness wise, you will see skaters, skateboarders, children, lovers and groups strolling around the lake. There is a bridge which leads to an island and it is lit up in the night. Ask about the story of the lake.

Soak up the energy of Hanoi. A walk around the circumference of Hoan Kiem Lake is an excellent way to soak up the energy of Hanoi - without the worry about being run over or tripping over motorbikes, people eating etc. The lake itself is atheistically pleasing, especially at night, and is right in the heart of the city. A slow stroll around here is a great way to begin or end an evening.
beautiful Lake at night. The whole lake is lit up with different colour of lightings at night and it's really beautiful. a walk around the lake is a must if you visit Hanoi.
Pleasant area to walk. Enjoyed a walk around the lake just to people watch.At night is a prettyplace to eat with a few lights around the lake
Great for people watching. Charming little lake, try to sit around on the side not near the old quarter. There is a Pho 24 there...delicious!
No excalibur here. A nice lake, and small enough to walk around - unlike West Lake - but spoilt by being hassled all the time (shoe shine, taxis, etc.)

Interesting Place. The lake, though not very large, has an interesting history andthe early cultural links are obvious from the monuments there. Its location, being near the old quarter and all the shops, enhances its attractiveness and its also within walking distancefrom the old quarter area. It seems very crowded and busy, andthere are inadequate benches to rest and relax. Convenientlylocated to allow visitors to make multiple walking ' tours ' nearby.

Nice place to walk around. It was a lovely place to have a walk with the children. Nice wide pathway with beautiful trees surrounding. We visited the temple as well. Lots of interesting things to look at for the kids..

Wonderful place. Spend some time there and mix with the people.
Located in the heart of Ha Noi, it is a favourite spot for both locals and tourists.
Beautiful and Peacefull. The entire lake is beautiful and you should visit this small and very peaceful little island that has an interesting history.

Triple visited lake. Hoan Kiem lake is at its most beautiful at night whent the many coloured lanterns in the surrounding trees are lit up, and the small pagoda in the middle is underlit with a yellow glow. It takes about 30-40 minutes to walk around it and have time to stop and watch various other people being romantic or selling various unnecessary goods. After stealing a kiss and heading back to your hotel its worth getting up really early to get back to the lake and watch or join in the old Hanoians in their exercise... it's truly entertaining and healthy at the same time. They employ a strange mix of limb swinging, bum wiggling and body dipping each morning to stay healthy, and by the looks of them it works. After that it's worth grabbing some breakfast taking in some sights of the old quarter and returning the third and final time to walk around at midday, get a famous and expensive ice cream from the West shore of the lake (across the road) and check out the temple that has a big embalmed turtle in it. Finish off by grabbing a beer with a view of the crazy road junction on the north shore of the lake and marvel at the locals systemless driving that somehow works.

Practice your English with a Viet friend!. In one pass around this small, but picturesque lake, I was asked to sit and speak with 3 people, only for the experience of sharing English. I am 63 and not particularly attractive, but this friendliness was quite charming.

Nice and cool. There's a temple across the red bridge of this lake. Have to purchase admission tickets to the temple. It's cheap but still not worth the time. There's nothing much inside. Try the restaurant situated at the side of the lake. Sitting by the lake having a meal is surprisingly breezy even though it was lunch time. The price is about US$7 and above for a meal excluding drinks. We our lunch while waiting for the afternoon matinee of the water puppet show. The theatre is just across the road.
For a late nice afternoon. Make a nice walk around the lake, take drink with Nems or spring rolls, and finished the day by the "Water poppies spectacle", it's an one hour kind spectacle
Pretty feature of Hanoi. Lovely lake to stroll around. Visit to Fanny's for ice cream is a must. We didn't make it to the Huc Bridge nor visit the temple on the island.

Calm, beautiful respite in Hanoi. This is Hanoi's most important urban water feature and a crucial geographic reference point. It's never far away and it's a perfect place to have a (relatively) quiet stroll when you need a break from Hanoi's fascinating but frenetic street life.

A piece of calm in a hectic city. Nice to stroll around or maybe have a drink over looking the lake. Not a great deal to see here although good for people watching and visiting the temple on the island.

Temple at the Lakeside. The temple had some unique features. One of them was the pagoda that paid homage to the prominent monks that used to live there. The lake was beside the temple but now it looked more like a river after the waters was detoured for city development. The lake did not seem too fantastic to me but the history of the temple was worth a visit.
Centrepiece of Hanoi. You are bound to pass by this lake at least 2x a day. Not serene at all, too many people, both local and tourist, and the very very noisy traffic. Worth a visit
nice park. Nothing special. A nice place in the center of the city, but it is rather drab overall. The temple was okay but I have seen much better in the other Asian countries.
