Promenade, Ha Noi Style. This is the focal point of Ha Noi. Every morning and evening it is filled with people walking, exercising, chatting...it is also something of a tranquil island in a sea of motorbikes. Highly recommended that you do a stroll round the lake of an evening after dinner and then get an ice cream at one of the kiosks. A nice way to end the day.
Expected peace and quiet. but the constant hum of traffic around killed that idea. The lake was actually really green and filthy looking.

Nice lakeside walk. A walk about the lake is a nice, relaxing experience. Many shaded areas with public seating for contemplation and reading. End up back at Cau Go and look for the Highlands Coffee Bar on the 3rd floor. Great view of the lake, the city traffic and great coffee.

a relaxing place in the middle of a chaotic city. If you need a place to chill out after navigating the narrow, vendor-laden streets of the Old-Quarter, this is definitely the place to go. It's been a staple of our day during our visit in Hanoi with our dog! There are great paths and lawns to walk through or run along if you need some exercise or just a breath of air away from traffic.
like some exercise walk around the lake. I think you need some guides to explain the significance of place and more information of the history of the lake

A special space peaceful and quiet street between busy travel chaos. There were a lot of lakes in Hanoi. Lake of Restored Sword Hoan Kiem was a special space peaceful and quiet street between busy travel chaos. A small island with a pagoda can be reached via a red-painted bridge. Where a healthy atmosphere drifts, more than anything else in the morning, because there is no danger that I feel. Some grass, benches, relaxing waterside. There is a cafe selling snacks and ice cream along the lake, terrace. I had a bit annoyed when the hawkers bother... Light up the night the lake was beautiful. Lake has become a place of recreation, a large number of people gathered at night, out of a variety of shops, the north side of the lake is particularly lively.

Nice but lots of scammers. This was a pleasant place to walk around and to see the temple on the bridge. Beware there are many scammers mainly book sellers trying to sell overpriced books who dont take no for an answer and also women who trick you to take a photo with their fruit peddler equipment and straw hat then demand money, we got tricked into this, then the woman shoved bananas in my hand while her friend took money off my partner and then demanded more off me! I was unaware of this at the time and was pissed off when i found out how much they had robbed us - i later saw these women again and confronted her about her thieving ways....she knew she was in the wrong because she looked scared and ran. Beware there are lots of wolves dressed in sheep's clothing.

Nice break from the Hanoi streets. Beautiful lake. Nice and quiet. You may get hustled to buy stuff you probably don't want, especially near the fountain on the north end of the lake. But once you get to the lake, you'll find peaceful surroundings, and a bunch of locals just doing their thing. The lake is at its absolute best in the early mornings, when you can find people practising Tai Chi, but any time is fine.

Beautiful lake. Located in the heart of city. A perfect recreational place. You can see people jogging, playing badminton, or just sit on the bench and relax. If you are tired of walking around old quarters, this is the place where you can take a break and enjoy the creation of mother nature.

Beautiful. I very like this place! The lake is a famous historical place of Hanoi capital. Hoan Kiem Lake is the center of the city. The lake is the city's most popular strolling ground and a lovers' lane at night with couples locked in embrace on benches or parked motorbikes looking out over the placid waters, the shadows of overhanging willows cast by moonlight. In the morning the lake area is crowded with folks out for their morning exercise -- running or walking in a clockwise circle around the lake or joining in with the many tai chi, martial arts, calisthenics, aerobics, and even ballroom dancing groups that meet in the open areas at water's edge. It is a useful locator for navigating the city; for addresses downtown, people generally give directions in relation to it. It's good to know how to get from the lake to your hotel. The lake is also the jumping-off point for exploring the Old Quarter, Hanoi's labyrinth of traditional craft streets in a sprawling maze on the north end of the lake. Lakeside is also a good place to find a bench and rest your toes after trundling around town, and you can find some good little cafes, particularly on the north end. Grab an ice cream and take time to stroll or stop and watch the moon reflect off the surface of this magical lake.
Beautiful. It was so beautiful seeing this lake in the middle of such a hassle busy city was so surreal. We just loved it.

Lovely Respite!. Such a nice place to have a bit of a break from the hustle and bustle of Hanoi.Plenty of places to sit and there's always something happening close by.We found it a great place to exercise, just by doing a circuit of the Lake.The Electric tourist cars seem to start from here.
A lovely lake. It is a lovely lake. you must come and enjoy the atmosphere here when slowly walking around. many hanoi people begin their new day with an exercise around the lake
Peaceful escape from the City. Great place to watch the locals going about their day to day business and traditions. Nice place to chill out after running the gauntlet of the surrounding streets.

First stop. First place tourists go, pretty during day or night, but be ready for locals selling everything. Suggest learning a few basic words like no, and thank you, leave me alone. Will come in handy can find words in lonely Planet guide.
Hoan Kiem Lake and Ngoc Son Temple. A very attractive temple and connecting bridge situated in the lake. Whether you accept the mythology or not, it is worth a few photographs.
Just amazing. this is always my great place to stay away from the hustle and bustle city of Hanoi. Just want to say you will find hanoi more beautiful after seeing this place
Nice walk around the lake. The lake offers a bit of green and quite. it is alos a good place for a stroll and observing how the locals live

thousand year structure. According to the legend, emperor Lê Lợi was boating on the lake when his magic sword, Heaven's Will, was grabbed by a turtle who quickly disappeared into the depths. All attempts to find either the sword or the turtle failed. Lợi concluded that the Golden Turtle God (Kim Qui) had come to reclaim the sword that it had given Lợi some time earlier, during his revolt against the Chinese Ming Dynasty. Lợi renamed the lake to commemorate this event, it was formerly known as Luc Thuy meaning "Green Water"). The Turtle Tower (Thap Rùa) standing on a small island near the centre of lake is linked to the legend.

people watching in early morning is the best!. i had went to the lake at 2 different timings.in the early morning (0700), you will see that viets are a healthy bunch. there are so many people who are up early and doing their usual routine of exercise. tai-chis, fan dance, aerobics, line dance, walking, jogging, badminton, stretching!in the night (1930), the crowd is lesser. people are sitting by the lake, artist drawing portraits, people doing exercise. activities are much lesser.if you are keen in taking photos, do wake up early! :p

Very Much the Center of the City. In a booming, increasingly crowded city, the lake is a relatively peaceful place. The small temple on an island in the lake is reached by an incredibly photogenic arched red pedestrian bridge. Vietnamese and tourists stroll or jog along the shore and there are many benches for a peaceful sit-down in the shade of the trees.

A nice place to relax at any time of the day. I was staying just a few minutes away from this lake and I made sure I came to the lake area every day. During evenings I went on foot around the lake. I could make out that both Hanoians and visitors enjoyed this place a lot and found lot of people jogging, and even doing weight lifting in makeshift gyms set up there!

Good photos. Very nice place to take some sunset photos! And you can also check the market which stay across the street. You will find all sorts of souvenirs and very good bargains, but the painting shops are definitely the most impressive! You will find very good quality work for an excellent price! I wish I have more walls in my apartment :)

Very pretty. The town busstles aroudn this lake - you will always find a wedding or two going on around the lake. Go across the bridge (for a small fee) to see another temple & view out to the island temple in the middle of the lake.

Quiet Oasis. This is one of the "must see" attractions in Hanoi. The beauty comes from the lake itself and not the pagodas or temples which - although quaint - cannot compare to the structures you would find in China for instance. Locals and tourists alike come here to take a break from the hustle and bustle of Ha Noi. A pleasant lake side cafe - Hapro - is located half way and is a good place to sit down and revitalize yourself with a glass of iced Vietnamese coffee - thick and sweet with half an inch of condensed milk at the bottom this tasted like liquid Hagen Daz ice cream!

Perfect place for people watching. A nice lake to walk around, and get a good feel for the people tht inhabit the city,you will get a better feel for the people leaving in this grand hustle and bustle city. Young people will to exercise their English with you Try to visit in the late afternoon nd into early evening so you can see the color changes with the sunset and the lighting of the lake

A must do when in Hanoi. The best way to escape the melee of motorcycles is to take a stroll around the lake then over the bridge into Ngoc Son Temple. Watch for touts and vendors though, they're everywhere!

Watch Hanoi life. The lake is not huge, if you walked steadily I think it would take about half an hour. There is a smallish park surrounding it, and at most times of the day you will find some kind of activity there such as 'techno workouts', Thai Chi, jogging, excerising, dancing amongst others....its a nice place to just sit and soak up the atmosphere of Hanoi.

old world charm. full of life. The beautiful flowers that are decorated on raised pedestal's. The calm that surrounds the lake with people engaging in variety of activities that include, reading, dancing, lovers, walkers, ice cream lovers, foodies, shoppers, tourists is a treat. The lighted dome in the center of the lake is a treat and is very soothing as ou take a walk around the lake
Lovely spot. Do yourself a favour & take a walk around here before 7:00am, some great sights & good to watch how the vietnamese start thier day.

The place to be at 6am. I'm an early riser who likes to go for a walk so decided to walk to and around the lake. As I walked to the lake I watched the city start to wake up. The small traders/stallholders were on their way with their goods to set up shop. Workers were starting to set off on their scooters and bikes. The lake surrounds, when I arrived, was alive with the locals. Most were exercising, some were seriously exercising while others were pretending to exercise while gossiping with friends, some were fishing, some were just sitting watching the world go by. There was tai chi, badminton, jogging, walking backwards, chin ups, push ups, knees ups. There were groups doing exercises to music, another group was into chest slapping in unison while another was into shouting 'ha, ha, ha, rest, ha, ha, ha'. Men tended to be more solitary and as they became hotter shirts were removed or rolled up to their armpits. It made me happy to be amongst a community that knows how to use their public space and don't care about impressing others just about having a good time with their friends.

Best place to exercise or people watch any time.. Hoan Kiem Lake drew me out of my hotel every morning. It's always so lively any time of day. My favorite was watching the ballroom dance classes early in the morning.

Worth a visit. This was a nice,low-key attraction that was well worth the visit. Look out for the turtle in the lake, as if you see it, you will bring good luck. Lots of locals could be seen just sitting and looking out at the lake for a long time. Nice walk around the lake too. Would definitely recommend a visit.

The Hub. This appears to be the hub of the old quarter. The mood and atmosphere changes as the day and then night unfolds. At anytime of the day or night it is worth a visit. The outdoor cafe, near Bata has great coffee and is a wonderful place to people watch.

Where try Taichi in the morning. I like walking around here in the early morning to enjoy the fresh air and watch locals do Tai chi and some weird Aerobic exercises. This is also a nice stop while strolling around the Old quarter, this lake close to Thang Long Water Puppet theater.

Pretty lake by old town centre. Beautiful lake where you can watch the locals go about their business of exercise in their hundreds at dawn! It is also a good reference point, it is hard to get lost as you just head back until you meet the lake.

Fascinating window into aspects of local life. We went to the lake on several afternoons around 5-6pm. The commitment of older people to their fitness and Qi Gong is marvellous. Unselfconscious seniors walk with purpose with particular arm swings, they stretch using a tree or a bench to anchor themselves and others carry out a routine alone or in a small group. One day a group had a few 'gym aids' and on another I joined a stationary conga line of women who were being coached by a man, to carry out shoulder and back massage. It was great.If you are willing to engage, there are so many opportunities. Lovers or other tourists appreciate you taking their photo; young people want to practise their English; dogs play sociably together, people parade, there are parents, fathers and grandparents with little ones, people pushed in wheelchairs, and old people always respond to a respectful nod of acknowledgement and a smile. For some reason we were taken as French more than once so we were able to use our very basic French to connect. Monsieur Le (retired) Professeur de Mathematique (who had spent a lot of time in Toulouse) was so pleased to chat that he took photos with us. There he was again the next day, with his bicycle, but this time he took a moment from coaching a student in French, to accept deux basiers and to pose for photos we took.The Lake is a really interesting oasis in the middle of the busy noisy pollution that is Hanoi.The kiosk is a good place to sit and people watch and the prices are fair.It is only when you are back at home that you are struck by the absence of alcohol and aggression and the consideration and polite behaviour, in such a crowded space used by so many
Early morning!. Worth getting up early and heading down to the lake (between 6-7am), it's buzzing with people doing Tai chi, dancing, zumba, volley ball, fan dancing etc.
Picturesque lake in central Hanoi. A pleasant walk around the lake and a visit to the buddhist temple at the north end, finishing with a meal and drinks on the lake shore
Nice enough. Nice area to walk around and escape the madness of the traffic. if you can grab a bench and chill out over a picnic. Can get busy during peak times.
A nice stroll. Not the most spectacul;ar lake of all time, but pleasant to stroll around. Get there early in the morning to see the throngs exercising.
For photo taking only. you won't be spending much time there as it is just a beautiful lake with a legendary history behind it.
Centre off Town. Take a walk around the lake, have a meal and a drink, take a tour enjoy the people and the view. This is the heart of Hanoi and everything can be sourced from around this lake

Pleasant lake to walk around. A nice break from the bustle of the old quarter. Eat at one of the many cafes and then take a relaxing walk around the lake on the path and escape from all the motorbikes.

Nice area to see the locals. One could see many local people doing exercises, dancing, taking tea, painting by the lake. A good place for photos.My 2 and 4 yrs old children enjoyed feeding fish by the lake. There wasn't that much space between the main road and the lake and so they couldn't run around freely. The paid area cost USD1 per person. There was a temple and not that much to see.
Small but worth seeing. The view of the lake is nice and there are some interesting things to see. The turtle is the most interesting. This is the second time I have been there.
pretty. the lake is very pretty in early morning,and nice to see so many locals in late afternoon enjoying it.

Nice place for a stroll or a run. Lovely lake in the Old Quarter. Very interesting old Pagoda accessed via bridge for small fee. Lot of families walk around the lake or do Tai Chi mornings and night - no problem to join in. Couple of restaurants and eateries with nice lakeside views, but can find much cheaper beers in other local bars. Unfortunately the footpath is not motorbike-free, so need to keep alert. Don't walk on the grass - not allowed.
short visit. nothing much to see there. A lot of prayer places for the people of the religion but nothing much for the rest of us

A place to see all life in Hanoi. Daily from dawn life goes on around this lake starting with Tai Chi early in the morning and continuing all day with people coming and going though their day, resting, taking lunch, doing exercise, just sitting, just take an hour to people watch here you will see life going on as usual for all sorts of people.

Amazing lake in the center of the city. I was here in Mid autumn festival. The tour guide leave us 1 hours to travel around the lake. We had cafe at Four seasons restaurant beside the lake. It was a peaceful afternoon in Autumn in Hanoi. I heard a lot about Hanoi's beauty with peace and that's true. I walk around Hoan Kiem lake and see many ladies do aerobic, so funny but lovely. Parents ride their children in small pram. I did love the atmostphere there...

Place of recreation and relaxation for Hanoi. Places where people went to Hanoi always visit. Nature of face and feet is located in the heart of the city, around, and the Old Town and the famous hotel so close. I think a little one kilometers around, there is also a small island in the lake, very beautiful. Early morning walk or jog, rest during the day. People are not constantly all day.

A charming site in the middle of the crowded city!. The lake with a great history is a cool oasis in the hustle and bustle of Hanoi. The views on the East side are more photogenic with large trees drooping their branches into the water.

Worth a visit or two but .... We enjoyed our time around the lake and particularly early in the morning when there are some very interesting exercise regimes going on. It is a bit of an oasis however we were disappointed that the roads are quite close to the edges in parts and thus the noise is incessant.Yes you could not come to this city without visiting, I guess we were just hoping it might have had a bit more impact on us with a bit more serenity.
walk around the lake. everyone who visits Hanoi must walk around the lake at least twice once during the day and once at night
Nice place to hang out. Just sitting here for a few minutes is entertaining as tons of people stroll past. Its also a good place for jogging at night or early in the morning.

This is an oasis within the city.. Visit this at least at some different times. The atmosphere is different depending on the time of the day. Early mornings, starting 5 am, many people excersise or dance around the lake. In the daytime busy around with tourist and locals. Evening is the best, lights, bustling, many good restaurants (look at the higher floors, many are on the rooftops). Vietname like to drive around the lake on there motorbikes, kind of flirting and flandering. Very nice. Many sales of traditional souvenirs for the locals. But be carefull with the traffic. Just cross the streets, do not hesitate (that is dangeroues), the traffic will marveleous go around you.

Its Just a Lake. On my way to Hanoi, I read a magazine that says Hoan Kiem Lake is the Asian's second spot for people watching. You have to see it to believe it. There is simply so many locals and foreigners around the lake. Unfortunately, the walkway was poorly maintained with many potholes that put the visitors at risk of tripping, or worse still, falling into the lake. However, if you like to observe people, it is a good place to see and immerse in the local cultures.
Its a Lake. Its a lake and not even that big, its got water and a Pagoda on it, After that not much else, cant even swim in it

Nice morning walk.. The area around the lake was enclosed in trees, the walking path and the park around it well maintained and provided concrete seats thus it is a comfortable place to exercise, meet with friends or simply relax. On Sundays, it is very interesting to see brides and grooms having their photo-ops by the lake.

Good to walk along the lake.. it's nice to walk along the Lake and meet locals as you smile at them. The people around are friendly. The only thing I don't like is that the lake is dirty and sometimes smelly.

beautiful Oasis in the City. the lake and surrounds are beautiful. it has strong cultural and spiritual significance to the people of Vietnam. It gets very busy and very hot there, so perhaps put on your itinerary for early morning or late afternoon. The smell of incense from the many altars inside and out can be overwhelming, This aside, w nice place to visit.
Nice view. I had a good view from my room to Hoan Kiem Lake. I could see the people exercise everyday there. Very nice things to see there. I enjoy with this history.

Looks like every other dirty lake in the middle of a city. I didn't find much to write about here. There were some nice spots to sit under trees to get out of the sun, but it wasn't anything special. You can walk over a bridge to see a temple but that's about it.

Go only for the attractions within the vicinity!. This place is rather historic, but it is not exactly a scenic lake. It may be an interesting sight to foreigners as you can see many locals exercising around the lake. There's even an outdoor gym! For the culture and history-buffs, there is a very old temple somewhere near the Thang Long puppet theater, which is at on end of the lake. The temple exhibits a preserved giant turtle. Giant turtles were thought to be extinct in the Hoan Kiem Lake until one was spotted within the past 2 years. As a final tip, if you visit this lake, you definitely should visit the attractions nearby. There is a night market, some cafes nearby (including Highlands Coffee) and some souvenir shops.

A morning oasis.. Best experienced very early mornings. We thought we were early at 6 am but the rapid clockwise walkers were already lapping the lake. Elegant tai chi using fans, latin american dancing, badmington, personal 1:1 instruction in all the above were well in progress on our first day. To share the uninhibited exercising of people whose lifestyle is busy and compacted was great. So too evenings as the cooler weather allows families a place of comfortable relaxing and coming together of friends and families often sharing picnics or food from local vendors. We were always able to find a quite place to watch and enjoy the culture unfold before or eyes.

Time out to relax. Get away from the hustle and bustle of the Old Quarter. I spent so many hours here, day and night. Sometimes I would walk around the lake, other times sit down and relax. If sitting alone there is a good chance a local person will want to sit with you and practice their English. It was in some of these situations where I learned some of the Vietnamese language. I was also told the story of the "Restored Sword" and other Vietnamese legends. After dark the lake is lit up beautifully, especially around Western New Years and Tet.

Calm in the Chaos. A lovely place to go to escape the hustle and bustle all around it. You can sit and watch the world of Hanoi go by and interact with the locals, many of whom make this a place they use to relax and exercise in as well.

Beautiful Lake in heart of Hanoi. Worth the time to stroll around the lake. See yoga early in the morning as the mist rises. Go to the area of artists and purchase beautiful local art. Have a dress made for a few dollars. Sit above the traffic and enjoy local cuisine.

Lovely.. The chaotic nature of Hanoi comes to a halt when you reach Hoan Kiem lake.While there is not that much to do there, it's a beautiful and tranquil lake, which is very easy on the eye.There's a temple in the middle of the lake, which can be reached by the beautiful Huc bridge - Đền Ngọc Sơn.If you visit he lake during daytime, you are bound to meet numerous brides and grooms taking their wedding photos by the lake - simply beautiful.It'll take you apx. 1-1.5 hours to circle the lake.Don't miss re-visiting the lake after dark, when it nicely lit and its atmosphere changes completely.

Heart and soul of Hanoi. No visit to Hanoi can be complete without a stroll around Hoan Kiem Lake. The best times to enjoy the lake are early morning or evening/night. The lake is peaceful and pleasant in the morning; takes on a festival mood at night. Starting early evening and continuing late into the night, swarms of people of all ages cruise around the lake on motorbikes in endless circles; young couples enjoy the lights and photo-ops around the bridge and small temple at the lake. Hawkers sell balloons, toys and food of all types around the waterfront.
A nice scenic open space in the crowded Old Quarter.. A great place for a stroll in the daytime or after dark. Hanoians like it too and it is busy with activity (and a lot of ice cream eating!).

Nice for a walk. Our hotel was near the lake so we often went there just for a walk and the fun of it. Many Vietnamese come here to enjoy the place and relax. We also visit the little temple with the red bridge and enjoyed it because it was really serene. Entrance fee is less than 1€.
Great place to walk around. Lots of stuff happening around here, tons of people and traffic. "the liquid heart of the old quarter" lonely planet desribes it as
Lovely both day and night. Charming lake to walk around during day or night. Best viewed from the Highlands Coffee balcony while having dinner or a drink.
Better vibe at night. Really pleasant atmosphere at night, cooler and the lights in the trees and on the lake itself make it more attractive
Calm and pretty lake. Lake provides great view and relax your mind. The temple in the lake got not much thing to say but ok to visit.

A brief visit. I have given this an average review because to be honest there wasn't much there. You could visit the temple at the top of the lake by crossing the bridge and walk round. All of the seats are at the edge of the lake which is bordered by the busy roads which make crossing difficult. The lake however is beautiful in sunny weather and there is not much shelter if it should rain. Still worth a visit but does not take long to walk round. In the mornings you can see the locals exercising at the lake.

Beautiful Lake. The lake is cleaner than our last visit, 12 years ago. It still has the tranquility and peaceful feeling when walking arounf the lake. The Turtose Tower is still elegant and mystique. You can look at it for all you like and the feeling is the same.

The number 1 neighbourhood in Hanoi. If you say Hoan Kiem Lake, you immediately say Hanoi Old Quarter. For tourists this lake is very easy if you need to orientate around the old quarter. If I can give you 1 hint.. Learn the route from the lake to your hotel by heart and you'll never get lost. It's that easy :)

Nice Peaceful Spot BUT BEWARE OF PICKPOCKETS. Lovely place to go in Hanoi just to chill out. It is shaded, leafy and quiet and the views of the lake are very nice. However, it is a bad place for pickpockets, I caught on red handed. He literally was withdrawing my wallet from my backpack when I luckily turned and caught him. The backpack was zipped closed and the wallet (thankfully nearly empty anyway) was in a zipped inner compartment. They were obviously watching me pay for a coke in a lakeside cafe to see where I put my wallet. One guy hassles you to buy postcards following you down the street annoying you...and his amte is busy behind you at your backpack. Careful. I caught them, but thousands won't be that lucky.What annoyed me is that local traders must have seen what was going on as we passed in broad daylight and did and said nothing. Disappointing that humanity can be that low.

Great place to experience the Hanoian lifestyle !. Hoan Kiem Lake is a popular attraction if you visit Hanoi. However, I do recommend to stroll it in the early morning when you could experience a totally different aspect of this city. In contrast with the bustling , chaotic of the city , it is the hidden charm and peace of it . From there, you could see Hanoians with their distinguished lifestyle. When some seniors are focusing on their taichi session, the other enjoy a cup of coffee with an attractive flavors on the street . The beauty is not actually about the lake itself but about the people !

Gr8 place for a relaxing stroll. A nice peaceful area in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of Hanoi.Beware of youngster pushing postcards in your face whilst his accomplice has his hands in your girlfriends handbag - as happened to us. Luckily he got caught and received a swift kick where it hurts!!

Relaxing area. Wake up early and take a run in Hanoi, this is actually the only place you can run in Hanoi considering the motorcycle and cars in the city. Nice lake to visit, we actually past by it everyday. You get to see locals exercising, young people hanging out and dating! Have a coffee overlooking the lake.

Great for a walk. We walked around this lake on our first day in Hanoi. Was a nice afternoon walk with lots of locals walking and hanging around too. The best part was watching a group of exercisers massage each other.

Lovely area to walk or sit. It is a nice feature in Hanoi, and we enjoyed resting in the shade overlooking the lake, and also eating in one of the restaurants that afforded a cool breeze from the lake on a very humid day.
Very nice. The landscape around the lake was good and it is nice to go for a walk around the lake in the morning. There is a temple at the lake. It was alright, not really a must see.

Nice lake but.... Remarkably clean lake but nothing on the lake; a small temple is there accessed by a foot bridge. There is a well laid pathway around the lake. On the weekends it is a popular destination for background camera pictures for just married couples. But I couldn't quite sense any traquility that would be usually associated with a lake view

The smaller lake. Didn't spend too much time here. Was very pretty took a quick stroll around a bit of the lake, a lot of the locals hung out here so that was nice. Very busy all the time, even at night.

A Must at the early morning hours. The lake is the Heart of Hanoi, and you can not say you have visited the city without having spent some time walking around the lake. Not to be missed is a visit in the very early morning hours, ideally between 6:00 and 7:00 a.m. when there is ongoing flow of humanity moving clockwise around the lake, in daily exercise. There are groups performing ti chi, individuals in private meditation, Zumba and aerobics classes, and dance groups all moving to their own rhythm.Being part of this experience was a highlight of my visit to Hanoi

Great for a stroll under the shade. On a Saturday lots of young couples stroll around the lake and we joined them (not so young couple). It is picturesque and at a gentle pace very relaxing. With a breeze and shade its a nice break from the old quarter Do as the locals do Stop and sit on benches in the shade and watch the passing people. Brides having photos, young kids playing and family groups. Excellent.

A nice walk around the lake. This lake was nice to walk around, lovely trees, and people taking in the atmosphere. Plenty of of cafe/restaurants to enjoy a drink or ice-cream at. Looked really nice at night too! All lit up.

Nice lake. I had been walking around the lake in the morning with my friends. A beautiful lake surrounded by crowed traffic, restaurants, cafes and shops. Relaxing atmosphere with many trees. This is a nice place to walk around and watch people, enjoy a coffee. We stopped at a restaurant right by the lake and a bit surprised to pay a bit expensive. Good to watch the locals engaging in yoga and a good opportunities for photographs of the temples at any time.
Wonderful place!. We enjoy the day tour in the lake with my family. Love Food, love people & culture. It's worth to stay here for couple of month.

Sit and watch the world go by. You can even have beer.. The lake and surrounds are a microcosm of Hanoi. Herons on the lake, travellers and locals mixing together in relaxation and history surrounds you.
I liked it. The weather was very hot but we had great time on the small island in the lake. Go there, cross the bridge, take some pictures and in the end go to visit the small temple in the island
Nice Lake. Very nice place to walk around, especially during the evening.At day time it was to hot, in the evening is better.

Go there at night. This lake is really at the heart of Hanoi, literally and figuratively. It is touristy is the sense that there are far more Vietnamese tourists there than foreigners. I believe that the Vietnamese themselves consider this lake the highlight of Hanoi. I went there for the first time on a Sunday afternoon and all around the lake it was wedding photo op! Yep, young Vietnamese couples having their wedding location photos taken. That should give you an idea of the lake's importance and beauty.But, better to go at night. In the evening the lights render this lake majestic! All around the lakeshore, but especially right to the north and the west shores, there are many places to sit down, relax and have dinner or a drink or coffee enjoying the view. Let's face it, Hanoi doesn't exactly have many places to sit and enjoy a nice view, this one is it!

nice lake in midst of hustle and bustle. Lake seems someone deserted and out of place in the middle of Hanoi. Nice place to escape from the business but main road runs around the entirety of the lake.

Very visitor friendly and definetly a photo op.... This lake is in the heart of down town Hanoi across from the famous"water puppet show" but this lake has a large walk way 360 degrees around it , maybe even walk very slow you could get around it in a hour. Nice for people watching and photos.

you wouldn't miss it if you skip it :). Don't understand what is the specialty of this place, nothing fancy. Adjacent to the busy street of the old quarter, the lake surroundings are not clean, litter everywhere, and to be honest the water kindda smelly. If you go close to it, there is a strong smell tht would push you away, seriously!!I visited last year, so I hope things have gotten a bit better since then. But overall not a big fan of Hanoi and so would not want to visit again, unfortunately!

Green Lake in a City Center. It is nothing special. It is a green lake in the middle of a city. The temple on the island is sub par. The tree lined sidewalks offer some shade on a sunny day but don't get to excited about this place.

Must see. Very French in its concept. Great at day or night, a wonderful place to see and be seen. Even in the heat a steady walk with the occasion drink stop. Morning walks are an opportunity for a bit of stretching if your up to it. The lights on a night give it a wonderful feeling. You have not been to Hanio if you have not been to the lake.

quite disappointing. Very well known, nice landscape but not so much to see, to be fair. The brdge is ideal to take picture. But no more to say ; slightly disappointing, and the neighbouring is clearly ... modern !

Center of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is a nice enough area to visit, particularly when you are exhauseted from the craziness that is Hanoi. Around the lake you'll find locals and travelers alike. Locals can be seen doing their daily exercise in the park (including group dancing, which is fun to watch). You don't get as many people trying to sell you crap around the lake, so it's a good place to get away from hawkers. The lake is also the ideal place to orient yourself when you get lost, as is likely to happen in Hanoi. Overall, you'll Inadvertently find yourself at Hoan Kiem Lake several times during your stay in Hanoi, and for a good reason, as it's one of the nicest areas of the city.
Busiest part of Hanoi?. Only sat around the lake at night...very busy with locals setting up shop selling local food and drinks.Locals congregate for their morning exercises.Nothing really exciting!!

peaceful. the lake is something special...... it can be busy as...... with people exercising, dancing, walking, running......... but always smiling..... it is obviously a sacred place for the locals who seem at peace with the world as they gather in their thousands around the lake 24 hrs a day......... for any visitor to the city who wants to see what sort of people live in Hanoi ... this is a great place to start.
A spot to relax. This was very beautiful to just sit beside and enjoy after shopping. There are some lovely cafe's nearby and it's worth the trip

Walk around the lake. Walk around the lake in the morning and afternoon is a fun activity, but you could be the food vendors offering too much. Tell them you'll call the police (if disturbed), they will quickly leave.

A very pleasant place. A place for a nice walk, especially in the early morning or in the evening. There are broad sidewalks and lots of trees. There is a small temple- Ngoc Son Temple- that is accessed over a lovely bridge on the north side of the Lake. this is, perhaps, the most visited temple in Hanoi.

Beautiful atmosphere. The perfect site for people watching, Hoan Kiem Lake is constantly surrounded by both tourists and locals alike. A popular area for exercise, especially in the early hours of the morning where you will find many of Hanoi's senior citizens out for a stroll or a group exercise session. Worth setting the alarm clock to check it out while most other tourists are fast asleep and before the sun really gets into gear. Also great to take some time out during the day to claim a bench and relax as the world passes by, or simply drink a coffee at one of the many surrounding cafes.

Very pleasing site in the middle of bustling Hanoi. This lake, situated in the middle of Hanoi's most interesting quarters, is rare place of calm in this city. The lake is bordered with flamboyant trees, making it very nice to walk around the lake in the morning/evening. In the middle of the lake are two islands, one joined to the shore by a red bridge. The best view on the lake is from a little rooftop terrace nearby :-)
Interesting. It is interesting to seek to understand the importance of ancestors to Vietnamese and the Chinese influences of the past 2 to 3 hundred years.
Pleasant. Pretty lake area to walk around that adjoins the old quarter , so you will see it anyway.Many couples getting wedding photos etc.

Just like any other Chinese temple out there. The only interesting thing here is the story about the sword itself. Other than that, if you've been to a typical chinese temple, then there's nothing new here to see.

Nice atmosphere at night. I would recommend you go to the north part of the lake (by the old quarter) at night. It was amazing seen some Viet people having dance classes in the street (Saturday night) and also seeing so many people sitting outside around the lake, drinking and having those seeds that they eat everywhere…
It pays off to rise early. It pays off to rise early and watch half of Hanoi´s population doing their morning sports around the lake,

Good people watching. I've driven around this lake many times. It's pretty much unavoidable during any length stay in Hanoi. There's great people watching here. Vietnamese come here for exercise, as well as Westerners. Lots of people just wandering, others doing sports, couple holding hands. The pagoda in the water is pretty neat looking, and Ngoc Son (across the red bridge) is worth a quick visit.

Beautiful and poetic. The Hoan Kiem Lake is just off the town that bears the same name (Hoan Kiem District). It is a wonderful place with beautiful paths for walking in the otherwise very hectic, but very attractive old town. The place is great in the early morning as you will see the Vietnamese practising Tai Chi and jogging and chatting...There is a small island with a temple that can be reached by a red-painted bridge. Love the atmosphere and the locals' smiles ina bright sunlight day.

Just another lake.... Took quite a few walks around the lake, and found it to be.......just another lake.At nighttime the the lighting added a little to the experience.A good place to meet locals, and experience local life.
Hoan Kiem. A beautiful lake surrounded by frenzied traffic, restaurants, cafes and shops. This is a nice place to walk around and people watch, grab a bite to eat or enjoy a coffee.

'Restored Sword Lake. It is a lovely lake to walk around to get away from the bussle of the Old Quarter, but it is it just a lake. There is a temple at the top end which you can visit explaining a little bit about the 'Restored Sword'
Relaxing place to sit and enjoy the area.. With the heat in Hanio this was a welcome respite from the crowds. We sat under trees and watched people, ate some ice cream and just relaxed.

Spot to while away a little time waiting for water puppet show. This is a smallish lake and there's not much to do once you have taken a few photos and absorbed the legend of the restored sword. There's a temple that charges $1 for entrance and while I visited it, I must admit I never fully understood the importance of the temple having done no prior research; all the descriptions were in Vietnamese. There are a few benches along the lake and if you can find one under some trees, it is a pleasant spot to while away some time waiting for the water puppet show to start.

Worth an early morning stroll. Better to go early to avoid the crowds and a weekday if you're able, walk over the bridge but we didn't bother doing the temple, good location and nice bars and cafes surrounding.

Pleasant lake in the center of town. Having very nearly not survived the traffic crossing the road to reach the lake, I feel very privileged to be able say that I have walked the circumference of Hoan Kiem lake and made it home again afterwards. It is certainly nothing special by the standards of city center parks and lakes in some European cities, but compared to the city centers of most Asian cities, the lake is very much an oasis in the middle of the city. There are many places to sit, lots of greenery, a number of small restaurants and cafes and the lake is small enough to be able to walk comfortably without being so small that you end walking around multiple times in a few minutes. The lake itself is very calm and serene but no where on the lake is far from the city center traffic so it is never really peaceful either.It is well and truly worth a walk either early or late in the day and remember to be careful navigating the traffic to cross the street
Hoan Kiem Lake. The lake is so peaceful, we have been there a few times, everyone is so friendly. Yesterday we passed a group of women dancing as we walked around.

Lovely Lake At The Centre Of The City. Lovely and shaded to walk around during the day, perfect for a stroll in the evening or after dinner. Great to watch the locals engaging in yoga and thai chi in the cooler hours, and great opportunities for photographs of the temples at any time. Make the effort to stroll around, it's so relaxing to be on the leafy walkways while the frenetic Hanoi traffic circles around the lake, you almost forget the noise.
Nice place to have a walk. A lot of tourists and locals hang out here. There is a old temple on the lake. They light up the lake at night. Watch out for fake "Red Cross member" asking for donation.
each morning. very good time around 6 am... lot of people are around the Hoan Kiem lake for yoga, sports etc It is a must to see when you visit Hanoi

Early morning or late at night. It is better when less tourists are about and you can watch locals exercising or enjoying their evenings together. My boyfriend is a tortoise and turtle lover so he loved the idea of turtles appearing on the surface of the water, and though we didn't see any, they are often spotted in this urban lake! I can't believe they have survived!
Not sensational.. At some point if you are in Hanoi you'll come across this Lake but there isn't much to do or see really. Go have a Pho in the streets you might feel better after this!
Local nightlife. Great place to sit and watch the local people, especially in the evenings. Good to enjoy a cold drink and a brise from the lake.

A lovely lake. First, I like the fact the lake is hiking friendly. You could walk on the cement pavement around it. The lake is very scenic as well. The vendors around the lake area is a bit of a bother, but then I don't blame them for trying to sell stuff to tourists. They're just trying to earn a living.

Full of tourists, but center of Hanoi life. Every vist seems to revolve around this lake. Although not as large as west lake. Worth the time to stroll around. But be aware, ou will be surrounded by busses unloading our groups complete with fanny packs, safari clothing, and extraordinary cameras detaching there interaction with the world around them

Great people watching. This is one of the most interesting people watching experiences I had in Vietnam. I walked around the Lake on three occasions. It took about an hour if we're not counting stops along the way. On the weekends in the daytime, newly married couples have wedding photos by the lake. In the evenings, whole families sit outside for dinner and drinks. At night, groups of young people ride their motor bikes in packs, occasionally dispersed by the police.
Beautiful. Walk around during the morning or at sunset, it is very beautiful. It is very busy and you can see many people walking / running / exercising around the lake.

Perfect for a romantic walk and ice-cream. The lake is so pleasant and beautiful. Its in the center of the old quarter which makes it perfect for navigating around this great part of town. People exercise around the lake and you can find some nice cafes to stop for an ice cream in the heat. Its also interesting that a 2 meter long near extinct turtle lives in the lake. I loved this place and my boyfriend and me walked here every day of our trip. Its perfect for romance.

Stroll through the heat w/all of Hanoi.... Rich, poor, middleclass, familes, honeymooners AND tourists. Be sure to catch a game of da cau (soccer-like game w/a shuttlecock) around 5pm at SE end of the lake.
Yes it's a lake. Nice gardens around the lake but hey it's a lake which is hard to miss if you are in the old quarter
Also a just see in Hanoi. Just take at walk around the lake in the early morning or in the evening, and watch as life unfolds in Hanoi.

great place to walk. I really enjoyed walking around the lake in several times of the day. There you can see vietnamese women selling her carfts, fruits and whatever else they can think of. With you, will be people from all over the world, also walking around the lake, enjoying the atmosphere and the scennery
Great Walk around.... Relaxing atmosphere to see a calm lake in a big bustling city. Locals exercise and have tai chi classes there at sunrise

A great walk. Every city has a place where people meet, exercise or simply sit and relax. Hoan Kiem Lake is such a place in Hanoi. Mornings you'll see people practising Tai Chi, playing badminton, walking, running or reading before heading to work. In the evening family groups gather there. Make a point of walking around the whole lake or simply sit and watch the world go by.

Stunning. Lovely to walk round and see the crazy traffic on the outside and the calm on the inside. Just have to be careful of people trying to sell fans or other rubbish near the entrance to the Jade Mountain Pagoda. But go for a wander and grab a bench, very relaxing place in the middle of the chaos.

Local life very much happens here. We went on Suturday morning and there were hundreds of people exercising and dancing. We saw ladies queued up did back massage for each other. It was fun to see and relaxing to go for a stroll around the lake. Local life is very much happens around here. Elder do exerise in the morning. Young adults date here. Some couples took wedding
Lake. Very nice to walk around early in the morning and late afternoon
Great. Took a trike ride around the lake. Enjoyed it so much. A great time for a couple.

It's a lake. It might be me but I am not sure how this qualifies as an attraction, it is more of a landmark as a starting point and a tool of navigation rather than a specific attraction. It is very busy at the key areas, close to the old shopping quarter and temple and expect to be pestered by someone attempting to super glue your shoe etc etcNot ideal for small children as the road surrounding the lake is super busy, with mopeds and cars etc etc, and is your children are blonde hairer then expect then keep them close to you as they will be picked up by any passer by

Land mark. Great to use as a land mark in Hanoi... Start all travel from the lake and in a couple of hours you will feel well acquainted with the hustle and bustle of the city. Great to sit and people watch, read a book or snap some great pictures of the locals.

Scenic spot. This place is great just to sit and relax and watch the world go by. The lake itself is beautiful either day or night (when they light it up) There are a few postcard sellers who go away without too much hassle
nice. good view of the lake and nice place to have a rest

Good place. Only few times passed, but really I found that it is a good place for you to enjoy. Especially in the evening or early morning, let's imagine that you are enjoying a thin fog of the lake in the early morning or a gentle breeze in the late of afternoon with a cup of coffee, you will touch the feeling of tranquil soul. Why don't you try? ;)
Even when crowded, quite and peaceful. A nice quite place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
good to see. nothing but good to see. see lake, tuttle, temple and take a rest. That's all.
Nice lake by the city. Very near the hotel we were staying.. Unless you are there to have coffee by the lake and people-watch, there is really nothing much to see except traffic.

Romantic and away from the usual rush. I love lakes in general, so obviously I really enjoyed Hoan Kiem Lake. I went there nearly every night, and once during the day. It was really also a point of direction for me whenever I got lost. In the evening, I went running around the lake. It was great to see the locals and tourists strolling around at night, and there are lots of cafes you can stop at to eat. The pagoda is also lit up, and really romantic. If you've just had a stressful day running around the old town, I would also recommend you take a stroll to enjoy the relative peaceful atmosphere there. Great place and I would definitly go again!
Live everyday life in Hanoi. I recommend you go early in the morning, when locals are excercising or simply sitting under the beautiful trees.
A nice place to walking around and admire. We like to walking around the lake in the early morning and late noon to admire fresh air at there

Pretty. It's pretty and scenic. There's swan boat bike for those interested. Go in the evening, it is breezy and filled with families. Great place to experience what the local families do at their free time.

Place for people watching. We headed here several times when we were in Hanoi as it is a great place to sit and people watch. Lots of students hang out here and will often stop to speak to you to practice their English. The electric cars that park by the lake are also great for a cheap tour of the old quater.

Nice place to walk around Hanoi.... Truly center of people's activities, especially in the evening..Have a good walk around the lake...Nice Ngoc Son temple, with its red bridge is lovely, the water puppet show is just around the corner...Hang Gai is around 10 minutes walk, with lines of beautiful silk stores and souvenirs...crowded in the evening, but all in all an enjoyable time there...try yourself and feel the beat..

Excellent Starting Point.. Went for a walk (first morning) at 5.30am. Watching the City & people waking & starting work by exercising.Even in the rain, plenty going on. At first, cos of rain, lots of people standing on pavements, doing Tai Chi, mass aerobics etc. Soon as rain stops, all out in open! Lake itself is not outstandingly beautiful, but an amazing place to people gaze. Cross the red bridge to walk around a tiny Island with beautiful Temple.At Northern end, walk up couple of flights of stairs to Highland Coffee & sit outside with iced coffee an watch the same scene from a great vantage point!

lovely place to hang out. nothing special, but nice to just walk around and see the city and people. A lot of newly married couples having their photos taken here, which is lovely sight. It is beautiful at night also.

Beautiful addition to busy city centre. This was the first place we visited in Hanoi and we were blown away by the contrast between the peaceful lake and the flurry of mopeds in the old quarter. This really is a signature spot in Hanoi. You can't miss it!

Charming. Only minus point if at all, the grafitti on one of the standing old structures. But it's a great place to regroup an admire the nearby opera house and museum along with the art shops across the road on the south side of the lake
Lovely lake. Beautiful lake to walk around. Popular place for the locals to hang out.
lovely place. Again, better with a guide, or get as much info before visiting so you can appreciate the meaning of the pagoda and the turtle which are in the centre of the lake.

Great centrepoint for a crowded city. Take a walk around the lake
Be careful of the bad tile work and footpaths. Everything in need of repair
Real Life. Nothing special to see, but a great way to get a snapshot of daily routine, especially early when the locals are excersising and preparing for the day. Even better if you join in.

Picture Perfect Lake. You can't miss this. This is the center of Hanoi. Beatiful lake, old people doing Tai Chi. Warm smile's of Vietnamese people.
Come here at least twice. One to visit the pagoda,next to just chill, maybe bring a book.
calm place. Calm place in the middle of the town. Good place to rest

A good point of rest in Hanoï. We stayed near the lake during our trip in Hanoï and it is pleasant to have some walk around, see the Vietnamese people play badminton (sometimes with no racket), do their Tai Chi in the morning, have a nap on their scooter...Well, you are still quite in the middle of the scoots horrible noise...but good to see.
Pretty lake. Was a pretty lake with the water puppet theatre being a cool addition. Was told there was two large turtles living in there, unluckily we didn't see them!
Good Vibe. Good vibe in this place. Feels like the heart of the city.
A great walk!. We just loved strolling around the Lake watching what is going on in HaNoi. In two days, we looped the Lake three times; both day and night and also in both directions.

Smoggy but beautiful. Excellent place to visit when in Hanoi. Didn't get hassled either - good place to take a break from the bustle of Hanoi. Good restaurants surround the lake. There's also an ANZ bank nearby - good for those with the bank at home! The post office is nearby also.
Hoan Kiem Lake a green beauty. Restful, peaceful, calm and interesting. Great place to escape the heat
Nothing to see.. The mand-made (??) little lake did not offer much. Water was green and opaque. Definitely nothing to see.
Experiance. Go over to the island and take a look around. And make sure you give yourself time to walk all around the lake. Try to getthere early in the moring and "watch Hanoi wake up".
A Pleasant Stroll. The lake is a nice area to have a stroll and enjoy the scenery.
beautiful. a little bit of beauty and peace in the middle of the hustle bustle.

Home of the giant turtle. I didn't get to see the giant turtle who reside at the lake. There is a dead specimen in a glass case which died earlier. Nice to see the locals playing chinese chess in the evening and just enjoying the lake.

A relaxing and somewhat cooler part of Hanoi. There's nothing like strolling past a large, cool body of water on a hot day, trying to snag an empty bench for a rest and watching out for immense tree roots. A rather laid-back corner of the old quarter, with the water puppet theatre on one end and the pagoda in the lake. A nice change of pace, Also, the great restaurant Green Tangerine is just down a side street and some nice bars, etc.
Take a walk. Nice place to stroll and watch people. Don't walk too slow, though, or you will get run over.

Go at 5am - thousands exercising. A great Lake and a must see/photgraph red bridge. But go at 5am, the place is teaming with old men with their tops off exercising along with badminton, weights, running, yoga, tai chi and even hundreds doing aerobics all in time to music and no instructor...! Very cool to see.
Nice, but not outsanding. Pleasant place to stroll, but not especially impressive visually

wake up early to see the city at play. Western societies employee local government officials to try and generate a sense of place is created spontaneously by the communities to use like surrounds in the morning for their exercises. If you are a late-night person, make a big effort to wake up early and do lots of articles, trot around like an watch the spectacles of dance, exercise and other joyous celebrations of early-morning life
not bad.. peaceful and calm, this lake is surrounded by an otherwise bustling area.

Lovely walk. We had a lovely walk round the lake and end up at the temple. Not far away is the Thang Long water puppets theater which highly recommended - although in local language the action were quite hilarious. my kids 11 and 7 had a good laugh!Even my 3 yo son was clapping and dancing.

Hide away from the heat. What a beautiful lake in the heart of the city! We walked around the lake, took great photos with the red bridge and enjoyed fresh air by sitting on marble chairs around the lake.

Pretty lake. Nice to walk by during dawn or dusk. Saw the local people exercising around at dawn. Lots of young couples enjoying the sunset at dusk. Nothing much happening around the lake otherwise. Saw a local pay 10,000D for a bottle of water at the stall by the lake. When buying one for myself I got charged 15,000D!
The Sword Lake. Nice to walk around and sit by looking out from Coffee Bar. A useful landmark for getting diretcions when navigating the old quarter by foot.

A lake.. Walking across the red bridge is free. You'll have to pay VN20,000 to enter temple on the other side.Lots of stuff to see and do around the lake. Don't expect too much of the lake.Beware of scams around the lake. Don't take the grey taxis. The usual fare to our hotel was around VN30,000 in the Old Quarter. We took a grey taxi that cost us VN160,000. We never had issue with the taxi company, Mai Linh.

For The Real Hanoi, Wake Early and Walk Around The Lake. Okay, I know you are on vacation, and don't want to wake early, but do yourself a favor and do it. We went out at about 6:30 to walk around the lake and for the next hour it seemed there was so much to see! Old people doing Tai Chi. Pictures of the Turtle Pagoda when the light is perfect. Hanoians exercising their dogs, playing badminton, dancing to various kinds of music, grandparents and children, businesses opening up. I can't recommend this highly enough. Just do it.
Beautiful. Colourful and worth the visit, a nice place to sit and relax
Lake. The Lake is at its best at night. A little polution but very good to visit, sit and enjoy the night lights.

agree... just a lake. agree with previous review that it's just a lake, and it's not very big. However, it's a good landmark and there are a lot of other activities, shops around the lake.
I use the lake as a drop-off point after going on day-tour.
For nice photos, go during sunrise/sunset or night
friendy atmosphere. The atmosphere was so nice, the beautiful red bridge, the temple, the story of the sword and the turtle. Great place

Just a lake!. Walked around the lake during the day as part of a Hanoi Kids tour. I had read fantastic reviews about the lake and was disappointed as it was just a body of water. If you are going to see the lake, my suggestion would be to go at sunset or sunrise.

Oasis in the Hanoi Mayhem. Certainly an oasis in the Hanoi traffic mayhem...great for a stroll in the morning to view locals exercise, do taichi, run their pets,....do stand at the Huc Bridge (Bridge of the Rising Sun), breath in the air and take in the view. In the evening, the view changes and take on a more relaxing ambience. Many visitors chose to book hotels that congregate around the lake due to its central location. And from here, proceed to cruises at the famous Halong Bay. Many quaint streets can be accessed from strolling around the lake.The notable intersection streets are that of Hang Dao, Le Thai To, Din Thein Hoang, etc. where you can witness the infamous Hanoi traffic mayhem. Certainly a must visit venue when in Hanoi.

Serenity within Chaos. First thing in the morning a leisurely stroll to start the day, around what the locals refer to as Turtle Lake, its steeped in tradition and history, apparently 1 of only 4 remaining turtles of this type still live in the lake, there is talk of trying to breed with a turtle brought in from another area, only a short distance away the bustling and chaotic city is waking up but here its serene and beautiful, locals are doing morning exercise like Tai Chi, old men are playing chess, stop for a Cafe Su Da and watch the world go by, then stroll to the island(small fee) and visit the temple or turtle tower and see the giant turtle on display, or just stroll around the lake, Turtles play a large part in Vietnamese History and its considered lucky to rub the Turtles head, what a wonderful way to start a day
Scenic lake in the heart of Hanoi. At sunrise and sunset jay walk around the lake for incredible photo opportunity

Lovely to walk around. It's amazing how this lake have all the hustles and bustles happens around it. It's lovely to walk around - especially early morning or evening. It's fun to watch elders and mature ladies do exercises and dancing here. At night, it's relaxing to have a sit and watch the city in lights. City view cafe ( on 2-3 rd floor ) by the lake side is great stop for (Highland Coffee) with excellent views of the Lake and crazy chaotic traffic.
Worth a visit. There is a temple to one side which is very busy but interesting to visit
Serene and scenic. This is the heart of the ancient Old Quarters of Hanoi. Today, you can find many people playing chess in the morning or couples dating in the late afternoon to evening.

Beautiful lake, surrounded by beautiful sculptures. This is a very good place to walk around in at Hanoi-with beautiful scupltures dotted around the gardens surrounding the lake, and a clear entrance to the temple. It's a nice central point to Hanoi-though it is far away from some necessities-such as decent restaurants.

A welcomed peace in a crazy city. It was lovely to walk around this lake for half an hour watching people go about their interesting business (Group massage, Tai Chi and more) without being asked to buy anything. Restored my sanity and made me dislike Hanoi a little less than I did when we first arrived (I was eventually sad to leave!)

Morning walk at the lake. I think the best time to visit this lake is in the morning when it is not too hot and there is many activities too...
It's within walking distance from the Old Quarter. There is a bridge connecting to the old temple. There is an entrance fee but it is worth to visit, good spot for taking pics.

Very beautiful. A really lovely place to sit and enjoy some natural beauty in Hanoi, and enjoy a coffee or ice cream. Nice to see the locals enjoy their family time or exercise and just go about their day.

Lovely place to visit. Relax and enjoy one of Hanoi's top attractions. The first morning been in Hanoi, we walked around the Lake and loved watching the variety of activities being undertaken by the locals. Lovely views of the island temples, flowers, trees, and pre-wedding couples having their photos taken at various scenic locations around the lake. The cool breeze and fresh air! Follow my old England friend who been here a long time, we booking to the Hapro restaurant at the south end is a great place to enjoy a repast and people-watch. Reasonable food and prices, beer, wine and fruit and coffee drinks. Lovely place to visit in the center of city.

Nothing much to see but the lake is scenic. There is a temple on the lake and a mummified tortoise. Looks nice when lit up at night and there are benches around it. Serene. Anh, our tour guide from Legend Indochina Travel, was very good
Very pretty. Lots of coffee shops around the lake. Nice to sit and relax before or after your walk around the lake. Bring camera.

Loved walking around here. Met so many interesting people around the lake, students practising their english and other locals. Loved just sitting and watching everything going on. It is a big lake and you can jump in a golf buggy or cyclo and get taken around.

Great place to relax and watch families. This was my favourite place in Hanoi. Lots of places to sit down and watch locals in their everyday life. You can see the strong family bond within a family. The whole family were out walking from babes in arms to the elderly being pushed in a wheel chair.It is a pleasant stroll around the lake as the trees have coloured lanterns.We ended up here most nights as it was not far from our hotel, to wind down and relax.Everymorning I intended to follow the stream of locals mainly dressed in white heading for the lake to do Tai Chi, but my lazy bones were still half asleep.Several home made ice cream shops in this area. Make sure you stop and enjoy an ice cream.

A slice of real Hanoian life. We spent many hours walking, sitting or drinking coffee around the lake, it's so lovely to see the local people enjoying the open space at all hours of the day and night.

Really beautiful. A great lake, always bustling with tourists and locals. The locals seem to use it as a place to exercise. Particularly impressive at night time when different coloured lights shine on turtle tower. Lovely to walk around.

A walk around the beautiful lake. It is a memorable experiance. Particulerly in March when the temprature is low.In the nights it is like paradise.There are coffee shops and seats around the lake where you can sit and enjoy your time. This walk is a must for the Hanoi visitors.
Respite in the Storm. Great place to walk and admire the beauty surrounding you. Nice to get away from the hustle/bustle for a little while

A lovely lake. A good place to have a sit and watch the world go by.
Not the cleanest lake, but they are working on it.
A good place to get your bearings from.
Nice walking. Nice to walk around and get a feel of the city. Watch out for the shoe shine boys and others always trying get you to part from your money. Overall I real pleasant walk.
A nice walk in the city. You can walk or just sit and watch the crowd go by. It is nice place to go to if you want to get away from the traffic and rest your tired legs.
Nice place to hang around. It's nice. It's near the shopping area as well as restaurants. You can relax by the Lake and enjoy the scenery.

Walk around the lake for a glimpse of Vietnamese life. We walked around the lake late one afternoon after first stopping at the nearby opera house and Metropole Hotel. We walked in an anti-clockwise direction and went to the little island at the top end of the lake (along with about 1,000,000 other people). The crazy shopping streets of Hanoi are a little further to the north from here, but we hit those up another day. We continued on our leisurely stroll around the lake down the western side and saw young and old Vietnamese alike playing checkers, reading, doing Tai Chi, canoodling, engaged in conversation and generally just enjoying the peaceful surroundings in such a ridiculously busy part of the city. It was a very relaxing thing to do.

Hoan Kiem Lake is a magnet in Hanoi old quarter. We stayed for three nights in hotel Maison d'Hanoi (see my review) and every evening we were "pulled" to Hoan Kiem Lake. Not only the Water Puppet theater is there, also the island with the Ngoc Son temple and the Turtle tower. Moreover, the banks are park-like, good for strolling and many cafe's and eateries surround the lake. We visited Dinh Lang Thuy Ta restaurant on the north-west point of the lake (See my review). In short, not to be missed while in Hanoi old quarter.

The place to be calm. This marvelous inner city lake is truly a jewel in Hanoi. It is one of the things that makes this city and it is easily walked. It's a bit of a test getting to the lake but it is worth the traffic challenge...
Serenity. So peaceful and wonderful to see everyone using this area as a leisure area
Day Break Is Best. Early morning or evening is the best time in order to see locals doing what they do.
Pretty. Pretty lake, especially at night. Nice for a walk, no attractions as such around, just a scenic view

Relatively cool oasis in the city. A walk around the lake and you can observe the locals. Check out the old men on the seats just hanging out or the locals walking in the evening with their family. The tree lined shore encourages you to linger and just look. There is a cafe near the large intersection where you can have a drink or meal on the lake side with a gentle breeze in the evening
see it at sunrise.... ... when it is misty and the crowds of people are gathered to do morning exercises. amazing cultural experience!
A restful park amidst the chaos of Hanoi.. Serene,yet near restaurants and hotels.For a buck you can get a mobike driver to the old quarter.

Get up early. Start out about 6.00am it's well worth it watch everyone exercising from ti chi to just doing a circuit of the lake take note of the age range these people are amazing. The big surprise is the dancing that is open to everyone just grab a partner and do a waltz or a fox trot wonderful to watch made me wish that I had kept up those dance lessons my mom sent me to.
Pretty. We felt it was sort of the Central Park of Hanoi. Locals and tourists alike were out walking around, sitting and eat ice cream and enjoy the day.

Pleasant respite. Easy to get to, lovely to walk around - especially early morning or evening - do stop for coffee at the top of the lake (Highland Coffee) inside or outside seating with views of the Lake.

Good 'map' start. It all happens around the lake, traffic, restaurants, walkers. Nice place to sit and stop for a drink, book into a restaurant and have a meal or just go for a walk around the lake and into the temple.

an artificial pond.... Ok it's a nice walk round it in between two highly traffic loaded roads, so you get some peace and quiet.The "lake"'s water is far from clear, also the litter on the walkway certainly does not add any romanticism to the place.

The Lake near my hotel. I liked seeing people (mainly women) doing Tai Chi.
Beautifully illuminated at night.
The Lake itself should be kept cleaner.
Bustling and energetic. Great spot to eat / walk and take in the Hanoi atmosphere!

Good place to meet people. This is really a opportunities for a meeting vitnamesere and speak with them about their life..I am sitting several days in a bench at the lake.og within long time come there some and asked about also must sitting on the bench.It was most time students in the Universitetet .They are coming to the lake to speak with people-they are oing to learn english.The teacher har says it is good to speak on english.Some times other people are come . I have never meet some there there beggar or will sold somethinks.Only good things.The Lakes is about 2 1/2 km arond and it is a good wlk in centrum of hanoi

Enjoy a walk around Hoan Kiem. The lake is pretty much the center point of Hanoi's tourist area and its a great place to walk around, maybe not so much on one of Hanoi's 40.C days but the whole walk is under beautiful big trees and there are plenty of seats to sit down and enjoy the passing parade.

Nice, go during different times of the day. Large lake with a pagoda in the middle, and a temple. It worth going at different times, early morning to see the locals exercise and walk around at am, with less traffic around. Later in the day as the traffic pics up, and then evening to see the bridge lit up and the chaotic traffic...

The Heart of the Old Quarter. Hoan Kiem Lake really is the heart of Hanoi's Old Quarter. Regardless of the time of day there are always people here with the majority easily being locals - sitting, chatting, exercising. The lake is a special place to visit, I recommend you take the time to sit and take in the ambience.
Popular area. Not too big to enjoy a stroll around, day or night. Plenty of people at all times, find a seat and enjoy the scenary.

This lake comes alive at night. A real gathering place in the evenings, with groups of youths break dancing, some busking-type activities, lots of hawkers and hundreds of visitors and locals who are out for a casual after-dinner stroll. If you can, find a cafe or bar that has a view of the lake in the evening and watch the traffic from a comfy viewpoint.

Didn't see the turtles. Beautiful and cool on a hot day. Go across the bridge to the little island to see some great gardens. The turtles rarely surface but if you see one it's meant to bring you good luck.

Iconic Spot of Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is a nice place to go to. It's a relaxing park for the hot temperatures during daytime. You'll see and meet nice locals who walk around the place.Being thw Iconic Spot of Hanoi, this is a must-see park.
fun to visit in the morning. we went on Sunday morning and there are hundreds of people exercising and dancing. fun to see. lake itself is nothing special.

Hoan Kiem Lake. Just a great place to visit. We walked around the lake each day at 0530. Yes, even at this time the lake was very crowded with older VN locals. They exercise in arobics type classes in many different groups. You would think it was 1000 am at 0530. To beat the heat this is a good time to visit the lake.
An oasis. The lake can be a fulcrum of calm for first-time visitors to Hanoi. Go sit at Hapro, have a beer or a coffee, look out over the lake, and allow the city to flow around you.
A lovely lake. During early morning & late evening till night, lots of senior exercise and walk around. Good night photography place.
Lake. A lovely walk around the lake, a good way to see different sections of the city. Some nice restaurants surround the lake as well

Not a place for relax. There are better lakes for a relaxing time in Hanoi. During the day Hoan Kiem is occupied by seniors and in the evening when you finally find a place to sit, just to watch all the people exercise and walk around, you will be approached by annoying guys offering weed, prostitutes and other service.
Lovely place. One of the must visit places in Hanoi. Best to take a guided tour, or visit with a local acquaintaince to understand and soak in the importance of this site.

the place to relax. We spent quite some time around the lake in our visit to Hanoi. Morning, afternoon or at night there is always something to see. Around the lake there a several little hidden cafes on the rooftops of some buildings that are worth checking out, the view is amazing from the top.

the hub of hanoi. the hoan kiem lake is the hub of hanoi. for a lake in the middle of such a large city it is well kept. sure there is garbage in the lake but considering the amount of people who frequent it is in good condition. what it is great for is people watching. find a nice spot sit down and take in what is around you.
A nice place to take a rest. A good place to have a sit and watch the world go by.Not the cleanest lake, but they are working on it.A good place to get your bearings from.
Relaxing. A great place to begin and end each day. Great for people watching, relaxing or joining in on a group dance!

Not worth a look. The lake is not bad looking and has a little temple. It is very simple and not very impressive, you have to pay 1$ to see the temple, and there is not much to see. The water of the lake is pretty dirty. Better not pay the 1$ and only take a picture from the bridge.It is actually the only place in Vietnam where we meet rude and issulting people while only being setted on a beach. And we had to leave because it was very umpleaseatIt is also quite noisy, next to main roads.Only positive you can walk round the lake without being run over (like in the old town)

Great for a walk and people watching. We went for an early morning walk around the lake, which is located adjacent or within the old quarter of Hanoi. Locals were out and about performing all sorts of exercise including various aerobics and tai chi.A great place for a relatively peaceful walk. No street crossing involved once you get there! And the tree lined walkways are mostly brick pavers. Nice views of the lake all around. Early morning and the large trees everywhere are important since, at least at this time of year, May, the heat and humidity of Hanoi are quite oppressive-- at least for us.
peace amongst the energy of old quarter. Very relaxing place to watch the locals enjoying their time

Great place to RUN and People Watch...!. This is a great place to go for an early morning run (because after that, it is so sweaty hot, you will want to jump in the lake). Also a nice place to enjoy the afternoon and people watch...especially the girls.
a cool oasis. It's a lovely way to start the day with a 40 minute walk around the lake.
OK. A bit dirty etc and not high on the agenda but the little bridge is good for photos
EARLY STROLL around the lake. Great way to welcome in another day in Hanoi. Join in with the relaxation exercises with the locals. Chance to speak & learn more about the Vietnamese culture.

Center of Activity Old Town Hanoi. At the center of activity, if not the geography, of Old Town Hanoi is Hoan Kiem, a lake rich with tradition and surrounded by people morning noon and night. The lake reputedly is the home of a large, 500-year-old turtle, which is still sighted from time to time, and which survives the other ancient turtle that died in the bombings in 1968 and is preserved in a glass case in the temple on the lake today.
