The name means “Lake of the Returned Sword, as legend has it that a turtle in the lake gave a sword to the king to help him repel the Chinese invaders 600 years ago. A red bridge with brightly colored banners links the shore to a temple in the lake, outside of which old men play Chinese chess and slap pieces down loudly onto the ground with each decisive move, and inside of which people come to burn incense and make prayers to the icons of one of three kings. On the bridge, engaged couples and bridal parties are getting photographed amid the continuing flow of locals and tourists. This is really a wonderful place to experience the energy of Old Town Hanoi, whether in the morning for group Tai Chi, or mid-day for brides and chess, or evenings for colorful lights, families, more group exercise, and family and romantic outings. Cannot imagine a trip to Hanoi without some time at the lake.

Beautiful symbol if Ha Noi. The place I visited first was Hoan Kiem lake, the small lake in the of Hanoi. The lake and its surrounds were very pretty. The green water, the old building of different periods of Hanoi’s colonial history were very impressing us. The Temple in the middle is worth a visit where you can have a pleasant feeling and enjoy the Hanoi’s old age culture. At night the lake seemed to be more charming with the colorful lights reflecting on the lake. It offered a bit of a peaceful break from the rest of Hanoi and possessed some classic landmarks.

Very peaceful. I visited the lake twice. Early one morning and then early evening two days later. The lake a little misty during both visits and appeared quite eerie. Considering the lake is in the middle of a city with a population of around 9 million, the lake was very peaceful
Nice walk around the lake. It is a very nice walk to go around the lake. Stop at a cafe and get a good cup o coffie. Or pop in at Fanny´s and get a big nice ice cream.

Hanoi's heart - Hoan Kien Lake. The history of the lake goes back to king Ly Thai Tho who on boating on the lake was given a sword by a giant turtle and went on to win famous battles against the chinese. The turtles are still there, but it is unlikely you will see one. The lake continues its importance today as a symbol of the independence of Vietnam and its people, but also as a centre of recreation. If you turn up at five in the morning or in the late afternoon you will see many Hanoians taking exercise in classes or just walking around the lake. The ice cream place on the lake is good and you can sit on the terrace overlooking the lake whilst you eat it. The main island on the lake houses a pagoda (and a stuffed giant turtle) and the bridge to it is again famous. Difficult to miss, but also a must on a visit to Hanoi.

One of Hanois many lakes.. Spent a morning strolling around the lake watching the locals exercising before visiting the temple. Didn't see any of the large almost extinct turtles but did get to see small turtles swimming at the lakes edge. Unfortunately, as it is with most of Vietnam's waterways, the pollution was very evident

Beautiful Lake, Go Early. This is one of my favorite lakes in the world, especially early in the morning. If you wander about early then you beat the heat, see all of the lovely people out doing Tai Chi and exercising, guys fishing, and the serenity is wonderful. Don't miss this one!
Watch the world go by. Find the ice cream bistro by the lake,sit there and enjoy their yummy ice cream or coffee and spring rolls. Nice feeling watching the world go by.

A Plain Lake with a Small, Unremarkable Temple. This is a lake with historical significance but nothing much else to recommend it. There is a temple (entrance fee) on a small island that is utterly unremarkable to anyone who has traveled a bit in Asia.

The heart of Hanoi. This lake and its surrounds is a fabulous area. It is also essential that you experience it at different times of the day to really appreciate it. We first saw it just after dark when people were just wandering around or sitting enjoying the view. Our next visit was in the early morning when locals were doing exercises, aerobics, tai chi, dancing, jogginng etc. We walked around the entire lake thoroughly enjoying observing all of these activities and then sat down at a lakeside cafe to enjoy the peace of the lake itself. Early evening brings out more families and more exercise activities and the temple is another attraction. This is definitely an area you can visit again and again and never get bored.

Hoan Kiem Lake. It's wonderful to walk around at night. Never felt threatened for a minute in Hanoi, it's a beautiful city. The Puppet Theatre is there and many restaurants, and it's also beside the Old Quarter. See the pics here: http://womentravellingalone.blogspot.com/search/label/Hanoi%20-%20Vietnam

A great place to people watch.. We walked around the Lake every morning and loved watching the variety of activities being undertaken by the locals. Line dancing, tai chi, boxing, jogging, stretching, badminton and aerobics were just a few of the things to see or join in.
Nice lake but a bit smelly. The lake and the temple were a bit crowded. Interesting to see early in the day when everyone is out exercising..

Good place for a small relax. If you will be tired by noisy streets, by many motorbikes on the roads, you can buy some cold drink or fresh fruits for eating and sit and watch the lake with the Turtle pagod in the middle of lake, or another temple with beautiful red bridge, you can see many very old trees and many Hanoi's people who speaking, playing the chinese chess, running, walking... in the morning it looks like the morning in the Central Park in New York City. Morning there is a full of images, impresses and not so hot weather.
Felt like a local. We got up early on a few mornings and joined in the walking around the lake, and having a coffee at a cafe.
Restful place. We loved the lake, especially at night when people quietly strolled around or sat on benches enjoying the reflections of lights on the water and the cool breeze!

Lake Walk. You must walk around the lake. It is a beautiful setting, thoroughy enjoyable and relaxing, then go to the highland restaurant and sit on the balcony to have lunch and watch the hussle and bussle of Hanoi, excellant

My Favorite Place in Old Hanoi. I love going to Hoan Kiem Lake any time to get exercise, sit and people-watch, and read. Lovely views of the island temples, flowers, trees, and pre-wedding couples having their photos taken at various scenic locations around the lake. The Hapro restaurant at the south end is a great place to enjoy a repast and people-watch. Reasonable food and prices, beer, wine, and fruit and coffee drinks. A lap around the lake is a little over a mile. You will be hassled by walking vendors; just say "Khong" which works better than "no". You may also be approached by young students who want to speak English with you. The vast majority are truly young students who want to practice although, every once in awhile, you will get someone trying to sell you something -- often asking you to 'donate to the Red Cross". Still haven't figured out if this is a scam or not, but there are certainly a large number of "volunteers" for the Red Cross in Hanoi!

Travel back in History. A visit to this lake area is worth just to enjoy the beauty, peace and tranquility. Spend some time walking around the area any time of the day, particularly in the early morning or early evening. Plenty of coffee shops and eating places to relax. Avoid the hawkers - they can be a nuisance. Your excursion will be more enjoyable if you can read up about the history of the ancient kingdoms.
Great place to watch and walk. Great in the early evening watching groups and families. Not too big to walk around.

A place to sit and observe?. We walked around the lake and then we sat and watched the passing parade for a couple of hours. Watch out for the shoe repair con merchants. I had three lots come along and want to polish my sandles. The last one had them off my feet and had started to repair non-existent damage before I could object. He then cleaned my suede sandles with nugget and objected when I would only give him a couple of dollars!

Good for an evening stroll!. It's not as big as West Lake but definitely worth the visit. Lots of restaurants, coffee shops, hotels, and the Water Puppet Theatre right on it's perimeter. Near the old quarter if you're an adventure-seeker!
Night walk. Very enjoyable walk around the lake in the evening observing the locals relaxing and enjoying themselves
relaxing. nice to sit around the lake and watch all of the locals doing exercise early in the morning

Beautiful lake in the middle of a bustling city. The huge lake provides a beautiful relaxation spot in the middle of a city. The only down side of it was peddlers pestering tourists to buy their wares and take their trishaws for a ride.
Delightful. Don't let the color of the water turn you off unless you were thinking of a swim! A walk in the evening brings a new level of magic to the lake.

Relaxing and Calming. Seems like a popular place. We spoke to locals and they say alot of young couples come here on dates. In the mornings, there're lots of older folks doing taichi here.
On any other day, there're always lots of people hanging out with their family and friends. It's a good place to chill out and people watch.
Lake. Enjoyed the Lake visit,,,,,,,,,,,,,easy walking distance from our hotel.

Ice cream and a nice view. Though there was some trash around some corners and the aroma of sulfur near the ice cream stand Hoa Kiem Lake is still a nice place to visit. Keep away from the people who suddenly dart at you with bikes or good and will ask you to take a photo. They will charge you a good dollar. But all it work and you are on vacation anyway. :D

A nice break from the streets of the old quarter. After walking the street of the old quarter for a while it was nice to stroll along beside the lake and visit the temple.Like much of Vietnam, I was disappointed to see the rubbish and pollution in and around the lake. Didn't see any turtles, hope they are navigating the plastic bags in their home ok.

Great escape in the city!. Even though the lake gets packed with locals and tourists, it is still a pleasant place to visit in the city.We had a few drinks at the restaurant on the side of lake, cant remember the name, but it's the only 2 story one there and is worth a stop at!All in all, not too bad if you want to fill in an hour or two.

Filthy. The lake is filthy but the locals love the area. They dance, massage each other, exercise and generally enjoy themselves around the lake. It's a great atmosphere.It's a pity Vietnam is spoiled by their polution. Sewer, plastic bags and rubbish....
Just a hint of Central Park!. A pleasant walk and a nice way to pass an afternoon.

A photographers dream. While the lake is pretty polluted, the broad walk around the lake is lovely on a hot day - I don't know how the lake generates cooler air, but it certainly does. Fantastic photo opportunities all around the lake, but particularly from near the International Post Office - especially when the trees are all in flower. I think they've banned hawkers from this area, so its pretty peaceful.

Fantastic lake in the middle of the CBD. The lake is charming set in the middle of the very busy CBD, it is relaxing to walk around and take in the vista, enjoy a drink on the boardwalk at the number of cafes.

Pleasant walk around the Lake. Very popular place for families, lovers and those out enjoying the scenic beauty of the lake. There are heaps of stone benches for one to just simply take in the serenity surrounding the area.
Charming indeed. Great place to relax and have a drink. While this area is still busy as most of Hanoi it still allows you to drift away a bit.

Enjoy it. It's great to visit Hoan Kiem lake in the spring. You will see the green lake with the cool air, falling leaves... Every wind can make you have another feeling when I come to this place. Love walking around this lake because I can joy the view and it's very good for my health. The natural scene here is very romantic, couples hand in hand walking around the lake ang relax with the fresh atmostphere. A peaceful place, with the smooth surface of water and wonderful sight-seeing, whenever I feel sad, I may come there, and I will be calm. I really love this one very much.

Nice walk in Hanoi.. very nice to walk around. takes about 35 minutes if you don't stop. Interesting to watch vietnames having their photo shoots around the lake. At first we thought that they must be weddings or something but they weren't dressed in wedding gear. We asked someone and they said they were just having portrait done. We were there on Easter Sunday, so was very busy. Cost 20,000 dong (about $1) to visit the temple on the lake. Quite interesting and worth it.
worth seeing. Worth it to see the famed turtle but little else worthy of a wow factor.
Lake of the Restored Sword. This lake is central to the Old Quarter and nice to walk, bike, or boat around in. At night it is lit up with lanterns and coloured lights.

It's good as far as a lake goes.. It's just a lake. You only have to pay 15000 VND (70c USD) to check out the dead 900 year old turtle on the island in the middle.Not a pristine lake with swimming etc, it's in the middle of a filthy city.
Great lake. great spot to take in the whole city view as well as the lake itself, very busy though.

People watching at its finest!. Enjoy an early morning stroll around the lake, or just sit and watch the world go by. This is the spot in Hanoi for a little relaxation or exercise, or eating ice cream, or all of the above!

Lovely place for pix. Lake in the center of town. Pretty pagoda for pictures and additional neat island to visit in the middle. They have a preserved turtle in the little museum that was taken out of the lake in the 60's.
Scene stroll. A stroll around the Lake is recommended. The may facets of the Lake as well as its surroundings made great photos.

Very relaxing. It's very nice to walk around the lake, it's very beautiful and as a westerner you will definitely be talked to. It's possible that some students will come up to you and ask if you want to practice english with them. This is genuine, they want to learn english so they can get better jobs!
Pretty lake. Really nice small lake to have a wonder round. Plenty of benches to sit and people watch. A nice way to spend a couple of hours.
Nice to observe. The place to observe tourists and locals relaxing. Can take hours. But generally pretty boring.
pretty. Great for a stroll on a Sunday. Lots of couples getting married and having photos taken. Also a good reference point so you can find your way around.
its nice but not lots to see when you get on the little piece of land. it looks cool, and peaceful, but lacks anything to do
Hanoi experience. It's a lake with a nice little red bridge over a section of it! I can't see it as a must see to be honest.

Nice Hanoi Community Lake. This is a nice little community lake for people to Hanoi to enjoy. You can find people in the crack of morning (5AM) doing tai-chi exercises and other people exercising. Excellent energy comparable to places like Central Park in NYC. Really worth it to see in the morning!
great spot for lunch. Loved having a good coffee at Hapros by the lake and watching the world go by.

Relaxing place in the hustle of the Old Quarter. A pretty lake with lots of people and newly wed couples having photographs taken! Be prepared to be approached by young Vietnamese wanting to practice their English! :)
Visit early in the morning. The misty mornings with locals beginning their day with Tai Chi, ballroom dancing lessons or offering incense. You may even find a lone soul singing at the clock tower.

Nothing special. This is a big lake in Hanoi. And that's it. It's lit up at night and looks a bit tacky, the temple in the lake is also not really worth a visit and the red bridge looks better in photos. Maybe I was a bit tired at this point after a month in Vietnam but I didn't think it was anything special.

Hanoi's lungs. Don't miss out strolling around this lake when you visit Hanoi to appreciate a little about how Hanoi many years ago. The Huc Bridge is very picturesque, but is oftentimes jammed with young people taking pictures of each other.
Lovely and peacefull. Lovely place to visit in the centre of the bustleing city
Serene tranquility.... ...with traffic noise!!! An oasis 'midst the chaos and a platform for people watching...

Nice lake. It's a lake. It has a pagoda in it with funny colored lights. The trees have funny colored lights. Lots of couples. Some musicians some times. A happening place. A pleasant place for a stroll.

A good stroll but look out. Good to stroll around the lake and see all of the goings on, Tai chi, dog training, dancing, you name it. At the weekend they light up the lanterns in the trees which is very pretty.ick pockets lurk in the area so be on your guard. Especially the kids with postcards.
Pretty lake. Nice for a stroll and to observe the locals relaxing, etc.
Fantasy and flying fish. I travelled with Intrepid Tours to Vietnam and Cambodia and had the most wonderful grass roots experience. A highlight was this lake.

a relaxing stroll around the lake. Sat aftn and both tourists and locals are walking around the lake.
Beautiful to photograph on a sunny day with trees decorated with lanterns that overhang the water. Check out the popular ice cream shop Ken Trang Tien a couple of blocks away.

Beautiful. This little lake is in the center of the city, and the heart of it.
Fireworks and celebrations start from here.
Don't miss to visit the little island

OK. It's ok, lots of scams around here, people out to annoy you and rob you etc but it is still nice to walk around and enjoy the atmosphere, nice little coffee place at the top corner, if youre hungry, get the club sandwich, a great feed!!!

Hoan Kiem Lake. Hoan Kiem Lake provides a place to rest and think and is beautiful. We saw many students practicing sketching with the lake as the setting, so you know it must be special. Conveniently located on the lake is Ngoc Son Temple. We spent plenty of time just people watching at the lake.
Beautiful lake right in the center of the city. It's nice to stroll around the lake early in the morning when Hanoi is waking up. Peaceful before the chaos starts!!

Nice place to walk and witness all of the activities. Nice place to walk and witness all of the activities. There's everything from badminton to tai chi to ballroom dancing to selling arts and crafts. Visit the "City View" cafe and watch the crazy traffic.
Love Hoan Kiem Lake. We loved walking around Hoan Kiem Lake, shopping, looking at the wedding couples taking photos, etc.
Very Green lake but to escape the traffic; bliss. it was lovely to walk around this in the morning when the locals were exercising, felt part of the city, it was misty but atmospheric.

Please clean it well... I really like this lake for it's history and charm regardless if you're there during the day or night. BUT I almost stepped on a dead rat on my first visit after i took a picture. Of course, i screamed because i almost stepped on the most disgusting thing. There were around 3-4 Vietnamese seating nearby and they were laughing at me as if they were even disgusted by it. One of them even teased me that there's another one under his mopeds. I just smiled and continue pushing the stroller of my son. Although we returned like 5 more times and I didn't see any dead rat anymore but my 3-year old son started and always teasing me and reminding me the whole time we were in Hanoi "watch out for rats mommy!"
Hoan Kiem Lake. pollution spoilt the ambience of the lake and crossing the road from the old quarter to get to it was a nightmare.
Get some exercise. It was nice to walk around the lake and much more peaceful than the old quarter

Start to the Old Quarter day. If you can manage it one day, you should join the warm up to the day that occurs around the lake each morning. Our best start was 5;30AM and there were already 500-1000 folks walking(mostly counter-clock-wise), exercising(some even brought weights out), group calisthenics(to really poor boom boxes) and the ubiquitous tai chi followers. By 6AM, the number of people had doubled and by 6:30, there was a full house. What a site.

Interesting spot in the middle of chaotic old qtrs. It is a gd spot to pole watch the locals . We were there killing time at 5.30 am having come in from Sa Pa on an early am train . Many locals were already gathered at the park , exercising away ... It's a nice peek into a tiny tiny slice of local life, a cool respite fm the Hanoi heat and pollution, early morning, before the craziness of the day begins .
Nice but nothing special. You got a temple in the middle of the lake and some nice statues around it, thats almost it right?
Lovely walk.. A lovely walk around with places to stop for a drink. Temple in the middle of the lake very interesting to see.
Some quiet in the madness. Nice to sit and relax for a break in the madness. Lots of touts but you just need to be firm with them.

Hanoi, please clean the lake!. A traffic free haven in the centre of the old quarter and a lovely walk with open skies above you. Hopefully there are moves to clean up the lake to protect the almost mythical giant turtles that supposedly live here.
Nice lake in the middle of a city. Nice area to walk around. We went off season but I guess during the high season it might be too crowded.
A nice walk. A nice place to walk without worrying about traffic..

A great walk in the center of Hanoi. We walked around the Lake on 2 separate occasions. The paths are very easy to walk, and there are nice benches to use if you want to stop to enjoy the scenery or people watch. The Thap Rua ( Turtle Tower) in the center of the lake looked quite mystical in the haze in daytime. At the north end, the red wooden bridge leading to the island Jade Mountain Temple is very pretty. On our first visit, a large turtle surfaced at the north end, drawing a huge crowd of people. Last Sunday evening, we again walked around the lake and were pleasantly surprised to see all the lanterns lit in the adjacent trees, and the Red Bridge illuminated- it was quite magical.

Beautiful! Walk around the lake. Fun to see brides & grooms in their wedding outfits posing by the Lake. It was cold so the brides wore heavy coats until they got to the next place they posed for a photo - then they took off their coat and posed (and froze).

We visited it a few times.. It is a very beautiful place. We liked to go there over the bridge. Last day we had a farewell visit in the rain and it felt like it was the right place to visit to say goodbye and thanks.

A Green Colored Lake in Old Town ... Needs to be better kept up. Our hotel was two blocks away from this lake and we regularly walked along the lakeside each day. While we found the lake enjoyable to look at from afar, we were not impressed by the cleanliness of the lake or shoreline. It is highly unfortunate that such a significant cultural landmark as this body of water and temple is not better kept up. The lake is completely green with algae and there seemed little interest in residents or tourists in keeping the area clean. I agree with other reviewers that it's in a great area with cafes, restaurants and shopping. While I rated this average due to it's current condition, there is opportunity to improve with more focus on preserving the living conditions for the rare symbolic turtle(s) that live here.
nice place. go there in the evening - nice lightning, plenty of nice cafes to sit and observe the lake and the streets

Lucky Day. We were in walking distance of the lake. Walked right around it and found a very nice place to have a coffee and people watch. We saw the turtle that lives in the lake. We were told he is elusive and that if you see him it is deemed lucky. We also visited the Temple on the lake.
Peaceful spot. A peaceful place to rest with cafes nearby. Interesting watching the locals doing their daily exercise
Beautiful in the morning!. Fog, Pagodas, Red Bridge, Tai Chi, and danncing all at 8AM!
A pleasure for the eyes. Nice quiet and well kept place, the legend of the Lake of the Restored Sword is also very interesting and makes you appreciate part of the Vietnamese culture.

Fantastic to Walk Around. When you want to take a nice leisurely walk, then this is a lovely place to do it, there are local people selling there wares all around it and lots of bars and restaurants situated on or very close to it, on the whole a lovely relaxing walk, just what the doctor ordered.
Overrated!!! Just a patch of dirty water!. Just a dirty old water hole in the middle of town. ok to stroll past on your way somewhere but certainly don't go out of your way.

Lovely temple. The lake and its surrounds are very pretty - but the small temple in the middle is well worth a visit, even if only for the wonderful art on sale in the small gift shop. Also,check out the sculpturesin the park on the mainland by the exit bridge

It is there for a reason. This is the center and social heart of the old quarter. Just as a warning, the place is badly infested with cockroaches so if you don't like these fellas (likely), don't wear sandals, just to feel a little safer.

Nice Lake with character. Whole lake is surrounded by old buildings of different period of Hanoi's colonial history. Hopefully no future high rise buildings construction planned at the expense of progress. Restoration of old building is apparent for current usage. Traffic flow is a problem with no taxis and trishaws trying to pickup tourist.

It´s not so much the lake but the life around it. In the middle of Hanoi this small lake (it would take a lesiurely 30 min walk to go around) is not very impressing as a lake in the daytime but at night with the lights all around on and the mirror effects on the lake it becomes a bit enchanted.There is a temple in the middle fo it also well illuminated at night and while the nortwestern corners has a small nice park the south eastern holds the place where a lot of locals meet. There you can a glimpse of how the localslive their lives in the evenings very interesting with a good view on the town.It is a nice place in the evening and early night to wind down and relax a bit and enjoy the sights of this place. Lots of food to buy and just south of the old town, to miss it would be a sad thing.

A must see - famous landmark of Hanoi and Vietnam. This lake is a must see for a trip to Hanoi. It offers a bit of a peaceful break from the rest of Hanoi and posseses some classic landmarks. This lake offers a nice walking environment for getting some exercise and relaxing. there is an ice cream shop and coffee shop located on the side of the lake which are nice to sit an enjoy. Many young couples like to come here in the evening for a bit of canoodling on one of the many benches. Most of all, this lake is a great place to take some photos for Hanoi memories. Make a game of it and see how many young brides you can capture in a single photo. One note: the lake is dirty, but not as bad as it used to be.
Beautiful!!!!!. Spent many days walking around this lovely lake. Always something different to see, music, young couples (very popular for Vietnamese teenagers), artists.
A special place. I have met life long friends here at Hoan Kien Lake. Be sure to walk the lake in the morning and see the wonderful start to a day in Ha Noi.

Romantic night walk. Do as the local young couples... Buy an icecream and relax with your loved one on one of the many benches next to the lake. For the occassional shower; bring your umbrella and you will have a great night without spending much :-)

So Much To Do And See Around This Lake. Every weekend evening Hanoi comes out for a leisurely walk around Hoan Kiem Lake. Color lights adorn the trees and a small group gathers around an older man playing his musical instruments while they sing folk songs. A walk around the lake can creates a calming effect in the middle of a busy environment.

lovely lake. great to potter around,and people watch. There are lots of benches scattered around. There area also cafes in or around the area. After seeing the lake, bridge and temple, you return to the hurly burly of Hanoi traffic.

Dirty. Dirty lake. I didn t really trust the greenish colour. On the positive side, you can walk there without scooters passing you from al sides. And you can see some Vietnamese people doing tai chi or massaging eachothers backs.

Seen in murkey conditions.. This is a lake in the city centre. At the time of our visit the weather was rather grey and drizzly.
We thought it was nothing special.
Fascinating. After walking through crowded and noisy streets find the spot was a suprise! Good to walk around and enjoy some quiet moments enjoying a nice view.. and a coffee!
Nice walk in busy Hanoi. The lake it self is so so:-) But the temple in the middle of the lake, is definetly worth a visit! Beautiful temple, with a lot of "kodak" moments:-)
Another ordinary lake. nothing to rave about...the lake does serve as a central point to the old quarter.

Great for a wander. Go for a wander around the lake at anytime to get a feel for this 'hub' in Hanoi. Early mornings see the locals exercising, afternoon see the locals & the younger crowd just hanging out. Grab ice cream from Fanny's and enjoy it!

Hoan Kiem Lake. What a wonderful lake to explore and walk around. Great to see all the activity around the lake and to explore it at different times, it takes on a different atmosphere at different times of the day.

Very scenic, especially around Tet; beware of pickpockets. Hoan Kiem is a very scenic lake in the heart of Old Quarters. The lake has a temple in the middle which is reachable across a short bridge along the north eastern side of the lake. The temple houses a turtle from the species which purportedly aided the King by lending him a sword which was dutifully returned to the turtle by the victorious king. The lake looks very pleasant by day with a soft mist covering it every morning around Tet and by night it looks magnificent in grandiose lighting. There are several coffee shops where one can dine alfresco. We opted for one of the coffee places on the 4th level of a building overlooking the square and the lake. However, I'd strongly like to point out that on northern end of the lake opposite the road there is a group of 4 odd women who keep strolling the pedestrian walk way and have the gall to open my wife's haversack whilst she's walking. Thankfully my wife sensed some foul play and immediately turned to see a woman opening her bag and made a ruckus, immediately the lady turned and started observing a menu card on display a few steps away and another lady immediately came and explained to my wife that nothing was wrong. We did complain to a few policemen who were a hundred meters away but they said that if nothing is stolen then not to pursue the matter forward. Just wanted to caution all travelers so that their vacation is not ruined by a few lousy thieves. I'd like to state here that every other experience that we had with the local Vietnamese people was fabulous and we have absolutely no other complaints.
turtle. loved the space around this lake. even spotted a sacred turtle.

Historic Lake. This lake is very peaceful for being in the center of Hanoi. An interesting fact for Americans is that John McCain was shot down in this lake during the Vietnam War and captured. There is a marker signifying this event at the lake.

A good stroll. We spent 20 minutes strolling round this lake on a lovely misty day. There is more room to walk around here than in other parts of the old quarter so it was very relaxing and we enjoyed it. The water is thick green though and we wondered how the old turtle that lives there actually survives.

Hanoi's Relaxation Point. This parkland fringed lake is a pleasure to stroll around. While multitudes in cars or on bikes whiz past, on can watch the locals doing their morning exercises, like Tai Chi, couples getting wedding photos taken, professional photographers doing photo shoots, and travelers enjoying a quiet cup of tea, coffee, or ice-cream in various cafes.

Nice view, nothing to do.. Hanoi was cold, overcast, and windy (March 13). We walked around the lake, got cold, went into a museum just to get inside. Traffic here is worse than in Saigon, just as crowded, but they drive faster.

A great lake in the centre of Hanoi. An excellent place for a walk. Try and get up early and come here when the locals do their morning excercises, ranging from aerobica and thai chi to weight lifting and sword fighting.

1 thousand yr structure. there was a story of a King on this lake. a king with no child and dream of GuanYin gv him a child. Queens deliver a baby after the dream, so King decide to build something to memory GuanYin
Beautiful place to walk and people watch. A great place to see brides getting pre-wedding photographs and enjoy the Hanoi street scene.

Interesting history for this lake. Suggest to get someone to explain the history of this small lake in the city.
It goes back a long way!!
Nice, but not exciting. Pleasant to walk around for 30 mins, but not thrilling.

Vietnam coffee. Vietnam coffee with a perfect scenery! March still a spring in hanoi and the temperature was 12-13degree celsium. The restaurant similar to france design. We like having high tea in France with the cold air.Perfect!

Lovely!. If you go to Hanoi, you owe yourself at least one trip around Hoan Kiem Lake. This lake and many, many others in Hanoi, is surrounded by a lovely walkway, and it's a great place to observe some Vietnamese culture. If you go very early in the morning, you will be astounded and charmed by the number of people who are out exercising. It's worth it just to see the elderly people out doing their morning stretches and various kinds of group exercises. The early evening is the same. Many of the iconic shots of Hanoi are taken around this lake.
Green Mold Lake. Not much to see the little green Parks aroundthe Lake are kept nice , but the lake is a garbage pool for the Locals to dumpthere garbage into..
Beautiful temple. The lake has 2 temples, 1 of which you are able to visit. The lake itself is polluted, but there are many places for great photos despite that.
Living by the lake. Westayed by the lake and loved to walk around it in the early mornings with the locall people having their morning exercise.
Nice area to walk and people watch. Very busy on Sundays so fun to stroll around with the camera
Hoan Kiem Lake. Nice spot for a walk and photos in late afternoon or early morning. Lots of locals on the weekend.

Very touristry place. Scenic view. It was a break away from the hustle and bustle of the city life. There's a temple in the middle, and was overcrowded as we went during the weekends.There were many couples taking their wedding photos.

Nice early morning walk. We went to have a stroll and crossed the bridge to visit the embalmed Turtle. it costs 20,000 VND to cross bridge.It's not a must do in Hanoi Imo but it whittles away 30 mins or so.We had a drink in a cafe on the side and even managed a glimpse of the remaining Turtle.

Worth a stroll. If you are staying in the old quarter of Hanoi, this is def worth a look. But there is nothing spectacular that I would suggest is worth a out of the way trip to come here.It took about 20 mins to walk around the lake, you can cross over a bridge and go to a heritage temple, im not really sure what it was as all of the writting was in Vietnamese and the ticket was too, but for 20,000 dong it was worth a look.There is a pagoda in the middle of the lake that is pretty.The hawkers were particularly bad around the lake and also beware of friendly students (looking to fish items from your bag or get a free meal).

Better than West Lake. It's a much smaller lake but in my opinion, a much nicer place to hang out in Hanoi than the West Lake. It looks more relaxed and more beautiful. You will definitely not miss it if you are in Hanoi or Old Quarters.

Peaceful Place in the Middle of a Hectic City. We were in Hanoi last month and were staying just a 5 minute walk from the lake. We really enjoyed it in all kinds of weather. First time it was drizzling, then we strolled round it at night and the lights in the trees and reflected in the water were delightful. Then we spent some time there when the weather improved - lots of newly married couples posing for wedding pics. Crossing the bridge to the temple in the middle was a treat. A great place to relax in the middle of Hanoi.
Runaway from the noise. Walk around the lake, the place is a nice runaway from the crazy noisy city life. The cycle is a short one but nice places to look at around.
great. just walking around here is great lots of people exercising or just sitting around talking looks great at night
A almost must go lake. Surrounded by shops, hotels and every travellers shall go there to taste the real Hanoi

Beautiful!. The lake is gorgeous... In any weather! When we visited it was cold, rainy and misty and the lake was moody and mysterious! I'd recommend talking a walk around the lake on your way back from dinner, or perhaps early morning.

Exploring HoanKiem Lake.. HoanKiem Lake is an useful location which is always given direction by local people. It's convenient to know how to get from the lake to my hotel. the lake is also the jumping-off point for exploring the old quater, Hanoi's labyrinth of site traditional craft streets in a sprawling maze on the north end of the lake. Lake site is also a ideal place to find a bench and rest my toes after walking around ola quater.

Heart of Hanoi. this lake is a very popular place for locals and tourists alike. Many brides and newlyweds can be seen around the shore having photographs taken in staged poses with make-uo and hair retouched after each one! We were there over Chinese New Year and the lake had lights strung in the trees all the way around the lake. So pretty in the evenings.

Go at night to see the great lights around the lake. This is the main lake in Hanoi and is very large. It is just south of the Old Quarter so there is alot of activity around the lake. Especially interesting is the beautiful pagoda on the lake which has a long history. It costs about a dollar to cross the bridge and visit the pagoda. Around the lake are interesting monuments and sculptures. At night there are colorful lights around the lake.

Mythical turtle does exist. The lake gives Hanoi an old European style quality. The ambiance and friendliness of the people (students asked us to converse with them to practice their English). Watch out for the traffic though!

Peaceful and picturesque. Take time to walk right around the Lake. It is the focal point of Hanoi. Most of the landmarks are around the Lake and Old Quarter. Light rain fell most of the time we were there so take a jacket as the wind can pick up around the lake.

Very popular lake. The lake was within walking distance of my hotel, so I walked to it early one morning. Very pleasant walking at that time. Lovely to see. Later did a tour to the temple, very busy. interesting. Not sure if it was just for TET or a permanent fixture, but at night the lake was lit with coloured lights around the perimeter. Very beautiful. A very popular place for locals to have wedding photos taken.
Lovely. Take a walk around it at night - we were lucky enough to do this on valentines day..it was lovely..lots of heart shaped balloons and courtship :)
Beautiful picturesque location. Perfect location for a leisurely stroll around the lake away from the hectic traffic. Very charming and 'Romantic"
Very Pretty Lake, Great for Photos. Great central location to find your bearings. Lots of lovely restaurants and things to do nearby.
romantic, many people. good for excercise, walking around, do Taichi, safe

nice to walk around!. i stayed nearby and walked around the lake. there's lots of activities and some temples around. a nice place to walk around but beware of grouchy locals! i took a pic of a weighing machiine and the lady minding it woke up and scolded me
romantic. we hanged around the lake during st valentine eve... so many yourn couples around us and love in the air...what do u want more?
We visited with Hanoi Kids!!. We liked being with our student guide and icecreams by the lake
You can't avoid it. It's a lake with pretty lights, a tomb, a tortoise and a sword - two out of three are mythical.
photo taking was great. a lot of young newly married were taking photos that Sunday nice palace to visit if were very free .Shops selling cheap silk dress .
go early morning. this is the life of hanoi - go early in the morning and see the activity - the oldies and their tai chi - the youngun's doing their areobics etc

It wouldn't be trip to Hanoi without a visit to the lake. Make it a point to walk around the lake at least once during your stay. I've been to Hanoi 3 times and each time it is a different experience. Early mornings are perfect if you are there in May before it gets too hot and you can see everyone out and about doing excercises, ball room dancing, you name it. Later in the day you will see brides being photographed in all their finery. In the evening, there are street performances. The temple is definitely worth a visit. My last trip was so packed with business that I didn't get to do my morning walk and l left feeling incomplete. Next time I will do the first morning I am there so I am sure I get my fix.

Central point and a great view at night. It is the centre of everything in Hanoi and a great reference point if you are trying to learn to navigate the streets. It is easy to find, costs nothing and is nice to sit near and people/traffic watch.

Very peaceful oasis in a noisy city. Hoan Kiem Lake is one of the most famous landmarks of Hanoi.You cannot not visit it.We went around the lake full circle in our previous trip in 2010. One can stroll leisurely and watch many activities--children at play, couples doing their pre-wedding location photography, people doing through the red bridge to the temple in the middle of the lake, families or couples just wandering about, singles doing a quiet read with a book or on their iPad or checking phone text messages on a bench, vendors hawking their wares--food, drinks, balloons, trinkets, etc.We were in Hanoi to observe their Tet festivities. I was out to photograph those who were wearing colourful clothes (it was around 20 degrees Celsius though). I also volunteered to take photographs of families, esp a large one (over 20) on the 1st day of Tet.In short, Hoan Kiem Lake is therapy for the heart and soul. We will definitely visit it again and again.

Centre of the city. This beautiful lake is the centre of the old town. It provides some calm in an otherwise chaotic city (especially for us since we visited just prior to Tet). Go early in the morning to watch the variety of exercise routines.
Flowers for Tet. Wonderful flower displays for the forthcoming Tet celebration. also the road all down one side was closed to traffic which made for very pleasant wandering and observing.

Easy to get to, take a look. Hoan Kiem lake in in the center of the Old City and features a number of interesting sites around it. More like a large pond, you don't need much time here. Visit at night when it's lit up!

Nice lake to walk around. Its small enough to walk around for a nice stroll, the history of the lake is interesting too and its very close to the old quarter which is handy as its the best place to be.

A peaceful spot.. This beautiful lake is surrounded by a pathway and well maintained gardens. It's a tranquil setting in a busy city. A red wooden bridge leads to an island with a temple. A great place to sit and relax. Little wonder brides come here to have photos taken.
Lovely stroll. The lake is lovely to stroll around and there aren't many bikes on the pavement (rare in Vietnam). Plenty of cafes near by to pass some time.

Walking and people-watching.... Walk around the lake. Visit the temple. People-watch. Drink some coffee or tea. Get some ice cream. Look at the red/orange bridge. At night, they have colored lights. Enjoy!

Best walk along the lake in the sunrise and sunset. A good place to walk along the lake.
To me personally it is best to come early in the morning, when the sun comes out.
Then you can witness the extraordinary experience, namely a hundreds of people to gather around the lake and doing the exercises, jogging ....
what a lake!. it's just that it's completely walkable & right in the centre of the capital, where else would you get that?

Chinese New Year setting for many wedding photos. If you come around the time of Chinese New Years you can see couples and photographers using Sword Lake as a backdrop. Other than that, it is a lake. At night it is very pretty with the lights reflecting on its surface.

Oasis of calm. Nothing much, just a green open space, offering a respite from the chaotic traffic and crowds of the Old Quarter. On a few nights I was there, there were a couple of elderly musicians playing viet folk songs "for fun" (not money) with young people gathered around clapping and singing along. Tip: There are a number of restaurants with open terraces fronting the lake at the northern part of the lake - it is very pleasant (weather permitting) to have a coffee and enjoy the atmosphere.

Peace in the center of Hanoi. Even the surround areas are so busy and noisy but at the edge of the lake is so peaceful and so green. It's a best place to take a break between you walking around the district for attractions. One thing that anoy me is the people who try to sell travel book to me while I sit by the lake. The come and talk to you very friendly then suddenly they discover their hidden travel books and keep asking you to buy.

Where Hanoi comes out to play!. As most people live in small spaces these public areas are the ones that are used to walk, play, meet friends and exercise. A great way to see how they spend their leisure time.
Beautiful at night. Enjoyed walking around the lake. Many locals sit and people watch. We enjoyed watching everything. From the lake we could easily find our way back to where we started.

Heart and Soul of Ha Noi. Hô Hoàn Kiêm is the true heart of Ha Noi. Situated between the old quarter and the french quarter, this lake is cultural heritage, recreation area, tourist sight, aerobic gym, photo studio and much more. When Hanoians want to experience nature or relax, they come here. At all times, you can see people walkin or jogging around the lake. Young couples or girls in the traditional Ao Dai dress get pictures taken with the lake as background. between 6 and 7 a.m. and between 6 and 8 p.m. a lot of Vietnamese come here to do morning/evening exercises like aerobics or stretching. And it's the perfect place if you want Vietnamese to talk to you to practice their English :)The lake is home to the famous Hoan Kiem Turtle, a god who is guardian and protector of the city and (supposedly) lives in the small pagoda on the island. If you can spot the turtle it means good luck - so if you ever see a huge crowd at the lakeside, keep your eyes open for a turtle head :)
Go for a walk, visit the temple or shop. You can walk around the lake, visit the temple, or shop or dine at one of the shops nearby. The red bridge offers a great photo opportunity.
Could have walked around it every day. Delightful centre of the old centre. It seems to never change despite the hurly-burly of daily life in Hanoi. People exercising, walking, talking - Really Hanoi

Pretty Lake to walk around. It is worth having a wander around the Hoan Kiem Lake especially in the evening as the lights are being turned on. There is a little cafe on the west side of the lake which is nice to sit and have a drink and watch the world go by

It's a lake...walk around it, eat sausages!. We were in Hanoi over the Tet period so the lake wasn't the usual haven of tranquility I imagine it to be at other times. This was mostly due to the hordes of Vietnamese, Chinese and Korean tourists milling around and coming to pay their respects at the temple in the lake. The red bridge is a great photo opportunity and the temple itself at 20000d is a nice place to see the various ceremonies. The path around the eastern side of the lake is dotted by ladies selling delicious sausages on a stick and old guys selling popcorn and candy floss. I've read that it's also a great place to go jogging as you can make a full circuit of the lake quite easily in none busy periods. I'm not sure I'd want to attempt that in such a smog filled city though.

Interesting, fun and relaxing. There was a very relaxed atmosphere here, tourists looking around, a beautiful lake on a cool day, old men playing Chinese chess, beautiful temple and kids running around having fun. I probably felt the most relaxed here in all of Hanoi. Through my daughter, I met some friendly Vietnamese tourists.My wife and daughter after crossing the bridge back to the mainland joined a small crowd of spectators looking at the mythical turtle which breeched a few times out of the lake's waters. I never saw it though - i only heard the gasps of excitement.

The core of Hanoi!. Loved this place! It is where everything takes place in Hanoi. Restaurants as well as street food stalls are all around the lake. Old people doing tai chi and young guys having fun with friends. At night it is just beautiful all lit with color lights.

Well worth a walk around. A very relaxing place to walk around amidst the days hustle and bustle of Hanoi - the Highlands Coffee Shop at the top of the Lake is a good place to sit and relax before/after. Take care of your vauables as there were a few dubious characters walking around on one of our walks just after dusk.

Like a basket full of flowers in a busy busy city. Hoan Kiem Lake is not Hanoi's biggest lake, nor is it the cleanest. But a walk around its circumference in less than thirty minutes gave us a peek into the role it played in Hanoians' day in life. People make their way on their bicycles and motorbikes, moving slowly, packed tight, around the lake. We saw so many professional photographers snapping away pictures of brides and grooms dressed in their fine suits and wedding gowns on the green lawns beside the lake. Highlands coffee on one side, Fanny's ice cream on the other side, restaurants and coffee shops surrounding it, one can spend hours and hours by the lake.
Nice Lake in Centre of Town. Loved the temple in the centre as well as the one accessible by red bridge.
Symbol of Hanoi. Lake, Temle, park. You can get rest and touch to history. Very beautyfull!

Heart of Hanoi must beat here. I stayed near the lake and walked it countless times. Popular with locals and tourists alike. The best people watching in all of Hanoi, far as I can tell. Hoan Kiem is like a magnate. It comes alive as early as five in the morning with groups of folks engaged in exercise, tai chi, and so forth. Hoan Kiem is a place to spend time at; not just look at like a tourist stop.
Wonderful place to start your holiday. The area around the lake is very charming and lots of local things happening there.

Its just a lake . . . .. Well more like a big pond. Chances are you will bump into this on your travels around Hanoi, but I wouldn't say this should be down as an attraction. Its a nice touch to the hustle and bustle but I would say its nothing near beautiful.

A cool escape from the frantic rhythm of old quarter. A walk around the lake is a pleasant experience in the Winter in Hanoi, especially when there is no rain. Good escapade from the hustle and bustle of the old quarter.Walk through the French quarter is much more relaxing than the old quarter.I would beg to differ from most reviewers here who preferred the old quarter, if I were to come to Hanoi again, would certainly stay in the french quarter- much cleaner with less traffic - which gives you a feel and touch of the holiday mood, if you are here for holiday.There is no shortage of good eating place in the French quarter, of course minus the many street vendors you can find in the old quarter. Prices in the French quarter is rather reasonable to me, you may find cheaper food in old quarter but the hawkers tend to rip you off , eg by charging you 50,000dong for a pho, which you can have for 45,000dongs at pho24 in the French quarter, in a much nicer environment, cleaner, plus a plate of herbs which is clean, unlike the hawkers who usually recycle the uneaten herbs left over by the previous customers.One minus points about the Lake- it is rather dirty.

The legend of lake.. When visiting Hanoi, a visitor who did not see Sword Lake has not actually been to Hanoi. I saw many young and old Hanoians come to Hoan Kiem Lake to rise with the sun every morning. They did exercise and chat with each others in the late afternoon. Located in the heart of Hanoi, the lake is acknowledged as a historic and cultural relic and an endless topic and inspiration for painters, poets, writers, and music composers.

Nice retreat. Lots of people sitting on seats, gathering with friends around the lake. Popular meeting point. Looks beautiful with all coloured latterns lit up around the side of the lake.We visited a cafe every evening along the waters edge. Best to sit outside & look out over the lake. Locals doing exercise early in mornings.Regards,Karen.
Colourful!. We were there just before TET festival so the flower displays were in abundance in preparation for the event.Interesting character and lots of touists from all around the world!

Dawn walk!. We liked to find a relatively quiet place to go for an early morning walk. This is it. You can join in the tai chi or other exercise groups. There are lots of people exercising. A group of very old woman in a line all working out was a sight. It gets very busy later on especially if you want to access the red bridge.
Go at sunset!. Lovely lit up at Sunset, we went just before so saw the lake in the day and at night. A must see, the hub of the city.

a retreat from the hubbub. Thank goodness for Hoan Kiem Lake! We would retreat from the chaos of the old quarter to walk around the lake, sit at a cafe, and people-watch. There is a great outdoor cafe on the south side that serves the best Vietnamese coffee we had anywhere! Be sure to have a seat at the table and watch the other cityfolk walk by.
Pretty. It is very pretty at night with all the lights, and nightlife going on . We saw a water puppet show which was enjoyable.

Early morning exercise. I took my running shoes to Hanoi and this is what I found. The tracks around Hoan Kiem provide a pleasant place for a run. Take the outside track and avoid the casual walkers. My calculation says it is about 1.5kms per lap.
Centrally located. Didn't get to see much of the lake as there was a new year's day flower show around the lake.

Hoan Kiem lake. The lake is beautiful and cool with many trees around, but it is very crowded. I don't like crowdedness.
Ngoc Son temple is old and nice. I love going around the lake and visit the temple, sometimes I pray for lucks in the temple.
I love ice creams around the lake. It is tasty, various and cheap.
Get up early in the morning. Well worth getting up early and walking around the lake and watch people exercising or join in. On a misty morning this is quite magical!
Nice lake. I went running around the lake in the morning during my stay and it gave me a nice memory
The lake. Quite interesting - nice walk around and the sculptures were a feature.

A must visit in Hanoi. Have walk around the lake, maybe a coffee or a beer at one of the lake \side cafes.Visit the temple in the cetre of the lake and learn something of the myth of the giant turtle who retrieved themystical sword that saved Vietnam from the chinese. Marvel at all thecapitalist businesses that have their offices around the lake.Historic and ironic fun
A lake's a lake. It is a lake. A nice one, but still a lake. Fanny's ice cream and Pho 24 are nearby- definite plus.

Is the turtle really there?. Hoan kiem is a dirty little lake in the middle of downtown, the tortoise tower is pretty cool. And there is supposedly some rare turtle species that lives in the lake, but I've never seen it in my many visits and I have to wonder if anything could live in there.

Peaceful in the heart of the Old Quarter. The lake is right at the edge of the Old Quarter, and is a bit of a focal point of locals and tourists alike. Peacful and tranquil, wiht lots of local family activity at nights and weekends. Don't bother with the cafe or resturaunt that sit right on the water on the west side of the lake for anything more than a coffee or cold drink (lovely location but shocking service and the food really bland and over priced. Just a bit of a tourist trap really).

Beautiful pagoda island!. The temple (as usual) was beautiful! The setting being on a tiny island on the lake made it that much more beautiful. Hopefully you have a day with good visibility and can see across the lake. Great places for ice-cream cones all around the lake!
Nice place. Only 1 minute walk from the Gondola Hotel, It's amazing with old man and old lady did the exercise everymorning. At night, the man play the chess arround the lake. Amazing
Another must see place. Weather during my trip was not that good but I still enjoyed walking around this area.

A lake is a lake I guess... Its an alright lake - if you have seen any big or better ones (most TripAdvisor visitors would have), you wont be impressed. Much is made of the pagoda in the center - the red bridge to get there is quite pretty but once you get in, there's not too much explanation. We spent around 20-30mins on the whole and I did not come back any enlightened.
Not much to see. Not much to see around there (except the small temple in the middle), but you can have a relatively peaceful walk around.

Charming and tranquil. The lake is huge, so you can always avoid the throng of tourists crossing the red bridge by visiting the quieter spots. There are plenty of benches around, and a couple of cafes nearby too; all in all, a charming and tranquil place to rest and relax for a while.
Beautiful lake. Quite a beautiful lake, where you can (almost) get away from the extreme busyness of the Old Quarter. There is a nice walkway around the lake which makes for a good stroll.

Peaceful lake in busy Old Quarter. A peaceful lake surrounded by busy traffic and a bustling Old Quarter. There are well maintained paths, and there appears to be no motorbike parking on these too. There is good seating for those who just want to sit and relax. In the morning you can see some people jogging around the lake, doing tai chi or exercise. At sunrise it is also lovely too. A walk over the bridge to the pagoda is worth the small admission fee. You can stand on the bridge without paying. It gives a different perspective of the old quarter. You could also just walk around the lake and sit and enjoy an icecream from Fannys.
Lovely Lake. A nice oasis in the busy crazy city. The pagoda is worth walking to for pictures.
EXERCISE HERE!. Many tourists and locals alike take a walk around the lake (about 15-20 minutes only), a picturesque and relaxing haven in an overcrowded city.

A good place to see. Everyday in this area was too crowded. The people come here for relax, sightseeing, take picture and do exercise from everywhere both Vietnammess and foreigner. In this area also have many shops for coffee, Ice-cream and fast-food... and nightly entertainment. A must come and see!
Wedding photos around the lake. Took quite a few walks around the lake, one day, about 10-15 couples were having pre-wedding photos taken. what a great sight.

Sunrise Stroll a Must!. We loved Hoan Kien Lake- especially for an early morning stroll. The walking paths around the lake are alive with groups of people playing badminton, doing tai chi and even ballroom dancing! Not to be missed!

Enjoyed the time whe spent around the lake. We were lucky enough to be a 5 minute walk from the lake.The first day we arrived in Hanoi we walked to the lake and enjoyed the gentle pace of life that surrounded the lake.It is a place of community with small hawkers,tourists and people getting married.The Temple of the Tortoise and the bridge are woth the view.We were up early one morning on our return from Sapa and went down to watch the Vietnamese people start their day with gentle aerobics and my sister joined in.Worth the stroll and take your time.It is clean and very beautiful.

A nice afternoon stroll. This central lake in Hanoi is a nice afternoon stroll - start with the temple and then head clockwise past several impressive government buildings and monuments on your left. As you reach the other end of the lake and start to head up the other side cross the street for a delicious ice cream at Fanny's the cross back to look at the Turtle Tower which sits crumbling on its own island in the lake. When you get back to the old quarter end of the lake head to the nearest coffee shop for refreshments.
Beautiful & Romantic. Beautiful lake with some history. Take a stroll at night and enjoy a romantic evening with a loved one.

a great place for a stroll. Hoan Kiem Lake is steeped in history, culture and myths (just ask any Hanoian about the giant turtles!), but above all, it's a wonderful place to just dawdle along and take in the atmosphere of Hanoi whether it is during Tet or on any given day.....thriving with courting couples, old people getting their state-mandated exercise or just people out for a breath of air....it's a great place to see the weird and wonderful side of Hanoi.....bring a camera and good luck awaits if you spot the mystical/mythical turtle!

a break from the busy streets. A great place to relax and watch the older locals in the evening exercising together and the younger vietnamese gathering to socialise. We came to the lake each day as its central and peaceful in comparison to the surrounding streets. From here you can visit the temple on the lake, the water puppetry show, night markets, museums and if your staying in the old quarter the lake is an easy walk.
A peaceful oasis. A beautiful lake surrounded by crazy traffic and a bustling city. Well maintained paths and good seating for those who just want to sit and watch the passing parade.

Peaceful. We work up early for a walk around around the lake. It was an easy walk with little traffic. The lake framed by weeping willows, was a picture for romantic walk at sunset. But, the early morning proves very interesting, watching the hanoians do their morning exercise like Tai Chi, jogs etc. The tourist police weren't happy with the kid polishing our shoes. I understand their job was to stop tourist from being harassed. But their over exaggerated act was disturbing for my teens. They are better off concentrating on the photographers, who charge ridiculous rate for a photo.

Quiet spot in bustling Hanoi. A beautiful lake surrounded by a walk, benches, trees, historical sites, some places to stop for coffee. We ended up here often to get out of traffic and take a moment to escape the crowds and noise in the streets. We came around 5am one morning and found the park areas filled with locals doing their morning exercise: men doing calisthenics, women doing something like jazzercise to boom boxes every 30 meters or so.
Heart of Hanoi. Lovely walk around the lake, stroll like the locals do and stop off on the way for coffee or ice creams.

Peaceful stroll. I enjoyed strolling around the lake. At this time of the year, the city adorns the shores with floral arrangements of all sorts that give a bit of a feel for Vietnamese culture. Some have huts that represent a certain part of Vietnam; others have a beach theme to show another. Yet others have fishing baskets. It was neat walking around. Be sure to visit the Turtle Temple right on the lake and the water puppet theater across the street from the temple.
Beautiful. We went in the morning, when the mist was lying on the lake, and got some great pictures. Lots of great cafes nearby for coffee or a meal, and central to the whole fascinating Old Quarter.

Nothing out of the ordinary. Personally, I find it hard to rate a site based on historical event especially when there is very little self-help guidance. This is very true with many other historical sites I visited in Vietnam. We decided to not visit the temple on the lake.as we figure it would just be like any other temple we have seen. I appreciated the relief painting at the entrance and the banyan tree. Still, I wish the stewards of these sites do a better job of making them more interesting by providing more written explanation

Romantic walk. Lovely, romantic walk around the lake. It is fun to watch the young, newly wed couples taking photos as well as the elderly Vietnamese exercising. I did not like the many vendors who tried to sell you postcards and other tourist memorabilia but once you waved your hand negatively they never bothered you again.
Great walk. Nice to go for a stroll around the lake, and loved the stories surrounding it.
brides on the lake. Its a pleasant walk lots of history and a great back drop for newly weds having their picture taken, look out for the giant fish in the lake
Nice for a stroll. The lake is average and there are interesting streets around it. We went to Hapro Cafe by the lake and sat there reading books and chilling.
Oasis in the center of Hanoi. Come early to join in with local residents practicing Tai Chi along the shore!

enjoy the atmosphere in early mornng. I like to walk around Hoan Kiem lake in the morning and in the afternoon.The atmosphere is so great and fresh. You can see many Hanoian do the exercise. it is very interesting and strange with the foreigners

Peaceful, quiet place to take a break. I love this lake! It's within walking distance from my hotel so it became a favourite place for us to hang out and the kids to let off some steam. Despite the insistant honking all around, this lake eminates a tranquility about it. It's just the place to centre yourself again after all the crazy traffic dodging on the streets.

I love this place. This is the heart of Hanoi. This is where Hanoi comes to celebrate, mourn, party, or just relax. For people on a tight budget, you can cross the bridge to the pagoda without paying, and this makes for some fantastic photo opportunities (although you and everyone else will be doing this, so be patient). If you're looking for coffee, there are some great coffee spots in the area, although, because of proximity to the lake, they are generally quite expensive. Wake up for about 6 am and watch the insanely fun and hilarious aerobics around the lake done by middle-aged and elderly women to loud techno music. There is reportedly a turtle in the Lake, and it is supposed to be a great sign of luck if you see it, so keep your eyes peeled.
Traffic free zone. Pretty, cooler than the rest of Hanoi because of its shaded banks. Nice cafes nearby (but beware of inflated cost)

A beautiful lake of the city center Hanoi. 2 hours strolling around the lake make you, me or any tourists understand more about local people here. Be a voice shoeshine boys who hang around or postcard sellers who may cause you trouble
Hoan Kiem lake. The Bridge is no longer a vibrant red!! There was no room to actually walk on the bridge, most people just stood there.

Take a stroll along the lake, it's beautiful at night. Everything is happening around the lake. Take your time to stroll and sit to watch the locals go around. Bikes and cars are everywhere you need to be careful while crossing the streets. There is a supermarket across the lake which have almost anything Vietnamese and even imported goods. In the morning, the locals dance on one end of the lake.
Very nice landmark to walk around. It is in the heart of the city with lots of people exercising around it. Fun to people watch in the evenings

Peaceful lake. I loved sitting at the top of Avalon cafe and looking down to the beautiful view of the entire lake. Lookout for this cafe.You'll see people exercising in the mornings & evenings and small stalls around selling sausages during winter.

Peaceful place in hectic hanoi. The lake and island are a wonderful place to temporarily escape the rush nearby. Take your time and sit in the garden . surprising number of joggers around the lake which I might do next time.

Beware Cell Phone Thieves and Pick pockets around Hoan Kiem Lake. A mid-afternoon stroll around the Hoan Kiem Lake was marred by the loss of a cell phone taken by an experienced pick-pocket. Using the same sorts of techniques you would expect outside the Termini Station in Rome, the thief sized us up and then approached with an array of postcards he was attempting to "sell". Even though I realized the guy was bad news and was pushing him away, she still managed the "divert, bump and run" getting m Iphone in the process. I was able to call the phone company (in this case Korea telecom) and cancel the number, but I hadn't finished setting up "find my iphone" which would have allowed me to remotely wipe the phone. So my advice to travelers. Beware when walking around the lake and figure out how to use the "find my iphone" service before traveling.
It's a lake. But it offers a nice break from the hectic city.And you might even see what lives beyond.
In the center of Hanoi. Near our hotel which we stayed and just some minutes, very nice in the evening with the colorful light, perfect.

Beautiful at night!. The lake is beautiful at night and makes for some amazing photos. I thought it was less impressive (well, less magical-looking) during the day and way more crowded, which takes away the serene feeling you get walking it at night. I walked it at night alone (with an expensive camera, no less) and never felt unsafe, nor was I bothered by anyone. The lake is a peaceful respite after a long day of chaotic Hanoi.
restaurant right by the lake. Good experience to enjoy a lunch at the restaurant (north west corner) right by the lake.

Nice open space to get away from the traffic. The beauty of this place is that it has an open area where you can walk around without fear of being run over by the numerous cars/motorbikes which chaotically 'drive' (using that term loosely) around Hanoi. There are a couple of small sites but the beauty is walking around the lake and enjoying being out in the open. A few pick pocketers, drug dealers and scammers have proliferated along this area so be careful. Although you should be careful at all times in Hanoi, no matter where you are.
Very pleasant area in Hanoi. Quirt area in midst of Hanoi's chaos with many nice restaurants, etc.
Lots to See. Walk around, Temple across a bridge in the middle. Visit lake at 0600-0700 to see lots of locals doing Tai Chi

Holiday visit to Hoan Kiem Lake. Going to Hoan Kiem lake during the day is very pleasant and filled with exercising, walking, and viewing the natural and constructed beauty. Visiting at night is filled with romance, eating, drinking, and dancing!Now, in December, Hoan Kiem is festively decorated with many lights, Christmas scenes, families walking, and couples kissing! Go there any time, but now is the best!
Relaxing. Either on daytime or nighttime, Hoan Kiem Lake is beautiful and very soothing.. nice place to relax after a long walk
Nice place to walk around. It is a great landmark .... Great food n decent numbers if regular tourist attractions in n around Hoan Kiem Lake... Get a good pair of sneakers n walk your calories off
Lights galore!. Fun chaotic. Beatufil at night. If U dont mind the hookers...
A slower pace. An oasis in the middle of the city, one of the places where it is possible to walk or exercise without eyes in the back of the head to avoid impact from the traffic

Be careful at night. First time I went was at 10pm. I walked around the whole lake. Was asked to buy drugs at least 5 times. Someone tried to scam me for $20, and 2 guys tried to follow me until I glared at them and let them move on. There are lots of people around and it is well lit. Just be careful if you are by yourself.I went again the next morning. I lucked out and saw one of the huge turtles surface for air a couple of times. It was pretty special to see.

Nice for an evening stroll. Its a quaint little take in the middle of a bustling city. Provides a bit of tranquility away from the endless mobs of scooters. Coffee spots found all around, especially in South Western corner, restaurants around lake are very expensive, as can be expected

The heart of Hanoi. A beautiful small lake located between the French quarter and the Old Quater of Hanoi. Surrounded by a strip of parklands full of locals enjoying the lake, getting married, people watching and just enjoying life in general. Two beautiful small temples adorn the lake, one reached by one of the prettiest footbridges you could imagine. This is a photographers dream, both for the scenery itself and the people enjoying the scenery.

Wonderful lake full of nice vietnamese people. I think this lake is wonderful not only for its appearence, wonderful especially in the night, but also for the nice Vietnamese people walking and sitting on the lake: young guys, families, old couples....And the lake is so near to the shops and cafe, tou can walk near it for an entire day and it will be not enough. I love it!!! If you want to see some photos of the lake, here you are my blog: http://vietnamwaterpuppet.wordpress.com/2011/08/07/hoan-kiem-lake-in-hanoi/

Nice little lake for couples. Its a nice lake for couples to stroll, not so much for tourists. Well, since its near old quarter, we do stop by the lake before heading to old quater by the green eco buddy. (See my review on Old Quarter for details) :)

Beauty. Serene and peaceful in the heart of chaos, weeping trees overhanging the lake ,walking paths and a welcome respite from the noise, traffic and pollution, that's if you can cross the road! Pretty girls in their traditional dresses and many brides being photographed.
good place for morning excercise. when staying in old quarter Hoan Kiem lake is most convenient place for rest and for morning exercise.
Nice for walking. This place is always busy with people and very nice for you to take a walk around the lake.

Worth an early morning visit!. I have stayed in a hotel near this lake twice this year (July and Dec) and the highlight of my day is often an early morning walk (or run) around the lake. From about 5am there are plenty of locals out and about - all walking in the same direction - practicing their Tai Chi, stretching or doing an open air aerobics class. It shows you a different aspect of the people of Hanoi and is a lovely start to the day. Enjoy!
So pretty. Doesn't take a lot of time, and you can say you were there.

So unlike the rest of the city. A green lung and peaceful sanctuary in the heart of the old city, that locals and foreigners alike hang out at day and night for various activities from exercise to simply chilling out. Takes you out of the hustle and bustle of Hanoi
Was expecting more somehow.. The lake is nice at night, and the ice cream shops in the area are well worth visiting, but the lake itself is not that impressive.

Go see first thing in the morning. As with all public spaces the park is beautifully kept and used by everyone. See it early morning 6-7am when the locals are out exercising, playing badminton and practising their ball room dancing. Fascinating. That is if you have the nerve to cross the road to get there!
Great to walk around. Its quite nice to walk around the lake. The lake itself is quite a small ordinary lake. But it has the smell of history and gives a feel of the city.
lovely. Go for a walk around the lake on a Sunday to really appreciate how Hanoi people spend their off hours.

Peace & Serenity. You can relax beside the lake any time of the day and find it is such a relief from the traffic and crowds. Best time to go is before 7.00am to see all the activities - tai chi, badminton and all sorts of exercises. You can even claim a piece of pavement for yourself to do your early morning exercise.

Pleasant oasis in a noisy polluted city. Early morning walk around the perimeter was educative about the locals customs and social interaction. Disliked the propaganda from loud speakers from about 8am around the old quarter. Felt like North Korea
A good place for a stroll. The lake is a good place for an early morning or evening stroll. Visit the temple on the lake and grab a seat at one of the nearby restuarants and watch the world go by.

Chill Out in this timeless lake. It is just good simply sit down and get peace in the middle of chaos, forget about the traffic in Hanoi, watch the lake, let your thought wonder aimlessly without control. The lake is the center of Vietnam and is full of stories from old days until nowadays.

beautiful. Its only a small place, so will only keep you occupied for half 20 minutes/half an hour, but is a very nice experience. Lovely views of the lake and the city surrounding it. It was nice to just sit in the sun and look out on to the lake.

Great for exercise and relaxation. The lake is big enough to provide a decent walk for exercise purposes, without having the deal with Hanoi's traffic. Probably a 30 minute brisk walk. Has lots of seating if you want to relax. Locals love to chat to you.
Sweet View. It was visually so nice to have a lake in the middle of a busy city. I enjoyed people watching around the lake as well.

An oasis in the hustle and bustle of Hanoi. Nice to walk around and visit the temple using the sunshine bridge, a nice area to escape the mad traffic of Hanoi, at the temple end of the lake cross over to the Old Quarter and visit Highland Coffee (3rd floor?) for a good view of the 5 street intersection to watch the traffic.

Hoankiem lake. In here, has old history, very nice.
You can walk around the beautiful lake and get clear air.

A great walk around the lake. If you have the time and energy walk around the lake to fully appreciate its beauty. The walk across Sunbeam bridge to Dang Ngoc Son (Jade Mountain Temple) can be very congested but the temple experience is worth the possible dscomfort. Thap Rua or Turtle Tower is beautifully lit at night. We visited during "wedding season" and lost count of the number of newly weds having heir photos taken at the lakes edge.There is a large intersection at the NW corner of the lake with 3 or 4 levels of bars that provide a great spot to have a cold beer and take photos of the intertwining cars, scooters and pedestrians as they weave through the intersection.
Greta place to refresh. Freat to sit and watch local pepople when the sport, wlaking and talking.
Good to see at night also - a very relaxing place!!. It is a great place for people watching, relaxation and very romantic if you are travelling with your partner

Wonderful. A great place to walk at night or during the day. Lots of food lines the lake and the streets just near by and there are plenty of places to just sit and enjoy the shade in the nice weather. At night the lake lights up and and it is especially pretty.

A great visit.. Hoan Kiem lake is a wonderful focal point in the city and makes for a great visit. In the middle of the lake stands turtle tower.
