Apart from the historic stories, the lake is really nice and peaceful to visit away from the crazy traffic of Hanoi. People jog past, couples take a stroll and it just makes for a wonderful visit. At night too, the views of turtle tower are lovely. If you are in Hanoi, you will and should definitely walk past here and admire the sight.
its a lake with two islands. its a good walk around the lake and there are a couple of good cafes etc on the north and west sides. Try Fanny ice cream if only for the photo op

A great place to relax or workout. Hoan Kiem Lake is a hive of activity on any given morning. There are people playing badminton, joggers, walkers, tai chi classes, weight trainers and many people just relaxing or looking to see the famous turtle. Of an evening, it becomes romance central with lots of couples just sitting by the lake watching the reflection of lights and talking as only two people in love do.
lovely lake with a great story. we walked around the lake which was very interesting --saw quite a slice of life. also went across the lovely bridge to the temple. worth a visit.

Nice spot to relax all day during weekends. A local tourist attraction with many people all day long especially weekends....many bride & grooms to be go here for photo sessions and the place to go for exercise in the evenings, Good place to relax and have a good stroll or catch up on a book surrounded by a lake and see people from everywhere walking past. Many restaurants and near to Old quarters....plus few attractions e.g. water puppet, cathedral, kem fanny, etc
Worth a visit and a walk. The lake is beautiful. Worth taking a casual walk around the lake. Nice view in the evening as well...
Walk around the Lake. A landmark for the centre of Hanoi I suggest walking around the lake and see the temples closeby.
Big turtle. The lake is pretty. Look for the big turtle. If you see it, then it should be your lucky day. We were lucky enough to see it when we were there.
Beautiful scenery. It was a good walking excercise around the lake. Beautiful scenery.
quiet refuge in busy Hanoi. a mystical, quiet refuge from the traffic - friendly faces, brides posing for their photographs, and not too many touts.
Great for an evening stroll. A must see when in Hanoi. The temple at the north end is worth a look. Very nice to walk around at night.
Beautiful Hoan Kiem Lake. Hoan Kiem Lake is still so beautiful and serene. Take a stroll round the Lake if you have the time.
The lake. A historic site but it is essentially just a lake!

pretty tourist area. Well looked after and really pretty. We spent a lot of time in the lake area. This area tends to quite expensive for Hanoi. And is mainly for the tourists. You'll tend to eat round here when you first arrive then move onto the smaller local restaurants. The city view cafe has 5 floors each with 2 restaurants per floor. The front restaurants have an excellent balcony over looking the lake and crazy junction.
beautiful. it was in the heart of the city and is the heart I think. People walking, dancing and exercising and having fun unselfconsciously.
Early Morning Experience. After the long plane ride to Hanoi, a little exercise with the locals might just be what you need! Feel free to join a Thai Chi group just after sun up.
Nice, but a bit hyped up. It is nice to stroll around, but it hasn't been maintained and doesn't have the charm I anticipated. Still, we did a couple of strolls around to people watch.

Colourful at all times of the day/night. As we were staying near the Lake, we enjoyed walking around the lake at different times of the day and the evening. At night the temples on the lake and the park around it were bright with colourful lights and it is obviously a focal point for locals as well as visitors. We saw wedding groups posing for photos, young and old jogging or doing exercises, kids playing shuttlecock, people just strolling. It was a real promenade ground, much as you might see in Italy. It was a lovely area.
Lovely. Great way to pass to pass time with locals -- lots of benches, cares, and people to watch.
Peaeful. The safe walkways and the restaurant where you can sit and watch the moods of this lovely lake

Peaceful way to spend a quiet morning. I visited the lake on a quiet saturday morning when there were many locals at the lake doing their exercises and morning strolls. Take a slow walk around the lake, and visit the Ngoc Son Temple by the lake if you have the time.

Do as the locals do, walk around it in the evening to escape some of the heat. It was absolutely beautiful and so relaxing. The night air was a pleasure as we walked around this lake after dinner. So many of the locals also enjoy this time to catch up, socialise and gossip as they walk around. You will see groups of elderly people doing a version of Tai Chi and the younger crowds hanging out of the coffee shops enjoying the cold Vietnamese condensed milk iced tea. Make sure you stay in the old quarter in Ha Noi and make sure you visit this lake (and the pagoda).
A Focus for the Locals. While the lake itself required some rehabilitation there was a constant flow of humanity around the perimeter - walking, talking, exercising for just sitting.

Peaceful. Although you can still hear the car horns blaring it's still a nice peaceful place to visit. The bridge and temple in the middle of the lake are very picturesque and nice to visit. The lake is also nice to visit at night because the temples are lit and the reflection off of the water is really pretty. If you need a nice relaxing afternoon I recommend visiting the Highlands coffee that overlooks the lake, nice way to wind down :-)
Beautiful if smog clears. Temple is beautiful and lake is serene but dirty. Loved walking here just to get away. Lots of couples sitting around park and must be famous place for doing wedding photos

Nothing special but still worth to see. It's the place where everyone goes to that is why there always many people: locals and foreigners. We were taken around the lake in the cyclos and had lot's of fun.
Wow, it is the center beauty.. Here is the center and best view of the city. Quiet in the center and also the place for all Hanoi couple to take wedding pictures.
Picturesque. Enjoyed wandering around the Lake and the local busy streets, too many touts selling postcards..... but you get used to it.
Overrated. Not a lot to see, The pagoda was quite nice but the whole thing was a bit grubby
Great orientation point.. Great to walk around and visit the temple. Interesting legend and history surrounding the lake.Funny to see the locals doing their exercise there!
The place for you to hang around or have a beer looking at the lake. It is very beautiful but bit crowded in the day time, if not it is very beautiful.

Great for 'people watching'.. A wander around the lake is great for seeing all Hanoi has to offer ... from the pedlars, to the old ladies doing Thai Chi.
The island on the lake is well worth the tiny fee - it's bigger than it appears, or rather it's well packed with interesting things to see.
Nice Scenery. This is where good scenery and central of the city is. Shopping is great and there is a French Liquor ice cream shop. Good to try

Lake in the middle of the Old Quarter. It was lovely taking a stroll in the evenings. All the locals were exercising or romantic couples taking in the atmosphere. A nice place to not feel like a tourist. People wandering around enjoying a gelato after dinner..

Plenty to do around the lake, an evening can slip by in a blink. Loely atmosphere all around the lake in he evening, gets dark around 6PM, with an SLR on a tripod you can do magic herre. Many trees are lit up like Christmas, the wooden bridge lit up in Neon, lots of people exercising, saw two street groups playing lovely music, people walking, jogging, exercising, some young couples co-hi-cooing....... time will fly.Our city tour ended here around 4 PM(would be wise to ask your guide to end here, you can take it on yourself for the next 2-3 hours) we crossed the wooden bridge to the temple. Temple too is better preserved then many others we saw, the story of Tortoise is pretty interesting; they said the dead one lived for 300-400 years and another one lives in the lake (300 year old!!) and gives Divine appearance to special people, so you can try your luck :) The wooden bridge looked like the best spot for clicks; saw lots of wedding gangs clicking away in all poses. We (me and wife) were lucky to be staying 3 minutes walk from the lake and spend some time in the evening on all 3 days just sitting and watching life flow by; you can get an idea of Hanoi cross-section of life; the rich, middle class and also the poor are seen chasing bread and pleasure. There's a great department store "Intemex" from were we picked up fruits, drinks and stuff. One day we took a Cyclo tour 4 USE for 2 hours, you sit on the cycle and the man pedels it into the maddening small streets; scary stuff how they drive and zig-zag through traffic. From in front of the cycle if you catch the video and show it to people they're not going to believe such a place in the world exists, I shot about 15-20 minutes of it, everyone who saw said like....'what a ride". Take this ride without fail.If you don't like noise, crowd, dust and mist.... this is not the place for you. =======

Sword Lake. What a fabulous asset to a wonderful city in the Old Quarter. We enjoyed almost every afternoon just strolling and taking photos of the sunset over the lake. We met some lovely locals who just came and chatted to us, who had an opportunity to practice their English, and who were genuinely interested in who we were and where we were from.

Spend the whole Evening!. Have dinner and then spend the rest of the evening wandering out the lake, see groups of ladies doing excersize to dico hits, couples learning latin dance and young couples sitti n romantically on the side of the lake. In the weekends the lanterns are on all around the lake and it's just like a fairy tale! This was my favourite place in all of Vietnam!

Hanoi's heart. We loved the lake and found ourselves here several times a day. My favourite time was first thing in the morning. By sunrise the lake is alive with people working out, stretching, walking and chatting. It's a great place to watch Hanoi wake up. Head down any time after 5.30am and join the locals for a morning walk.
Beautiful. Beautiful to walk around at night time with the lights everywhere and seeing so many couples out and about. People getting married, people watching the world go by.

The gathering place in the Old Quarter. This is the gathering place for early morning exercisors and as we walk around the lake, we enjoy watching the people--young and old out doing Tai Chi, badminton, stretching, etc. It's also great in the evening when we stoll along with others walking hand in hand. Last time we we're there one group was taking ball room dance lesons--that was a first for us!

Pretty lake gets you out of the noise a little. One place where you can just stroll in the city centre without having to concentrate on not treading on goods out for show and parked bikes on the pavement. Nice tearoom at the opposite end to the puppet theatre.

aka wedding photos venue. Looks better in pictures than in real life, but nevertheless not too bad. Nicer at night with the lightings though. Fairly crowded with not only tourists but also the locals as this seems to be one of the favourite spots for couples to take their wedding photos. You will see brides traipsing around the area ( some barefooted) in traditional AoDai and also various other dresses. And yes, they can even change from one set of clothing into the next right in full view of everyone without any makeshift Dressing room. There is a helper who will help her put on one set of clothes over the other, and then unlace and remove the one underneath. Interesting.........

Serene and peaceful. Hanoi seemed to be enveloped in haze when we arrived. So, there seemed to be an ethereal feel when we arrived at the lake. Nonetheless, there were many activities around the lake and saw several couples taking wedding photos too. Is really a nice place!

Culture plus. A walk around this lake at 6am is unforgettable !From tai chi to volleyball to early morning catch up chat sessions it is all there. We were invited to join an early morning waltz class!
Spot the brides. We walked rounf the whole lake and lost count of the wedding couples having their pictures taken. The temple on the lake is very cheap to get in.
Worth a stop in the morning.. Go in the early morning to catch the folks doing their exercise. Not much else to see.

Nice lake, great story. The place is a little bit crowded with locals and tourists. However the pagoda was peaceful and the Red Bridge is beautiful. You can ask the tour guide about the story that tells why this lake was named “Restored Sword”, quite interesting!
soul of the city. All of the action seemed to be centered around the lake. A beautiful sight and also a great place to people watch.

Very beautiful area. this pagoda does get very busy at times but you can take time out here and enjoy the beautiful scenery and take in the history of the lake. The lakeside is very beautiful and is a serene contrast to the busy streets of Hanoi. The day we arrived there were many brides and grooms to be having their wedding photos taken, in traditional Vietnamese wedding outfits, as well as white wedding gowns and very bright colourful wedding gowns. In the evening many locals take to the street for their evening exercise.
A quiet retreat. The lake and pagoda are a lovely, quiet retreat from the noise of the nearby street. It is a beautiful place to spend a little time.
a little bit of tranquility in the heart of Hanoi. You can feel the cool breeze off the lake, and there is a lovely restaurant that looks over the water
Go on dusk. the light around the lake are amazing. The whole lake is a hub of activity and if you have the time to just sit and relax it is worth it.

cafe's on the south end. great paris feel in cafe on the lake sth end. also great to watch the locals stretch and thai chi in early morning. My kids loved dare I say KFC near rnd about on north end but i told some other travelors and they all went for abite.
Overcrowded and touristy. The lake scenery is ok...but it is definitely crowded with locals and tourists...don't expect a nice quiet romantic walk

Don't miss a stroll around the lake - and do it several times.. There are several nice photo settings that make good souvenir pics. The highlight was meeting people just strolling or taking their own pics, or taking children for walks or wedding photos. A nice experience
Gorgeous view at sunset. Very peaceful area where locals love to rest for a little while
smaller than I expected. Walked this lake early Sunday morning on walking tour.
Interesting and cultural. Locals spend a lot of time here. Hear the story of the turtle.
Back to nature. It is lovely to see families gathered around the Lake over the weekends. The walk around it was lovely except no peace and quiet because of the horns from vehicles all around.
Hoan Kiem Lake. Great to walk around at night and people watch. There is a fab outdoor cafe at the southern end, and Fanny's ice cream is very near too.

quite a beautiful scenery. nice to take a slow stroll along the lake...
traffic on the road beside the lake is horrible! just ignore them...
Lake by night. The lights around the lake were spectacular. The people were friendly. What a lovely place just to sit and reflect on the day.

Beautiful walk. Really nice to walk around the lake during the day as so much happening. Would be about 40 minutes to do full lap. Is a totally different walk at night with all the lights. We were lucky to be here on the 10th October which is Hanoi's birthday so was very pretty with all the coloured lanterns.

Beautiful, lots of locals in the morning. Take a walk around in the early morning and you'll see many people out doing their morning exercises together (mostly seniors, which is inspiring in itself!).
Interesting night views. Watching the sun set and the lights come on is pretty special. Try it from the City View restaurant

Nice view around sunset. There's a nice path surrounding the lake where people go walking or jogging. Can spend a calm moment or two away from the traffic behind sitting on the shore. There's a pretty little bridge that connects to the monument in the middle of the lake.
Lake and temple in the the center of Hanoi. Interesting visit. They are nicer and larger temples in Hanoi, but that one is worth the visit with its view over the lake.

Sights, exercise, and a little peaceful quiet. It was a welcome to surprise to find a wide, open space like this lake in the middle of a busy city. There are so many phases to the lake's daily routine - the morning is quiet, the afternoon full of people playing checkers & taking wedding photos, the early evening sees exercise happening in every form imaginable. And the Ngoc Son Temple was a nice spot to stop & view the city.
Hoan Kiem Lake. It is nice by walking , seeing view and take photograph. It have many hotel and place to visit.

A lot of moments.. Hoan Kiem Lake is located at the heart of Hanoi. It's the symbol of the city. There's so much to see and everything and anything can be found at the shops around. During the day I'd go around taking pictures and suddenly found a photography club with almost all English speaking members who are very young. I think at night this place really comes alive.. I don't know if there's the night market where they set up little street shops for numerous blocks from Friday to Sunday night. Can spend the whole day walking around looking at painters, people watching, shopping. It sure holds a lot of memories.

Pretty, but Stressful. We enjoyed walking around the lake and crossing the bridge to the temple, where we learned about the history and saw one of the mystical tortoise carcasses. We were however, constantly bombarded by hawkers of all kinds, and chased by a few. A word of advice if you have trouble saying "no", avoid eye contact and try to take a different route if possible if you see someone coming your way.

Tranquil Lake. I love walking around in Hanoi. The weather is so nice, windy and cold! The lake is definitely a highlight cos there were lots of decorations on the time we were there (their 1000 year celebration or something). There were even these huge balloons hanging over the lake and flower decorations all over...The lake is such an integral part of Hanoi City because it's right in the middle of the city! From jogging to just taking an evening stroll, the lake is just perfect for city folks to chill out. There's even this dancing/tai chi session at night held somewhere near the lake!
Clean and quiet and hugh. water puppets theatre nearby, Shopping and resturants within walking distance. Crossing road juncture, smust be very careful.

A very ordinary little lake. The lake gives a respite of sorts from the din of Hanoi but it is an unimpressive little lake which has a small, and I mean small, temple in it. Its value lies in the quietness and a rarity - some green grass to walk on.

Lovely lake in the middle of the city. The lake is a focal point for many locals and tourists alike. Everyone finds a spot for an early morning coffee, and the locals participate in fitness activities in the morning and again in the evening. We walked past exercises and a dance class in the evening. It's a haven from the crazy traffic! The little island with Ngoc Son Temple on it is lit up at night and looks very nice.

Great place. We stayed at Golden Lotus hotel, nearby Restore sword lake and my family walk to the lake for Ice cream.Walking around the lake is fantastic and you can visit The Huc brigde, enyoy Ice cream.Love this lake.

Great place to observe Hanoi life.. We found ourselves walking around the lake every day and/or evening and sitting watching life. It is a wonderful place to see people of all walks of life and all ages meeting, exercising, getting married, chatting, reading etc. A real focal point for Hanoi and a wonderful place to rest in shade after a day's walking. The evenings are probably the best time to wander as the Lake seems so popular for everyone after work and we went there almost every evening after dinner. Located on the edge of the Old Quarter it is a great antidote to the bustle and hum there as the other end of the lake is peaceful even with the constant traffic.

You’ll find yourself in here. It’s so wonderful if you can take a walk around the lake in the early morning and enjoy how life moving. Feeling the cool air in the autumn. Nowhere could be more beautiful than Hanoi in this season. A beautiful basket of flowers inside Hanoi, a place of love. Would come back again

Nice evening walking around the lake. Rarely have i saw so much people enjoying the evening in Czech Republic , but in vietnam its is surely living . . Exellent time spent at the lake of Restored Sword ,you can do much things there .

It's normal late as you don't expect much. If you are interested in going for shopping then there are various shops around the lake. Also it's nice in the early morning or at night to stroll around the lake too. There would be local people enjoying the night relaxing on the bench or couples walking enjoying spending time together.

Good for a relaxing walk during the day. Hoan Kiem Lake is a nice lake that you'll find a number of tourists happily snapping photos of themselves with the water in the background and so on. In addition, the place is picturesque enough to have your wedding photos taken as evidence by the number of couples and professional photographers we saw.Definitely good for a stroll during the day or just sitting down on the benches and admiring the world as people pass by. There isn't too much to see but that's probably a good thing. The lake at night turns a little bit tacky with lights along the lake that change colours constantly and makes it look cheap.Overall, recommended is you're in the area. Perhaps go for a walk before/after lunch or for a spot of ice cream.

Lake of the Sword is a scenic center in Hanoi. Hanoi is not filled with a large amount of stellar historical sites but this area gives some respite from the streets filled with motorcycle. In the center of the Lake there is a tower and some good photo opportunities of the locals exercising, play chess, or young lovers strolling. On the north side of the lake there is a functioning temple and a nice bridge to cross that provides some nice photos too.Around the lake on the north side there are several places to eat or drink as rest while affording a great view of the lake from above.
Restaurant, Pagoda, Walk, a must do. A highlight to sit and have a drink, eat, with a view of the lake.

Relaxing spot. The lake is within walking distance to the Old Quarter. For a small fee, you could walk to the shrine / temple in the center across the bridge. We could not get tickets to the water puppets show as tickets are pre-booked a least few days to a week ahead.A calm oasis and place to jog, or just relaxt along the benches.

Romantic atmosphere in the early morning !. Don't forget to get up early and walk around Hoan Kiem lake to see people pratise TaiChi. Fresh air in the morning at Hoan Kiem lake and walking around this lake is one of the good reasons for me to come back to HaNoi for the second time: It is quite romantic in Hoan Kiem lake in the early morning and that is the same feeling I had when I walked around the river in the centre of Paris or around the lake Lugano in Switzerland in the early morning. However, it is much warmer here in Hanoi ! By the way, try different tasty fruit juice or ice cream at the fruit bar at the beginning of the lake near the small pagoda. They are jummy !

Lovely and mysterious lake in the old quarter. Get away form the bustle and take a stroll around this lake said to be home to a giant turtle, although seldom seen, a sighting is said to bring extraordinary good luck. There is an island with a temple which you can visit and some beautiful old buildings overlooking the water.

Worth a short visit. The lake is totally green, an okay place to take a short stroll, but not to spend a lot of time. Pictures came out so-so. The turtle tower in the middle of the lake at night is pretty.
a lake. if u wake up early,maybe 5 or 6 am, u can see the real hanoi in the lake~
Certainly worth a visit. We really enjoyed our visit here and saw the huge turtle in the lake. The temple is beautiful and all the paintings of mythical beasts

People Watching Galore. Nothing more fun than taking a stroll around the lake, having an ice cream and getting yourself immersed in the crowd. Great fun to people watch as well. With the number of people walking by, chances of seeing the same faces twice are extremely slim so yes, watch. Haha.

Nice Lake, just near the old quarter, nice place to walk around. We didn't spend all that much time here, there was a fee to enter into part of the lake, honestly cannot remember what was inside, but we opted not to go, we just walked around the lake.I think if we had had more time it would have been a great place to go around at night. Just watch your camera and money/wallet. Lots of people, locals and travelers.If you are in the old quarter at least visit it, you can also take a cyclo around the old quarter, so they will usually pass the lake on all sides.

Lake of the Restored Sword. Pleasant place to wander around when you are exploring the shops, restaurants & bars located around the Lake. Nice temple in the middle of the lake called the Tortoise Tower.Seen a couple of brides & grooms being photographed on the lake-side prior to their weddings.

Great place to spend time on the evening.. We liked to walk around the Hoan Kiem lake during the day, but it's in the evening that we liked it the most. We liked to see Vietnamese families spending some time there, seeing younger people chilling in small groups, watching people dancing or doing exercises, all that without being annoyed by crazy motorcycles like in the old quarters...

Such a good place for walking day and night. the weather in Hanoi now is so excellent for walking. Hoan Kiem lake is so beautiful especially in early morning and at night. sitting near the lake you can see Hanoi life around here. when i first saw the lake, i think it's not something special as people often say. but when i come there the 2nd, 3rd times, it's very different. the charm could not be found at your first glance, trust me, you'll have unforgettable memories there ;")

Not a whole lot going on but on the way to night market & old quarter. The lake is dirty and the air is thick from all the motorbikes, but if you go to hanoi there is no doubt you will end up here at some point. Take the time to walk around the lake and visit the temple. The temple has a good gift shop inside. From the edge of the temple there is a great spot to view turtle tower. I never saw any turtles and with the water so nasty I'm not sure how anyone could. The best spot about this place is the fact so many of the other places to visit in Hanoi are within walking distance, just look out for all the motorbikes!

Nice for a walk, but quite a dirty lake. Visited Hanoi for the first time in five years this past week. The lake still disappoints. Compared to walking the motorbike infested streets of the old quarter, the lake offers a chance to just enjoy a stroll for a change. That part we like about this lake. There is also a decent temple to visit (10,000 dong) over the red bridge but its nothing particularly special. Otherwise, the water of this lake is in really bad shape, much like it was five years ago. Its a toxic, mutant ninja turtle, sort of green color, seems little has changed. This is too bad as this could easily be a major attraction for Hanoi. I don't quite understand why the city doesn't invest a bit of finance to cleaning and adding a fresh water system to freshen up this lake. For the poor quality of the lake water, we don't recommend this attraction. However, for a peaceful stroll, it may be your only option as Hanoi has so many people, motorbikes and now cars!!!

Beautiful especially at night!. We walked around the lake on numerous times during our trip to Hanoi. It looks beautiful at night. The added bonus for us was Fannys ice cream parlour onthe edge of the lake! Try the icecream fondue and watch the lights on the lake!

Beautiful Lake from a dsitant. Beautiful lake from a distant, but unfortunatly once you get up close you can see its polluted. But then again what lake in a city is not polluted. The trees and sidewalks around the lake make it very peacful to walk around. Also we were fortunate to see the famous turtle that day on the north end of the lake by the water puppet show location. It actually made the local newspapers about the turtle sighting, so we felt special that we got to see it.
A must place to take a walk. It is a bit cold to take a walk around the lake but we could not stop our feet to get there. It is so nice at night time.

A nice attraction to take a look. It is a legend lake and a representing picture of its city. From the hotel staff’s information where I stayed, this lake got a historical story behind that was reason why we wanted to have a look. Somehow, when we walked around it, we could feel the hollowed spirit from the lake. It looks so charming at the night time.

The lake with golden Turtle. There is a legendry story about the Emperor Ly Thai who with a magical sword drove the Chinese away. The sword was grabbed by a giant golden turtle in the lake who now resides in the Ngoc Son Temple. This lake is a great beauty spot and heart of Hanoi. I headed to the Ngoc Son Temple on the lake, which is very interesting. I met some young girls who were out on the bridge with notebooks learning English so I taught them a little English in the small amount of time I had.Next morning at 6 .30 am I passed the lake by the car and saw many locals exercising, near the lake.
beautiful lake in the centre of the city. In the middle in the Ngoc Son temple is a giant embalmed tortoise. We also enjoyed watching the many couples posing for wedding photos by the lake.
beautiful Lake. Full of people walking a round the lake with colorful lights,many activities celebrated for Hanoi 1000 years.Every morning thousands of people doing exercise beside the lake.

A classical beauty in the small city. Our hotel is in the same area with the look so that why it was very easy for us to go around the lake. The look looks extremly charming in the night time with mixed colour-light. We took some walks around the lake almost everynight during our staying in Hanoi. It was really airy and ideal to take a short rest after a long tired day. The lake brings out the traditional unique face to present the city.

Sit back, relax & enjoy !!. Hoan Kiem Lake and its surrounding is quite happening at night as there are plenty of restaurants, pubs, souvenir shops and hotels nearby. The locals love to ride motorbikes around the lake at night or just sit by the lake to catch up with friends and family members. I was there one morning in Spring 2007. Had my breakfast by the lake in one of the kiosks. I was enjoying the cool February breeze as I slowly sipped a cup of hot coffee and watched the elderly doing some light exercise ie. jogging, tai chi around the lake. It's a cool place to relax... no wonder it's a popular hang out place among the locals and also tourists. Walking distance to Old Quarter but be careful of the heavy traffic when you cross the road. Last but not least, don't forget to watch the water puppet show. The water puppet theater is located just opposite Hoan Kiem Lake.

Nice lake but take care of thieves. The lake is very beautiful but there were some fixing place at the time I visit. So many tourists walk around here. You can easily find souvenir shops, gallery, restaurants with a nice view to the lake and street, water puppets, cycle tour, bag shops, travel agent... You should take care of your pocket, wallet and your properties when entering crowded place. Thieves always prowl there. I took some photos at the lake.

Beautiful lake in the centre Hanoi. When we come to Hanoi , the first thing we want to visit is Hoankiem lake . Because i have heard about story King Le Loi with golden turtle in this lake. I really like this history. Go around the lake my wife and me take many beautiful picture. The landscape . Lake scenery is beautiful and attracted to the tourists. Hoan Kiem lake as the heart of Hanoi .I think it's a place everyone must visit.
Nice lake in Hanoi. Hoan Kiem district, Hanoi. Hoan Kiem Lake is considered the pearl of the Capital, or as foreign visitors called "flower basket in the heart of the city"

nice view and also history. Hoan Kiem Lake is located between the capital Hanoi. Lake is located in a district with central ancient town. The lake had legendary god sword pay for Golden Turtle. Lake arounds with beauty-spot

The Most Beautiful Place in Hanoi. This is the center of the tourist area in Hanoi, where you have restaurants, souvenir shops, cyclo tours, water puppets, and everything else touristy in the Old Quarter of Hanoi. It is a natural spot for this, as it's located right in the middle of the Old Quarter, and is beautiful. You can go early in the morning and walk around the lake, watching people do their exercises, and visit the temple without the crowds. The temple itself is interesting, but not essential, the cute wooden bridge out to it is about as interesting. If you're there in the afternoon, and don't want to stand in line to see the temple, don't lose sleep over it. The lake itself isn't really an attraction per se - it's just a nice place to walk, relax, and soak up the ambience, then hop across the street, see the water puppets, take a cyclo ride, eat, drink, and shop.Take the same common sense precautions with pickpockets here as anywhere. Don't walk with purses or fancy jewelry or things like that around SE Asia in general - there's no reason to as nobody but you will have it, and it's just an invitation for problems, not just here but anywhere in the developing world. There is not an extra cause for concern here vs. anywhere else. Relax and enjoy one of Hanoi's top attractions.

Beautiful spot, beware the pickpockets!. One of the classic spots in Hanoi. Get there in the early morning, if possible, temple opens at 8am and much better to see it then. Watch the locals doing their exercises around the lake... Not so much hassle from hawkers either - and on that note, wanted to second burlington_gal's warning, and say that this is a real place to be extra wary. Beautiful place, really lovely to see, but an absolute hot spot for extremely practised thieves, who seem to provide a bit of theatre for Vietnamese onlookers. In just a moment - as you're speaking on the phone, or when hawkers are hassling you - their hand has crept into your bag, usually because they have watched you put something away and followed you closely waiting for (or helping to create) a moment of inattention. They really are so deft and speedy that even a seasoned traveller can be caught off guard; this really is one of the worst spots in Hanoi I've found for repeated attempts at theft. A real shame because the Vietnamese are so friendly, generous and welcoming, and Hoan Kiem is a must-see...

A Disaster. It was almost as if we were on a stage as we entered the park around the lake. As I put my 4 year old grandson on my shoulders, the local crowd laughed. My shoulder bag hung tucked safely under my arm, I thought. Seconds later, someone was talking into my ear wanting me to buy his books. I ignored him, then felt him in my purse. I turned and screamed, "You stole from me! Catch him!" My son-in-law was in immediate chase, fell, and the crowd laughed. It was my Blackberry which was taken. 5 min. before, we had been in a phone store to buy a Sim card, and the clerk insisted it would not work. I suspect she phoned this thug to attack us.

So glad we visited. I was doing some research before our recent trip to Vietnam looking into things to do and see while we were there. I came across a story about a turtle and a restored sword, it all sounded very interesting and decided that I would have to see it all for myself. Also being the same place as the red bridge, the most photographed bridge in Vietnam (or so I am led to believe) I was more than happy to include the temple into my sightseeing. I am so very glad we did as it was just incredible. Seeing the huge turtle & having a wander through the temple was great. Even just the enterance into the temple had me snapping away like crazy on my camera. After our trip through the temple, we went for a walk through all of the local streets which are arranged in different items eg belt street, shoe street, shirt street etc. So depending on what you are looking for you should be able to find it here. We did go to a two story market which we were told by a local was really good, but we were quite disappointed as did not seem to cater to the tourist shopper very well.There are heaps of places to eat & drink around the lake so you shouldn't have trouble finding something that you like. Be wary of some taxis though as we had one that's meter said we had travelled 48 kilometers when we had not even travelled three!!

The Hoam Kiem Lake &the Ngoc Son Temple. They are located in the heart of the city. Legends said that on the occasion of King Le Loi's relaxation trip by sampan on the lake after the victory over the Ming aggressors, a Golden Tortoise emerged to request him to return the holy sword given to him by the Sky God to protect the country against the enemy. This small lake is nicely bordered by age - old trees. In the extreme north is an islet accessible by a wooden bridge painted red namely The Huc. The small temple of Ngoc Son of 19th century is dedicated to General Tran Hung Dao, a hero against the Mongolians in the 13th century together with three genie: La To, the pioneer of medical career; Nguyen Van Xuong, the genie of literature; Tran Vu, the genie of martial arts. In the middle of the lake is the tortoise tower considered as the contemporary symbol of Hanoi.
